DOC.Title: Geological age
DOC.TEXT: Based on the overlapping condition of the strata, the history of the earth approximately 4.6 billion years are classified roughly in descending order into the Archean, Proterozoic, Paleozoic, Mesozoic and Cenozoic. Among them, Proterozoic and Proterozoic account for about 88%, but after the emergence of organisms about 600 million years ago, they are roughly divided into Paleozoic, Mesozoic and Cenozoic based on their evolution.

DOC.Title: Cenozoic era
DOC.TEXT: It is the newest period among the geological ages, from about 65 million years ago to the present. It was divided into the 3rd and 4th centuries in order of older, humanity appeared around the end of the third century.

DOC.Title: tertiary
DOC.TEXT: Early Cenozoic. It was about 65 million years ago to about 1.8 million years ago, when the activities of mammals became aggressive after the dinosaurs died. At the end of this year humanity's ancestors were born.

DOC.Title: Quaternary
DOC.TEXT: Late Cenozoic. About 1.8 million years ago to the present time. This is divided into the Pleistocene and the Holocene in order of older.

DOC.Title: Pleistocene, Hidenagi
DOC.TEXT: It is the first half of the 4 th century (occupying the majority), about 1.8 million years ago to about 10 thousand years ago. In the glacial era, there were four ice ages and three interglacial periods. It corresponds to the Paleolithic age of almost the archaeological era.

DOC.Title: Ice Age, Glacial
DOC.TEXT: A cold period when the earth was widely covered by glaciers from the cold to the temperate. There were four times in the 4th century.

DOC.Title: Interglacial
DOC.TEXT: When the climate becomes relatively mild, between the ice ages and the ice ages. The glacier retreated to the high latitude region.

DOC.Title: Holocene, alluvial
DOC.TEXT: About ten thousand years ago from now to the present in the latter half of the 4 th century (late term). Distribution of climate and amphibious land, flora and fauna became almost the same as present.

DOC.Title: Post glacial period
DOC.TEXT: The Holocene. Because it warmed after the end of the 4th Ice Age, it is also called this way.

DOC.Title: Old continent
DOC.TEXT: Generic name for Asia, Europe and Africa. The name for calling the Americas the Americas the New Continent. Humans originated from the old continent and evolved.

DOC.Title: Humanity
DOC.TEXT: Biologically, an animal belonging to the mammalian primate human family. It evolved separately from apes about 5 million years ago, and the brain developed by upright bipedal locomotion. Produce and use tools, know the use of fire, have language-based culture.

DOC.Title: tool
DOC.TEXT: Things to use as an aid in order to achieve the purpose of expanding the scope of activities by humans. Its production / use is one of the characteristics of mankind. Materials of prehistoric tools were stones, animals, plants, and the like.

DOC.Title: stoneware
DOC.TEXT: A stone processed tool. It is the main tool of prehistoric times, depending on how it is made, it is roughly divided into stone stone tools and polished stone tools.

DOC.Title: Ape
DOC.TEXT: Primates close to humans such as chimpanzees, gorillas, orangutans, and buddhist monkeys. You can walk upright and grasp objects with your fingers.

DOC.Title: Fossil mankind, pseudo human race
DOC.TEXT: Human beings known by fossilized bones. It is roughly divided into monkey people, original people, old people, and newcomers.

DOC.Title: monkey person
DOC.TEXT: The oldest human race. Although the brain volume is the same as chimpanzee gorilla, it is presumed that the tooth alignment showed the characteristics of human beings, and since the hip bones and the like resemble the current human beings, they were walking upright biped. Some also used simple stone tools (gravel stones).

DOC.Title: Ramidas Monkey Man
DOC.TEXT: It is currently the oldest monkey, and appeared about 4.5 million years ago (there is a theory that it was about 5.5 million years ago). The existence was revealed from the fossil found in Ethiopia.

DOC.Title: Australopithecus
DOC.TEXT: Monkey people discovered in South and East Africa since 1924. The skeleton and brain volume (about 500 to 600 cc) are close to gorillas, but walked upright biped and used stoneware. It is estimated that it appeared about 4 million years ago. The name means "monkey in the south".

DOC.Title: Homo = Habilith
DOC.TEXT: Monkey person discovered in Tanzania in 1964. It is estimated that it appeared about 2 million years ago from the excavated formation. The name means "deftly person." There is also theory that it seems that the brain volume is bigger than the astralopithecus, and it seems that it is located in the middle of the evolution of monkey and original person.

DOC.Title: Hara
DOC.TEXT: Fossil mankind for monkey people. It is estimated that it appeared earlier in the Pleistocene earlier than about 1.8 million years ago. I used stone tools such as hand grenades and spoke simple words. Represented by Java original, Beijing Hara et al.

DOC.Title: Java original, an upright monkey
DOC.TEXT: Hara, discovered in Trinite, Java. In 1891-94 Dutch Dubois unearthed part of the skull, two molars and left femur. The brain volume is estimated to be about 900 cc, about two thirds of that of modern people. It was scientific name that upright walking was confirmed.

DOC.Title: Beijing original person
DOC.TEXT: Hara, discovered from a lunch shop in the suburbs of Beijing. A nearly perfect skull was found with a large excavation from 1927 to 37 years. The brain volume is about 850 to 1220 cc. It has been confirmed that I lived in a cave, used stoneware and used fire.

DOC.Title: lunch box shop
DOC.TEXT: About 54km southwest of Beijing. A large amount of fossils of human beings and animals, including Beijing Hero, were excavated from Limestess in this place.

DOC.Title: Heidelberg
DOC.TEXT: In 1907 the mother of the mandibular joint was found in the southern quarry of Heidelberg in southern Germany. In recent years, there is a theory that it is not an original but an ancestor of old people or newcomers.

DOC.Title: Stoneware
DOC.TEXT: A stoneware made by lacking a stone. It is mainly used in the Paleolithic age, and it is roughly divided into a stone stone tool and a stone nuclear stone instrument.

DOC.Title: stone nuclear stone instrument
DOC.TEXT: A stoneware striking a part of the raw ore and leaving the nucleus. The gravel stone aquarium is a representative stone tool and it is distributed throughout Europe, America and India.

DOC.Title: Gravel Stone
DOC.TEXT: It is the most primitive stoneware just striking a natural stone. Many are difficult to distinguish from natural stones.

DOC.Title: old man
DOC.TEXT: Fossil human beings located between the original and newcomers. It is estimated that it appeared in the early late Pleistocene period about 200,000 years ago. I used a piece of scallop stoneware and wore fur clothing. Fossils have been excavated from all over the continent on behalf of the Neanderthal people.

DOC.Title: Neanderthal people
DOC.TEXT: The old man discovered in Neanderthal in Germany in 1856. It is also found in West Asia and North Africa, mainly in Europe. The skeleton approaches the newcomer, and the brain volume is about 1500 cc which is almost the same amount (or more) as the freshman. Living in a cave, some religious acts such as burials also began.

DOC.Title: Burial practice
DOC.TEXT: From the excavation status of the Neanderthal fossils, interpretation is made that they are the first human beings who performed "burial".

DOC.Title: Homo = sapiens
DOC.TEXT: It means "person with wisdom", represented by the Neanderthal people.

DOC.Title: Stone bracelet
DOC.TEXT: A stoneware made from peeled strips from gemstones. It was crafted for various uses such as shaving fur or cutting meat. Among them, the stones are representative stone bricks invented by newcomers. It was widely distributed in Europe, Africa and West Asia.

DOC.Title: Newcomers, current human beings, Homo = Sapiens-Sapiens
DOC.TEXT: Fossil human race that appeared at the end of Pleistocene (about 40,000 to 10,000 years ago). It belongs to the same kind as modern people. Using sophisticated stone tools and bone horn horn, hunting and fishery developed. It is typified by the Cromagnonite, the lunch box shop, and the upper cave.

DOC.Title: Cromagnonite
DOC.TEXT: A rookie discovered in Cromagnon in southern France in 1868. It appeared about 30 thousand years ago. I lived in southwestern Europe, left cave paintings and invented bow and arrow.

DOC.Title: Shou mouth shop upper cave man
DOC.TEXT: A newcomer discovered from a cave in Yatsura mountain above the cave where Beijing Hero was discovered.

DOC.Title: Grimaldi
DOC.TEXT: A rookie discovered in northwest Italy.

DOC.Title: Hamakita person
DOC.TEXT: A rookie discovered in Hamakita, Shizuoka prefecture in 1961.

DOC.Title: Bone horn vessel
DOC.TEXT: Tools used to process bones and corners, used from the late Paleolithic age. It was used as instruments such as harpoon, spear, needle and jewelry.

DOC.Title: Woman naked image
DOC.TEXT: Venus statue of the stone. It seems to be a magical thing symbolizing birth and praying for prolific or harvest. It was distributed in the northern part of the Eurasian Continent in the late Paleolithic Age.

DOC.Title: Cave Art
DOC.TEXT: Paintings drawn in the cave in the late Paleolithic age and engraved sculptures. Many pictures of preyed beasts are considered magical acts praying for the success of hunting. Sometimes it was drawn also on the rock wall.

DOC.Title: Altamira
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of North Spain discovered in 1879. It is known for the cave picture by the Cromagnonite, and in particular there are many pictures of wild cattle, and there are pictures of wild boar and reindeer.

DOC.Title: Lasko
DOC.TEXT: Representative cave picture painting ruins in southern France discovered in 1940. It was drawn about 20,000 to 10,000 years ago.

DOC.Title: Paleolithic age
DOC.TEXT: An era in which food was acquired through hunting, fishing, and collecting using stone tools and bone horn horn. It is the first stage of long-term human culture since the monkey.

DOC.Title: Late Paleolithic Age
DOC.TEXT: Late Pleistocene (about 40 thousand to 10 thousand years ago), the period from the appearance of newcomers to the end of Pleistocene.

DOC.Title: Hunting / Fishery / Collection
DOC.TEXT: Means of food acquisition in the Paleolithic age. Life was unstable. This stage is called an acquired economy.

DOC.Title: Hold, Hold group
DOC.TEXT: Primitive social group where several families gathered. Humans seemed to have lived during the hunting and gathering stage by forming a Hold, moving seasonally within certain areas.

DOC.Title: Medium Stone Age
DOC.TEXT: An era of the transition period from the Paleolithic Age to the Neolithic Age. A fine stone tool was used for cutting, cutting the wild grain, and used it as food.

DOC.Title: fine stone instrument
DOC.TEXT: Small stone stone tools. From the Mesolithic Age to the beginning of the Neolithic Age, it was used as a tool such as arrows, spears, scythe, etc., to fit in the patterns of trees and bones.

DOC.Title: Bow and arrow
DOC.TEXT: Hunting and combat tools that appeared in the late Paleolithic age. Although the occurrence area is unknown, it spread widely in a short period of time.

DOC.Title: Neolithic Age
DOC.TEXT: Stone age since agriculture · livestock starting. We made polished pottery using polished stone tools.

DOC.Title: Agriculture / livestock
DOC.TEXT: Major means of getting food after the Neolithic Age. Approximately 9000 to 8000 years ago, cultivation of wheat and breeding of goats · sheep · pigs started from West Asia centering on eastern Mediterranean area. The transition from the acquired economy to the production economy, the life stabilized and the culture rapidly developed compared to hunting and collection.

DOC.Title: Neolithic Revolution, Food Production Revolution
DOC.TEXT: It means the development from an acquired economy to a production economy.

DOC.Title: Jarmo
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of the initial agricultural settlement found in northern Mesopotamia (now Iraq). It is presumed to be between 8000 and 6000 years ago, and it is the transition period from the acquired economy to the production economy.

DOC.Title: Dry farming method
DOC.TEXT: Early farming methods. Since agricultural tools are underdeveloped and it is difficult to remove trees and weeds, arable land with predominant rainfall expected in cultivated land was chosen. It was a looting farming law that relies on rainwater, does not add fertilizer, consumes the ground power until it becomes impossible to consecutive, so it was necessary to frequently move the arable land and never develop into a large settlement.

DOC.Title: Ground God
DOC.TEXT: A god symbolizing the vitality of the earth. It was often expressed as a naked image emphasizing female reproductive power.

DOC.Title: polished stone tool
DOC.TEXT: Stone tools polished with sand and grinding stone. It is regarded as a feature of the Neolithic era against the paleolithic stone tools of the Old Stone Age. Due to the development of agriculture, the type was abundant according to the use, such as polished stone axes, stone mortar, stone dish, stone pestle for crushing grain.

DOC.Title: Earthenware
DOC.TEXT: Dough kneading clay and baked. It spreads along with agricultural settling life, developed for ritual use besides storage and cooking.

DOC.Title: Sayumi pottery
DOC.TEXT: Earthenware that painted patterns using red, black, white and other pigments on the ground of unglazed. Mesopotamia, mainly in Egypt, Europe, India, Central Asia and China in the Yellow River middle region.

DOC.Title: Textile
DOC.TEXT: Fiber of the plant, the birds of the birds and animals are made into a filamentous shape, and the cloth made by combining it.

DOC.Title: Clan
DOC.TEXT: A social group or a consular community connected by consciousness that it has a common ancestor. Following the development of agriculture and pastoralism, clan communities that shared arable land and livestock have been formed. Members of the community were equal, and shared rituals of their ancestors.

DOC.Title: Irrigated agriculture
DOC.TEXT: Agriculture that artificially supplies water necessary for farming. Drought farming method dependent on nature, yield increased. Cooperative work became necessary, conditions for civilization occurred that the community developed and headed toward the formation of the city.

DOC.Title: Metalware age
DOC.TEXT: An era when bronze ware and ironware began to be used. Natural gold and natural copper were used from the end of Neolithic era, but only after the bronze ware was invented and used as a tool, the metal age was established.

DOC.Title: Bronze ware
DOC.TEXT: A tool made of bronze that is an alloy of copper and tin. From around 3500 before, it was manufactured and used in civilization such as Orient · Indus · Yin with copperware. Initial bronze wood was mainly weapons and rituals, it was not used as an agricultural tool.

DOC.Title: Ironware
DOC.TEXT: Iron was recognized as an institution from early, but the metallurgical technique was difficult, lagging behind bronze. About 1400 Hittite people used iron weapons, spread to all parts of the Orient after their destruction, then spread to Europe, India and China, became iron age.

DOC.Title: class
DOC.TEXT: Bottom segments of social status. Beginning in the Bronze Age, differences in rich and poor, differentiation of occupations occurred as productivity increased, economic and political domination and subordination were formed there. In the beginning three classes of aristocrats (priests), commoners and senior citizens were established.

DOC.Title: seal
DOC.TEXT: It began to be used in West Asia 5000 ago. It is thought that people started to have private ideas.

DOC.Title: Establishment of State
DOC.TEXT: Due to the establishment of the class and expansion and development of the community, the leader grasped more control as a privileged aristocrat, and the state was established. In the case of the ancient nation, the consciousness of the community was strengthened, centering on the temple.

DOC.Title: City State
DOC.TEXT: A small country that dominated the central city and its surrounding areas. It is considered the first form of the state.

DOC.Title: Invention of character
DOC.TEXT: At about the same time as the establishment of the state, in order to record the content of rituals and contributions, it was created by the ruling class.

DOC.Title: Prehistoric
DOC.TEXT: The era before characters occurred. Archeological remains / artifacts, anthropology / ethnology / cultural anthropology etc are main research materials / means.

DOC.Title: History era
DOC.TEXT: The era after the occurrence of letters. Research mainly depends on textual materials.

DOC.Title: Culture · Civilization
DOC.TEXT: Culture is an individual material and spiritual product such as tools, social life, thought, learning, etc. that people have created, and civilization is one in which these cultures are combined in various ways to form one integrated body , Can generally be defined. As an example in the ancient times, it is conceptualized that ancient civilizations were formed such that individual cultures such as bronze tools, cities, letters, and nations were formed together. However, in many cases, they are used as synonyms without distinction between them.

DOC.Title: Four Great Civilizations
DOC.TEXT: It means the four civilizations of Egypt, Mesopotamia, Indus, Yellow River and Yangtze that early developed cities, classes, nations and letters. Both were established in the river basin. In addition to the Maya · Aztec civilization and the Inca civilization independently established in the plateau · mountainous area, it is sometimes made as the six largest civilization.

DOC.Title: Race
DOC.TEXT: It is a concept that is mainly created by classifying people, mainly on differences in skin, eyes (iris) color, hair etc. From around the 16th century, classification of white race, yellow race, black race started to be done. However, the definition of classification is ambiguous, and the marriage between "race" and "ethnic group" also increases. Today, this concept is not only scientifically incorrect but also "ethnic group" that classifies based on cultural differences The danger of becoming a hotbed of racial discrimination has also been pointed out, being confused with the concept.

DOC.Title: White race, Caucasian
DOC.TEXT: We gathered people with extremely thin skin and iris iris as one group.

DOC.Title: Yellow race, Mongoloid
DOC.TEXT: Yellow or yellowish brown skin, people with brown or dark brown eyes in one group.

DOC.Title: Black race, Negroid
DOC.TEXT: Dark brown or black skin, crimped hair or people with curly hair were grouped together as one group.

DOC.Title: Ethnicity
DOC.TEXT: A group of human beings classified by language, religion, socioeconomic life, customs customs and so on. The surface formed in the history process is strong, not fixed.

DOC.Title: Language
DOC.TEXT: In terms of linguistics, it refers to a group of languages ​​developed separately from languages ​​of the same origin. In historical studies etc, we use this word in the sense that it is a human group speaking the same language, in that case it may be expressed as Indian = European, Semese etc.

DOC.Title: India = European Language
DOC.TEXT: Indian and Iranian eastern languages ​​such as Hindi and Persian, Germanic languages ​​such as English / German, Romance such as Latin / French, Slavonic such as Celtic, Greek, Russian, Baltic It is divided into Western languages.

DOC.Title: Afro = Asian Language
DOC.TEXT: A language group mainly used in West Asia and North Africa. It is often divided into Semese and Egyptian.

DOC.Title: Semitic system
DOC.TEXT: Akkadian, Bapillonian, Hebrew, Aramaic, Phoenician, Assyrian, Arabic, etc.

DOC.Title: Egyptian, Ham language
DOC.TEXT: Ancient Egyptian, Coptic and so on.

DOC.Title: Ural language
DOC.TEXT: Finnish, Hungarian, Estonian etc.

DOC.Title: Altai Language
DOC.TEXT: Turkish · Mongolian · Tungus etc. There are also theories that Japanese and Korean belong to this, but there are many objections.

DOC.Title: Sina = Tibetan language
DOC.TEXT: Chinese, Tibetan, Burma (Myanmar), Thai, etc.

DOC.Title: Murray = Polynesian Language, Austronesian Language
DOC.TEXT: Malay, Indonesian, Tagalog etc.

DOC.Title: South Asian Language, Austro-Asian Language
DOC.TEXT: Vietnamese, Khmer, Mongu, etc. There is also a theory that requests the origin of Japanese from this series.

DOC.Title: Dravida Language
DOC.TEXT: Tamil and so on.

DOC.Title: African languages
DOC.TEXT: Hausa language, Fulah language, Bantu language, Koisan language etc.

DOC.Title: American languages
DOC.TEXT: Inuit, Navajo, Nahuatl, Maya, Quechua etc.

DOC.Title: Orient
DOC.TEXT: In Latin meaning "where the sun rises", the word Romans refers to the eastern provinces as seen from the Italian peninsula. The term for Occident (Western), mainly refers to areas including Egypt, West Asia, Small Asia etc.

DOC.Title: Mesopotamia
DOC.TEXT: In the sense of "area between rivers" it refers to the region of the Tigris / Euphrates river basin. Called both River Regions, it almost corresponds to current Iraq.

DOC.Title: Tigris and Euphrates rivers
DOC.TEXT: A river that emanates in the eastern part of the Anatolian Plateau of Asia Minor, flows through Mesopotamia and flows into the Persian Gulf. In the basin's alluvial plain, agriculture by flood control and irrigation has been carried out early, urban civilization was established around 3000 years ago.

DOC.Title: "Fertile crescent moon"
DOC.TEXT: The formation zone of agricultural civilization extending from Palestine / Syria to Mesopotamia. Egypt may also be included.

DOC.Title: Semitic, Afro = Asian
DOC.TEXT: People who use Semese language. I have lived a lot from West Asia to North Africa. Akkadi, Alam people, Hebrews who took the ancient Mesopotamian civilization, Arabians who originated and expanded Islamists belong to this family. Generally, the Egyptian system is also regarded as an Afro-Asian language.

DOC.Title: Sumerian
DOC.TEXT: People who built the oldest civilization in southern Mesopotamia. The ethnic lineage is unknown. Since about 3000 years ago, we built a number of city states such as Ur · Uruk · Lagash and developed bronze wood · cuneiform letters. Each city state had its own guardian god and fought for supremacy.

DOC.Title: ur
DOC.TEXT: A city state built by Sumerians on the right bank of the Euphrates river basin. From the royal tomb was found a martyr and a golden burglary. In the sanctuary surrounded by the walls of sun-dried bricks (about 300 m on each side, trapezoid with about 180 m and 150 m across flats), Ziggurat (tower) was rising.

DOC.Title: Uruk
DOC.TEXT: Sumerian city state upstream from ur. Current Walca. The oldest cylindrical stamps and letters were found.

DOC.Title: Lagash
DOC.TEXT: A city nation of the Sumerians who was in the north of Ur. Current Teluro.

DOC.Title: The Priesthood Politics
DOC.TEXT: Politics done with the authority of God · religion. The king (ruler) himself was done as a god (or proxy), or by a priest forces with great power to assist the kingship.

DOC.Title: City State
DOC.TEXT: As the village expands through conquest and coalition, it is a small country formed from a city centered around a temple and its surrounding areas. It is considered to be a form of nation appearing at the stage of civilization occurrence.

DOC.Title: class
DOC.TEXT: A social group that is positioned as a top-down relationship by wealth, the amount of power and so on. In the development of civilization, social division of labor (position and role) occurred, it is thought that it was fixed as dominance / subordination.

DOC.Title: Akkadian
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic groups using Semitic Akkadian language. From the northern part of Babylonia (Southern Mesopotamia), he conquered the Sumerian city state one after another, and built the first Mesopotamia unified state in the last 24th century.

DOC.Title: Sargon I
DOC.TEXT: The King of Akkadi. Expeditions to various regions, establishing the first unified state of Mesopotamia, expanded the trade area / culture zone.

DOC.Title: Ur 3 rd Dynasty
DOC.TEXT: The last dynasty that the Sumerians built. The law issued by Urnanum, the founder of the dynasty, is now known as the oldest law. It collapsed with the invasion of Elam people.

DOC.Title: Babylon 1st Dynasty, Old Babylonian Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: In the early 19 th century the kingdom where Amur who invaded Mesobotamia built Babylon as the capital. It was destroyed by Hittite in the early sixteenth century.

DOC.Title: Babylon
DOC.TEXT: A large city in the middle of the Euphrates river basin. It prospered as the city of Babylon 1st Dynasty and New Babylonian Kingdom.

DOC.Title: Amur people, Amori people
DOC.TEXT: Semitic nomads. Babylon built the first dynasty.

DOC.Title: Hammurabi
DOC.TEXT: King of Babylon 1st Dynasty 6th. We unified all Mesopotamia and established the Hammurabi Code.

DOC.Title: Code of Hammurabi
DOC.TEXT: The law enacted by King Hammurabi. Inherited the Sumerian law, culmination of the synthesis law. All 282 articles. Including many contents such as criminal law, commercial law, civil law etc, the criminal law characterized the same harm revenge law and punishment difference by status. In 1901-02 Susa of the ancient capital of Persia, the original text engraved with cuneiform letters was found on the stone monument.

DOC.Title: "Eyes for eyes, teeth for teeth"
DOC.TEXT: A word expressing the principle of the same harm revenge law of Hammurabi Code. However, there was a difference in punishment due to the difference in status between the parties.

DOC.Title: polytheism
DOC.TEXT: Religion to believe in multiple gods. It is universally found in ancient Mesopotamia civilization and Egyptian civilization. In contrast, Judaism, Christianity, Islamism etc. are monotheisms that believe in God only.

DOC.Title: MARDUC
DOC.TEXT: God of creation in Babylonia. Originally it was a city god of Babylon, but later became the supreme god, a temple and Ziggurat were built to festival this.

DOC.Title: Ziggurat, Holy Tower
DOC.TEXT: From the Sumerian era, the sanctuary built in Mesopotamia cities. It consisted of several layers of base and was constructed with roof tiles. The legend of "The Tower of Babel" in the Old Testament is said to have occurred in the future.

DOC.Title: "Gilgamesh epic"
DOC.TEXT: Legendary epic of ancient Mesopotamian hero Gilgamesh, which is regarded as the king of Urk. It is known to contain the flood tale which is regarded as the prototype of "Noah's Ark" of the "Old Testament".

DOC.Title: Noah's flood legend
DOC.TEXT: A story of 'Creation Century' of 'Old Testament'. It is a story that God who got angry at the fall of mankind gave mankind the hardship of the flood, but ordered the creation of the ark to leave the Noah family as the only human being, to get rid of difficulties.

DOC.Title: model letter
DOC.TEXT: The letter Sumerian made from pictograms. Each stroke is in the shape of a wedge because it was written with a reed stem or a metal tip pressed against a clay plate. The priests and secretaries were used to write rituals, laws, history, etc., and were widely used in the ancient Orient until the destruction of the Achaemenid dynasty.

DOC.Title: clay board
DOC.TEXT: It was used to describe model letters. It was sun dried or baked and hardened.

DOC.Title: seal
DOC.TEXT: The Sumerians carved wedge shaped letters and made it for use as a contract.

DOC.Title: Six decades method
DOC.TEXT: The numbering system invented by the Sumerians. It began with astronomical circumference division and became a unit of angle and time.

DOC.Title: Taiko Calendar
DOC.TEXT: Calendar based on the cycle of the phases of the moon. It started with Sumer, and now it is used only in the Islamic world.

DOC.Title: Sun lunar calendar
DOC.TEXT: The calendar which is made using solar calendar together based on the lunar calendar. In Babylonia, it was first established.

DOC.Title: leap month
DOC.TEXT: Moon added to correct the seasonal deviation by the lunar calendar.

DOC.Title: leap year
DOC.TEXT: Year in which a leap month is placed.

DOC.Title: 1 week 7 days system
DOC.TEXT: Began with Sumerian with lunar calendar, established in Babylonia.

DOC.Title: Astrology
DOC.TEXT: Thinking that the operation and combination of stars represents the fortune of human beings and society, then the technique to predict the future. It became competitive with the Babylonian caldea, and therefore astronomical observation technique developed.

DOC.Title: India = European ethnic group
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic groups using Indo-European languages. Hittites and Iranians are representative of ethnic groups who played the ancient Orient civilization. Ethnic groups that once built the Kingathi kingdom and the Kingdom of Mitanni have been considered to be applicable, but in recent years it has been unknown.

DOC.Title: Anatolia
DOC.TEXT: Part of the peninsula surrounded by the Black Sea, the Aegean Sea and the Mediterranean, also known as Asia Minor. It almost overlaps with the territory of the present Turkish republic.

DOC.Title: Hittite
DOC.TEXT: Indian = European ethnic group. Around the middle of the 17th century BC built a kingdom with Hatusha (currently Boazukoyi) as a small Asia, and in the early 16th century Babylon 1st Dynasty was reduced. Then defeated Mitanni, advanced to Syria, fought with Egypt, reaching its peak in the 14th century. In addition to using horses and tanks, we used iron weapons for the first time. Early in the 12th century, it was destroyed by the invasion of "the people of the sea".

DOC.Title: Pozuqoy, Hattusha
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of central Asia Minor. The capital city of Hittite was placed.

DOC.Title: Cassid
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic groups invaded Babylonia from the mountainous region of Zagros. Although it has been regarded as an Indian-European language, there are many unclear points about the ethnic lineage. From the 16th to the 12th century ago, he dominated the land as the 3rd dynasty of Babylon and fought against Egypt · Mitanni · Hittite. In the 12th century, it was destroyed by Elam people.

DOC.Title: Elam people
DOC.TEXT: The ethnic lineage is unknown. It dominated the southwestern part of the Iranian Plateau. Before the 3rd Dynasty of Babylon was defeated, it was at the height of the 12th century.

DOC.Title: Mitanni
DOC.TEXT: Kingdom that controlled Syria from northern Mesopotamia in the 16th century. The Indian-European ethnic group was the ruling class, but the majority of the inhabitants were composed of the Frari people (recently, the theory that it was a full-fledged country including the ruler) has been issued. In the 15 th century before, it flourished alongside Egypt and Hittite, but declined after losing to Hittite in the 14 th century, and then merged with Assyria.

DOC.Title: Furri people
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic lineage unknown. It appeared in the upper basin of Mesobotamia from around the middle of the 3 rd millennium, and gradually expanded all over West Asia. It occupied the majority of the population of Kingdom of Mitanni which was established in the 16th century.

DOC.Title: Egypt
DOC.TEXT: Located at the eastern end of North Africa, the area centered around the Nile basin. Along with Mesopotamia, the oldest agricultural civilization in the world occurred.

DOC.Title: Egyptian
DOC.TEXT: Egyptian ethnic group. We built the Egyptian civilization which is one of the oldest agricultural civilization in the Nile River Basin.

DOC.Title: Egyptian language
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic groups using Egyptian language.

DOC.Title: Nile river
DOC.TEXT: A large river that emits to Lake Victoria and flows northward through the desert area in northeast Africa. Periodic rise and flooding in June to October produced fertile arable land, blooming the irrigation farming civilization.

DOC.Title: "Egypt is Nile's Taming"
DOC.TEXT: Famous words of ancient Greek historian Herodotus. It represented the prosperity of the ancient Egyptian civilization on a fertile soil formed by the regular flooding of the Nile River.

DOC.Title: Nomos
DOC.TEXT: Administrative unit of ancient Egypt. Originally tribal independent settlement. With the progress of irrigation agriculture, 22 nomos were established in the upper Egypt and 20 in the lower Egypt.

DOC.Title: Memphis
DOC.TEXT: City of the Kingdom of the Old Kingdom. Located at the southern end of Delta province. It is said that Menes of the first dynasty first generation built.

DOC.Title: King Kufu
DOC.TEXT: The king of the 4th dynasty around the 27th century ago. We built the largest pyramid in Giza.

DOC.Title: Giza
DOC.TEXT: Cairo on the other side of Cairo today. Kuff, Kahura, Menkauer 3 king's pyramids and sphinx are left.

DOC.Title: Middle Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Eleventh and twelfth dynasties. I reunified Egypt, adjusted the bureaucracy system and promoted centralization, but the royalty declined and it was destroyed. The capital is Thebes.

DOC.Title: Thebes
DOC.TEXT: Cities in the middle of the Nile. Current Luxor. During the Kingdom of the Middle Kingdom and New Kingdom, it was almost the center of politics.

DOC.Title: Hixos
DOC.TEXT: Asian nomads. After the destruction of the Kingdom of the Kingdom with a horse and a tank, invaded from Syria, dominated the Delta, built the 15th and 16th dynasties. Declined in the mid 16th century, Egypt was expelled.

DOC.Title: New Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The 18th and 20th dynasties. Established by expelling Hixos, the capital was primarily placed in Thebes. The 18th and 19th dynasties were at their height, and in Syria · Palestine they fought against Hittite · Mitanni · Cassito etc.

DOC.Title: Amenhotep IV, Eknaton
DOC.TEXT: The king of the 18 th dynasty (around 1351 before the throne to around 1334 around). In order to eliminate the political intervention of the priest of Ammon God, we forced the faith of God Aton only, renamed himself Ekinerton ("loved by Aton"), and then transferred to Tel-el-Amarna. The successor is Tutankhamen (about 1333 before before 1323 before before the presence) and famous Tutankhamen (in particular the golden mask) discovered from the uninvited King 's tomb.

DOC.Title: Tel-el-Amarna
DOC.TEXT: The city on the right bank of Nile. It was built by Amenhotep IV and it was named Aketo = Aton. After the death of the king, the priest of Ammon got over, Amarna was destroyed, the capital was transferred to Memphis, faith returned to polytheism. At the end of the 19th century, a clay board document (Amarna diplomatic document) with many cuneiform characters was found.

DOC.Title: Amarna art
DOC.TEXT: The art of Amenhotep IV. For an immobilized style after the Old Kingdom, it was unusual for ancient Egypt, characterized by a free and graphical style.

DOC.Title: Rames II, Ramesses II
DOC.TEXT: The king of the 19 th dynasty (around 1304 before before 1237). After fighting Hittite and Kadesh, he then entered the oldest existing international treaty.

DOC.Title: Kadesh
DOC.TEXT: City of Syria. About 1286 years ago, Rames II fought with Hittite.

DOC.Title: Amarna document
DOC.TEXT: Diplomatic documents of the 14th century before the discovery in Amarna, Egypt at the end of the 19th century. It was written in cuneiform shaped letters on about 400 clay boards, and it is an important historical material for knowing international relations at the time.

DOC.Title: Late dynasty
DOC.TEXT: The 21st ~ 31st dynasties. It was dominated by foreign forces such as Assyria and Persia, and it did not react.

DOC.Title: Ra
DOC.TEXT: The principal god in the ancient Egyptian polytheism, the sun god.

DOC.Title: Amon, Amen
DOC.TEXT: Guardian of Thebes. It was regarded as the supreme god since the middle kingdom, and in the new kingdom it joined with Ra and spread widely as Ammon-Ra.

DOC.Title: Aton
DOC.TEXT: God represented by the sun. Amenhotep IV is the only god who forced faith in opposition to the polytheist whose main god is Ammon-Ra.

DOC.Title: Osiris
DOC.TEXT: God of death and resurrection. Honor the world after death, and make a referee after death.

DOC.Title: "The Book of the Dead"
DOC.TEXT: In compliance with Osiris' referee, the papyrus document which wrote the good deeds and spells of the deceased, and was later buried. It is a guidebook of the world after the death of the ancient Egyptians, which expresses the view of the afterlife, the view of religion, and the view of morality.

DOC.Title: Mummy
DOC.TEXT: The remains processed and preserved from the faith of the immortal soul. It was made possible by dry climate and excellent preservation technique.

DOC.Title: pyramid
DOC.TEXT: It is thought to be a megalithic tomb for preserving the body of the ruler (mummy). Representative building of the old kingdom of Egypt, with the masterba (a megalithic tomb where a staircase or a vertical hole communicates with a corpse stored in the body). The most developed in the 4th dynasty, the largest King of Khufu is about 137 m in height, about 230 m on the side of the base, about 180 m on the hypotenuse, about 5.8 million tons in total, mobilizing 100 000 people in construction It is said that it took 20 years. Although it showed the magnificence of Pharaoh power, it became miniaturized after the 5th Dynasty, then disappeared.

DOC.Title: Sphinx
DOC.TEXT: An image with a human head and a fuselage of a lion. Guardian of the royal palace / temple / tomb. The one before the Pyramid of Giza is the most famous.

DOC.Title: Solar Calendar
DOC.TEXT: Calendar based on solar years. The ancient Egyptians set the year to 365 days from the positional relationship between the flood of the Nile and the star Sirius.

DOC.Title: Julian calendar
DOC.TEXT: The calendar enacted by Caesar in the late Roman Republic. A solar calendar was improved, and a leap year was set once every four years.

DOC.Title: Egyptian character
DOC.TEXT: A collective term used by ancient Egyptians for sacred letters, priestess letters, and private letters.

DOC.Title: Sacred letters, hieroglyphs
DOC.TEXT: The first Egyptian character developed from emoji. Hieroglyphs, Greeks called sacred letters. It was engraved in a temple, a grave etc.

DOC.Title: Shinto characters, hieratics
DOC.TEXT: Simplified typeface of sacred letters. It was used for religious documents, public documents, literary works.

DOC.Title: Civil characters, popular characters, demotics
DOC.TEXT: The simplest typeface.

DOC.Title: Rosetta = Stone
DOC.TEXT: A stone monument discovered in 1799 during Napoleon 's expedition in Egypt. It was an inscription in 196 years before praising Ptolemy V. It was engraved with three types of sacred letters, private letters, Greek letters in order from the top, and it became a clue to decipher the sacred character.

DOC.Title: Shampollon
DOC.TEXT: Egyptian scholar in France. In 1822, I succeeded in deciphering sacred letters from the inscription of Rosetta = Stone.

DOC.Title: Papyrus
DOC.TEXT: It is a kind of a large cane tree grass which grew steadily in wetlands of the basin of the Nile Basin. Several pieces of the stem which were opened vertically were stuck at a right angle, compressed and dried, and used as a kind of paper. Etymology of English paper.

DOC.Title: Datum surgery
DOC.TEXT: Practical knowledge developed for land restoration after the flood of the Nile. It is regarded as the origin of geometry.

DOC.Title: Syria
DOC.TEXT: Northern region of the east coast of the Mediterranean. It corresponds to the current Syrian-Lebanon countries. In the ancient Orient, Phoenicians and Alam people played an important role as an active stage.

DOC.Title: "Sea people"
DOC.TEXT: A collective term for ethnic groups who attack countries and cities in the eastern Mediterranean from the end of the 13th century to the beginning of the 12th century and confused a wide area. The ethnic lineage is unknown. Due to their invasion, Hittite was destroyed and Egypt weakened.

DOC.Title: Alam people
DOC.TEXT: Semitic nomads. Formed many small kingdoms mainly in Syria from the 12th to the 8th century ago, and was active in the inland relay trade. I belonged to Assyria in the 8th century.

DOC.Title: Damascus
DOC.TEXT: Around the 10th century, the capital of the small kingdom built by the Alam people. It prospered as the largest center of the Aram people's trading activity.

DOC.Title: Aramaic language
DOC.TEXT: One of the oldest Western western language. It became the international commercial language of Western Asia by the Araman trading activity. It was later used as the official language of Assyria · New Babylonia · Achaemenes.

DOC.Title: Alam character
DOC.TEXT: A phonogram consisting of 22 consonants popularized in West Asia from the 9th to the 8th century ago. It was transmitted to various places, in West Asia it became the mother of Hebrew letters and Arabic letters, in the east it was the mother of Sogudo letters, Occupation letters, Uyghur letters, Mongolian letters and Manchu characters. [In recent years, a theory that the Arama character can not be concluded as a mother is also issued about the character that character. ]

DOC.Title: Phoenician
DOC.TEXT: Semese ethnic groups. It is thought that it developed from a group of Canaan people. Constructed many city states on the current Lebanon coast and almost monopolized the Mediterranean trade since around the 12th century. Its activity extends to the Black Sea and the Red Sea coast, and built colonial cities around the Mediterranean coast.

DOC.Title: Ugarito
DOC.TEXT: Seaport's seaport city. The Phoenicians developed a culture influenced by Orient civilization and Aegean civilization in the 15th century. It was destroyed by the invasion of "the people of the sea" around 1200 years ago.

DOC.Title: Sidon
DOC.TEXT: Phoenician seaport city state. It prosperous from around the 12th century and was destroyed by the new Bapieronia in the 6th century before.

DOC.Title: Tirth
DOC.TEXT: Phoenician seaport city state, alongside Sidon. It prospered from around the 12th century before, and built colonial city Cartago in North Africa before 814. After joining Assyria / New Babylonia / Achaemenid Dynasty with other cities, he also engaged in maritime trade.

DOC.Title: Sinai character
DOC.TEXT: A phonetic character for Semitic system developed from Egyptian hieroglyphics. It was discovered in the Sinai peninsula in the beginning of the 20th century.

DOC.Title: Phoenician character
DOC.TEXT: A phonogram consisting of 22 consonants, which Phoenicians made based on Sinai characters. Along with the trading activities of the Phoenicians, it was transmitted to the eastern Mediterranean coast and was accepted by the Greeks in the 8th century and became the source of Western Western characters.

DOC.Title: Alphabet
DOC.TEXT: Phonogram developed from Sinai character · Phoenician character. Greek letters were added in Greece and Greek = alphabet of 24 letters was born. Latin letters and Russian letters developed later from Greek letters and spread throughout Europe.

DOC.Title: Palestine
DOC.TEXT: Southern region of the east coast of the Mediterranean. In old days it was called Canaan. The name of Palestine is derived from the Philistines (Phyllthians) established in the south.

DOC.Title: Canaanese people
DOC.TEXT: Semese ethnic group living in the present Palestinian region. Prior to the 15th to the 14th century flourished with trade, but then subordinated to Hebrews.

DOC.Title: Hebrews
DOC.TEXT: Semese ethnic groups. I was sending nomadic life to the upper stream of the Euphrates River, but I settled and settled in Palestine around 1500 a year ago. A part of it moved to Egypt, but led by Moses in the 13th century before the escape from Egypt and returned to Palestine. After that, the kingdom was built around 1000 years ago, but the kingdom split before 922. Hebrews were nicknamed by foreigners, they called themselves as Israelis. Also, after the capture of Babylon is often called a Jew.

DOC.Title: Mosé
DOC.TEXT: The legendary Prophet of the Hebrews. It is said that he guided "Exodus Egypt" around the 13th century before and led the Hebrews to Palestine. On that occasion, it is said that the only command in Sinai Mountain from God Yahweh was given the Ten Commandments and set the core of the Jewish law.

DOC.Title: "Egypt"
DOC.TEXT: The events described in Exodus in the Old Testament. After immigrating to Egypt, the Hebrews who were under pressure of the new kingdom are going to escape in accordance with Moses around the 13th century and the process of establishing in Palestine is drawn.

DOC.Title: Davide
DOC.TEXT: King of the Kingdom of Hebrew King (around 1,000 before pre-presence to around 960 before). Jerusalem was the capital, and the heyday of the kingdom appeared.

DOC.Title: Solomon
DOC.TEXT: King of the Hebrew King of the Third Kingdoms (around 960 before before 922 around). I trade in trade trading, boasting of the glory of Solomon such as building the temple of Yahweh. After the death, the kingdom divided into Israel and Judah.

DOC.Title: Jerusalem
DOC.TEXT: Central city of Palestine. Since David has been regarded as the capital of Hebrew kingdom, the temple of Yahweh was built in the days of King Solomon, becoming a holy land of Judaism. Since then it became a sacred place for Christianity and Islamism, so the conflict between the three peoples has been repeated.

DOC.Title: Israel kingdom
DOC.TEXT: A country built in the northern part after division of the Hebrew kingdom. Although it fought with the Kingdom of Judah in the South, it was conquered and died in Assyria 722 ago.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Juda
DOC.TEXT: A country built in the south after division of the Kingdom of Hebrew. It was destroyed by the new Babylonia before 586, and the inhabitants were in captivity of Babylon.

DOC.Title: Babylon Captivity
DOC.TEXT: Nebuchadnezzar II of the new Babylonian destroyed the kingdom of Judah and caused many of its inhabitants to migrate to Babylon. It was released by Cyrus II of the Achaemenid dynasty that destroyed the new Babylonia before 538 years ago. The Jews who returned home confirmed the correctness of Yahweh faith and rejoined the temple in Jerusalem to establish Judaism. This incident also became a factor that Jews adopted Mesopotamian legends / myths etc.

DOC.Title: Judaism
DOC.TEXT: The Jewish ethnic religion. It is the only god of Yahweh, featuring electoral thought, judicialism, Messiah belief, etc. The influence of Zoroastrianism was seen in the thought of the last referee and angel · demon, and later influenced the formation of Christianity and Islamist.

DOC.Title: Yahweh, Yerve
DOC.TEXT: The only god of Judaism.

DOC.Title: electoral thought
DOC.TEXT: An exclusive idea that only Jews who keep the contract with Yahweh will be saved. Jesus denied this ethnic superiority.

DOC.Title: Messiah, savior
DOC.TEXT: The meaning of "those who have been anointed" in Hebrew. It was the meaning of those who save the Jewish people from the ruin, but in other religions they also appear at the end of this world to save people, meaning in Christianity Jesus.

DOC.Title: Prophet
DOC.TEXT: He who trusts the word of God and warns people to warn them. It is said to emerge during the crisis of the Jewish people.

DOC.Title: "Old Testament"
DOC.TEXT: The Jewish teaching which compiled the Hebrews' tradition, the anthem for Him, the words of the prophets between the past ten and the first century. It also became a Christian church, this name was given to the "New Testament".

DOC.Title: Assyria
DOC.TEXT: Semese-based. It was founded in the northern Mesopotamia centering on the Ashle in the middle of the Tigris. In the 15th century before, he was affiliated with Mitanni, but eventually he recovered his independence and formed a powerful military state. In the first half of the 7th century, the main part of all Orient including Egypt was unified for the first time, the king of the tyrant divided the whole country into states and dispatched the governor to rule. It is said to be the first "world empire", but because of severe domination such as forced relocation and heavy taxes, it was rebelled by belonging ethnic groups and decreased in the previous 612, by the attack of the new Babylonia (Chaldea) and the media.

DOC.Title: "World Empire"
DOC.TEXT: A country that conquers a vast area and holds a variety of ethnic groups, yet retains powerful control.

DOC.Title: Ashle
DOC.TEXT: A city in the middle of the Tigris. In the first city of Assyria, the guardian god of the city of the same name became the god of creation of heaven and earth.

DOC.Title: Nineveh
DOC.TEXT: Cities of the Tigris Midstream Left Bank. It became the capital of Assyria from the end of the 8th century. It is also known that the large library was built during the time of King Ashl-Banipal (668 before 627 before 627 before).

DOC.Title: Ashuru God
DOC.TEXT: Originally the guardian of Ashuru, became the national god by the formation of the Assyrian Empire.

DOC.Title: Region State
DOC.TEXT: A state established in the conquest area / colony.

DOC.Title: 4 Kingdom Partitioning
DOC.TEXT: Lydia Media · New Bapieronia (Caldea) · Egypt was divided into Orient since 612.

DOC.Title: Lydia
DOC.TEXT: Indian = European language system. Flourished in the southwestern part of Asia Minor from the 7th century before, in the latter half of the 7th century, the world's oldest metal coin was used. Before the year 546 was destroyed by Cyrus II of the Achaemenid dynasty.

DOC.Title: New Babylonian, Caldea
DOC.TEXT: A Semitic Chaldean country. Babylon the capital. It dominated the "fertile crescent moon" from Mesopotamia to Syria and Palestine, and was the most urgent among the four kingdoms. In the previous 538 years, it was destroyed by Cyrus II of the Achaemenid dynasty.

DOC.Title: Nebuchadnezzar II
DOC.TEXT: The King of the Kingdom of the New Babylonian Kingdom (604 to before 562 before the preliminary period). In the previous year 586 he destroyed the Kingdom of Judah and carried out Babylonian captivity against the Jews.

DOC.Title: Media
DOC.TEXT: The first nation built by Indian-European Iranians. The capital is Ekbatana. In the previous 612, it was an alliance with the new Babylonia and destroyed Assyria and it became strong, but it was destroyed by Cyrus II of the AKEMENESE morning 550 years ago.

DOC.Title: Ekbatana
DOC.TEXT: Iran Midwest city. City of media. Current Hamadan.

DOC.Title: Iran
DOC.TEXT: An area centered on the Iranian plateau of West Asia. Originated from the early residents' self-stated Arujah (noble people). The Iranian civilization zone includes the Mesopotamian region and Central Asia.

DOC.Title: Persia
DOC.TEXT: Former name of Iran. The region name Pearse (Pulsa) in the southwestern part of the Iranian plateau where the Achaemenid Dynasty occurred was Latinized.

DOC.Title: Persian, Iranian
DOC.TEXT: Indian-ethnic ethnic group. It happened from a district centered on the Iranian plateau.

DOC.Title: Akemeneshi
DOC.TEXT: The dynasty of the ancient Persian Empire. The founder is Akemenes. Cyrus II destroyed the media before 550 years ago, expanded the territory by destroying Lydia Caldea. Next Campyseus II conquered Egypt and unified all Orient. Furthermore, during Darius I generation, the east developed into an empire ranging from the Indus River basin to the west to the northern Aegean Sea coast. Failed in Greek expedition (Persian war), and then was destroyed by the eastern expedition of Alexander the Great. As official languages ​​Persian, Elamese, Babylonian, Assyrian, Aramaic, etc. were used, while Persian characters which phonetically cuneiform letters were used for letters were used.

DOC.Title: Persian character
DOC.TEXT: Cuneiform letters used to represent the Persian language in the Achaemenid period. However, in West Asia after the destruction of the Achaemenid dynasty, Alam characters became mainstream, cuneiform shaped letters are no longer used.

DOC.Title: Cyrus II
DOC.TEXT: Founder of the Achaemenid dynasty (559 before 530 before being). In the previous 550 years, it destroyed the media and became independent, further destroyed Lydia · Shin Babylonia, laying the foundation of the great empire.

DOC.Title: Cambieses II
DOC.TEXT: King of the second generation of Achaemenid (530 to before 522 before the preliminary) 522. He conquered Egypt and succeeded in unification of all Orient.

DOC.Title: Darius I, Darius I
DOC.TEXT: The king of the third generation of Achaemenids (522 before 486 before the post). In the confusion after the death of Cambusseus II, he entrusted himself, East built the great empire ranging from the Indus River to the north to the northern Aegean Sea coast. We divided the whole territory into about 20 states and established a centralized regime by appointing Satrap. We strengthened our financial base by casting gold and silver coins, improving taxation system, etc. In the fifth century BC, the Persian war broke out but failed.

DOC.Title: Persepolis
DOC.TEXT: The capital city where Darius I started construction. A New Year 's ceremony was held, but later Alexander the Great was destroyed and became ruins. The grand palace remains still today.

DOC.Title: Satrap, Governor
DOC.TEXT: Secretary of the state appointed by the king. Tax collection and security maintenance were the main duties, hereditary was not allowed.

DOC.Title: "King's eyes" "King's ears"
DOC.TEXT: Inspector of the direct reporting. He patrolled the province and reported to the king about the trends of Satrap and the local situation. The Satrap system has exerted centralized function by this.

DOC.Title: "King's Way"
DOC.TEXT: Long distance national road constructed by Darius I. Eleven-type system was developed, such as establishing 111 inns in the royal road of about 2,500 km from the most famous Susa to Sardis. The city and the district were directly connected, and it helped a lot in economic, military and security maintenance.

DOC.Title: Susa
DOC.TEXT: Cities in southwest Iran. It was the capital of the Achaemenid dynasty, the center of the administration.

DOC.Title: Sardis
DOC.TEXT: Cities in western Asia Minor. In the old days the capital of the Kingdom of Lydia was established, and the world's first casting money was created.

DOC.Title: Persian War
DOC.TEXT: The war between the Achaemenid dynasty that started in Darius I generation and the police of Greece. Although it was a war spanning three times before and after, the Achaemenid Dynasty was defeated.

DOC.Title: Zoroastrianism, Takashi Fire
DOC.TEXT: The religion of Iran made by Zoroaster around the seventh century BC (There are hypotheses such as the theory that Zoroaster is about 1200 years ago about the time of activity of Zoroaster). Based on good and evil dualism, we capture the world from the conflict between Afra-Mazda of goodness and Eariman of evil. He emphasized the worship of fire and light, so it is also called worship teacher. It was protected in the Achaemenid morning and was regarded as a state religion in the Sasan morning. It was introduced to China around the time of Northern Wei and was called ç æ.

DOC.Title: Afra = Mazda
DOC.TEXT: Supreme god of Zoroastrianism. God of light and goodness.

DOC.Title: Ahriman
DOC.TEXT: A god of darkness and evil that conflicts with Afra-Mazda.

DOC.Title: Last Judgment
DOC.TEXT: In Zoroastrianism, the superiority of good and evil gods is exchanged every 3000 years, the good god won the decisive battle of 9000 or 12,000 years, and the spirit of good people was supposed to be saved. It also affected Judaism and Christianity.

DOC.Title: Grotte fent
DOC.TEXT: A German scholar. I studied the Persepolis inscription and got the chance to decode the cuneiform shape.

DOC.Title: Persepolis inscription
DOC.TEXT: Inscriptions of Persian characters excavated from Persepolis. It became a clue to decorate cuneiform characters.

DOC.Title: Raurinson
DOC.TEXT: A British scholar. I transcribed and studied Behistoon inscription, succeeded in deciphering cuneiform characters.

DOC.Title: Behiston inscription
DOC.TEXT: An inscription engraved on a rock wall facing the "King's Way" in Western Iran. The record of Darius I was recorded.

DOC.Title: Alexander the Great, Alexander the Great
DOC.TEXT: King of Macedonia (before the preliminary 336-before 323). We carried out the eastern expedition, we reduced the Akemenes morning and conquered Central Asia and the Indus River Basin. We tried to form a Hellenistic culture that fuses East and West culture, but after death the great territory was divided by its captains.

DOC.Title: Seleucid morning
DOC.TEXT: After the death of Alexander, the Hellenistic state the warrior built in Syria. It owned the majority of West Asia including the Iranian Plateau, but in the 3rd century Bactria / Parthia declined autonomously and declined in Rome the previous century.

DOC.Title: Bactria
DOC.TEXT: A country that Greek residents autonomously built under the Seleucid morning and built in the upper stream of the Am River. Hellenistic culture was conveyed to northwestern India, and Gandhara art was born in the Kushana era. It was destroyed by Scythian Tohara people.

DOC.Title: Parthia, Arthaketh morning
DOC.TEXT: From the control of the Seleucid morning, the Iranian nomads led by Arusaketh are self-sustaining, a country built in the southeast of the Caspian Sea. After the 2nd century BC, it became mighty, and fought with Rome in the Mesopotamian region after the destruction of Seleucos morning. While under the strong influence of Hellenistic culture, I was conscious of the successor to the Achaemenid Dynasty and eventually revived the Persian culture such as Zoroastrianism. In almost the same age as the Chinese Han, it occupied the western part of "Silk Road" and contributed to the exchange of East-West civilization. It was destroyed in Sasan morning in the 3 rd century.

DOC.Title: Arasquez
DOC.TEXT: The chieftain of Iranian nomads parni. It built the kingdom of Parthia, became the founder of the Arthaketh morning.

DOC.Title: Sabbath
DOC.TEXT: Chinese transliteration of Arusakes. It is listed in the great name "Fumihiki" as a country name.

DOC.Title: Mitra Dathus I
DOC.TEXT: King of Parthian King of the 6th (before the preliminary 171-before 138). In the east it attacked Bactria, in the west it occupied Seleucia and oppressed the Seleucus morning.

DOC.Title: Cutsiphon
DOC.TEXT: A city on the east coast of the Tigris Midstream. It was built by Mitrazados I, became the capital of winter after that, became the capital after the mid-first century. Sasan morning also set the capital here.

DOC.Title: Parthia
DOC.TEXT: In Arthaketh morning, the language used with Greek and Aramaic language.

DOC.Title: Sasan Dawn
DOC.TEXT: Instead of Parthia, Iranian farmers built the Kingdom of Fars in the southern Iranian plateau. The dynasty name comes from the founder Alda Seal's grandfather Sasan. The capital is Cuti Siphon. Although Zoroastrianism was established as a state religion, it continued prosperity while repeating the conflict with Rome and eastern Rome, but it was invaded by Eftal in the 5th century. It was the heyday after defeating Eftal in the days of Phill I, but it was destroyed by the Islamic force in the seventh century.

DOC.Title: Arda Seal I, Aldeser I a
DOC.TEXT: King of the first Sasan dynasty (ranking 224 to 241). He destroyed Parthia, founded the Sasan dynasty and called it the "King of the King". Zoroastrianism was regarded as state religion.

DOC.Title: Shirpool I
DOC.TEXT: Sasan dynasty second generation king (rank 241-272). In the east it broke the Kushana morning, while in the west he called himself "prince of Roman emperor Valerianus at the fight of Edessa" King of Iranian and non-Iranian kings. "

DOC.Title: Valerianus, Valerianus
DOC.TEXT: Roman military emperor (ranking 253-260). We made an expedition to the East, but it was caught by Charpool I.

DOC.Title: Kushana morning
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty which dominated Afghan / North-north India in the 1st-3rd century. It was attacked by Sasan morning in Sharp Pool I era and faded.

DOC.Title: Eftal
DOC.TEXT: A cavalry herd who was active in Central Asia in the 5th-6th centuries. It is also said to be Turkish and Iranian. Chinese name is åå or white å å. It also invaded Turkistan and Northwest India, fought over the Sasan Dynasty and the East-West trade route. In the latter half of the 6th century it collapsed and collapsed in the Sasan dynasty and it was destroyed.

DOC.Title: Phill I I
DOC.TEXT: King of the Sasan morning peak (ruling 531-579). He developed the battle favorably with Emperor Justinian of Eastern Roma advantageously, and allied with him and destroyed Eftal, and revealed the heyday of Sasan dynasty.

DOC.Title: Philosophy II
DOC.TEXT: Susan Morning King (rank 591-628). I made an expedition to Eastern Rome, but I lost to Herculesius I.

DOC.Title: Battle of Naha Vand
DOC.TEXT: Battle between Sasan morning and Islamic army in western Iran. Sasan morning was completely defeated and soon fell apart.

DOC.Title: Zoroastrianism
DOC.TEXT: In Sasan morning it was regarded as a state religion, the classics were compiled and a church organization was established. It was utilized to raise the ethnic spirit against Rome, but since the 7th century the conversion to Iranian Islam has progressed, Zoroastrian moved to Central Asia and India. In China it was called ç æ.

DOC.Title: "Avestar"
DOC.TEXT: Zoroastrian scripture. The age of establishment is unknown. Existing ones were completed in the Sasan dynasty era.

DOC.Title: Nestorian faction
DOC.TEXT: A faction of Christianity who was regarded as heretical at Ephesus Council. It was transmitted to the east centering on Sasan morning, and in Tang Dynasty China it was called Jingkyo.

DOC.Title: Maniacism
DOC.TEXT: Religion Founded by Mani in the First Half of the 3rd Century. Fusion of elements of Christianity and Buddhism with Zoroastrianism, characterized by exhaustive good and evil dualism, asceticism, idolatry denial. In Sasan morning, except for Sharp Pool I era, it was repressed, but in the west it was transmitted to North Africa and South France in the late Roman Empire, to the Central Asia and China to the east.

DOC.Title: Mani
DOC.TEXT: A religiousist born in Babylonia who created Maniacism. He was persecuted in the Sasan dynasty and executed.

DOC.Title: Masudaku
DOC.TEXT: The teaching that Mazdak says as both a religious reformer and a social reformer. It is also regarded as one of the heretics of Zoroastrianism. Although it insisted on extreme abstinence and equality, it was repressed in the sixth century and faded.

DOC.Title: Sasan morning art
DOC.TEXT: Traditional Iranian art, incorporating Hellenistic style and surrounding styles. Excellent items were made in silverware, glassware, fabrics, etc. It was also passed on to China and Japan through Oasis' way (silk road).

DOC.Title: Horyuji Temple
DOC.TEXT: In the first half of the 7th century, Nara Prefecture Ikaruga was a temple where Prince Shotoku was founded. It is the oldest wooden building in the world, leaving many arts and crafts since its establishment.

DOC.Title: Shishi Hunterishiki
DOC.TEXT: Collection of Horyu-ji Temple. Works of the Tang Dynasty who were influenced by Sasan dynasty art.

DOC.Title: Shosoin
DOC.TEXT: Nara, Takashi-ji Temple 's imperial treasure warehouse. Since the establishment of the 8th century I have not been suffering from suffering, I convey the cultures of the time to now.

DOC.Title: Lacquer bottle
DOC.TEXT: Shosoin 's treasure. Typical Sasan dynasty style artwork including forms, methods, patterns etc. The character of "Hu" refers to the Iranian family in the Tang Dynasty.

DOC.Title: Aegean civilization
DOC.TEXT: Bronze civilization flourished around the Aegean Sea around 3000 to before 1200. Especially the Creta civilization flourished around 2000 and before 1400 and the Mycenae civilization which flourished around 1600 and before 1200 are important.

DOC.Title: Schlieman
DOC.TEXT: German archaeologist. Since I was young I believed the contents of the epic poem of Homer as a fact, after 1870 I discovered the Troy (Troya) · Mycene region and proved its existence.

DOC.Title: Evans
DOC.TEXT: British archaeologist. After discovering the remains of the Knossos palace since 1900, discovered Creta civilization.

DOC.Title: Crete civilization, Minos civilization
DOC.TEXT: Bronze age civilization flourished in maritime trading centering on Crete Island, around 2000 to before 1400. The ethnic lineage is unknown. From the legendary King Minos, also known as Minos civilization. Although it is under the influence of the Orient civilization, the palace has no walls, the mural paintings of marine animals and humans in a graphical way, the pot paintings, etc. show the open nature. It was destroyed by the invasion of the Achaeans.

DOC.Title: Minos
DOC.TEXT: The legendary king who lived in the Knossos palace, appearing in Greek mythology.

DOC.Title: Cretan
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic who fell in Creta civilization. Because the characters used by them are unread, there are many unclear points such as ethnic lineage and social organization.

DOC.Title: Crete Emoji
DOC.TEXT: Hieroglyphs used since the early days of Crete civilization. Later letters A from this pictogram followed by the line character B of Mycenae civilization later developed. Emoji / line character A is unreadable.

DOC.Title: Knossos
DOC.TEXT: It is the center of Crete civilization located on the northern coast of Crete. A magnificent palace was excavated, and many small rooms / corridors were arranged in a complex manner, so it was also imitated by the labyrinth (Lavilintus) built by legendary Minos. Even after the destruction of the Cretan civilization, it prospered as the base of the Mycenae civilization until around 1200.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Crete
DOC.TEXT: A kingdom that became Crete civilization centering on Crete Island. About 1,400 years ago, it was destroyed by the Achaeans who built the Mycenae civilization.

DOC.Title: Achaean
DOC.TEXT: Generic name of the first wave of Greeks who fell south from the 20th century to the Greek region. Formed the Mycenae civilization, destroyed Crete civilization.

DOC.Title: Mycene civilization
DOC.TEXT: Bronze age civilization formed around the Mycenae region of the Peloponnesos Peninsula in the first wave of the Greeks by Achaeans around 1600 before 1200. Early 14 to the thirteenth century was the heyday, but the conflict continued after the division into the small kingdom and a megalithic fort was built. In the second wave of the Greeks, it was said to have been destroyed by the invasion of the Dorians, but in recent years, the theory that it is destroyed as a result of multiple causes such as attacks of "sea people" and climate change intertwined .

DOC.Title: Mycene
DOC.TEXT: The center of the Mycenae civilization. Located in the northeastern part of the Peloponnesos Peninsula, a solid megalithic fortress was built surrounding the Acropolis. Shuriman excavated.

DOC.Title: Tilens
DOC.TEXT: Representative remains of the Mycenae civilization. Located in the south of Mycenae.

DOC.Title: Pyros
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of Mycenae civilization. Located on the western south coast of Peloponnese. Numerous clay plates engraved with line character B were excavated.

DOC.Title: Line character
DOC.TEXT: Line character used in Aegean civilization. A line character A in the late Crete civilization, and a line character B in the Mycenae civilization period.

DOC.Title: Venturis
DOC.TEXT: British architect. In 1952, we succeeded in deciphering the line character B and proved that the language is ancient Greek.

DOC.Title: Troy, Troya
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of small Asia western north coast. Schlieman excavated and proved the existence of Troia in Homer's poem. The seventh layer of the 9 ruins is said to be the Trojan civilization of the same period as the Mycenae civilization.

DOC.Title: Trojan War
DOC.TEXT: The legendary war that the heroes of ancient Greece attacked Troy and made it fall after the siege for 10 years. It was drawn vividly in the epic poems "Iliad" and "Odyssey" which are made by Homer.

DOC.Title: Sonoda kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The tax system carried out during the Mycenae civilization period. We collected agricultural products etc from farmers using contribution organization.

DOC.Title: "Sea people"
DOC.TEXT: From the end of the 13th century to the beginning of the 12th century, people with unknown ethnic line who confused a wide area of ​​the eastern Mediterranean. It is thought to be related to the sudden decline of the Mycenee civilization.

DOC.Title: Dark Ages
DOC.TEXT: The era of Greek history in the past 12 to 8 th century. About 400 years after the decline of the Mycenee civilization was poor in historical material and it was named because it is almost unknown. In the meantime, it moved to the iron age, entering the era of a new Greek civilization centered on police from around the 8th century.

DOC.Title: Greece
DOC.TEXT: Southern part of the Balkans. It was a mountainous terrain with no large river or large plain and because it had less rain, it was more suitable for cultivating fruits such as olives and grapes than grain cultivation. Because of relying on imports of grain, transportation and trade by the sea has developed from early on.

DOC.Title: Greeks
DOC.TEXT: Indian = European language system. Began to the north of the Balkan Peninsula to the south to Greece, from the 20th century before the establishment. According to dialect, it is divided into eastern dialect group (Achaean, later Ionian / Aiolis) and Western dialect group (Dorian).

DOC.Title: Ionian people
DOC.TEXT: A group of Greeks who settled in the eastern part of the peninsula and the west coast of Asia, southward to the Greek region since the 20th century before. Athens is representative.

DOC.Title: Aiolis person
DOC.TEXT: A group of Greeks distributed from northern peninsula to northern small Asia.

DOC.Title: Dorians
DOC.TEXT: The second wave of the Greeks. Center of Western dialect group. Around the end of the 12th century before the end of the 12th century, with the ironware south, spread to the southern peninsula and the Aegean Islands, settled.

DOC.Title: clay loss
DOC.TEXT: About private property. Originally it means "lottery", after settling, derived from distributing land to individuals by lot.

DOC.Title: Settlement, Shinoyukismos
DOC.TEXT: About the 8th century before the century, influential people (nobility) migrated to military and economic points and integrated the surrounding villages. Police and aristocracy were formed by this.

DOC.Title: Police
DOC.TEXT: An ancient Greek city state. It consists of the city center surrounded by walls and the surrounding countryside. Politically it is completely self-sustaining, with more than 1000 police existed. The aristocracy monopolized the military and politics at the time of formation, aristocratic government was done.

DOC.Title: Acropolis
DOC.TEXT: In the meaning of Shiroyama, the hill in the center of the police. It became the center of faith of citizens, the guardian god of the city was festivities, but in emergency it became a castle.

DOC.Title: Agora
DOC.TEXT: Public square was located at the foot of the Acropolis. Trade, gatherings, trials, etc. were held, and it was the center of politics and economic activities of police.

DOC.Title: Helenness
DOC.TEXT: Autonomous name of ancient Greeks. The meaning of the descendants of Helen Helen. Although the Greeks were politically separated, thought that the ancestors were the same, the same ethnic consciousness was strong. In addition, he called his land area Hellas.

DOC.Title: Barbaryo
DOC.TEXT: Nickname used by ancient Greeks despised against foreigners. It means "a person who speaks difficult words."

DOC.Title: Neighboring Union Alliance
DOC.TEXT: A religious alliance that the neighboring police made for the purpose of jointly holding the temple and festival.

DOC.Title: Orchestra of Delphi, oracle of Delphi
DOC.TEXT: Delphi is the land of Central Greece, and there is the Apollon Temple. That oracle is authoritative, and many policeman leaders questioned whether to decide important matters such as declaration, peace and colonization.

DOC.Title: Festival of Olympia
DOC.TEXT: A festival held in Olympia every four years from the previous 776. Olympia is known for the Temple of Zeus, and a sports competition was held as a festival for the temple. Every battle was stopped during the competition period, and it helped fellowship between police. In 393, it was canceled by the Royal Emperor 's Edict.

DOC.Title: "Humans are police animals"
DOC.TEXT: In Greek classical period, Aristotle's words, which show that there are all kinds of living infrastructure in police.

DOC.Title: Colonial City, Greek colonial city
DOC.TEXT: Around the 8th and 6th centuries ago, those who wanted a new place from the lack of land due to population increase and political conflict within police were built around the Black Sea and the Mediterranean Sea. The colonial city became a politically independent police from the mother city, promoting the expansion of Greek culture and trading activity.

DOC.Title: Byzantion
DOC.TEXT: Colonial city built in the area facing the Bosphorus Strait. Current Istanbul.

DOC.Title: Massa Ria
DOC.TEXT: A colonial city built on the Mediterranean coast of southern France. Current Marseille.

DOC.Title: Neapolis
DOC.TEXT: Colonial city built in southern Italy. Current Naples.

DOC.Title: Syracuse
DOC.TEXT: Constructed on the east coast of Sicily, colonial city with Corinth as the mother city.

DOC.Title: Nicene
DOC.TEXT: A colonial city built on the Mediterranean coast of southern France. Nice current.

DOC.Title: Talentum
DOC.TEXT: Colonial city built in southern Italy. Current taranto.

DOC.Title: Use of money
DOC.TEXT: Metal money used in the Lydia Kingdom of Asia Minor in the latter half of the seventh century passed through the Ionian colonial city, and each police produced its own currency. Its promotion promoted commercial activities, created wealthy commoners, promoted the development of heavily infantry units based on the principle of self-defense of weapons. On the other hand, a lot of debtors were born and some people became obligations.

DOC.Title: Sparta
DOC.TEXT: Polari of the Dorian who occupied the Laconia plain in the southern part of the Peloponnesos Peninsula. A typical example of a conquering police which the Dorians conquered indigenous people and constructed. In Greece exceptional grain self-sufficiency was possible, citizen's commercial and industrial activities were prohibited and the isolation system was taken. In order to suppress the rebellion of the conquered people, a complete citizen conqueror set a unique national system called "Ryukurugosu system".

DOC.Title: Halo Thailand, Helot
DOC.TEXT: Agricultural farmers shared by the entire citizen of Sparta. In the 8th century BC, when the Dorians invaded the land of Sparta, the origin was conquered by the people, forced farming labor and was obligated to contribute. The number was presumed to be several times the full citizen, and often revolted.

DOC.Title: Periodicoi
DOC.TEXT: An incomplete citizen of Sparta. In the sense of "people living in the surroundings", engaged in agriculture, commerce and industry. He was charged with the duty of Sonoda · Syuto, but he did not have voting rights.

DOC.Title: Ryukurugosu
DOC.TEXT: Sparta legendary legislator. In order to preserve the superiority of the full citizen who is a heavily infantry soldier, it is told that it has established unique military and isolation system.

DOC.Title: Athens
DOC.TEXT: Police that Ionians built in the Attic region. Typical of police formed by settlement. Commercial trade was gradually developed mainly. Its name is Goddess Athena.

DOC.Title: Aristocratic Politics
DOC.TEXT: In the mid-eighth century, Athens shifted from royalty to aristocracy. Large owning aristocrats monopolized military and politics, nine of the nominees selected by nobles (Governor, one year term) governed the police.

DOC.Title: Heavy infantry, Greek heavy infantry
DOC.TEXT: Infantry equipped with heads, armor, shimmer, shield, and long spear. Because that compact formation was the main force of the fight, monopoly of the aristocratic government was upset when traders and industries developed and civilians participated in the battle as a heavily infantry soldier.

DOC.Title: Phalanx
DOC.TEXT: The long spear formation. Heavy infantry with long spears and shields lined up next to each other, and I could do it by forming a row.

DOC.Title: Culon
DOC.TEXT: A nobleman of Athens in the seventh century before. In the previous 632 I tried to become a master, but I failed and I was executed.

DOC.Title: Dragon
DOC.TEXT: A legislator of Athens in the latter half of the 7th century. Codified traditional customary laws and broke the monopoly of the nobility by the law. It regrets private revenge, entrusts to Police 's trial, and maintains order.

DOC.Title: Solon
DOC.TEXT: A politician in Athens. Although it took reform in the previous 594, it was later accused by both aristocrat and the commoner and retired.

DOC.Title: Reform of Solon
DOC.TEXT: A systematic reform that Solon took as a mediator entrusted with full authority. Delegation of debt, prohibition of debt obligations, implementation of property politics was the main content. It was unpopular from both aristocrats and commoners, and they could not resolve their confrontation relationship.

DOC.Title: debt obligation
DOC.TEXT: A person who has borrowed land and a body as a mortgage and has fallen by himself without repayment.

DOC.Title: Property Politics
DOC.TEXT: Citizens were divided into 4 categories according to their property and the suffrage power and duty of military service were determined according to the grade.

DOC.Title: å ä
DOC.TEXT: A dictator who took advantage of the dissatisfaction of the people, gained its support, grasped the power illegally. Principal politics appeared in the transition period from aristocratic politics to democratic politics in the seventh to the sixth century ago. It became the etymology of English tyrant tyrant.

DOC.Title: Paysistratus
DOC.TEXT: The master of Athens. In 561, in the past 561, with the support of the commoner, he became a principal, distributed the land and property of exiled nobility to the poor, protected and nurtured small and medium-sized farmers, and devoted themselves to beautification and cultural projects in Athens. After death, the second two turned into a tyranny.

DOC.Title: Claystenness
DOC.TEXT: A politician in Athens around the end of the sixth century ago. In the previous 508 years, reforms such as abolition of relativeship tribal system, establishment of ostracism, etc. were carried out, and the foundation of democratic rule was established by blocking the reproduction of aristocratic politicians and politicians.

DOC.Title: Demos, Demos Ward
DOC.TEXT: Meaning of village, villager, ward, people etc. Claystenne abolished the traditional four-tribal system of relatives, shifted to a regional ten-tribal system, and made it as a unit of administration and military.

DOC.Title: Five hundred people council
DOC.TEXT: An institution consisting of 50 councilors each selected by lottery from ten tribes, established through the reform of Claystennes. I was in charge of preliminary deliberations for the civil society and daily administration.
