DOC.Title: Ostrichism, extermination of pottery
DOC.TEXT: A voting system by citizens to prevent the emergence of principals. In the name of a dangerous person in the pottery (Ostracon), if the total number of votes was 6000 or more, the most voter was taken as a ban on 10 years of abroad (The theory that one who won 6000 votes was banished from the country is also is there). It was enforced for the first time in 487 years ago but it was abused afterwards and it was canceled at the end of the 5th century BC since it became an instigation instrument by demagogos.

DOC.Title: Persian War
DOC.TEXT: The war with the Greek police centered on Achaemenids Morning Persia and Athens. Greece defeated the invasion of the Persian army three times before 492, before 490, before 480 to before 479. Ultimately, it ended with about the sum of the Karias of 449 years ago.

DOC.Title: Ionian colonial city rebellion
DOC.TEXT: Before 500 The rebellion caused by Ionian cities in the west bank of Asia Minor for Darius I in the Achaemenid dynasty. The fact that Athens assisted this rebellion was the cause of the Persian war.

DOC.Title: Miletus
DOC.TEXT: City which became the center of Ionian colonial city rebellion. I have had a friendly relationship with Athens since long ago. It was occupied and destroyed by Persia 494 years ago.

DOC.Title: Battle of Marathon
DOC.TEXT: A battle where the Persian army landed at the Marathon on the northeastern coast of Athens was destroyed by Athens Heavy Infantry Army led by Miltiades. A story (legend) of a message that conveyed this victory to Athens is regarded as the origin of the marathon race.

DOC.Title: Battle of Thermopyre
DOC.TEXT: A Spartan army led by King Leonidas tried to stop the Persian army coming south, the extinct fight.

DOC.Title: Themistocles
DOC.TEXT: A politician in Athens. I commanded the Greek fleet in the naval battle of Salamis and broke the Persian fleet in a strategy strategy. It was later expelled by ostracism.

DOC.Title: Three-stage paddock ship
DOC.TEXT: An ancient warfare ship that rowers in upper, middle, lower three rows use a paddle to move. In Athens, the talking rights of nonproductive citizens who rowed in the Persian War increased after the war.

DOC.Title: Battle of Salamis
DOC.TEXT: The Greek fleet led by Themistocles brought the Persian fleet into the Salamis bay between Attica and Salamis Island and destroyed it.

DOC.Title: Battle of Platire, Battle of Bra Thier
DOC.TEXT: Battle where Athens Sparta Allies defeated the Persian Army. The victory of the Greeks side in the Persian War was finalized.

DOC.Title: Deros Alliance
DOC.TEXT: Formed around 478 years ago. A military alliance formed mainly for Athens in response to Persia's re-attack. It is said that about 200 polices around the Aegean Sea have joined in the heyday. The headquarters was placed in Delos. The member police were obliged to provide ships, soldiers or war capital. From 454 onwards the safe of the alliance was transferred to Athens and the Athenian Empire changed its name to Athens where Athens dominates other police.

DOC.Title: Pericres
DOC.TEXT: The leader of Athens heyday. Shogun. He took over the leadership of the Deros Alliance, realized the "Athenian Empire", completed the Greek democratic politics, and commanded the reconstruction of the Parthenon temple, the Pericyz era (before 443 and before 429). He died of disease during the Peloponnesus war.

DOC.Title: Democratic Politics
DOC.TEXT: Politics held by citizens taking initiative. The foundation was built by the reform of Claystennes in 508 years ago, and typical development was seen in Athens, such as completing with Pericle's guidance after the Persian war. The major content of the civil society was the conversion to the highest voting institution, the lottery system of most government offices excluding the general, the daily allowance for participants to the civil society and the trial etc. However, on the premise of the system of slavery, the conditions that can become citizens are limited, and women's participation in politics is not accepted, and there were also aspects that greatly differed from today's democratic politics.

DOC.Title: Direct democracy
DOC.TEXT: The civil society did not adopt the representative system, and all the citizens participated.

DOC.Title: Civics
DOC.TEXT: The highest institution on legislative, administrative and justice. It consisted of all the adult male citizens over the age of 18.

DOC.Title: People's Court
DOC.TEXT: A large number of juries among the people were selected by lot drawing, and the vote resulted in a ruling.

DOC.Title: Citizenship Act
DOC.TEXT: The law that the citizenship of Athens is allowed is limited to those whose parents are both Athens.

DOC.Title: Legacy, Greek slavery
DOC.TEXT: Ancient Greece was a fellow society alongside ancient Rome. Many of them were war prisoners of war and debt guys, which were sold and sold in the slush market. In Athens there were many individuals owned in house, occupied one third of the total population, engaged in agriculture and handicraft, but in mines they were used for collective labor. In Sparta, farmers belonging to farmers called Halo Ties were served as state-owned fans.

DOC.Title: Laureión
DOC.TEXT: Ginzan of Athens. The mining authority was lent to the citizens, where a large number of fellows were overworked and supported the economic power of Athens.

DOC.Title: Peloponnesos alliance
DOC.TEXT: Sparta-centered military alliance formed in the 6th century before. Most police of the Peloponnesos peninsula participated, and fought against the Deros Alliance, Peloponnesus war.

DOC.Title: Corinth, Corinth
DOC.TEXT: Police in the northeastern part of Peloponnese. Along with Sparta, he became the center of the Peloponnesos alliance, opposing Athens.

DOC.Title: Peloponnesus War
DOC.TEXT: The Delos alliance in the center of Athens and the war of the Peloponnesos alliance centering on Sparta. After the death of Perryz's disease, Athens fell into politics of liberty and was defeated by Sparta who was supported by Persia. Police society triggered the collapse.

DOC.Title: Politeness of Faith
DOC.TEXT: A corrupt form of democratic politics. During the Peloponnesos war, Athens' democratic politics is corrupt and it is said that democratic democracy fell into a typical politician of instinctive incitement for the people.

DOC.Title: Demagogos, demagogue
DOC.TEXT: An agitating politician. Continuing to Athens during the Peloponnese war, he broke down the democratic politics of Athens into politics of politeness.

DOC.Title: Thebes, Thebes
DOC.TEXT: The police of Ioris in Central Greece. He expanded the power under the guidance of Ephemannondus. In vain against the control of Sparta, he won the battle of Reuctiona (371 before), and held control of Greece for the next ten years.

DOC.Title: Mercenary fads
DOC.TEXT: The military that was made up of police citizenship changed to be supported by mercenaries. The main cause is that the citizen lost the land and fell down during the long war.

DOC.Title: Greek mythology
DOC.TEXT: The myth of Olympus gods centered around. Positive affirmation of this world, characterized by the fact that God has human character. It influenced Western European literature since the Renaissance with a high literary value.

DOC.Title: Olympos 12 God
DOC.TEXT: God bless the Greek myth that was supposed to live in Olympos Mountain. Zeus of the principal god, his wife Hera, the god of the sea and the earth God Poseidon, the army god Ares, the sun god Apollo, the god of fire Goddess Hermes, the goddess of wisdom Athena, the goddess of the moon Artemis, the goddess of beauty Afrodite, the beautiful goddess Afrodite Hestia, 12 gods of the goddess Demeteru of agriculture.

DOC.Title: Zeus
DOC.TEXT: Main god. God of heaven, thunder and justice. It was worshiped in all Greece.

DOC.Title: Homer's
DOC.TEXT: A blind poet who will be the author or editor of Greek's oldest epic poem "Iliad" "Odyssey". There is a doubt in its existence.

DOC.Title: "Iliad"
DOC.TEXT: An epic depicting the success of heroes in the Trojan War. The meaning of Ilion's song, another name for Troy.

DOC.Title: "Odyssey"
DOC.TEXT: An epic depicting the adventure from the Trojan capture to the return home of the hero Odysseus of the Trojan War.

DOC.Title: Hesiodos
DOC.TEXT: An epic originating from Boiootia in northern Greece who was active around 700 years ago. "Labor and days" and "Shikengaku" were left.

DOC.Title: "Labor and Daily", "Work and Days"
DOC.TEXT: Taking the form of a lesson learned to a lazy brother, he preached the suffering of farmers, the preciousness of labor.

DOC.Title: "Shinranji"
DOC.TEXT: An epic that talked about the genealogy of God 's eyes since the creation of heaven and earth. Especially praised Zeus.

DOC.Title: SUFFO
DOC.TEXT: A lady lyric from Lesbos Island. Only fragments of romance poems remain except for 2 pieces.

DOC.Title: Anakreon
DOC.TEXT: Lyrics. The theme was on sake and romance.

DOC.Title: Pin Dross
DOC.TEXT: Lyrics. "Competition championship song" which praised the winner of the competition such as Olympia was left.

DOC.Title: Ice Cyrus
DOC.TEXT: One of the three great tragedy poets of Athens. I often won the competition of tragedy. I also participated in the Persian War.

DOC.Title: Sophocles
DOC.TEXT: One of the three great tragedy poets of Athens. Improvement was made to the form of tragedy's performance, and the tragedy was completed as literature. Having friendship with Pericles, he took charge of important positions such as general.

DOC.Title: Euripides
DOC.TEXT: One of the three great tragedy poets of Athens. I created a work of a new trend that does not fit in traditional form.

DOC.Title: Aristophanes
DOC.TEXT: The greatest comedy writer in Athens. In the era of Peloponnesus War, he picked up political and cultural issues from the standpoint of pacifism and satirized and criticized demagogues and literatians of Socrates and Euripides.

DOC.Title: "Women's Peace"
DOC.TEXT: A representative work of Aristophanes. A fantasy drama that realizes peace through female sexual strikes. In the anti-war plays against the Peloponnesos war, you can learn the existence of great freedom of speech at the time.

DOC.Title: "Women's parliament"
DOC.TEXT: Works that criticized Athens' politics through women's occupation occupation.

DOC.Title: Natural philosophy
DOC.TEXT: The first form of philosophy which tried to interpret the explanation of natural phenomenon by reasonable thinking, not from mythical interpretation. From Ionian colonial city centering on Miletos in the 6th century before, philosophers born in this area are called Ionian School or Milets school.

DOC.Title: Thales
DOC.TEXT: Greek's first natural philosopher from Miletus. It is the founder of the Ionian school, and it is said to be "father of philosophy". I thought the root of everything was water. It is said that he predicted a solar eclipse of 585 years ago.

DOC.Title: Pythagoras
DOC.TEXT: Natural philosopher and mathematician from Samos Island. With numbers as the root of all things, I found "Pythagorean theorem".

DOC.Title: Heraclitus
DOC.TEXT: A natural philosopher from Ephesus. With the change itself as the root of all things, leaving the word "all things flow," we used fire as a symbol of change.

DOC.Title: Democritus
DOC.TEXT: A natural philosopher of the Ionian school. He asserts that the root of all things is an homogeneous invariant atom (atom), and is regarded as the founder of atomistic materialist philosophy.

DOC.Title: Sophist
DOC.TEXT: Vocational teacher of speech and rhetoric who played an active part in Athens at the height of democracy in the 5th century. The meaning of "wise person." I emphasized winning the controversy, sometimes I was fond of something contradictory to facts, so it is also called "sophistry school".

DOC.Title: Protagoras
DOC.TEXT: Representative Sofist. Taking the position of relativism, denying the existence of universal truth.

DOC.Title: "Humans are all things scale"
DOC.TEXT: Words of Protagoras. A word expressing relativism and subjectivity, which assumes that the subjectivity of an individual is the standard of truth, and that universal truth does not exist.

DOC.Title: Socrates
DOC.TEXT: Philosopher of Athens. In the period of Peloponnesus war and the subsequent decline of Athens, he criticized Sophisto and insisted on the existence of universal and objective truth, Takashi Kazuichi. I practiced a method of making awareness of "knowledge of ignorance" (knowing that he is ignorant) through dialogue, a question-answering method, and preaching that people in Athens have universal truth. After that, under the sentence of death penalty in a popular trial, it was death toll by calling "the law also law." I did not leave the work.

DOC.Title: Plato
DOC.TEXT: Philosopher of Athens. Disciples of Socrates. Based on the idea theory, I pondered ideological philosophy and left "dialogue story". His ideal social image is found in "State theory".

DOC.Title: Idea
DOC.TEXT: The central idea of ​​Plato philosophy. The real existence is idea of ​​good and beauty (idea), the idea that the real world is only what the idea appeared in various forms.

DOC.Title: "State theory"
DOC.TEXT: The main work of Plato. The philosopher politics governed by a small number of philosophers was made an ideal form of police politics. Neither Plato nor Aristotle was a philosopher of democratic decline, negative to real democratic politics, and he had made him a major premise of society.

DOC.Title: Academia
DOC.TEXT: A school that Plato built in the sanctuary wearing the hero Academus in the outskirts of Athens. It was the etymology of the academy.

DOC.Title: Aristotle
DOC.TEXT: Greek philosopher. I learned from Plato in Academia and served as a teaching staff for Prince Alexandros, led by Philippos II of Macedonia. Afterwards, I went to Athens and opened the school Lucionion. From the standpoint of realism and empiricism, I overcame the idea theory of Plato, the teacher. Not only philosophy but also culmination of various studies culminated, it was called "Father of Mankind" and had a great influence on later Islamic philosophy and medieval European philosophy / theology. "Metaphysics" "Athenian people's system" "Political science" is known as a work.

DOC.Title: "Political science"
DOC.TEXT: Representative work of Aristotle. I'm discussing the policies of the country.

DOC.Title: Hippocrates
DOC.TEXT: Born from Kos Island of Asia Minor. Scientifically investigate the cause of the disease, it is said to be "father of medicine", but most of his life is unknown.

DOC.Title: Herodotus
DOC.TEXT: A historian from Halikarnasos of Asia Minor. With the theme of the Persian War, he wrote a "history" with a view on his big trip. This is a systematic historical description by the oldest individual in the world, it is called "father of history".

DOC.Title: "History"
DOC.TEXT: The history of the Persian war that Herodotus wrote. It is regarded as a typical narrative history description.

DOC.Title: Thucydides
DOC.TEXT: A historian from Athens. It describes the history of Peloponnesus warfs based on strict historical criticism and is said to be "the father of scientific history descriptions".

DOC.Title: "History"
DOC.TEXT: The history of Peloponnesus war in Tukidides. Incomplete.

DOC.Title: Phadias
DOC.TEXT: Sculptor of Athens. Having friendship with Pericles, he served as general director of the reconstruction work of the Parthenon temple.

DOC.Title: "Statue of Athena"
DOC.TEXT: Fadias work. The principal of the Parthenon temple in Athens. It does not exist.

DOC.Title: Praxiteless
DOC.TEXT: Sculptor of Athens in the 4th century. "Hermes statue" such as the work that pursued ideal human beauty was left a lot.

DOC.Title: Doria formula
DOC.TEXT: Architectural style in the early Greek period. The column is almost decorative, giving a majestic feel.

DOC.Title: Parthenon
DOC.TEXT: The Athena Goddess temple of the Acropolis of Athens. Representative of Dorian style architecture. It was destroyed in the Persian War, but was reconstructed around the year 432 by the life of Pericles.

DOC.Title: Ionian formula
DOC.TEXT: Middle Greek architectural style. The spirit of spirit K decorations are attached, giving an elegant feeling.

DOC.Title: Corinth expression
DOC.TEXT: Late Greek architectural style. The pillars become thinner, the decoration of the stigma becomes complicated, giving an ornate and delicate feeling.

DOC.Title: Macedonia
DOC.TEXT: A kingdom built by the Greek factions considered to be Doriaic in the north of Greece. Expanding power in the last 4 century when the police world faded, and suppressed all Greece under Filippos II.

DOC.Title: Philippos II, Philippe II
DOC.TEXT: King of Macedonia (before the preliminary 359-before 336). He became a hostage of Thebe, studied Phalanx tactics and Greek culture, and after returning to Japan, he tried to make Macedonia more powerful. It won the fight of Chironone in 338 years ago, and suppressed all Greece. He was assassinated while planning an expedition to Persia.

DOC.Title: Battle of Chirononia
DOC.TEXT: A battle where Philippos II defeated Athena · Theba Allied troops and almost exterminated the Greek police.

DOC.Title: Corinth Alliance, Hellas Alliance
DOC.TEXT: Filippos II formed by former 337, Alliance of all Greek cities excluding Sparta. It was used by Macedonia to dominate Greece.

DOC.Title: Alexander the Great, Alexander the Great
DOC.TEXT: King of Macedonia (before the preliminary 336-before 323). A child of Philippos II. After learning from Aristotle, he was crowned at the age of 20 with the assassination of his father. After suppressing the rebellion, he led the Allied Greece Allies to do the expedition to the east, conquered the Achaemenid dynasty and built a great empire straddling the western part of India from Greece · Egypt. The construction of Alexandria City in various places, the settlement of many Greeks, the transmission of Greek style culture and lifestyle to West Asia, and the incorporation of Persian rituals and customs on the other hand, the fusion of East and West culture will proceed It was. While planning an Arabian expedition, he died suddenly in Babylon.

DOC.Title: Toho expedition, Persian expedition
DOC.TEXT: A big project done by Alexander. After destroying the Akemenese morning in the previous 330 years, we restructured the army, conquered from Central Asia to the west bank of the Indus River and returned to Susa.

DOC.Title: Battle of Isso
DOC.TEXT: The battle where Alexander's army won the Dalius III army at the northern tip Issos on the east coast of the Mediterranean. After that, the expedition army of Alexandros conquered the cities of the Phoenicians and entered Egypt.

DOC.Title: Battle of Albera, battle of Gaugamea
DOC.TEXT: The decisive battle between Alexander the Great and Darius III in Albera in the middle of the Tigris. The battle began near Gaugamera and ended with Alexander's Arbela occupation.

DOC.Title: Darius III
DOC.TEXT: The last king of Achaemenes morning (before pre-ranking 336 to before 330). After being defeated in Albera, the assassinated by the vassal, the empire was destroyed.

DOC.Title: Dialcoy
DOC.TEXT: Meaning of "successor". After the sudden death of Alexander the Great, the powerful generals who split up and fought for the successor.

DOC.Title: Battle of Ipsos
DOC.TEXT: Diedo Koi war in western Asia Minor. The division of the Alexandros empire became decisive.

DOC.Title: Ptolemaic morning
DOC.TEXT: The last dynasty of ancient Egypt where the captain Ptolemy of Alexandros the King founded. Greek type. Although Alexandria was the capital and prospered as the central presence of the Hellenistic world, it was destroyed in Rome 30 years ago.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Syria
DOC.TEXT: The kingdom where Seleucci was built and dominated the majority of West Asia. Originally the capital was Seleucia, about 300 years ago I moved to Antioch. In the last 3rd century Parthia · Bactria became autonomous, the territory diminished and declined. It was destroyed in Rome 63 years ago.

DOC.Title: Seleucid morning
DOC.TEXT: The dynasty of the Kingdom of Syria where Alexandros' captain Seleucus opened. Greek type.

DOC.Title: Parthia
DOC.TEXT: Syrian territory Independent Iranian nation in the southeast of the Caspian Sea. It became mighty after the 2nd century and fought with Rome in the Mesopotamia region.

DOC.Title: Bactria
DOC.TEXT: A country that the Greeks of the Am River basin of Central Asia built autonomously. Although Hellenistic culture flourished, it was destroyed by the Scythian Tohara people.

DOC.Title: Palmyra
DOC.TEXT: Since the Hellenistic era, it dominated the trade route of Syria · Mesopotamia, and it was the most prosperous city city in the 2nd and 3rd centuries. In the era of Queen Zenobia (ranking 267-272), he challenged Rome but was defeated, the town was destroyed and destroyed.

DOC.Title: Mca bea War
DOC.TEXT: Jewish religious rebellion against the Kingdom of Syria. The Jews acquired religious and political independence.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Macedonia
DOC.TEXT: Alexandros the captain of Antigonos, the capital of the Great King, a country dominated by the Greek region. It was destroyed by Rome.

DOC.Title: Antigonos Morning
DOC.TEXT: The dynasty of the Kingdom of Macedonia where Antigonos opened.

DOC.Title: Pergamon
DOC.TEXT: The city of Pegamon Kingdom of Asia Minor, the capital of Attalos (241-133 ago). Three and three thousand years ago it prospered in the second century.

DOC.Title: Hellenistic
DOC.TEXT: It means Greek culture and thought, but together with Hebrewism (Judaism and Christian culture and thought), it constitutes one of the two major trends underlying European culture. A term used by German historian Droisen (1808-84) in his work. Historically, since the eastern expedition of Alexander the Great, Greek culture flowed into West Asia centered on the harbor city on the east coast of the Mediterranean Sea, formed by fusion with Orient culture. The main players were Greeks who lived in the city, but they are distinguished by the characteristics of world citizenship and individualism without being caught up by police and ethnic frameworks. About 300 years from the eastern expedition of Alexandros to the destruction of Egypt in the early morning of Egypt is called Hellenistic era.

DOC.Title: Hellenistic era
DOC.TEXT: Before 334 and before 30

DOC.Title: Koinee
DOC.TEXT: A common language of Hellenistic world. Based on the Attic dialect, the common language of Greek ceremonially made in various dialects.

DOC.Title: Alexandria, Egyptian Alexandria
DOC.TEXT: Alexandros the Great is a city built in the Delta estuary of the Nile river 331 years ago. It became the capital of the province of Butolemyus, prospering as the center of politics, economics and culture. Beyond the population of more than one million, it is called "world knot" and became Hellenistic world's largest center.

DOC.Title: Museion
DOC.TEXT: A large research institute established in Alexandria. It received protection of Ptolemy morning, became the center of ancient natural science and literature research, and produced many scholars. It was the origin of the museum (museum).

DOC.Title: E. clades, Euclid
DOC.TEXT: Greek mathematician. I learned from Museion of Alexandria and formed the plan geometry. Book "original geometry".

DOC.Title: Aristarchus
DOC.TEXT: An astronomer from Samos, Greece. The revolution and rotation of the Earth, insisted on the solar central theory.

DOC.Title: Archimedes
DOC.TEXT: A mathematician and physicist from Syracuse, Sicily. I learned from Museion, discovered the principle of floating body (Archimedes' principle), lever principle. During the Poeni War, Roman soldiers were killed.

DOC.Title: Eratosthenes
DOC.TEXT: An astronomer from Greek colony city Kireene in North Africa. He served as the director of Museion. Considering the earth as spherical, measure the length of its surroundings from the angle of the shadow, and set it to about 45,000 km (actually 40,000 km).

DOC.Title: World Citizenism, Cosmopolitanism
DOC.TEXT: The way of thinking that spread in the Hellenistic era. The background cultivated in the police society of the past (police centralism) became meaningless due to the collapse of the police society, and the value judgment started from a more universal standpoint. At the same time, there was also a tendency of individualism pursuing personal happiness. It denied the electoral thought and became a spiritual foundation to accept Christianity preaching universal salvation.

DOC.Title: Store faction
DOC.TEXT: A part of Hellenistic philosophy beginning with Zenon. I pursued happiness through abstinence, preached the importance of living according to my reason without being swept away by passion. He also assumed that humanity is a companion connected by universal reason, and stood from the viewpoint of world citizenship. I got this name because I gave a lecture at Athens' store (Column).

DOC.Title: Zenon
DOC.TEXT: A philosopher from Cyprus. He played an active part in Athens and started a store faction.

DOC.Title: Epicross faction
DOC.TEXT: A part of Hellenistic philosophy beginning with Epicross. Although he emphasized pleasure, he preached that it is not momentary body pleasure, but to obtain sustained mental pleasure. It also has the aspect of escape from politics and faded during the Roman Empire.

DOC.Title: Epicross
DOC.TEXT: A philosopher from Samos Island. He played an active part in Athens and founded the Epicross faction.

DOC.Title: Mithraism, Mitlasism
DOC.TEXT: Iranian origin religion, which gets a sense of unity with God through secret ceremonies. It was admired by the people of Hellenistic period.

DOC.Title: "Venus of Milo"
DOC.TEXT: A marble statue of beautiful goddess Aphrodite discovered in Miro Island in 1820. There is a theory that the age of production is the fourth century before or two to a century ago.

DOC.Title: "Gaulian of the Death"
DOC.TEXT: Representative Hellenistic sculpture excavated from Bergamon in Asia Minor.

DOC.Title: "Nike of Samothrace"
DOC.TEXT: Representative sculpture of Hellenistic era, discovered on Samothrace Island in northern Aegean island.

DOC.Title: "Lao cone"
DOC.TEXT: Representative sculpture in Hellenistic era, discovered in Rome in 1506. In Greek mythology, the theme is Trojan priest who is killed by Athena goddess.

DOC.Title: Italian
DOC.TEXT: Indian = European language system. Almost in parallel with the south of the Greeks, we went down to the Italian peninsula for two waves. The first wave (Umbria series) settled in the mountainous region of the eastern southern part of the peninsula around the 16th century and the second wave (Latin family) established in the hills of the peninsular middle western part around the end of the 11th century.

DOC.Title: Latin
DOC.TEXT: The second wave of Italians. The origin of the name was settled in the Latium region. One of the city states built by the Latin people Rome developed into the Great Empire, so that their language Latin, which is their language, became widely used, and from there the languages ​​called Romance (French, Spanish, Italian Etc.) was born.

DOC.Title: Rome
DOC.TEXT: A city state the Latin people built on the banks of the Tiber. It is said that in the legend was founded in 753 years ago.

DOC.Title: Etruscans
DOC.TEXT: An unknown ethnic group settled mainly in the Tuscan region. The seventh to the sixth century ago were at its peak, and the twelve city states of the royal government formed city union. Although some Etruscans dominated Rome at the end of the 7th century, they declined since the 5th century and was conquered by Rome before the 3rd century. Besides arch arch and aqueduct, I gave great influence to Rome including clothes, government system, customs etc.

DOC.Title: Tiber River
DOC.TEXT: River flowing through Rome. It is regarded as a symbol of Rome with the Palatine Hill.

DOC.Title: Republic, Republic of Rome
DOC.TEXT: In tradition it is said that the Republic was launched by expelling the Etruscan king at the end of the 6th century (509 years ago). The early republican was a nobleman republic who aristocracy held the real power and monopolized public office.

DOC.Title: Patrici, aristocrat
DOC.TEXT: Large landowner with full citizenship. Monopolized the key positions of Republicans such as the Senate and Consul.

DOC.Title: Senate
DOC.TEXT: The highest legislative and advisory body composed of 300 aristocrats. Term of office is lifetime. Capacity increased later.

DOC.Title: Consul, Governor, President
DOC.TEXT: The highest political officer who was in charge of administrative and military affairs. A term of office is unpaid for one year. Two members were elected at the military assembly that was one of the civil society, but the aristocratic monopoly.

DOC.Title: Dictor, Dictator
DOC.TEXT: Dictator who was delegated full authority in temporary work in emergency. One of the consuls was appointed at the proposal of the Senate. The term of office was six months, and reappointment was not approved.

DOC.Title: Preves, commoner
DOC.TEXT: A citizen of Rome. It consisted of small and medium-sized landowners farmers and commerce and industry, and initially did not have suffrage right. He formed a heavily infantry force and played an active struggle with Patrick in search of suffrage.

DOC.Title: Civics
DOC.TEXT: Congress composed of all male citizens. Three civic societies were established in Rome, and both decisions were accepted as national law only after approval of the Senate.

DOC.Title: The Peace Committee
DOC.TEXT: One of the civil society. It was established in the first half of the 5th century and consisted only of commoners. The civilian security officer served as the chairman, and initially the vote was detained only by the commoner.

DOC.Title: Civil Protection Officer
DOC.TEXT: In tradition it is said that it was installed in 494 years ago. Official position for the protection of common people, elected by the People 's Congress vote. The body was regarded as sacred and inviolable and had the right to veto the decision of the senate and consul. Initially two people increased afterwards, reaching 10 people in the previous 449 years. It gradually began to be used for career advancement by ambitious people.

DOC.Title: Twelve table method
DOC.TEXT: The oldest law writing law in Rome that was enacted around 450 ago. As a result of the conflict of commoners against aristocrats who monopolized legal knowledge, traditional customary laws were clarified and published in 12 boards (material unknown). There are many civil law relations, such as the protection of private rights.

DOC.Title: Licinius · sexties law
DOC.TEXT: In 367 years, the guardian's Rikinius and Sekusuti established. (1) One of the consulates was elected from the commoner, and (2) the occupation of the public land was limited to 500 yugera (about 125 ha) per person.

DOC.Title: Holtensius method
DOC.TEXT: Law enacted by Hortensius which was Dictarine in the previous 287 years. Resolution at the Peace Committee was decided as national law without the approval of the Senate. By this, legal equality between aristocrats and commoners was achieved. In this period, however, due to the development of large land ownership and the spread of the monetary economy, a system in which noble aristocracy (Nobilace) has the real power has been established, and complete republican democratization was not realized.

DOC.Title: Heavy infantry, Roman heavy infantry
DOC.TEXT: The center of Roman military power. It consisted of small and medium-sized landowners (peers) armed with self-defense. It was mainly driven by dense group battle, and it became the driving force of Rome development. Weakened by the collapse of small and medium-sized landowners after Poeni War.

DOC.Title: Division of Governance
DOC.TEXT: The way of governance that Rome used to rule over conquered Italian cities. Divided conquered cities into colonial city, autonomous city, alliance city, etc. to make differences in rights and obligations to prevent mutual unity and resistance to Rome.

DOC.Title: Colonial City
DOC.TEXT: Like citizens of Rome, full citizenship was granted.

DOC.Title: Autonomous City
DOC.TEXT: Although private citizenship on private law was accepted, citizenship on public law, such as military, trial, was not accepted.

DOC.Title: Alliance City
DOC.TEXT: Citizenship was not admitted.

DOC.Title: Carthago
DOC.TEXT: A colonial city built in the northern part of Africa by the City of Tyce of the city of the Phoenician in the 9th century. Monopolized the West Mediterranean trade, conflicted with the Greek colonial city since the 6th century. Even after the home country declined in the 4th century before, it prospered as a maritime nation of the aristocratic owner.

DOC.Title: Poeni War
DOC.TEXT: The war over the supremacy of the Western Mediterranean of Rome and Carthage over three times. It is derived from the fact that the Romans called the Phoenicians Poeni (Poeni). [1st] Prior 264-before 241 Rome won and won Sicily. [2nd] Previous 218-before 201 Rome received Italy's invasion of Carthage's Hannibal, but Scipio broke Hannibal's army at the battle of Zama and eventually won. [3rd] Previous 149-before 146 Rome destroyed Carthage and took over the hegemony of the West Mediterranean.

DOC.Title: Sicily Island
DOC.TEXT: It is the largest island of the Mediterranean located south of the Italian peninsula. It was the main point of the Mediterranean trade, it was also the largest grain producing area at the time. Regarding this rule, the first Poeni war began, Rome won, making it the first province.

DOC.Title: Hannibal
DOC.TEXT: Carthaginian captain who commanded the 2nd Poeni war. In Spain, he expanded his military strength, and in 218 years, beyond the winter Alps, invaded Northern Italy, and in the 216 years before, in the battle of Cannes he gave a great blow to the Roman army. In the 202nd year, in the battle of Zama, the defeat of the Roman army was defeated although Rome which was driven was conversely attacked mainland Carthage. After that, he was chased by political opponents, exiled to Asia Minor, and later committed suicide. The second Poeni war is also called Hannibal war.

DOC.Title: Battle of Zama
DOC.TEXT: A battle where the Roman army won the Carthaginian army in the southwestern part of Carthage. With this, the winner of the 2nd Poeni war was decided, Carthagos lost all overseas territory, a large amount of reparation was imposed, and Rome became dominant in the Western Maritime maritime rights.

DOC.Title: Corinth, Corinth
DOC.TEXT: Commercial city in the northeast of the Peloponnese. Though prosperous in trade and colonial activities, since it was a rival in trade in Rome, it was destroyed with Carthage in 146 years ago.

DOC.Title: Skipio
DOC.TEXT: The Roman general. Also called big scipio. After controlling Spain 's Carthaginian forces, he went to North Africa and won the battle of Zama and decided the victory in the 2nd Poeni war. My grandchild's small Scipio destroyed Cartago in the 3rd Poeni War.

DOC.Title: Region State
DOC.TEXT: Rome conquest area other than the Italian peninsula. After Sicily island acquired in the 1st Poeni war, Rome made the occupied territory as the following province. Residents' autonomy was not permitted, the governor appointed from the center ruled the army and reigned. The people of the province were subject to tax payment and military obligations and were subject to the exploitation of the governor-general and tax collector.

DOC.Title: tax collector
DOC.TEXT: People who took charge of taxation, civil engineering projects etc in the provinces under a contract with the state. We taxed more than the contract from the citizens of the province forcibly and privatized the surplus and fertilized my stomach. On the course to rich man, there were many knight classes.

DOC.Title: Knight, Equates
DOC.TEXT: Since the 2nd Poeni War, emerging rich citizens emerging in public civil engineering projects, procurement of munitions procurement, tax consignment in the provincial provinces, etc. It was regarded as a hierarchical position following the senior aristocracy. Originally the meaning of a person racing with a horse.

DOC.Title: Latifunia, Latifidium
DOC.TEXT: Large land management based on a slave. Aristocrats and upper class residents privatized the public land spread by conquest activities, became large landowners by buying land from farmers, overworking the fellows, mainly cultivating fruit trees such as grapes and olives. It developed rapidly since the 2nd Poeni War, and it caused the downfall of small and medium-sized farmers.

DOC.Title: Falling of small and medium-sized farmers
DOC.TEXT: Small farmers fell rapidly due to long-term service by self-defense warfare, devastation of arable land by war, cheap grain inflow from postwar provinces, development of latif upia, and so on. Many farmers who became a nonproductive citizen flowed into the city (especially Rome) and turned into a crowd demanding "bread and spectacle". Those with voting rights wanted a war with looting, turned into a soldier of ambition.

DOC.Title: "Pan and spectacle"
DOC.TEXT: Roman politicians gave to the fallen crowd, such as games or races held at the amphitheater. Words of satire poet Uwenalis.

DOC.Title: Injustice, Roman slavery
DOC.TEXT: In Roman society, prisoners of war were mainly used as agricultural fellows on a large scale and became the basis of large farm management. Therefore, the war for compelling was also economic activity. However, on the other hand it often resulted in a massive rape.

DOC.Title: Sicilian fellow revolt
DOC.TEXT: A large-scale fellow rebellion that occurred in Sicily at the end of Roman Republic. The total number of insurgents was reported as 200,000 people, after that it also relapsed 104 to 100 years ago.

DOC.Title: New nobility, Noblesse
DOC.TEXT: A new control hierarchy consisting of wealthy Patrici and Prebus graduates. It dominated the administration from the second half of the 4th century.

DOC.Title: Cowboy, Optima Tes
DOC.TEXT: A conservative partisan who tried to maintain the political system of the senate center. Sla is a representative person.

DOC.Title: Commonist, popular school, poplaress
DOC.TEXT: Anti-senior college faction advanced to politics based on civil society. An ambitious family from a noble family or knight class used the civil society to enter the political world, different from a modern democratic politician. Marius is a representative character.

DOC.Title: Grax brothers' reform
DOC.TEXT: My older brother became a guardian in 133 years ago, aiming for the restriction of large land ownership by the revival of the Licinius law, the creation of own farmers by redistribution of land to nonproductive citizens, the reconstruction of the Roman citizen army, but against the senate It was assassinated. My brother became a guard of citizens in the previous 123 years and took over his brother's reform, but committed suicide in the counterattack of the Senate and the reform collapsed. Since then, Roman society has entered an era of confusion called "a century of civil war".

DOC.Title: Marius
DOC.TEXT: A politician of a commoner. He crushed the Yugurta war (from before 111 to before 105), emerged, forming a commoner faction, fought with Queen factions, grabbed the temporary regime. Meanwhile, we carried out military-system reform that gives weapons to volunteers of nonproductive citizens and incorporates them into corps, eliminating the chronic deficiency of troops, ensuring their lives and making themselves private, and the soldiers of the Roman armies themselves It was a pioneer of the formation.

DOC.Title: Vocational soldier system
DOC.TEXT: A system that constitutes army corps with volunteers.

DOC.Title: Alliance City War
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that the alliance city within the Italian peninsula requested Roman citizenship. The cosmic sla promised the granting of citizenship under the consent of the senate and collected it.

DOC.Title: Sla
DOC.TEXT: Politician of a cascade. In conflict with Marius, after suppression of Asia Minor Asahi suppressed the commoners. I joined the Senate and became an indefinite Dictor and forced a tyranny.

DOC.Title: Swordsman
DOC.TEXT: An enemy who was forced to win seriously as a spectacle in an amphitheater etc. Many prisoners were born, and leading politicians trained for popularity.

DOC.Title: Spartacus' Rebellion
DOC.TEXT: The big rebellion rebelled by the swordsman Spartacus from Thracia. Many guys joined and became a major force reaching 100,000 people, beating the Roman army in various places, but was suppressed by Pompey · crassus.

DOC.Title: Pompey
DOC.TEXT: Roman general and politician. As successor to Sura, he played an active part in suppressing Spartacus 'rebellion, Eastern Mediterranean pirates, Mitridates' rebellion and others. It gradually conflicted with the Senate and started the first three-pronged politics. After confrontation with Caesar, he was defeated and was assassinated slaying to Egypt.

DOC.Title: Crushes
DOC.TEXT: A politician from the knight class. I participated in the 1st three-pronged politics. It was killed in the Parthia expedition.

DOC.Title: Caesar, Caesar
DOC.TEXT: A politician of a commoner. The first round of three-pronged politics, and expedition to Gaul from the previous 58 years, strengthened the power base. In opposition to Pompey and overthrowing this, he became a Dictor in the previous 46 years, and became a Dictator for the last 44 years and held the dictatorship. We carried out various reforms such as abolition of the tax collector in the province, adoption of the Julian calendar, but were assassinated by Brutus' republists and others. Also known as a work such as "Gaara's Senki".

DOC.Title: 1st three-headed politics
DOC.TEXT: Politics carried out by private affiliation of Pompey · Caesar · Crassus. Pompey was Spain, Crassus was Syria, and Caesar had unstable Gaul as their sphere of power. After the war death of Crusse in the previous 53 years, Pompey who dangerous Caesar's rise approached the Senate and was resolved because it conflicted with Caesar.

DOC.Title: Gallia expedition
DOC.TEXT: The military expedition which Caesar carried out after the beginning of the first three-pronged politics. He conquered residents such as Celts and Germanians. Gallia is almost the current French, it also became the beginning of the advance of Rome into the inland region of Europe.

DOC.Title: Impellato
DOC.TEXT: The title to Triumphal General was gradually the meaning of the highest leader on military affairs. To the Caesar who defeated Pompey and returned from Egypt, the Senate gave this title 45 years ago. Later in the Imperial era it came to be used as the emperor 's nomenclature, became the origin of the emperor.

DOC.Title: Bluetus
DOC.TEXT: Republican who opposed Caesar's dictatorship and assassinated Caesar in the previous 44 years. Later lost to the Caesar school and committed suicide.

DOC.Title: 2nd Triple-Headed Politics
DOC.TEXT: Politics that Antonius Octavianus Levidus went against the Republican. Distribution of the influence range was Antonius Hellenistic region, Octavianus the whole western region, Lepidus the northern part of Africa excluding Egypt.

DOC.Title: Antonius
DOC.TEXT: Caesar's captain. I went to Egypt in the second round of three-pronged politics, joined with Queen Cleopatra, conflicted with Octavianus. He lost his battle of Aktium and committed suicide.

DOC.Title: Octavianus, Octavian
DOC.TEXT: Adopted by Caesar. I participated in the second round of three-pronged politics, but gradually fought with Antonius. Winning the battle of Aktium in the previous 31 years, and consolidating Egypt for the last 30 years, completed the reconciliation of the whole Mediterranean region. Received the title of Augustus from the senior citizen for the past 27 years, it was virtually emperor's status.

DOC.Title: Lepidus
DOC.TEXT: Caesar's captain. I participated in the second round of three-pronged politics, but I have lost 36 years ago.

DOC.Title: Cleopatra
DOC.TEXT: Eto the last queen of the Ethiopian buttremy morning (before preliminary 51 to before 30). With its beauty and education, he fascinated Caesar Antonius and others and kept the throne by using its power. He was defeated by Octavianus and then committed suicide.

DOC.Title: Battle of Actium
DOC.TEXT: The battle that Octavianus defeated the Allied troops of Antonius Cleopatra off the coast of the northwest coast of Greece. This completes Roman Mediterranean domination.

DOC.Title: Augustus, the dignified person
DOC.TEXT: In the previous 27 years, the honorific title that the Senate gave to Octavianus. He respected the Republican tradition, shared the authority of the Senate and the provincial governorate, but held the key role of Bunmu, practically endeavored to restore the order after the civil war as the emperor. After Octavianus, it was used as the title of successive emperors.

DOC.Title: Principes
DOC.TEXT: Meaning of "the first citizen". Autonomous name of Octavianus respecting Republican tradition. Often translated as "head of state".

DOC.Title: Prinquipatus, head of state
DOC.TEXT: Governing system by Principes. Nominally respected the tradition of the Republic such as the Senate, but the real power is the de facto emperor that Princes built.

DOC.Title: Imperial Rome, Roman Empire
DOC.TEXT: Refers to after the beginning of Prinquipatus in the previous 27 years. During the period of peace and prosperity in the previous term, the empire gradually expanded, but began to wane from the second half of the 2nd century and entered into a turbulent period of the military emperor period (235-284). In the latter half of the 3rd century, dominatus was established in the latter period, but split in the east and west in 395.

DOC.Title: Pax-Romana, "Peace of Rome"
DOC.TEXT: It refers to the golden age of Rome, about 200 years from Augustus to the end of the 5th Emperor. The security of the vast area stabilized, and numerous Roman-style cities were built in the empire, culture also flourished. Also, seasonal wind trade in the Indian Ocean was actively carried out.

DOC.Title: Nero
DOC.TEXT: Emperor famous for violence (rank 54-68). I persecuted Christians for responsibility for the fire of Rome in 64 years. I lost my mind and committed suicide by being exiled.

DOC.Title: Five Emperors
DOC.TEXT: The five emperors from the Nellowa to Marcus-Aurelius, the emperor of the Roman Empire.

DOC.Title: Nerva, Nerva
DOC.TEXT: It is regarded as the first Emperor of Wenjie (President 96-98). I delegated full authority to an adopted Trajan.

DOC.Title: Trajan
DOC.TEXT: One of the Five Emperors (ranking 98 ~ 117). Originally from Spain, he became the emperor from the first province of the province. With Dakia (current Romania) as the provincial state, defeating Parthia and conquering Mesopotamia temporarily realized Rome's largest version.

DOC.Title: Hadrian
DOC.TEXT: One of the Five Emperors (ranking 117-138). From the external aggressive measures of Emperor Trajan, we turned to domestic administration and marginal defense, and we built Hadrian's Wall in Britannia. It is also known to have traveled throughout the empire and strive to develop the province.

DOC.Title: Antoninus Pius
DOC.TEXT: One of the Five Emperors (ranking 138-161). We worked on the relief work of the poor and the fiscal reform of Rome.

DOC.Title: Marx-Aurelius-Antoninus
DOC.TEXT: The last emperor of the Five Emperors (ranking 161-180). Struggling to invade foreigners, spending much of his reign in expedition destroyed himself in the camp. Learned store philosophy, called "Tetsujin Emperor", and wrote "a self-record". It is said to be Da Qin Ahn Tsang of the "later Han Book".

DOC.Title: Seasonal trade
DOC.TEXT: Trade using the Indian Ocean's monsoon which flourished around the 1st and 2nd century. The trade area expanded from the Mediterranean, the Red Sea, the Persian Gulf to South India. The Roman Empire imported silk, spices and so on from Asia and exported glassware, wine, gold coins and others. In the "Eurutura Sea Guide Information", the trade circumstances at the time are stated.

DOC.Title: "The Crisis of the Third Century"
DOC.TEXT: It refers to the crisis situation where the Roman Empire fell from the end of the 2nd century to the 3rd century. Frequent occurrence of the rebellion of the provincial government, the Sasan dynasty and the fight against the Germanic people overlapped, economic turmoil caused social unrest. Politically it was a period of confusion called the age of the soldier emperor.

DOC.Title: Caracara
DOC.TEXT: In 212, he issued the Antoninus Royal Decree and granted Roman citizenship to all free people in the Roman Empire. Antoninus is real name. It is also famous for building a large public bath.

DOC.Title: Roman citizenship
DOC.TEXT: It was given to all Italian libertarians by the Alliance city war and in 212 was given to all free people in the imperial territory. As a result, there was no distinction between Romans and foreigners, and Rome became a world state.

DOC.Title: Valerianus, Valerianus
DOC.TEXT: From 253 to 260. In Edessa 's battle, he was defeated by the Sasan morning Sherbour 1 and became a prisoner.

DOC.Title: Military Emperor
DOC.TEXT: Since the throne of Maximus of 235 years, there were emperors who were retired and abolished by corps of various provinces, and for 26 years until the Diocletian's emperor arrived in 284, 26 emperors were murmuring. Rising society appeared politically, the city was pressed by the deviation of military power, the devastation of the empire progressed due to the invasion of the german man in the north, Sasan Dynasty in the east. Beginning this confusion period, Empire was shifted to the eastward tyrannical rule, the civil warrior system to the center of mercenaries, and the battle to the coronatus greatly.

DOC.Title: Maxinus
DOC.TEXT: Degrees 235-238

DOC.Title: Colonus
DOC.TEXT: Attractive crop writer tied to the land. Entering the Emperor period, the lattice manage based on labor labor approaches, but in exchange it has expanded farm management where influential people use liberated fellows and fallen farmers as peasant (Colonus). Initially Colonus was recognized personality freedom, but freedom of movement was restricted by delinquency of the rent and soon gradually strengthened the affiliation to the landowner. It has increased since the 3 rd century and became the precursor of medieval serfs.

DOC.Title: Coronatus
DOC.TEXT: Land management using Colonus. Instead of Latifunia, it developed within the great place of the influential in the late Roman Empire.

DOC.Title: Liberation fellow
DOC.TEXT: Self-employed labor is inefficient, there is a danger of escape and rebellion, and also the reduction of prisoners of war (suddenification) by "Pax-Romana" is added and the management of Latifunia disappears after the 2nd century · those who are released Has increased.

DOC.Title: Diocletian
DOC.TEXT: The last soldier Emperor (ranking 284 to 305). We confirmed the confusion of the military emperor and started dominatus. Moved the capital to Nico Media, rebuilt the empire by quadratic rule, strengthening the military power. Since then he has entered the era of autocraticism. I did the last great persecution against Christians.

DOC.Title: Dominatus, tyranny
DOC.TEXT: The political system of the late Emperor starting with Diocletian. Republican tradition such as the senate is completely ignored, the Emperor is Dominus (Lord, domi-nus), and the eastward tyranny dominating the Persian style courtesy rite, emperor worship, bureaucratic system development, etc. went.

DOC.Title: Quarterly Government, Quaternary Judgment <Tetra Luka>
DOC.TEXT: In accordance with the trend of decentralization of the empire, the whole area is divided into quadrants, and the system is to be shared by two emperor and two emperors to govern. Diocletian became Toyo Emperor.

DOC.Title: Constantine
DOC.TEXT: I reunified the empire with the confusion after Diocletian's abandonment quickly. I approved Christianity in the Milan Royal Decree of 313 and presided over the Council of Nicene in 325. In 330, he moved to Constantinople and fixed the occupation and status, improved the bureaucracy system, promoted the Mediterranean trade with the Solidus gold coin as the basic currency, and established a tyrannical monarchy.

DOC.Title: Christian official recognition
DOC.TEXT: Constantine issued the Milan Royal Decree, accredited Christianity. It is considered as a political measure to embrace the increased faithful.

DOC.Title: Constantinople, Byzantium
DOC.TEXT: Former Byzantine. A city built as a Greek colonial city in the Black Sea entrance. In the background of the prosperity of the Roman Empire shifting to the east, it was supposed to be the capital of the empire by Constantine in 330, renamed the Constantinople with the name of the emperor. Current Istanbul.

DOC.Title: Germann's great move
DOC.TEXT: Large migration to the Germanic Imperial territory, triggered by the Danube riverside boundary of the south of the West Goat tribe in 375 and the following year. An event that is regarded as a trigger for the shift from ancient times to medieval times.

DOC.Title: Theodosius
DOC.TEXT: In 392 Christianity was established as state religion. Although it fulfilled the last unification of the Roman Empire, in 395, when death divide the empire into east and west, the east and west division of the empire became decisive.

DOC.Title: East Roman Empire
DOC.TEXT: Begin with Arcadius, the eldest child of Theodosius. The capital is Constantinople. It is also called the Byzantine Empire from the former name of the capital. In the 6th century Justinian era, the unification of the Mediterranean world was temporarily restored.

DOC.Title: Western Roman Empire
DOC.TEXT: Begin with Honorius, the second child of Theodosius. The capital moved from Rome to Milan / Ravennahe. The emperor 's weakness was weak, in the 5th century a tribal state of the Germanic nation was divided into the territory, the dominant area of ​​the emperor was confined to the peninsula. In 476, it was destroyed by Odokel.

DOC.Title: Odoquel
DOC.TEXT: Germanic mercenary captain who served the Western Roman Empire. In 476, the Western Roman Empire was destroyed.

DOC.Title: Latin literature
DOC.TEXT: Generic name of literature written in classical Latin. In the Augustus era golden era.

DOC.Title: Vergilian, Vergilius
DOC.TEXT: Ancient Rome's greatest poet. He wrote the great epic "Aenei" and "Agricultural poetry".

DOC.Title: "Aenei"
DOC.TEXT: An epic singing adventure from hero Aeneas' escape from Troy to Roman founding. Works greatly influenced by Homer's "Iliad" and "Odyssey".

DOC.Title: Horatius
DOC.TEXT: Lyrics. Masterpiece work "lyric poetry".

DOC.Title: Ovidius, Ovidius
DOC.TEXT: Lyrics. It was exiled to Emperor Augustus and died. Masterpiece work "turnover" "song of love" etc.

DOC.Title: Cicero
DOC.TEXT: Politician, prose writer, eloquent owner. From the knight. As a politician was confronted with Caesar Antonius and assassinated. Contributing to the spread of Greek thought to Rome, the style was regarded as a model of Latin prose.

DOC.Title: "State theory"
DOC.TEXT: Cicero work of Cicero.

DOC.Title: Seneca
DOC.TEXT: Store philosopher. The teacher of Nero. Nero was forced to die and committed suicide. Master work "Theory of Happiness".

DOC.Title: Epitetus
DOC.TEXT: Store philosopher, a Greek fellow.

DOC.Title: Marx-Aurelius-Antoninus
DOC.TEXT: The last Emperor of the Five Emperors (ranking 161 to 180). A philosopher of the philosophy of the store, called "Tetsujin Emperor".

DOC.Title: "Self-study"
DOC.TEXT: A book by Marx Aurelius Antoninus. Work based on a store-oriented philosophy.

DOC.Title: New Platonism
DOC.TEXT: Platonicism philosophy reconstructed in the second half of the 3 rd century. It was established with the religious thought of Orient in Greek philosophy, the mysticism tendency is strong. The idea had a great influence on medieval Christian theology through Augustine et al.

DOC.Title: Plotinus
DOC.TEXT: A philosopher who created a new Platonism.

DOC.Title: Polybios
DOC.TEXT: Greek historian / soldier. Although it became a hostage of Rome, it was hospitable to small scipio, and participated in the 3rd Poeni war expedition of Cartago.

DOC.Title: "History"
DOC.TEXT: A book by Polybios. It consists of 40 volumes, but only 5 volumes are present. A practical historical story that describes the history of Rome from 221 to 144 years ago from the standpoint of trying to investigate the cause of its development.

DOC.Title: Political circulation historical view
DOC.TEXT: History view of Polybios. Suppose the political system is going to circulate like monarchy → tyrant rule → aristocracy → oligarchy → democracy → fraternity → monarchy, and the Roman republic, three elements of monarchy, aristocracy and democratic rule Since it is fused, it is said to be excellent.

DOC.Title: Rihius, Livius
DOC.TEXT: Historian of Rome. With the hospitality of Augustus, he was commissioned and wrote "Roman Founding History".

DOC.Title: "Roman Founding History", "History of Rome"
DOC.TEXT: There are 142 volumes in total, but the existing volume is 35 volumes. I wrote the history of Rome from the founding nine until nine years ago. Although it is regarded as a representative prose of Latin literature in a stylistic flux, the critical attitude is thin.

DOC.Title: "Gallic War II"
DOC.TEXT: Records of Caesar himself in Garria 's expedition before 58 to 51 years ago. It touches the circumstances of Gallia · Germania · Britannia and it is an important historical material of the old Celtic · old German study. A brief name is considered the highest peak in Latin literature.

DOC.Title: Takitus
DOC.TEXT: Historian / politician. I praised Republicans ideologically and criticized Empire.

DOC.Title: "Germania"
DOC.TEXT: Germanic ethnographic magazine published by Takitus. It is said that he tried to give a warning to Roman society by drawing a simple and courageous Germanic society. Along with Caesar 's "Gaara war memorial", it is regarded as the most important historical material of the old Germanic study.

DOC.Title: "Chronicle"
DOC.TEXT: The work of Takitus. Described the political history of Rome from the death of Augustus to the death of Nero (14-66 years). I can read empathy with the republic.

DOC.Title: Plutarchus
DOC.TEXT: A Greek biographer.

DOC.Title: "Contrasted Lesson", "Hero Demo"
DOC.TEXT: A biography in which Plutarch is comparative critic of heroic figures of Greek and Roman. It is a record of 23 people 46 people and a single person alone who sent a similar life and is also an important historical record of Greek-Roman history.

DOC.Title: Strabbon
DOC.TEXT: Greek geographer from Asia Minor.

DOC.Title: "Geography"
DOC.TEXT: Book of Strabbon. A total of 17 volumes. A historical magazine describing the history and legends of Europe, North Africa, West Asia, India.

DOC.Title: Pliny
DOC.TEXT: A generalist in the general. He has abundant knowledge and wrote "Museum magazine". During the eruption of Wesuius Volcano, he died during human life rescue and observation activities.

DOC.Title: "Museum of magazines"
DOC.TEXT: Book of Pliny. A huge encyclopaedic book covering 37 volumes, the number of items 20 thousand.

DOC.Title: Ptolemy
DOC.TEXT: Greek astronomy and mathematician of the 2nd century. He played an active role in Alexandria, taking the Earth-centered Forest Theory and having a decisive influence on the view of the universe before Copernicus.

DOC.Title: "Astronomy Satisfaction"
DOC.TEXT: A book by Ptolemy. Culmination of astronomy.

DOC.Title: Galen
DOC.TEXT: A Greek doctor born in Bergamon. He studied medicine in Alexandria and served as a surgeon in Marcus-Aurelius-Antoninus. He left many writings in various fields including anatomy and physiology.

DOC.Title: Roman law
DOC.TEXT: The collective term of the law created by the Romans since the table law. Developed from citizen law to all civil law, became the source of modern European law along with the Germanic law.

DOC.Title: Citizen law
DOC.TEXT: Act applicable only to Roman citizenship owner. Twelve tables first. Civil law is central.

DOC.Title: Million Civil Code
DOC.TEXT: Law enacted by expanding Roman territory and citizenship. As a law for applying to all ethnic groups having various customs and customs, universality has increased and the natural legal elements have become darker. In the case of Emperor Caracalla in 212, Roman citizenship was granted to all free people in the Empire, and it was applied equally to the whole area. It is regarded as one of Roman heritage for future generations.

DOC.Title: "Roman law enforcement"
DOC.TEXT: The compilation of the ancient Roman law which the East Roman emperor Justinian had edited by Tribonian. It was completed in 534.

DOC.Title: Justinian
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of eastern Roman (rank 527-565). Successfully restored the Western Region.

DOC.Title: Tribonian
DOC.TEXT: Eastern Roman law scholar. He served as the center of editing "Roman law enforcement".

DOC.Title: Form
DOC.TEXT: Square. In the vicinity of the central square of Rome city there is a temple, government agency, market, etc. It was the center of citizen's life.

DOC.Title: Pantheon, Temple of Great Mansions
DOC.TEXT: The temple where the God of Rome hanged. Although it remains in various places, Agrippa was established, and Roman thing which Hadrianus remodeled is famous.

DOC.Title: Appia Road
DOC.TEXT: The oldest military road in Rome paved with stone which will be the construction of the inspector Appius during the Samnium war 312 years ago. It was built between Rome and Capua in the beginning, extended for a total length of 540 km. It is typical of Roman practical cultural heritage, and it is still partially usable.

DOC.Title: Military Way
DOC.TEXT: The road network was developed radially from Rome as "all roads lead to Rome". In addition to promoting military dispatch to various places to support centralization, it was also used for commercial activities, and worked to convey Roman institutions, customs, culture, etc. to various places.

DOC.Title: Girl Aqueduct
DOC.TEXT: A stone aqueduct over the Gare river in southern France. It consisted of 3 layers of arch with a total length of 270 m, a height of 50 m, a water trunk at the top, and a man and horse track at the middle and the bottom. Representative of Roman Civil Engineering.

DOC.Title: Colosseum, amphitheater
DOC.TEXT: Rome stadium. Completion in 80 years of Titus' s emperor, games of swordsmen etc were held.

DOC.Title: Arc de Triomphe
DOC.TEXT: The Great Stone Gate of the Victory Memorial. Currently there are seven in Rome city, famous for those built by Trajan and Constantine.

DOC.Title: Public bath
DOC.TEXT: Large entertainment center mainly in the bath. I let citizen owner use it cheaply. Those of the Emperor Caracalla built in the first half of the 3rd century are famous.

DOC.Title: Latin
DOC.TEXT: Language of the former Latium residents. As Rome expanded, it spread from southern Europe to all Western Europe, and then formed a Romance family language. After the Middle Ages it survived as an academic language.

DOC.Title: Romaji
DOC.TEXT: Phonograms made in ancient Rome under the influence of Greek letters. Also called Latin letters. It spread to all Western Europe with Latin.

DOC.Title: Julian calendar
DOC.TEXT: Egyptian solar calendar enacted by Julius Caesar in the previous 46 years. It was used until 1582 when the current Gregorian calendar was enacted. There is a theory that the enacted year is 45 years ago. ]

DOC.Title: Gregorian calendar
DOC.TEXT: The current solar calendar. In 1582 Pope Gregory XIII established a higher leap year accuracy incorporated into the Julian calendar.

DOC.Title: Dynamic Religion
DOC.TEXT: Religion that individual spirit is saved by participation in closed ritual. It was prevalent in the Roman Empire. Many are of Oriental origin, sometimes persecuted, and occasionally emperorated the emperor, but disappeared in the advancement of Christianity.

DOC.Title: Maniacism
DOC.TEXT: Mysticism religion that Magny originated, in the 3rd century, flowed into Rome of the imperial period, and was conspired among the people with Mithraism etc etc.

DOC.Title: Mithraism, Mitlasism
DOC.TEXT: Iranian origin casual religion to worship Mitsuru God Mitra. The general population of the Roman Emperor period prevailed aspiring to relieve the soul.

DOC.Title: Isis
DOC.TEXT: Burial religion of ancient Egyptian origins. Isis was admonished as a guardian of travelers and seafarers.

DOC.Title: Judaism
DOC.TEXT: Yahweh's monotheism where the Hebrews believe. Established in the 5th century as a monotheistic monotheism in polytheistic Orient. It features the idea of ​​contract, preceptsism, electoral thought, terminal view and the emergence of Messiah. The scripture is "Old Testament". It became the mother of Christianity.

DOC.Title: Hasmoon morning
DOC.TEXT: A Jewish dynasty independent of Syria. It was conquered by Pompey.

DOC.Title: Pharisee
DOC.TEXT: A faction of Jews who insists on complying with the law of Moses. It was criticized and persecuted Jesus for formalism which placed extreme importance on its religious ceremony.

DOC.Title: Messiah, savior
DOC.TEXT: Christos in Greek (Christ). It appeared on the day of Judaism "The Last Judgment" and is to be a person who will salvate all believers.

DOC.Title: Nazareth
DOC.TEXT: Komura in the northern part of Judea. The hometown of Jesus' father Joseph.

DOC.Title: Yes
DOC.TEXT: Jew. He realized the Messiah, preached God's absolute love and neighbor's love, and conflicted with the Pharisees of electoral thought and formalism. He was sentenced to death by the Roman governor Pontius Pilatus, who believed in Jesus' resurrection and spread his teachings.

DOC.Title: Christ
DOC.TEXT: A Greek translation of Messiah. It is the same as the savior in the sense of "a patriot".

DOC.Title: Pontius Pilatus, Ponteo-Pilate
DOC.TEXT: Governor General of Roman Jewish (Tenure 26-36). He executed Jesus as a rebel to the Empire.

DOC.Title: Christianity
DOC.TEXT: Religion to believe that Jesus is Christ and its teachings. A monotheism which developed Judaism as the mother, but overcomes its electoral thought and formalism and developed into world religion. It appeared in the eastern margin of Rome, spread to the lower classes of the Roman Empire by the activities of Peter and Paul's apostles, and at the end of the 4th century became the Roman Empire. It then spread to all Europe.

DOC.Title: Apostle
DOC.TEXT: The disciple of 12 people including Peter Jacob · John, chosen by Jesus. In that Judas will be the person who betrayed Jesus. Paul was later added to the apostles. The apostles conveyed the gospel, founded a church, and recognized great authority in the formation of scriptures and the creation of beliefs.

DOC.Title: Peter
DOC.TEXT: Born from a fisherman of Galilee. The highest apostle. Although he made power in Roman evangelism, it is told that he was martyred by the persecution of Nero. Later became the first Roman pontiff.

DOC.Title: Paul
DOC.TEXT: Person who is considered to be the most important apostoly since then. It belonged to the Pharisee and persecuted Christians, but later he became a Christian by conversion. It is said that they martyred in the persecution of Nero during the evangelism to Rome, after being called the "apostles of the Gentiles" by evangelizing all over the eastern part. Paul's theology that "justified by faith" is justified, influenced Augustine and religious reform.

DOC.Title: Emperor's worship
DOC.TEXT: Worshiping Roman emperor as a god. The monarchy worshiped during the Hellenistic period was inherited to Roman Emperor, and its budding was already seen in the Augustus era. As the emperor 's rights were strengthened, the degree increased and those who refused were charged with rebellion. Therefore, Christians who refuse emperor worship were often subject to persecution.

DOC.Title: Martyrdom
DOC.TEXT: To live a life in order to pass through faith. Christians who refused emperor worship were persecuted by successive emperors and many were martyred.

DOC.Title: persecution of Nero
DOC.TEXT: A case where Emperor Nero suffered a believer by causing Christians to cause the cause of the Roman Great Fire. It was regarded as the beginning of persecution and martyrdom, and most of the emperors after that repeated persecution against Christians due to refusal of emperor worship.

DOC.Title: Catacomb
DOC.TEXT: The underground cemetery in the early Christian era. In the era of persecution in the 2nd and 4th centuries, it was used as a shelter and place of worship. Mural paintings remaining in catacombs are valuable legacy of early Christian art.

DOC.Title: "New Testament"
DOC.TEXT: A Christian church. "New Testament" is the meaning of a new contract against "Old Testament". It consists of 27 Gospels, Acts of Acts, Letters, Apocalypse in the records after Jesus. It is presumed that it was established in the existing form in the 2nd-4th century, written with the common language koinee of Hellenism world.

DOC.Title: "Four Gospels"
DOC.TEXT: In the "New Testament", the part that recorded Jesus' speech. Biography of Jesus who is said to be by four of Matthew, Mark, Luca, John. The center part of the "New Testament".

DOC.Title: "Acts of Acts"
DOC.TEXT: In the "New Testament", the part that described Peter-Paul's evangelism. It consists of 28 chapters.

DOC.Title: Father
DOC.TEXT: Authorized by the church, early Christian writers of ancient and medieval times. Following the apostles, he tried to establish orthodox doctrine, contributing to the establishment of the church and the development of doctrine.

DOC.Title: Church
DOC.TEXT: Episodic organization / meeting place. In the "New Testament" I came from using the Greek citizen's civil society (ekklesia) as a word indicating Christian groups. Later it began to point to that building.

DOC.Title: Great persecution of Emperor Diocletian
DOC.TEXT: In order to strengthen the faith and emperor worship of Roman traditional gods, they made a great persecution against Christians, but failed.

DOC.Title: Milan rush Inquiries
DOC.TEXT: Edict that authorized Christian faith. Emperor Constantine interviewed and collaborated on Delegation with Rikinius in Milan. It is regarded as a political measure in search of increased faithful supporters.

DOC.Title: Constantine, Constantine I
DOC.TEXT: In 313 I approved Christianity with the Edict of Milan, and in 325 convened the Council of Nichea and tried to mediate disputes within the church.

DOC.Title: Nicene Council
DOC.TEXT: The first Council of the Christian Church, held in Southern Nicomedia in Small Asia by Constantine I. Constantine was convened for the unification of doctrine. The theory that Athanasius could afford was orthodox, and the Arians were expelled as heretics.

DOC.Title: Arius controversy
DOC.TEXT: In the controversy that Arius challenged Athanasius' Trinity theory, settlement was settled at the Council of Nicene.

DOC.Title: Athanasius
DOC.TEXT: A fellow from Alexandria. Criticized the Arians school at the Nicene Council, and established the Trinitarian theory which is later regarded as Orthodox.

DOC.Title: Athanasius faction
DOC.TEXT: People who serve Athanasius' theory. In opposition to the Arians faction in accordance with the Trinitarian theory, it became orthodox doctrine at the Council of Nichea and led to the later Catholic.

DOC.Title: Trinity Theory
DOC.TEXT: The claim that the three of the Father, the Son Jesus, and the Holy Spirit are homogeneous and inseparable. I strongly admire Jesus' divinity.

DOC.Title: Orthodox Doctrine
DOC.TEXT: Meaning of those who properly inherit the true intention, business, authority of the founder. A word for sects and heretics. In the doctrinal controversy, the writers argue mutual orthodoxy.

DOC.Title: Arius
DOC.TEXT: Clerics of the Alexandrian church. He was sentenced to be heresy by the controversy with the Athanasius faction at the Nicene Council and was exiled.

DOC.Title: Arians school
DOC.TEXT: People who bring Arius' s theory. I strongly acknowledged humanity to Jesus, I regarded it differently from God and conflicted with the Trinitarian theory. Since being heresy at the Council of Nicene, it was evangelized to germans and others outside the Roman territory.

DOC.Title: heresy
DOC.TEXT: A theory other than orthodoxy. Although he self-termed Christians, they are deemed anti-Christian, and from the orthodox they were treated as enemies of sects and more infidels, and often received severe persecution.

DOC.Title: Eusebius
DOC.TEXT: Bishop of Palestinian Caesarea. Christianity First church historian and father. Major works "History of the Church" "Chronicle". The divine emperor's idea that he emphasized the emperor as an agent of God was handed down to the Byzantine Empire.

DOC.Title: "Church History"
DOC.TEXT: 10 volumes. Church history from the era of the apostles until 323. It is regarded as an important historical material of ancient church history research.

DOC.Title: "Chronicle"
DOC.TEXT: An important historical material that chronicles the history from the era of the Old Testament to 303.

DOC.Title: God emperor's philosophy
DOC.TEXT: The idea that the emperor is given by the grace of God. It was handed down to the Byzantine Empire, and was also used as the basis of the theory of the theology of Kingdom of Western Europe.

DOC.Title: Julian
DOC.TEXT: Roman Emperor (ranking 361-363). I am deeply concerned about the Greek classics and the Mithraism of the civilized religion, I converted and converted to pagan recovery, but I failed. It was called "apostate" from the church.

DOC.Title: Christianity nationalization
DOC.TEXT: In 380 Emperor Theodosius issued the Royal Decree to enforce the Christian faith, and in 392 it became a state religion, strictly prohibiting all other pagan faiths.

DOC.Title: Theodosius
DOC.TEXT: 392 Christianity was completely diplomaticized in 392. With that death Rome split in the east and west, after which the western Rome has gone through chaos and downfall.

DOC.Title: Augustine
DOC.TEXT: The greatest father of the end of Rome. Bishop of North Africa. Adolescence was devoted to Manichaism, but after having deepened interest in the intellectual world under the influence of New Bratonism, he decided conversion and contributed to the establishment of Catholic doctrine in the West Roman Empire of confusion. "Kingdom of God" "Confession Record" was written, and its thought had a great influence on Medieval Scholastic philosophy.

DOC.Title: "Country of God", "Theory of theology"
DOC.TEXT: A writings by Augustine from 413 to 427, triggered by the invasion of the Romans of the West Goat people. It was composed of 22 volumes, claiming that it is faith to God and the church to save the dying Roman Empire. It is a theology book that established church authority and also a historical philosophy document that shows a Christian worldview.

DOC.Title: "Confessions"
DOC.TEXT: Augustine's autobiography. From the life of childhood, I drew a record of the heart from maniacism to reaching Christianity.

DOC.Title: Ephesus Council
DOC.TEXT: Emperor Theodosius II of the Eastern Roman Council held at Ephesus in the West Coast of Asia Minor. I exiled Nestorius as a heresy.

DOC.Title: Nestorian faction
DOC.TEXT: A faction of Christianity who supports the theory that separated the divinity and humanity of Jesus as claimed by the total archbishop Nestorius (? ~ 451) of Constantinoble. After expulsion, it spread to the east mainly Sasan morning.

DOC.Title: landscape
DOC.TEXT: In the Tang Dynasty China, the nestorial name of the Nestorian faction that was reported by Iranians in China.

DOC.Title: Council of Chalcedon
DOC.TEXT: The Council held by the Roman Emperor Marcian on the opposite bank of Constantinople in Chalcedon. At the request of Papacy Leo I, the unity theory was made to be heresy.

DOC.Title: Unity Theory
DOC.TEXT: A theory that takes the standpoint of recognizing only divinity in Christ. Different from the orthodox theory of both sexes that recognize divinity and humanity, it was made to be heresy.

DOC.Title: Unity Theory
DOC.TEXT: A group of people who believe monotheism. Although made heresy at the Council of Chalcedon, since the 6th century, the Coptic Church (Egypt), the Syrian Church, the Armenian Church and others were built, and even after the expansion of Islamic forces, they developed their own activities.

DOC.Title: Indus river
DOC.TEXT: A large river flowing southwest of northwestern India, originating in Tibet, using glaciers and snow of the Himalayas / Karakoram mountains as the main source of water. The name of India comes from the name of this river.

DOC.Title: Indus civilization
DOC.TEXT: India's first city civilization. It seems that it was established under the influence of the Mesopotamian civilization, centering on the middle and downstream areas of the Indus River. Based on the magnificent plan, orderly urban construction was proceeded, there were houses, streets, workshops, warehouses, bathrooms, drainage grooves and the like of baked bricks. There were also facilities of fortifications outside, but there were no palaces and tombs that showed a mighty power of control. Bronze ware · Saiwa pottery · stamps etc. are used, Indus characters are engraved on the seal, worship of animals and plants · mother gods is also seen. Various reasons such as flooding of rivers, change of flow path, drying of climate such as natural situation change, artificial destruction of nature, decline of foreign trade activities are thought as cause of extinction.

DOC.Title: Harappa
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of the Indus civilization in the Punjab region of the middle Indus River. It was discovered in 1921. It is a castle of 200 m east-west, 400 m north-south, and there are many building groups such as castle gate, dwelling, grain warehouse, workplace and so on.

DOC.Title: Moenjo-daro
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of the Indus civilization in the Sind region downstream of the Indus River. The meaning of "dead man's hill". It was discovered in 1922. The streets with drainage grooves run in order, brick houses line up, and there are many building groups such as grain warehouses and large public baths.

DOC.Title: Sind region
DOC.TEXT: Current Pakistan South. Down stream area of ​​the Indus River.

DOC.Title: Rotar
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of the Indus civilization in the province of Gujarat, Western India.

DOC.Title: Dora Viera
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of the Indus civilization newly discovered in the Kuchi wetland in Western India in 1990. It is estimated to be a large scale comparable to Moenjo-daro.

DOC.Title: Indus character
DOC.TEXT: Hieroglyphs engraved on the seal which was excavated at the ruins of the Indus civilization. It remains uncrypted.

DOC.Title: Dravida system
DOC.TEXT: One of Indian indigenous peoples who used language of Dravida series. Prior to the Alyan, he advanced to India. It is estimated also as a builder of the Indus civilization from the view that the Indus character is a language of the Dravida series. Currently it is distributed mainly in South India.

DOC.Title: Tamil language
