DOC.TEXT: Language of the Dravida line. The Tamils ​​who used this language built Chora Morning and Berndiya Morning at the southern end of India, and Tamil literature flourished in these countries in the first to third centuries.

DOC.Title: Ariyan
DOC.TEXT: People who settled in Iran and India with Indian-European ethnic groups. Ariya who they self-termed means "noble". Part of the prairie zone in Central Asia was set as the original residential area, and the major migration began around 2000 before, a part of which advanced to the Iranian plateau, and the others partly crossed over the Kyabar Pass before 1500 and wavy in the northwestern part of India I emigrated. After conquering indigenous people with horses and tanks, it became a major ethnic group in Indian history, but after that, as we entered agricultural living, racial and cultural integration with indigenous people progressed.

DOC.Title: Kaibaru Pass
DOC.TEXT: Located in the southern part of the Hindu Kush Mountain Range, a key hub of traffic that connects Kabul in Afghanistan to Peshawar in Pakistan. By using this pass, Persian army of Darioos I and Alexandros troops invaded, and Mahayana Buddhism was transmitted to the north.

DOC.Title: Punjab
DOC.TEXT: A fertile area in the middle of the Indus River. Located in the traffic path connecting India and Central Asia, the Aryan first invaded and established.

DOC.Title: Ganges river
DOC.TEXT: A big river that emanates from a glacier in the Himalayan mountain range and flows through the plain area in northeastern India. About 1000 years ago, the Aryan invaded this basin and settled.

DOC.Title: Veda
DOC.TEXT: It is the collective name of the oldest scripture in India (initially oral). The meaning of knowledge, especially religious knowledge. It is a collection of hymns and rituals of God for the Aryan who admitted worshiping the divinity as a natural phenomenon and became the basis scripture of Brahminism. There are 4 types of "Rig = Veda" "Therma Veda" "Yajur Veda" "Ataruva Veda", which is regarded as an important historical material for early Aryan social studies.

DOC.Title: "Rig = Veda"
DOC.TEXT: The oldest Veda, a collection of praises for God 's. It is estimated that it was established around 1,200 to 1,000 before.

DOC.Title: "Therma-Veda"
DOC.TEXT: Writing collection.

DOC.Title: "Yajur-Veda"
DOC.TEXT: Festival collection.

DOC.Title: "Atharva-Veda"
DOC.TEXT: Cursews collection.

DOC.Title: Vedic era
DOC.TEXT: An era where Vedas are supposed to be compiled. The politics of the celebration match were held.

DOC.Title: Varna
DOC.TEXT: Conquest of the Aryan, since the settlement, a strict hierarchical status system formed from the previous 10 to the 7th century. The word of caste is derived from a custom (portrait or pedigree) used by a Portuguese who arrived in the era of a voyage as a word referring to Indian status. In India we use the word jirty which means birth in general. At the beginning when the Aryan settled, the four basic standings (Varna) of Brahmin, Kushatriya, Vaisya and Sudra were formed, but after about 3000 Jaruti (caste) became complicated with occupation differentiation and heredity Was formed. The marriage between different Jirties was strictly strictly prohibited, and the development of Indian society was hindered by fixing social relations. In modern times we deny discrimination caused by the Constitution but in fact it is said to remain strong.

DOC.Title: Rajan
DOC.TEXT: Tribal chief in Aryan society. That position tended to be hereditary, but it was not a tyranny king.

DOC.Title: Brahmin
DOC.TEXT: Priest hierarchy. In the top of Varna, I am responsible for religious ceremonies.

DOC.Title: Kshatriya
DOC.TEXT: Samurai / nobility hierarchy located in the second place of Varna. I was in charge of politics and military affairs.

DOC.Title: Vaisya
DOC.TEXT: The common general population level located in the third place of Varna. They pointed to farmers, pastoralists, merchants, etc., but later mainly pointed to merchants.

DOC.Title: Shudra
DOC.TEXT: At the bottom of Varna, the top three members of the civilian population who serve Varna. It centered on indigenous people conquered by the Alyan people. Afterwards, agriculture · pastoralism was regarded as occupation of Shudra.

DOC.Title: Immaculate, Dalit, Harijan
DOC.TEXT: 4 People at the lowest level who were discriminated out of the fence of Varna.

DOC.Title: Brahminism
DOC.TEXT: Religion formed as a fundamental scripture of Veda. Brahmin tried to maintain the order of Varna and developed a complicated ceremonial provision to raise its authority.

DOC.Title: Upanishad, "Miyoshi"
DOC.TEXT: An ancient Indian philosophy of religion, which constitutes a part of Veda. In the sense of "sitting nearby", it was pointed out that secrets were transferred to disciples serving in the side of the teacher. It was born from reflection and criticism of Brahminism which fell into festival universalism. The significance of the ceremony, the fundamental principle of the universe, Kazushi Sagoro (ultimately matching Brahman and Artman), preaching the withdrawal from the circulation decided by the work.

DOC.Title: Brahman, Bra
DOC.TEXT: In the sense that it is given from God, the fundamental principle of the universe and the body of all things.

DOC.Title: Artman, I
DOC.TEXT: A word meaning self and me, in Upanishad philosophy it is the fundamental principle of human existence.

DOC.Title: work, Karma
DOC.TEXT: One of the ideas of Upanishad philosophy. Past actions that are the cause of the difficulties of this world.

DOC.Title: Ring transformation
DOC.TEXT: The idea that organisms are influenced by industry, and repeat life and death. Discussed in Upanishad philosophy, deepened in Buddhism.

DOC.Title: Magada country
DOC.TEXT: One of the oldest kingdoms in India. It occurred in the middle Ganges river basin in the 6th century before and thrived as the center of politics, economics and culture. Buddhism · Jainism also occurred here.

DOC.Title: Kosara country
DOC.TEXT: A prosperous kingdom that took place in the middle Ganges river basin in the 6th century before. It was annexed to the Magadas country of the 5th century.

DOC.Title: Shaka tribe
DOC.TEXT: Tribe near the Indian border of Nepal at the foot of the Himalayas.

DOC.Title: Gautama = Siddharta
DOC.TEXT: Regarding birth and death benefits, there are various opinions such as around 563 before 483 before, 463 around before 383 around. Prince of Capilla of the Shakha family. He got out at the age of 29, opened enlightenment under Bodhwagaya's Bodhi tree, became a Buddha (a person who realized), opened a Buddhism.

DOC.Title: Buddha, Buddha
DOC.TEXT: Meaning of the awakenor / wisdom. It is a person who opened enlightenment, and generally refers to Shaka.

DOC.Title: Buddhism
DOC.TEXT: The religion that Shaka started in the 5th century BC. Based on a thorough and unnatural sense, I preached the departure by practice of Eight Masamichi and four crucifixions (correct recognition method to withdraw from four difficulties of aging disease). Denial of the Varna system, preaching the mercy heart and human equality. It was also supported by Vaisha including Kushatriya.

DOC.Title: Release
DOC.TEXT: In Buddhism, to escape from circulation, to transcend the life suffering of life and death.

DOC.Title: 8 Shingichi
DOC.TEXT: Shaka's method of practical training. Justice · Masters · Tango · Masters · Masters · Masters · Minds · Positive Determination.

DOC.Title: Buddhist cult, Sanga
DOC.TEXT: In the era of Buddha, organizations of embarkers organized to achieve disengagement. The important question was decided by a consultation of the founder. It broke down about 100 years after the death of Buddha and was divided into many branches of Buddhism.

DOC.Title: Vardamana, Mahavira
DOC.TEXT: Regarding birth and death benefits, there are many theories such as before 549 and around 477, before 468 and before 396. Founder of Jainism. Born from the Kushatriya level in the northeastern part of Bihar, northeast India. After going home he made severe penance, gained complete wisdom, opened Jainism. Mahavira is a honorific name in the sense of "a great hero."

DOC.Title: Jainism
DOC.TEXT: The religion that Vardamarna started. Jaina means "winner". Thinking of life as a pain, preaching abstinence and penance, taking extreme non-biocidalism, emphasizing severe precepts. Denial of the Varna system, primarily got a believer among Vaisha, especially merchants.

DOC.Title: "Mahabharata"
DOC.TEXT: A great epic over the battle between the Burrata tribes of North India, written in Sanskrit. It was summarized in the present shape around the 4th century. It was also regarded as a Hindu scripture and had a great influence on Indian faithful life. It was also transmitted to Southeast Asia, which had great influence on popular literature and arts in various places.

DOC.Title: Krishna
DOC.TEXT: Hero of "Mahabharata". It was popular with the masses and was regarded as the incarnation of God Vishnu.

DOC.Title: "Ramayana"
DOC.TEXT: A hero epic sang a suffering and adventure for the Prince of Kosara's country to rescue his robbed wife who was robbed. Written in Sanskrit, it was summarized in the present shape around the 4th century. It is regarded as a Hindu scripture. Along with "Mahabharata", all those who are active are Kushatriya, reflecting the rise of the Kushatriya forces at the time.

DOC.Title: Rama
DOC.TEXT: The main character of "Ramayana", popular with the masses, was regarded as the incarnation of God Vishyu.

DOC.Title: concept of zero
DOC.TEXT: In the Gupta period of India it was used with the Decimal Law, afterwards to Arabia, developed mathematics.

DOC.Title: Nanda morning
DOC.TEXT: One dynasty of Magada country. Although it was despised as a dynasty from Pseudra, he ruled the Ganges river basin by rich wealth and military strength. It was a short-lived dynasty that was reduced in about 30 years.

DOC.Title: Maurya Morning
DOC.TEXT: In one dynasty of Magada country, established the first unified state in Indian history. Immediately after Alexandros' invasion of Northeast India, Chandragapta was founded by defeating the Nanda morning. In the era of King Ashoka, it reached the heyday, and achieved the unification of all India except the southern end.

DOC.Title: Chandragapta
DOC.TEXT: The founder of the Maurya morning (around 317 before before around 296). After knocking down the Nanda morning, we wiped away the Greeks who were in the Indus River basin after Alexander's death, flattened North West India, and further robbed Afghanistan from the Seleucus morning. By a mighty military and bureaucracy, we realized Fukoku Army and set the foundation for unification of India.

DOC.Title: Pateralipra
DOC.TEXT: City of Maurya. Chinese name, Fahrenheit castle. The current Patna.

DOC.Title: Ashoka King
DOC.TEXT: The king of the third generation of the Maurya morning (around 268 before before the pre-232 time). Chinese name, Akio. We achieved the unification of all India except the southern end, and revealed the heyday of the Maurya morning. After conquering Kalinga country in southeast direction, I devoted to Buddhism, put a political philosophy with Dharma (law) as ideal, and tried to stabilize the unified state. In addition to advancing social projects such as construction of hospitals, improvement of roads and irrigation facilities, we assisted the 3 rd Buddhist scripture rallying and also conducted missionary activities such as Sri Lanka.

DOC.Title: Carlinga country
DOC.TEXT: A country that flourished in the northeastern part of Deccan around the end of the 4th century. In the first half of the 3rd century BC Asoucher conquered even the fierce battle, but it is said that it was shocked by hundreds of thousands of victims and devoted to Buddhism.

DOC.Title: Tiger monument, stone pillar monument
DOC.TEXT: A polished brick and stone pillar engraved with the imperial rescript of King Ashoka. It was built in various parts of the territory to declare the content of politics of Dharma (law). The letters written in the inscription are the oldest in India.

DOC.Title: Dharma, Law
DOC.TEXT: It is the concept of Indian thought, and refers to the norms that people should protect, such as religion, ethics, laws and customs. In the imperial rescript of King Ashoka it meant human universal ethics.

DOC.Title: Buddhist collective association, 3rd Buddhist collective unity
DOC.TEXT: After the death of Shaka, collection and compilation of doctrines conducted by disciples. The rally of Ashoka era is the third time after Shaka 's death.

DOC.Title: Sri Lanka Missionary, Ceylon Island Missionary
DOC.TEXT: In the latter part of the 3rd century, according to the legend, King Ashoka was said to have been sent to evangelist Prince Mahinda. After that, Sri Lanka became a major center of Buddhism in the upper seat.

DOC.Title: Stupa
DOC.TEXT: A building which is translated as a pagoda and pays a stupa (remains of Shaka). It was built in various parts where Buddhism was propagated. It became the etymology of a graduated woman.

DOC.Title: Saturday morning, Andendra
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty dynasty dynasty dynasty dynasty. Dominated the Deccan region, early adopting Aryan culture, Paramontism · Buddhism · Jainism spread. It prospered by maritime trade with the Roman world in the west. The city is the current pie.

DOC.Title: Bactria
DOC.TEXT: A kingdom built by the descendants of residual Greeks at the time of the expedition of Alexander the Great in the upper stream of the Am River. Maintaining Hellenistic culture and invading northwest India at the end of the last 3rd century. It was destroyed by the Tohara people in the 2nd century.

DOC.Title: Saka Tribe
DOC.TEXT: Iranian nomads in Central Asia. Mr. Moon moved south to build a small kingdom in Afghanistan, Pakistan, Northwest India. It was attached to the Kushana morning around the 1 st century and was destroyed at the end of the 4 th century Gupta morning.

DOC.Title: Mr. Otsuki
DOC.TEXT: Nomads who played an active part in Central Asia since the last 3 century. There are many theories that see ethnic lines as Iranian lines. Since the first half of the 2nd century Buddhism · Wu Chi wrestled with Amu River upstream Osuki built the country (around the previous 140 to the 1st century), further moved to the Bactria region, around the first century Big summer (Tohara) I conquered it. In China, Kushana morning is also called Mr. Otsuki.

DOC.Title: Kushana morning
DOC.TEXT: The Iranian Kuscana tribe under the rule of Mr. Otsuki was independent and built in Northwest India from Western Turkistan (For the Kushana tribe, there is a theory that it is a Moon family clique or an indigenous tribe in the Bactrian region ). It reached its heyday in King Ethics of the 2nd century, but it declined in the 3 rd century under the attack of Sasan morning.

DOC.Title: Purushapura
DOC.TEXT: City of the Kushana morning. Current Peshawar in northern Pakistan.

DOC.Title: Kanishika
DOC.TEXT: Although there are many theories about the existence age, the 130-170 year theory is considered to be the most promising. A king who built the heyday of the Kushana morning, with Prince Shapura as the capital, ruling from Central Asia to Ganges Middle Basin. We protected Buddhism and carried out the 4th Buddhist collective rally. Gandhara art developed in its reign.

DOC.Title: Buddhist collective association, the 4th Buddhist collective unity
DOC.TEXT: Buddhist script editing project carried out under the protection of King Kanishka.

DOC.Title: Gandhara art
DOC.TEXT: Buddhist art developed from the latter half of the century in the Gandhara region centered on Purushabura. In Buddhism in India, the technique of Hellenistic sculpture since the time of Kingdom of Bactria and the idea of ​​modeling fuse together, and a deep Buddha image of Greek element was created. The style was transferred from the western region to China and extended to Japan.

DOC.Title: Buddha statue
DOC.TEXT: Indian Buddhists did not express the Buddha in the statue, but Greek people who take God's human form as human beings began making Buddha statues with Gandhara, Matler etc.

DOC.Title: Hideaki Buddhism
DOC.TEXT: A derogatory name from the new Buddhism (Mahayana Buddhism) side for traditional Buddhism (departmental Buddhism). In Departmental Buddhism, it is important that believers go out and train themselves to leave their own. Most of this propagates to Southeast Asian regions, also called Buddhist Buddhism / Nantong Buddhism.

DOC.Title: Departmental Buddhism
DOC.TEXT: Name of Buddhism after division of Buddhist Church. About 100 years after the death of Shaka, the Buddhist division broke into a number of divisions over understanding of precepts and doctrine.

DOC.Title: Azabu Buddhism
DOC.TEXT: Originally it was a conservative Buddhism that is trying to keep the existing precepts in the Buddhist division, but it was widely believed in Southeast Asia and Sri Lanka, became self-proclaimed by the faithful of the branch Buddhism (Hideaki Buddhism) There. The upper seat means "one who communicates the teachings of the elder".

DOC.Title: Mahayana Buddhism
DOC.TEXT: New Buddhism that occurred after BC against a conservative and formalized Buddhist division (Hideaki Buddhism). In the sense of "big ride", it was widely accepted by the people aiming at salvation of all human beings based on Bodhisattva faith. It was mainly transferred to China through Central Asia and also to Korea and Japan, so it is also called the Kita-Buddhist Buddhism / Northern Buddhism.

DOC.Title: Bodhisattva faith
DOC.TEXT: Bodhisattva originally refers to a person under training so as to become a Buddha, but Mahayana Buddhism encouraged practitioners to aim to relieve all people, who also wanted to obtain disengagement. That faith forms the central idea of ​​Mahayana Buddhism.

DOC.Title: Naagirl Juna, Tatsuki
DOC.TEXT: Buddhist scholar from Buramon. I wrote "Middle Theory" and established Mahayana Buddhism theory.

DOC.Title: Gupta Morning
DOC.TEXT: The unified dynasty of northern India since the Maurya morning. Chandragupta I was founded by conquering the middle Ganges river basin. In the era of the third generation Chandraguga II, he dominated the majority of northern India, and reached his peak. It was considered the golden age of Indian classical culture, Sanskrit literature and net Indian style art developed, Hinduism spread. Domestic disorder from the latter half of the 5th century, declined with the invasion of Eftal, was destroyed in the middle of the sixth century.

DOC.Title: Eftal
DOC.TEXT: A cavalry herd who was active in Central Asia in the 5th-6th centuries. It is considered to be Turkish or Iranian. In the beginning of the sixth century I dominated the territory extending from east to west Turkestan to Iran and invaded northwest India, which caused the decline of the Gupta morning. In the mid-sixth century, it was caught and destroyed by a thump and Sasan morning.

DOC.Title: Chandraglup I 1
DOC.TEXT: The founder of the Gupta morning (around the rank of 320-335). It emerged at the current Bihar where former Magadas were, and conquered the Middle Ganges.

DOC.Title: Thumb dagger
DOC.TEXT: King of the second generation of Gupta morning (ranking around 335 ~ 376).

DOC.Title: Chandragas II, Super King Sun
DOC.TEXT: King of the third generation in the morning Gupta (around the rank of 376-415). Maximizing the area of ​​Gupta morning, encouraging literature, and revealed the heyday.

DOC.Title: Pateralipra
DOC.TEXT: Gupta In the morning city, the center of culture. The law was written as Fahrenheit Castle.

DOC.Title: Legend
DOC.TEXT: A monk in the Higashin Jin period. In search of the original text of precepts, he departed from 399 years of departure, went to India in Chandrakuta II in the west via the west area, and returned to the country on 412 sea route. He wrote "French Republic" as its record.

DOC.Title: Sanskrit word
DOC.TEXT: The literary language of ancient India belonging to the Indo-European language. For the popular language, the meaning of "completed Yaji". It was used by Brahmin since BC and was used as the official language of the Indian dynasties until the 18th century.

DOC.Title: Sanskrit literature
DOC.TEXT: Literature written in Sanskrit. It flourished under the protection of the royal family in the Gupta era, represented by Caridasa.

DOC.Title: Carriedasa
DOC.TEXT: Poets and playwrights of the Gupta morning season. It is said that he played an active part in the Court of Chandragog Buta II. The highest peak of Sanskrit literature.

DOC.Title: "Shakuntarah"
DOC.TEXT: A masterpiece of Karidasa. A drama of seven acts with the theme of ceremonial love between the daughter Shakuntarah and Dufshanta of her daughter. The best masterpiece of Sanskrit literature.

DOC.Title: Nherlander monastery
DOC.TEXT: Buddhist school which Gupta morning was built in the 5th century. Developed as the center of Buddhist teaching, he also learned Genkyo and Yoshihiro here. It was destroyed by Muslims in the 12th century, but excavations from 1915, excavations of temples and so forth were excavated.

DOC.Title: Gupta style
DOC.TEXT: The net Indian style of art completed in Gupta era. From the influence of the Greek style Gandhara style, it emerged the golden age of Indian classical culture. Representative examples include mural paintings of the Ajanta cave temples.

DOC.Title: Ajanta cave temple
DOC.TEXT: Buddhist remains in Western India. It consists of 29 caves dug in the cliff of the river. A monastery was built since the last century and was temporarily suspended, but it was again excavated from the 5th century and many murals were drawn in the 6th and 7th centuries. Its style was regarded as a representative of Gupta art, it also spread to China and Japan, and it also affected the mural paintings of Horyuji.

DOC.Title: Voracutaka Morning
DOC.TEXT: We did the excavation of the Ajanta cave temple.

DOC.Title: Ellora Cave Temple
DOC.TEXT: Cave remains in the western part of India. It consists of 34 caves, with Buddhism, Hinduism, Jainism architecture, mural paintings and sculptures remaining in the 7th and 10th centuries.

DOC.Title: Mathura
DOC.TEXT: An ancient city located 160 km south of Delhi. It is known for the pure Indian style Buddha statue sculpture in the middle of the first to fourth century.

DOC.Title: Sarnnut
DOC.TEXT: The town north of Benares. It is said that Shaka is the first Kannoen that he has taught for the first time, and it is one of the four big sacred sites of Buddhism. It is also famous for Buddhist art.

DOC.Title: Dharma-Shastra
DOC.TEXT: The law on religious and social obligations and living standards of each Varna, written after Maurya. "Manu Code" is representative.

DOC.Title: "Manu Code"
DOC.TEXT: The law that was established around 200 to 200 later. It stipulates the religious and social obligations and living standards of each Varna, consisting of chapter 12 2685 verses. Brahmin's advantage, discrimination against women, etc. were emphasized and had a decisive influence on the later Indian society.

DOC.Title: Hinduism
DOC.TEXT: After BC, Indian ethnic religion which was established by the ancient Brahmanism with the fusion of private faith in various parts of India and the influence of Buddhism. There is no specific doctrine / scripture in polytheism mainly of God Shiva · Vishnu. In the meaning of Indian religion, he was involved in every detail of the daily life of the people, overwhelming and absorbing Buddhism liberated from the people.

DOC.Title: Shiva God
DOC.TEXT: One of the three major gods of Hinduism. In the beginning was a wind god, but in Hinduism it became a multifaceted god such as destruction gods and creation gods. It is also represented in various dancing forms as a god of Butoh.

DOC.Title: Vishnu
DOC.TEXT: One of the three major gods of Hinduism. At the beginning was a sun god, but in Hinduism it was believed as a god of world maintenance.

DOC.Title: Brahma God
DOC.TEXT: One of the three major gods of Hinduism. God to create the world. It is a conceptual god and lacks myth, and it did not collect the faith of the people among the three major gods.

DOC.Title: Vardina morning
DOC.TEXT: In the first half of the 7th century, the unified dynasty of North India, which Harsha-Vardana founded. After the destruction of the Gupta in the morning, we unified the majority of North India, which was in a split state, but it collapsed rapidly after the death of the king.

DOC.Title: Harsha-Vardana, Opposition King
DOC.TEXT: Founder of Vardana morning (Rd 606-647). The last unified person in Ancient North India. He protected Hinduism and Buddhism and encouraged literature such as writing Sanskrit play himself.

DOC.Title: Kanuji
DOC.TEXT: City of Vardana morning. Gen Yu called Shikijo.

DOC.Title: Genba
DOC.TEXT: Tang priest. In search of Buddhist scripture, he left departing from Chang'an in 629 and went to India via the western region. Following the hospitality of King Harsha-Vardana, I studied at the Nherlander monastery and traveled around India. After returning home in 645, he received the life of Tajong, translated the scriptures, and also wrote the travel book "Great Tang West Region".

DOC.Title: Yoshiaki
DOC.TEXT: Tang priest. Leaving Guangzhou in 671, I went to India via the Nankai, I studied at the Norander Monastery and returned to Japan in 695. I wrote a journal "Nankai Paradigm Law" in Sri Vijaya on his way home.

DOC.Title: Para morning
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty dominated the Bengal region. It protected the declining Buddhism (esoteric religion) and brought its last prosperity, but Buddhism was subsequently absorbed by Hinduism and disappeared from India almost.

DOC.Title: Esoteric religion, tantricism
DOC.TEXT: Amidst the decline of original Buddhism, around the 7th century, a magical mystical Buddhism established by incorporating private faith.

DOC.Title: Large Pet
DOC.TEXT: A caste group of North India meaning Kushatriya's status. It means "the child of the king".

DOC.Title: Rajputo era
DOC.TEXT: The era when the kingdom ruled by Rajputo's powerful forces split and fought in North India where the Dali dynasty was confused from the destruction of the Vardana morning to the foundation of the Delhi dynasty.

DOC.Title: Platy Hala Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: One of the rajputa kingdoms. With Kaoji as the capital, the western and central parts of North India were possessed, and Arab factions prevented the eastward movement.

DOC.Title: Chandela Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: One of the Rajputat kingdoms that was independent from the kingdom of Platy Hala and thrived during the 10th-11th centuries.

DOC.Title: Fuha Mana Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Kingdom of the Rajput in the northwestern part of India. It was destroyed by the Islamic army.

DOC.Title: Pandiya Morning
DOC.TEXT: Dravida dynasty. The southernmost dynasty of South India. It maintained independence from the Maurya morning and developed its own Tamil culture. It is also known for trade with Rome.

DOC.Title: Chola morning
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty of the Tamil dynasty of South India. It was known since the 3rd century BC and reached its peak in the 3 rd century, but then declined.

DOC.Title: Pallava morning
DOC.TEXT: After the decline of the Saturday morning, the dynasty developed mainly on Kanchi in the southern east coast of India. Pakti faith spread among the people.

DOC.Title: Charoukiya Morning
DOC.TEXT: Dravida dynasty. We unified the Deccan region and tried to introduce Gupta culture. In the first half of the seventh century I stopped the advance of Harsha-Vardana.

DOC.Title: Morning Chora
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty of the Tamil dynasty of South India. It flourished on the basis of maritime trade, and in the heyday of the 10th-11th century, it dominated the northern part of Sri Lanka and also made an expedition to Sri Vigaya. In the latter half of the dynasty Hindu faith became popular and Bakhti faith spread.

DOC.Title: Dravida style
DOC.TEXT: A style that was established by introducing and fusing the northern Aryanian culture to Tamil culture of the Dravida dynasty of South India.

DOC.Title: Bakti Movement
DOC.TEXT: Religious activities devoting absolute devotion to the highest God of Hinduism such as Shiva and Vishnu. We denied Buddhism and Jainism and tried to obtain relief by singing faith to God and dancing without knowledge or penance. In the seventh century, the population was involved in South India, spreading to North India in the 14th and 15th centuries.

DOC.Title: Bard, Indian Bard:
DOC.TEXT: Pakuti The poet who sang the absolute love to God and walked through various places while faith spread.

DOC.Title: Sinhalese
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic groups currently occupying the vast majority of Sri Lanka. Ariya group. Many upper Buddhist Buddhists.

DOC.Title: Sinhala Kingdom, Sinhari Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: In the middle of the 3rd century Buddhism Buddhism was accepted. Prosperous in East-West trade, but declined from around the 14th century.

DOC.Title: Mong people
DOC.TEXT: Indigenous people scattered in Burma (present Myanmar) South and Thailand Midwest. South Asian language. As early as I accepted Indian culture, it affected the surrounding area.

DOC.Title: Mon character
DOC.TEXT: A letter made in accepting Indian culture. It was transmitted and developed in the Pagan morning.

DOC.Title: Dover Lavatie
DOC.TEXT: Chao Phraya (Menam) A monkey country flourishing mainly in the downstream river basin. Trade activities such as talks to Tang were involved. The Buddhist Buddhism was believed, and many Buddhist architecture and sculpture were left.

DOC.Title: Pegou
DOC.TEXT: The harbor city state built by Mong people. It flourished in Bengal Bay trade.

DOC.Title: Pew, 驃
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic and national flourished in the Burma Irawawi River basin. Tibetan-Burma system. Although Buddhism (such as Buddhist Buddhism) flourished, it is presumed that it declined in the Nanko attack in the 9th century and then destroyed.

DOC.Title: Pagan morning
DOC.TEXT: Burma's first unified dynasty by Burmese. Bagan was the capital, and almost dominated my present Myanmar (Burma). We accepted Buddhism from the lower Burmese monks and Sri Lanka, and established many pagodas and temples. It decreased by receiving the original invasion at the end of the 13th century.

DOC.Title: Burmese people
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic groups using Tibetan-Burmese language.

DOC.Title: Jingo dynasty
DOC.TEXT: Another name for the Pagan dynasty where many temples were built.

DOC.Title: Shan people
DOC.TEXT: Thai ethnic groups. It blows southward from the Yunnan area and blows Pagan morning.

DOC.Title: Vietnamese people
DOC.TEXT: It belongs to the South Asian language along with the Mong / Khmer people. In the Southeast Asian region, we accepted Chinese civilization most aggressively.

DOC.Title: Vietnam
DOC.TEXT: Eastern Indochina Peninsula. Most of the inhabitants speak Vietnamese of the South Asian language. After the expedition of the Qin Shi Emperor and the conquest of the Emperor of Han, in particular the northern part was dominated by China in particular, Chinese culture flowed in. Since the establishment of Anseong Guard Office in Hanoi in the Tang Dynasty, it was called Anzan. After the short-term unified dynasty in the second half of the 10th century, Mr. Lee established the first long-term unified dynasty of Okoshi (Lee Dynasty) at the beginning of the 11th century.

DOC.Title: Dong Son culture
DOC.TEXT: Bronze and ironware culture spread all over Southeast Asia from around the 4th century. In 1924, it was named for the first time from the Donson ruins in northern Vietnam that bronze copper drums etc were excavated. It is considered that the influence of Chinese culture and the indigenous element are fused.

DOC.Title: Bronze drum
DOC.TEXT: It is a bronze-made ritual with various patterns drawn, relics that symbolize Dong Son culture.

DOC.Title: Southeast Asian civilized area
DOC.TEXT: Dong sung culture and others are the foundations, civilization established under the influence of China and Indian civilization. Especially influence of Hinduism and Buddhism from the former is large in kanji and regulation system, and from the latter is big.

DOC.Title: Surfing culture, Safin culture
DOC.TEXT: Culture of fishermen who developed at the coast of Vietnam on the south and south at the same time as Donson culture. It was characterized by cultivation of rice and millet and production of bronze ware. Similar relics are found in the Philippines, and the activity of ocean trade in this area is inferred.

DOC.Title: Okoshi County, Dibet country
DOC.TEXT: First northern Vietnamese long-term government. Since Lee Kang-soo was built, it is also called Mr. Lee Ouchi (Lee Dynasty). The capital city is Dragon (now Hanoi). Until the beginning of the 12th century, it reproached the Song Army and fled to the Champers three times. Buddhism · Confucianism has developed.

DOC.Title: Cham People
DOC.TEXT: Murray = Polynesian language. I received Indian culture from the early Indochina Peninsula East Coast.

DOC.Title: Champagne
DOC.TEXT: The Kingdom built by the Cham people in the southeastern part of the Indochinese Peninsula. Originally under Chinese rule, after 1922 it became independent from Han. The Chinese name is Lin Yu, Ring Wang, Han Geun. It flourished in the relay trade connecting Southeast Asia, West Asia and South China. The influence of Indian culture such as religion is great.

DOC.Title: Hayashiro
DOC.TEXT: The Chinese name of the champagne around the 2nd and 7th centuries. Initially it was influenced by Chinese culture, but by the end of the 3rd century I adopted Indian culture. Following the attack of Sui, it was a tribute to the Tang dynasty.

DOC.Title: Forcible Castle
DOC.TEXT: The Chinese name of the champagne since the second half of the 9th century. From the end of the 10th century to the dynasties of Vietnam, the 11th and 12th centuries fought against the encore morning, and in the latter half of the 13th century invasion of the ex-army was received. In the late 15th century the main part was conquered by the Vietnamese Dynasty and the remaining power was destroyed in the 17th century.

DOC.Title: Khmer, Cambodian
DOC.TEXT: South Asian language. Mixed-blooded people of Mont-Khmer and Indian immigrants. I reside in the Mekong River basin in the southern part of the Indochinese Peninsula, built Buonan · Mingling Country, and left its own Khmer culture.

DOC.Title: Fenan
DOC.TEXT: In the 1st or 2nd century, the Chinese name of the country that the Khmer people or Murray people built. It dominated the delta area in the Mekong River Basin. Imported Indian institutions and cultures, thrived with trade with India and China. In the middle of the 7th century, it was subject to the pressure of Makoto and it was destroyed.

DOC.Title: Okayo
DOC.TEXT: A ruin presumed to be the foreign port of Fuanan that developed as a typical port city state. Located in the Mekong River Delta, it developed as a relay trade port for various goods from the Siam Bay and Mekong River water system. Buddha statue · Han mirror, Hindu god image · Roman gold coin etc are excavated and shows spread of maritime trade at the time.

DOC.Title: Harbor City State
DOC.TEXT: A country developed as a harbor port and collection port of goods along coastal and river trade routes. The central port city state such as politics, military affairs, and trade often summarizes the surrounding port city state and forms the port city state group in many cases. Representative of the Indochina Peninsula Lin Eung, Fuanan, the Malay Peninsula, the Sumatra island and the kingdom built in Java.

DOC.Title: Shin è
DOC.TEXT: The Chinese name of the country Khmer built in the Mekong River basin. Cambodia. Hinduism was regarded as state religion. It broke up in the north and south around the 8th century, but it was reunified under the 9th century Angkor morning and reached the heyday in the 12th century. Since the 14th century it was pressed by Thai forces and faded.

DOC.Title: Luo Mei
DOC.TEXT: After the division of the 8th century, the country which dominated northern Cambodia.

DOC.Title: Water Shao
DOC.TEXT: After the division of the 8th century, the country which dominated South Cambodia.

DOC.Title: Angkor morning
DOC.TEXT: Khmer dynasty flourished mainly in the Angkor district in Northwest Cambodia. Heir's heyday.

DOC.Title: Angkor Tom
DOC.TEXT: Ruins of the Kingdom of the Angkor morning. It was founded at the end of the 9th century and continued to increase and remodel until around the 13th century. A wall of about 3 km on a side is built, and the temple built in the wall is influenced by Indian culture.

DOC.Title: Angkor Wat
DOC.TEXT: A typical temple ruin of Angkor morning. It was built as a Hindu temple by Suryyavarman II in the first half of the 12th century, but since around the 14th century it became a Buddhist temple. It is a three-layer stone building surrounded by a moat, and there are many sculptures representing scenes of "Mahabharata" and "Ramayana" on the inner wall of the corridor.

DOC.Title: Sul Yavarman II
DOC.TEXT: King of the heyday of Angkor dynasty (around 11 to 52). I believed in Hinduism Vishnu and built Angkor Wat.

DOC.Title: Jayavarman VII
DOC.TEXT: King of Angkor morning (around 1181 to 1220). I believed in Mahayana Buddhism, completed Miyakonojo Encore Tom expansion, and improved the road network. Though prosperous, including the whole Indochinese Peninsula as a version, after the death of the King, the encore morning declined.

DOC.Title: Malay people
DOC.TEXT: People who live mainly in the Malay Peninsula and Sumatra Island. Use Malay language of Malay = Polynesian type same as Javanese and Tagalog (main language of the Philippines).

DOC.Title: Sully Vijaya
DOC.TEXT: A kingdom built by Malayans around Southeast Sumatra. Chinese name is Muroyasu Buddha / Three Buddha. A typical port city state that prospered by dominating the key maritime transportation centering around Palembang. Toward the end of the 7th century, Yang Ji visited during the return from India and conveyed the prosperity of Mahayana Buddhism. It has declined since the 11th century, with little record left.

DOC.Title: Samudra = Pasay
DOC.TEXT: A country at the northern tip of Sumatra Island. At the end of the 13 th century, the King was converted to Islamism, affected by Muslim merchants and Sufi.

DOC.Title: Old Mataram Country
DOC.TEXT: Around the 8th century, the country Javanese built in central Java. In recent years attention has been paid to the relevance to the Shirendra morning. Rice cultivation was held, Hinduism was believed.

DOC.Title: Pranbanan Temple Group
DOC.TEXT: A group of Hindu temples built by ancient Mataram country in central Java.

DOC.Title: Shireredda Morning
DOC.TEXT: Middle Eastern to the early ninth century Murray was built in the central Java Java Dynasty. Regarding the establishment of this dynasty, there is a theory that Shiri Vijaya's dynasty had entered Central Java in the mid-eighth and early ninth centuries, and the theory of dynasty reigning in Sri Vijaya in the royal Java. It protected Mahayana Buddhism and built Borobudur.

DOC.Title: Borobudur
DOC.TEXT: Stone ruins of Mahayana Buddhism in the Shireredda era in central Java. One side 111.5 m, total height 31.5 m. It is a large stupa with six layers of rectangular pillars and three layers of circular piles overlapped in a pyramidal shape, and the decorative Buddha statue has strong influence of the Gupta style.

DOC.Title: Kudiri Morning
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty in eastern Java. Indian epic "Mahabharata" was translated into Javanese and a shadow play (Wayang) was held and created a unique culture.

DOC.Title: Wayang
DOC.TEXT: Shadow play running in Java. It is centered on the theme of Indian epic "Mahabharata" "Ramayana".

DOC.Title: Yellow River
DOC.TEXT: China's second big river. It emits to Qinghai Province, flows through the provinces of Gansu, Shaanxi, Shanxi, Henan and Shandong and pours to Bohai Bay. In the watershed, a fertile loess area spread and agricultural civilization occurred. In the middle and lower basin, flooding and change of flow path were repeated, and its flood control became a big problem of successive dynasties.

DOC.Title: ocher
DOC.TEXT: Fine particles of pale yellow / gray-yellow rocks deposited and deposited by winds and rivers from the desert area. It forms a fertile soil containing a large amount of lime and alkali, passes through air and water well, so wheat, kohlean, millet etc grows with moderate moisture. It accumulated thickly around the North China Plain, making it possible to develop the initial farming in the lower basin of the Yellow River.

DOC.Title: Yellow River Civilization
DOC.TEXT: A farm civilization centered on millet and millet, which the original Sina people opened in the ocher zone of the Yellow River middle and lower basin. From the Neolithic era chaotic culture through Yongsan culture, it developed into the bronze culture of Yin.

DOC.Title: Xi Shao Culture
DOC.TEXT: It is the oldest neolithic culture in China which occurred in the Yellow River middle basin around 5000 before 4000. In 1921, the Swedish Anderson found a ruin featuring pottery in Hoengshan village in Henan Province, and was named Esa Chow Culture (or Ceramic Culture). People cultivated millet · millet, pig, dog, chicken as livestock, lived in a dwelling house, formed a colony. The relationship with the West is estimated from the use of polished stone axes and pottery. Representative ruins are Shaanxi Province Semi-Pope Democratic Republic and Kang Jiai-zee Mark.

DOC.Title: Sayumi pottery, Saika
DOC.TEXT: Pottery made potatoes with red, white and black on a pink red ground. Firing temperature is about 1000 ℃. Bowl shape and bowl shape are many, and it is distributed in Henan · Shanxi · Shaanxi · Gansu etc. The production method can be thought of the influence of Western Neolithic Culture.

DOC.Title: Yongsan culture
DOC.TEXT: The late Neolithic culture that ranged to the Liaodong Peninsula and the Yangtze River basin mainly in the lower Yellow River basin of Henan and Shandong in the 3 rd millennium (especially the second half). The first ruin featuring black pottery was found at the castle cliff of Longshan Town in Shandong Province, and it was named Yongsan culture (or black pot culture). Agricultural and agricultural techniques improved, cows and horses were also kept, the size of the settlement increased, and fortunetelling using the bone bone was done in part. The prototype of the later Chinese village (Eup) is seen.

DOC.Title: Black pot
DOC.TEXT: Dark black color, a thin Riken pottery. A potter's wheel was used and it was manufactured at a firing temperature of 1000 ℃ or higher. The shape is various such as three-legged pottery, it is regarded as a prototype of bronze ware of Shin and Zhou. It is distributed in Shandong · Henan in the downstream region of the Yellow River.

DOC.Title: Grayware
DOC.TEXT: Blue gray thick coarse pottery excavated from almost all of the ocher zone. The shape is diverse, but there are many three-legged pottery, and many Jomon patterns. It continues to be produced for a long period from the Neolithic Age to the Bronze Age, and it is still used today as a daily item.

DOC.Title: three-legged pottery
DOC.TEXT: A three-legged pottery characteristic of China's Neolithic Age. Two types of é and Ding are representative, and it is many in gray and black pottery.

DOC.Title: Ding / Ding
DOC.TEXT: Representative three-legged pottery in China. Having a sack-shaped foot, Ding has a stick-shaped foot and is used to boil meat etc, to stir the hot water and steam the cereal. Ding appears in the latter part of the euphostic culture, but it was used in the Yongsan culture period, and its shape affected the bronze ware of the Yin.

DOC.Title: Yangtze River, Yangtze River
DOC.TEXT: The biggest river in China. It flows to the Tibetan plateau, flows through the central part of China, and pours into the East China Sea. It was confirmed that the Neolithic cultures based on rice cultivation existed in the middle and lower basin, at the same time as Yellow River Civilization.

DOC.Title: Yangtze civilization
DOC.TEXT: In recent years, excavation began in the Yangtze River basin, the civilization from the Neolithic Civilization to the Bronze Age civilization era. In agriculture, rice cultivation was the center.

DOC.Title: Kawamadori ruins
DOC.TEXT: An excavation since 1973, found in Zhejiang Province in the Yangtze River Basin, earlier Neolithic cultural ruins around 5000 to 3000 before. There was also a view that it was confirmed that rice crop was done, and it was propagated to the Japanese archipelago. It was thought that it flourished at the same time as Xuhua Culture, revealing the existence of Yangtze Civilization.

DOC.Title: Goodagin culture
DOC.TEXT: Neolithic culture developed around Zhejiang Province mainly in the Yangtze River basin around the year 3300-before 2200. The excavation began in the 1930's, and many ball instruments (ornaments made from a kind of jewels called softballs) which are presumed to have been used for rituals were excavated.

DOC.Title: Samsung Evolution
DOC.TEXT: Late neolithic culture that prospered in the vicinity of Chengdu in Sichuan Province since 2000. It is known for its unique mask, with bronze eyes protruding.

DOC.Title: Eup
DOC.TEXT: It means villages and cities formed during the Longshan Culture Late to the Spring Autumn Era, in which the life of a clan community emphasizing rituals and military operations was carried out. There are also many eups surrounded by trees and earth walls for defense, and they are called castle cities. If the scale of Eup later expands, it is also called a city state.

DOC.Title: City State
DOC.TEXT: A major eup surrounded by a solid castle wall, which was established under the control of the surrounding eup. Depending on the scale and function, it can be divided into Wang Du (Miyakonojo), Ouegu (National castle), Oguchi.

DOC.Title: Wang Ru, Miyakonojo
DOC.TEXT: Large scale eup ruled by the king.

DOC.Title: Oumu, National castle
DOC.TEXT: A relatively large eupy ruled by the Great Hou.

DOC.Title: Ogura
DOC.TEXT: Small-scale Tomoe dominated by small and medium-sized princes.

DOC.Title: Eucalyptus State
DOC.TEXT: A powerful eup (a city state) is a national organization formed by dominating other elec- tions or becoming the center of the coalition. The leader is usually called "king", and its strength was weakened by the large number of eups that were placed under control (coalition).

DOC.Title: 堯・舜・禹
DOC.TEXT: Chinese ancient legendary emperor. 堯 has created a calendar, handed down the position to Shun who was successful in the government, Shun also appointed widely talented person, and it is said that he gave way to Yu who was successful in flood control. 堯・舜's world was idealized later by Confucius' Mencius.

DOC.Title: Summer
DOC.TEXT: The oldest legendary dynasty in China, beginning with Yu. It is said to have been destroyed by Yin no Yu when Tyrant King was king.

DOC.Title: Yin
DOC.TEXT: The oldest dynasty in China that can be confirmed at present. In the legend Yu went down to destroy the summer and built the dynasty, afterwards it was said to have been destroyed by Mu Wang of Zhou when King Suwon. Among the elephants interspersed in the middle of the Yellow River, the great ocean called the owner was established as the union of the allied nation (the ecstatic state). The social structure was revealed from the discovery of Yin ruins and the decapitation of the torso character, and the king performed the theocracy politics congruent with the celestial rule based on the godlessness. Advanced bronze ware was used as a ritual / weapon, and wood and stoneware was used for farming.

DOC.Title: Business
DOC.TEXT: A powerful bigeye that became the center of the city national union called Yin, or Yin.

DOC.Title: Zhengzhou Castle
DOC.TEXT: Miyakonojo found in 1950. It is considered to be the capital of Mid-Year period.

DOC.Title: Yin Ru
DOC.TEXT: The ruins of the capital of the late period of the Yin dynasty, centered on Xinyang Xiaotun village in Henan province. In 1899, the skull script was discovered, excavation advanced in 1928 to 37 years and after 1950. The tombs and dwelling traces of the murdered animals from the surroundings of the palace were discovered, and a large number of such as bones, bronze ware, ivory work, white porcelain, petrel, shellfish, etc. were excavated.

DOC.Title: Torso character
DOC.TEXT: Characters engraved on tortoise and beast bones excavated from Yin ruins. Because it mainly marks the result of fortunetelling, it is also called a word. It is regarded as a prototype of kanji. Since the discovery in 1899, nearly 3,000 letters were deciphered by nearly half of the studies by King Kwon (1877 ~ 1927) et al.

DOC.Title: Kanemoni
DOC.TEXT: It is an inscription affixed to the bronze ware of the Yin / Zhou Period.

DOC.Title: The Priesthood Politics
DOC.TEXT: Shinto politics. The politics of the ruling coalition that the king makes the result of fortune telling an absolute god and implements agriculture, military, ritual, throne succession etc. based on this. In the ancient society the theocracy is often done, but it was typical of Yin.

DOC.Title: Everyday Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty change theory in China. The theory that the virtuosum will receive the destiny and become a god of a new age. Mencius and others came up. "Surname" is easy for the surname (the name of the dynasty), "Revolution" means that the life of the heavens (sky) is learned. There are two forms of Zen assignment and logging.

DOC.Title: Zen delegation / disintegration
DOC.TEXT: A form of dynasty change that takes peacefully the administration in China is called Zenzu and it is said to take away with armed force. The replacement of å · Shun · Yu is Zen geographical change, replacement of summer · Yin · Zhou is considered to be littering, Zen derision is made the ideal.

DOC.Title: Yin Zhou Revolution
DOC.TEXT: The transition from Yin to Zhou. Because the warriors of Yin went through evil, it was supposed to have moved to Zhou dynasty by the circumference Mu of King who received the life of the Emperor, and it is positioned as a revolution in a logging style.

DOC.Title: Emperor
DOC.TEXT: The god who is responsible for the sky. Also known as Emperor. He was the ruler of the space and human world, became the center of the abstract heavenly thought for Zhou, and the human nature was denied in the Warring States period, which was regarded as the highest principle of the universe.

DOC.Title: Tenshin
DOC.TEXT: The supreme ruler of the dynasty nation who will rule the people by receiving the life of the sky. That name appeared after the West Zhe.

DOC.Title: Zhou
DOC.TEXT: The dynasty occurred in Shaanxi ææ Basin, dominated North China in place of Yin. Beginning 770 years ago, the first half is called West Zhou and the second half is East Zhou.

DOC.Title: Xi Zhou
DOC.TEXT: Zhou of the era when the capital was in Ho Ji. Zhou was affiliated with Yin, but at the time of Mukuo he slashed the King of the Yin (1027 before the one), destroyed Yin. Zhou passed the theocracy while succeeding and developing the culture of Yin, and adopted the feudalism system and dominated North China. In the previous 770 (771 for a review) the capital was captured by the dogs in the west, and it went east to Luo. The rest of the week is called the eastern hour.

DOC.Title: ææ
DOC.TEXT: A river that enters Shaanxi Province into Gansu Province and joins the Yellow River. The basin of the basin was the center of China's ancient history, after Qin · Han, called Seki.

DOC.Title: Hōkyo
DOC.TEXT: Miyako City. Also called Muneaki. Near the current Xi'an city.

DOC.Title: Mukuo
DOC.TEXT: Constructor of Zhou dynasty. Following the father's crown, defeated Yin, achieved unification of the people.

DOC.Title: feudal system
DOC.TEXT: Governing system enforced in Zhou. Kao went to the clans, factions and others to give the land (enclosure) and made it the heresy of the hereditary assassination, and the duty of tribute and military service was burdened. In addition, Zhou King and the princes gave the lords of the vassals, Okio, and masters of their own vassals, imposed similar obligations and placed themselves in their own territory. The master-slave relationship of Zhou is a clan-related relationship centered on blood relations, which is content -different from the master-slave relationship of the Western medieval feudalism system (fudalism) based on individual contracts.

DOC.Title: enclosure
DOC.TEXT: The secretary was delegated the controlling authority as compensation for loyalty, military service, and tribute to the lord.

DOC.Title: Princess
DOC.TEXT: Clans and factions who were given seizure from Zhou King. Depending on the degree of blood relationship with the vicinity room, the size of the enclosure, etc., it was divided into five groups of public, Hou, Eric, child and male.

DOC.Title: Sir, Ooio, å
DOC.TEXT: The revolutionary keeper of Zhou King and the princes. It was a political and military carrier, who was given seizure and dominated farmers.

DOC.Title: Ida system
DOC.TEXT: Land system telling that it was enforced by Zhou. According to "Mencius", the rice field of 900 square ridges is divided into nine equal parts, the surroundings are given to eight houses as surrounding areas, and the central 100 ridges are co-cultivated in eight houses, and the harvest The system that is said to have paid the country as a duty. The actual condition is unknown.

DOC.Title: Religion
DOC.TEXT: Paternal relatives of the same family. It was distinguished between Ojong (the head family) and Kozune (a branch), and united by making the same ritual of the ancestors. Based on the principle of unfamiliar with the same name, it was the foundation of the ruling class of Zhou feudalism system.

DOC.Title: Moral Code
DOC.TEXT: The norm to protect within the family. Rituals of the ancestry centered on the Majong, the inheritance system of the true child, the principle of the same name of the unmarried, the superiority over the King Ozong of the Maedong etc. are the main contents. Emphasized Takashi Takashi.

DOC.Title: Spring Fall / Sengoku Period
DOC.TEXT: An era from the Zhou Dynasty to the unification of Qin. It is a transition period from the collapse of feudalism system to a unified state. Social changes greatly as the princes undertook a divisive conflict, and phenomena such as improvement of productivity, formation of new thought, expansion of Chinese culture sphere were seen. In the early spring and autumn, the princes who counted 200 were the dozens of in the mid-term, the seven in the warring States, and the unification of China by Qin was achieved in the second half of the third century.

DOC.Title: Dog Eel
DOC.TEXT: Different ethnic groups in the northwestern remote boundary of China. In the previous 771 years he capture the capital city of Ho Ji West.

DOC.Title: Luo Yu
DOC.TEXT: City of eastern Zone from 770 ago. Zhou Zhou built for the eastern governance in the Xi Zhou era. Current Luoyang.

DOC.Title: Eastern
DOC.TEXT: After the capital to Luoyu, Zhou until destroyed by Qin. The authority of the Zhou royal family declined, and the ability declined to a small country below the princes.

DOC.Title: Spring and Autumn Era
DOC.TEXT: From the Zhou Dynasty, the period until Sin broke up into Korea · Wei · Zhao and each became independent. Zhou royal family declined, influential princes fought for hegemony with "Hesu Wang Yi". The era name comes from Lu's chronicle "Spring Fall".

DOC.Title: 'Hideou 攘ies'
DOC.TEXT: A slogan that the champion of the spring and autumn era, honoring the Zhou royal family and having invading foreigners (Yi Shi)

DOC.Title: champion
DOC.TEXT: A powerful owner who instructed the alliance (congregation) of the princes with raising "King Hyeosi" in the spring and autumn period.

DOC.Title: Spring and Autumn Five Games
DOC.TEXT: Representative five champions of the spring and autumn era. Qi Wanqing, Shin Jeongkyo, Chu's squirrel, Wu Wang or husband difference, Yue king slavery. There is also a theory that it is a morning call of Qin and Sung, except for Kure · Yue, and there is also a case that it is a difference of Wu Ou husband in place of Chu 's prince king.

DOC.Title: Han Guo
DOC.TEXT: The monarch of the Philippines (685 before 643 before the prime minister). The best guru of the 5th champ of the spring and autumn. By using the abalone fang 's recommendation, we used the bells as the president and promoted the Fukoku militia.

DOC.Title: archives
DOC.TEXT: Jin's prince (636 before 628 before his position). One of the five victories of spring and autumn. After a long exile, he reigned, reigned inner affairs of Zhou, defeated Chu and became a champion.

DOC.Title: Rosor
DOC.TEXT: The lord of Chu (before 613 to before 591). One of the five victories of spring and autumn. I entered Luoyang, then broke Shin and became a champion.

DOC.Title: 穆 公
DOC.TEXT: Principal of Qin (659 before 621 before presence). Promoted the strengthening of Qin.

DOC.Title: Xianggu
DOC.TEXT: The monarch of the Song (651 before 637 before the post). Succeeded to dominate the country, but was defeated by Chu in "Song Song Yong".

DOC.Title: 闔閭
DOC.TEXT: Kure Wang (514 before 496 before his post). Although he broke Chu, he fought and fought Yoshi and was defeated.

DOC.Title: husband difference
DOC.TEXT: Kure Wang (before 495 to 473 before his post). Aspiring for the revenge of the father who had been defeated, he broke the Victory, but succussed himself by losing his counterattack later.

DOC.Title: graciousness
DOC.TEXT: Yue King (before 496 to before 465). Although he broke the invasion of Wu King, he lost the difference by his lord. After that, he tried to make Fukoku Militia and destroyed Wu. The story of "pretentious grueling" is a story of the hardships of revenge of husband difference and grading.

DOC.Title: beef lacquer
DOC.TEXT: Cultivation method that began to catch iron cakes by cattle, which started from the late spring and late spring period. Deep cultivation became possible, agricultural productivity rapidly increased.

DOC.Title: Iron-made farm tools
DOC.TEXT: It appeared in the late spring and spring period. China's iron is not suitable for weapons because it is brittle and cast iron, it was used as an agricultural tool. The use of ferrous agricultural tools made it possible to expand cultivated land by cultivating the land, improve agricultural productivity and conduct a large-scale flood control project.

DOC.Title: shellfish
DOC.TEXT: Child shells used as money in various places until the spring and autumn era, and those that simulated the shape of a petal shell with bones and stones. Numerous shellfish have been excavated from the ruins of the Yin / Zhou Period.

DOC.Title: Bronze Money
DOC.TEXT: Bronze coins issued by large merchants and princes during the late spring and late spring period. The development of agricultural productivity and handicraft industry, and the development of transportation, commerce and cities urged the emergence of money.

DOC.Title: Swiss money, sword coin
DOC.TEXT: Bronze money which simulated a small sword. Mainly in the Warring States Period, it was mainly produced and used in Hebei · Shandong such as Yan · Qi.

DOC.Title: cloth money, clothing
DOC.TEXT: Bronze money that simulated the shape of agricultural tools. It was used in Shanxi and Henan such as Korea · Wei · Zhao etc. from the latter half of the spring and autumn period to the Sengoku period.

DOC.Title: Yen, Qian Qian
DOC.TEXT: Circular bronze coins with holes in the center (circular holes, lateral holes). It was used in Qi, Qin, Wei etc in Warring States Period.

DOC.Title: ants nose
DOC.TEXT: Bronze money used in Chu in the Warring States Period. The table bulges, the back is flat and elliptical, and there is a small hole at one end. It seems to have simulated shellfish, but this name is because uncoded characters (also called patterns) are inscribed and it looks like a combination of the face of an ant and the nose of a demon.

DOC.Title: splitting of Jin
DOC.TEXT: In the previous 453 years, the three houses of Han, Wei, and Zhao divided Jin's national land, and the three houses were recognized as princes by Zhou King in the previous 403 years. From this, the age of warring States began.

DOC.Title: Warring States Period
DOC.TEXT: An era from the division of Jin in the end of the spring and autumn period to the unification of Qin (by Shiba Ko 's "Shogun"). In the era of meritism and Shimoguchi, the authority of the Zhou royal family became inevitable and powerful male publicly called the king, endeavored to expand its own territory and the wealthier men. Also, agricultural productivity has increased due to the spread of iron agricultural tools, commerce and industry became involved, learning and thought also developed. The era name comes from the "Sengoku earthquake".

DOC.Title: Nanoei of Sengoku
DOC.TEXT: The country of the seven major houses in the Warring States Period. Qi · Chu · Yan · Korea · Wei · Zhao · Qin.

DOC.Title: Qi
DOC.TEXT: One of the Nanoe of Sengoku. The vassals of the vassal have been killed after the lord's death. The latter half of the 4th century was the heyday, and thinkers and others of the countries gathered in the city of the capital. It was destroyed by Qin.

DOC.Title: LIBIO
DOC.TEXT: City of Qi. It prospered as the center of economics and academia.

DOC.Title: Chu
DOC.TEXT: One of the Nanoe of Sengoku. Countries since the lap. It occupied the Yangtze River basin, became a champion in the spring and autumn era, and fought with Qi, Shin and Qin throughout the Warring States Period. I have different customs with the Nakahara countries.

DOC.Title: Yan
DOC.TEXT: One of the Nanoe of Sengoku. Countries since the lap. It owned southern part of northeastern China from northern part of Hebei province. The capital is 薊 (near Beijing). It was prosperous at the time of Showa (before 311 to before 279), but it was destroyed by Qin.

DOC.Title: Korea
DOC.TEXT: One of the Nanoe of Sengoku. Although he was a vice president, he was independent with Wei · Zhao and possessed the central part of Henan Province from southern Shanxi province. In the latter part of the 4th century Buddhism of the lawyer worked as a prime minister and was proud of the prosperity, but it was destroyed by Qin.

DOC.Title: Wei
DOC.TEXT: One of the Nanoe of Sengoku. Although he was a vice president, he was independent with Han and Chao, and owned the northern part of Henan Province from southern Shanxi province. Although it became strong in early 4 th century, it was destroyed by Qin.

DOC.Title: Zhao
DOC.TEXT: One of the Nanoe of Sengoku. Although he was a vice president, he was independent with Han and Wei, and owned the northern part of Shanxi Province from the southern part of Hebei Province. The capital is Handan (Hebei Province). Although it became powerful in the first half of the previous 3rd century, it was destroyed by Qin.

DOC.Title: Qin
DOC.TEXT: One of the Nanoe of Sengoku. From the small country of Zhou became the principal meridians at the time of the east train of the 8th century before, possessing Shaanxi province and Sichuan province. In the middle of the 4th century before the reign of Takashi the capital was moved to Xianyang (Shaanxi Province) and became mighty. In the middle of the 3rd century, the perishable world was destroyed, and the government destroyed the other six countries, completing the unification of China.

DOC.Title: 孝 公
DOC.TEXT: Qin Ha (361 before 338 before the race). We tried to make Fukoku Military with business trading, and moved from Yongzhen (Shaanxi Province) to Xianyang.

DOC.Title: Hundreds household
DOC.TEXT: It is a collective term of philosophers and schools that appeared in the Sengoku period since the late spring and autumn period. With the collapse of the old order and the tactics of the principles of power by the wealthy military measures of the people, he preached the reconstruction of the order of the nation and society, the view of the world that survives the world and the process of the world, and it became the source of the Chinese academic thought.

DOC.Title: Confucius
DOC.TEXT: A school that stands in the Tokugawa principle with Confucius as the father. After being handed down to Mencius · Sonko of Warring States era · Since it was regarded as government officials during the Han Hau era, it became orthodox doctrine that supports the despotic system of successive dynasties.

DOC.Title: Confucius
DOC.TEXT: The ancestor of Confucians. People of Lu 's Qufu (Shandong province) in the late spring and fall period. Ideal for Zhou's politics, participated in the reform of the government of Lu, failed and made a tour of the countries. Afterwards, he returned home and devoted himself to classical arrangement and disciples' education, and preached the way of "Masami, Jijiah, Taiwan, Hei Tian," aiming for completion of Jin from the practice of family morality.

DOC.Title: Jin
DOC.TEXT: Confucius' s basic idea. A moral feeling that naturally exists between people. Takashi against his parents and his wife against his brother are the foundation, Confucius said that by practicing this widely, he can maintain the order of the state and society.

DOC.Title: "Thesis"
DOC.TEXT: After Confucius' death, the words of Confucius and Disciples edited by his disciples. One of the four books.

DOC.Title: "Spring fall"
DOC.TEXT: One of the five people. Chronology of Lu in the spring and autumn era. Brief record from 722 to 481 years ago. As Mencius decided to become an editor of Confucius, Confucians sticked to that one phrase and pursued exploration.

DOC.Title: "Shosai"
DOC.TEXT: One of the five people. Before Han it was called "Book", after Han it was called "Era", which was called "Shushi" after the Song Dynasty. A record of the words of the people centered on the king of summer, yin, and circumference from 堯 · Shun. Confucius is supposed to be added later, centering on the records of Zhouzhou relations.

DOC.Title: Mencius
DOC.TEXT: Confucian house in the Warring States Period. A person in Lu's Zou (Shandong province). Inherited the theory of Confucius, furthermore the sexual theory and the reputation of the reputation of the reputation, denying the supremacy and evaluating royal road politics. I tried playing the field such as Qi and Song, but failed, I went back to Japan and devoted himself to my disciples' education. "Mencius" wrote that speech.

DOC.Title: Himawari
DOC.TEXT: Politics govern the people by military force.

DOC.Title: Road politics
DOC.TEXT: Politics govern the people by virtue.

DOC.Title: sexual novel
DOC.TEXT: Mencius's theory. Human nature is good, inferiority is attributed to acquired elements, preaching that everyone can become a saint, Ideal for royal road politics by Jin and Virtue.

DOC.Title: 荀 子
DOC.TEXT: Confucian house at the end of Warring States Period. Zhao's people. Following the theory of Confucius-Emphasized the thanks to Mengko's sexual theory in order to maintain a society's order. He served the Qi and Chu. "Sonko" wrote that speech. Han's non Korean non-Korea was his master.

DOC.Title: gender theory
DOC.TEXT: The theory of Sonko. Because the nature of man is evil, we decided that it is necessary to edify by the reputation set by the saint (monarch) for that correction.

DOC.Title: inkmaker
DOC.TEXT: A school whose origins are Fukiko. Criticizing Confucians, dismissing Confucius Jenn as discrimination love, preaching conglomerates, mergers and injuries, respecting formal pleasures by respecting labor savings. In contest with Confucius during the Warring States Period, it became a matter of time, but it declined since Qin · Han.

DOC.Title: Akiko
DOC.TEXT: From the end of the spring and autumn era, a philosopher in the beginning of the Warring States Period. Father of Inkiya. It is said that he was a man of Lu, served the song. It is 53 "inkko" that conveys the idea of ​​him and his disciple.

DOC.Title: Kanei Ai
