DOC.TEXT: The first Iranian Islamic dynasty in Central Asia. I ruled West Turkistan and told Muslims to this place. It was destroyed by Kara = Han morning.

DOC.Title: Kara = Han morning
DOC.TEXT: Turkish Islamic dynasty in Central Asia. He defeated the Saman morning, dominated the east and west Turkestan, promoted the Turkish Islamization.

DOC.Title: Seljuk morning
DOC.TEXT: The Turkish Islamic dynasty built by a nomad who has emigrated to the Shill River basin. In 1055, he advanced to Baghdad and dominated the West Asian region.

DOC.Title: Holosmor morning
DOC.TEXT: The Turkish Islamic dynasty which came from the Amu River basin. It defeated the Sergquk morning and dominated Iran-Afghanistan.

DOC.Title: Mongolian people
DOC.TEXT: Nomads of Altai living in the Mongolian plateau and its surroundings. Record-wise, the name of Mongolia is said to have appeared in the name of Meng Nen for the first time in the Tang Dynasty. Under Genghis = Han unifying the tribes in the 13th century, the foundation of the biggest empire in history was consolidated.

DOC.Title: Mongol Empire, Mongolia Empire
DOC.TEXT: Empire of the Eurasian Prairie Zone starting with the construction of Genghis = Han. In the latter half of the thirteenth century, it formed the largest area from northeastern China to Russia, but it was divided into the former of the religious powers and the four-handed country (three countries except Ogotai-Han).

DOC.Title: Nyman
DOC.TEXT: Turkish nomads who were in the western part of Mongolian plateau. It was conquered by Genghis = Han in 1204. The son of the chief ran away to Central Asia, deprived West Liao in 1211, became the king, but was destroyed by the Mongolian army in 18 years.

DOC.Title: Kurltai
DOC.TEXT: Meaning of "gathering" in Mongolian language. Mainly on influential people such as aristocrats and warlords, they chose and decided on national important matters such as selection of Han, decision of expedition, issuance of laws and regulations.

DOC.Title: Han, sweat
DOC.TEXT: The title of the monarch in the U.S., Uyghur and Mongolia. Hagan Kagan (perspiration) after flexibility Khaghan has changed. Sometimes it is pronounced as "kan".

DOC.Title: Tempin
DOC.TEXT: The name in front of Genghis = Han 's throne (real name).

DOC.Title: Genghis = Han, Sei Yoshida, Ta Ta
DOC.TEXT: Founder of the Mongol empire (ranking 1206-27). I lost my father early and put it in trouble but then unified all the Mongolian tribes and got the title Genghis Khan in Kurl Thai in 1206. It attacked Xi Xia and gold, conquered Horasm, formed a great state including Central Asia and South Russia. Afterwards, he died of disease on the way of the West Xia expedition.

DOC.Title: Thousand door system
DOC.TEXT: Administrative and military system organized by Genghis Khan. The old family clan system was abolished, the nomads of the whole country were divided into 95 thousand group, it was classified further into one hundred houses and ten houses, and each chief was placed. Each unit doubles as an administrative group and a military group and became the basis of the centralized system of the Mongol empire.

DOC.Title: Holosmor morning
DOC.TEXT: An Islamic state that was built by Turkish guardian of the Serjuke morning, centered around the horror region of the Amu River Basin. In the beginning of the 13th century, I dominated the large area including Iran, but in opposition to Genghis-Han, it was conquered in 1220 and then soon died.

DOC.Title: Toului
DOC.TEXT: Chinggis-Han 's fourth child (youngest child). Following his father, he was active in expedition to gold and westward, and after his father's death, he gave his older brother Ogotai a han position and helped him. I returned home after gold expedition and I died of illness.

DOC.Title: Ogotai-Han, Tajong 矜
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of the second generation of Mongol empire (rank 1229-41). The third child of Genghis-Han. Constructed the capital city of Karakorum, organized the Ekiden system, strengthened domestic policies through population survey and taxation improvement. In 1234, I made a conspiracy and destroyed money, and then let Batu do the westward.

DOC.Title: Karakorumu, Wakabayashi
DOC.TEXT: The capital of the Mongol empire built on the right bank of the Orkhon River in outer Mongolia. From the 2nd generation Ogotai to the 4th generation Monkke era, it was regarded as the capital of the Mongol empire.

DOC.Title: Batu
DOC.TEXT: Chingis = child of the firstborn of Han. As Ogotai-Han's life he served as General Commander of the West Coast Guard (1236-42) and returned home in the report of Ogotai-han disease death. I built Kipchak-Han country with Saray as the capital of South Russia.

DOC.Title: Seiyu, Europe expedition
DOC.TEXT: Ogotai-Han's expedition took place as Batu became commander-in-chief. Invaded South Russia, Hungary, Poland, won the battle of Wallstadt in 1241, threatened Europe, but withdrew with a report of Ogotai-han disease death.

DOC.Title: Battle of Wallstadt, Battle of League Nits
DOC.TEXT: Battle where the Mongolian army broke the German-Polish coalition forces commanded by Schlejen Hou Heinrich (Henrik) in the southeast of Poland's League Nitz (Regnica). The Shrejaj region was devastated, German colonies became tough.

DOC.Title: Monke-Han, Norimune
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of the 4th generation of Mongol empire (rank 1251-59). Firstborn of Tsurui, the youngest child of Genghis = Han. He served in the west coast of Batu and was active. With Batu's support, he thrust to the opposition and strived for internal reunification. We made Fubylai expedite to Tibet, Yunnan, Vietnam, etc. and caused flags to make expeditions to West Asia, destroying the Abbasid Morning. He also advanced Southern Song Dynasty attack, but he was sick in the camp.

DOC.Title: Fubirai Han, Genji
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of the 5th generation of Mongol empire (rank 1260 ~ 94). Chingisu = child of Trulli, the youngest child of Han. He broke Moniku = Han, conquered Daiji and Tibet, and was active in the expedition to the South Song. After the throne took over into the capital of 1264, it was based on the name of the country 71 years. In 1979, the southern Song was destroyed, unifying China, unifying Goryeo and Myanmar (Pagan morning), the original territory became the largest. However, Japan, Vietnam, Javanese expedition failed. In domestic politics, China adopted a government regime and issued a unified currency and set the foundation for China dominance.

DOC.Title: Funtanzawa
DOC.TEXT: A warlord from a Han Chinese. He served Fabirai and made advices on how to rule Han Chinese in the agricultural area of ​​China.

DOC.Title: Great City
DOC.TEXT: Current Beijing. In 1264 Fubirai took over, Mongol empire, became the former capital. It reflects the transition from a nomadic state to a rich agricultural zone to a Chinese state.

DOC.Title: former
DOC.TEXT: After the capital of Fubirai transits to the capital city, it is the country name set in the Chinese style. Mainly in China, Tibetan and Korea were regarded as a country of origin. We have developed a network of the Eurasian continent that connects the land and the sea by improving the Ekiden system and the canal network, centered on the major cities, and has set up a monetary system centered on silver and exchanges. However, it declined due to natural disasters, internal conflicts, popular rebellion, etc., and disappeared from the red clover, followed by Ming Dynasty, followed by Michigan Plateau.

DOC.Title: Dali
DOC.TEXT: After the destruction of Minami Prefecture, the country whom the white barbarian clan was built in Yunnan's Dali. The kingship was weak, and it was destroyed by Fabylais.

DOC.Title: Mangero attack, Genji
DOC.TEXT: The expedition carried out at the life of Fabylai Han. In the role of Bunbunaga in 1274, the former · Goryeo Army invaded former · Koryo · Old Southern Song Army in the role of Hiroyu in 1281, but failed to meet the storm and counterattack twice.

DOC.Title: Alikubuke
DOC.TEXT: Brother Fubirai = Han's brother. In opposition to Fubirai-Han 's throne, he throne with Karakorum, fought against Fabylai, but surrendered in 1264.

DOC.Title: Hydu
DOC.TEXT: Ogotai-grandson of Han. In opposition to Fubirai Han 's throne, it caused a revolt.

DOC.Title: Hydu's Random
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion Haidu opposed to Fubirai Han 's cadence. Haidu rebelled against Fubirai's brother Arikubuke, who fought against Fubirai 's brother, against the fact that the throne of Monke-Han, Fabirai Han and the Truyi continued after the 3rd generation Guyuk-Han. Even after Alibukuke surrendered, Haidu continued to defend with allied countries of Kipchak and Chagatai, and the turbulence lasted about 40 years.

DOC.Title: Ogotai = Han Country
DOC.TEXT: Ogotai and its descendants built in the current Jungalia region. Emi is the capital. Hydu of the 4th allied with Kipchak · Chagatai Han Country and rebelled against the former. After that, it was annexed to Chagatai Han country. There was also the theory that the country actually did not exist because Ogotai group forces existed but it did not become a stable political force.

DOC.Title: Chagatai-Han Country
DOC.TEXT: A state built by Chagatai from Ali river to the Sir River with Almálik as the capital. It became Islam in the 14th century. It split in the east and west in the middle of the 14th century and Timur began to emerge from Western Chagatai-Han kingdom.

DOC.Title: Kipchak = Han country
DOC.TEXT: Batu went back to the west coast, a state built in South Russia. Sarai is the capital. Among the Han countries, Islamization progressed at the earliest, reaching the heyday in the 14th century. It collapsed after independence of the Grand Duchy of Moscow.

DOC.Title: Saray
DOC.TEXT: Kipchak = Capital of Han country. Former Sarai was downstream of the Volga River, and New Sarai was upstream. When Uzbek = Han, I went to New Sarai.

DOC.Title: Uzbek Han
DOC.TEXT: Kipchak-Han of the Han dynasty period (Hanshin 1313-40). Adopted Islamist and maintained a friendly relationship with the Mamluk and Byzantine Empires.

DOC.Title: flag
DOC.TEXT: The third child of Tingui, the youngest child of Genghis = Han. The expedition to West Asia by the older brother Monke-Han 's life, occupied Baghdad in 1258 and destroyed the Abbasid Morning. I ruled the province of Iran, built Il Han country.

DOC.Title: Il = Han Country
DOC.TEXT: Country that the flag dominated the Iranian province. The capital is Tabriz. Keeping friendship with the former Morning, confronted Kipchak · Chagatai both countries. The seventh generation Gazan Han endeavored to centralize the central government, converted to Islamistic beliefs of the residents, and made it this state religion.

DOC.Title: Tabriz
DOC.TEXT: The capital city of Il Han country. The current capital of northwestern Iran, East Azerbaijan province.

DOC.Title: Gazan = Han
DOC.TEXT: The 7th Han of Il Han country (ranking from 1295 to 1304). In 1295 I converted to Muslimism as a state religion, and harmonized with Mongolian Muslims and Iranian inhabitants. I appointed the Iranian Rashid = Aedin, striving to stabilize domestic affairs, such as adopting the lecture system and establishing a taxation system centered on the land tax. Encouraged academics and matured Iran-Islamic culture.

DOC.Title: Rashid = Aedin, Rashidudiden
DOC.TEXT: Iranian politician and historian of Il Han country. Although he was the premier minister of Gazan-Han, he was convicted of death by a conspiracy. The book "collection" is regarded as an important historical material.

DOC.Title: "History"
DOC.TEXT: Early in the 14th century, Rasheed = Audine's history book written in Persian. Although a part has not been discovered, the history of Mongolia in Volume 1 is regarded as an important historical material to know the history of the Mongol empire.

DOC.Title: Mongolian first principle
DOC.TEXT: The principle of the original Chinese rule. The Mongolian monopolized the heads of the central government and the chief administrative agencies of local administrations, and strictened the order of the owls, Han people, South people. However, in the hypothesis, a policy different from the traditional Chinese dynasty, such as disregard of the enumeration (Confucianism), was taken, but discrimination against South people etc. was not done much.

DOC.Title: Homo person
DOC.TEXT: Abbreviation for various color people (meaning of people belonging to various races). It refers to various ethnic groups originating mainly from Central Asia and West Asia, which was heavily used next to Mongolian people, and was active in finance and culture as a high-level bureaucracy.

DOC.Title: Han Chinese
DOC.TEXT: It is a collective term of residents under the rule of the old Kin Dynasty (Huaihe River North). It consists of Huaihe northernmost Han people, Khitan man · Masato · Goryei · Bohai people.

DOC.Title: South Man
DOC.TEXT: Inhabitants of Gangnam under the rule of former south song. Originally it was placed in the order of Mongolian, Hanami, Han Chinese, South Korean, in order, and became the main agent of tax together with Han people.

DOC.Title: Completion
DOC.TEXT: In the Mongolian first principle, I felt coldly of Mr. Okio of Han Tribe and stopped the initial examination. Although it revived in 1313 of the fourth generation Junjong who showed an understanding of Chinese culture, it was advantageous for Mongolian and eyelid people, disadvantageous for Han / South. It was conducted in a three-tier system consisting of the village examination / examination session (Song province trial) · Temple test.

DOC.Title: Grand Canal
DOC.TEXT: Fubirai repaired the Grand Canal since the early days and built a new canal leading to the capital. In addition, the shipping from the Yangtze River to the Shandong peninsula to the Okinawa area became irreplaceable, and the major city developed as the center of land and sea transport throughout the Eurasian Continent.

DOC.Title: Ekiden system
DOC.TEXT: Transportation system developed in the original. In Mongolia it is called jamchi (log red). Genghis = Han was founded, the Taezong wing was institutionalized, complete with the former morning. We set up a station (station) every 10 rt on the main road, set 100 residences in the city as a stationo, and put the responsible person to provide the tourist with horses and food. For this reason, traffic in a vast area became convenient, and it helped to exchange East-West culture.

DOC.Title: Tale, tiles
DOC.TEXT: Certificate carried by official traveler. Originally developed with the development of the Ekiden system, there are kinds such as gold tiles, silver tiles, copper tiles, iron tiles, wood tiles, etc. It was used properly by travelers and travel purposes.

DOC.Title: Hangzhou
DOC.TEXT: Harbor City developed to South Song · Yuan period. Marco Polo introduced to Europe in the name of the quince.

DOC.Title: Mingzhou
DOC.TEXT: Current Ningbo. Developed to Tang · Yuan period, a Japanese trade boat arrived.

DOC.Title: Quanzhou
DOC.TEXT: Port city of Fujian Province. It developed to Tang · Song · Motoyo, and Marko-Polo called Zayton, introduced it as the world's first trade port.

DOC.Title: Guangzhou
DOC.TEXT: The harbor city of the Pearl River estuary. It developed to Tang · Song · Yuan period. Marco = Polo called Kung Fu.

DOC.Title: intercourse
DOC.TEXT: Gold noodle bill. Although it circulated widely with silver, it was later overwhelmed, causing economic confusion.

DOC.Title: White lotus teacher
DOC.TEXT: Private Buddhist religious association born from Amitabha faith. It is said that it starts in Southern Song Dynasty and was forbidden as an evil spirit from the end of the southern Song dynasty by the increase of the Epistle. There were many poor people in the Epistle, Maitreyusha faith that Maitreya Buddha appeared to be saved in order to save it, became the center of the disaster of the original red claw.

DOC.Title: Maitreya Buddha
DOC.TEXT: Buddha in the future who is supposed to emerge due to sentient being in this world after 5.67 billion years. That faith combined with the long-awaited savior, often became a philosophy of Chinese peasant rebellion.

DOC.Title: Rannist's Ran, White Lotus Chaos
DOC.TEXT: Farmers' rebellion centered on religious associations such as White Lotus teacher at the end of the year. A red hood was marked. The Han River planned a revolt by fellows raised by the Huang River flood control project in Miroku student's theory, but since it was discovered before and killed, the child Han Lin had guided and developed into a large farmers rebellion .

DOC.Title: "Peace of Tatar"
DOC.TEXT: It refers to the political stability of the 13th-14th century brought about by the formation of the Mongol empire to nearly the majority of the Eurasian continent. "Tatar" in this case means the Mongolians. As a result, transportation and trade between the former and each Han-ku area became tricky, and the East-West exchange of economic and cultural progress advanced.

DOC.Title: Plano = Carpini
DOC.TEXT: Franciscan monks from Italy. It was dedicated to Mongolian reconnaissance and missionary work, and was dispatched in 1245 with the life of Pope Innocentius IV. I handed the letter to Guyuk Han who was near Karakoram and returned to my home country in 1247. The report is regarded as an important historical material together with Lubruk's travel notes.

DOC.Title: Lubruck
DOC.TEXT: Franciscan monks from France. In the lives of King Louis IX of France, it was dispatched in 1253 for the cooperation request to the Islamic Crusade and Christianity propagation. I met Monka Han at Karakorum in 54 years and returned home 55 years. I left valuable travelogues.

DOC.Title: Marko-Polo
DOC.TEXT: A merchant / traveler from Venice, Italy. Departing in accordance with my father / uncle in 1271, I arrived in the capital 75 years via Central Asia. He served Fabylai for the next 17 years, departed from Quanzhou in 1990, returned to China in 1995 after passing through Il-Han County. In 1996 he was caught in Genoa and dictated "the description of the world" in prison.

DOC.Title: "Description of the world", "Oriental visit"
DOC.TEXT: A travelogue by Marco Polo. It was written by Rusciano about travel talks dated in Genoese prison from 1296 to 1998 and was completed around 1999. I described the central Asia, China and South Sea in the 13th century in detail, and introduced Japan as Zipang. It increased the interest of Western people toward the eastern side.

DOC.Title: Monte-Corvino
DOC.TEXT: Franciscan monks from Italy. I arrived in Oita in 1294 after passing through Il Han County as a pontificate of the Pope. It was appointed Archbishop of Great City, became China 's first Catholic missionary. I was sick in the majority.

DOC.Title: Marinjori
DOC.TEXT: Franciscan monks from Italy. I arrived at the capital of 1342 as an envoy of the pope. After returning to Japan after staying for about 4 years, I wrote his experiences.

DOC.Title: Ibn = Batuta
DOC.TEXT: I am from Morocco. A Muslim traveler. I departed from Mecca pilgrimage in 1325, traveled to West Asia, Central Asia, India, Sumatra, China and returned to Japan in 1949. Then traveled from the Iberian Peninsula to sub-Saharan Africa. I wrote a journal entitled "The Three Continents Tour".

DOC.Title: Mongolian
DOC.TEXT: It belongs to the Altai language. Mongolian empire, the official language of Yuan dynasty.

DOC.Title: Mongolian letter
DOC.TEXT: Characters created to write Mongolian with the Uygur as the base. Since Genghis = Han, I borrowed Uighur letters in public documents, but some reworking was added, and classical Mongolian letters were made. Tibetan passpa letters were enacted in 1269 in Fubirai-Han, but Paspa letters gradually became rituals, and in general Uyghur Mongolian letters revived and spread.

DOC.Title: Uygur character
DOC.TEXT: Arama character, directly derived from the sogged character. Based on this, Genghis = Han made Mongolian letters and was generally used.

DOC.Title: Pass, Paka
DOC.TEXT: Tibetan Buddhist sacred school pope. In 1260, he became a national teacher (teacher) with the life of Fabylai and was given the former morning Buddhist administrative authority. I made a pass character.

DOC.Title: Pass character
DOC.TEXT: A letter created based on the Tibetan letter for Paspa to photograph the Mongolian language with the life of Fabylai = Han. It was enacted in 1269, it was used for official documents, but it was not popular in general.

DOC.Title: Tibetan Buddhism, Lamma
DOC.TEXT: Mahayana Buddhism established in Tibet. Originally, Fubirai greeted Paspa as a national master, so Tibetan Buddhism prospered greatly in Yuan dynasty. It also became part of the financial difficulties of the former end.

DOC.Title: Guo Mamoru
DOC.TEXT: The original scientist. He was able to communicate with the number of astronomical calendars, Mizushi, and served in Fubirai = Han and he was active in waterwork construction at the beginning. Afterwards I was ordered to revise the calendar law to create a calendar.

DOC.Title: Time calendar
DOC.TEXT: A calendar that was created by Takashi Guo, who was stimulated by Islamic astronomy in 1280. Yinyun calendar with 365 2425 days as a year. It was distributed in 1281. It affected the Ming Dynasty calendar and the Japanese Chadashi era in the Edo period.

DOC.Title: Chadahiro
DOC.TEXT: In the Edo period in Japan, the calendar that astronomer Shibukawa Haruhi made based on the sunset calendar. It was adopted in 1685, and it was used until 72 (Meiji 5) year after correction in 1842.

DOC.Title: round gun
DOC.TEXT: A stone thrower manufactured by a Persian who served Fabylai. It was used as a siege weapon and demonstrated its power to conquer the original Southern Song. It is also called Xiangyang.

DOC.Title: dyeing
DOC.TEXT: Pottery made with cobalt blue on white porcelain. Pigment cobalt came from the Islamic world. It was the principal export item with ceramics representing the original.

DOC.Title: Original Song, Play
DOC.TEXT: Classical drama which began with Song and was completed by original. In the opera composed of 4 acts, lyrics and speech also took a new literary style of colloquialism. Approximately 300 screens remain. What is developed mainly in the big city is called the northern song, and what happened in Gangnam is called South Song.

DOC.Title: "Saikosha"
DOC.TEXT: A representative piece of the original song. Fuwa Ohmi. A male / female love story pierced on the feudal pressure of the upper society. It is a story made of the tale of the gold fee based on the novel of Tang dynasty.

DOC.Title: "Han Kan-ku"
DOC.TEXT: Representative masterpiece of the original song. Horse myths work. A dramatized tragedy of Wang Shao, a palace woman from the Han, married to a fool.

DOC.Title: "Biwa"
DOC.TEXT: A masterpiece of the southern music of Yuan Sweet (Tenchi). Masanori Makoto. 42 The act. A story that husbands who live a glorious life after their career advancement and contrast the hardships of their wives left at home and finally meet again.

DOC.Title: "Water Margin"
DOC.TEXT: Representative long novel of China. The original stories of the private story were summarized, and the Ming Dynasty was completed. A monumental story about 108 ruthless people of justice who was active as a base for Liangyama stay at the end of North Song.

DOC.Title: "Journey to the West"
DOC.TEXT: Representative long novel of China. It is said that the subject of Indian tour of Xuanxi was the subject, completed in the middle term of Ming, by Kure God.

DOC.Title: "Three Kingdoms award"
DOC.TEXT: Representative historical novel in China. The theme of the hero of the Three Kingdoms period · the mastery of the exquisite mastery, the prototype was established in the original generation. In the end of the era was Rajun-ka Taisei, was published in the Ming Dynasty.

DOC.Title: Mr. Zhao Meng, Zhao Zi Tong
DOC.TEXT: A calligrapher / painter who served the origin. The royal family of Song. The book is regarded as the leading authority of Orthodox founding the Wang Yonoyo tradition, and the painting is said to have revived the literary paintings and opened the way to the four principal residents.

DOC.Title: Yellow Demi
DOC.TEXT: A literary artist at the end of the year. One of the four major houses. Excellent for the painting of the mountain water, it had a great influence on future generations.

DOC.Title: 倪瓚
DOC.TEXT: A literary artist at the end of the year. One of the four major houses. I drew a unique mountain water painting.

DOC.Title: Kure Town
DOC.TEXT: A literary artist at the end of the year. One of the four major houses. It was excellent in the waterfall painting.

DOC.Title: Wang Meng
DOC.TEXT: A literary artist at the end of the year. One of the four major houses. It is an ex-grandchild of Mr. Zhao Meng and is regarded as an Owner of the Namdong.

DOC.Title: Miniature, fine detail
DOC.TEXT: Illustrations of books and precise paintings drawn on decoration. Idol worship was forbidden in the Islamic world, but the influence of Chinese paintings was transmitted to the Islamic world and developed by the formation of the 13th century Il-Han country. After that, even in the Timur Dynasty and the Ottoman Empire, it became irrepressible and developed to the highest degree in the Mughal Empire.

DOC.Title: Chen Dynasty
DOC.TEXT: It is the dynasty of Vietnam after Lee morning. In the latter half of the 13th century I fought back the invasion of the Mongolian army three times and fought with Champa. Administrative system · Buddhism culture developed, the character of character was started to be used. It was destroyed by the clan revolting.

DOC.Title: Character, Tunom
DOC.TEXT: In the era of Chen Morning, letters made based on Kanji. It has declined since France was established in the 19th century.

DOC.Title: "Okoshi Shiki"
DOC.TEXT: History of Vietnam. It was compiled by Lee Myung-bong at the life of the Taejong Chen dynasty and described the history from Minamikoshi to Lee morning, completed in 1272.

DOC.Title: Hu Dynasty
DOC.TEXT: Short term dynasty established in Vietnam on behalf of Chen Morning. We encouraged the use of letters and tried to prepare a bureaucracy by adopting a ceremony.

DOC.Title: Thai
DOC.TEXT: Central Thai ethnic groups. By the invasion of Mongolia in the 13th century, he immigrated from the southern part of China to the Indochina Peninsula, massively merged with indigenous peoples and formed a nation.

DOC.Title: Sukhothai Morning
DOC.TEXT: A small dynasty of Thai independence built from the Khmer (Angkor morning), mainly in Sukhothai in northern Thailand. The capital is Sukhothai. At the end of the 13th century, the era of King Ramkhamhaen was at its height, the Buddhist division set in the upper rank Buddhism. It declined later, it was subordinate to the Ayutthaya morning in the mid-15th century.

DOC.Title: Ramkhamhaen
DOC.TEXT: The Sukhothai dynasty's third generation king (about 1275 to around 99/1317). It is the king of the heyday, expanding its influential sphere to the Malay Peninsula, incorporating Buddhist divination into the national religion, and making Thai letters.

DOC.Title: Thai character, Siamese character
DOC.TEXT: King Ramkhamhaen modified by modifying the Cambodian character (Khmer letter). Origin of modern Thai characters.

DOC.Title: Ayutaya Morning
DOC.TEXT: A Thai dynasty established after the encore of the Sukhothai morning, breaking the encore morning. The capital is Ayutaya. It became a typical port city state which exclusively manages ocean trade from the South China Sea to the Indian Ocean and exports of rice and wood produced in the hinterland, and dominated the largest territory of Thai history in the 17th century. It is also known that not only neighboring countries but also western countries have formed active diplomatic and trade relations. It declined in the invasion of Tung Dynasty and was destroyed in the morning of Conborg.

DOC.Title: Myanmar, Burma
DOC.TEXT: Regional name / country name centered on the Irawawi River basin. There was a country called China in the Chinese until the 9th century, but the Pagan morning was built as the first unified state in the 11th century. Until 1989 it was called Burma. After that the military regime was renamed Myanmar and became official name, but criticism is also strong. ]

DOC.Title: Pagan morning
DOC.TEXT: Burma (Myanmar) The first unified dynasty. Bagan is the capital. Buddhism culture flourished from Ceylon, incorporating Buddhism in the upper part, but it was destroyed in response to the original invasion.

DOC.Title: Java
DOC.TEXT: The central island of Indonesia. Since the 8th century, the Indian dynasty (Buddhism · Hinduism) dynasty flourished and prospered, but in the 16th century the Islamic Mataram Kingdom was built.

DOC.Title: Morning Singhusari
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty was established in the eastern part of Java by destroying the Kudiri morning. I repelled the original messenger of Fabylai and made the original JAVA expedition.

DOC.Title: Majapahit Kingdom, Majapit Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Kingdom of Hindu established in eastern Java. The 14 th century was at its heyday, the dominant territory covered the whole of Indonesia and part of the Malay Peninsula. It was the last dynasty of Java with Indian culture, and it was destroyed by the expansion of Islamic forces from the late 15th century.

DOC.Title: Koryo
DOC.TEXT: Unification dynasty of Korea following Silla. The capital is Gaeseong. Although it interchanged with Godai and Song and protected and protected Buddhism, in the 12th century, the warrior regime (Choi) was deprived of the real power, in the 13th century it was regarded as a kingdom by the invasion of Mongolia, It became and suffered. Struggled by the invasion of Yao in the end of the 13 th century, it was destroyed by Li Chengli.

DOC.Title: Choi
DOC.TEXT: At the end of the 12th century, the warrior regime established in Goryeo. I held power over the Korean Peninsula for 60 years. However, after 1232 it fought against Mongolian attack, but was defeated in the coup.

DOC.Title: Three separate extract
DOC.TEXT: Another is the army corps organized by the warrior regime (Choi) during the Goryeo period. Although he also played an active role in opposing Mongolian resistance warfare, when Choi collapsed in 1258, Koryo was attached to Mongolia the following year and ordered the dissolution of a separate extract. On the other hand, in 1270-73, the other three corps continued to resist resistance mainly on Jeju Island but was suppressed by the former army and the Goryeo army.

DOC.Title: Kamakura period
DOC.TEXT: An era from Yoshitomi Shigeishi General to take off from Kamakura Shogunate to be knocked down. Genji perished in three generations, and Mr. Hojo later gained power as an authority. In the era of the 8th Hojo era, two times Mongolian attacks (Genji) were blocked.

DOC.Title: Kamakura Culture
DOC.TEXT: Culture flourished during the Kamakura period from the end of the 12 th century to the beginning of the 14 th century. Based on Kyoto 's public home culture, the culture cultivated by the emerging Samurai forces of Dongkok province was added, and furthermore the influence of Chinese culture such as Zen Buddhism was added and it was established.

DOC.Title: Zen sect
DOC.TEXT: A faction of Buddhism trying to achieve enlightenment by zazen. From Southern Song Dynasty, Eiyu told Rinzai sect, Dogen told Soto Denju, spreading mainly around bamboos.

DOC.Title: Jodo sect
DOC.TEXT: Buddhist denominations that it is possible to go to the best possible way by concentrating Nembutsu. Founder is legal. Popularized mainly around aristocrats and samurai.

DOC.Title: Jodo Shinshu
DOC.TEXT: In pursuit of faith alone in my mind, I emphasized absolutely other power to sink into Amitabha Nyorai 's power. The founder is surprised. It was popularized mainly by samurai and farmers.

DOC.Title: Nichiren sect
DOC.TEXT: It tells us that we can be saved by fulfilling the subject of "Lotus Sutra", "Southern Heroes Lotus Sutra". Founder is Nichiren. Initially sustained by samurai of the eastern province, spread to the commercial and traders of Kyoto in the Muromachi period.

DOC.Title: Mangero attack, Genji, role of Bunenaga / Hiroyasu
DOC.TEXT: Twice the original Japanese attack on 1274 (Fumiya 11) and 1281 (Kei 4) years. Both failed.

DOC.Title: Islamic world
DOC.TEXT: Islamist faith refers to an area where social meaning is significant. It was originally formed in the Arabian Peninsula, where Islamism was established in the 7th century, and rapidly expanded to Western Asia, North Africa and the Iberian Peninsula in the 8th century. After that it has also spread to Central Asia, Southeast Asia, sub-Saharan Africa, and it has reached today. While sharing many cultures centered on the teachings of Islam, centered on the "Koran", they also show diverse forms by fusing with the indigenous cultures of various places.

DOC.Title: Arabian Peninsula
DOC.TEXT: A major peninsula in southwest Asia. Most of inland areas are occupied by deserts, with cities scattered along the Red Sea, the Indian Ocean and the Persian Gulf. The inhabitants are mainly based on Semeseese ethnic groups.

DOC.Title: Arab people
DOC.TEXT: Aborigines of the Arabian Peninsula, whose native language is Semese Arabic. It expanded toward West Asia and North Africa through conquest activities that began with the unification of Muhammad early in the seventh century.

DOC.Title: Bedouin
DOC.TEXT: Generic name of Arabic nomads. Scattered all over West Asia around the Arabian Peninsula, livestock such as sheep and camels, plundering and trade as a living industry. In Arabic, the meaning of "people in the desert (badw)".

DOC.Title: Yemen
DOC.TEXT: Coastal area in the southwestern part of the Arabian Peninsula. There was also rain, agriculture was carried out, and it was also on the sea trade route, so civilization was open long before Islamic scholarship was established.

DOC.Title: Jerhilliya
DOC.TEXT: It refers to the period before the establishment of Islamist. It means the era of "unknown" or "ignorant".

DOC.Title: Hijaz
DOC.TEXT: The Red Sea coastal area of ​​western Arabian Peninsula. Traditional roads connecting Yemen and Syria and Egypt ran from old times, and commercial areas and oasis settlements were scattered.

DOC.Title: Mecca
DOC.TEXT: Islam's largest sacred place. Located in the southern part of the Hijaz. Since ancient times it was known as a religious city (the location of the Temple of Kaaba), a regional commercial city, but since the latter half of the 6th century remote commercialization from Yemen to Syria and Egypt has become a big development and has developed greatly.

DOC.Title: Crish tribe
DOC.TEXT: Arab tribe from Muhammad. In the 5th century I conquered and settled Mecca and acquired the guardian of the Temple of Kaaba. Hassim family and the Umayya family were among the most powerful, divided among many families.

DOC.Title: Temple of Kaaba
DOC.TEXT: A cube in Mecca. Stone statues and holy statues have been stored since ancient times, the center of polytheism religion on the Arabian Peninsula. After Muhammad's Mecca conquest, only the black stone which was embedded in one corner of the wall was left and became the center of Islamic religious belief.

DOC.Title: Herseme family
DOC.TEXT: A leading commercial aristocrat within the Clyas. Muhammad's birthplace. The branch has Ali family and Abbas.

DOC.Title: Muhammad, Mahomet
DOC.TEXT: A prophet and the founder of Islamist. Born from Mr. Crish Tribe Hassim family. After becoming an young child, he became an orphan, later engaged in caravan trading, spreading out his views in various places. In about 610, following the revelation of Allah, he consciously recognized himself as a prophet, emigrated to Medina in 622, and set up Umama (community of faith). Together with believers and others, they conquered activity, conquered Mecca in 630, but died of illness in Medina in 632.

DOC.Title: Prophet
DOC.TEXT: Those who convey the words deposited from God through inspiration. In the "Koran" there are 28 names, of which Judaism Abraham, Moses and Christian Jesus are highly appreciated, Muhammad is said to be "the finest prophet in the end".

DOC.Title: Islamism
DOC.TEXT: Religion that Muhammad originated. One of the world's three major religions. Islam means "absolute obedience to God" in Arabic. Equality in the presence of God was preached, and for the faithful called Muslim, Shikabin (Allah · Tenshi · Scripture <Koran> · Prophet · Next Generation · Belief in Fate) and Five Line (Faith Confessions · Worship · Fasting · Plea Pilgrimage) obligation was imposed.

DOC.Title: Ramadan
DOC.TEXT: Islamic calendar 9th month. It is a fasting moon.

DOC.Title: Allah
DOC.TEXT: The only God of Islam. Allah who created all things is a merciful absolute, its existence is considered to be beyond human reason and its idolatry was severely forbidden.

DOC.Title: Hijra, Theatrical Relations
DOC.TEXT: Case that Muhammad got away from Mecca to Medina, avoiding the persecution of the large merchants of the Claish tribe. This year was considered as the first year of the era of the Islamic calendar.

DOC.Title: Islamic calendar, Hijra calendar
DOC.TEXT: The lunar calendar that the Arabic calendar January 1 (July 16, 622 CE) of January 1 of AD 1 is the year of Hijra done. One year is 354 days, one month is 29 or 30 days, one year does not leave a leap month at 12 months.

DOC.Title: Medina
DOC.TEXT: About 300 km north of Mecca, an oasis city in the middle of Hijaz. The meaning of "the town of the prophet". The old name is Yasuribu. There is a tomb tomb of Muhammad, and it is the second sacred place of Islamism following Mecca. After Muhammad's relocation in 622, it became the base of the match against Mecca, becoming the capital of the Islamic world until 656 death of the third caliph, Isuman's third caliph.

DOC.Title: Umma
DOC.TEXT: Muslim community. After Muhammad emigrated to the Medina, it was established as a community of the Epistle led by him.

DOC.Title: Muslim
DOC.TEXT: About Muslims. Arabic meaning "who dedicated himself to God".

DOC.Title: "Quran", "Quran"
DOC.TEXT: Islamic scriptures. A record of the revelation Muhammad was devoted from Allah. In Arabic meaning "to recite". It was edited to its present shape around 650 in the time of Usman of Third Caliph. There is a big feature in that it includes not only religious but also things to protect in daily life.

DOC.Title: Caliph
DOC.TEXT: Muhammad's successor. Although there was no religious authority to change the doctrine and law that the prophet Muhammad had, he inherited the political and social powers and instructed the Islamic community (Umma). When the political right to Sultan shifted from the 11th century, the caliph became involved only in religious events. Initially it was elected from close relatives of Muhammad, but after the Umayya heredic system was taken.

DOC.Title: Orthodox calif
DOC.TEXT: After the death of Muhammad, the caliphs from the first generation to the fourth generation elected by election system. Four people of Abu = Bakuru Umaru Usuman Ally. During this period, we established the control of the Arabian Peninsula, combined the whole Sasanian territory, and robbed Syria and Egypt from the Byzantine Empire.

DOC.Title: Abu-Bakuru
DOC.TEXT: Muhammad's father-in-law. The first legitimate caliph (ranking 632-634).

DOC.Title: Jihad, Holy War
DOC.TEXT: Battle of Muslims against infidels. It was regarded as an obligation imposed on Muslims in the battle for expansion or defense of the Islamic world. The war dead became a martyr, and it was thought that heaven was promised.

DOC.Title: Missle
DOC.TEXT: Military cities. A city where Arab Muslims migrated and built along with their families to the important base of the conquested place during the establishment and development of the Islamic world. At the same time it developed as a center of consumption life and academics. Representative examples include Iraqi Kufa Basra, Egypt's Hutto, Tunisia's Kila Warn and others.

DOC.Title: Umar
DOC.TEXT: The second caliphate of the second generation (ranking 634-644). He took Syria and Egypt from the Byzantine Empire, defeated Susan morning in the battle of Niehavand and conquered the Iraqi Iranian Plateau. We started collecting regular taxes from conquested areas and promoted organization of Islamic state. I adopted the Islamic calendar.

DOC.Title: Battle of Naha Vand
DOC.TEXT: Battle where the Arab armies destroyed Sasan army in Zagros mountain. The Sasan dynasty collapsed virtually and it was destroyed in 651.

DOC.Title: Ussuman
DOC.TEXT: Third Orthodox Caliph (ranking from 644 to 656). He was from the Umayya family and was dissatisfied with the preferential treatment of family members and was assassinated.

DOC.Title: Ally
DOC.TEXT: Fourth canonical caliph (ranking 656-661). Muhammad's cousin, he became husband of daughter Fatima. While being tapped with Syrian governor Muawiya, the Hawariju faction was assassinated and the orthodox caliphate days ended.

DOC.Title: Hawleyju faction
DOC.TEXT: The sort that people with discontent with Ally made. The meaning of "leaving people". Criticizing that Ally had a compromised attitude in the fight against the Umayya Mooreya, he assassinated Ally.

DOC.Title: Moireya
DOC.TEXT: The Umayyad first caliph (presence 661-680). Governor General Syria from the family of the Klyes tribe. After fighting Ally and Ali, assassinated the caliph and started the Umayya morning.

DOC.Title: Umayya Morning
DOC.TEXT: Mawiya's open dynasty. The capital is damascus. From then on the Umayya came over the caliphs. Established a large empire that dominates the area from northwest India to northern Africa and the Iberian peninsula, conflicts with the Byzantine Empire and the Frank Kingdom. Although it was at the heyday of the fifth generation Abdo-Al-Marik, it declined in the 8th century Abbas family due to the rebellion of Shia and Hawleyju factions who did not recognize the Umayya morning and Mawlie's who increased dissatisfaction.

DOC.Title: Umayya family
DOC.TEXT: It is a prestigious family line with the Hersheem family in the Crish tribe.

DOC.Title: West Goat Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The Germanic kingdom in Iberia Peninsula. It was destroyed by the Umayya family in 711, after which the Iberian Peninsula entered under the control of the Islamic influence.

DOC.Title: Arab Empire
DOC.TEXT: The name of the Orthodox caliph and the Umayyad era where the Arabs dominated other peoples as a privileged ruling party.

DOC.Title: Damascus
DOC.TEXT: Central city of Syria. It was occupied by Muslims in 635, then became the capital of Umayya, prospering as the center of politics and economics.

DOC.Title: Battle between Tours and Poitiers
DOC.TEXT: The Umayya army who advanced from the Iberian Peninsula to the Frank Territory was a battle that lost to Frank Army commanded by Carl-Martel. Since then, Muslims and Christians confronted the Pyrenees Mountains.

DOC.Title: People of the Book
DOC.TEXT: Designation for Jews and Christians with Scriptures such as the Bible. Because Muhammad admitted both prophets as a prophet ahead of him (however, it is said that he misunderstood God's revelation), it was given preferential treatment to other heathens and faith of Jizuya subject to payment Maintained the maintenance. Zoroastrians and Buddhists also received the same treatment as the people of the Scripture since the Orthodox Caliphate Period.

DOC.Title: Jizuya
DOC.TEXT: Personal head tax. Initially it was imposed on the people of the Book, but since the Orthodox caliphate it was expanded to the heathens of the conquested place.

DOC.Title: Harage
DOC.TEXT: Land tax in the Islamic world. The second caliph of Umar began to collect from the people of the conquested place. As the Arab conquest expanded to the agricultural zone, it became a major part of the empire's financial resources. Originally, even if the inhabitants of the conquest ground converted to Islamistic, they did not exempt it, but in the late Umayya morning, they were also subject to Arab muslims. In the Abbasid morning it took over this policy and adopted a policy to resolve the inequality between Arab and non Arab.

DOC.Title: Mowery
DOC.TEXT: Non-Arab Muslim converts. The Umayya era was discriminated against Arabic Muslims in terms of atar and tax burden, dissatisfaction with it was a factor in the dying of the Umayya morning.

DOC.Title: Jinmy, Zin Me
DOC.TEXT: The meaning of asylum. Those who did not convert even after conquest by Islamic forces. By paying additional taxes such as Jizuya, we guaranteed faith, life, wealth and autonomous living.

DOC.Title: Shiite
DOC.TEXT: A sect of Islamism that recognizes only Ally and its descendants as Muhammad's legitimate successor. Currently, it accounts for almost 10% of Muslims. Meaning means Shi'aarie ('faction' to support Ally). Afterwards, it was divided into extremists like the Ismailians, moderates like the twelve Imams, but today the latter is the majority.

DOC.Title: Ismailer faction
DOC.TEXT: Shi'a sect. It was extremely Shiite and fiercely opposed to the Sunnis school. In Fatima morning it was regarded as state religion. Around the 11th century, the assassination sects broke away from this.

DOC.Title: Twelve Imam faction
DOC.TEXT: Moderate in major denominations within Shi'a. In Safavid Morning it was regarded as a state religion and became the principle of the Iran-Islamic revolution of the 20th century.

DOC.Title: Imam
DOC.TEXT: Leaders in the Islamic world. Especially in Shi'a, it was used as the title of the highest leader after Ally.

DOC.Title: Sunni school, Sunnie school
DOC.TEXT: A majority of Islamist who admits the caliph as a regular caliber. In the sense that it follows Sunnah (the word of Muhammad), he called himself orthodox.

DOC.Title: Islamic Empire
DOC.TEXT: The Muslim empire. In general it refers to the period from the Orthodox Caliphate until the Abbasid Dynasty, but in some cases it also refers to the Abbasid era when the Arabs' privilege was abolished and Muslim's equality was realized.

DOC.Title: Abbas home
DOC.TEXT: A family of Haciem family in Mecca. Al-Abbas gradually gained power from where he was Muhammad 's uncle, its descendant Abu-al-Abbas beat the Umayya Morning and built the Abbasid Morning.

DOC.Title: Al = Abbas
DOC.TEXT: Muhammad's uncle.

DOC.Title: Horace Saen
DOC.TEXT: Region in the northeastern part of Iran. It became the base of Umayya falling exercise by the Abbas family. After that, it became an important area even in the Ghazna morning and Seljuk era era, for example.

DOC.Title: Abbasid Morning
DOC.TEXT: Islamic dynasty where the Abbas family Abu-Al-Abbas opened. Although it was built by making use of complaints of radical Shia and non-Arab converts, it subsequently suppressed Shi'a and protected the majority 's Sunnis. Eliminating the privilege on the tax collection side of the Arabs, realizing equality among Muslims, and converting from the Arab Empire to the Islamic Empire. After the second Mansur, the capital was almost placed in Baghdad. The bureaucratic system of centralized authority has been established to reach the heyday from the second half of the 8th century to the beginning of the 9th century but it was politically disintegrated and weakened and it was destroyed in the western conquest of the 13th century flag.

DOC.Title: Battle on the bank of the Taras
DOC.TEXT: Battle where the Abbas army won the Chinese Tang army in the Taras River in northern central Asia. It is said that the papermaking method was transmitted to the Islamic world at this time.

DOC.Title: Mansur
DOC.TEXT: Abbasid second caliph (rank 754 to 775). Establishment of the administrative organization to establish a centralized regime, will be regarded as a real builder in the Abbasid morning. In 762 I built a new capital Baghdad.

DOC.Title: Baghdad
DOC.TEXT: The city of Abbasid. A circular city built in the Tigris Midstream. It prospers as the political, economic and cultural center of the Islamic world, and it is said that the population reaches 1.5 million at the peak.

DOC.Title: Haruhn-Alla Seed
DOC.TEXT: Abbasid fifth caliph (ranking from 786 to 809). Encouraged academics, and emerged the golden age of Islamic culture. It is also known as a character of "One Night One Night Story".

DOC.Title: Wazir
DOC.TEXT: The Prime Minister of Abbasid. Originally, he was a representative of Caliph, but after that he began to govern the general affairs in general.

DOC.Title: Zanju's Ran
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that Alie-Ben Muhammad involved the black guy called Zanju. Temporarily dominated the southern Iraq, took over the Kingdom of Zanju and upset Abbasid morning, but was flattened in 883.

DOC.Title: After Umayya
DOC.TEXT: The Umayya family climbed to the Iberian Peninsula, the dynasty built against the upper morning. The Islamic Empire became the first political division. The time of Abdul Al-Human III in the 10th century was at its best, but then declined with internal conflict, the Islamic minor dynasties were divided and destroyed.

DOC.Title: Cordoba
DOC.TEXT: A city in the southern part of the Iberian Peninsula. It was regarded as the capital city of Umayya in the morning and became the center of politics, economics and culture of the West Islamic world.

DOC.Title: Abdul-Al-Fahman III
DOC.TEXT: After Umayya 8th prince (ranking 912 to 961). Encouraged academic arts, and emerged the heyday of the Islamic culture of the Iberian Peninsula. In opposition to Fatimid morning, in lieu of Amir in 929 the title of the caliphate was used.

DOC.Title: Amir, Governor General
DOC.TEXT: Arabic meaning military commander and governor. With the decline of the Abbasid morning, self-reliance in rural areas, some that created a military regime appeared.

DOC.Title: Toornone morning
DOC.TEXT: The Egyptian Governor General of the Abbasid (Amir) Ibn T'Orun, the dynasty built autonomously.

DOC.Title: Safar morning
DOC.TEXT: Islamic dynasty where Yaquop = Bunrice came to independence from Tahir morning and founded. It was destroyed in the Thurman morning.

DOC.Title: Morning Thurman
DOC.TEXT: Iranian Islamic dynasty continued in the morning Safar. It dominated eastern Iran from Central Asia and played de facto independence from the Abbasid Morning. Commercial cities such as Bukhara Samarkand Merve under control prospered in East-West trade, but it was destroyed by the end of the 10th century Kara-Han morning.

DOC.Title: Bukhara
DOC.TEXT: City of the Thurman morning after 900 years. His fellowship flourished as a center of Iran-Islamic culture.

DOC.Title: IDLEASE Morning
DOC.TEXT: The Shiite dynasty built in Morocco.

DOC.Title: Faty morning
DOC.TEXT: The dynasty that the Ismailians of extremist Shi'aism founded in Tunisia. From the beginning he called the caliph and conflicted with the Umayya morning after Abbasid. After 969, Ruled Egypt · Syria, built a new city Cairo. In the late 12th century, Saladin destroyed it.

DOC.Title: Cairo
DOC.TEXT: A new capital built in the 10th century by Fatima Morning conquered Egypt. Later developed greatly and became the center of Islamic culture in lieu of Baghdad.

DOC.Title: Azhar Academy
DOC.TEXT: The Ismailians' college (Madrasa) that was founded in Cairo during the Fatimid era. After that it became the center of the Sunni school theology during the Ayyub era era, after that he retained the authority of the highest academic department of Islam theology / law.

DOC.Title: BOOFF Morning
DOC.TEXT: Iranian Shiite military regime. Since entering Baghdad in 946, he was given the authority to enforce the Islamic Law appointed as a big Amir from Caliph, so Abbasid became a nominal existence. It was destroyed in the morning of Seljuk in the middle of the 11th century.

DOC.Title: Large Amir
DOC.TEXT: Title of the person who was granted the military leadership / governance right of all Islamic worlds by the caliph. With this installation, the leader of the Abbasid caliph became the nominal only.

DOC.Title: Seljuk morning
DOC.TEXT: The Turkish Sunnis dynasty from Central Asia. In the middle of the 11th century Tugrill = Beck entered Baghdad to defeat the Bieif morning and received the title of Sultan from the Abbasid caliph. It is said that crusaders became the origin of the Crusader by suppressing the whole of West Asia, entering Asia Minor and pressing the Byzantine Empire. In internal conflict it split into four small dynasties.

DOC.Title: Nicherpool
DOC.TEXT: Eastern Iran, a city in the Horacean region. Seljuk morning conquered, prospering as its central city.

DOC.Title: Tugrill = Bek
DOC.TEXT: Founder of Seljuk in the morning (residence 1038-63). In 1055 he entered Baghdad and received a title of Sultan from the Abbasid caliph.

DOC.Title: Sultan
DOC.TEXT: The title of the secular monarchy of the Islamic world. It was first used by Seljuk Morning Tugrill-Baek, which was later used in the Sunni dynasty.

DOC.Title: Nizzarm = Almorque
DOC.TEXT: Iranian prime minister of the Serbuche morning. In addition to maintaining administrative system, military, ictor system, etc., Nizamiya Academy was opened to encourage academic arts, such as the Seljuk morning golden era appeared. It was assassinated by a faction of the Ismailians (assassination sect).

DOC.Title: "Book of Government"
DOC.TEXT: A work written by Nizzarm Almorque, who preached what kind of rule Sultan should govern.

DOC.Title: Malik Shah
DOC.TEXT: Seljuk in the Seljuk morning golden era (ranking from 1072 to 92). The assistance of Nizzarm-Almurk improved the ictor system.

DOC.Title: Alp = Arslan
DOC.TEXT: Seljuk of Seljuk morning (ranking from 1064 to 72). In the Battle of Munich, he defeated the Byzantine army and made a trigger for the inflow of Turkish people into Asia Minor.

DOC.Title: Battle of Mansikert
DOC.TEXT: Battle where the Serjuke army captured Emperor Romanus = Diogenes by breaking the Byzantine army. It was the beginning of the Turkish conquest of Asia Minor.

DOC.Title: Room = Seljuk Morning
DOC.TEXT: The dynastic dynasty which Serguc tribe founded in Asia Minor, by multiplying Mansikert's victory. I left the capital in Nicene, but after Nikaia was robbed of the first crusade, I moved the capital to Konya. Pressured the Byzantine Empire, promoted Turkishization and Islamization of Asia Minor, but it split due to the offensive of Mongolia in the latter half of the 13th century.

DOC.Title: Horasmor morning, Holasm-Shah Dynasty
DOC.TEXT: The dynasty established when the Turkish faction of Sergjuk morning was appointed to the armor of the Am River Horasm. I took Iran away from Seljuk morning, defeated the goal morning and combined Afghanistan. It was captured by Genghis Khan in 1220 and it decreased later.

DOC.Title: Zungi morning
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty that comes to the stream of Seljuk. As an Islamic force, he challenged the first organizational battle against the Crusaders.

DOC.Title: Kara = Han morning
DOC.TEXT: The Turkish first Islamic dynasty which dominated central Asia. It destroyed the Thurman morning in 999, conquered east and west Turkestan, promoted its Islamization. In the middle of the 11th century, it split to the east and west with the Pamir Plateau as the border, and then entered under Seljuk morning and West Liao.

DOC.Title: flag
DOC.TEXT: Genghis = grandson of Han. By the life of my older brother Monke = Han, in 1258 I destroyed the Abbasid morning and built Il Han country.

DOC.Title: Il = Han Country
DOC.TEXT: Mongolian dynasty where the flag founded around Iran. Tabriz and Sultaniya and so on were the capitals.

DOC.Title: Gazan = Han
DOC.TEXT: In the 7th Han of Il-Han country (ranked from 1295 to 1304), Muslim became a state religion immediately after the throne. Afterwards appointed Rashid = Addin to the Prime Minister, introduced an ictor system, emerged the mature period of Iran-Islamic culture.

DOC.Title: Kipchak = Han country
DOC.TEXT: Mongolian country where Batu founded. In the latter half of the thirteenth century, it first became Islam in various Han provinces. During the decline of this Kipchak-Han country, Astrakhan-Han country and Klim-Han country self-sustained, but Islamist inherited to these countries.

DOC.Title: Saladin, Salahu-Affine
DOC.TEXT: Founder of the Ayube morning. It was a Kurdish warrior who served in the Zangee morning, but in 1171 he held independence with the real power of Egypt and built the Ayube morning. In 1187 Jerusalem recovered, the third crusade and fight, its yabu and generosity also became familiar to Europe.

DOC.Title: Kurdish
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic group of Indian-European living in the Kurdistan region that spans the current three countries of Iran, Iraq, and Turkey. It was occupied by Arabs in the 7th-9th centuries and advanced to Islamization.

DOC.Title: Aiyuba Morning
DOC.TEXT: The Sunni dynasty where Saladine was founded. It dominated Egypt · Syria centering on the capital city of Cairo, and it became a crusade. After the death of Saladine, the territory was divided into clans and destroyed in the coup of Mamluk army in 1250.

DOC.Title: Mamluke
DOC.TEXT: A slave / soldier of a Turkish (which may include Slavs, Greeks, etc.). It became the center of the military power of the Islamic dynasties from the 9th to the 19th century.

DOC.Title: Mamluk Morning
DOC.TEXT: The Sunnah dynasty built by military commander from Turkish Mamluk in the Ayube morning. Ruling Egypt-Syria, the capital city of Cairo prospered as the center of international trade. It blocked the invasion of the Mongolian army and eventually fought back the Crusaders, but it was destroyed by the Ottoman Empire in the 16th century.

DOC.Title: Byburusu
DOC.TEXT: Mamluk 's fifth sultan (ranked from 1260 to 77). After the destruction of the Abbasid morning, he became the ally of the Islamic world with a new caliph in Cairo. Fighting back the invasion of the Mongolian army, the military success, such as destroying Crusader forces from Syria, and the Mamluk dynasty's heyday emerged.

DOC.Title: Carlye Merchant
DOC.TEXT: Muslim merchants who played an active role in the protection of the Ayyub and Mamluk mornings during the 11th-15th centuries. It is based in Cairo and Alexandria, connecting the Mediterranean Sea and the Indian Ocean mainly in the Red Sea, monopolizing the spice trade.

DOC.Title: Maghrib
DOC.TEXT: In Arabic meaning "the sunset of the day", the name of the Western Islamic world against the eastern Muslim Islamic world in the eastern part of Egypt. It usually refers to a part of the northern part of Africa, including Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia.

DOC.Title: Berber
DOC.TEXT: Also called Moore. Indigenous people in the Maghrib region. An ethnic group formed mainly by Egyptian languages, mixed with Negro and Semu. Although it entered under Islamic domination since the 7th century, it also resisted, but in the 11th century the Islamicization advanced rapidly.

DOC.Title: Murabito Morning
DOC.TEXT: Islamic dynasty of the Berber people who occurred in Western Sahara. Morocco 's Marrakech was the capital. He advanced to the Kingdom of Ghana and also advanced to the Algeria-Iberian Peninsula. It was destroyed in the Muwahid morning.

DOC.Title: Muwahid morning
DOC.TEXT: The Berber Islamic dynasty. It happened from Morocco to destroy the Murabit morning and dominated Tunisia. It was pushed by the Christian influence of the Iberian Peninsula and retreated.

DOC.Title: Marrakech
DOC.TEXT: Cities in southwest Morocco. It became the capital of Murabito Muwahid Dynasties, prospering in commercial and academic research.

DOC.Title: Nasser Morning
DOC.TEXT: The last Islamic dynasty of the Iberian Peninsula. The capital is Granada. Also called Granada Kingdom. Although it only dominated the narrow area of ​​the peninsula southeast, it protected the arts and left the Alhambra. It was defeated by the Christian forces and was destroyed, and the Islamic rule of the Iberian Peninsula ended.

DOC.Title: National Recovery Campaign, Reconquista
DOC.TEXT: Islamic force destroying movement from the Iberian Peninsula developed by Christian forces. In 1492, the last bases of the Nasr morning Granada went down and was completed.

DOC.Title: Granada
DOC.TEXT: Cities in southern Spain. As the capital of the Nasser Dynasty, it was the last base of Islamic politics, military affairs and culture in Europe, but it fell in 1492.

DOC.Title: Dee Waan
DOC.TEXT: The office of the Islamic state. Beginning as a government office handling the affairs of the at-a-service, after the Umayyan era the number of administrative offices handling various administrative affairs also increased, meaning that also.

DOC.Title: at
DOC.TEXT: Payment paid in cash against military personnel and bureaucrats in the early days of Umayya and Abbasid era. It was paid based on the tax collected from the conquest ground. Since the middle of the 9th century, Carol 's power declined due to the rise of Mamluk soldiers in rural areas and was abolished as tax revenue declined.

DOC.Title: ictor system
DOC.TEXT: A system that gave military personnel and bureaucrats management of land and the right to collect taxes in exchange for their loyalty to the dynasty, which can collect the amount corresponding to that salary (at). As the caliber power declined, the revenue of the state revenue declined and it became impossible to maintain the ath system, the Bwifu morning began. It was further developed by Nizzam-Almurk of Seljuk morning and was adopted even in many subsequent dynasties.

DOC.Title: Muslim Merchant
DOC.TEXT: Muslim merchants. Commercial business has developed especially in the Islamic world, and merchants who were active in the Mediterranean and Indian Oceans not only gained great profits from the trade and spice trading, but also to Muslim missionaries in the Southeast Asia in the east and Africa in the west It played a big role.

DOC.Title: Ghana morning
DOC.TEXT: The Turkish Islamic dynasty where Alpstegin who was Mamluk of the Saman dynasty was built around Ghazna in Afghanistan. Since the end of the 10th century, it has repeatedly invaded India and opened the way for Islamization in India. I also invaded Iran, protecting Iranian literature, but was destroyed in the Serjuke morning and the goal morning.

DOC.Title: Goal morning
DOC.TEXT: The Islamic dynasty which self-termed the Iranian system established around the goal of Afghanistan. It destroyed the Ghazna morning and repeatedly intruded into India, beating the Hindu kingdoms. It laid the foundation of Muslims' rule of North India, but then divided up with internal conflict and destroyed in horror morning.

DOC.Title: Large Pet
DOC.TEXT: Hindu force in India. Because they continued to fight against each other under the invasion of Islamic forces, they allowed the domination of Islamic powers.

DOC.Title: Aibaku
DOC.TEXT: The founder of the Mang Dynasty (ranking 1206-10). Turkish guy flying out. As a goal morning warrior conquered Delhi, then became independent.

DOC.Title: Delhi
DOC.TEXT: Cities on the banks of the Jamna River in North India. In the city of the Delhi-Sultan era, it was the center of Islamic rule in North India.

DOC.Title: Derry = Sultan Morning
DOC.TEXT: Indian = Islamic 5 Dynasty of India = Islam, Harzy, Tugulque, Said, Roddy, with Delhi as the capital. Rody morning was Afghan, the other 4 dynasties were Turkish.

DOC.Title: Slave Dynasty
DOC.TEXT: India's first Islamic dynasty where Eipaku founded. It was the origin of the name that the sultan of three people, including Aibaku, came from a fellow (Mumluk).

DOC.Title: Haruji morning
DOC.TEXT: Delhi-Sultan 2 nd dynasty. Turkish type. Jala Ruddeen (ranking 1290-96) built the country after defeating the morning morning. When Allah Woodeen = Harzy, I sent an expedition army to Decan / South India, and reached its peak.

DOC.Title: Tugluq morning
DOC.TEXT: Delhi-Sultan 's Third Dynasty. Turkish type. When the last king in the morning of the Harugey was assassinated, the general Tugrik killed the assassin and built it. After the invasion of Timur Army in 1398, it declined since.

DOC.Title: Said Morning
DOC.TEXT: Delhi-Sultan 4th Dynasty. Turkish type. Timur 's captain Hizle-Han occupied Delhi and built it. The dominant territory is limited only to the surroundings of Delhi and it has decreased in 4 th 37 years.

DOC.Title: Rody Morning
DOC.TEXT: Delhi-Sultan 5th Dynasty. Afghanistan. Baharro of the Afghan Rodi of Punjab region was welcomed by Delhi.

DOC.Title: Bahman morning
DOC.TEXT: The Islamic dynasty which dominated the Deccan region. It fought against the surrounding Hindu dynasty, became a major force at one time, but it split at the end of the 15th century and soon ruined.

DOC.Title: Melaka Kingdom, Malaca Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Harbor City State which dominated the eastern coast of Sumatra Island from the Malay Peninsula. It became Southeast Asia's first full-fledged Islamic state in the mid-15th century. Although it was destroyed by Portuguese people, Islamists and Malay language used in this kingdom spread to the Malay Peninsula, Java Island and Sumatra Island.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Aceh
DOC.TEXT: A port city state built at the northern end of Sumatra Island. With the advancement of Portugal, the Kingdom of Melaka faded and declined, it prospered Islam and prospered with trade. In the early 20th century, lost by the Aceh war with the Netherlands, it was placed under its control.

DOC.Title: Mataram Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: An Islamic kingdom built in the east of Java on behalf of Majapahit. It was divided and annihilated as the pressure of the Netherlands strengthened.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Banten
DOC.TEXT: Islamic Kingdom that occurred in the western part of Java in the first half of the 16th century. Though it prospered in pepper trade, it was dominated by the Dutch East India Company in the latter half of the 18th century.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Kush
DOC.TEXT: After the destruction of the new Kingdom of Egypt, the oldest black kingdom built by Kush people around the Nile River Napata. It invaded Egypt in the 8th century before, shifted its center to Thebes, but retreated to Meroe with the invasion of Egypt of Assyria in the 7th century. It was destroyed by the Kingdom of Aksum in the 4th century.

DOC.Title: Meroe
DOC.TEXT: A town in the middle of Nile. It became the capital of the Kingdom of Kush who retreated from south under Egypt invasion of Assyria. It prosper as a base for East-West trade leading from Abyssinia to the Indian Ocean.

DOC.Title: Meroe Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The kingdom name after the Kingdom of Kush moved the capital from Napata to Meroe in the south. Prosperous in the development of steelmaking technology and in commerce. It was destroyed by the Kingdom of Aksum in the 4th century.

DOC.Title: Meloe character
DOC.TEXT: A letter made based on Egyptian hieroglyphs. It was used at the Meroe court in the Kingdom of Kush. Uncrypted.

DOC.Title: Axum Kingdom, Ethiopian Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The kingdom which Aksm man built on Abyssinia Plateau in the 2nd century BC. The second to third century was at its heyday, in the 4th century Christianity (Coptic faction) spread.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Ghana
DOC.TEXT: A black kingdom built in the western part of Africa, the Senegal River, the upper reaches of the Niger River. Prosperous in Sahara longitudinal trade exchanging Sahara rock salt and Guinea's money, mediating Muslim merchants. It declined and declined after the 11th century Berbers' Murabbit morning attack.

DOC.Title: Mandingo person
DOC.TEXT: A race of blacks in West Africa. In the thirteenth century it expanded its influence and built the Kingdom of Mali.

DOC.Title: Mali Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The upper reaches of the River Niger, the kingdom of the Mandingo who dominated the majority of the West Sudan. It accepted Islamist, prospered as a trade-over with North Africa and Mecca pilgrims, mainly in Tonbuktu, and also in the 14th century Ibn = Batuta visited. It was destroyed in the Kingdom of Songgeai in the late 15th century.

DOC.Title: Mansa = Musa
DOC.TEXT: King of the Kingdom of Mali (king 1312-37). Aka Cankan = Moussa. It is known for dedicating a large amount of money during Mecca pilgrimage.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Song King
DOC.TEXT: The Islamic dynasty where the Black Songhai of Western Sudan founded in the Niger River Basin. The capital is Gao. Prosperous in inland trade, the dominant territory extended north of Sahara. It was destroyed by the attack of the Moroccan army at the end of the 16th century.

DOC.Title: Tombuktu
DOC.TEXT: The southern edge of the Sahara desert, a city in the middle of the Niger River. Since the 11th century, it prosper as an end point of caravan trading. It is the economic and cultural center of the Kingdom of Mali and Songhai, and in the 16th century the first university by blacks was founded.

DOC.Title: Niger River
DOC.TEXT: A large river of West Africa from Guinea Plateau to Guinea Bay.

DOC.Title: Kanem = Borneau Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: A black kingdom around Lake Chad. It was founded in the Kanem district east coast of Chad lake around the 9th century. Accepted Islam at the end of the 11th century, prosperous in the Sahara longitudinal trade, promoted Islamization of central Sudan. In the 14th century I was weakened by internal conflict, but the Sephua morning moved to Borneau on the west coast of Chad Honan and revived. After the destruction of the Kingdom of Songhai at the end of the 16 th century, it developed into Western Sudan.

DOC.Title: Zimbabwean Ruins
DOC.TEXT: A spectacular stone monument in the southeast of the Republic of Zimbabwe. The meaning of "Stone house". It seems that it was built during the 11th-18th century, the heyday was in the 13th-15th century. Indian glass bowls and ceramics made in China were excavated from the ruins and the activity of trade by Muslim merchants has been confirmed.

DOC.Title: Monotumapa Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Kingdom that dominated the Zambezi River basin in southern Africa, mainly Zimbabwe. It flourished in the Indian Ocean trade, but in the 16th-17th century it received the influence and pressure of Portugal.

DOC.Title: Mozambique
DOC.TEXT: Coastal area of ​​southeastern Africa. Many Muslim merchants arrived as the spot production area and trading area, forming the southern end of the Islamic area.

DOC.Title: Zanzibar
DOC.TEXT: A port city on the east coast of Africa. A Muslim merchant arrived and prosper as a spice and a producing area and a trading place of a slave.

DOC.Title: Kirwa
DOC.TEXT: A seaport city on the east coast of Africa. Muslim merchants arrived, Chinese ceramics and copper coins, Indian cotton cloths and glass beads were also brought in.

DOC.Title: Marindey
DOC.TEXT: A seaport city on the east coast of Africa. Prosperous in the Indian Ocean trade, in the 15th century the fleet of Cheng Era and Vasco da Gama visited.

DOC.Title: Mombasa
DOC.TEXT: A seaport city on the east coast of Africa. Prosperous in the Indian Ocean trade.

DOC.Title: Mogadishu
DOC.TEXT: A seaport city on the east coast of Africa.

DOC.Title: sofa
DOC.TEXT: A seaport city on the east coast of Africa.

DOC.Title: Bantu word
DOC.TEXT: Language of inhabitants of East African coastal area. Swahili was born with Arabic language.

DOC.Title: Swahili
DOC.TEXT: The meaning of "people living on the coast". It refers to the Bantu Muslim and its language living in the coastal area of ​​northern East Africa. The Swahili word which was established with the Bantu word and Arabic word in a puffy manner spread as a commercial term, and the original Swahili culture was established.

DOC.Title: Islamic civilization, Islamic culture
DOC.TEXT: Civilization developed in the Islamic world (culture). Based on Islamist and Arabic, it was formed by fusing cultural heritage of Iran, Egypt, Iberian Peninsula, India and other conquests all over the place. Although it is deployed in a vast area, it has strong commonality, but on the other hand diversity such as Iran-Islam culture, Turkish-Islamic culture, India = Islam culture etc. can be seen.

DOC.Title: Iran = Islamic culture
DOC.TEXT: Under the rule of Turkish Seljuk morning and Mongolian il Han kingdom, Islamicism was accepted and a culture formed by heavily using Iranian intellectuals. Activities such as Umar-Khayam and Nizzarm-Almurk in the former and Rasheed-Addin in the latter are noteworthy.

DOC.Title: Turkey = Islamic culture
DOC.TEXT: Culture formed during the Timurid era when Iran = Islam culture was conveyed to Central Asia where Turkish people lived in. A magnificent mosque and madrassa was built in Samarkand and Herat, a fine painting developed, a Turkish literary work was produced, and the development of astronomy and calendar law was noted.

DOC.Title: India = Islam culture
DOC.TEXT: Culture formed by the fusion of Islamic culture and Indian ancient Hindu culture in the past since the formation of the Derry-Sultanate, especially during the Mughal Empire. It is characterized by art such as the formation of Urdu and architecture represented by Taj-Mahal, Large Boot painting etc.

DOC.Title: Toledo
DOC.TEXT: Cities in Central Spain. City of the West Goat Kingdom. In the 8th-11th century, it flourished as the central city of Islamic culture. After the conquest by Christianity Casteiriya at the end of the 11th century, it became the base of importing Islamic culture in Western Europe, and in the 12th and 13th century translation of the Arabic literature into Latin was performed extensively.

DOC.Title: Islamic city
DOC.TEXT: Religious and educational institutions such as mosque and madrassa, public facilities for daily life such as souks and hospitals are located, and citizens living a life of people, mainly Islamists who follow Shari'a. The role of the city was so important that it was also called "religion of city and merchant", but the transportation path connecting these cities was developed, Islam = network was established, advanced culture developed. However, in recent years, the role of rural farmers in the Islamic world has also been reviewed.

DOC.Title: ULAMAR
DOC.TEXT: A scholar of Islam. He was involved in Islamic studies such as theology and law, and was engaged in interpretation and execution by Shari'a, but was engaged in occupations such as judges, teachers, worship leaders, etc., not clergy status. It gradually became bureaucratic and maintained.

DOC.Title: Cardy
DOC.TEXT: Judges of the Islamic world. It was a person who was familiar with the Islamic law, and in many cases Ulamar took office. In the Ottoman Empire, I also took charge of local administration.

DOC.Title: Mosque
DOC.TEXT: Islamic chapel. Inside, there is only a depression (Mihrab) of the wall showing the direction of the pulpit and Mecca.

DOC.Title: Minaret, light tower
DOC.TEXT: Spire that belongs to the mosque. From this point on, the time of worship is told by human voice.

DOC.Title: Souq, Bazaar
DOC.TEXT: The souk is Arabic, and the bazaar is the Persian language. Shops and restaurants are lined up around the narrow road around the square, where the mosque is adjacent.

DOC.Title: Charavansaray
DOC.TEXT: Caravan trading inn. In addition to pure lodging facilities built along the highway, some were built next to the bazaar in the city, and some also served as warehouses and trading places for goods.

DOC.Title: Waku
DOC.TEXT: Donation (act) based on the Islamic law. In the Islamic world, expenses for the construction and operation of public facilities such as mosques, madrasas, hospitals, caravansaray, etc. are expenses for people to donate (donate) the right of use of their own land, houses, stores, etc., It was often applied by income.

DOC.Title: Madrassa, Gakuin College
DOC.TEXT: Higher education institution to train ULAMA. Since the 11th century, many cities were established.

DOC.Title: Battle on the bank of the Taras
DOC.TEXT: A battle where the Tang Army who lost the Abbasid Army in the Taras River in the northern part of Central Asia was defeated.

DOC.Title: Western paper of papermaking law
DOC.TEXT: It is said that it was conveyed to the Islamic world by the Tang paper mill which was caught in the fight along the bank of the Taras. Then it was transmitted to Europe via Andalusia.

DOC.Title: Sufism
DOC.TEXT: It is thought that Uramama and others avoid Islamic (law) 's esoteric interpretation and formalism and emphasize inner salvation. Because it was easy to accept for the general public, it played a major role in propagating to India, Southeast Asia, Central Asia, China and Africa, with the expansion of Muslim merchants' scope of activity. Among them, the idea that emphasizes "asymmetric sense of unity with God" and ascetic training is called Islamic mysticism.

DOC.Title: Sufi
DOC.TEXT: Islamic mysticism. It comes from the fact that they were wearing the poor clothes made from soup (wool). A part of Sufi spread as a saint from the people spreading saints worship, many mysticism religious groups have been founded, but from orthodox people of Ulama and others were condemned as a deviation from Islamist.

DOC.Title: Mysticism Christianity
DOC.TEXT: Organized to promote certain Sufis (mystics). Representative examples are the Catholic Church and the Mevurevi culture.

DOC.Title: Catholic Church
DOC.TEXT: The earliest mysticism organization organized in Baghdad in the 12th century. Since the 15th century it has spread all over the world of Islam.

DOC.Title: Mevurevic Order
DOC.TEXT: A mysticism organization organized in Anatolia in the 13th century. It is known for doing outrage and aiming for unity with God.

DOC.Title: Arabic
DOC.TEXT: It belongs to the Semitic system. As the words of the Arabs, since the "Koran" was written in Arabic, it became a common language of West Asia and North Africa as the expansion of Islamist.

DOC.Title: specific learning
DOC.TEXT: Among academics in the Islamic world, the discipline field unique to Arabs based on the "Koran". Legal theology, theology, grammatology, clinical studies, poetics, prosody studies, historiography are included.

DOC.Title: Sharia
DOC.TEXT: About Islamic law. Originally it means "the way to the water field", that is, "the law prescribed by God", and it was structured based on the interpretation of "Koran" and Hadith. He developed his own development in the Islamic world, including religious ceremonies such as worship and fields such as administrative law, identity law, family law, and commercial law.

DOC.Title: Hadeeth
DOC.TEXT: Tradition on Muhammad's speech (Sunnah). Along with "the Koran" it formed the foundation of the Islamic law.

DOC.Title: Jah Hiz
DOC.TEXT: Theologian and literary man in the Abbasian era. I opened up one field of medieval Islamic literature.

DOC.Title: Tabury
DOC.TEXT: Iranian Islamic theologian and historian who was active in the Abbasid period. He wrote the chronological world history "History of the Prophets and the King".

DOC.Title: Gathering
DOC.TEXT: Iranian Islamic theologian at the Seljuk period. Became professor of Nizar Meya Institute, criticized the Shi'ite school deepening the Sunni school theology. However, after that, he gradually became Sufi himself, leaned to mysticism, went for pilgrimage and wandering, and advanced the theory of Sufism after returning home.

DOC.Title: Ibn-Khardoo
DOC.TEXT: Islam from Tunis The best historian in the world.

DOC.Title: "Introduction to World History"
DOC.TEXT: Part 1 of the "Example Book" written by Ibn Khardon in the late 14th century. I discussed the law of history development focusing on the relationship between the city and the nomads, not the chronological record.

DOC.Title: Outpatient learning
