DOC.TEXT: It is the largest building in Italy = Renaissance which started construction after 1506. Adjacent to the Roman Northwestern Vatican Palace.

DOC.Title: Letter of Indulgence, Disbelief
DOC.TEXT: Certificate issued by the Catholic Church (sign) as a sign for forgiveness of sins. Those who donated (donated) to the church were also sold for sins. Especially at the beginning of the 16th century, in order to create the construction cost of St. Peter's Basilica, it was sold in Germany, which is delayed in national unification, through the futurist Fugger family who gained permission from the Pope, It caused anger and became the cause of religious reform.

DOC.Title: "Cow of Rome"
DOC.TEXT: Because the Holy Roman Empire was in a state of division, it was exploited especially from the Roman church, so it was called in such a despair. German farmers' songs "We are cows, we just have no horns 3" "Words from the shoobies if we sow seeds".

DOC.Title: Martin-Luther
DOC.TEXT: German religious reformer. Born in Saxony of Central Germany. My father is a farmer's son, a copper refiner at the Mansfeld mine (middle-income citizen). Luther broke theology as a monk, criticized the issuance of indignation, and induced German religious reform. Since then, he taught the new denominations such as the German translation of the Bible, the creation of the Lutheran church.

DOC.Title: Wittenberg
DOC.TEXT: Luther was a professor of theology at the university since 1512, a small city of central Germany Saxony.

DOC.Title: Ninety-five articles of subjects
DOC.TEXT: In 1517, a document criticizing the indulgence sales and released by Luther at the Wittenberg church. From the belief that the salvation of the soul depends solely on the faith in the Gospel, he insisted that it is irrelevant to the indignation and the salvation of the soul. It spread throughout Germany, calling for great response, the reform of the German religion began.

DOC.Title: Carl V
DOC.TEXT: Holy Roman Emperor (ranking 1519-56) and King of Spain (Carlos I, ranking 1516-56). He was elected emperor with the financial support of the Hugar family and conflicted with King French. In addition to opposing many German houses, I repressed Lutheran.

DOC.Title: Worms Imperial Council
DOC.TEXT: The first meeting when the emperor Carl V invited German princes. Calling Luther for his skill show, he forced the cancellation of the theory. Because Luther refused, the Lutheran was forbidden.

DOC.Title: Saxony elector Friedrich
DOC.TEXT: One of the anti-emperor major influential people (ranking 1486 to 1525). From 1521 to 22, he hid Luther in the castle of Wartburg.

DOC.Title: German translation of 'New Testament'
DOC.TEXT: The first German translation that Luther did. Luther was excommunicated to the Pope and was repressed by the German Emperor, but under the protection of Saxony Hou, completed in the Wartburg castle between 1521 and 22 years. It was regarded as the greatest achievement of Luther taking Bible-centricism and also contributed to the establishment of modern German.

DOC.Title: "freedom of Christ"
DOC.TEXT: Written by Luther in 1520. He asserted the belief of faith that "human beings are justified by faith" (soul salvation can only exist without faith).

DOC.Title: "A person is justified by faith"
DOC.TEXT: At the heart of Luther's faith's belief in original sin, love and grace of God, this word well expresses Luther's faith admiration thesis.

DOC.Title: Lutheran
DOC.TEXT: Followers of Luther 's doctrine centered on religious faith and biblical first. Supported by the princes, labor citizens, farmers, taking the standpoint of anti-pope / anti-emperor (But Luther lost support from poor farmers as they claimed repression of farmers in the German farmers' war). The establishment of the Lutheran faction leads to the establishment of church control in the dominion of the princes (lord), the establishment of a national church system.

DOC.Title: Knight War
DOC.TEXT: Small lords and knights who were weakened by the progress of the monetary economy raised up with the destruction of the church principal areas of the line catchment line by the religious turmoil. It was led by Jikkingen · Hotten and others, but was seduced in cooperation with saints and saints, leading to the final downfall of medieval knights.

DOC.Title: Munzer
DOC.TEXT: German preacher and leader of peasant war. Initially he supported Luther 's evangelism, but since 1520 it has rapidly evolved from demanding the abolition of serfdom. Linking faith with demands for social reform and guiding the army of the German farmers' war on the side of the poor, he was captured and beheaded.

DOC.Title: Twelve Claim Requests
DOC.TEXT: Farmers' Unification Code created in March, 1525 during the German Peasant War. The content was abolition of the serfdom system, reduction of the feudal lodging, justice of the trial etc, but rejected by the lord.

DOC.Title: German farmer war
DOC.TEXT: Farmers in southern and central Germany are revolts aimed at abolition of serfdom system and lord system. Luther was sympathetic to farmers at first, but turned to the lord side knowing that farmer's goal is in social change, calling for thorough crackdown. There were also farmer side internal divisions, which were suppressed by the lord side.

DOC.Title: François I
DOC.TEXT: French King (ranking 1515-47). In 1519 he went out to Holy Roman Emperor election, lost to Carl V, and fought violently after that. We endeavored to strengthen the royalty, protected and encouraged art, bloomed the Renaissance in France. Also known as a guardian of the later years of Leonardo da Vinci.

DOC.Title: Italian War
DOC.TEXT: Mainly the fight between Holy Roman emperor over France's rule over Italy's rule. After the invasion of Italy by Charles VIII of France in 1494, it was fiercely fought between Francois I of France and Emperor Carl V of Holy Roman. In this fight, Catholic François I connects with Sulaiman I of the Islamic Ottoman Empire, and Catholic Karl V connects with England's Henry VIII who did the religious reform, such as international, unrelated to religion A connection was held. France came to an end from Italy in 1559 Kato-Cambresi treaty, but the Renaissance in Italy was devastated, after that the center of Renaissance moved to countries north of the Alps.

DOC.Title: Roman Church System
DOC.TEXT: The German monarchs (the princes) are the best bishops to control the protection of the church in the territory. Established by the introduction of Lutheranism.

DOC.Title: Protestant
DOC.TEXT: It is the etymology that Lutheran faction submitted a protest-tatio to the decision of Speyer Empire Council (1529) sponsored by Carl V. Generic name of the Newspaper including Calvin school and British sect.

DOC.Title: Suleiman I
DOC.TEXT: Ottoman Sultan (ranking 1520-66). Emperor of the golden age realizing the greatest realm of the empire and raising the cultural aspect. He intervened in the West European politicians, confronted the King of France and confronted Carl V.

DOC.Title: Vienna siege, First Vienna siege
DOC.TEXT: The Ottoman army of Suleiman I besieged, but retired due to cold weapons and insufficient weapons.

DOC.Title: Shumkalkden alliance
DOC.TEXT: Anti-emperor alliance formed in 1530 by the Lutheran Germans and cities.

DOC.Title: Schumacalden War
DOC.TEXT: Schumacalden Alliance tycoon was opposed to the emperor side by opportunity of the Council of Trent, but lost by internal division of the alliance.

DOC.Title: Augsburg religious consolation
DOC.TEXT: Empire Act promulgated Lutheran faith which was issued at Augsburg's Imperial Council. Everyone was given the right to select either Catholic or Lutheran religion in its controlling territory. However, there was no recognition of the Calvin faith and individual freedom of religion.

DOC.Title: Zwingli
DOC.TEXT: A Swiss religious reformer. In 1523 he started a religious reform movement in Zurich, but his cooperation was refused by Luther from the doctrinal problem in 1929. After that, he fought with a conservative faction, killed by battle. Part of the Zwingri 's argument was adopted by the Calvin school.

DOC.Title: Zurich
DOC.TEXT: A city in Switzerland. Early urban autonomy developed, civil rationalism was revitalized, supported the movement of Zwingri.

DOC.Title: Calvin
DOC.TEXT: A religious reformer born in France. I was persecuted because I fulfilled the evangelicalism. After that, it was imposed on the reformist of Geneva, and after 1541 monopolized the municipal administration and put efforts on reform of politics and religion. Like Luther, he preached evangelism, but he preached the "plan of the theory" separately and carried out the elderly system.

DOC.Title: Geneve
DOC.TEXT: A city in Switzerland. There were many reformists along with Zurich Basel, but Calvin was imitated and politically politicized, becoming the center of the Swiss religious reform.

DOC.Title: Basel
DOC.TEXT: Cities in northern Switzerland. Calvin published "Christianity Requirements".

DOC.Title: "Christianity Requirements"
DOC.TEXT: Main article of Calvin published in 1536. With this work which theorized the evangelism, it is said that he was led to Geneva.

DOC.Title: Evangelism
DOC.TEXT: Protestant claims that faith is based on the Bible and salvation is obtained only by faith.

DOC.Title: Schedule theory
DOC.TEXT: The theory that salvation of the soul is unrelated to human will and good deed, pre-determined by God, thoroughly by Calvin. And if you encourage your work as a royal priest given by God, you will be able to gain confidence that you will eventually be the object of salvation. Although Catholic denied the accumulation, Calvin acknowledged the accumulation as a result of excellence in ranking in this scheduled theory and religiously approved the activity of emerging civil class, it became thought that contributes to the development of capitalism .

DOC.Title: Elder system
DOC.TEXT: Calvin 's church system. From the top do not have an appointed supervisor (priest), run a church with the pastor and the elders of the church representatives who assist this. Institutionalized evangelism and planned theory, it was enemies from Catholic and national kings.

DOC.Title: Theocracy politics, Theocracy politics
DOC.TEXT: Religious consciousness is strongly reflected in politics Politicity matching politics. Since the late 1540s Calvin held dictatorial power in Geneva, reflecting its religious teachings directly in politics.

DOC.Title: Calvin school
DOC.TEXT: A denomination that believes in Calvin 's doctrine. Like the Lutheran faction, he was in the position of evangelism, but he did not preach obedience to the lord, and endorsed the resistance to illegal lords. Also, the schedule theory, occupational ethics that respects abstinence and labor are accepted by workers and citizens of the West and Northern Europe and became a spiritual backbone of capitalist development.

DOC.Title: Puritan, Puritan
DOC.TEXT: The name of the Calvin school of England. Self-employed farmers · gentries (gentlemen) are the supporting strata.

DOC.Title: Presbyterian, Presbyterian
DOC.TEXT: The name of the Calvin school of Scotland. Etymology of the church organization.

DOC.Title: Huguenot
DOC.TEXT: In the name of the French Calvin school, it is regarded as "allied".

DOC.Title: Goisen
DOC.TEXT: In the name of the Calvin school of Nederland, the meaning of "beggar".

DOC.Title: All-people priestism
DOC.TEXT: A theory denying the authority of the papacy and the privileges of the priests. An almost common idea for the New Epistle.

DOC.Title: Henry VIII
DOC.TEXT: British king (ranking 1509-47). We strongly promoted centralization, established British absolute monarchy. In the divorce issue with the first Queen Qazarin he set up a British church in opposition to the Pope, dissolved the monastery, sold the land to emerging citizens cheaply, strengthened the kingship with their support. Elisabeth I is the daughter born with Anne-Boleyn who was executed after the second princess.

DOC.Title: Employee Law, King's supreme law
DOC.TEXT: The law established by Henry VIII with the support of Parliament and issued. This made the King of England the only head chief of the British Church. The independence of the British National Church from the Pope was confirmed.

DOC.Title: British National Church
DOC.TEXT: British national church established by the chief rule. Although the head of the church changed to Catholic in that it became the British King rather than the Pope, the Catholic element remained in terms of religious doctrine.

DOC.Title: Edward VI
DOC.TEXT: British King (ranking 1547-53). It was the only man of Henry VII. A general prayer letter was enacted in this era, and the doctrine and institution as the new church of the national church were prepared.

DOC.Title: General prayer letter
DOC.TEXT: A written prescribing worship ceremony and doctrine of the British church which was enacted in 1549. The doctrine contents are similar to Calvinism by adopting righteousness, biblicalism, and the theory of plan, but on institutional basis a bishopic system similar to Catholicism was adopted.

DOC.Title: Bishopric system, bishopric system
DOC.TEXT: Catholic church leadership system. In the British Church it was called the bishop (supervision) system, the bishop was appointed king.

DOC.Title: Mary I
DOC.TEXT: Queen of England (ranking 1553-58). It was an ardent Catholic, and was also called "Mary of the blood" because it repressed the New Testament. In addition, he got married to Spanish Crown Prince Felipe (who soon became Felipe II), and the crisis that Britain was under Spain's control.

DOC.Title: Elizabeth I
DOC.TEXT: Queen of England (ranking 1558-1603). Establishing the British Church by the unified law, the religious confusion of the era of Mary I, celebrated the extreme rise of British absolute monarchy.

DOC.Title: Unified law
DOC.TEXT: Law to unify the worship and prayer of the National Church. Initially, it was enacted in 1549. After the Catholic revival of the era of Mary I, it was enacted again by Elizabeth I. This established the National Church.

DOC.Title: Counter Religious Reformation, Anti-Religious Reform
DOC.TEXT: Self-innovation movement on the side of the Old Tribes that was done against the New Times. The Roman church and the Spanish court were the center, and the Jesuits performed a unique activity. Contents include confirmation of the supreme right of the Pope, refuge within the Old Tribe side, strengthening of religious trials, suppression of the new denominations by establishment of a prohibited catalog, actions by national rulers, powerful implementation of overseas evangelism.

DOC.Title: Paulus III
DOC.TEXT: Pope the Pope (ranking from 1534 to 49). Excommunication of the Kingdom of England King Henry VIII, hosted the Council of Trent. I approved the establishment of the Jesuits.

DOC.Title: Jesuits, Jesuit Christianity
DOC.TEXT: A new cult of the old denomination established around 1534 Loyola. Promising absolute obedience to the Pope, having a strict organization and discipline, at the forefront of opposing religious reform, he was active in overseas missionary work with Spanish foreign entry. In 1773, I broke up at the orders of the Pope, but it is rebuilt soon and it has reached today.

DOC.Title: Ignatius = Loyola
DOC.TEXT: Former Spanish aristocrat and soldier. Xavier and six others formed a Jesuits, became the first president.

DOC.Title: Francisco Xavier, Francisco Chavier
DOC.TEXT: Spanish missionary. We established the Jesuits with Loyola. He devised overseas evangelism, arrived in Japan in India in 1542, 1949, and conducted missionary work in various parts of western Japan. After that, I went to China evangelism, but soon he died of disease on Kamikawajima near Guangdong.

DOC.Title: Matio = Rich
DOC.TEXT: An Italian Jesuit missionary. After going through Macao and Gora, in 1583, the first full-fledged Chinese evangelism of the cult was started. He was allowed to live in Beijing in 1601, and left a lot of accomplishments due to Western academic knowledge.

DOC.Title: Council of Trient, Council of Torrent
DOC.TEXT: Originally the purpose was mediation of both old and new, but because the New Guard refused to attend, it became a conference only on the Old Tribe side, reaffirmed the Pope's supremacy and Catholic doctrine.

DOC.Title: Religious Trial
DOC.TEXT: The church court which punishes discoveries of heretic. Although it was from ancient times, both the new and old factions strengthened during the religious reform period, and convicted persons were turned into fire. Especially in the old-fashioned country Spain we tried.

DOC.Title: Prohibited catalog
DOC.TEXT: A list of books and authors that are regarded as anti-Catholic and forbidden to possess or disseminate them. It was revised often after the announcement in 1559. It extends to science (especially astronomical relations). Its major relaxation was in 1900.

DOC.Title: Witch hunt
DOC.TEXT: "Witch" is the person who sold the soul to the devil, including men. It was regarded as more malignant than heretics. Witch hunting was also in the Middle Ages, but since the religious reform period, it was done systematically and systematically. It also repeated both inquiries and accusations to the religious courts, torture, confessions, folly and stupidity, both old and new. It was the most extensive in the 16th-17th centuries.

DOC.Title: Religious War
DOC.TEXT: From the second half of the 16th century until the middle of the 17th century, the war that happened to various parts of Western Europe as a major cause of the confrontation between the new and old denominations arising from religious reform. The Huguenot war of France, the Dutch independence war, the German thirty year war and so on. In both cases, there is a common point that the Spanish court (Habsburgs) existed in the center of the Old Tribe side, politically and realistically.

DOC.Title: Sovereign State
DOC.TEXT: A region surrounded by a clear border and a modern state with independent sovereignty. Since the end of the Middle Ages, as the universal power and authority like the Holy Roman Empire and the Roman Papacy declined, the state grew as an independent political entity and was established.

DOC.Title: Sovereign State System
DOC.TEXT: A system in which many sovereign states are formed in Europe, international politics is developed by competing with each other.

DOC.Title: Italian War
DOC.TEXT: Mainly the fight between Holy Roman Emperor (Habsburg family) over France's rule over Italy's rule. The invasion of Italy by King French King Charles VIII (the Valois family) in 1494 was triggered and then fiercely fought between Francis I of France and Emperor Carl V of Holy Roman Empire. Mainly because this war was fought as a struggle between sovereign nations, it became a trigger for the formation of a sovereign nation system throughout Europe.

DOC.Title: Kato-Cambresi Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The Peace treaty of the Italian war, centered on Henry II of France, Felipe II of Spain, Queen Elizabeth I of England. Spain acquired Milan, Napoli, Sicily, Sardinia etc, but France abandoned its advance to Italy.

DOC.Title: Military Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A method of large-scale war spread after the Italian war. The Italian war became a long-term and large-scale war, and new weapons such as rifles and cannons were used in large quantities. As a result, the fall of the knight, which was the center of the war of the past, became decisive.

DOC.Title: Association State
DOC.TEXT: A nation where the association (middle group) was recognized a great privilege. As a corporation, there are the aristocracy and priesthood status, professional organizations such as guilds, universities and village communities, regional organizations such as cities and rural areas, etc. Since each was recognized privileges and customs by the king, the king The direct control by the people was insufficient.

DOC.Title: National nation
DOC.TEXT: A nation with sovereignty over the sovereign nation, not the king, in a sovereign state. The people exercised sovereignty either directly or through representation (parliament).

DOC.Title: National language
DOC.TEXT: Words that are publicly used in each country. As the sovereign state solidifies, it is often formed on the basis of a specific language within the state (such as the language used around the capital) (or designated by the state). As a result, by the end of the 17th century most books were published in national languages, not in Latin. Also, words that were not designated as national languages ​​were often called "dialects" and were often suppressed.

DOC.Title: Absolute monarchy, absoluteism
DOC.TEXT: A political system that was developed in Europe in the 16th-18th centuries and whose centralization towards the kingship has progressed. The king rode the balance between the falling feudal aristocratic group and the civic stratification which was putting power and brought the bureaucratic system and regular army to strengthen national unification. This absolute monarchy is the final stage of the feudal nation because it promoted centralization while maintaining the medieval status and social order (intermediate group), and on the other hand, it concentrated on sovereignty to the king, , It can be regarded as an early stage of a modern state, since it formed a sovereign state which unilaterally dominates the country. After that, when the civic hierarchy grew even more in the UK, France, etc. and feeling pain in the bondage of the royal civil revolution, the civil revolution occurred, the absolute monarchy was overthrown.

DOC.Title: Theory of royal authority
DOC.TEXT: The king's control overwhelms the absolute monarchy that justifies the absolute monarchy that the king's ancestors were given directly by God, so even in the case of misappropriation it is not responsible for the people. British James I and Filmer, France 's Louis XIV, Bosch etc, insisted.

DOC.Title: bureaucracy
DOC.TEXT: In the era of absolute monarchy, administrative work (a relatively high official) who worked as a king's limbs. Many people from aristocrats (including newly aristocrats) were protected by a status system, so their character was different from the bureaucrats who should work for today's citizens.

DOC.Title: Permanent Army
DOC.TEXT: An army organized in both wartime and peacetime. In the Middle Ages, the army was hardly organized in peacetime, and the feudal Order was convened every time the war was brought together and became the center of the fight, but when the absolute monarchy period comes, the military, mainly mercenaries, It was prepared for wartime. Later, instead of the mercenary system, the armed forces of the nation (permanent army) based on conscription system and voluntary voluntary weapons system came to be organized.

DOC.Title: Commercial capital
DOC.TEXT: In the absolute monarchy era, in the absolute monarchy era, the monopoly right in the direction of commerce and trade was given instead of financial assistance to the royalty, and it gained great profit. There was also a face against the development of capitalism based on industrial capital.

DOC.Title: wholesale system
DOC.TEXT: Commercial capital of merchants and financial institutions procure raw materials and tools to producers, make custom production, buy products monopolistically and dominate production. It was held in Britain 's woolen textile industry in absolute monarchy era.

DOC.Title: Capitalism
DOC.TEXT: Generally refers to the economic structure of a modern society established by the Industrial Revolution. A mechanism of economic society in which a capitalist who possesses production means such as factories, machinery, funds, etc. hire workers who have only their own labor force and produce goods. Beginning in the UK from the 16th century, from the factory industry in the woolen textile industry, established through the industrial revolution since the 18th century.

DOC.Title: Civic class, bourgeoisie
DOC.TEXT: Originally meant the residents of a city (medieval city) established in the late Middle Ages. In modern times, it came to point to citizens such as wealthy commercial and traders among aristocrats and urban people and peasants. Furthermore, once capitalism is established, it often means a capitalist for workers.

DOC.Title: Manufacturer, factory handicraft
DOC.TEXT: A capitalist builds a factory, gathers workers and produces through collaboration through division of labor. In the early stages of the capitalist production style, began to be developed in British woolen textile industry in the late 16th century. As an industrial capitalist, management opposed the commercial capitalist who had been privileged in connection with absolute monarchy. In the late 16th century, first of all, it was developed in the British woolen textile business on behalf of the traditional house handicraft industry.

DOC.Title: Mercantilism
DOC.TEXT: Economic policy that the state actively intervened in economic activities during the absolute monarchy era. That is because absolute royalty needed a lot of financial resources to maintain its enormous bureaucracy and powerful army troops. In fact, for this purpose, policies of mercantilism were developed in the form of heavy money principle, trade balance principle, industrial protectionism, etc. according to the country (or time) respectively.

DOC.Title: Heavy principle
DOC.TEXT: Position to emphasize money acquisition through means such as gold and silver mine development in overseas colonies and export restrictions on precious metals. Early stages of Mercantilism. It was typically done in Spain of the 16th century.

DOC.Title: Trade Balanceism
DOC.TEXT: A position that emphasizes money acquisition through expanding trade surplus. Policies taken at a more advanced stage of Mercantilism. Furthermore, in order to make export good, it is necessary to make excellent export goods, protection and cultivation of domestic export industries such as woolen fabrics, weapons, glasses, etc. were put on and shifted to the stage of industrial protectionism . It was developed in many countries, mainly England · France.

DOC.Title: Habsburg House
DOC.TEXT: A royal family attached to the throne of the Holy Roman Empire and the Austrian Empire from the 13th to the 19th century. In 1273, the sacred Roman Emperor was first chosen from the family and became Austria-Habsburg Family (1278-1918) with Austria as its main territory, and since 1438 he reclaimed the throne until 1806. The Spanish-Hapsburg family (1516-1700) also occurred due to marriage with the royal family of Spain, both Habsburgs confronted the French Valois and Bourbon morals for more than two centuries since the 16th century and became the center of the movement of European international relations .

DOC.Title: Maximilian I
DOC.TEXT: The Holy Roman emperor from the Habsburg family (ranking 1493-1519). By spreading control to Nederland on marriage with the Burgundy daughter, he gained the right to succeed to the throne of Bamen Hungary and built the foundation for the development of the Habsburg family, including the succession to the Holy Roman Empire. Also, the grandson who was born in the marriage between Prince Philippe and Princess of Spain became King of Spain (Carlos I), and Emperor of Holy Roman (Carl V).

DOC.Title: Carlos I
DOC.TEXT: The first Spanish king from the Habsburg family (ranking 1516-56). In 1519 he became Emperor of the Holy Roman Emperor of the Holy Roman (Carl VI) by winning the campaign with Francois I of France and its dominant domains are not only European Spain, Netherlands, Naples, Milan, Austria but also a vast It extends to the Americas. As King of Spain promoted the management of the Americas, as Emperor of the Holy Romans faced Luther 's religious reform, suffered from the fight against the Lutheran. In 1556 he retired Spain, etc to his son Felipe and Austria to his brother Ferdinand.

DOC.Title: Felipe II
DOC.TEXT: A king from the Habsburg family (ranking 1556-98). He inherited the vast territory of Carlos I to the Americas and built the heyday of the absolute monarchy of Spain through victory in the Lepanto war and consolidation of Portugal. At one time, he married to Queen Mary I of England and aimed at its control. Promoted passionate Catholic policies to lead the Dutch War of the Netherlands, in 1588 the invincible fleet was defeated to the UK and the national strength declined.

DOC.Title: Battle of Lepanto
DOC.TEXT: The fight that the Spanish fleet destroyed the Ottoman fleet. Lepant is the land of the western coast of Greece.

DOC.Title: Portugal consolidation
DOC.TEXT: Spain was forced by multiplying the confusion and disconnection of the Portuguese royal family. It also annexed the vast overseas territory, its territory to the Americas and Asia, and Spain literally "the country where the sun does not set".

DOC.Title: "The country where the sun does not settle"
DOC.TEXT: A Spanish designation that owned colonies throughout the Earth's surface and formed the world's largest colonial empire.

DOC.Title: Nederland
DOC.TEXT: Currently in the Netherlands and Belgium. Since the Middle Ages, the prosperity of relay trade and woolen fabric production, many cities have been established. In 1477 he became Austria-Habsburg family territory by marriage and moved to the Spanish-Hapsburg family in 1556. After that, the northern seven states became independent in the Netherlands independence war.

DOC.Title: Goisen
DOC.TEXT: In the meaning of "beggar", the word which the Spanish governor has exhorted the alliance of the aristocrat who united in opposition to Spanish tyranny in 1566 originates from the etymology. It came to point to the Calvin school which became the center of resistance.

DOC.Title: Dutch War of the Netherlands
DOC.TEXT: A war brought against the tyranny of Spain by new players of Nederland. After the departure of 10 southern provinces, 7 northern provinces formed the Utrecht alliance, declared independence in 1581. After that, after the destruction of the Spanish invincible fleet, virtually independence was achieved in the 1609 armistice treaty, and in 1648 the Westphalia Treaty was also internationally approved for independence.

DOC.Title: South of 10 states
DOC.TEXT: It almost corresponds to the present Belgium. Since the woolen industry was crowded, there were relatively relatively Catholics in Nederland, and it succumbed to the pressure of Spain, dropped out of the independence movement in 1579 and it moved to the beginning of the 18th century (Rastat treaty of 1714) until the Spanish territory .

DOC.Title: Northern 7 states
DOC.TEXT: It almost corresponds to the current Netherlands. Maintaining independence, continued resistance even after the fallout of the south, centered on new woolen textile companies and self-employed farmers.

DOC.Title: Utrecht Alliance
DOC.TEXT: An alliance formed by Utrecht in the northern seven provinces after the departure of 10 southern provinces. We vowed to unite until the acquisition of freedom of religion, opposed to tyranny of home country.

DOC.Title: Holland State
DOC.TEXT: The current central area of ​​the Netherlands. Etymology of Japanese name "Netherlands". As the most influential state among the northern seven provinces, I was able to be the center of the war of independence.

DOC.Title: Declaration of Independence, Netherlands
DOC.TEXT: Seven northern provinces declared independence of the federal Republic of Nederland.

DOC.Title: Armistice Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Convention that Spain approved the independence of the Netherlands effectively. Internationally, it was officially recognized by the Treaty of Westphalia in 1648.

DOC.Title: Federal Republic of Netherland, Netherlands
DOC.TEXT: It was born in the independence declaration of 1581. Each country was officially approved by the Treaty of Westphalia in 1648. The Oranie family became governor general.

DOC.Title: Willem Orange, William Orange
DOC.TEXT: An Independent Leader and Eager Newpeople. Inaugurated the first governor of the Federal Republic of Nederland (ranked 1579-84), but was assassinated by the Old.

DOC.Title: Dutch governor, Dutch president
DOC.TEXT: The name of the official of the Spanish territory is attached, the highest government post of the federal republic of the Netherlands. Congressional restrictions are strong. The owner of the Oranie family strayed, but in 1806 Napoleon 's younger brother became king of the Netherlands and was abolished.

DOC.Title: East India Company, Dutch East India Company
DOC.TEXT: In 1602, it was founded by consolidating a large number of trading companies. It monopolized primarily Asian trade and became the basis for the prosperity of the 17th century the Netherlands. It was chased by the competition with the UK and broke down in 1799 due to internal corruption.

DOC.Title: West India Company, Holland West India Company
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1617 as a model of East India Company, acquired a patent right for 21 years. In the Atlantic region I was involved in capturing, plundering, trade activities, etc. but lost due to competition with Portugal and the UK and faded, broke up in 1791.

DOC.Title: Antwerp, Antwerp
DOC.TEXT: Commercial city in northern Belgium. Since the latter half of the 15th century, it became the most prosperous city in Europe with intermediary trade and the financial industry, but it was devastated by the occupation of the Spanish army in 1585.

DOC.Title: Amsterdam
DOC.TEXT: The capital of the Netherlands (the center of legislation and administration is The Hague). Following the devastation of Antwerpen, the independence of the Netherlands, it became the center of the economic, political and cultural aspects of the Federal Republic of Nederland, boasting the prosperity of Western Europe in the first half of the 17th century.

DOC.Title: Rotterdam
DOC.TEXT: The second largest city in the Netherlands. One of the world's seaport city. It was developed as a commercial city including the opening of the first stock exchange of the Netherlands.

DOC.Title: hegemon country
DOC.TEXT: It refers to a country based on the overwhelming economic (commercial and industrial · financial) capabilities, with power that is unparalleled in terms of politics and military. Historically, the Netherlands in the mid 17th century, Britain in the 19th century (Pax-Pleistanica) and the United States of America (Pax-Americana) in the latter half of the 20th century corresponded, exercising a decisive influence in the international community of that age.

DOC.Title: Morning Tudor
DOC.TEXT: The reign of Henry VII to Elizabeth I. British absolute monarchy was established, the time when internationalization also emerged. It moved to Stuart by the death of Elizabeth I.

DOC.Title: Henry VII
DOC.TEXT: The first British king of Tudor morning (ranking from 1485 to 1509). I ended the rose war and quickly expanded the kingship and lay the foundation for British absolute monarchy.

DOC.Title: Henry VIII
DOC.TEXT: British king (ranking 1509-47). We established the British National Church by issuing the Emperor's Law in 1534, furthermore dissolution of the monastery, etc., established the absolute monarchy of Great Britain.

DOC.Title: Thomas = More
DOC.TEXT: British politician / humanist. In the era of Henry VIII, he was heavily used as a major law official, but against the king 's divorce, he was executed.

DOC.Title: Gentry, Township
DOC.TEXT: On the status was a commoner, but the landowner who formed the British dominance hierarchy with the few aristocrats since the end of the Middle Ages. He was primarily a rapporteur of the province, and he took charge of local administrations about key posts such as magistrate judges. Including a rich hierarchy such as doctors and lawyers. Moreover, accumulating wealth by managing and trade woolen textile manufacturers and entering the House of Representatives, conflicts with absolute kingship to protect privatized merchants, played a major role in the Puritan Revolution in the mid 17th century.

DOC.Title: Magistrate Magister
DOC.TEXT: Since the 14th century, unpaid honorary profession who took charge of local administration and trial. Mainly regional knights and gentlemen were appointed, and during the Tudor period, they played a part in centralization.

DOC.Title: woolen textile industry
DOC.TEXT: Representative industry in the UK since the late Middle Ages. Especially developed in rural areas. Until the 16 th century the technology in the finishing process was inferior, dependent on Nederland, but eventually became able to produce finished goods even in the UK, became the center of Europe.

DOC.Title: enclosure, enclosure, primary enclosure
DOC.TEXT: Because the woolen market expanded, for the pastor, lords and landlords picked up open farmlands from peasants and enclosed them with hedges and fences. The campaign in the 16th century England, many farmers lost the land, many of them became vagrants and social unrest increased, the government took a banning attitude.

DOC.Title: "Sheep eat humans"
DOC.TEXT: Thomas Mor used it to criticize the enclosure in his "utopia".

DOC.Title: Mary I
DOC.TEXT: Queen of England (ranking 1553-58). Henry VII and the first princess of Catherine. Taking a hard policy of returning to Old Man, he got married to the Spanish Crown Prince (later Felipe II) and bought the disappointment of the people.

DOC.Title: Elizabeth I
DOC.TEXT: Queen of England (ranking 1558-1603). Immediately after the throne 1559, promulgated the Unification Act established the British Church. Encouraged the advance of the economy to the American continent, against the Spanish under the control of Felibe II, in 1588 it destroyed the Spanish invincible fleet, raised the international status of Britain, opened the way for future maritime development. Domestically, we promoted mercantilist policies such as nurturing woolen textile industry, Establishment of East India company, efforts to centralize centralization by strengthening the Privy Council, etc., and revealed the extreme rise of British absolute monarchy. Through single, he became the last king of Tudor morning.

DOC.Title: East India Company, British East India Company
DOC.TEXT: 1600 Trading company founded by Elizabeth I. Given a trade exclusive right throughout Asia from the Cape of Good Hope to the Magellan Strait, it played a major role as the center for Asian expansion and colonial rule. After that it gradually lost the monopoly right of trade, and was broken up in 1858 India big rebellion.

DOC.Title: Invincible Fleet, Armada
DOC.TEXT: The world's largest Spanish fleet of those days. The Ottoman Imperial Navy was defeated at the Lepanto war, and it was nicknamed this name.

DOC.Title: Armada war
DOC.TEXT: The fight that the invincible fleet that hit England was destroyed by the activity of the British navy and windstorms. Since then, Spain lost control of the seas, the Netherlands became virtually independent, became a turning point for decline.

DOC.Title: Hawkins
DOC.TEXT: Both were British naval soldiers who participated in the game against Spain and played an active part in the Battle of Almada in 1588.

DOC.Title: Drake
DOC.TEXT: British navigator. I was known as the captain of a captured ship, but in 1577-80, I succeeded in the world's first time traveling around the world as an Englishman. After that, he also served as a deputy commander in the fight against the invincible fleet.

DOC.Title: Lauri
DOC.TEXT: UK soldier, explorer, colony. Participating in the Atlantic exploration, he was active in suppressing the Irish rebellion. Following the love of Elizabeth I, I colonized North America and built "Virginia colony", but it ended in failure. After that, he did exploration activities in the South America, but was later executed with treason.

DOC.Title: I caught ship, Private ship
DOC.TEXT: An armed ship of a private citizen who received a permission (foreign state ship looting permission) from the state (patented form) and was active. It occupied a large part of the British maritime forces in the 16th century and hit the Spanish silver fleet from the Americas. Activities such as drake are famous. Spain requested the UK to enforce the crackdown, Elizabeth I was the largest shareholder of a captive shipping company, eventually, caused the invincible fleet to be dispatched.

DOC.Title: Poor Law
DOC.TEXT: Law stipulating the relief of poor people and crackdown on vagrants. In 1601 in the late reign of Elizabeth, what was promulgated in the growing number of poor people due to progress of enclosure is famous.

DOC.Title: Valowa Morning
DOC.TEXT: French royal family. Following the cape disconnection, he succeeded to the throne, but Heng III was assassinated at the end of the Huguenot war and was severed and replaced with Bourbon morning.

DOC.Title: Catherine
DOC.TEXT: From the Medici family, Henry II of France (Prince 1547-59) is the princess. After sudden death of her husband thrust three young prince horses and intervened in politics. In particular, I planned the slaughter of Saint Barthelem, and made France a great turmoil, eventually leading to the destruction of the Valois dynasty.

DOC.Title: Charles IX
DOC.TEXT: French King (ranking from 1560 to 74). Mother Catherine was regent, but the Huguenot war broke out in its reign, and the massacre of Saint Barthelem took place.

DOC.Title: Huguenot War
DOC.TEXT: French religious war. A civil war in which the political struggle over the royalty of powerful aristocrats centered on the Duke of Guise caught a confrontation between the new and old.

DOC.Title: Slaughter of Saint Barthelemi
DOC.TEXT: In the early August 24, 1572 (Saint Barthelemi national holiday), the old denomination attacked the new denomination who had gathered in Paris to celebrate the wedding with King Henry and the sister of the king and Henry of the Bourbon family, mass genocide I was a case. There was Catherine 's plot behind this, but since that time the Huguenot war has become more complicated.

DOC.Title: Henry IV
DOC.TEXT: France = Bourbon first morning king (ranking 1589-1610). After throttling in the Valois dynasty throne, converted from Huguenot to Catholicism. In addition, he issued the king of Nant, and ended the Huguenot war. Centralized and accomplished overseas colonists, but was assassinated by Catholic priests.

DOC.Title: Bourbon Morning
DOC.TEXT: France Dynasty dynasty dynasty. Beginning with Henry IV and arriving at the height of the age of Louis XIV, despite being executed by Louis XVI in the French Revolution. After the fall of Napoleon, it revived, but in the July revolution he eventually left the royal right.

DOC.Title: King of Nantes, Order of Nantes
DOC.TEXT: Wang Dec issued by Henry IV. Given royalty of royalty equal to that of the Old church, firstly in modern Europe, it allowed the freedom of individual religion. The Huguenot War fell quickly and it became the starting point for French national unification.

DOC.Title: Louis XIII
DOC.TEXT: French King (ranking from 1610 to 43). Following the settlement of the religious war by the father Henry IV, he was awarded to Richelieu's minister and established absolute monarchy.

DOC.Title: Stop convocation meeting
DOC.TEXT: Called in 1614, dissolved in 15 years. It was not held until the French Revolution before 1789.

DOC.Title: Richelieu
DOC.TEXT: The aristocrat and the prime minister of Louis XIII (from 1624 to 42). I held down the great aristocracy, banished the political power of Huguenot, and tried to absolute the kingship. Externally, she pushed her full power to overthrow the Habsburg family and intervened in the thirty year war.

DOC.Title: Louis XIV
DOC.TEXT: King of the heydime of absolute monarchy of France (ranking 1643-1715). After 1661, he took charge of the royal government by taking the theory of kingship theory. Mr. Colbert appointed the Finance General Inspector to advance mercantilism, build a Palace of Versailles, and performed gorgeous court politics. However, they fought a raging invasion war and exacerbated financial budgets.

DOC.Title: Mazarin
DOC.TEXT: A politician born in Italy. The Prime Minister who took over after Richelieu (1642-61). In support of a young Louis XIV, externally, the Westphalia treaty of the war of 30 years of war was suppressed, Huisburgh family was held down, domestically suppressed Fland's turbulence, wiped out opposition forces of the king and promoted centralization.

DOC.Title: Friend's Random
DOC.TEXT: The high courts and aristocratic revolts opposed to the extension of the kingship, which happened in Paris. Mazarin finally crushed using division. It became the last noble rebellion of France.

DOC.Title: High Court
DOC.TEXT: The French Supreme Judicial Organization, maintained since the 13th century. Because he had the authority to judge the king 's decree, even the disturbance of the Friends became the base of resistance to the nobility' s king, but after the rebellion suppression he succumb to the king.

DOC.Title: Pyrenees Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty tied between France and Spain. It was decided that the defeated Spain will cede some territory to France, Princess of Spain will be after Louis XIV.

DOC.Title: "The Crisis of the 17th Century"
DOC.TEXT: An expression that shows that Europe in the 17th century (around 1620-1720) was attacked by various difficult situations compared with the booming 16th century. Social anxiety phenomena such as stagnation of economic activity, epidemic epidemic, food riot, witch hunting, as well as the thirty-year war mainly in Germany, the French stronghold, war and revolution such as British Puritan revolution and honor revolution It is interpreted in relation to this. Declines in temperature (small ice age) and declining prices due to a decrease in the influx of silver from the Americas are considered to be the main causes.

DOC.Title: Thirty Year War
DOC.TEXT: The last and greatest religious war that occurred mainly in Germany in the first half of the 17th century. Battle began from the religious confrontation between the new and the old houses in the Holy Roman Empire, but eventually the New Ethnic countries Denmark and Sweden participated in the nominal war with the episcopal side aid and expanded to the international war. However, in the last stage, the religious character of war faded because the former female France (the Bourbon family throne) fought on the side of the newlymen side to overthrow the sacred Roman Empire (the emperor is the Hapsburg family), which is the center of the Old Tribe side , The nature of the battle forces among the nations came to the fore. This war caused the German to be devastated, with the Westphalia Treaty the territory of the Holy Roman Empire gained almost complete sovereignty, the empire was effectively demolished, and the modernization of Germany was delayed.

DOC.Title: Bamen rebellion, Bohemian rebellion
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that the new denomination caused by the old denomen Vim New King 's Ferdinand (the Holy Roman emperor the following year) against the new denomination suppression. After this, a thirty year war began.

DOC.Title: Gustav Adolf
DOC.TEXT: King Sweden Gustav II (ranking from 1611 to 32). Allied with France, continuing to win the battle series in Germany, penetrated Germany nominally for Protestant Protection from 1630 to 32 years. In 1632 Rutzen's battle broke the emperor army under the command of Walenstein, but he was killed in the battle.

DOC.Title: Wallenstein, Warrenstein
DOC.TEXT: Captain of mercenary from Beamen. Employed by the emperor side, he fought back the Danish-Swedish army, became the center of the old-fashioned side, but was assassinated by the emperor group suspected its ambition.

DOC.Title: Mercenary Corps
DOC.TEXT: Army made up of soldiers hired by salary. In the Thirty Years War, Wallenstein led the Emperor and was active, but plundering by soldiers rampant and caused the German devastation.

DOC.Title: Westphalia Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of thirty years war. A peace conference was held in the two cities of Munster and Osnabruck in the Westfalia region of Germany. Contents include confirmation of Augsburg religious conspiracy and recognition of the Calvin faction, international independent recognition of Switzerland and the Netherlands independence, partial acquisition of Alsace Lorraine in France, acquisition of Sweden's West Bommeln, establishment of sovereignty of German nations, Attendance of the Representatives of France and Sweden to the Imperial Diet · Approval of voting rights etc. Also, the Holy Roman Empire is effectively dismantled (nominally remaining until 1806) in more than 300 countries (this convention is also referred to as "death certificate of the Holy Roman Empire"), France = Bourbon Family The overall superiority to both Habsburg families has become decisive. As each country participating in this conference passed the position as a sovereign state and the German countries also recognized nearly complete sovereignty and the international relations of the 17th-18th century were established, "As soon as the countries of the sovereign nation in Europe Establishment "was realized.

DOC.Title: Independence of Switzerland and the Netherlands
DOC.TEXT: I internationally recognized the independence from both Habsburgs.

DOC.Title: Alsace
DOC.TEXT: It became French territory with the three bishops of Verdun · Metz Tour in the Lorraine region.

DOC.Title: West Pommern
DOC.TEXT: The area on the southern part of the Baltic Sea, west of Oder River. It was Sweden territory from 1648 to 1720.

DOC.Title: "Baltic Empire"
DOC.TEXT: The Swedish designation which boasted a strong prosperity from the latter half of the 17th century to the beginning of the 18th century. It is due to the prosperity of the Baltic sea trade with the Westphalia Treaty under the control of the Baltic Sea under almost control.

DOC.Title: Famous innocence of the Holy Roman Empire
DOC.TEXT: The function as an Empire was lost as the Westphalia Treaty recognized the nearly complete sovereignty of the country within the Empire.

DOC.Title: Grand Duchy of Moscow
DOC.TEXT: Russia's nation built around Moscow in the 14th-16th century. It was under the rule of Kipchak-Han country (1243 ~ 1502), but with independence from Mongolia, we strengthened independence from Mongolia with strength, and succeeded independently in the era of Ivan III in the late 15th century. In the latter half of the sixteenth century Ivan IV reached his peak in the era, but it declined rapidly after its death, and it was destroyed in the confusion.

DOC.Title: Ivan IV
DOC.TEXT: The Grand Duke of Moscow (ranking 1533-84). Initially the aristocracy was holding power, but since 1547 he began his civil service, he called him Tsar. It was called "the thunderhead" with crackingly repressing the opposing people. I ordered Jörmark and set out to advance to Siberia. It also reinforced the serfdom system.

DOC.Title: Tsar
DOC.TEXT: The title of the emperor of Russia. It was used by Ivan III and became a public title in the 4 th generation. Russian emperor Caesar's Russian form, became the etymology of tourism.

DOC.Title: Tourism
DOC.TEXT: Russian monarchy tyranny. It began in the era of Ivan IV and was beaten by the Russian revolution of 1917.

DOC.Title: Kazan Han Country
DOC.TEXT: Kipchak = Mongolian state built in the middle of the Volga river, which flows through Han province. It was conquered by Ivan IV and annexed to Russia.

DOC.Title: Astrakhan-Han country
DOC.TEXT: Kipchak = Mongolian state built in the lower region of the Volga river that flows through Han province. It was conquered by Ivan IV and annexed to Russia.

DOC.Title: Cossack
DOC.TEXT: Living in the remote region of southern Russia, warrior group long for the horse. Since the 14th century, people who escaped the oppression of the serfdom system made living by pastoral fishery, fishery, hunting, trade, looting, etc. and formed an autonomous group. After the 16th century, it often rebelled against Russian tyranny, while on the other hand it was also used for remote defense of Russian empire, suppression of revolutionary movements, advance to Siberia, and so on.

DOC.Title: Siberia
DOC.TEXT: An area from the east of the Ural Mountains of Russia to the Pacific coast. Civil = Han country that first conquered is taken as the etymology. Since the 11th century, it was known as gold dust and fur production areas, but since Jellmark's exploration, it has been incorporated everyday under the rule of Russia.

DOC.Title: Jell mark
DOC.TEXT: Chairman of Don Cossack. Beyond the Ural Mountains occupied the capital of Civil-Han country in 1582, and made the opportunity for Russia to enter Siberia.

DOC.Title: Mikhail-Romanoff
DOC.TEXT: Romanov's founder. In 1613, he was elected Russian emperor at the national conference. It was young and lacking in political ability, but under that reign, strengthening of the serfdom system was promoted.

DOC.Title: Romanoff morning
DOC.TEXT: Since the ceremonial position of Mikhail Romanov, the Russian dynasty kept for more than 300 years until being beaten by the Russian Revolution of 1917. Featuring a tyranny of politics by village based on a serfdom system.

DOC.Title: Citizen Revolution, Bourgeois Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Political and social change that established a modern civil society by overthrowing the absolute monarchy that the growing citizen class hindered the development of capitalistic production. British Puritan Revolution, Honorary Revolution, American Independence Revolution, French Revolution are representative. The feudal status system was abolished, aiming at the formation of a society that guarantees individual freedom.

DOC.Title: British Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Another name for the Puritan revolution occurred in England in the mid 17th century. In accomplishing this civil revolution, Britain established the modern civil society the earliest in the world.

DOC.Title: Puritan, Puritan
DOC.TEXT: It means British Calvin school. Many in the industrial capitalist who purportedly worked and believed, religiously deepened the conflict with the King of the absolute monarchy and politically the privileged large commercial capitalist, sociologically with the old and the British religious faction .

DOC.Title: Puritan Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A citizen revolution that overthrew the absolute monarchy of the Stuart morning. It was called like this because there were many Puritans in the Congress who advanced the revolution.

DOC.Title: Independent self-employed farmer, Yeoman
DOC.TEXT: From the 14th century, farmers who became freelance free from agriculture in the UK and became to own some degree of farmland. In the Puritan Revolution, he fought with absolute royalty with the gentry.

DOC.Title: Gentry, Township
DOC.TEXT: The landowner of the commoner located between the lower aristocracy and rich farmers (independent farmer Yeoman). Some of them managed to manufacture woolen fabrics, accumulated further wealth, and some advanced to the House of Representatives, religiously many Puritans. For this reason, it was severely conflicting with the absolute monarchy which protected a privileged merchant and oppressed Puritan, playing a central role in the Puritan revolution in the mid 17th century.

DOC.Title: Stuart morning
DOC.TEXT: A dynasty established by the Stuart family who was immediately in line with the throne of Scotland since the 14th century, also serving as the throne of England at the beginning of the 17th century. In this era, the citizen revolution occurred twice against the king's tyranny, and Britain made a shedding to civil society.

DOC.Title: James I, James VI
DOC.TEXT: A child of Queen Mary-Stuart of Scotland. After becoming young and became King James VI of Scotland (rank 1567-1625), after receiving Elizabeth I, he became James I of King England (ranking 1603-25). Following the doctrine of royal authority, deepening the conflict by ignoring the parliament, financing was given by giving exclusive rights to privileged merchants. Religiously I took Puritan crackdown measures.

DOC.Title: Charles I
DOC.TEXT: King of England (ranking from 1625 to 49). He was the second son of James I and kept on absolute monarchy policy. Failed to suppress the Scottish rebellion, became financial difficulties, conflicted with Congress to take a tax increase plan, and was executed with a Puritan revolution.

DOC.Title: petition for rights
DOC.TEXT: A petition filed by the British Parliament for Charles I. Those opposed to taxation, illegal arrest etc. without Congressional consent. Charles I ignored this, dissolved Parliament, continued tyranny.

DOC.Title: Scottish rebellion
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that occurred because Charles I tried to force the system of British church in Scotland. The king lost to the rebel army and convoked the parliament for payment of reparations, but also from Parliament, it led to a rebellion of the Puritan revolution.

DOC.Title: Short-term Congress
DOC.TEXT: Charles I calls for the first time in 11 years to seek a tax increase in order to obtain Scotland 's rebellion suppression cost. However, as Congress rebounded against the king, it was broken up in three weeks.

DOC.Title: Long-term lecture
DOC.TEXT: Charles I who was defeated by the Scottish revolt and rejoined again to pay the reparation. The conflict between the royalists and parliamentary factions intensified here, and the civil war (Puritan Revolution) began in 1642. It continued until it was dissolved by Cromwell during the Republican era.

DOC.Title: royalist, royalist
DOC.TEXT: Groove that supported the king in the Puritan Revolution. Some aristocrats, privileged merchants, some conservative gentries, others joined in relationships of relatives and relatives, religiously there were many nationalities. Mainly the western part of England and the northern part became ground.

DOC.Title: Council faction
DOC.TEXT: A group that gathered to the parliament side with the Puritan revolution, and was praised as the king. Gentri Yeoman and small and medium-sized commercial and traders in the city, mainly religiously had a lot of Puritans. Eastern and southern England was the main ground, London was the center base.

DOC.Title: Cromwell
DOC.TEXT: A soldier / politician from Gentry. An enthusiastic Puritan, an independent leader within Congress. Defeated the royalist, then expelled the Presbyterian from Congress, executed King Charles I, established the Republic. Since 1653 as a lord of guardians, military dictatorship was forced.

DOC.Title: Iron Cavalry
DOC.TEXT: In 1643, the common name of cavalry centered on Gentri-Yeomann founded by Cromwell. The faith heart was thick, excellent in discipline, overwhelming the royal party army. In 1645, the new army was organized according to this.

DOC.Title: Battle of Nesby
DOC.TEXT: The battle where a new army newly organized in parliamentary faction destroyed the royal army and decided the battlefield. King escaped to Scotland, but in 1647 he was handed over to Congress.

DOC.Title: Presbyterian
DOC.TEXT: In the Congress, the majority formed mainly by aristocrats and large merchants. The elderly system and the constitutional monarchy were insisted, and it was a compromise with the king.

DOC.Title: Independent faction
DOC.TEXT: In the Congress, a group representing mainly the position of landlords and wealthy citizens. Restrained the compromising elders faction to the King and executed the king. On the other hand, I repressed the more radical horizontalists. The leader is Cromwell.

DOC.Title: Horizontal, equality
DOC.TEXT: A group representative of the positions of poor farmers, craftsmen, small citizens among the parliamentary groups. He strongly insisted on the equality of property rights and suffrage rights, sharply conflicted with independence. Lilburn was organized, supported by many lower rank officers and soldiers within the military. In 1649, it was cracked down by independent factions and it disappeared as a political faction.

DOC.Title: Charles I Execution
DOC.TEXT: January 1649

DOC.Title: Republic, Commonwealth
DOC.TEXT: It was the period of time when King was not the only one in British history, from the time immediately after the execution of the king to the restoration of the restoration. After 1653, Cromwell became the guardian lord and carried out severe military dictatorship.

DOC.Title: Conquest of Ireland
DOC.TEXT: Cromwell conquered the follow-up of the royalists as an excuse, confiscated the Irish land. UK rule and deprivation was severe and became a major cause of the serious Irish problem later.

DOC.Title: Conquest of Scotland
DOC.TEXT: Cromwell's conquest against Scotland. It invaded Scotland for the reason that Charles (II) of Charles I 's son was recognized as a king.

DOC.Title: Voyage Law
DOC.TEXT: The law established and issued by the Republican government under the guidance of Cromwell. During trade, we restricted the shipping of goods to British ships and ships of other countries. One of the mercantilist policies aimed at monopolizing the colonial trade by Britain, shutting out Netherlands vessels that are mainly based on relay trade. After the restoration of the royal government, it became an official parliament enactment law.

DOC.Title: UK = Dutch war, British orchid war
DOC.TEXT: War broke out due to the navigation method. First (1652-54), Secondary (1665-67), Third (1672-74). UK gradually put pressure on the Netherlands and robbed its maritime hegemony after the war.

DOC.Title: Lord Guardian
DOC.TEXT: Cromwell was appointed after dissolving the 1653 long-term parliament, the highest government position of the government and military. I made a military dictatorship for this position till the death of 58 years.

DOC.Title: Commercial Revolution in the UK
DOC.TEXT: Since the latter half of the 17th century, the British expanded colonies in the region surrounding the Atlantic Ocean (North America · West Indies), the trade with that region grew rapidly, the trade structure changed. A vast sugarcane plantation is managed in the cigarette in North America (south), in the West Indies (Jamaica), and in London and Glasgow there are also merchants who gained huge profits from trade with this region, the later industrial revolution The accumulation of capital for.

DOC.Title: Restoration Restoration
DOC.TEXT: After the death of Cromwell, the Presbyterian who revived the power reached a compromise with the royalist, admitted the revival of the royal government subject to the respect of Parliament, that Charles II throne.

DOC.Title: Charles II
DOC.TEXT: A child of Charles I. During the revolution, he took over from France and the Netherlands, was hostile to the British revolutionary regime, then returned home and reigned (royal restoration, ranking 1660 to 85). I attempted to go against absolute monarchy, conflicts with Congress.

DOC.Title: Examination Law
DOC.TEXT: Legislation enacted by Congress, which contravenes the king's Catholic tolerance policy and limits official inauguration to nationalists. It was abolished in 1828.

DOC.Title: Non-Kokaku
DOC.TEXT: Those who do not belong to the National Church. However, it usually does not include Catholic, and refers to something that does not belong to the National Church among the Protestant.

DOC.Title: Act on Personnel Protection
DOC.TEXT: Law prohibiting arrest and trial not by law. Congress enacted against the tyranny of Charles II.

DOC.Title: Tori, Tori party
DOC.TEXT: A nickname attached by the opponents to the group who admits James, the younger brother of Charles II and famous as a Catholic, to the throne, the meaning of "outlaws in Ireland". The supporters of this faction are many of the clergy of the national church and conservative landowners, after which they will develop into a Conservative Party.

DOC.Title: Whig, Whig Party, Wig, Wig Party
DOC.TEXT: For the group who does not recognize James as a heir to the throne, the nickname Tori added is "the rebellion of Scotland". Proponents are progressive aristocrats and commerce and industry, and then develop into Liberal Party.

DOC.Title: James II
DOC.TEXT: King, Charles II 's younger brother, who tried to restore tyranny and revive Catholicism (ranking 1685-88). It was forced to abdicate with honorary revolution and exiled to France.

DOC.Title: Honorary Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution forced James II to abdicate. Because the boy was born a boy, Congress gave Mary the daughter of James II and her husband Mr. Willem of the Netherlands as king, and James II exiled to France. Boasting that political change has progressed without bloodshed and great chaos, it was named the honorary revolution.

DOC.Title: Declaration of Rights
DOC.TEXT: Declaration passed by parliament in 1689. The content that the king can not take action against legislation, administration, justice, taxation, military etc. contrary to the intention of Congress, the advantage of Congress against the royalty is indicated. William and his wife approached and decided upon this declaration.

DOC.Title: Rules of Rights
DOC.TEXT: A legal statement of the declaration of rights. Clarifying parliament sovereignty, including enacting / abolishing legislation, abolishing taxation, draft conscription is necessary for parliament approval, became the origin of constitutional politics in the UK.

DOC.Title: Constitutional Politics
DOC.TEXT: Politics performed under basic laws such as the Constitution. After the honorary revolution, Congress became the center of politics and the royalty is restricted, it was first established in the UK in the world and became the fundamental principle of modern democratic politics.

DOC.Title: William III
DOC.TEXT: British King (ranking 1689-1702). Willem, Duke of Oranjez. Since 1672, he was in the position of Governor of the Netherlands, but became King of England with honorary revolution and co-governed with Mary. Cooperating with Congress, he paved the way for the establishment of parliamentary politics.

DOC.Title: tolerance law
DOC.TEXT: Law that recognizes Protestant religious freedom established by William III in 1689.

DOC.Title: Mary II
DOC.TEXT: The daughter of James II. Wife of Willem Oranie. He returned to the UK with a honorary revolution and throne, and co-ordinated with his husband (rank 1689-94).

DOC.Title: Queen Anne
DOC.TEXT: Queen of England (ranking from 1702 to 14). My sister of Mary II. Because all the children who were supposed to be successors died while they were young, the Queen's death disrupted the Stuart morning. In this era, the UK annexed Scotland and expanded overseas colonies.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Great Britain, Kingdom of Great Britain
DOC.TEXT: In 1707 of Queen Anne, England and Scotland, which had been in the relationship of the same allies, have been merged and formed.

DOC.Title: Hanover election
DOC.TEXT: From the 17th century, German prestigious nobleman who was the electorate. Since I was able to marry the daughter of James I of the first Staart morning, I had a blood relationship with the Stuart family.

DOC.Title: Hanover morning
DOC.TEXT: It was established in the discontinuation of the Stuart morning, with the blood German Hanover house George.

DOC.Title: Windsor morning
DOC.TEXT: Hanover morning has been renamed the name of the royal palace since 1917, by hitting the enemy country German style in the First World War.

DOC.Title: George I
DOC.TEXT: Founder of the Hanover morning (ranking 1714-27). The greatest grandson of James I. Because I could not understand English and stayed in Germany a lot, the system of Prime Minister and Cabinet who took charge of the administration on behalf of the King, developed on behalf of the King.

DOC.Title: Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Origin is the meaning of a closed room at the secretary 's conference during the restoration period. After the honor revolution, securing the support of Congress became important, and a modern interior prototype was formed in the reign of George I.

DOC.Title: responsible cabinet system
DOC.TEXT: A system in which the majority party in Congress organizes the Cabinet and is responsible to Congress. Despite the King King George II wanting to keep the cabinet on Walpole, it began with the fact that Walpole resigned as a few supporters in Parliament.

DOC.Title: Political party politics
DOC.TEXT: Political parties are politicians in which multiple political parties are in charge of the administration in turn and in principle the majority party organizes a cabinet.

DOC.Title: Walpole
DOC.TEXT: Politician of Whig Party. It is said to be the first Prime Minister (1721-42). It strengthened the foundation of British parliamentary politics and cabinet system.

DOC.Title: "The King reigns but does not rule"
DOC.TEXT: Words that symbolize the status of the king in Britain where parliamentary politics has developed.

DOC.Title: Bank of England
DOC.TEXT: The central bank in the UK. Founded in 1694, since then, with the development of British capitalism it became a dominant global financial world.

DOC.Title: Methane Convention
DOC.TEXT: Treaty of trade that the United Kingdom has tied to Portugal. Instead of importing Portuguese wines with low tariffs, they are allowed to export woolen fabrics, etc., and they dominated over other countries in portugal trade.

DOC.Title: Louis XIV
DOC.TEXT: King of the heydime of absolute monarchy of France (ranking 1643-1715). After 1661, he took charge of the royal government by taking the theory of kingship theory. He decided to use Colbert, promoted mercantilism, built the Palace of Versailles and carried out gorgeous court politics. However, it caused an invasive wars of aggression and exacerbated fiscal budget.

DOC.Title: "Sun King"
DOC.TEXT: An alias of Louis XIV.

DOC.Title: "朕 is a nation"
DOC.TEXT: A word indicating absolute monarch 's national view. It is reported as the word of Louis XIV which was at the height of the absolute monarchy.

DOC.Title: Colbert
DOC.TEXT: A politician from a citizen. He served Louis XIV and strengthened its finances by conducting typical mercantilist policies such as the creation of privilege manufacturers and rebuilding of East India Company as General Director General of Finance (1665 ~ 72).

DOC.Title: Colbertism
DOC.TEXT: Mercantilism that Colbert did. The contents include protection trade, promotion of patent trading companies such as East India Company (revitalization in 1664), establishment of Royal Manufacturers in weapons manufacture and woolen textile industry, control and protection of handicraft guilds.

DOC.Title: Royal Manufacturer, Privilege Manufacturer
DOC.TEXT: Factory based on factory handicraft founded by Colbert. In order to expand the trade surplus, we mainly produced woolen fabrics (Gobelin weave) for export.

DOC.Title: East India Company Rebuilding
DOC.TEXT: It was rebuilt as part of Colbert 's mercantilist policy.

DOC.Title: Palace of Versailles
DOC.TEXT: Great Palace Louis XIV built in the southwest of Paris. Huge money, completed in 1682, spending more than 20 years of age, was used as a royal palace until 1789. It is renowned for baroque luxurious architecture and interior decoration, extensive garden. France became the symbol of absolute monarchy, the courts of Europe tried to imitate its architecture and court life style.

DOC.Title: Abolition of the King of Nantes, Abolition of Nantes' Declaration
DOC.TEXT: It was enforced as Catholic-oriented policy of Louis XIV. Many Huguenots fled outside the country, and it hit the French industry and economy.

DOC.Title: Natural Border Theory
DOC.TEXT: A theory that the border should be determined according to nature (geographical conditions) such as mountains and rivers. Especially in France in the Louis XIV era, it was claimed that its borders should be the Rhine, Pyrenees, Alps mountains, etc. It was regarded as the reason for the French invasion war.

DOC.Title: Southern Nederland inheritance war
DOC.TEXT: The battle over the right to inherit the Spanish Nederland. Louis XIV insisted on the right to inherit and was dispatched, but was blocked by UK, the Netherlands, etc. and only gained some territory.

DOC.Title: Dutch invasion war
DOC.TEXT: French revenge fight against what the Netherlands interfered during the Southern Nederland inheritance war. Because Britain and Habsburgs (Spain-Holy Roman Empire) supported the Netherlands, France only gained some territory.

DOC.Title: Farutsu War, Pulz Inheritance War
DOC.TEXT: The battle that Louis XIV gave to the right to inherit the right of the Empress Fartz of Germany. The sacred Roman Emperor ended without obtaining because the opposition against the nation and the Augsburg alliance was opposed.

DOC.Title: Carlos II
DOC.TEXT: Spain = the last king of the Habsburg family (standing 1665 to 1700). He died without leaving the inheritance due to his illness.

DOC.Title: Spain succession war
DOC.TEXT: War broke against Austria, the United Kingdom and the Netherlands as an enemy by Louis XIV claiming the succession of the grandchild Felipe to the disconnection of the royal family of Spain. France struggled in isolation and inferiority continued in the fight in the colony, and it ended with the Utrecht Convention. [In addition, in the Rastat treaty of 1714, the fight with the Holy Roman Empire was also over. ]

DOC.Title: Felipe V, Philippe V
DOC.TEXT: The grandson of Louis XIV. Became Spain King (ranking 1700-24, 24-46), became the father of Spain = Bourbon Morning (1700-1931).

DOC.Title: Utrecht Convention
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of the Spanish succession war. Although the nations approve the succession of Félipé V to the throne of Spain, the French and Spanish nationalities are forbidden forever, and it is said that many of the overseas territories of both countries will be transferred to the UK.

DOC.Title: Gibraltar
DOC.TEXT: Britain acquired from Spain.

DOC.Title: Minorca Island
DOC.TEXT: Britain acquired from Spain. In 1783 again, it becomes Spain territory.

DOC.Title: Hudson Bay Region
DOC.TEXT: Britain acquired from France.

DOC.Title: Newfoundland
DOC.TEXT: Britain acquired from France.

DOC.Title: Acadia
DOC.TEXT: Britain acquired from France.

DOC.Title: Rastat treaty
DOC.TEXT: Treaty concluded between Holy Roman emperor and Louis XIV. Austria possessed the Spanish territory Nederland, Milano, Napoli and Sardinia, which completely ended the Spanish succession war.

DOC.Title: Louis XV
DOC.TEXT: French King (ranking from 1715 to 74). The great grandchild of Louis XIV. French absolute monarchy showed weakness, suffering from defeat in war and financial difficulties.

DOC.Title: Brandenburg Electoral Country
DOC.TEXT: In 1134, a country that was founded as a remote border area in the Oder River basin from the West Bank of the River Elbe. After 1415, Hohenzollern family continued to dominate as elector.

DOC.Title: Hohenzollern family
DOC.TEXT: Early in the 15th century I gained the position of the Brandenburg electorate, then Prussian King, the family who produced the German emperor.

DOC.Title: elected chief
DOC.TEXT: Powerful princes of the sacred book with the right to elect the King of Germany (Emperor). It was limited to 7 people in the provision of the Kim's Imperial Book of 1356, but it was added later.

DOC.Title: German Knights
DOC.TEXT: One of the three major religious Order groups established during the Crusades. After the failure of the Crusader in the 13th century, he was active in the East Eastern colony, Christianized the land of the Baltic Sea coast to build the Knights of Germany and became the basis of later Prussia.

DOC.Title: Prussia, Prussia
DOC.TEXT: The name of the indigenous Baltic residents is the source of the place name. In the 13th century the Order of the Germans conquered and became a German minority, became a principality in 1525, and in 1618 the Brandenburg elector was inherited and became Hohenzollern family. In the Spanish succession war, it was acknowledged that he went on to participate in the Holy Roman emperor (Habsburg family) side and was promoted to the kingdom in 1701, and then further developed.

DOC.Title: Democratic Prussian
DOC.TEXT: A country where the head of the German Order of the Kings got transformed into New Guild (Lutheran) in 1525, secularized the territory. In 1618, merged with the Brandenburg electorate country, formed the same coalition.

DOC.Title: Friedrich I
DOC.TEXT: Prince Prussia (ranking 1701-13). During the Spanish succession war, the Roman Emperor (Habsburg) side participated in the war, promoted to the kingdom of 1701, the foundation of the subsequent development was established.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Prussia
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1701 as a promotion from the principality, it is a foundation. In the northeastern part of Germany that continued to divide, we rationalized administrative and monetary affairs and strengthened armaments, and gradually emerged.

DOC.Title: Friedrich-Wilhelm I
DOC.TEXT: Prussian King (ranking 1713-40). Protect industrial development. After conscription system, the military service was improved to over 80,000 people, and it was called "military king." It laid the foundation of Prussia's military absolute monarchy.

DOC.Title: Friedrich II, Friedrich the Great
DOC.TEXT: Prussian King (ranking 1740-86). In cooperation with the Yunker factions, we promoted bureaucracy and strengthening of the military, without fighting the Austrian succession war / seven year war, made Prussia a powerful country of Europe. In addition, it was an enlightenment tyrant who endeavored to promote academics such as having friendship with Voltaire. In 1772 I participated in the first division of Poland.

DOC.Title: Austria
DOC.TEXT: A country located in the middle of Europe. It became the territory of the Habsburg family since 1278 and dominated until 1918. Since 1438, as the same family ruled the Holy Roman emperor's position effectively, it became the center of the empire until the Holy Roman Empire became famous in the 1648 Treaty of Westphalia.

DOC.Title: Composite nation state
DOC.TEXT: A country possessing areas where several ethnic groups live. In the 17th-18th centuries, Austria including checker 's Bamen and Magyar' s Hungarian are typical, but the national integration was accompanied by difficulties.

DOC.Title: Karlovitz treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty between the Ottoman Empire and Austria, Poland and the Republic of Venezia. As a result, Austria gave Hungary and its surroundings from the Ottoman Empire and established hegemony in East and Central Europe.

DOC.Title: Carl VI
DOC.TEXT: Holy Roman emperor from Habsburg family (ranking 1711-40). Because there was no male heir, he left the law to inherit the throne to let her daughter Maria Terezia inherit the territory of the Habsburg family.

DOC.Title: Maria = Theresia
DOC.TEXT: The Grand Duke of Austria (ranking from 1740 to 80). It inherits the vast Habsburg family territory and is also called the empress. In the Austrian succession war and the seven year war that happened over the succession of the Habsburg family lost Shrejaen, we made various reforms such as nurturing domestic industry and alleviating the service of serfs and trying to maintain national strength. After 1765 he joined Joseph II as co-ruler, and participated in the first Polish division in 1972.

DOC.Title: Duke Bavaria, Public Bavaria
DOC.TEXT: Due to blood ties with the Habsburg family, Maria Terezia and her husband Franz claimed the right to succeed the throne and opened up the Austrian succession war.

DOC.Title: Austria succession war
