DOC.TEXT: It means the whole area of ​​the current Tohoku coastal area of ​​the United States. Many Puritans settled after Pilgrim-Fathers in 1620 and development has progressed, and today a purely-like atmosphere remains, which is the center of academic and cultural interest in the United States.

DOC.Title: Pilgrim = Fathers, Pilgrimage founder
DOC.TEXT: 102 people who landed in Plymouth, North America at the end of 1620 at the Mayflower. They were said to be Puritans who went to the United States in search of freedom of religion from Britain under the absolute monarchy in the morning of Stuart, and became mythicalized as "the founder of the faithful Americans", but in reality they are many other than Puritans People were also included.

DOC.Title: Mayflower No.
DOC.TEXT: Pilgrim fathers' small sail boat. 180 Drain water.

DOC.Title: Plymouth
DOC.TEXT: Small town in southeast Boston. Pilgrim fasher's landing place.

DOC.Title: Massachusetts
DOC.TEXT: One state of the New England colony. Autonomous colony built by Puritan in 1629. Boston was the center and played a big part in the independence war.

DOC.Title: Maryland
DOC.TEXT: One of 13 colonies. It was built in 1632.

DOC.Title: New York State, New York State
DOC.TEXT: The Netherlands' New Netherlands colony was occupied by the UK in 1664 and renamed. One of 13 colonies.

DOC.Title: Pencil Venier
DOC.TEXT: In 1681, the Lords colony which Quewakers, a faction of the New Testament, built as a place of relief. One of 13 colonies. Founded in the meaning of "the town of fraternity" from the ideal of the Quewaker, Philadelcia City became the central city of the United States at the beginning of the foundation.

DOC.Title: Georgia
DOC.TEXT: 13 In the southern part of the colony, the colony which was built the longest in 1732 for the relief of British debtors.

DOC.Title: 13 colonies
DOC.TEXT: British 13 colonies established in the eastern coast of North America by the first half of the 18th century. It was built by immigrants seeking economic interests and political and religious freedom, and in colonial era there were three forms of autonomy, lord and owner, both have independent parliament, the residents are domestic affairs It increased the right to speak about.

DOC.Title: colony council
DOC.TEXT: In each colony, a parliament made up of resident representatives, established following the British parliamentary tradition. The Virginia Parliament of 1619 was first established in each colony.

DOC.Title: Plantation, Great Farm
DOC.TEXT: A large farm which mainly produces commodity crops such as tobacco, rice and indigo by using a guy. Developed in the southern colony.

DOC.Title: Planter
DOC.TEXT: Management of plantations. I translate it as a farmer.

DOC.Title: Black guy
DOC.TEXT: As a plantation's labor force, African-born black guy imported and overworked. In North America, it was the first time that it was imported to Virginia in 1619, but since the end of the 18 th century the demand for raw cotton increased due to the progress of the British Industrial Revolution, the slavery system was established again in the United States.

DOC.Title: British mercantilist policy
DOC.TEXT: Policy for national wealth enhancement taken in the UK. For the colonies (the United States), they will give priority to the interests of the home country (the UK), to supply resources and position them as purchasers of British goods, to suppress free trade and industrial development It was. This policy was relatively slowly operated until the seventh year of the war in the mid 18th century, but after the war it was strengthened, the colonies side repelled, leading to an independent war. Representative mercantilist policies before the seven year war include the voyage method (1651, 60), the wool products law (1699), the hat law (1732) etc.

DOC.Title: Seven Years War
DOC.TEXT: In the Americas the French = Indian War (1755-63). Britain who won the victory strengthened the mercantilist policy with the nominal war charge burden, strengthened the taxation policy, cracking down the close trade of colonies that had been silent before.

DOC.Title: George III
DOC.TEXT: King King of England (ranking 1760 to 1820). He attempted to strengthen the royal power, interferes with colonial autonomy and caused the American independence revolution.

DOC.Title: Sugar method
DOC.TEXT: A law that amends the molasses method (1733), enhances the import duty of sugar and molasses and punishment for close trade. The colonial side violently opposed the stamp method.

DOC.Title: stamp method
DOC.TEXT: Law that obliges the affixing of stamps issued by the home country to all the documents such as law · commercial relations · newspaper etc · publications. For colonists it is a new taxation other than tariffs, a violent opposition campaign occurred in each colony as an infringement of the autonomy of colonies, and was abolished the following year.

DOC.Title: "No taxation without representation"
DOC.TEXT: Words expressing the logic of the colonies who opposed the stamp method. Because the colonial side has not sent representatives to the mainland assembly, the mainland parliament has no right to tax colonists. It was stated from thought that the right to vote and tax liability should be integrated.

DOC.Title: Townsend Law
DOC.TEXT: Legislation aimed at strengthening taxation as stipulated by the suggestion of the Treasury Department Treasury. Import duties have been imposed on tea, glass, paper, paint and others.

DOC.Title: Tea law
DOC.TEXT: The law the mainland parliament sent directly to tea to the American colonies and the exclusive right to sell tea to East India Company. Colonial merchants and radicals fiercely opposed and triggered the outbreak of the Independence War.

DOC.Title: Boston Tea Party Case
DOC.TEXT: A case where radical radical citizens opposed to tea law attacked the East Indian company ship that had entered Boston and dumped all of the loaded tea into the sea. After that, the home country clarified the repressive attitude and the colonial side rapidly evolved.

DOC.Title: Boston harbor closure
DOC.TEXT: Retaliation Measures against the Boston Tea Party Incident in the UK Mainland. At the same time, it also enacted a law stipulating armed forces armed forces and the Massachusetts colonial self-governing power.

DOC.Title: American Revolutionary War
DOC.TEXT: A war that began as a result of armed conflict in 1775. In 1976 the declaration of independence was announced. The colonial side was forced to struggle at first, but continued to fight against militia. British European countries supported the colonial side and the state became advantageous as Britain was isolated internationally, and the colonial side achieved independence in 1783 Paris Convention.

DOC.Title: Continental Conference
DOC.TEXT: A liaison conference consisting of representatives of 13 colonies (states). The first was held in Philadelphia in September 1774. In the first round of protests against the home government declared to form a trade deal alliance, showed refusal of unfair taxation and colonial side united. In the second round of May 1975, he appointed Washington as General Commander of the Colonial Army. After adopting the Declaration of Independence in 1776, it acted as the de facto US government.

DOC.Title: Philadelphia
DOC.TEXT: The capital of the Pennsylvania colony. "Town of fraternity" constructed by William Penn. The Continental Congress, Declaration of Independence, Constitution Establishment Meeting, etc. were held and it was regarded as the capital of the United States between 1790 and 1800.

DOC.Title: Concord
DOC.TEXT: A town in the northwest suburb of Boston. 1975 April 19 British troops tried to pick up the weapons of Concord, armed conflict occurred at Concord and Lexington, and it became the beginning of the Revolutionary War.

DOC.Title: Battle of Lexington
DOC.TEXT: The First Battle of the Revolutionary War. In the northwest suburbs of Boston, the colonial militia army was almost equal to the home army army.

DOC.Title: Washington
DOC.TEXT: A politician from Virginia 's wealthy planter. He was appointed General Commander of the Colonial Army at the Continental Conference of 1775 and led the war of independence to victory. Afterwards, he served as chairman of the Constitutional Conference and became the first President of the United States (1789-97).

DOC.Title: Patrick = Henri
DOC.TEXT: Leader of independence movement. Rapidly patriotic school. In the year of the Virginia colony council in 1975 he gave a speech that he was "free or dead," and insisted strongly against the home country.

DOC.Title: Thomas-Pain
DOC.TEXT: A British-born writer / revolution thinker. In 1776 he wrote "Common = Sense" and raised the mind of independence. Afterwards he served as a member of the National Assembly with the French Revolution.

DOC.Title: "Common = sense", "common sense"
DOC.TEXT: Pamphlet published by January 1776 Paine. From the home country of the royal government appealed the legitimacy of colonial independence and the necessity of establishing a republic with plain text. It sold 120,000 copies in three months, boosting public opinion for the war of independence.

DOC.Title: Independence Declaration, American Independence Declaration
DOC.TEXT: Declaration that Jefferson drafted and was adopted at the 2nd continental conference. It consists of three parts, arguing fundamental human rights · revolutionary right based on Rock 's natural law thought at the first part, then enumerating the tyranny of King George III of England, finally bringing independence of 13 states Declared. It aimed to clarify the reasons for independence both inside and outside and to assert its justification. However, he was hostile to the Indians and he did not take up the black guy.

DOC.Title: Jefferson
DOC.TEXT: A politician from Branter of Virginia. After drafting the Declaration of Independence of America, he became the third President of the United States (Tenure 1801-09).

DOC.Title: Royal factions, school children
DOC.TEXT: Colonies who supported the home country during the period of independence war. It is said to be at least ten percent of the colonial population of 2.5 million people (there is a theory that it is one-third), mainly by high-level officials, national church clerics, large merchants, and land owner. Also, most indigenous Indians were anti-independents.

DOC.Title: Patriotic school
DOC.TEXT: A colony who supported and promoted the independence war. There are many planters, self-employed farmers, small and medium-sized commerce and industry, and it is regarded as about one-third of the colonial population. In addition to the royal and patriotic groups, there were also many middle-aged men who wanted reconciliation with their home countries.

DOC.Title: Battle of Saratoga
DOC.TEXT: The battle where the American army surrendered the British army in the land of the Hudson River in New York State. On this occasion the following year, the United States and France Alliance was formed.

DOC.Title: Franklin
DOC.TEXT: Politicians, writers, scientists. After succeeding in the printing industry and publishing industry, he devised a lightning rod as a scientist. He served as a drafting committee for independence and in 1776-85 as a French ambassador, succeeded in obtaining French assistance.

DOC.Title: Participation in France
DOC.TEXT: France of Louis XVI first approved the independence of the United States and fought and declared war with Britain by joining the French alliance. I was aiming to recapture the colonies deprived of England, but after the war, I fell into financial difficulties and became the cause of the French Revolution.

DOC.Title: Spain participation
DOC.TEXT: I fought against and against the French allies with France.

DOC.Title: Netherlands participation
DOC.TEXT: I fought against and against the French allies with France.

DOC.Title: Armed neutral alliance
DOC.TEXT: The alliance formed by the advocacy of Russian empress Empathelea II against the blockade of Britain against the United States sea. Sweden, Denmark, Prussia, Portugal etc. participated. It isolated Britain internationally and indirectly assisted the independence of the United States.

DOC.Title: La Fayette
DOC.TEXT: French liberal aristocracy. Following the influence of the Enlightenment Thought, he joined the American Independence Army as a soldier in 1777-81.

DOC.Title: Kosushiko
DOC.TEXT: Patriots and soldiers in Poland. After studying in France, he joined the American Independence Army from 1776 to 1984 and was active as a Washington counterpart. After returning home, I opposed Borland division and I was reluctant to Russia.

DOC.Title: Battle of Yorktown
DOC.TEXT: The town of east coast of Virginia. The United States and France Allied victory won the British Army virtually and confirmed the victory of the independence warfare virtually.

DOC.Title: Paris Convention
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty on the independence war between the United States and Britain. The UK approved (1) full independence of the United States, (2) ceded Louisiana east of the Mississippi River.

DOC.Title: Louisiana east of the Mississippi River
United States
DOC.TEXT: A country that was established as a gentle association of 13 states with its own constitution and parliament under the Union Rule of 1777. It became a modern federal state by the enactment of the Constitution of the United States of America in 1787 and the establishment of the federal government and Congress in 1989.

DOC.Title: American Coalition Agreement
DOC.TEXT: The first constitution in the United States approved at the continental conference. Effective in 1981. The country was named the United States (UnitedStates of America). In addition, the Union Council (central government), which is composed of representatives of each provincial assembly, maintains substantial sovereignty, freedom and independence, and has the authority of defense, diplomacy, casting, etc., but the right of collection and trade It was forbidden to hold regulatory rights and permanent forces, and so forth.

DOC.Title: Constitution establishment meeting
DOC.TEXT: Meeting held in Philadelphia, convened by the Union Congress, chaired by Washington. A powerful centralized draft constitution was created to replace the Union Rule.

DOC.Title: Constitution of the United States of America
DOC.TEXT: Constitution enacted in 1787. In 1998, ratification of more than 9 states came into force. The first modern composition of the constitution in the world. (1) establishing people's democratic rights, (2) strengthening authority by giving the central government the right to collect taxes and trade, while adopting federalism which allows significant autonomy in each state, (3) The principle of prevention of concentration of power to the central government. However, the rights of Indians and blacks were ignored.

DOC.Title: Separation of powers
DOC.TEXT: The idea of ​​trying to prevent the abuse of power by dividing the state power into Congress (legislation), government (administrative), Supreme Court (judicial) and mutual check. In contrast to concentration monopoly of absolute monarchy power. The Enlightenment Thinkers of Rock Montesquie and others claimed and was established as an institution in the Constitution of the United States.

DOC.Title: Federal Government of the United States, Central Government of the United States
DOC.TEXT: In 1789, an administrative agency established under the Constitution of the United States.

DOC.Title: President of the United States
DOC.TEXT: The head of the executive branch of the head of state. It was elected by citizen's indirect election, the term of office is four years, the reelection is up to two (determined in 1951).

DOC.Title: United States Congress
DOC.TEXT: The bicameral system assembly consisting of the Senate consisting of two lawmakers of each State and having the character of the provincial representative and the House of Representatives consisting of members elected proportionately to the population of each state and having the character of a national representative. The Senate, in particular, dominates foreign affairs.

DOC.Title: Supreme Court
DOC.TEXT: The highest institution of justice. It has an unconstitutional legislative judgment right to judge whether laws and ordinances are not in violation of the Constitution and plays a role of suppressing the congestion / government's rush.

DOC.Title: Federal faction, Federalist
DOC.TEXT: People who insisted on strengthening the power of the central government and supported the draft constitution in 1787-88. It will be the name of a party formed after Hamilton later. Emphasizing commerce, promoting industrial protection promotion, taking a leading position in the outside world. After 1801, the initiative of the administration moved to anti-Federalism and declined rapidly.

DOC.Title: Hamilton
DOC.TEXT: A politician in the US founding period. During the Revolutionary War he served as a deputy of Washington and became the center of the Federation after the war. Treasury Secretary under president Washington, he solidified the foundation of federal finance.

DOC.Title: Anti-Federation
DOC.TEXT: People who insisted respect for autonomy in each state and opposed the draft constitution in 1787-88. Based on farmers, small commercial and traders, Jefferson formed a republican (Democratic Republican). After 1801, he overwhelmed federalists and was in charge of the administration.

DOC.Title: Washington Special District
DOC.TEXT: The official name of the capital Washington.

DOC.Title: The Atlantic Revolution, the Atlantic Revolution of the Atlantic
DOC.TEXT: It means a series of major reforms occurred across the Atlantic Ocean from the latter half of the 18th century (after the seven year war) to the first half of the 19th century. Beginning with the American Revolution in America, events such as the French Revolution, Latin America's Independence and Industrial Revolution, and others have developed with a strong influence on each other as the unification of the world progresses.

DOC.Title: French Revolution
DOC.TEXT: French citizen revolution following British civil revolution and American independence revolution. It is a thorough and typical citizen revolution compared to British and American citizen revolution, and it has transformed French society from the ground. Its influence has spread to all Europe and has become a turning point for the establishment of modern society.

DOC.Title: Ancien = Regime, old system
DOC.TEXT: French politics, social system before the revolution. Although the feudal status system that kept the king at the top was maintained, dissatisfaction concentrated on the old land system and the social status system (especially suffrage right and taxation law) which the economic growth of the citizen hierarchy did not match with the real situation of society Then, the absolute monarchy was gathering up.

DOC.Title: Privilege status
DOC.TEXT: Clergy and aristocratic identity that was associated with absolute monarchy under Ancian = regime, and was permitted various privileges (especially tax exemption) and rulership control. 2% of the total population owned about 40% of the land. Including those who are falling economically, they therefore clung to their privileges rather than trying to strengthen exploitation and control over farmers and intensified contradictions.

DOC.Title: first status
DOC.TEXT: Clerical status. Approximately 120,000 people are about 0, 5% of the French population. Most of the senior clerics were occupied by aristocratic people, both ruling classes and large landowners. However, among the lower priests who were from the commoner, many saw the contradiction of society sharply and many were standing by that change.

DOC.Title: second status
DOC.TEXT: About the aristocracy. It was estimated to be about 400,000, accounting for about 1.5% of the total population. Court nobility paid by the king, regional aristocrat who directly exploits and dominates farmers, regional aristocrat directly controlling farmers, clothing aristocrat who rich citizen became a nobleman as a new bureaucracy, and so on, there are various groups in aristocracy and confront each other Because there was no unity as a nobleman.

DOC.Title: third position
DOC.TEXT: About commoner status. It consists of farmers and the citizen hierarchy. Politically I was not allowed to speak, economically I was pressured by heavy tax burden and privileged position, and I hoped for the strongest change.

DOC.Title: Farmers, former institution farmers
DOC.TEXT: It accounts for over 80% of the entire French population. There were also some rich leasehold farms, but most were rice farmers and poor tenant farmers who were under the control of the lords, under the heavy pressure of national taxes in addition to exploitation of the lords. I strongly hoped for abolition of lord control and possession of land.

DOC.Title: Citizen, old system citizen
DOC.TEXT: Upper bourgeoises such as bankers, squire owners and large merchants, middle-class bourgeois centered on emerging commerce and industry, lower level citizens such as workers and craftsmen. Politically it was unprivileged. The upper bourgeoisie was a person who enjoyed wealth with privileged status even under the Ancian regime, but was influenced by the enlightenment thought and demanded a political right that is suitable for its capability, and with the middle bourgeois, parliamentary politics based on restricted elections and In search of corporate freedom, it became the driving force of the revolution. On the other hand, most lower-level citizens supported politics and the economy, seeking cheap bread (cereal), stabilizing their lives with heavy labor / low income, the first half of the revolution cooperated with the superior bourgeois guidance, but in the long run I began to get over and began to intensify the revolution.

DOC.Title: Shees
DOC.TEXT: A leader in the early French Revolution. A cleric from the third status, who wrote "What is the third status" and attacked the privilege status. He was active as a theoretical leader at the beginning of the revolution, endeavored to establish the National Assembly and the 1991 Constitution.

DOC.Title: "What is the third status"
DOC.TEXT: A pamphlet by Shaes issued in 1789. At the invitation of the trilogy, he attacked the privileged position and claimed that "the third status is everything."

DOC.Title: Louis XVI
DOC.TEXT: French King (ranking 1774-92). The grandson of Louis XV. Admitted to convocation of the trilateral meeting from the stagnation of fiscal problems, politically unwilling, abandoned and executed without being able to cope with the outbreak, progress and intensification of the revolution.

DOC.Title: Mari-Antoinette
DOC.TEXT: Princess Louis XVI. Daughter of Maria Terezia in Austria. It was seen as a fanatic fanatic consumer, and bought the public's antipathy. It was regarded as the central figure of the anti-revolutionary, and executed under fear politics.

DOC.Title: Financial reform
DOC.TEXT: Foreign war and famine from Louis XIV and financial distress caused by court waste have become decisive with aid to the American Revolutionary War. As a fiscal rebuilding measure, reduction of court fee, stoppage of aristocratic pension, even taxation to privilege position was thought up, but it was not possible to do with the opposite of the queen and the aristocracy.

DOC.Title: Turgot
DOC.TEXT: French political agricultural economist / politician. In 1774 he became finance minister and attempted to rebuild the government through liberal reform such as liberalization of grain deal and abolishment of guild, but was opposed to privilege status, and it fell down in 1974.

DOC.Title: Neckel
DOC.TEXT: Bank of Switzerland. From 1777 to 81, he became the finance minister in 188 to 90 years, tackled the fiscal rebuilding, claimed taxation of privilege status (abolition of tax exemption), but failed against the opposition of aristocrats.

DOC.Title: English-French trade treaty, Eden treaty
DOC.TEXT: In 1786, a trade treaty tied between Britain and France. Mutual tariff reduction was implemented, but inexpensive industrial products in the UK where the industrial revolution progressed, flowed into France, its domestic industry was hit and became part of the French Revolution.

DOC.Title: Three Parties
DOC.TEXT: French status system. We elected members by election by status and we have the right to discuss new taxation. Philip IV invited by 1302 began and the 1614-15 years of Louis XIII was not convened at the end but no nobility and clergy approve the Neckl who is seeking to abolish tax free privileges by the three parties It was held in Versailles on May 5, 1789 for the first time in 175 years. The attendance is 308 for clerics, 290 for nobility and 594 for citizens.

DOC.Title: Status-based resolution
DOC.TEXT: A traditional way of voting by 1 clerk / nobility insisted by one clerical / nobility at the three parties meeting in 1789. The third senior representative insisted on voting by individuals and did not give way, and Congress dandelioned for about 40 days.

DOC.Title: National Assembly
DOC.TEXT: The parliament formed by separating the third senior representative of the trilateral group from the trilateral group. On June 19, many of the first status and part of the second status decided to join, continuing until the establishment of the Constitution in 1991 as a parliament early in the French Revolution.

DOC.Title: Oath of the playground, vow of tennis court
DOC.TEXT: Because the king forbade the use of the floor against the newly formed National Assembly, the pledge gathered at the playground and promised not to dissolve until the enactment of the Constitution. The king approved the National Assembly on June 27, but at the same time the troops were gathered in Vusailles, the crisis of arms suppression against the opposition national parliament increased.

DOC.Title: Constitutional Council
DOC.TEXT: Parliament that renamed the National Assembly. I began to establish the first constitution of France.

DOC.Title: Bastille prison assault
DOC.TEXT: A Parisian citizen who was exponentially upset by the king's dismissal of Neckle and the mobilization of the army's Versailles attacked the Bastille in the city of Paris (French in the meaning of prison) which was believed to have a large amount of weapons in the prison of the state crime Occupied incident. This incident triggered local peasant rebellion and became a nationwide disturbance. After that, it became the Founding Day of the French Republic (Paris Festival).

DOC.Title: terrified
DOC.TEXT: Panic occurred in rural areas around Bastille prison assault. The farmers fearing the rumors of "conspiracy of aristocrat" raided the ruler's palace, struck the lord's house, burned down the land register, and so on, it was in a revolt condition.

DOC.Title: Abolition of feudal privilege
DOC.TEXT: A declaration that the National Assembly who felt a threat to the spread of farmers' rebellion decided and proclaimed at the suggestion of aristocrat Noire. The serfdom system, the right of judicial jurisdiction, adequate tax for the church etc were abolished without charge, but since the lump sum payment of the annual contribution of 20 to 25 years was necessary to abolish the contribution, we acquired the land There were few farmers who could stand on their own. However, on this occasion, farmers' rebellion quickly caught.

DOC.Title: Human Rights Declaration, Declaration of Human and Citizen's Rights
DOC.TEXT: Declaration adopted by the National Assembly. Article 17 stipulates that the natural rights of human universal liberty and equality and resistance to tyranny are natural rights and its maintenance is the purpose of politics and regulations such as public sovereignty, rule of law, division of power, inviolability of private property etc. did. The influence of American Independence Declaration and Rousseau 's Enlightenment Thought is seen.

DOC.Title: La Fayette
DOC.TEXT: Liberal aristocracy. Army in the American Revolutionary War. After the outbreak of the revolution, he became commander of the National Army of Paris, formed the 89 year club of Mirabeau and the constitutional royalist and became one of the drafters of human rights declaration. Consistently taking the standpoint of constitutionalism, losing the initiative by the intensification of the revolution, exiled to Austria in August 1792. After returning home after winning the Napoleonic regime, he was also active in the July revolution in 1830.

DOC.Title: Versailles Marching
DOC.TEXT: A crowd that thousands of women who were suffering from high food prices did not carry grains sufficiently to Paris due to political unrest, marched 20 km in the rain, and entered the Palace of Versailles. The next day the king 's family was taken to Paris, the National Assembly also moved to Paris, the center of the political centers concentrated in Paris, politics for the moment steadily.

DOC.Title: Mirabeau
DOC.TEXT: A politician from a nobleman. Since being elected as the third position representative in the trilogy, he took the position of constitutional monarchy and played the center of the National Assembly, but behind it was trading with the king and prevented the rapid evolution of the revolution. I suddenly died in April 1991.

DOC.Title: Varenn escape incident
DOC.TEXT: A case where the King Louis XVI tried to escape to Austria and ended in failure. King Mirabaud, who had been mediating between the king and the Congress, died of illness, and the king's family, who had anxiety about the rapid evolution of the revolution, contacted Austria, Queen's parents' house, and tried to escape the country, but near the Tohoku border on 21st It was caught in Varenne, brought back to Paris, and became virtually arrested. Trust in the people's king faded, the Republicans rushed rapidly.

DOC.Title: Pillnitz declaration
DOC.TEXT: The declaration that Austrian emperor Leo Porto II invited Friedrich Wilhelm II of Prussia jointly. Calling for the restoration of the French royalty, calling on Louis XVI's relief to the monarchs of the countries, it contributed to the interference war against the French Revolution of foreign forces.

DOC.Title: Constitution of 1791
DOC.TEXT: Constitution adopted by the National Assembly on September 3, 1791. In France's first constitution, main contents such as constitutional monarchy, property qualification election, unicameral regulation etc. are main contents. We aimed to establish a national system centered on bourgeois, but was lagging behind the reality of rapid revolution.

DOC.Title: Legislation Liaison
DOC.TEXT: Congress which the National Assembly was dissolved under the constitution of 1991, and a restricted election was held under the declaration of disqualification of the former MPs, a parliament passed. The right wing is Huyan faction, the left is Gironde faction. I could not cope with the external war and the domestic crisis and dissolved.

DOC.Title: Juan faction
DOC.TEXT: In the July 1791 Jacobin club divided from the civic constitutional monarchy, representing wealthy citizens and liberal aristocrats. Lafayette and Barnab guided, constitute a conservative in the legislature parliament, fought for the administration with the Gironde, but declined after the August 10 th incident in 1792.

DOC.Title: Gironde faction
DOC.TEXT: Partisans formed mainly of lawmakers from Gironde County. On behalf of the bourgeois of commercial and industrial citizens of wealthy citizens and middle class citizens, he claimed moderate republicanism. In the Legislative Assembly, the majority formed a left wing and caused an external war to fight against Huyan faction Jacobin faction. It gradually became conservative, became a right wing in the next National Assembly, lost to the mountain faction fiercely.

DOC.Title: Jacobin school
DOC.TEXT: In November 1789, a political party formed based on the Jacobins Abbey in Paris. In February 1990, "Constitutional Friendship Society", since September 1992 it was named "Jacobin Association", but in general it was called "Jacobin = Club." Until the summer of 1991, the Constitutional Monarchy had power, but the Huyan faction withdrew from 1991. In the summer of 1992 the Gironde group withdrew, after which the mountaineers held the initiative. Therefore, mountain factions are often called Jacobins.

DOC.Title: Mountain faction
DOC.TEXT: Jacobin factions most left. The name comes from having occupied a seat at the high place of the floor at the National Assembly. Although it was a minority in parliament, it represented the interests of small bourgeois, poor citizens and farmers, and it emerged with the intensification of the revolution. He emphasized the thoroughness of the revolution, but opposed the foreign war during the war of 1992.

DOC.Title: Sanchett
DOC.TEXT: It means urban people such as craftsmen, craftsmen, small shopkeepers, factory workers at the time of revolution, meaning those who do not wear short pants worn by aristocrats and bourgeois at the time. As a force outside Congress, we frequently carried out mass movements such as demonstrations and urged the rapid evolution of the revolution.

DOC.Title: Gironde Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: The Gironde-led cabinet, established in the second half of the legislative parliamentary era. Declaration fought in Austria on April 20, and started a revolutionary war. Prussia was also an enemy, and it expanded to the war between France promoting the revolution and the European countries maintaining monarchy. To the aristocratic commanders, with no warfare, defeat and retreat at Belgian Front continued, soon after the cabinet resigned, the cabinet replaced with the Huiyan Cabinet.

DOC.Title: Voluntary army
DOC.TEXT: A soldier voluntarily volunteered to defend the country and the revolution, taking the declaration of "the motherland in crisis" of the legislation council. Equipment and training were inferior, but full of fighting spirit and ingenuity, he changed the constitution of the old dynasty French army. The mountain faction supported them and tried to thoroughly revolutionize and overthrow the royalist.

DOC.Title: La Marseillaise
DOC.TEXT: A patriotic revolutionary song composed by poet and lieutenant Luge de Lille. Initially it was sung as "Song of the Line Army", but it was renamed by the Marseille Yongle veteran who entered Paris in July 1792 and became the French national anthem in 1995.

DOC.Title: National War
DOC.TEXT: A war pursued by a state standing on the principle of national sovereignty. Unlike the war for the monarch's interests under the absolute monarchy, the war of France during the revolution is widely accepted as realizing the interests of the general public, the morale of the French army soldiers is high, There was a side to be welcomed as a liberator from the people of the partner country suffering under the control of the system.

DOC.Title: August 10 incident
DOC.TEXT: A mountain faction raided Sancherot and Yoshinobu soldiers at the Tuileries Palace. The king was caught and the king 's family was buried in the Temple tower. The Legislative Assembly declared the suspension of the royalty, dissolved, the male ordinary election took place, the national council was established, the abolition of the royal government and the Republican declaration made.

DOC.Title: Tuileries Palace
DOC.TEXT: Since the Versailles march, the palace in Paris where the King Louis XVI resided until the August 10 incident.

DOC.Title: National Council
DOC.TEXT: Instead of the legislation parliament, the unicameral parliament established by the first male ordinary election. Immediately after the establishment, the declaration of the abolition of the royal government and the formation of the Republicans. Although there were a few mountain schools, he executed execution of Louis XVI with the initiative, then exiled the Gironde group, and exercised fear politics from June 1793 until July 1994. After Thermidor rebound, it broke up by the establishment of the Government Government.

DOC.Title: Battle of Walmie
DOC.TEXT: A battle where the French army won the enemy army under command of the Prussian general who tried to approach Paris. Walmy is a small village east of Paris. Goethe, who used to serve in the Prussian army, said that the revolutionary volunteer victory against the professional dynasty army, said this battle, "From here and this day, a new era of world history begins I wrote down.

DOC.Title: First Republic
DOC.TEXT: The first public republic of France, where the National Assembly declared the abolition of the royal government and the establishment of the Republic, declared. Following the Government Government and the Government of the Government, Napoleon continued until the establishment of the First Empire.

DOC.Title: Louis XVI Execution
DOC.TEXT: Louis XVI, which had been suspended for kingship on August 10, 1792, was sentenced to death for the act of hostile acts against the people in the case of the National Assembly, and was executed in Guillotine.

DOC.Title: Pit
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom (1783-1801, 1804-06). We broke off with France with the execution of Louis XVI, formed the 1st to 3rd French major alliance, while the National Public Prosecution fought in February 1793 in the UK, the Netherlands and March in Spain.

DOC.Title: 1st French major alliance
DOC.TEXT: French military occupation Belgium and execution of Louis XVI, French military alliance formed by advocacy of British prime minister pit. Russia, Spain, Prussia, the Netherlands, Austria, Portugal, Sardinia and others participated mainly in the UK, but the results were few in the conflict of the French army's good fight and the conflict of interests among allies.

DOC.Title: Implementation of conscription system
DOC.TEXT: The National Assembly decided to recruit 300,000 single men from 18 to 35 years old. A royal farmers' rebellion occurred in the Vendée region of western France in March 10, but in addition, in August the general civil service ordinance, all men from 18 to 25 years old were targeted.

DOC.Title: Farmer's rebellion of Vendy
DOC.TEXT: Peasant rebellion that occurred in the Vendée region of western France. Vanday was a poor rural area, the Catholic church and royalist forces were strong, but there was a rebellion from the opposition to the conscription system of the National Assembly. Widespread in the western region, it was almost suppressed by the end of 1993.

DOC.Title: Revolutionary Court
DOC.TEXT: In March 1793, the special court established in Paris by the National Assembly to hear political prisoners. Activities began in earnest in autumn 1993, and executed an anti-revolutionary school with a simple trial.

DOC.Title: Public Safety Commission
DOC.TEXT: A committee established within the National Assembly on April 6, 1793. In July Robespierre assumed control and played a de facto government role as the highest instructor of politics and war. It was abolished in October 1995 after the reaction of Thermidor.

DOC.Title: Security Committee
DOC.TEXT: A committee within the National Assembly established in October 1792. I was in charge of security and police, but conflicted with the Public Safety Commission, afterwards became the center of overthrow of the Robespierre faction.

DOC.Title: Fear Politics
DOC.TEXT: In order to cope with the revolutionary war and domestic anti-revolutionary movement / economic crisis, the mountaineering party exiled the Gironde from the National Assembly on June 2, 1793 and dictatorship. The mountain school seized the initiative of institutions such as the Public Safety Commission and the Revolutionary Court and forcibly suppressed people who were deemed not cooperative with anti-revolutionaryists and revolution.

DOC.Title: Muller
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary politician from a doctor. A leader of the mountain school of the National Assembly. Published a newspaper "Friends of People" standing in the position of lower citizens, gained popularity, was one of the greatest strength persons in the early days of fear politics, but in July 1793 a female Charlotte Cordee of the Gironde group stabbed him It was.

DOC.Title: Robespierre
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary politician from a lawyer. Party councilor-Congressional parliament member. In response to the ideological influence of Rousseau, the legislative council guided the mountain faction from outside the hospital and developed an assertion to stand for the people. He was elected a member of the National Assembly, became a public safety commissioner after assassination of Mahler, promoted fear politics with the request of Sankyrot as leader of the mountain school. In 1794, the same mountain faction's Evere and others and the right wing Danton and others were overwhelmed and thoroughly revolutionized, but himself was also executed in Thermidor's coup d'etat.

DOC.Title: Free abolition of feudal rent
DOC.TEXT: In July 1793, measures of the mountainist regime that decided to abolish the rent of the rent that the lords had imposed on farmers. French farmer liberation was completed for a while, but farmers who owned their land became reluctant to change further, became conservative and became negative to the progress of the revolution. [Note that unlike the explanation of any textbook, this bill was issued in August 1792, the theory that it was first passed by the legislative assembly that the Gironde had the initiative. ]

DOC.Title: Exile Aristocrat
DOC.TEXT: During the French Revolution, a nobleman who ran away outside the country. Emigre of the original language also includes political asylum seekers such as clergy. In the exile to the court of each country, the revolutionary government overwhelmed the government to overthrow, became one of the causes of the revolutionary war. The asset (land) was forfeited by the mountainist regime, but the exiled nobility returned after the reign of the royal government, causing a big problem concerning the return of the property (land).

DOC.Title: 1793 Constitution, Jacobin Constitution
DOC.TEXT: Constitution adopted by the National Assembly on June 24, 1793. The first thorough democratic constitution that historically recognized history of sovereign people, the people's rights of living, labor rights, male ordinary election system. It was established with overwhelming support by the referendum, but it was not eventually implemented due to the intensified revolution.

DOC.Title: Highest price order
DOC.TEXT: Price control law promulgated in May 1793. We expanded our target in September. The highest price such as daily necessities, food and wages was set up, and offenders were punished as an anti-revolution crime. Commercial workers, eventually buy antipathy from workers and was abolished in December 1994 after the reaction of Thermidor.

DOC.Title: Revolutionary calendar, Republic calendar
DOC.TEXT: The calendar adopted by the National Assembly on October 5, 1793. It consists of 12 months, starting from 22 September 1792 of the establishment of the first Republicans, a period of one month as 30 days, and a five-day period as a national holiday (day of Sancheroth) and constituting one year He directed natural phenomena. In September 1805 it was decided to return to the Gregorian calendar and it was officially abolished in 2006.

DOC.Title: metric method
DOC.TEXT: Law stipulating the unit of length and weight. Established by the National Council of 1793, formally adopted by the President Government in 1999. 1 m is set at 1/40 thousandth of the meridian passing through Paris. In determining the reference unit of the metrology, it was due to the influence of the rationalism spirit of the enlightenment thought that correlated with the scientific fact of the size of the earth.

DOC.Title: decapitation bed, guillotine
DOC.TEXT: It was believed that the doctor Gyotan invented, and the execution tool used during the revolution. Louis XVI, Queen Mali-Antoinette, Gironde, royalist and others were executed one after another and became a symbol of fear politics.

DOC.Title: Worship of Reason
DOC.TEXT: A rationalistic religious festival that was carried out on November 10, 1793, with the Evael school on the left-wing faction claiming the Christian denial movement. Evere was annihilated as it was executed in March 1994.

DOC.Title: Evere
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary politician from journalist. After the incident on August 10, he organized the Evere School and became leader of the mountain faction extremist Leftist. Deepened the confrontation with the Robespierre faction, was executed in March, 1794.

DOC.Title: Danton
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary politician from a lawyer. In the National Assembly he became the leader of the mountain school right wing, became a public safety commissioner, and oppressed the anti-Revolutionary. But opposing the strengthening of fear politics, confronted with Robespierre, arrested after the Ebert suppression, was executed in April 1794.

DOC.Title: Thermidor's coup d'etat, 9th coup d'etat
DOC.TEXT: July 27, 1794 (revolutionary calendar month 9th), the coup d'etat decided by the National Assembly anti-Robespierre faction. We arrested and executed the Robespierre faction. The mountain dictatorship was overthrown and the control by moderate Republican bourgeoisie revived.

DOC.Title: Constitution of 1795, Constitution of Republic 3rd Year
DOC.TEXT: Constitution of the center of the bourgeoisie enacted in August 1795. The restricted election system due to property qualification resumed and tried to avoid concentration of power by building a government by a bicameral system parliament and five presidents.

DOC.Title: royalist revolt
DOC.TEXT: Before the election by the new Constitution (October 20), the rebellion that the royalist made in Paris. It was crushed by the army of Napoleon's command.

DOC.Title: Government Government
DOC.TEXT: The bourgeois republic government established in accordance with the Constitution of 1795. Five presidents shared the authority. While aiming at the establishment of the liberal economy, the dissatisfaction of the people and the administration of the royalists did not stabilize the administration, and gradually the military's voice of the military was strengthened.

DOC.Title: Baboff
DOC.TEXT: French thinker / revolutionary. It belonged to the most radical during the revolution and after the establishment of the Government Government, organized a secret society, prepared a communist society by abolishing the private property system, prepared a revolution by the people. A plan was discovered just before the armed uprising, arrested in May, 1796, and executed the following year the following year.

DOC.Title: Napoleon = Bonaparte
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of France. A soldier from Corsica. In December 1793, in support of the Jacobin faction during the French Revolution, he retired from the British Navy and the royalist tournament of Toulon and made a contribution, but was temporarily imprisoned by Thermidor rebellion. In 1995, he repressed the rebellion of the royalist, and in 1996 he was appointed commander of the Italian expeditionary army and defeated Austria, and he gave a fame of fame. Exposed to Egypt in May 1998, established the governorate government in the coup in 1999 and held de facto dictatorship. In 1804, due to military success, he became the emperor (rank 1804-14, 15), aiming to rule over all Europe but withdrew from 1814 and 15 years.

DOC.Title: Corsica
DOC.TEXT: Mediterranean island which became French territory since 1768. The hometown of Napoleon.

DOC.Title: Napoleonic war
DOC.TEXT: A series of wars Napoleon commanded. Initially it was a revolutionary defense game, but gradually the character changed to aggressive war.

DOC.Title: Italy Expedition
DOC.TEXT: The battle that the French army commanded by Napoleon destroyed the troops of Austria and Italy forces in the Lombardy plain. About the sum of Campo-Formio was concluded, the first French alliance collapsed.

DOC.Title: Egyptian expedition
DOC.TEXT: A military expedition made by Napoleon for the purpose of breaking the communication between England and India. The French troops dispatched to the Ottoman Empire Egypt and broke the British Ottoman army temporarily on land, but on the sea they were defeated by the battle of Abkir Bay and were suppressed by Britain. Napoleon returned home knowing the deterioration of his home situation, and then in 1801 the residual French troops surrendered to England. The revolutionary French Army's arrival in Egypt became the opportunity for the subsequent rise of nationalism in West Asia, which led to the way to acquire the administration of Muhammad Ali.

DOC.Title: The 2nd French Union Alliance
DOC.TEXT: A military alliance that Britain tied with Russia · Austria etc. (Prussia is neutral) with Napoleon's expedition in Egypt.

DOC.Title: Bule Mail 18th coup d'etat
DOC.TEXT: A military coup that Napoleon who went back from Egypt destroyed the unstable president's government. In lieu of the president's government, a governance administration was established and the French Revolution ended.

DOC.Title: Napoleonic era
DOC.TEXT: The period in which Napoleon actually took power and forced the dictatorship.

DOC.Title: Government, Government Government
DOC.TEXT: Burumet Government consisting of the three men who were established after the coup on 18th. Nominal is Republic, it was the de facto military dictatorship of Napoleon who took office as the first territory. Industrial bourgeoisie and small peasants who got land through the revolution were the main support base.

DOC.Title: First Region
DOC.TEXT: A de facto dictator who holds powerful administrative authority and has the right to declare warfare, armed forces of navy and army. Napoleon took office for a term of ten years.

DOC.Title: France Bank
DOC.TEXT: The central bank of France. In 1800, Napoleon established as a private bank for fiscal consolidation and unification, but it was later nationalized. Traditional national finance depended on borrowing from the merchant merchant, but after that the French bank has assumed the national finance.

DOC.Title: Religious agreement, Concorder
DOC.TEXT: About the sum which was established between Napoleon and Pope Pius VII (ranking 1800-23). Catholic revival, content that the government nominates clergy and the Pope has the appointment right, confiscated property at the time of revolution is not refunded.

DOC.Title: Summary of Amians
DOC.TEXT: Treaty between Britain and France that was signed in Amiens in North France. The French military superiority and isolated Israel proposed and returned many of the occupied places of each other. For France for peace since 1792, the second French alliance was resolved, Napoleon's position was strengthened.

DOC.Title: Life conviction
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon took office by a referendum against the backdrop of the success of Amiens.

DOC.Title: Napoleon Code, French Civil Code
DOC.TEXT: French Civil Code enacted by Napoleon. It consisted of 2281 articles in full text, including the law principle of modern civil society established by the revolution, including inviolability of private property and freedom of contract, became a model of foreign civil code. Napoleon after the defeat is said to have said that "the remaining honor is not a victory over 40 times, it is this civil code that will remain forever."

DOC.Title: Napoleon I
DOC.TEXT: He rang to the emperor overwhelmingly in the referendum. The first republic was over and the first empire started.

DOC.Title: Josephine
DOC.TEXT: The first Empress of Napoleon I. In 1796 he remarried Napoleon, became the Empress in 1804, but was divorced in 2009.

DOC.Title: First Emperor
DOC.TEXT: A military dictatorship system beginning with the emperor 's grace of Napoleon I. Also called the Napoleonic Empire (Bonaparte Morning). The basic system succeeded the governance government.

DOC.Title: The 3rd French Union Alliance
DOC.TEXT: A military alliance formed by inviting the British Prime Minister Pitt to Austria · Russia (neutral Prussia) against the formation of the French First Empire.

DOC.Title: Battle of Trafalgar
DOC.TEXT: The battle where the French Spanish Federation was destroyed by the British fleet led by Nelson off the coast of Gibraltar Sea North Gyeongsang. Napoleon abandoned its strategy of landing in Britain and changed its policy to dominate the continent.

DOC.Title: Nelson
DOC.TEXT: Admiral in the UK. In the Battle of Abkir Bay · won the French fleet at the Trafalgar battle, but was killed in the Trafalgar battle.

DOC.Title: Joseph
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon's older brother. Cooperating with Napoleon, King Naples (rank 1806-08) · King of Spain (rank 1808-13) became.

DOC.Title: Louis
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon's brother. I joined the expedition of Napoleon and became the King of the Netherlands (rank 1806 to 10). Father of later Naboleon III.

DOC.Title: Battle of Austerlitz, Three Emperor's Battle
DOC.TEXT: The battle where Napoleon destroyed both Army Russia (Alexander I) and Austria (Francis II of Holy Roman Emperor) in the present Czech land. As a result, the 3rd French Alliance collapsed.

DOC.Title: Line Alliance, Line Commonwealth
DOC.TEXT: An alliance of southwest German countries with Napoleon as the leader. It was a French puppetry federation to combat Prussia and Austria. After the Tilgit Treaty of 1807, middle and northern Germany also joined, but it was dismantled in 1813 when Napoleon faded.

DOC.Title: Holy Roman Empire Disappearance
DOC.TEXT: Southwest Germany 16 who formed a line alliance declared an withdrawal from the empire and Franz II declined the throne, so it disappeared in 844 years since its establishment in 962.

DOC.Title: Franz II
DOC.TEXT: The last Holy Roman emperor (ranking 1792 to 1806). As the Austrian emperor Franz I (rank 1804-35). Losing in the battle of Austerlitz, a line alliance with Napoleon as a guardian was established, abdicated Sacred Roman Emperor. After Napoleon's defeat, he was assisted by Metternich and tried to maintain the Vienna regime.

DOC.Title: Battle of Jena
DOC.TEXT: A battle where the Napoleonic army won the Prussian army in Jena in central Germany.

DOC.Title: continental blockade order, Berlin imperial decree
DOC.TEXT: Edict issued by Napoleon in Berlin. At the same time, we aimed to monopolize the European market by French industrial capital, in order to fully ban commerce and traffic between the continental countries and the UK to give economic blow to the UK. However, it hurt the economic activities of continental countries more than Britain, and rebelled against Napoleon.

DOC.Title: Tilgit treaty
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon who won the victory in Jena's battle, etc., concluded a peace treaty with Prussia and Russia. Tilgit is now the Sovek city of the Republic of Lithuania. Building the Kingdom of Westphalia on the left bank of Elbe, with Jerome of the younger brother as the king, Building the Grand Duchy of Warsaw in Prussian territory, Danzig was made free city. Prussia imposed a huge amount of reparations and a majority of the territory of the territory, calling this treaty "humiliation of Tilgit" and made it a big chance for "Prussian reform." Russia was ordered to cooperate with continental blockade.

DOC.Title: Grand Duchy of Warsaw
DOC.TEXT: A state established in the former Polish territory by the Tilgit treaty. King Sachsen doubled as the capital, but it disappeared at the Vienna conference.

DOC.Title: Mari-Louise
DOC.TEXT: The daughter of Emperor Franz I of Austria. I married Napoleon in 1810. After returning to Napoleon, I returned home and remarried.

DOC.Title: Spanish revolt
DOC.TEXT: The resistance movement of the Spanish people against Napoleon 's invasion of the Iberian Peninsula. In protest against the ranking of the king of Napoleon's brother Joseph, nationalistic resistance, mainly farmers, occurred and developed guerrilla warfare in various places. The UK also helped the rebel army, and Napoleon could not be suppressed to the last.

DOC.Title: Prussian Reform
DOC.TEXT: A series of modernization policies promoted by the guidance of Stein Haldenberg and others since 1807. Farmer's liberation · Reform of administrative organization · Establishment of urban autonomy system, military reform by Scharnhorst · Gnaisenau, reform of educational system by Humboldt was also conducted. Although it aimed at the transition to a modern and liberal nation, it was a reform from the top, an insufficient part was also left in the rise of the conservative faction and the reactionary forces after the Vienna meeting.

DOC.Title: Stein
DOC.TEXT: Politician of Prussia. After the Tilgit treaty, he became prime minister (Tenori 1807-08), promoted the modernization from the top such as abolition of serfdom system, reform of administrative organization, but was dismissed under Napoleonic pressure.

DOC.Title: Haldenberg
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister Prussia (Resigned from 1810 to 22). We inherited Stein's reform course, promoted the modernization of Prussia, including reform of administrative organization, agricultural reform, liberalization of sales. After that the whole conference of the Vienna conference became complete, succeeded in expanding the territory of Prussia.

DOC.Title: Farmers' liberation
DOC.TEXT: The center of Prussia's modernization policy. In 1807 the serfdomrage system was abolished and freedom of occupation was given, but the allocation of land and the creation of self-made farmers were few, the majority of farmers became agricultural laborers, the capital of Junker (landlord aristocrat) We established the principle management.

DOC.Title: Fichte
DOC.TEXT: German philosopher. He was a professor at the University of Jena, a professor at the University of Berlin, and the first president.

DOC.Title: "Tell the German people"
DOC.TEXT: In 1807-08, a continuous lecture by Fichte in Berlin under French occupation. He preached the rebuilding of German national independence and culture and raised public consciousness.

DOC.Title: Humboldt
DOC.TEXT: German linguist / politician. Guided Prussian reform, founded the University of Berlin. Younger brother is a famous geographer and is called "father of modern geography".

DOC.Title: Berlin University
DOC.TEXT: A university that was founded by Humboldt et al. In 1810 and became the center of Prussia's cultural reconstruction. First President Fichte.

DOC.Title: National awareness
DOC.TEXT: Consciousness belonging to their own country owned by people who share (and feel) culture (words, religion, customs customs) and history. Since the 16th century, a centralized sovereign state was established in Europe, people living in the nation 's territory began to hold consciousness of cultural and historical shared first, and then they came into existence. However, at the stage of the 16th to the 17th century, the public consciousness was weak as generally sovereignty was in the king and the people did not. However, at the end of the 18th century, when the French Revolution took place, the feudal status was dismantled, and the pressure increased from the surrounding feudalism state, people living in France strengthened the shared awareness of cultures and history, citizens who are themselves French Consciousness was established. Later in the other European countries conquered (compressed) by Napoleon, the national consciousness of each country was established among the influence of the French Revolution and the opposition against Naboleon. Although there is also a nurturing awareness of national consciousness, sometimes the nation intentionally creates for the purpose of strengthening the people's solidarity and using it. For that reason, attention is also directed to the existence of dialects and ethnic minorities in recent years, and criticism has also been added to the way "public consciousness".

DOC.Title: Nationalism
DOC.TEXT: It is thought to strongly conscious of their ethnic value (national consciousness / national consciousness) and to try to strengthen the position of their own race. It began around the French Revolution at the end of the 18th century and expanded further after the latter half of the 19th century. Normally, three Japanese translations are applied in Japanese. (1) When translating as nationalism. Typically in the nineteenth century, Magyar (Hungarian), Italian, Polish, etc are independent from under the control of the Austrian empire, with the idea that ethnic groups placed under the control of other countries and other peoples are aiming for independence and independence A case aimed at. (2) When translating as nationalism. In the idea that ethnic groups that were in the split state aim for the formation of a unified state, typically in the 19th century, Germany and Italy were forced to divide and aimed at the formation of a unified state. (3) When translating as nationalism. Typically, Germany, Italy, Japan, etc., which formed a unified nation after the 20th century, such as Germany, Italy, Japan, etc., which form a unified nation after the invasion by other countries and other ethnic groups, are taking a blatant invasion policy to expand the state A case like aiming at.

DOC.Title: National nation
DOC.TEXT: A nation formed from "one nation (ethnic group)". Since the 16th century, began to be formed after a centralized sovereign state with the king as the sovereign in Europe was established. After that, sovereignty gradually shifted to the people (parliament) in European countries, a full-fledged nation-state was established at that stage. In reality, however, there are cases where there are different cultures (dialects etc. are also examples) and ethnic minorities in one country, and in recent years criticism has been added to the idea of ​​the nation state.

DOC.Title: Russian expedition, Moscow expedition
DOC.TEXT: A great expedition made by Napoleon to add sanctions to Russia who resumed grain exports to the UK in violation of continental blockade. Mobilized 600,000 troops, departed in May and entered Moscow on September 14, but in Russia's scorched tactics Moscow became a big fire, Napoleonic troops forced to retreat in October. Furthermore, on the way home, it was almost destroyed with the pursuit of the Russian regular army farmer guerrilla and ended in a great failure.

DOC.Title: The 4th French Union Alliance
DOC.TEXT: A military alliance (most counted when counting in detail) that Napoleon participated in most of the countries of Europe, mainly Prussia, Austria, Russia, with the failure of the expedition of Russia.

DOC.Title: Liberation War
DOC.TEXT: The 4th general term for the war of overthrow of the Napoleonic regime by the French Alliance.

DOC.Title: Battle of Leipzig, National War
DOC.TEXT: Battle where Prussia, Austria, Russian allied army won the Napoleonic army. In the big decisive battle of the Liberation War, Paris fell in March 2002 and Napoleon abdicated in April.

DOC.Title: Elba Island
DOC.TEXT: A small island on the northwest coast of Italy. From May 1814 Napoleon was infested.

DOC.Title: Louis XVIII
DOC.TEXT: French King (ranking 1814-24). Brother Louis XVI. He had been exiled abroad since 1791, but after seeing Napoleon's defeat, he returned to Japan in May and declared its position. Exiled again in the hundred days in the middle of the world, afterwards restored, restrained the rebellion of the reaction by the extremist group of the royalists, relieved the conflict between aristocracy and bourgeois.

DOC.Title: Vienna Conference
DOC.TEXT: An international conference held in Vienna to handle various problems after the Napoleonic War. Napoleon escaped from Elba Island in February 15, declaring his return to Paris in March, looking at the disorder of the conference caused by the conflict of interests of the participating countries and the public's dissatisfaction with the return of Louis XVI.

DOC.Title: Battle of Waterloo
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon and British Prussia, a decisive battle with the Allied Forces of the Netherlands. Napoleon was completely defeated in the present Belgian small village.

DOC.Title: Wellington
DOC.TEXT: British military commander in Waterloo fight. After participating as Vienna conference full authority, he became prime minister.

DOC.Title: Hundredth day of the week
DOC.TEXT: Temporary control of Napoleon, escaping Elba Island, until being defeated by Waterloo's battle and retiring again.

DOC.Title: St. Helena
DOC.TEXT: Island of Britain on the South Atlantic Ocean. Napoleon was exiled to this island in October 1815 after his withdrawal and died for 21 years. There was also a theory of poisoning, after death, Napoleonic legend was formed.

DOC.Title: Vienna regime
DOC.TEXT: The international reactionary system of Europe in the first half of the 19th century established by the Vienna conference. It revived the state before the French Revolution, and balanced the powers of the great powers. Although it suppressed the liberalism · nationalist movement, mainly on the sacred and Shikoku alliance, it collapsed in various revolution of 1848.

DOC.Title: Vienna Conference
DOC.TEXT: An international conference held to rebuild the international order after the French Revolution / Napoleonic War. All European countries participated except for the Ottoman Empire. The territorial issue conflicted and conflicting interests of the countries, but it went to compromise with the escape of Napoleon's Elba Island.

DOC.Title: "Conference is dancing, but it does not progress"
DOC.TEXT: Words that satirized the Vienna conference where there are many balls and banquets but deliberations do not progress at all.

DOC.Title: Metternich
DOC.TEXT: Austrian politician. Minister of Foreign Affairs, Prime Minister (in charge 1821-48). We hosted the Vienna conference and strived to form order as chairman. Since then, as the center of the Vienna regime, promoted the reactionary politics of all Europe in the first half of the nineteenth century, failed in the Vienna March Revolution in 1848, exiled to England.

DOC.Title: Talelan
DOC.TEXT: A French politician from a prestigious aristocratic clergy. As a foreign minister of Louis XVI, it became the full authority of the Vienna conference. Using the conflict of interests of each country, we advocated the principle of orthodoxy and avoided the responsibility of war in France.

DOC.Title: Orthodox
DOC.TEXT: Basic principles of Vienna conference proposed by Talelan. It pretended sovereignty and territory before the revolution and preached what should be returned to the state before the revolution.

DOC.Title: Power balance equilibrium
DOC.TEXT: An idea that emphasizes that each country maintains the same level of power so that only one country becomes powerful and does not control other countries. Along with orthodoxy it became the basic principle of the Vienna conference. Specifically, we tried to maintain the international order by balancing the forces among the five major powers (Britain, France, Prussia, Austria, Russia) and to prevent the reoccurrence of revolution and war.

DOC.Title: Vienna Protocol
DOC.TEXT: Protocol concluded at the Vienna conference. It was signed in June 1815. In principle, Bourbon Morning revived in France, Spain and Naples as a principle of orthodoxy and power balance, and territorial changes were made according to the interests of the major powers.

DOC.Title: Finland / Bessarabia
DOC.TEXT: It became Russian territory.

DOC.Title: Polish Constitutional Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Kingdom formed in the major part of the Grand Duchy of Warsaw. Emperor Russia doubled as the king, effectively became Russian territory.

DOC.Title: Ceylon, Sri Lanka
DOC.TEXT: England acquired from the Netherlands.

DOC.Title: Cape colony
DOC.TEXT: England acquired from the Netherlands.

DOC.Title: Malta Island
DOC.TEXT: It became a British territory.

DOC.Title: Lombardy / Venezia
DOC.TEXT: It became the Austrian territory.

DOC.Title: Constitutional Kingdom of the Netherlands
DOC.TEXT: The Dutch collapsed in the attack of the French Revolutionary Army resurrected and merged the Austrian Southern Nederlands (later Belgian provinces).

DOC.Title: · Rhineland
DOC.TEXT: Prussia acquired.

DOC.Title: German Federation
DOC.TEXT: The line alliance that Napoleon established was abolished, and a national union composed of 35 monarchic countries and 4 free city. Austria became an alliance. After the interruption by the March revolution in 1848, it survived until 1966.

DOC.Title: Eternal permanence of Switzerland
DOC.TEXT: Approved as a permanent neutral country with the addition of 5 provinces.

DOC.Title: Alexandre I
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of Russia (rank 1801-25). I broke Navoire 's Russian expedition army, advocated and established the sacred alliance at the Vienna conference.

DOC.Title: Holy Alliance
DOC.TEXT: In September 1815, spiritual alliance between monarchs based on Christian spirit of justice and fraternity, established by Alexander I advocate. All European monarchs, excluding Britain, the Ottoman Empire and the Pope, participated and were used for Metternich to reinforce the Vienna regime.

DOC.Title: Shikoku Alliance
DOC.TEXT: A military and political alliance established between November 1815, Britain, Russia, Austria and Prussia. For the purpose of maintaining the current situation in Europe, we strengthened the Vienna regime.

DOC.Title: Five-country alliance
DOC.TEXT: In November 1818, at the Aachen national conference, the French Shikoku Alliance was approved and became a Federation alliance.

DOC.Title: Liberal movement
DOC.TEXT: Respect for individual freedom and equality, exercise aiming at realization of acquisition of suffrage, establishment of ownership, freedom of economic activity, etc. Industrial bourgeoisie, which has been emerging in the development of capitalism, became the center of the movement.

DOC.Title: Nationalism, Nationalism
DOC.TEXT: Establishment of a nation-state by unification of ethnic groups, movement for seeking liberation / independence from foreign domination. It is also called nationalist movement, nationalist movement. Greek independence, the unification movement in Italy and Germany also spread to all parts of Eastern Europe.

DOC.Title: Bruschen shaft, German student alliance
DOC.TEXT: Union of college students formed at the University of Jena in search of freedom and unity in Germany in 1815. In late October 1817, in commemoration of three hundred years of Luther's birth, we held a large gathering in the Wartburg forest. It was suppressed by Metternich in the 19th year Carlsbert resolution.

DOC.Title: Carlsbert Resolution
DOC.TEXT: Resolution of the German federal parliament summarized at the initiative of Mötternich [The decision at the German major ministerial meeting held at the spa resort Carlsbad (Bohemia) in Bömen (Bohemia) was based]. The aim was to suppress the movement of liberalism and nationalistism which the students were centered, such as speech control and monitoring of universities.

DOC.Title: Carbonari, Charcoal Grilled Party
DOC.TEXT: A secret society formed in Southern Italy in the early 19th century. For the purpose of independence and unity of Italy, liberal reforms, it also penetrated northern Italy, strengthened the character of constitutional liberal movement. In 1820 Naples taught the revolutionary movements in Piemonte in 21 years, but it was repressed by the Austrian army, declined with the failure of the uprising of 30 to 31 years, and gave the youth Italy the central role of exercise. In addition, it was formed in France in 1821 and was active in the July Revolution.

DOC.Title: Naples Uprising
DOC.TEXT: An armed uprising that the Carbonarii-guided army took over against the Bourbon morning that was revived at the Vienna conference. It was crushed by the Austrian army 's interference in 1821.

DOC.Title: Piemonte Uprising
DOC.TEXT: Northern Italy, the armed uprising Carbonari took in Turin in the center of the Piedmont region of Sardinia. It was destroyed by armed interference of the Austrian army.

DOC.Title: Spanish constitutional revolution
DOC.TEXT: The revolution that Liego et al. Made in Cádiz against the tyranny of the Bourbon morning revived after rule of Napoleon. Although it revived the Constitution of 1812, in 23 years, it was frustrated by the interference of the French army which fears the spread of the revolution.

DOC.Title: Recovery of Decablist, disorder of the December party
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that the youth aristocrat officers of Russia made in December 1825. A Russian youth aristocratic officer who served in the Napoleonic war, learned the Western liberalism spirit, and remembered the backwardness of his country, demanded the elimination of the constitution and the serfdom system · tourism, but it was suppressed by Nicolai I It was done.

DOC.Title: independence of Latin American countries
DOC.TEXT: During the Napoleonic war, independence movement took place around 1810 on the turmoil of the home country. Meethernich and others attempted to repress, but abandoned in opposition to the United Kingdom aiming for economic advance to Latin America and the United States that issued the Monroe declaration, the independence of Latin American countries was achieved and the Vienna regime was outside the europe I got stuck.

DOC.Title: Latin America
DOC.TEXT: Latin America which is south of Mexico. Until the beginning of the 19th century, except for Brazilian Portuguese, it was primarily a Spanish colony, both Latin immigrants dominated indigenous people by assimilation.

DOC.Title: Indio
DOC.TEXT: Indigenous people in the Americas.

DOC.Title: Criolyo
DOC.TEXT: Caucasian white man in Latin America. Mainly landowner class. Conflicted with bureaucrats dispatched from home country and became the center of independence movement.

DOC.Title: Mestiso
DOC.TEXT: Mixed people of white and indians in Latin America. Many wanted liberation, and cooperated in the independence movement by Cliorogio.

DOC.Title: Mlato
DOC.TEXT: Mixed white and black people in Latin America. It was discriminated, wanted independence and liberation.

DOC.Title: Tupaku = Uprising of Amar
DOC.TEXT: In 1780, led by a leader who raised Tupak = Amar II, rebellion by indigenous people who expanded to the Andes Highlands. In the 81st year execution of the leader, the rebellion was suppressed, but it left a big influence on the South American independence movement after that.

DOC.Title: Uprising of Saint-Demang
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion of the black guy who occurred in the French colony in the western part of the Caribbean Sea of ​​Espanola (present Haiti). It evolved into independence movement and fought back the French army in 1804 to achieve independence.

DOC.Title: Haiti independence
DOC.TEXT: Haiti was in the western part of Espanola Island and in 1697 it became French territory from Spain territory. With the influence of the French Revolution, in 1791 the black guy rebelled and developed into an independence movement, the national public council of the home country declared abolition of the 94 years guilty system. After repelling the interference of the Napoleonic army afterwards, he became independent in 1804, became the world's first black republic (Haiti Republic), France approved in 25 years.

DOC.Title: Toussaint-leverture
DOC.TEXT: Black leader of Haiti independence movement. It was called "Black Jacoban" and repulsed the British troops invaded in 1798 and took control of the whole island, but it was caught by the Napoleonic army afterwards and died in prison in France right before Haiti independence.

DOC.Title: Simon Bolivar
DOC.TEXT: Leader of Latin American Independence Movement. From Venezuela's clioreo, he was active in independence after 1810. In the year 11 he joined the Venezuelan Declaration of Independence, succeeded in establishing the Republic of Great Colombia in 19 and Ecuador in it in 22 years. In 25 years he also succeeded in independence of Bolivia, but he retired after the demolition of the Republic of Colombia for 30 years.

DOC.Title: Venezuela independence
DOC.TEXT: Miranda in 1811 declared independence. In 19 years Bolivar's guidance was independent as part of the Republic of Great Colombia, but for another 30 years, it became independent and separated as the Republic of Venezuela.

DOC.Title: Independence in Brazil
DOC.TEXT: When the French army invaded Portugal, the royal family evacuated to Brazil, the king returned home after Napoleon's loss, but the remaining prince proclaimed to the emperor and proclaimed independence in 1822. It became a republic in 1989.

DOC.Title: Argentina independence
DOC.TEXT: In the guidance of Saint-Martin in 1816, he declared independence from the Spanish as Lapurota Commonwealth. In 1953, the Constitution was enacted and became a republic.

DOC.Title: Chile Independence
DOC.TEXT: With the support of Saint-Martin in 1818, he declared independence and became a republic.

DOC.Title: Colombian independence
DOC.TEXT: From Spain with the help of Bolivar it became independant as Republic of Great Colombia in 1819 and annexed Venezuela. But the Republic of Colombia was dismantled in 30 years and became the Republic of Colombia.

DOC.Title: Peru independence
DOC.TEXT: With the support of Saint-Martin in 1821, he declared independence and repulsed the Spanish army in 24 years, and achieved complete independence as a republic.

DOC.Title: Saint-Martin
DOC.TEXT: Leader of Latin American Independence Movement. Argentinaan clioreo instructed Argentina, Chile and Peru's independence movement.

DOC.Title: Mexico independence
DOC.TEXT: Uprising with Hidalgo's guidance in 1810, declaring independence from Spain for 13 years, failed. After that, they achieved independence in 1821, empire in 22 years and transition to Republic in 24 years. A revolution of liberalism occurred in 1954 and the Constitution was enacted in 1957.

DOC.Title: Hidalgo
DOC.TEXT: A leader of priest / independence movement from Cliorogio. He was active in Mexico's independence movement, but was captured and executed for the next 1811, following the release of the Declaration of Independence.

DOC.Title: Bolivian independence
DOC.TEXT: In 1825 Bolivar became independent from Spain as a republic, and adopted the name of Bolivar in the country name.

DOC.Title: Monoculture
DOC.TEXT: Refers to agriculture that produces a single (a little type) product crop. Sometimes it means a specific development of mineral resources. In Latin American countries, it was conducted mainly on the clitori, which was the center of independence and the plantation operated by foreign capital. Because it relies on a single (small kind) crop (mineral resources), it is heavily influenced by international price (or climate change), etc., and it is still a cause of stagnation of the Latin America economy.

DOC.Title: Canning
DOC.TEXT: British Foreign Minister (Tenure 1807-09, 22-27). In support of the Monroe Declaration, in order to expand the British commodity market, we approved and assisted the independence of Latin American countries. After 1825 Greece's independence was also supported. I became prime minister in 1976, but I fell ill.

DOC.Title: Monroe
DOC.TEXT: Fifth President of the United States (Tenure 1817 ~ 25). Democratic Republican Party. In 1823 he issued the Monroe Declaration to support the independence of the Latin American countries.

DOC.Title: Monroe Declaration, Monroe Instruction
