DOC.TEXT: A statement issued by President Monroe in the annual letter to Congress against the interference of independence of Latin American countries by European countries and the south policy toward Russia's Pacific coast. We insisted on mutual non-interference between European countries and the Americas countries, eliminating the interference of the Vienna regime to Latin American independence.

DOC.Title: Panama Conference
DOC.TEXT: 1826 Conference held mainly by Bolivar to strengthen solidarity in Latin America. I could not produce results.

DOC.Title: Greek Revolutionary War
DOC.TEXT: Greek independence war under the control of the Ottoman Empire. Proclaiming independence in 1822, the Ottoman Empire moved the Egyptian army to quell it, but Western European volunteers supported Greece, Britain, France, Russia aiming to advance into the eastern Mediterranean, intervened and in 29 Independence was achieved.

DOC.Title: Adrianope Convention
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty between the Russian-Ottoman Empire. The Ottoman Empire ceded the North Sea of ​​Black Sea to Russia and approved Greek independence.

DOC.Title: London Conference
DOC.TEXT: Britain · France etc. summarized the London Protocol and approved the complete independence of Greece.

DOC.Title: Restoration Queen
DOC.TEXT: Immediately after Napoleon 's withdrawal, Louis XVIII throne and restored the Bourbon dynasty. Between the 100th day of Napoleon 's heavenly earthquake, the Orthodox was approved at the Vienna conference in June, 1815.

DOC.Title: Louis XVIII
DOC.TEXT: French King (ranking 1814-24). Brother Louis XVI. After the fall of Napoleon, he came home and reigned, restoring the Bourbon Morning.

DOC.Title: Charles XII
DOC.TEXT: The last King of the Bourbon French of France (ranking 1824-30). Brother Louis XVI. Protecting aristocrats and priests, giving a large amount of compensation to exiled nobility, and promoting reactionary politics such as dissolving the national army. However, the July Revolution resulted in exile in the UK.

DOC.Title: Soldiers in Algeria
DOC.TEXT: The invasion war that Charles X carried out to deflect public complaints about domestic politics out. Since then, Algeria was regarded as a French colony until 1962.

DOC.Title: Abdul-Cadill
DOC.TEXT: Algerian nationalist leader. As Amir (chief) led the anti-French struggle for 1832-47 years, but surrendered to be defeated by the French army.

DOC.Title: July elegance
DOC.TEXT: Emergency decree issued by Charles XII. Dissolution of parliament (unconvocation) which liberalism forces extended in May general election, major restriction of election qualification to deprive voters of non-landowners voting rights, strengthening control of speech and publication.

DOC.Title: July Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that killed the restoration of the Bourbon and restored the monarchy in July. When the July Royal Decree was issued by Charles XII, on July 27 students, small citizens, workers and so on uprised by bourgeoisie gained victory over the 3-day urban war, and Charles XII I exiled to England. Regarding the regime of the new government, the constitutional monarchy and the Republican group conflicted, but the Orleans family Louis-Filippe, which was known as a liberalist, throne, the royal government of July was established.

DOC.Title: Orleans house
DOC.TEXT: A duke who starts with brother Philip of Louis XIV becoming public Orleans. In the July Revolution Louis-Philippe throne to the king.

DOC.Title: Louis-Philippe
DOC.TEXT: The King of the July monarchy (ranking 1830-48). I am from Orleans. Known as a liberal aristocrat, throne with the July Revolution, abandoned the theory of royal authority and self-stated as "the king of the French citizens." However, after that, it became reactive, exiled to the UK as a result of the February revolution.

DOC.Title: Julian monarchy
DOC.TEXT: Constitutional monarchy based on restricted elections established in the July Revolution. Politics centered on the interests of a small number of bankers / large bourgeoisie were promoted. However, during this period, as the Industrial Revolution progressed, small and medium-sized capitalists and workers who increased the number of people emerging, developed campaigns seeking amendments to the election laws. In response, Gizzo, who was in charge of the administration in the 1840s, continued the repression measures, finally the February revolution occurred and it collapsed.

DOC.Title: Belgian independence
DOC.TEXT: Belgium was consolidated in the Netherlands with different religions and languages ​​at the Vienna conference. However, in 1830, an armed uprising inspired by the July Revolution occurred in Prussel, declaring independence from the Netherlands, the following year the Leopold I was thrusting and constitutional monarchy was established. It was internationally approved at the London Conference in 1831.

DOC.Title: Poland revolt
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that Polish shruga (family and lord) and others asked for departure from Russia's rule. I could not get the support of the people, Warsaw fell into the hands of the Russian army and ended in failure.

DOC.Title: German Rebellion
DOC.TEXT: Rebellion that occurred throughout Germany due to the influence of the July Revolution. Constitution was enacted in Saxony · Hessen and others.

DOC.Title: Italian revolt
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that Carbonari dominated the central Italy due to the influence of the July Revolution. It was crushed by the Austrian army.

DOC.Title: Ireland annexation
DOC.TEXT: In 1800 the British Parliament negotiated a joint law ignoring Ireland and annexed Ireland next year in 2001. Discrimination against Irish people with many Catholics was born.

DOC.Title: Great Britain = United Kingdom of Ireland
DOC.TEXT: 1801 The name of the country after Britain annexed Ireland.

DOC.Title: Abolition of the Unity-Prohibition Law
DOC.TEXT: The unilateral prohibition law enacted in 1799 was abolished and the formation of labor union was officially recognized.

DOC.Title: Abolition of examination law
DOC.TEXT: It became possible to take non-national officials excluding Catholics.

DOC.Title: Non-Kokaku
DOC.TEXT: A Protestant other than British nationals. After the restoration of the royal government, it was the subject of political discrimination.

DOC.Title: Catholic liberation method
DOC.TEXT: The law which enabled Catholics to take office as public officials. Established by O'Connell 's efforts, religious discrimination was abolished in the UK. There was also a purpose to harmonize Ireland with many Catholics.

DOC.Title: O'Connell
DOC.TEXT: Irish nationalist and politician. In 1828 he won the House of Representatives, but he was not allowed to seat as prescribed by the Examination Law, he was abolished by the same year's examination law and endeavored to establish the Catholic Liberation Law in 1928. After that, in 1832 he became a member of the House of Representatives.

DOC.Title: Corrupted constituency
DOC.TEXT: Despite the dramatic decrease in population due to the population concentration in emerging cities in the 18th century in the United Kingdom, the electoral district was elected as a powerful landowner / aristocrat who elected the House of Representatives as before.

DOC.Title: First election law amendment
DOC.TEXT: With the influence of the July Revolution realized by the Gray Cabinet of Whigg Party. (1) abolishing the corrupted constituency, assigning seats to emerging commercial and industrial cities, (2) giving the industrial capitalist a suffrage. As a result, voters have increased from 500,000 to 810,000.

DOC.Title: Gray Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: The cabinet organized by Gray of Whigg party. In 1832 the first election law reform was successful, and the following year, the factory law and the Liberation Liberation Act were established.

DOC.Title: Banned Trade, UK
DOC.TEXT: With the efforts of the Quakers and the evangelists, the law for abolishing trade trade was enacted. However, until the abortion itself was abolished, measures against complete prohibition were not taken.

DOC.Title: Wilberforce
DOC.TEXT: British politician. Christian Evangelical activist. He endeavored to establish the abolition of trade trade abolishment law in 1807 and to abolish the slushing regime of 33 years.

DOC.Title: Abolition of abortion, UK
DOC.TEXT: With the strong opposition of colonial landlords, the gray cabinet realized it by establishing the Liberation Law on condition that the government compensated the slave owner. Furthermore, in France in 1848, in the United States in 65 years ban was forbidden.

DOC.Title: Abolition of Chinese Trade Exclusive Rights of East India Company
DOC.TEXT: East India Company's trade activities were completely halted, and China's trade was also free.

DOC.Title: Grain law
DOC.TEXT: Landlord Protection Act enacted in 1815 (In the UK, the establishment and revision of a similar "grain law" has been continued since the end of the 17th century). After the end of the Napoleonic war, imports were restricted by imposing high tariffs on foreign grain to prevent domestic grain prices from falling due to cheap grain flowing from continents. Since the 1830 's, industrial capitalists developed violent opposition campaigns and were abolished in 46 years.

DOC.Title: Cobden
DOC.TEXT: British politician. Promoter of the Free Trade Movement, formed an anti-grain law alliance, and was a great success both inside and outside the Congress to the ceremonial abolition movement.

DOC.Title: Bright
DOC.TEXT: British politician. He insisted on free trade and played an active part in the ceremonial abolition campaign with Cobden.

DOC.Title: Anti grain law alliance
DOC.TEXT: A nationwide organization seeking to abolish the grain law formed by Cobden Bright et al. The headquarters was placed in Manchester.

DOC.Title: abolition of grain law
DOC.TEXT: It was realized by Peir Conservative Party inside. It was an expression of the victory of the UK industrial capitalist against the landlord, making the flow to free trade decisive.

DOC.Title: Voyage Law abolished
DOC.TEXT: The navigation law enacted after 1651 has been abolished and the free trade system in the UK has been established.

DOC.Title: free tradeism
DOC.TEXT: Assertion to eliminate national interference in trade. Proposed by Adam Smith and Ricardo, it was also a strong demand of industrial capitalists.

DOC.Title: Charisteist movement
DOC.TEXT: Organized political movement by the first worker in history to realize the general election, mainly urban workers who could not obtain voting rights in the first election law amendment. We made the People's Charter, and in 1839, 42, 48 appealed for parliamentary petitions, demonstrations and strikes. With the influx of the February Revolution, the big rally held in 1848 was held as a climax, after that it declined due to government repression and economic boom.

DOC.Title: People's Charter, People's Charter
DOC.TEXT: A petition written by Charitist in 1837. It was distributed nationwide in 1838 and became a political platform and was submitted to Parliament for 39 years. Male ordinary elections, bearer secret voting, abolition of property qualifications of parliamentarians, parliamentary paid system, uniform equally elected district system, refereeing every year in Congress.

DOC.Title: Chadwick
DOC.TEXT: British social improvers. He contributed to the enactment of the Public Health Act of 1848 by cooperating as a committee member in welfare and welfare administration.

DOC.Title: election law reform movement, France
DOC.TEXT: An election law amendment campaign held under the July Queen. The electoral system at that time was an extreme restricted election where bankers, large merchants and owner of less than 1% of the French population monopolized the right to vote. Small and medium-sized capitalists and workers who increased in the industrial revolution demanded the implementation of ordinary elections and developed campaign to eliminate restricted elections.

DOC.Title: Reform Banquet
DOC.TEXT: A rally aimed at revising the election law held in various places in the late July. Originally bourgeoisie was the center, but since the radical republican and socialists joined, the demand became radical and the interference from the Gizzo cabinet became stronger.

DOC.Title: Guzzot
DOC.TEXT: French politicians and historians. He became the prime minister (1847-48), strongly opposed various reforms, resulted in a revolution in February and exiled to England.

DOC.Title: February Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that overthrew the July monarchy and established the second Republic. February 22 riots occurred by workers, students, small and medium-sized capitalists when the Gizzo cabinet prohibited Paris' reform banquet. February 23 GiZo resigned and Louis-Philippe ascended to England on 24th, the Queen government of July collapsed. The influence of the February Revolution spread to all Europe and the Vienna regime collapsed.

DOC.Title: Temporary government
DOC.TEXT: Immediately after the February Revolution, a government consisting of industrial capitalist republists and a small number of socialists joined. I declared the Republicans.

DOC.Title: Second Republic Government
DOC.TEXT: The political system from the February Revolution to Roy-Napoleon 's Emperor' s Position (Second Empire).

DOC.Title: La Martine
DOC.TEXT: French romantic poet and politician. He was active in the February Revolution with the bourgeois republican and became the foreign minister of the temporary government (in fact, it also served as prime minister).

DOC.Title: Louis-Blanc
DOC.TEXT: French socialist. He was active in the February Revolution, came to the temporary government and became the chairman of the Labor Relations Committee. Promoted socialist policies such as the establishment of a national workshop but failed in the April elections, exiled to the UK after the June violence.

DOC.Title: National Workshop
DOC.TEXT: Institutions established to rescue unemployed people by allegations of socialist such as Louis-Blanc. The main content was to let unemployed people engage in civil engineering work, etc. Even without work, the daily salary was paid and became antipathy of bourgeois and small peasants.

DOC.Title: April ordinary general election
DOC.TEXT: Male ordinary election held after the February Revolution. Socialist forces broke down and the conservative government of the Republic began, as female citizens and farmers who were afraid to advance socialist forces supported the bourgeois republican.

DOC.Title: June Riot, June Uprise
DOC.TEXT: Riot made by socialists and workers. The government of the bourgeois republic who got victory in the April ordinary election was caused as a rebound against the abolition of the national workshop. Being suppressed by the government forces, the second Republican rule of bourgeois was established.

DOC.Title: Cavignac
DOC.TEXT: French soldier / politician. He was active in the Algerian conquest war and appointed Governor General Algeria after the February revolution in 1848. After that, from the lawmakers became the land minister and suppressed the June riot, but in the presidential election of December 1848 it was defeated by Louis-Napoleon.

DOC.Title: Louis-Napoleon
DOC.TEXT: A child of Napoleon I 's younger brother Rui. While pursuing asylum after the collapse of the First Imperial College, he aimed for imperial revival. He returned home from the UK in the December 1848 presidential election, collected candidates for small farmers and troops using the fame of Napoleon I, won anti-bourgeois worker votes, and won the president (1848 ~ 52). In 1951, he got a coup duty and took over dictatorship, crowned to the emperor (ranking 1852-70) by the national referendum in 52 years, he called Napoleon III.

DOC.Title: "Spring of nations"
DOC.TEXT: The word pointing to the spring of 1848, where the movement of liberalism / nationalism occurred in various parts of Europe due to the February Revolution.

DOC.Title: 1848 Revolution
DOC.TEXT: It is a generic term that the French February Revolution spread across Europe and was eventually a collapse of the Vienna regime, a revolution as a turning point for liberalism and nationalism, and even the movement of socialism.

DOC.Title: March Revolution
DOC.TEXT: In the influence of the February Revolution, the Austrian capital Vienna, the capital of Prussia Berlin, the revolution in Germany.

DOC.Title: Vienna March Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that has led to Metternich due to the uprising of students, citizens and workers seeking freedom and constitution. As a result, the Vienna regime collapsed. In April the emperor approved the Constitutional Constituent Council and promised liberal reform, but turned to suppression when seeing the failure of the Paris June riot and suppressed the revolutionary in October.

DOC.Title: Hungarian folk movement, Majar ethnic movement
DOC.TEXT: Let Austria approve the amendment of the Constitution, and the first Hungarian Cabinet was formed. In April 1949, Koshut issued the Declaration of Independence, but was suppressed by the Austrian army who was assisted by the Russian Army in August 1949.

DOC.Title: Koote
DOC.TEXT: Hungarian politician. Immediately after the February Revolution, he requested Austria to revise the Constitution and a responsible cabinet system, becoming the Finance Minister of the first Hungarian Cabinet. In Austria 's reactionary April 1849, declared independence of Hungary, became consul, but defeated by the invaded Russian army, exiled, died in Italy in Milan.

DOC.Title: Magyar person
DOC.TEXT: Hungarian self-name.

DOC.Title: Bamend ethnic movement, Bohemian ethnic movement
DOC.TEXT: An uprising that Prague, mainly a Prague, checked for seeking independence from Austria. Succeeded in opening up a constitutional legislative parliament and acquiring autonomy, but was suppressed by the Austrian army.

DOC.Title: Polish independence movement, Krakow uprising
DOC.TEXT: In 1846, the lords of the owner (Shurafuta) and others became the center, established a revolutionary regime in Krakow. However, the Austrian army 's attacks, frustrated by farmer' s riots opposing the lordsmen. After that a small independent movement occurred in various places in 1848, but was immediately suppressed.

DOC.Title: Slavic ethnic conference
DOC.TEXT: A meeting held in Prague aimed at unity and self-reliance of Slavic people in Austria. In opposition to the approach between the German and the Majar, I did not aim to disassemble the Austrian Empire with a line with Pan-Slavism but broke up because of the conflict between local representatives and ethnic rebellion in Prague.

DOC.Title: Jerachic
DOC.TEXT: Croatian politician. The Emperor of the Austrian Empire was appointed Governor General Croatia, joining the Hungarian Independence Movement and the revolution in Vienna.

DOC.Title: Paratky
DOC.TEXT: Historian and politician of the Czech Republic. He served as Chairman at the Slavic National Congress and asserted the unity of Slavic peoples within Austria.

DOC.Title: Italian national movement
DOC.TEXT: Independence rebellion of Italian countries, beginning with the riot in Milan / Venezia in March 1848. Kingdom of Sardinia began war against Austria, but was defeated in March 1949. In addition, Matsini's youth Italy established the Roman Republic in February 194, but collapsed in July with the intervention of the French army.

DOC.Title: Berlin March Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A collision occurred between the citizen affected by the revolution of the month of January and the armed forces, promising the king to form a constitution, and establishing a liberal cabinet. As Frankfurt's National Assembly progressed, bourgeoisie, which conservatives fought back forces due to the influence of the Paris June riot crush and the success of the Vienna anti-revolution, compromised the workers, also compromised with the royalists and in November 188 the Constitution The parliament was overwhelmed and ended.

DOC.Title: Frankfurt national parliament
DOC.TEXT: Germany's first parliament convened in Frankfurt-am-Mine to discuss German unification and constitutional enactment. Members of parliament centered on officials, scholars and bourgeoisie selected by the general election of each country. In regard to the unification system, large Germanism and small Germanism opposed, but the small Germanism dominated, and in December 1848 the German citizen 's basic law was created and the next German constitution in March 194 was created. However, I could not obtain the acceptance of Prussian King for German emperor, and then it was broken up in June 1949 with armed oppression.

DOC.Title: Great Germanism
DOC.TEXT: I am thinking to pursue unification of Germany, including the German region in Austrian territory and Boamen (Bohemia).

DOC.Title: Small Germanism
DOC.TEXT: Except for Austria, it is thought to achieve Germany unity centered on Prussia.

DOC.Title: Friedrich-Wilhelm IV
DOC.TEXT: Prussian King (ranking 1840-61). The Frankfurt national parliament requested the immediate thing to be rejected, but then declared the King Constitution in Prussia.

DOC.Title: Socialism, socialist thought
DOC.TEXT: It refers to ideas and exercises seeking economic equality by making public (state-owned) production means (machinery, land etc.) as being the source of social inequality in private property. The word is said to start with Robert Owen. From the time when labor problems and social problems occurred in the Industrial Revolution, it appeared and developed as the biggest movement advocating reform or abolition of the capitalist regime.

DOC.Title: Fantasy Socialism
DOC.TEXT: It is a collective term of socialism before Marx who took a real ideal society from a humanitarian standpoint. Engels named it.

DOC.Title: Robert Owen
DOC.TEXT: British fantasy socialists. In New Lanark, Scotland, denying the pursuit of profit as a manager of a spinning factory, he strove to improve the welfare of his own factory workers, confident of improvement of human nature through improvement of the environment. In 1825-28, attempting to construct an ideal cooperative society new harmony in the United States failed. After returning home, he worked on the establishment of factory law, training of labor union and cooperative association, and formed a national union union coalition in 34 years, but retired due to the dissolution.

DOC.Title: Factory Act
DOC.TEXT: Act prescribed for the protection of factory workers. It was gradually improved through statutory laws such as 1802, 1819 and 1833.

DOC.Title: Cooperative
DOC.TEXT: Organization formed by workers / small producers for joint economic activities. He developed with the guidance of Robert Owen and others.

DOC.Title: Saint-Simon
DOC.TEXT: French fantasy socialists. I participated as a soldier in the American Revolutionary War. We stressed the realization of an industrial society where people's abilities can be demonstrated freely, not emphasizing the conflict of labor.

DOC.Title: Fourier
DOC.TEXT: French fantasy socialists. Criticized the capitalist society and claimed to realize a cooperative ideal society (Farrange).

DOC.Title: Anarchism, Anarchism
DOC.TEXT: An idea that aims at a society in which the power of the state, the government, etc. is denied and the individual is completely free. In modern times Proudhon and Bakunin and others became the main claimants. Denied Congressionalism and emphasized the direct action of workers.

DOC.Title: Proudhon
DOC.TEXT: French socialist. He stated that "property, it is theft", condemned the private property not based on labor, and called for mutual aid to settle the social problem. We spread the thought of anarchicism.

DOC.Title: Scientific Socialism
DOC.TEXT: Marx for fantasy socialism, socialism of Engels. Based on the materialism historical view, it was said that the process of transition from capitalist society to socialist society was analyzed "scientifically", that Engels claimed the correctness of socialism that was taken by himself (Marx · Engels et al.) .

DOC.Title: Marx
DOC.TEXT: A Jewish socialist born in Germany. We compiled philosophy, economics and history, and established the dialectic dialect and monument historical view. Furthermore, through the analysis of the capitalist society, the necessity of transition to socialism was preached, and the revolutionary theory was completed.

DOC.Title: Engels
DOC.TEXT: German socialists. As a collaborator of Marx, he tried to establish Marxism and disseminate it, and also himself made many writings and practical activities.

DOC.Title: "Communist Party Declaration"
DOC.TEXT: A work published by Marx and Engels in London in February 1848. I regarded the history of mankind as the history of class struggle and called for international solidarity of workers to overthrow the capitalist society and to build a socialist society. It is famous for the word "workers of the world, unite". Representative work of Marxism.

DOC.Title: Risorgimento
DOC.TEXT: Movement aiming for unification of Italy. The word "to revive" in Italian is the etymology.

DOC.Title: "Youth Italy"
DOC.TEXT: A political association formed in 1831 by Martini as an exile in Marseille. Following Carbonari 's activities, he organized a popular movement aiming for unification of Italy based on republicanism, but it declined with repression.

DOC.Title: Mazzini
DOC.TEXT: Revolutionary from Genoa. He joined Carbonari with enthusiastic republic and then in 1831, he organized "Youth Italy" at the exile in Marseille. Returning to Japan in 1848, he established the Roman Republic the following year, but failed in French pressures and exiled to London.

DOC.Title: Republic of Rome
DOC.TEXT: Republic of Mazzini's "Youth Italy" established after Pope Pius IX who escaped the revolution of February escaped from Rome. Calling for the constitutional establishment for unification of Italy, it collapsed in July due to the interference of the French army.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Sardinia, Kingdom of Sardinia
DOC.TEXT: In 1720, the small kingdom of Northern Italy, established by the Savoie family possession of Sardinia. Turin in the Piedmont region. Relatively capitalism developed within Italy, it was at the beginning of the Italian unification movement. King Carlo = Alberto enacted a liberal constitution by the February revolution and declared war against Austria but was defeated and abdicated. Then his son Vittorio Emanuele II succeeded in unifying Italy, and in 1861 he established the Kingdom of Italy.

DOC.Title: Carlo-Alberto
DOC.TEXT: King Sardinia (rank 1831-49). In 1848, the liberal constitution was enacted, exiled to Portugal after losing to Austria to unify Italy, but lost.

DOC.Title: Vittorio-Emanuele II ___
DOC.TEXT: King Sardinia (ranking 1849-61). He appointed Cavour as prime minister, succeeded in unifying Italy, became the first king (ranking 1861 to 78).

DOC.Title: Cavour
DOC.TEXT: A politician from a nobleman of the kingdom of Sardinia. From the standpoint of moderate constitutionalism, he instructed the unification of Italy, centering on the Kingdom of Sardinia. He became Prime Minister (Tenori 1852-61) and was active in domestic affairs and diplomacy, achieving unification of Italy, but shortly afterwards he died suddenly.

DOC.Title: Crimean war participation
DOC.TEXT: Sardinia participated in the Ottoman side at the request of Britain and France. As a result, in the Paris meeting held in 1856 after the war, it increased the international status and became a step towards the Italian Unification War (against Austria).

DOC.Title: Napoleonic III
DOC.TEXT: He also intervened in the Italian unification issue, promised a close agreement on unification in 1858, but then retreated and hindered the promise.

DOC.Title: Plonbière closeness
DOC.TEXT: Closure concluded between 1858 and Napoleon III and Cavour. Instead of Sardinia ceding Savoia and Nice to France, France promised to support Sardinia against the Austrian war.

DOC.Title: Italian Unification War
DOC.TEXT: The war between Italy, France and Austria over Italy unity. We fought from Austria who knew about Prom Biele. Sardinia won the victory with French aid, but when the merger of the northern Italian countries merged, Napoleon III fought with Austria and Villafranca to withdraw the French army in July afraid of Sardinia's mightyness . As a result, Sardinia has only acquired Lombardy.

DOC.Title: Acquiring Lombardier
DOC.TEXT: Sardinia in 1859 peace treaty, acquired from Austria through France.

DOC.Title: Central Italian consolidation
DOC.TEXT: Tuscan and other countries wanted a merger with Sardinia, Cavour decided to consolidate in March 1860, in exchange for the agreement of Napoleon III in exchange for Savoia-Nice's censure. As a result, integration north of central part was almost achieved.

DOC.Title: Savoia, Savoy
DOC.TEXT: In 1858 the Brombieres promised a ceremony to France, but as compensation for the approval of Central Italy integration for 60 years was executed.

DOC.Title: Nice
DOC.TEXT: In 1858 the Brombieres promised a ceremony to France, but as compensation for the approval of Central Italy integration for 60 years was executed.

DOC.Title: Garibaldi
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary from Nice. I joined Matszini's "Youth Italy" and also participated in independence movement such as Uruguay in South America. Returned to Japan in 1848, he was active in the defense of the Roman Republic for 49 years, but lost and exiled. After returning to the country in 1859, I participated in the Italian Unification War, but since I aimed for unification from a republican standpoint, I fought against Cavour. Later, in 1860, he led approximately 1,000 troop soldiers and succeeded in conquering Sicily and Southern Italy, but Italy unification was accomplished because it gave the land to Vittorio Emanuele II by Cavour's strategy.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Sicily, King of both Sicilia and Kingdom of Naples
DOC.TEXT: The kingdom which dominated Southern Italy (Naples) and Sicily. In 1130, Ruggero II of the Norman dynasty dominated both regions (officially the Kingdom of Sicily), and after the break of the Norman dynasty, the domination of the Staufen family, Anjou family, Aragon family, Bourbon family moved, It is complicated that Naples and Sicilia are separately controlled and reunited in that area as well. In 1815, the Bourbonese family of Spain recovered unity, used both Sicilian kingdoms as official name, but was conquered by Garibaldi in 1960 and was consolidated in the following Italian kingdom in 1961.

DOC.Title: 1000 thousand Corps, Red Shirt Corps
DOC.TEXT: Voluntary army Garibaldi organized in May 1860.

DOC.Title: Sicilian occupation
DOC.TEXT: A thousand enlistment commanded by Garibaldi landed in Sicily from Genoa. It was supported by the residents, occupied the island in three months, landed in southern Italy in September, conquered the two Sicilian kingdoms.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Italy
DOC.TEXT: In February 1861, representatives of all Italies except Venice and the Roman Catholic Church hosted a parliament in Turin, the kingdom established in March Vittorio Emanuele II as the first king (ranking 1861 to 78). The capital was placed in Turin (1861-65), then Florence (1865-71).

DOC.Title: Venezia consolidation
DOC.TEXT: Italy participated in the Prussian-Austrian (wageful) war by the anti-Austrian alliance with Prussia and merged in the peace treaty.

DOC.Title: Papal Occupation occupation
DOC.TEXT: The papacy had been shortly shrinking since the Napoleonic War. After the French army lost and withdrew in the Prussian-France (French) war, all but the Vatican was occupied and consolidated in the Italian kingdom, and the capital of 1871 was transferred to Rome. Since then, the Pope declared "Prisoners of the Vatican" and kept conflicting with the Kingdom of Italy.

DOC.Title: Vatican
DOC.TEXT: A place in the northwest corner of Rome city. The Vatican Palace is located next to Saint-Peter's Basilica and became the base of the Papacy since the 14th century. It is also used as an alias for the Holy See, which is the Catholic headquarters.

DOC.Title: "Uncollected Italy"
DOC.TEXT: After unification in 1870, we call an unrecovered area in an Italian residential area. Istria (including Trieste) · South Tyrol etc.

DOC.Title: Trieste
DOC.TEXT: The harbor city on the north east coast of the Adriatic Sea. Although it was regarded as an Austrian territory since the 14th century, three quarters of the residents were Italian, part of "uncollected Italy". It became the Italian territory under the 1919 Saint-Germain treaty.

DOC.Title: South Tyrol
DOC.TEXT: A mountainous area in the western part of Austria. Although it was a Habsburg family since the 14th century, it became Italian territory under the Saint-Germain convention in 1919.

DOC.Title: Customs Union, Germany Customs Union
DOC.TEXT: A customs union formed by Prussia after 1818. In 1828, a three tariff union in North, South and Central Germany was formed, then the integration of these 3 Customs Union was advanced, and the German Customs Union was established in 1934. It was influenced by a list of economists who insisted protectionist tradition, after that, economic unification of Germany advanced and became the premise of subsequent political unity.

DOC.Title: Krupp
DOC.TEXT: A large military company developed from a factory established in Essen, downstream of the River Rhine. In 1811, Friedrich-Klubb founded a cast steel factory, the second generation Alfredo was called "the cannon king" and established the ground as a weapon trader. It sold weapons to Prussia, the German empire, Europe and the rest of the world, became Germany's largest military consultant, and was regarded as a typical "merchant of death".

DOC.Title: Wilhelm I
DOC.TEXT: Prussian King (ranking 1861-88). In antagonism of the military reform, conflicts with Congressional liberalists, forcibly expanded armaments with Bismarck. Succeeded in Germany unification, became the first emperor (ranking 1871-88).

DOC.Title: Junker
DOC.TEXT: Landlord aristocrat east of the Elbe. After the liberation of the farmer, he did a semi-feudal farm management, monopolizing the conservative high-level bureaucracy of Breuzen and the soldier's job.

DOC.Title: Bismarck
DOC.TEXT: Born from Junker. Prime Minister Prussia (1862-90 in office) to promote iron-blood policy, ignoring Congress to force expansion of arms. Beating a diplomatic diplomacy skill to complete Austria-France and complete German unification, became the first German Empire's first president (1871-90), active in domestic affairs and diplomacy.

DOC.Title: "Current big problems are solved only by iron and blood, not speech or majority vote"
DOC.TEXT: The core part of the speech that Bismarck, aiming at expansion of arms, took place at the House Budget Committee in September, 1862. "Iron" is a weapon, "Blood" is a soldier.

DOC.Title: Iron Blood Policy
DOC.TEXT: It refers to Bismarck's military expansion policy, symbolized by the above speech. For this reason Bismarck was called "Chancellor of Iron Blood".

DOC.Title: Schleswig-Holstein
DOC.TEXT: A small minority in the southern part of the Jutland peninsula. Schleswig in the northern part belonged to Denmark from the early Middle Ages, Holstein in the south belonged to the Holy Roman Empire, but since the 15th century both Denmark's sovereignty came. There were many German residents, and it was a disputing place with Germany.

DOC.Title: Danish War
DOC.TEXT: The war between Prussia-Austria and Denmark, which broke out due to the Schleswig-Holstein problem. March 1863 When King Denmark declared the consolidation of the Dresdun Schleswig, Prussian invited Austria in the next 64 years to occupy both countries by dispatching in response to the requests of residents. In 1995 Schleswig was of Prussia and Holstein was placed under the administration of Austria but Bismarck further provoked Austria and made it an excuse for the opening of the Prussian-Austrian war.

DOC.Title: Prussia = Austrian War, Fawn War
DOC.TEXT: Due to the conflict between Germanism and Germanism over German unification, the war with Prussia's provocation triggered by the attribution of Schleswig-Holstein. Prussian victory over Sadova 's battle in July 1866, etc. It is also called seven-week war. Peace in Prague, Austria was excluded from the German Federation, and Prussia established the leadership in Germany unity.

DOC.Title: North Germany Federation
DOC.TEXT: Principal consortium of 22 countries north of the Main River headed by Prussian King. By this establishment, the German Federation has been demolished.

DOC.Title: Austria = Hungarian Empire, Austria = Hungary Dual Empire
DOC.TEXT: The allied state where Austria was established with the recognition of independence of the Magyar Hungarian kingdom by Ausgalai, in order to suppress the rebellion of Slavs in the territory as a result of the defeat in Prussia-Austrian war. The Austrian Emperor doubled as the King of Hungary and became a double empire with separate government, parliament. It was completely disassembled and extinguished at the defeat of World War I.

DOC.Title: Ausgriai
DOC.TEXT: Agreement concluded between Austria and Hungary in 1867. It means "compromise".

DOC.Title: Elisabeth
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of Austria Princess of Franz Josef I. Bavarian aristocrat. Having a close affinity with Hungary hating the conservative Viennese Court, it is known for traveling around the country. It was assassinated in Geneva.

DOC.Title: Spain's throne succession problem
DOC.TEXT: Queen Isabel II exiled to France in September 1868 's Spanish Revolution and became vacant and the Prussian royal Leopold was decided as the successor, but was canceled in 1970 with the strong opposition of Napoleon III.

DOC.Title: Prussia = French War, French War
DOC.TEXT: The battle between Prussia of Bismarck aiming at unification of Germany and France of Napoleon III who tried to prevent this. In July France declared war and declared war, but Napoleon III of September 2 was captured in Sudan (Sedan), the second Empire of France collapsed. Although the war continued as a war with the French citizens, the Prussian army won the victory and the provisional peace treaty of February 191 was tied in Versailles.

DOC.Title: German Empire
DOC.TEXT: Empire established around Prussia at the end of Prussia-France war. During the siege of Paris, it was declared established between the mirrors of the Palace of Versailles. Prussian King became the emperor, prime minister Prussia became the chief priest of the imperial capital, and took the federal system. In 1918, it disappeared in the defeat of World War I.

DOC.Title: German Emperor
DOC.TEXT: In German, Kaiser (Kaiser). It begins to Wilhelm I.

DOC.Title: Alsace-Lorraine
DOC.TEXT: In the Frankfurt Peace Treaty in May of 1871, Germany gained regional compensation of 5 billion francs from France. It has rich mineral resources and has made a dramatic development in German industry.

DOC.Title: German Empire Constitution
DOC.TEXT: It was issued in April 1871. Federal system · bicameral system parliament etc was stipulated. Breuzen held the initiative, the Prime Minister was responsible only to the emperor, and he was not responsible to parliament and the people. The monarchy was superior, it was only an appearance constitutionalism.

DOC.Title: Federal lecturer
DOC.TEXT: Congress consisting of 22 monarchies and 3 freedom representatives as prescribed in the German Empire Constitution. The right to ratify the law, the right to declare war and treaties, the right to speak, the right to resolve the dissolution of the imperial assembly. The chairperson was concurrently chairman of the imperial chief.

DOC.Title: Imperial Council
DOC.TEXT: A parliament composed of one parliament member elected for a population of 100,000 in a male universal election for all Germans over 25 years old. Although he had the budget deliberation right, the emperor had the convocation right, and a ruling cabinet system was not allowed.

DOC.Title: Central Party
DOC.TEXT: German Catholic party formed in 1870. South Germany was the ground, resisting centralization led by Prussia.

DOC.Title: Cultural Struggle
DOC.TEXT: A battle between Bismarck and the Catholic Church and the Central Party in southern Germanism anti-Prussian. For measures against socialist forces, Bismarck gradually conceded and it ended in 1980.

DOC.Title: German Socialist Workers' Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1875, the world's first socialist party, formed by the combination of the La Salle school (All-Germany workers' alliance) and Marxist Eisenach (Social Democratic Labor Party). It was suppressed by the socialist criminalizing law established by Bismarck.

DOC.Title: Emperor Sniper Incident
DOC.TEXT: Twice. Although it was unrelated to socialists, Bismarck enacted the socialist suppression law by this opportunity.

DOC.Title: Socialist suppression method
DOC.TEXT: Law to suppress the socialist movement that Bismarck set as an excuse for the emperor sniper case. Prohibition of socialist associations, restrictions on meetings and publications, etc. were prescribed and the Socialist Workers Party was temporarily hit but expanded the party party rather than martyrs' action of a strong organization and leaders . It was abolished by Bismarck's disappearance in 1890.

DOC.Title: Bismarck's social policy
DOC.TEXT: Policies such as establishing insurance laws such as diseases, disasters, and elderly, and developing labor protection systems for young people and women. It was part of the "American" part of the policy of Bismarck's "Ame and Meu", and there was also the purpose to separate workers from the socialist movement.

DOC.Title: protection tax law
DOC.TEXT: Established in December 1879. Act imposing tariff on imported goods of industrial products and agricultural products. "Iron is an industrial capitalist and grain symbolizes Junker" as it was established to protect the interests of industrial capitalists and Yunkers and to establish a support base for Bismarck.

DOC.Title: Three Kingdoms alliance
DOC.TEXT: Military alliance between Germany, Austria and Italy. It was the outcome of the Bismarck diplomacy to isolate French.

DOC.Title: Re-Security Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Confidential treaty tied between Germany and Russia. Bismarck was established to prevent Russia from approaching France. When one of the convention parties was attacked, the other promised to keep neutrality.

DOC.Title: Bismarck regime, Bismarck diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: The international system for isolation of France (foreign policy), which Bismarck has concluded with the Tripartite Alliance and the Re-Security Treaty etc.

DOC.Title: 1851 coup d'etat
DOC.TEXT: Coup d'etat president Louis-Napoleon did. I dissolved parliament with military power and wiped out the royalist. With the term of office of the president as 10 years, the authorities were expanded and a dictatorship system was established.

DOC.Title: Second Empire
DOC.TEXT: Empire by Napoleon III. Louis-Napoleon, who gained overwhelming support for the referendum in November 1852, declared the emperor in December and was named Napoleon III. Maintaining the administration by using conflicts of interest between republicans and bourgeois workers, nonproductive citizens and small peasants. The first half of the imperial period was called the era of authority empire and power was concentrated in the emperor, but since 1860 it conceded to the elevation of the liberal movement, and the right to question the parliament, the right to organize workers, the right to organize workers and publications It was called the age of the Free Imperial Government because it accepted part of freedom. The prestige of Napoleon III was hurt due to the failure of dispatch of Mexico, and during the Prussian-France war, the emperor himself became a prisoner of war, and the imperial government disappeared.

DOC.Title: Napoleonic III
DOC.TEXT: Nephew of Napoleon I. Emperor of France (ranking 1852-70). Utilizing the reputation of Napoleon I, he maintained the administration by multiplying the conflict of interests of workers, peasants and bourgeoisie (Bonapartism). He continued to expand and invade abroad in order to keep the popularity of the people, but it was abolished as a prisoner of war in the Prussian-French war.

DOC.Title: Crimean war
DOC.TEXT: A war that Russia requested Jerusalem 's holy land management right and fought with the Ottoman Empire. England and France etc participated in the Ottoman side in 1854 to prevent Russia's south to the eastern Mediterranean. Russia was defeated and the popularization of Napoleon III rose as Russia's south policy was rejected in the Treaty of Paris in 1956.

DOC.Title: Italian Unification War
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon III self-stated as an advocate of nationalism, supported the Italian unified war with the Bromyres closure, betrayed shortly afterwards, but eventually he gained Savoie Nice and expanded his territory.

DOC.Title: Arrow War
DOC.TEXT: U.S. and France invasion war against China. France entered China as a pretext to kill missionaries, gave way to the Qing Dynasty and gained various trade rights and reparations in Beijing Treaty in 1860 and entered China.

DOC.Title: Indochina soldier
DOC.TEXT: He was co-dispatched with Spain on the grounds of executions by Spanish missionaries. In 1859 occupied Saigon, declared the possession of the eastern three provinces of Cochin Sina in Saigon Treaty in 1962. In addition, 1863 Cambodia was a protected country, and in 1906 occupied the three provinces of Western Coachina, with the military force, laid the foundation of the French Indochina which will be formed later.

DOC.Title: Paris World Exposition
DOC.TEXT: In 1855, Napoleon III aiming for the revival of the national rule opened in Paris. The second time after London.

DOC.Title: Ottoman
DOC.TEXT: French officials. In 1853-70 he became Governor of the Seine Provincial Governor, conducted a full-scale remodeling project in Paris, making a prototype of the streets of Paris.

DOC.Title: Mexican dispatch
DOC.TEXT: Mexico's foreign debt of fiscal difficulties Mexico's joint fighting that Napoleon III invited Britain and Spain by multiplying the gap of the Civil War of the United States with an unpaid declaration as an excuse. After the withdrawal of the two countries also soldiers, defeated the Republican government of Mexico and set the Maximilian of the Austrian emperor to the Emperor of Mexico. With the guerilla resistance and pestilence of the Mexican army, the French army was destroyed and there were protests in the United States, eventually abandoning Maximilian and retreating. With this failure Napoleon III's popularity declined and became a trigger for decline.

DOC.Title: Prussia = French War, French War
DOC.TEXT: Prussia aiming for unification of Germany and the war of France that tried to restore the authority of Emperor Napoleon III. Bismarck 's provocation made a fight from the French side, but Napoleon III was abandoned as a prisoner of war, and the second empire collapsed. Although the fight continued, the defeat was decided in the castle in Paris in January 1971.

DOC.Title: Sedan, sedan
DOC.TEXT: A town in the eastern border of France. On 2 September 1870 Napoleon III surrounded and surrendered and became a prisoner.

DOC.Title: Temporary government
DOC.TEXT: A conservative government elected in Bordeaux as a result of the general election held after the conclusion of the Armistice Treaty with Germany and the national assembly was formed and elected there. Mr. Thiel was the chief executive (the prime minister), while proceeding peacefully against Germany, he suppressed Paris-Commune.

DOC.Title: Thier
DOC.TEXT: French politician. Republican bourgeois. He served as prime minister (resigned 1836, 1840) under the royal regime of July. Immediately after the establishment of the Second Republic, he supported Louis-Napoleon, but refused cooperation with the Second Empire. In 71 years after the Prussian-French war, he was appointed as the administrative chief of the temporary government in the Bordeaux Parliament, after suppressing the Paris-Commune, became the first president of the Third Republic (1871-73).

DOC.Title: Paris-Commune
DOC.TEXT: The autonomous government organized by the Parisian citizens who opposed the temporary government 's peace peace. In February 1871 the opposition against the Versailles provisional treaty against the Paris citizens against the National Army, the rebellion occurred as the Thiele government canceled the disarmament. In March, a commune was established through the election of all citizens, declaring independence from the Thier government. The autonomous government by the first worker in history, aiming at thorough democracy such as direct election of all official positions, opening of various conference decisions, principle of freedom and equality, corruption being death penalty. It was collapsed on Thursday 21 May from the repression of 'Thursday of Blood' by the Thière Government with support from Germany.

DOC.Title: Third Republic Government
DOC.TEXT: French political system from the collapse of the second imperial government to the surrender of World War II to Germany. Although it was unstable due to various cases involving the party party and the revenge against vengeance, it settled the Republicans.

DOC.Title: Third Republic Constitution
DOC.TEXT: Constitution passed by one vote in Congress when President McMahon. Prescribed the presidential system of seven years of office, etc., had democratic contents.

DOC.Title: Conservative Party
DOC.TEXT: Since the 1830s, the name of the party which has been used and fixed frequently on behalf of the Tori party. Based on landlord forces, he formed the Liberal Party and Britain's biggest political party through the 19th century.

DOC.Title: Liberal Party
DOC.TEXT: Party that got the trend of Whig party and represented the interests of emerging bourgeoisie. Since the 1830 's, it began to be used as an alias for the Whig party, the name of the Liberal Party established in the mid-nineteenth century. We tried to liberalism reform, but then weakened by the advancement of the working class.

DOC.Title: Queen Victoria
DOC.TEXT: The grandson of George III. Queen of England (ranking 1837-1901). The Golden Age of the British Empire was revealed, its reign was called the Victorian era.

DOC.Title: Second Empire
DOC.TEXT: After the Industrial Revolution, from the mid-nineteenth century "United Kingdom" called the "factory of the world" and dominated the vast colonies centered in India. It is a name for the "first empire" that was established from the 16th to the 18th century, but it disappeared after two world wars in the 20th century.

DOC.Title: London World Exposition
DOC.TEXT: The first exposition in the world in London in 1851. Although there were participation from 40 countries, it was to show off the British industrial and technological capabilities overwhelming other countries with the industrial revolution. In addition, through the mechanism such as cheap admission fee set for Weekday, group travel from districts organized by Thomas Cook, millions of visitors visited during the 140 day opening day, the first popular in British history It became an entertainment, and the arrival of "popular society" was promoted.

DOC.Title: Disraeli
DOC.TEXT: Conservative politician of the Victorian era. He became the second prime minister (1868, 74-80) and promoted imperialistic diplomacy such as the acquisition of the Suez Canal shares, the establishment of the Indian empire, the prevention of Russia's South-South policy.

DOC.Title: Gladstone
DOC.TEXT: Liberal party politician of the Victorian era. He became the fourth Prime Minister (in office 1868-74, 80-85, 86, 92-94) and developed peaceful diplomacy. Focusing on internal administrative reform, I am trying to revise the election law, Irish autonomy issue.

DOC.Title: 2nd election law amendment
DOC.TEXT: The Liberal Party promoted and was established at the time of Derby Conservative Cabinet. Voters were given to urban workers, and the number of voters rose from 1.35 million to 2.47 million.

DOC.Title: Education Law
DOC.TEXT: The law that decided to expand public schools to conduct primary education by the Gladstone Cabinet. In 1880, the mandatory formulation of primary education was legislated.

DOC.Title: labor union law
DOC.TEXT: The law established by the Gladstone Cabinet. Admitted legal status to trade union.

DOC.Title: 3rd election law amendment
DOC.TEXT: Established in the Gladstone Cabinet. Voting rights were granted to agricultural workers and miners, and the number of voters was 4.4 million.

DOC.Title: Ireland problem
DOC.TEXT: Since the invasion by England by the 16th century has progressed, Ireland has been placed in de facto colonial state since being conquered by Cromwell in 1649, suffering discrimination such as religion, politics and land ownership. In 1801, it was annexed to Britain, but the Irishmen entered the parliament by Catholic teaching liberation law in 19th, seeking Catholic religious freedom and political autonomy, promoting the nationalist movement in Ireland. Since the 19th century Britain called "a bone stabbed in the throat" was an important political issue.

DOC.Title: potato famine
DOC.TEXT: In the mid 1840 's, a large number (over one million) of Irish people starved to death by bad crops caused by potato diseases in Ireland. As a result, the autonomous movement from the UK increased, and on the other hand the flow of immigration to North America was accelerated.

DOC.Title: Youth Irish Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1842, a radical organization organized for the purpose of national independence of Ireland. Armed uprising in 1848 was suppressed.

DOC.Title: Finian, Fenian
DOC.TEXT: In 1858, a radical secret society formed for the purpose of ethnic independence of Ireland.

DOC.Title: Irish National Party
DOC.TEXT: Factions formed mainly by members of Ireland elected at the end of the 19th century. We aimed to gain autonomy.

DOC.Title: Ireland Land Act
DOC.TEXT: Legislation that acknowledged the stability of the copyright of the Irish peasants, the proper rents, the right to trade copyright. The 1881 revision also granted land purchase rights. The revision was repeated for 85 years, 91 years, 1903 years for the creation of a self-made farm.

DOC.Title: Ireland autonomy bill
DOC.TEXT: A bill proposed by the Irish Kuomintang for the autonomy of Ireland from 1874 to the Liberal Party Cabinet as the third party within the parliament. Both of 1886 and 1993 did not hold, so independence movement intensified.

DOC.Title: Dominion
DOC.TEXT: White colonies granted autonomy in the British colony. Initially, its autonomy was weak by being bound by the decision of the Council, but in 1931 the complete autonomy was approved in the Westminster Charter. Canada first arrived in 1867.

DOC.Title: Canada Commonwealth
DOC.TEXT: Established a responsible government in 1840, became the first ruling party in 1976.

DOC.Title: Australia
DOC.TEXT: In 1788 he became a British colonial colony, becoming the Federal Dominion in 1901.

DOC.Title: New Zealand
DOC.TEXT: Became a British colony in 1840, became a self-government in 1907.

DOC.Title: South Africa Federation
DOC.TEXT: In 1910 he became the UK dominion. I became independent as a republic for 61 years.

DOC.Title: Domination of the Suez Canal
DOC.TEXT: In 1875 Britain bought a canal share, militarily occupied the canal area by multiplying the civil war in 1982, virtually dominated the entire Egypt.

DOC.Title: Establishment of the Indian Empire
DOC.TEXT: Direct governance began with the dissolution of the East India company in 1858, and in the year 77, the Indian empire with the King of England (female) as Emperor of India was established.

DOC.Title: Nikolai I
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of Russia (rank 1825-55). I suppressed the decapitist 's turbulence and enforced tyranny. Outwardly, he assisted Greek's independence and oppressed the autonomy of Poland. I began the Crimean War, but suddenly died in the midst of the war following intervention from Britain, France etc etc.

DOC.Title: Alexander II
DOC.TEXT: A child of Nikolai I. Emperor of Russia (ranking 1855-81). I regretted the disastrous defeat in the Crimean war, and promoted liberal reform such as the release of a serf liberation order in 1861. However, after Poland 's rebellion in 1863, it became reactive and assassinated by revolutionary terrorism.

DOC.Title: Agricultural Release Liberation Order
DOC.TEXT: Edict issued by Alexander II. To the serfs, personality freedom was given free of charge, but the distribution of land was paid, a large amount of "repurchase money" was imposed and the land was often transferred to Mir (rural community) in order to guarantee payment The farmers continued to be tied to the meal for a long time. In this way, there was a strong "reform" of inadequacies. There is also a theory that considers it as a starting point for the appearance of self-employed farmers, Russian capitalism.

DOC.Title: Mir
DOC.TEXT: A rural community of Russia. After being an old autonomous organization, after the serfdom system was strengthened, we assumed joint responsibility for taxation and service and assigned farmland etc. During the liberation of the agricultural lady in 1861, the organization was left and we were responsible for purchasing the land from the landlord, paying for the purchase price, and joint use of the land.

DOC.Title: Poland revolt, January uprising
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that the nationalists of Russian territory Poland multiplied by Alexander II 's liberal reforms. The aid from the strength was weak and ended in failure due to the thorough repression of the Russian army.

DOC.Title: 'European gendarmer'
DOC.TEXT: After the collapse of the Vienna regime, the term that refers to the fact that Russia became the center of the reactionary forces and suppressed the liberal movement and the revolutionary movement in the second half of the 19th century.

DOC.Title: Intelligentia
DOC.TEXT: Intellectual class. Progressive aristocrats after the decapist disturbance and the children of emerging citizens after the liberation of the agriculture, they acquire Western culture and are keenly aware of the backwardness of Russian society and headed the criticism and transformation of the system.

DOC.Title: Naruto niki, People'sist
DOC.TEXT: People who tried to realize an equal society on a unique course different from Western Europe based on tradition of mutual aid that had long been in rural communities in Russia. In the 1870s it spread to students and young people and entered rural areas in anticipation of farmers' enlightenment and their rushing but frustrated by suppression of the constitution and indifference of farmers, some ran to extreme anarchism and nihilism.

DOC.Title: "V-Narad", into the People
DOC.TEXT: The slogan of Naruto niki. It became the origin of the name of Narodniki.

DOC.Title: Anarchism, Anarchism
DOC.TEXT: I deny the state power and strongly pursue individual freedom. Denial of parliamentaryism and strongly hoped for direct acts of workers. Blue Don insisted in the 1840s, after which Bakunin and Kropotkin and others deepened, developed in Russia in the latter half of the 19th century while opposing Marxism. It also had a strong influence on the sandikarism spread in France during the Third Republic period.

DOC.Title: nihilism, nihilismism
DOC.TEXT: Every authority and value, thought to deny the state and order. Since Turgainef's "Father and Son", it spread between the Russian intelligentia in the 1860s and was inherited as a revolutionary philosophy of narudeniki and anarchism.

DOC.Title: Terrorism
DOC.TEXT: A political position trying to realize his / her claim by assassination / assault etc. In Russia spread in the 1870s, planned and executed the assassination of emperors and politicians.

DOC.Title: Assassination of Alexander II
DOC.TEXT: Just before agreeing to the draft constitution and making an official statement, they were killed by bombs by the radical group of the Naruto niki "people's will".

DOC.Title: Pogrom
DOC.TEXT: Russian meaning mass assault and massacres against Jews. After the Crusade, it occurred in various parts of Europe, but in Russia it became obsolete since the 19th century. As a result, Jewish migration outside the country was accelerated.

DOC.Title: "Toho problem"
DOC.TEXT: Words expressing international problems arising over the territory and ethnic problems of the Ottoman Empire from the side of Western European power in the 19th century. Taking over the decline of the Ottoman Empire, the independence movements of the people under the control became fierce, and the power of Western Europe was interfered.

DOC.Title: Independence Movement of Ethnic People under the Ottoman Empire
DOC.TEXT: Among the ethnic groups in the Ottoman Empire of the multi-ethnic nation, the liberation of independence and freedom of independence was enhanced by the Napoleonic war (especially Egypt expedition), ethnic independence, ethnic movement including Greek independence, and the Ottoman rule I was upset. The European powers interfered using it and gradually advanced into the power sphere of the Ottoman empire.

DOC.Title: Protection of Greek Orthodox
DOC.TEXT: Greek Orthodox Faith, Bulgarian Orthodox and Serbian Orthodox resided in the Balkans, and Russia became a pretext to interfere with this area.

DOC.Title: Greek Revolutionary War
DOC.TEXT: The war that Greece called for independence from the Ottoman Empire. Russia, the United Kingdom, France and so on intervened from their respective interests, became a typical East Asian problem.

DOC.Title: Muhammad Ali, Mehmet Ari
DOC.TEXT: Albanians born in Macedonia. Activated with the Napoleonic army, he was appointed from the Ottoman Empire to Governor Egypt (rank 1805-49). On the domestic side, we tried to modernize Egypt, externally conquered Sudan, the Greek independence war, and the two Egypt = Turkish wars.

DOC.Title: Egypt = Turkish War, Egypt Case
DOC.TEXT: Two wars of war between Egyptian Muhammad Ali and the Ottoman Empire. Russia aimed at the Ottoman Empire with the aim of advancing into the Mediterranean and temporarily acquired the privilege on Da Daneless · Bosporas Baohai in 1833, the Uncal-Sceresce Treaty, but in the British Foreign Policy at the London Conference in 1840 The privilege was lost and the south policies were arrested.

DOC.Title: London Conference
DOC.TEXT: Russia, the UK, Austria, Prussia Four countries' conference. In recognition of Muhammad Ali's Egyptian governor's right to war, the Uncal-Scere Lee treaty was abandoned. In 1841, a strait agreement prohibiting navigation of foreign warships in both straits of Dardanells / Bosporas, including France, brought a blow to the Russian south policy.

DOC.Title: sacred management right
DOC.TEXT: Management right of Christian sacred place Jerusalem in the Ottoman Empire. Since the 16th century, King French possessed control, but Russian support during the French Revolution Greek Orthodox Church gained control. In 1852 Napoleon III requested management rights from the Ottoman Empire, while Nikolai I dissatisfied this.

DOC.Title: Crimean war
DOC.TEXT: The Russian Emperor who lost the sanctuary control fought against the Greek Orthodox within the Ottoman territory and waged the international war with England, France and Sardinia standing on the Ottoman side. The reverse nature of the defeated Russia was revealed.

DOC.Title: Dardanellus · Bosphorus Both Straits
DOC.TEXT: The only waterway connecting the Black Sea and the Mediterranean Sea. It is under the control of the Ottoman Empire since the 15th century, and getting this passage right was regarded as the greatest goal of the Russian south policy.

DOC.Title: Sevastopol Fortress
DOC.TEXT: The fortress that Russia boasted of the Crimean Peninsula is the largest martial port of the Black Sea. The greatest fierce battle of Crimean war was developed.

DOC.Title: Paris Convention
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of the Crimean war. Russia's southern Bessaravia abandonment, conservation of the Ottoman Empire, freedom of navigation of the Danube, neutralization of the Black Sea have been set, and Russia's South-south policy was arrested.

DOC.Title: Moldavia · Wallachia
DOC.TEXT: De facto independence was granted as a union docket. After Romania.

DOC.Title: Neutralization of Black Sea
DOC.TEXT: Contents of possession of Russian military base on the Black Sea coast and prohibition of warship navigation.

DOC.Title: South-South policy
DOC.TEXT: Policies to enter the Black Sea / Balkan Peninsula, which Russia went from the 18th to the 19th century. It was a major factor in the international conflict of the 19th century, but eventually failed in the Berlin Treaty after the Russian-Turkish war.

DOC.Title: Pan = Slavism principle
DOC.TEXT: Thoughts and exercise aiming at unification and consolation of Slavic people. It became irrelevant on the Balkans after the middle of the 19th century, and Russia supported these movements in order to counter the Ottoman Empire and Austria and use it for their own south policy.

DOC.Title: Russia = Turkish War, Russia War
DOC.TEXT: In 1875, after the rebellion of Bosnia-Herzegovina, the war that Russia declared war with Russia pretended to protect the Slavic people, whereas the Ottoman empire oppressed the Slavic people in the territory. The Ottoman Empire was defeated.

DOC.Title: Saint-Stefano Convention
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of the Russian-Turkish war. Russia expanded its territory, the independence of Romania, Serbia and Montenegro, the autonomy of Bulgaria was approved, and Russia put the Bulgarian Peninsula under its de facto control through Bulgaria and realized the South-south policy. Saint-Stefano is a place in the west of Istanbul.

DOC.Title: Romania
DOC.TEXT: After the Crimean War, in 1859 Moldavia Wallachia formed the Union Duchy, and in 61 the Romanian Autonomous Nation became Autonomous. It became independent in 1978 's Saint-Stefano Convention, was internationally approved by the Berlin Treaty, became Kingdom of Romania in 1981.

DOC.Title: Serbia
DOC.TEXT: He continued his independence movement from the beginning of the 19th century, and fought back in Ottoman army in 1867 and became independent. It was independent in the Saint-Stefano Convention and was internationally approved by the Berlin Treaty. It became the center of Pan-Slavism in the Balkans.

DOC.Title: Montenegro
DOC.TEXT: It became a mid-19th century principality, continued its independence movement, became independent in the Saint-Stefano Convention, and was internationally approved in the Berlin Treaty.

DOC.Title: Bulgaria
DOC.TEXT: It expanded the territory with the Saint-Stefano Convention and was placed under the protection of Russia as a self-governing nation within the Ottoman Empire.

DOC.Title: Berlin Conference
DOC.TEXT: An international conference where Bismarck was held for mediation as the U.S. and Austria opposed the entry into the eastern Mediterranean / Balkans Peninsula of Russia due to the Convention of Saint-Stefano, and the international crisis took place. It was the biggest international conference since the Vienna conference.

DOC.Title: "sincere broker"
DOC.TEXT: Authority of organizer Bismarck in organizing the Berlin Conference. It was meant to be fair in a neutral position, but at the conference I endorseed the British argument.

DOC.Title: Berlin Treaty
DOC.TEXT: An international treaty concluded in lieu of the Saint-Stefano Convention in July 1878. (1) Authorize Independence of Romania, Serbia, Montenegro, (2) Shrink the territory of Bulgaria and make it autonomous country under the religious rights of the Ottoman Empire, (3) Austria acquired the governance of Bosnia and Herzegovina, 4) UK decided to acquire executive power of Cyprus island etc. It was a major victory in the UK, and Russia's South-South policy was blocked again. Bismarck is said to have received British favor with the sacrifice of Russia.

DOC.Title: Bosnia and Herzegovina
DOC.TEXT: Region in the southeastern part of the Balkans. Many Slavic residents, in 1875 caused the rebellion against the Ottoman Empire, under the control of Austria under the Berlin Treaty in 1978.

DOC.Title: Cyprus Island
DOC.TEXT: Island of the eastern Mediterranean. Britain won administrative power from the Ottoman Empire in a bilateral treaty during the Berlin meeting.

DOC.Title: Finland
DOC.TEXT: It was almost Swedish territory since the Middle Ages, but in 1809 Russia was consolidated, the Emperor of Russia became the autonomous powerknown concurrently holding the Grand Duke. During the 19th century the nationalism campaign progressed, promoted national reform such as the general election in 1906 and realization of the third women's right to vote in the world the following year. With the Russian revolution of 1917, he declared independence and republican.

DOC.Title: Sweden
DOC.TEXT: As a result of the Napoleonic war, finland was ceded to Russia, and at the Vienna conference, Denmark took over Norway and made it union. We strove for external peace and domestic democratization, in 1866 a bicameral assembly was formed and developed as a stable constitutional kingdom.

DOC.Title: Norway
DOC.TEXT: As a result of the Vienna Conference in 1815, it became the Swedish territory of the same alliance from Denmark territory. Since then, he continued his independence movement and became a constitutional kingdom in peace with the referendum in 1905.

DOC.Title: Denmark
DOC.TEXT: Losing Norway at the Vienna conference and in 1848 issued a liberal constitution under the influence of the February Revolution. In 1864, Prussia and Austria deprived Shresvig Holstein, the land was shrunk and exhausted, but since then it has worked towards foreign peace and agricultural reform and welfare policies and developed as a stable democratic constitutional kingdom.

DOC.Title: Netherlands
DOC.TEXT: Restored at the Vienna conference, after which the constitutional monarchy has developed steadily, playing an important economic role as a small country.

DOC.Title: Belgium
DOC.TEXT: After independence from the Netherlands in 1830, the constitutional monarchy was developed steadily, taking a neutral policy, but was invaded by Germany in the Second World War. Today, the headquarters of the EU is established, occupying an important position in politics and economics in a small country.

DOC.Title: Portugal
DOC.TEXT: Following the invasion of the Napoleonic army, Brazil then became independent, weakened in the 19th century, but managed colonies in Africa.

DOC.Title: Spain
DOC.TEXT: Unstable politics continued due to conflicts between conservative forces based on owner and church and liberal faction based on undeveloped commerce and industry, imbalance between regions. Externalize dominated the Philippines as a colony.

DOC.Title: Swiss
DOC.TEXT: In 1848, the Constitution was imitated following the United States, maintaining the federal system while respecting the regional nature. It is continuing armed neutrality externally.

DOC.Title: Jefferson
DOC.TEXT: A drafter of the Declaration of Independence of America. In opposition to Federalist (Federal faction) with capitalists as its support base, he won the 3 rd president (in office 1801-09) of the year 1800, with the support of the southern landowner, western farmers and urban craftsmen. A peaceful transition of the government to an anti-Federal president who toughened state power is called the "revolution of 1800". After taking office as president, we bought Louisiana from France and opened the way for territory expansion towards the West.

DOC.Title: Louisiana acquisition
DOC.TEXT: President Jefferson bought Louisiana west of the Mississippi River from Napoleon for $ 15 million. The territory doubled and became the basis of advancement to the west.

DOC.Title: America = British War, United States & British War
DOC.TEXT: The war of 1812 occurred between the United States and Britain. During the Napoleonic war, the British broke out due to blockade of the sea and obstructed trade in the United States, peace was established and concluded at the conclusion of the Napoleonic war. Influx of British goods during the war was promoted, industrial development of the United States was promoted, continuing the political independence by the Paris Convention of 1783, economic independence from the UK advances, also called the Secondary Revolutionary War.

DOC.Title: Monroe Declaration, Monroe Instruction
DOC.TEXT: Declaration issued by President Monroe to eliminate the interference of the Vienna regime against Latin American countries' independence. It embodied the traditional isolated diplomacy since the foundation. However, the Monroe Declaration did not cover Asian countries.

DOC.Title: Monologist principle
DOC.TEXT: Foreign policy centered on mutual non-interference with European countries established in Monroe declaration. It was later used to justify the expansion of the United States for the Western Hemisphere.

DOC.Title: Jackson
DOC.TEXT: The seventh president (responsible 1829-37). Irish immigrant orphan. He became the national hero with active in the United States = British war, with the support of Western farmers and eastern workers, became the first president of the western origin.

DOC.Title: Jacksonian = Democracy
DOC.TEXT: Democracy developed during President Jackson 's era. Democratic politics for the common people, such as the adoption of white male ordinary election system, was suppressed by the restraint of capitalists' power. On the other hand, the Indians were persecuted, and they kept their guards as well.

DOC.Title: Florida acquisition
DOC.TEXT: I bought it from Spain.

DOC.Title: Texas consolidation
DOC.TEXT: American immigrants declared independence from Mexico in 1836, the Republic of Texas was established and joined the United States as a state for 45 years.

DOC.Title: America = Mexican War
DOC.TEXT: It broke out of the conflict in the Texas southern border, America won the race and won both regions such as New Mexico and California.

DOC.Title: California
DOC.TEXT: Earned from Mexico in 1848, it was promoted to the state for 50 years.

DOC.Title: Gold Rush
DOC.TEXT: A gold mine was discovered in California in 1848, followed by a rush of immigrants from all over the world in the next 49 years, a phenomenon in which the population has dramatically increased. The background of the development of the transportation network by railways and steamships has led to the development of the western part.

DOC.Title: Oregon annexation
DOC.TEXT: After the United States = British war, it was a joint possession of the United States and the United Kingdom, but at the occasion of the conflict with Canada, it split north and south with north latitude of 49 degrees as the border.

DOC.Title: Western
DOC.TEXT: It refers to the eastern 13 states in independence when it is west of the Appalachian Mountains and is almost north of the northern latitude line. Many settlers from the north, the area and the population increased with the westward movement. Imported agricultural machinery and fertilizer from northern part, export grain to northern part and strengthened ties with northern part. As a population increase, the autonomous government was established as a territory, after which it was promoted to the state.

DOC.Title: Western development, Xicheng movement
DOC.TEXT: Western development movement that took place through the 19th century. Immigrants from the north and Europe became the founder of the development. The Indians were robbed of living places such as hunting areas, and the population drastically declined.

DOC.Title: Manifest = Destiny, an obvious mission
DOC.TEXT: A word justifying the development of the West of the United States. It became popular from the mid-nineteenth century, and expansion of territory was a natural obligation due to population increase, and it was a mission from God.

DOC.Title: frontier, frontier
DOC.TEXT: The boundary between the settlement and the undeveloped land in the western United States. It moved to the west mostly by the pioneering front of the westward movement. Independent / behavioral frontier = spirit was formed. It disappeared around 1890.

DOC.Title: Frontier = Spirit
DOC.TEXT: Pioneer spirit. An autonomous and behavioral spirit that challenges the unknown and undeveloped land.

DOC.Title: Indian
DOC.TEXT: Indigenous people in the North American continent. Although he was hunting in the forest area in the eastern part, the population was drastically reduced by the white people being deprived of the land by land movement and slaughter.

DOC.Title: Indian Forced Immigration Law
DOC.TEXT: The law enacted by President Jackson. It is a law that expels indigenous peoples west of the Mississippi River, and it was harsh, such as many dead people getting out due to food shortages and diseases even in immigration (called "the way of tears").

DOC.Title: Reservation place
DOC.TEXT: A wasteland west of the Mississippi River, given to indigenous peoples expelled by the Indian Forced Immigration Act.

DOC.Title: Worn Dead knee
DOC.TEXT: It was a reservation that was in the southwestern part of South Dakota Province, where many nonresistant indigenous people (Sioux Indians) were slaughtered in 1890. After this incident, the organizational resistance of indigenous peoples ended.

DOC.Title: South part
DOC.TEXT: Sub-region of Virginia. Cotton by himself (developed by the invention of the whitney's cotton gift machine), tobacco cultivation as the main industry, claimed free trade and state rights theory. The population was smaller than that in the northern part even though he included his own.

DOC.Title: anti-Federalism, state rights principle
DOC.TEXT: A position to claim decentralization in the federal state of the United States. From the 1820s to the Civil War, especially the South insisted.

DOC.Title: Plantation, large farm, big farm system
DOC.TEXT: A large farm in the south that used black guys. Management is called a planter.

DOC.Title: Observer
DOC.TEXT: Since the end of the 18 th century the demand for raw cotton from the UK expanded, so it was expanded in the southern plantation.

DOC.Title: Black guy
DOC.TEXT: It was captured in the West Bank of Africa and its descendants, accounting for the majority of the southern slaves. It was overwhelmed by cotton cultivation, accounted for more than a third of all South Russian people in 1860, about 4 million people were counted.

DOC.Title: Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: A party that Jackson's supporters organized in the 1820s and the southern part was a powerful ground. Between 1829 and 1961 he produced the president except for 8 years, but there was the rise of the Republican Party in the northern part, and the party itself broke up in the north and south in 1960. After the Civil War, it became a national party with southern and northern major cities as the ground.

DOC.Title: Northern part
DOC.TEXT: A region north of Ohio. Commerce and industry developed, opposed protection expansion, to secure protection trade and centralizationism and secure free workforce.

DOC.Title: Protection tariff policy, American protection tariff policy
DOC.TEXT: Policies to protect industrial capital in the north against British capital and its products. Although it was continued since 1816, it was a disadvantageous policy to the south where cotton is exported to England.

DOC.Title: Whig Party, American Wig Party
