DOC.TEXT: In 1834, a political party which was formed by union of anti-Jackson factions. In the 1850s internal conflicts intensified and declined due to problems such as suffering, but after that some groups formed Republicans.

DOC.Title: Missouri Agreement
DOC.TEXT: When setting up Missouri state, the South and the North confront with whether to be free state or Jinju, eventually Missouri will be the Jungzhou, but after that it was agreed that he will not accept Hanzhou north north latitude of 36 degrees north latitude .

DOC.Title: Free State
DOC.TEXT: A state where banning was forbidden. Eleven states in the north before 1820.

DOC.Title: Slave state
DOC.TEXT: A state that allowed him to control. Eleven states in the south before 1820.

DOC.Title: Kansas / Nebraska Act
DOC.TEXT: When Kansas and Nebraska are regarded as the coastal states, it is a law that decides whether the two provinces will become Free State or Jinzhou future in the decision of residents. The Missouri Agreement was rejected and the conflict between the north and the south intensified.

DOC.Title: Mrs. Stow, Harriet Stow
DOC.TEXT: He wrote "Uncle Tom's Hut" and promoted the slavery liberation campaign.

DOC.Title: "Uncle Tom's Hut"
DOC.TEXT: Mrs. Stow's work. Presented 1851-52 years. Drawing popularism from the viewpoint of humanitarianism, he widely moved public opinion.

DOC.Title: John Brown's Uprising
DOC.TEXT: In 1859, the rebellion led by John Brown, leader of the abolitionism movement. Crushed and John Brown was executed.

DOC.Title: Republican Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1854, with the slogan opposition to the slushing, a political party formed around the members of the former Whig party. After developing northern capitalist and western farmer as ground, it developed into a nationwide party.

DOC.Title: Federalism, centralizationism
DOC.TEXT: A position to strengthen the power of the federal government. The northern part who insisted on protection tariff policy to counter Britain wanted a powerful government. It came under the trend of the Whig party and became a Republican allegation.

DOC.Title: Lincoln
DOC.TEXT: The 16th President (Resigned from 1861 to 65). From poor farmers. He became a lawyer by himself, and then entered the political world. In opposition to the expansion of the regime, he won the presidential election in 1860 by running from the Republican Party. I guided the northern part in the Civil War and led to victory, but it was assassinated.

DOC.Title: United States Alliance, United States Federation
DOC.TEXT: A nation formed by 11 southern states which withdrew from the United States after the president of Lincoln won. We have enacted the Constitution of maintaining state power and defending political power.

DOC.Title: Richmond
DOC.TEXT: Capital city of the United States of America. It fell in 1865.

DOC.Title: Jefferson = Devies
DOC.TEXT: President of the United States of America (Resigned 1861-65). Defeated by the Civil War, captured by the Union Army.

DOC.Title: Free Trade
DOC.TEXT: The trade policy that the South insisted. The southern part is an agricultural region, in particular because it was an economic structure that exports cotton, tobacco, indigo, etc cultivated in the branch to the UK and industrial products depend on import from the UK, so we took such a position.

DOC.Title: anti-Federalism, state rights principle
DOC.TEXT: A position to reduce federal government's authority and respect state autonomy. The South insisted.

DOC.Title: Civil War
DOC.TEXT: Civil war between the northern states of the United States and the southern states. In the war with the Confederate Sumter Fortress attack, the Confederates dominated early. However, the northern part, which is superior to the population and economic strength, gained support from public opinion with the release of the Liberation Declaration and the Homestead Act, was also endorsed by countries other than the UK and France, and in 1863 the northern battle of Gettysburg After the army 's victory, it continued to maintain the dominance. In 1965 Richmond collapsed, the Confederates surrendered to surrender.

DOC.Title: Lee
DOC.TEXT: General of the South Army. He fought as a commander, gained popularity from the north, and after being defeated, he became president of the University of Washington.

DOC.Title: Grant
DOC.TEXT: The commander of the Union Army. In 1864 he became general commander of the North Army and beat the South Army. Inaugurated as the 18th president (1869-77 in office).

DOC.Title: Homestead law, self-employed farmland law
DOC.TEXT: The law which decided to give 160 acres of land free of charge to those who settled and settled in the public for five years. Earned the northern support of the western part and promoted the westward movement.

DOC.Title: Emancipation declaration
DOC.TEXT: Declaration announced on January 1, 1863 by Lincoln. It was targeted at the southern rebellion guards, it was a strategic measure that strengthened the unity of the northern part, expected the rally of the southern parties, and at the same time appealed the European countries to the legitimacy of the north. The 13th amendment of the Constitution in 1865 had guaranteed the legal freedom of his fellow, but racial discrimination against blacks continued thereafter.

DOC.Title: Gettysburg
DOC.TEXT: A small city about 100 km northwest of Washington. It was known as the place where Lincoln made a famous speech at the ceremony to mourn the dead in this fight after the greatest fierce battle during the 1863 Civil War was held.

DOC.Title: "People's People's Politics for the People"
DOC.TEXT: A passage of Lincoln 's speech in Gettysburg. It shows the essence of democracy.

DOC.Title: Assassination of Lincoln
DOC.TEXT: I was sniperized by an actor booth from the south during the theater and died the next day.

DOC.Title: Black manipulation law
DOC.TEXT: A generic term for state law for black suppression established in southern states after the Civil War. Many of the contents of virtual death control are de facto, and it became a problem in the Congress.

DOC.Title: Constitution amendment Article 13
DOC.TEXT: It stipulates the declaration of liberation release, and stipulates the full abolition of the slavery system.

DOC.Title: Share cropper, benefits cashier
DOC.TEXT: The system which appeared in the south after abolition of the abortion regime. The landlord categorized the land roughly and lent the land, housing, agricultural tools and others to the croak (share cropper), taking two-thirds to two-thirds of the harvest. There were many black people who were unable to give land even after liberation to peasants.

DOC.Title: K · K · K, Koo-Kraks = Clan
DOC.TEXT: A secret society formed in Tennessee in 1865. It became a spearhead of black persecution and expanded to the south.

DOC.Title: Jim = Crow
DOC.TEXT: In the southern area after the Civil War, it means a room or seat exclusively for black people who was set up to separate from white people in public facilities and transportation facilities. It became a hotbed to carry out racial segregation "legally" and to continue racial discrimination.

DOC.Title: Alaska acquisition
DOC.TEXT: It bought for only 7.2 million dollars from Russia of financial difficulties, it was made to be a US territory. Immediately after that, gold mine was discovered and a gold rush took place.

DOC.Title: Transcontinental Railroad
DOC.TEXT: In 1869, the first transcontinental railroad opened. The eastern part and the Pacific coast were joined, the development of the western part was urged, bringing economic and political unity to the United States.

DOC.Title: Immigration, American immigration
DOC.TEXT: Immigration to North America was dominated by former immigrants from Scandinavia and Western Europe until the 1880s. Especially in the late 1840s and 1950s, immigrants from Ireland caused by potato famine and political asylum and farmers' immigrants from Germany failing in the 48 years revolution increased. After the 1880s, immigrants from Eastern Europe and Southern Europe sharply increased, and they were called new immigrants. Among Asian immigrants, since the 1840 's, Chinese immigrants were regarded as the work force of laying the transcontinental railroad as Coulee. However, it was also subject to racial discrimination and immigration restriction, the number of which was less than those of European origin.

DOC.Title: Coulee, struggle
DOC.TEXT: A derogatory name for Asian immigrants, mainly Chinese and Indian. I was forced to hurt labor with low wages.

DOC.Title: General Labor Relations Alliance, AFL
DOC.TEXT: The nationwide union of trade unions formed in 1886. Samuel = Gompers is the first president. A coalition organization of skilled workers, avoiding critical and direct political behavior in socialism, developed a moderate movement focusing on improving working conditions.

DOC.Title: National Women's Suffrage Association
DOC.TEXT: It was formed in 1869 and expanded mainly on white women. The starting point was the meeting of women's suffrage election requests held at Seneca-Falls in the United States in 1848.

DOC.Title: "Kinpika era"
DOC.TEXT: A word that sarcasticized the social tide of "everything is up to money" with the background of rapid economic growth at the end of the 19th century. Coined word by writer Mark Twain.

DOC.Title: Mexican civil war
DOC.TEXT: An anti-revolution coup occurred in 1985 against the 1855 liberal revolution. Juarez and others got victory in 61 years, but Napoleon III intervened, defeated the Republic, and made Maximilian the Emperor. However, in the protests of the United States based on the resistance of Mexican citizens and Monroeism, the French troops withdrew in 1867.

DOC.Title: Juarez
DOC.TEXT: President of Mexico (Tenure 1858-72). From indigenous people. He has served as lawyer, governor, chief justice chief. After that, he became the president, but the civil war caused by the conservatives such as the army and the church, the victory with the French army who had been interfering by it, protected the liberalism, and tried to democratize Mexico.

DOC.Title: Criolyo
DOC.TEXT: Caucasian white man in Latin America. It became the center of independence movement and formed a dominant layer after independence.

DOC.Title: Caudillo
DOC.TEXT: In Latin America after independence, a military powerful person who strengthened his voice. A nation that produced dictatorship leaders from among them also appeared.

DOC.Title: Immigration, Latin America Immigration
DOC.TEXT: In order to compensate for the labor shortage caused by economic development, it was attracted from Europe, the United States, Asia, after the abolition of the black racism system.

DOC.Title: Maximilian
DOC.TEXT: The royal family of Austria. After being withdrawn in Napoleon III and became the emperor of Mexico, Juarez and others caught him after the withdrawal of the French army and was shot dead in a military trial.

DOC.Title: Diaz
DOC.TEXT: The president of Mexico (from 1877 to 80, 84 to 1911). From Mestizo. He played active against French against Juarez, but after that it was recoiled. 1876 ​​Coup d'etat became president, maintaining dictatorship for a long time, but was overthrown in 1911 Mexican revolution.

DOC.Title: First International, International Labor Association
DOC.TEXT: The world's first mass organization of international workers formed in London. It was the occasion that workers in the UK and France supported the Poland revolt in 1863. Marcus drafted the founding declaration and the convention, but the Marxists first fought with the Bourdon school and then the Bakunin faction. It was oppressed by the governments of the governments who publicly supported Paris-Commune, in fact stopped activity in 1872 and officially dissolved at the Philadelphia Ground in 76 years.

DOC.Title: Bakunin
DOC.TEXT: Russian anarchist. A nobleman. After participating in the French February Revolution, he took part in the first international in 1868 after arrest, exile and escape, but it was expelled in conflict with Marx. Anarchist's way of thinking denying parliamentism and emphasizing direct acts of workers has had a great influence on France's sandikarism.

DOC.Title: Second International
DOC.TEXT: An international organization formed in Paris by representatives of socialist political parties and labor organizations of 19 countries in the West and the West. The German Social Democratic Party occupied the leading position, the idea of ​​Marxism became the mainstream, and anarchicism was excluded. From around 1900 the confrontation of each country surfaced due to the influence of imperialism, and when the First World War broke out in 14 years, the socialist political parties of each country supported the war policy of their own country and it actually collapsed.

DOC.Title: Nightingale
DOC.TEXT: A nurse in the UK. I grew up in a wealthy family, but I took nursing education and became the nurse head of a London hospital. Taking care of the crimean war report, he went to a field hospital with 34 nurses and was active in nursing injured soldiers. Founded a modern nurse system and also had a strong influence on the later Red Cross movement.

DOC.Title: International Red Cross Society
DOC.TEXT: An organization established for the rescue activities of injured soldiers during wartime. It was launched in Geneva in 1863 by the advice of the Swiss Dunan. In 1964, 16 countries participated and the Red Cross treaty was signed.

DOC.Title: Dunan
DOC.TEXT: Bank of Switzerland. After deeply being influenced by the activities of Nightingale, after seeing the misery in the battlefield of the unification war of Italy (battle of Solferino), he advocated the Red Cross movement in 1863. I received the first Nobel Peace Prize in 1901.

DOC.Title: International Olympic Games
DOC.TEXT: French Coubertin revived to promote international goodwill by sports exchange. It was held in Athens from the first meeting in 1896, every four years except during the two world wars.

DOC.Title: Coubertin
DOC.TEXT: A French educator. We organized the International Olympic Committee (IOC) in 1894 and revived the Olympic Games.

DOC.Title: World's Fair
DOC.TEXT: An international exposition that displays industries, technologies and products of each country. It also became a place to show off country power of the host country. The first was held in London in 1851, the third was held in Paris in 55 years. Japan (Shogunate · Satsuma clan · Saga clan) participated for the first time (exhibition) at the world exposition held in Paris in 67 years.

DOC.Title: Universal Postal Union
DOC.TEXT: An organization established in 1975 under the agreement of the Universal Postal Congress held in Berne, Switzerland in 1874. Facilitating smooth processing of mail items among Member States has been realized. After 1947 the United Nations specialized agency.

DOC.Title: International Telegraphia Union
DOC.TEXT: Founded in 1865, an organization involved in international communications. In 1934 the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) was reorganized.

DOC.Title: Universal Peace Conference
DOC.TEXT: An international conference held in The Hague, advocated by Russian emperor Nikolai II, in order to ease the tense international situation since the end of the 19th century. Including the prohibition on the use of poison gas, and the establishment of an international arbitration court. We could not produce results on arms reduction.

DOC.Title: International Arbitration Court
DOC.TEXT: Based on the decision of the Universal Peace Conference, the arbitration institution of international conflict established in The Hague in 1901. In the crisis of the outbreak of World War I, I could hardly play a part. Since the International Court of Justice 1946 was founded, it plays little role today.

DOC.Title: Integration of the world
DOC.TEXT: Since the middle of the 19th century, Europe has taken the initiative and involves the Americas, Asia and Africa, and the world is moving with a close relationship with each other. In this era, the capitalist regime was established mainly in the UK, and the background of the movement of people, goods, capital and information was in the background. The opening of the Suez Canal and the trans-US railroad, the installation of the submarine telegraph cable, etc. accelerated this movement.

DOC.Title: Information Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Since the mid-nineteenth century, communication means developed dramatically and promoted integration of the world in terms of information. In the mid-nineteenth century, when Morse developed a telegraph and Morse code, the installation of submarine telegraph cables rapidly progressed from the middle of the century, Marconi succeeded in transatlantic radio telegraph at the beginning of the 20th century and was put into practical use It was. As a result, a lot of information concentrates in the UK, and London's city has become the center of the world in terms of trade and finance.

DOC.Title: Reuters
DOC.TEXT: The world's first telecommunications company founded in the mid-19th century London. Correspondents dispatched to various places sent information to London using communication means based on the information revolution, which was distributed to newspaper companies and others. In 1858 I quickly communicated the great rebellion of the Indian people, its value was known, and it grew to be the world's largest telecommunications company.

DOC.Title: Thomas Cook
DOC.TEXT: Founder of modern travel industry. Abstinence exerciseist. Using an inexpensive night train and a coach horse, it made a project to bring many people to the Expo in London. After that, he also made overseas trips with the opening of the Paris Expo in 1855, the transcontinental railroad in 1969 and the Suez Canal, and settled on travel as an entertainment for the common people.

DOC.Title: Classicism
DOC.TEXT: A literary trend that emphasizes harmony and formal beauty, with ideals of ancient Greek / Roman culture as ideal. Beginning in France in the 17th century, spread from the late 17th century to the middle of the 18th century England, Germany in the middle of the 18th century to the early 19th century Germany.

DOC.Title: Shippuden, Sturm-und-Dorank
DOC.TEXT: A literary movement that took place in Germany since the 1770 's. Denializing secular morals and assaults, respecting individuality and nature, seeking the natural development of human emotions. It was strongly expressed in Goethe and Schiller 's early works.

DOC.Title: Goethe
DOC.TEXT: German writer. At the forefront of the gust of anger movement, he took office as president of the Weimaru Principality and became active as a politician. Together with Schiller, later became a great German classical literature.

DOC.Title: "Young Welter's trouble"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1774. Goethe's early masterpiece work. Drawing a love affair of a pure youth, it became a pioneering work of the gale anger movement.

DOC.Title: "Faust"
DOC.TEXT: Part 1 1808, Part 2 32th Anniversary. A masterpiece of Goethe who compiled German classicism. A drama that grandly depicts human conflicts and human ideals with the theme of private legendary Faust Festival.

DOC.Title: Schiller
DOC.TEXT: German poet, playwright, historian. Together with Goethe, he painted a human figure with intense intentions, headed for the gust of anger movement. After that, I brought German classical literature to the flowering.

DOC.Title: "Stolen"
DOC.TEXT: Schiller's drama announced in 1781. It depicts a freely freewheeling human figure, and it is regarded as a masterpiece of the gale anger movement.

DOC.Title: Romanticism
DOC.TEXT: A literary tendency that became irregular from the end of the 18th century to the mid-19th century. Emerged against classicalism formalism, emphasizing individuality and emotion, respecting the tradition of history and ethnic culture. There was also a rebellion against the Illuminati that emphasized the reason, praising the Middle Ages.

DOC.Title: Novalis
DOC.TEXT: German early Romantic poet. A nobleman. Master work "Blue Flower".

DOC.Title: Schlegel brothers
DOC.TEXT: German early Romantic poet. My older brother is a critic / translator, leaving Shakespeare's name translation. My younger brother is a historian and a philosopher and left a "literary dialogue" as a Romantic.

DOC.Title: Herderin
DOC.TEXT: German romantic poet. He had a close relationship with Hegel Schelling, he was overwhelmed by Schiller. He was described as "the best German poet", but later he fell into mental confusion.

DOC.Title: Grimm brothers
DOC.TEXT: Both are German linguists and professors at the University of Göttingen. Collecting german's myths and folklore, he compiled "Fairytales for Children and Families" ("Grimm's Fairy Tale Collection") and started publishing "German dictionary".

DOC.Title: Heine
DOC.TEXT: German romantic poet. Jewish system. It was inspired by the French July Revolution and exiled to Paris. He also had friendship with Marx, strengthened the socialist tendency, and was called "revolutionary poet". Masterpiece work "The book of songs".

DOC.Title: Mrs. Stale
DOC.TEXT: French lady literature. Daughter of Neckle, he was persecuted by Napoleon and exiled to foreign countries. Introducing German romanticism, it is made to be one of the pioneers of France = Romanticism.

DOC.Title: Chateaubriand
DOC.TEXT: French = pioneer of Romanticism. Novelist / politician. During the revolution he was exiled to the UK as a royalist but later appointed as Foreign Minister (1823 to 24). Master work "Atara" "Rene".

DOC.Title: Yugo
DOC.TEXT: France = Romantic largest writer / poet. Republican who denied Napoleon III 's second empire and sent an exile, but returned home with the collapse of the Emperor.

DOC.Title: "Les Miserables"
DOC.TEXT: A masterpiece written by Yugo in exile in 1862. A long story that humanitariously defended the oppressed people.

DOC.Title: Wordsworth
DOC.TEXT: British Romantic poet. In the "lyrical poem selection", Britain = cutting romanticism and singing harmony between man and nature.

DOC.Title: Scott
DOC.TEXT: British Romantic writer / poet. I left the story poem "beautiful on the lake" and historical novel "Ivan Ho".

DOC.Title: Byron
DOC.TEXT: British Romantic poet. A nobleman. I participated in the Greek independence war and died of illness. The masterpiece "Pilgrimage of Child = Harold".

DOC.Title: Emerson
DOC.TEXT: American romantic poet and thinker. It is an optimistic individualist, and the main work has "natural theory" and "representative figure".

DOC.Title: Hawthorne
DOC.TEXT: American romantic writer. A literary man who wrote a work symbolically depicting sinful consciousness from Puritan consciousness. There is "scarlet character" in his masterpiece work.

DOC.Title: Whitman
DOC.TEXT: American romantic poet. Singing nature, praising the Christian spirit and democracy.

DOC.Title: "Grass leaves"
DOC.TEXT: The early 1855 poetry collection of Whitman. A new poem was added every time a version was piled up, and I drew the lives and feelings of the common people and urged the spirit of freedom, equality and fraternity in a free form.

DOC.Title: Pushkin
DOC.TEXT: Romantic poet and writer of Russia. It resonated with Decaplist 's assertion, was overflowing with humanism, wrote work criticizing tyranny and was exiled. It is also called "father of modern Russian literature" because it produced superior works in Russian instead of traditional French. He died after fighting with a French officer over a beautiful wife. Major works include "Captain's Daughter" "Onegin".

DOC.Title: Realism, Realism
DOC.TEXT: Literary trends occurred mainly in France in the middle of the 19th century. It was advocated as a reaction to romanticism and tried to draw society and human beings as it is objectively.

DOC.Title: Standards
DOC.TEXT: Pioneering writer of French Realism. Born from the Napoleonic army soldiers, he also served as a diplomat in July. Excellent psychological depiction, criticized the times sharply.

DOC.Title: "Red and black"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1830. Representative works of Stendhal. Red symbolizes the military uniform of the aristocracy, black symbolizes the priest, and depicts the psychology of adolescent Julian Sorel with hostility and ambition in these privilege classes, criticizing the times and society. Pioneering work of modern novel.

DOC.Title: Balzac
DOC.TEXT: French real-world writer. Draw a civil society and a small citizen with an abject imagination and a keen observation.

DOC.Title: "Human Comedy"
DOC.TEXT: It is a collective term of about 90 novels which Balzac conceived and wrote. Using "People Reproduction Method", I drew from the various angles the appearance of the 19th century French society and people.

DOC.Title: Frobert
DOC.TEXT: Establisher of French Realism Literature. While trying to describe the objective depiction of self, he criticized the adultery of the bourgeois society through his work.

DOC.Title: "Mrs Bovary"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1857. A masterpiece of Froubert. (1) It depicts women's affair and suicide by excellent personality analysis and detailed description and is regarded as a typical of realistic novel.

DOC.Title: Saccharay
DOC.TEXT: British Realism writer. I portrays human imperfections satirically and objectively. The masterpiece "City of Vanity".

DOC.Title: Dickens
DOC.TEXT: British Realism writer. Taking the lower society as a theme, we left many masterpieces full of wit and humanism. "Two-city story" "Oliver-twist" is a masterpiece work.

DOC.Title: Googoli
DOC.TEXT: Russian writer / playwright. While pursuing strengthening tourism, we established prose literature based on realism. Representative work "prosecutor" "dead soul" "nose".

DOC.Title: Tulgenev
DOC.TEXT: Russian writer. I left a lot of works that looked directly at the contradiction of the serfdom system and the suffering Russia = intelligentia.

DOC.Title: "Hunter diary"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1852. Turgenev short story. Drawing farmers, it is said that the prince Crown Prince Alexandre (later Alexander II) made a decision to liberate agriculture.

DOC.Title: "Father and child"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1862. It is a masterpiece of Targenev. A representative work depicting nihilism through the appearance of a Russian society after the Order of Liberation and a lethargic intelligentia.

DOC.Title: Dostoevsky
DOC.TEXT: Russian writer. I am inclined to Westernism and experienced a four-year Siberian exile related to the socialist circle. After that, it flew away from politics and created works with a strong mysticism theme with the theme of salvation of human souls.

DOC.Title: "Sin and punishment"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1866. A long story novel by Dostoevsky. Drawing reflections and anguish of youth who committed murder for social justice.

DOC.Title: "Karamazov's Brothers"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1880. The last episode of Dostoevsky. A long story about the theme of salvation of human souls.

DOC.Title: Tolstoy
DOC.TEXT: Russian writer. In an effort to combine realism and humanitarianism, his later years wrote many works of religious humanitarianism.

DOC.Title: "War and Peace"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1869. A representative work by Tolstoy. A big river historical novel that depicts the Russian aristocrat in the Napoleonic war period after 1805.

DOC.Title: "Anna = Karenina"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1877. A representative work by Tolstoy. In the background of the aristocratic society of Russia, he painted a tragic love of her married wife Anna, criticizing the moral of the privileged class.

DOC.Title: Chekhov
DOC.TEXT: Russian writer. Playwright. He graduated from medical school and has experience in social work. While standing in sharp observation power and realism, on the other hand, with the brush full of Pasos, I painted a suffering Russian society / human. Master work "Cherry Blossoms Garden".

DOC.Title: Naturalism
DOC.TEXT: We emphasized realism and expressed the reality in experimental science and expressed it, it took place from the second half of the 19th century. He pursued contradictions of society and depicted the vulgar part of human beings.

DOC.Title: Zola
DOC.TEXT: French Naturalist writer. Taking up contradictions of society, himself insisted on social justice and criticized the military in Dreyfus case.

DOC.Title: "Experimental fiction theory"
DOC.TEXT: Zora 's theory of naturalism and literature. In the novel developed a claim that scientific determinism including genetic theory should be adopted.

DOC.Title: "Izakaya"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1877. A masterpiece of Zora. It depicts the disastrous appearance of the worker society in Paris and is regarded as a masterpiece of naturalism literature.

DOC.Title: Morpassan
DOC.TEXT: French Naturalist writer. He was a disciple of Flaubert and also joined the Zora group. He completed a short story novel form and wrote a dense work of pessimism (pessimism).

DOC.Title: "Life of a woman"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1883. Mopassan 's long story novel. I drew a life of a woman in a form without salvation.

DOC.Title: Ibsen
DOC.TEXT: A Norwegian playwright / poet in Norway. I dealt with social issues from the standpoint of humanitarianism.

DOC.Title: "House of Dolls"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1879. A drama by Ibsen. From the standpoint of liberation of women, I painted New Year in the history of world theater, depicting the awakening of the lady's main character, Nora, and the liberation from home.

DOC.Title: Stringberry
DOC.TEXT: Swedish naturalist writer / playwright. Unfortunate living and leaving works of female distrust from catastrophe of married life. It is regarded as the highest peak of Northern European naturalism literature, and representative works include "Father" and "Daughter Julie".

DOC.Title: end of the century
DOC.TEXT: A time of trend spreading mainly in France at the end of the 19th century. In literature, a pathological, decadent and pessimistic trend has appeared.

DOC.Title: Aestheticism
DOC.TEXT: Literary trends occurred in Europe during the latter half of the 19th century. Ignoring the ethical value of right and wrong, and seeking beauty as the best value. It was also a rebound against the real problem, in particular the naturalism that tackled social contradictions. Represent wild board rails.

DOC.Title: Symbolism
DOC.TEXT: Literary trends occurred mainly in France in the 1880s. In reaction to Romanticism and naturalism, we abandoned the traditional form of expression and emphasized fresh rhythm and symbolic expression.

DOC.Title: Board rail
DOC.TEXT: French aesthetic poet and literary student. Formally it is also a pioneer of symbolism. Major works have poetry "Flower of evil".

DOC.Title: Rambo
DOC.TEXT: French symbolic poet. It was named side by side with Mariarum · Velélène.

DOC.Title: Classicism painting
DOC.TEXT: A fine bureau, modeled on ancient Greek and Roman centered in France, a well-balanced art style. It developed mainly in court.

DOC.Title: David
DOC.TEXT: French classicist painter. After participating in the French Revolution, he served as the chief court painter of Napoleon I. The masterpiece is "Napoleon's coronation ceremony."

DOC.Title: Angle
DOC.TEXT: French classicist painter. He is a disciple of David and is considered to be a finished classicalist painting. The masterpiece is "Grand = Odalisque".

DOC.Title: Romantic painting
DOC.TEXT: The art style which was not satisfied with classicism and has been in effect since the beginning of the 19th century. Passionate and fantastic, many subjects and techniques are intense.

DOC.Title: Delacroix
DOC.TEXT: French = representative painter of Romanticism. Using a dramatic expression with intense color, left "Massacre of Chios Island" and others.

DOC.Title: "The Statue of Liberty Facing the People"
DOC.TEXT: Works of 1831. A masterpiece of Delacroix. I drew a city fight of the July Revolution.

DOC.Title: Naturalistic painting
DOC.TEXT: An art style that tried to depict the rustic nature as it is, abandoning idealization of classicism and exaggeration of romanticism. Many are subjects of rural landscape and natural scenery.

DOC.Title: Millet
DOC.TEXT: French naturalist painter. I painted a landscape painting on the theme of farmer's life. Master work "picking up Uchiha" "Night Bell".

DOC.Title: Goya
DOC.TEXT: Spanish painter. He kept Rococo-like, fantastic, satirical style, not being unrelated to one of Romanticism and Naturalism. It is famous for the execution of Napoleonic troops' invasion of Spain 'execution on May 3'.

DOC.Title: Realistic painting
DOC.TEXT: Art style to describe the real nature and human life objectively. In the middle of the nineteenth century mainly occurred in France, some of which were close to the socialist movement.

DOC.Title: Daumier
DOC.TEXT: French realist painter. In support of the revolution and republicanism, many paintings of accusation who stood by the people left a lot.

DOC.Title: Courbet
DOC.TEXT: French realist painter. I painted the appearance of working farmers as they are. He was imprisoned in Paris-Commune and exiled to Switzerland. Masterpiece work "Ishikari".

DOC.Title: Impressionists
DOC.TEXT: A school of painting which appeared in the latter half of the 19th century, and emphasizing light and color, to express the direct impression received from the object. Many are seeking subjects for natural landscape and human movement.

DOC.Title: Money
DOC.TEXT: Founder of French Impressionist. Major work "Meal on the grass" "Boy playing whistle".

DOC.Title: Monet
DOC.TEXT: French Impressionist leader. Famous for his late succession "Water Lilies".

DOC.Title: Renoir
DOC.TEXT: French Impressionist master. Portraits of women, masterpieces by bath women are many.

DOC.Title: late impressionist
DOC.TEXT: A school developed from Impressionism at the end of the 19th century. I try not only to visualize but also to grasp the fundamental form and style of nature, and to build it on my own sense.

DOC.Title: Cezanne
DOC.TEXT: Leading impressionist leading painter from French Impressionism. Described landscape, still life, portrait in intelligent composition, established a unique style which simplified nature, and exerted a profound influence on modern paintings.

DOC.Title: Gogan
DOC.TEXT: A late Impressionist painter in France. After living in Tahiti from 1891, criticizing civilized society by depicting a lively and undeveloped society.

DOC.Title: Van Gogh
DOC.TEXT: A late impressionist painter in the Netherlands. Since 1886 he resides in France. I established a style featuring intense color and touch, but I suffered mental confusion in my later years and committed suicide. Master work "Himawari" "Self-portrait".

DOC.Title: Rodin
DOC.TEXT: French sculptor. Using the sharp realistic technique, expressing the emotion, the dynamics of internal life and pioneering modern sculpture. The masterpiece "Thinker" "Hell Gate".

DOC.Title: Art-Nouveau, New Arts
DOC.TEXT: The art style that began in Europe at the end of the 19th century. It is decorated with wavy curves and flora and fauna as motifs, and its style covers architecture, furniture, crafts as well as paintings. Emile Gare of glass crafts and Klimt of painters are famous.

DOC.Title: Classical music
DOC.TEXT: It features a well-balanced instruments piece, developed mainly in Vienna. It was music of transition period from court music to citizen music.

DOC.Title: Haydn
DOC.TEXT: Austrian musician. Establish classical music, called "father of symphonies". He left numerous symphonies and oratorios.

DOC.Title: Mozart
DOC.TEXT: Austrian composer. From her childhood, she showed her talent and was called "Shinto child". Features are seen in light tempo and clear timbre. He left numerous works such as symphonies and operas, and is made an establishment of classical music along with Haydn.

DOC.Title: Beethoven
DOC.TEXT: German composer. He compiled classical music and opened the way to Romantic music. I left a masterpiece that makes me feel human-like anguish and a strong will to overcome it. Leave immortal masterpieces such as Symphony "Fate", "Countryside", "No. 9" and so on, called "Seiyu".

DOC.Title: Romantic music
DOC.TEXT: Music that departs from classical music, strongly expressing individuality, will and emotion. It was popular in the first half to the mid 19th century.

DOC.Title: Schubert
DOC.TEXT: Austrian romantic composer. I made many excellent songs in a short life. A masterpiece such as "Otome of a beautiful water mill hut" and "Winter trip" and eight songs including "Unfinished Symphony".

DOC.Title: Berlioz
DOC.TEXT: French romantic composer. It adds painting and poetic elements to the form of a traditional symphony, and created the title music. Master work "Fantasy Symphony".

DOC.Title: Schumann
DOC.TEXT: German romantic composer. It pioneered modern piano technology and left many piano songs and songs as a theoretical leader of Romanticism. The masterpiece is four symphonies and songs "Wandering People".

DOC.Title: list, Franz list
DOC.TEXT: A pianist / composer from Hungary. I left a lot of excellent piano songs and symphonic poetry in technique.

DOC.Title: Chopin
DOC.TEXT: Romantic composer in Poland. It is called "Poet of the Piano" and features lyrical style. In 1830, he learned about the failure of the Russian uprising in Poland on the way of a performance trip, and composed a piano practice song "Revolution". After that he worked mainly in Paris, and composed a number of piano songs based on Polish folk dance melody.

DOC.Title: Mussorgsky
DOC.TEXT: Russian composer. It belongs to the Russian national music school alongside Porodin · Greinka and others, among which among them is known for a style full of Russian realism. The suite "Exhibition drawing" and the opera "Boris Godonov" are famous.

DOC.Title: Tchaikovsky
DOC.TEXT: Russian composer. While being influenced by the national music school, it completed the style which blended the Western Romantic music and Russian national tradition. A beautiful melody filled with lyrical character is a big feature. Six symphonies and valley music "Nutcracker" "Swan Lake" are famous.

DOC.Title: Wagner, Wagner
DOC.TEXT: German romantic composer. Founder of a musical theater (large scale renaissance as an integrated art). With the theme of Germanic myth and others, he created a large scale work full of sensuality and euphoria. Musical performances such as opera such as "Wandering Hollander" and "Tannhuiser", and "Ring of Nibelung" are included.

DOC.Title: Smetana
DOC.TEXT: Czech composer. Participated in the Czech national movement, created a work full of ethnicity, called "the father of the Czech National Revolution". "My country of origin" in his masterpiece work.

DOC.Title: Impressionist music
DOC.TEXT: Music that began in the latter half of the 19th century and became one of the origins of modern music. It expresses the emotion of sound (chord or melody) itself.

DOC.Title: Debussy
DOC.TEXT: French composer. Founding impressionist music, he created his own chord and melody which made use of piano technique. The masterpiece is a piano suite "picture" and orchestral work "preacher to the afternoon of the fauna" "sea".

DOC.Title: German idealism
DOC.TEXT: Mainstream of German philosophy in the early 19th century. It began with Kant, after passing through Fichte Schelling, it was completed by Hegel.

DOC.Title: Kant
DOC.TEXT: German philosopher. Critically comprehensive the rationalism and the empiric theory, and started the German idealistic philosophy. In his book "Critique of Pure Reason", "Criticism of Practical Reason", "Criticism of Criticism of Judgment", it is regarded as the father of criticism philosophy.

DOC.Title: "Pure Reason Criticism"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1781. Kant's main work. It has clarified the possibility and limit of recognition, and therefore stands as a criticism point.

DOC.Title: Fichte
DOC.TEXT: German philosopher. First President of the University of Berlin. I strengthened Kant's practical reasoning thinking, established a subjective idealism.

DOC.Title: Schelling
DOC.TEXT: Germany = Representative of Romantic philosophy. I devised the same philosophy that the knowledge is based on the unity of the spirit (ego) and nature, starting from idealism. Later years ended in mysticism, but it is said that it affected existentialism.

DOC.Title: Hegel
DOC.TEXT: German philosopher. We advocated the dialectic philosophy and systematized and completed the German idealist. Main article "Mental phenomenology" "History philosophy".

DOC.Title: Dialectic Philosophy
DOC.TEXT: The idea that existence and thinking (positive) constantly develops indefinitely (unified) in unison with higher order dimensions while hiding contradiction (anti) inside. It was completed by Hegel and fitted to the world of nature, history and spirit.

DOC.Title: Feuerbach
DOC.TEXT: A philosopher of the German Hegel School leftist. Criticizing Hegel, claimed a materialistic that existence prescribes cognition and influenced Marx.

DOC.Title: Marx
DOC.TEXT: A German-born Jew. Philosopher · economist · socialist thinker. German idealist philosophy · British classical economics · France Fantasist socialism is studied · criticized, philosophy is dialectic materialism · historical studies of materialism, monetary value theory in economics, scientific socialism in practice theory · We comprehensively established a grand ideological system called Marxism.

DOC.Title: Dialectic Materialism
DOC.TEXT: Marxus critically inherited the material material of Feuerbach and was a great epistemology. A philosophy of understanding dialectically the root of recognition and thought from the standpoint of materialism.

DOC.Title: Material Historical Perspective, Historical Materialism
DOC.TEXT: A position to elucidate the law of development of history from the standpoint of dialectic materialism. We tried to think about the development of history based on the premise that class struggle arising from contradiction of productivity and production relations is the driving force of social development. Established by Marx Engels.

DOC.Title: Bentham
DOC.TEXT: A British philosopher / economist. Utilitarianism philosophy was founded and became the theoretical background of industrial capitalists in the early 19th century. I also ran into the revision of the 1st election law (Bentham himself died just before the bill was formed).

DOC.Title: Utilitarianism
DOC.TEXT: The idea that happiness, which is the purpose of life, can be measured quantitatively and realizing maximum happiness of the greatest number leads to social development. Supported by industrial capitalists.

DOC.Title: "Maximum number of greatest happiness"
DOC.TEXT: A slogan of Utilitarianism of Bentham.

DOC.Title: John = Stuart = Mill
DOC.TEXT: A British philosopher. He worked for East India Company for a long time, after that he endeavored to realize the second election law amendment. He advocated Bentham's utilitarianism and took into consideration the qualitative aspect of happiness and insisted on social improvementism.

DOC.Title: Cont.
DOC.TEXT: French philosopher. Founding positivism, it divides the developmental stage of knowledge between theological, metaphysical and empirical. It is regarded as "the father of sociology".

DOC.Title: Positivism philosophy
DOC.TEXT: Philosophical theory organized by Conti. A position to try to find the source of knowledge only on things confirmed by experience, excluding the hypothesis. All historical problems and social events were considered as one aspect of natural phenomenon and it was possible to explain by scientific law.

DOC.Title: Herbert = Spencer
DOC.TEXT: A British philosopher. We propose a social evolution theory combining utilitarianism and evolutionary theory (social Darwinism) and describing phenomena of nature, society, and history systematically in a unified manner.

DOC.Title: Shoppen Howell
DOC.TEXT: German idealist philosopher. I learned Braton, Kant and Indian philosophy and developed the philosophy of pessimism (the pessimism), preaching that "the essence of the world is a blind living will".

DOC.Title: Existential philosophy
DOC.TEXT: An idea that seeks human beings as irrational that can not reasonably explain and seek out subjective ways from among anxiety and despair. It began with Kierkegaard and Nietzsche.

DOC.Title: Kierkegaard
DOC.TEXT: Danish philosopher. Criticized the method of Hegel's philosophy as a quantitative dialectic, and insisted on the existential qualitative dialectic of "How to become a Christian who stands alone in front of God?" It is a pioneer of existential philosophy.

DOC.Title: Nietzsche
DOC.TEXT: German philosopher. The decadence of European culture is due to Christian rule, crying out "God is dead", insisting on the establishment of new value. The will to power, the return to eternity, the thought of a superman etc, but the idea was later used for fascism.

DOC.Title: "superman"
DOC.TEXT: Human figures Nietzsche idealized. Overcoming the life of pain, always exist to aim for self improvement. It was also a symbol of power.

DOC.Title: Freud
DOC.TEXT: Austrian psychiatrist. In researching methods of treating neurosis, he founded psychoanalysis. The psychological phenomenon was regarded as a conflict between libido and ego, and that theory also influenced psychology, humanities and social sciences. As it was a Jewish group, he escaped the persecution of the Nazis and exiled to London in 1938.

DOC.Title: Malthus
DOC.TEXT: British classical scholar. It is known by "population argument" which causes poverty as an imbalance between food production and population increase. The claim that solving the poverty problem by restraining the population was criticized from the viewpoint of socialism, but now it is modern and reevaluated in the midst of environmental problems.

DOC.Title: "Theory of people"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1798. A work by Malthus. The increase in food production is arithmetic series, but the increase in human beings is geometric series, and we argued that human beings' poverty is inevitable.

DOC.Title: Ricardo
DOC.TEXT: British classical scholar. We established the classical economics by building the labor value theory that the value of the commodity is determined by the amount of labor consumed in its production, the distribution theory and the theory of rent. Main article "Principles of economics and taxation".

DOC.Title: Classical economics, classical economics
DOC.TEXT: Another name for liberalism economics such as Adam = Smith · Malthus · Ricard · Mill.

DOC.Title: list
DOC.TEXT: German economist. He insisted protectionist tradeism and made efforts to form a customs union and to unify Germany. He advocated national economics, which promotes economic progressive countries, and established historical school economics.

DOC.Title: History School Economics
DOC.TEXT: Economics that was developed mainly in Germany in the 19th century and is trying to historically consider economic development. With the theory of economic development theory, in an economically disadvantaged country, it was said that protection trade policies are necessary, not free trade which can be handled by classical economics.

DOC.Title: Marx Economics
DOC.TEXT: Economics established by Marx Engels in the late 19th century. Analyzing the production style of capitalism from the labor value theory and the surplus value theory, it is said that capitalists are exploiting the value created by the workers beyond the pay wages paid out as profits.

DOC.Title: "Capital Theory"
DOC.TEXT: Marx's work which analyzed the capitalist economy. Basic literature on Marxist economics. Volume 1 was written by Marx in 1867, and volumes 2 and 3 were edited by Engels in the years 85 and 94 after the death of Marx. We analyzed the structure of the capitalist economy and preached the inevitability of its downfall.

DOC.Title: rankke
DOC.TEXT: German historian. We conducted empirical and scientific declarations based on strict historical criticism and established modern history. Representative work "World History".

DOC.Title: Modern History Studies
DOC.TEXT: History studies seeking historical facts empirically and scientifically through criticism of historical materials starting with Ranke.

DOC.Title: History Law
DOC.TEXT: One state's legislation is a historical product born of its own culture, and the position of a law that asserts the historical, developmental and ethnic specificity of the law. It was established in Germany in the first half of the nineteenth century against natural law which asserts the universality of the law.

DOC.Title: Savigny
DOC.TEXT: German law scholar. In creating the Civil Code in Germany after the Napoleonic War, he opposed natural law, argued for the establishment of a law based on the German history and ethnic spirit, and created "History Law". Main article is "history of medieval Roman law".

DOC.Title: Faraday
DOC.TEXT: UK chemistry and physicist. We discovered the law of electromagnetic induction in 1831 and the law of electrolysis in 1933 and contributed to the development of electromagnetism.

DOC.Title: Meyer
DOC.TEXT: A German physicist. We discovered the law of conservation of energy and contributed to the development of internal combustion engine.

DOC.Title: Helmholtz
DOC.TEXT: A physiologist in Germany. In cooperation with Meyer discovered the law of conservation of energy in 1847.

DOC.Title: Roentgen
DOC.TEXT: A German physicist. In 1895 he discovered X radiation and in 1901 he won the first Nobel Prize in physics.

DOC.Title: Curie and Mr.
DOC.TEXT: French physicist / chemist. My wife is from Poland. We jointly studied radioactive materials and found radium and polonium in 1898.

DOC.Title: Liebig
DOC.TEXT: German chemist. Established the foundation of organic chemistry, opened the way of agricultural chemistry.

DOC.Title: Darwin
DOC.TEXT: A British naturalist. In 1831-36, he surveyed the southern hemisphere at the survey vessel Beagle and confirmed biological evolution. In 1858 he published the theory of evolution, and then in 1959 published "Origin of Species".

DOC.Title: Evolution theory
DOC.TEXT: The doctrine published by Darwin in 1858. A theory that the living thing is not created by God, but has evolved from the primitive organism according to the environment. It influenced not only the biological world but also many theories and the world view such as religious circles and social science.

DOC.Title: "Origin of species"
DOC.TEXT: Published in 1859. A masterpiece that illustrates Darwin's theory of biological evolution.

DOC.Title: Social evolution theory
DOC.TEXT: The theory that Darwin's theory of evolution was applied to the understanding of human society. It is said that society is a world of weak coast and that people with ability are survived. It was later used for racial theory and eugenics, and was also used as a basis for anti-Semitism.

DOC.Title: Mendel
DOC.TEXT: Austrian naturalist. In 1865 he discovered the laws of heredity from pea hybridization experiments.

DOC.Title: Pasteur
DOC.TEXT: French bacteriologist. We discovered lactic acid bacteria and established the principle of natural fermentation. In addition, by negating the spontaneous generation theory of microorganisms, devised a sterilization method, contributed to the prevention and treatment of epidemic diseases, such as successful vaccination of rabies in 1880.

DOC.Title: Koch
DOC.TEXT: German bacteriologist. We pursued pathogenic bacteria of infectious diseases and established the foundation of bacteriology. He discovered M. tuberculosis in 1882, Vibrio cholerae in 1983, and in 1990 created tuberculin.

DOC.Title: Nobel
DOC.TEXT: Swedish chemical engineer. I invented dynamite in 1867, smokeless gunpowder in 1975, made a big wealth. In November the Nobel Prize was founded in 1901.

DOC.Title: Morse
DOC.TEXT: American electrician. Invented the Morse code, invented the relay type telegraph machine in 1837, and laid the world's first telegraph line between Washington and Baltimore in 44 years.

DOC.Title: Bell
DOC.TEXT: American electrician. In 1876 invented the telephone.

DOC.Title: Marconi
DOC.TEXT: Italian electrician. In 1895 he invented wireless telegraph and succeeded in communicating across the Atlantic in 1901.

DOC.Title: Edison
DOC.TEXT: An American inventor. He invented a lot of inventions such as gramophone in 1876, electric light (incandescent light bulb) in 1978, movie in 1993, and was called "inventive king".

DOC.Title: Diesel
DOC.TEXT: German mechanical engineer. Invented the diesel engine in 1897.

DOC.Title: Daimler
DOC.TEXT: German mechanical engineer. In 1883 he invented gasoline engine, produced two-wheeled gasoline car in 1985 and four-wheeled gasoline car in 1986. In 1990, Daimler automobile company (later merged with Benz) was established.

DOC.Title: Submarine Telegraph Cable
DOC.TEXT: In 1851, the world's first submarine telegraph cable was laid in Britain and France (Dover Strait), after that, between the Atlantic for 66 years, continued between the UK and India in 1970, the "integration of the world" advanced through information.

DOC.Title: Tasman
DOC.TEXT: Voyager in the Netherlands. In the voyage of 1642-43, 44-48 years, I reached Tasmania, New Zealand, Fiji Island etc.

DOC.Title: Cook
DOC.TEXT: British navigator. 1768-71, 72-75 In the voyage of 76-79 years I explored the Pacific from the Bering Strait to New Zealand, but I was killed by indigenous people in Hawaii.

DOC.Title: Hedin
DOC.TEXT: Swedish geographer / explorer. Since 1885, we investigated Lopnol several times from East Turkistan / Tarim Basin in Central Asia and found the Archaeological Site in 1901.

DOC.Title: Livingstone
DOC.TEXT: British missionary / explorer. After 1849 I explored the South African outback and discovered the Victoria Falls in 55 years. Departed for the 1866 Nile water source exploration, it had disappeared until 1971, but it was "discovered" by Stanley. The results of these expeditions are heavily used for colonial policy of imperialists, but they themselves tried to abolish them.

DOC.Title: Stanley
DOC.TEXT: An American explorer born in the UK. In 1871 he departed to rescue Livingstone and "discovered" in Tanganyika. After 1874 I explored the Congo region.

DOC.Title: Polar exploration
DOC.TEXT: Following the exploration of the African Outback and Central Asia, attempts were made to reach the North and South Poles from the end of the 19th century.

DOC.Title: Peary
DOC.TEXT: An American polar explorer. I succeeded in the first arrival of the North Pole in 1909.

DOC.Title: Amuzen
DOC.TEXT: Polar explorer in Norway. In 1911 he succeeded in reaching the South Pole for the first time and in the 25 years tried to explore the Arctic by air route. I left for the rescue of the Italian explorer Nobile in 28 years and became missing.

DOC.Title: Scott
DOC.TEXT: British polar explorer. It reached the South Pole in about 1 month behind Amundsen in 1912, and it came home on the way home.

DOC.Title: Ottoman Empire
DOC.TEXT: It was built by the Turkish ethnic group in the northwestern part of Asia Minor and then expanded its power to the Balkans and grew into a power to oppress the Byzantine Empire. It aborted in 1402, but it soon revived, destroyed the Byzantine empire in 1453, continued to expand the territory, built a large empire across Asia, Africa and Europe. However, it began to wane from around the end of the 17th century, and in the 19th century the Eastern problem caused by the ethnic independence movement in the territory and the interference of the European powers strongly occurred, completely weakened.

DOC.Title: Ayarn
DOC.TEXT: An influential person in rural areas of the Ottoman Empire. We accumulated wealth through tax collection contracts, etc. Since the 18th century it became autonomous as a local power, the decentralization and weakening of the Ottoman Empire advanced.

DOC.Title: Vienna siege, Second Wien siege
DOC.TEXT: The Ottoman army attacked and surrounded Vienna, but the incident failed after being repelled by the Austrian army who received assistance such as the King of Poland. The Ottoman Empire suffered a blow and it triggered a decline.

DOC.Title: Karlovitz treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty tied between the Ottoman Empire and Austria, Poland and the Republic of Venice. The Ottoman Empire ceded Hungary, Transylvania and others to Austria, and greatly retreated from the Balkans.

DOC.Title: Kyushuku = Kaynerge Convention
DOC.TEXT: The treaty where the Ottoman Empire deprived Russia of the control of the Black Sea. The Ottoman Empire let Russia abandon the control of Klim = Han country and gave the Black Sea the right to freely navigate. Furthermore, since it gave the right to protect Greek Orthodox Church living in the Empire, this was later made as an excuse for internal affairs interference.

DOC.Title: Egyptian occupation of Napoleon
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon raised the nationalism of the ruled races within the Ottoman Empire, as they invited indigenous people in Egypt to oppose the Ottoman Empire.

DOC.Title: Selim III
DOC.TEXT: Ottoman Empire No. 28 Sultan (ranking 1789-1807). In order to stop the decline of the empire, we advanced the modernization policy including the creation of the West Army 's New Army Nizam-Jedit, but it was abolished and killed by the riots of the conservative forces of Jenicheri and others.

DOC.Title: Mahmut II
DOC.TEXT: Ottoman Empire Thirtieth Sultan (rank 1808-39). Ayahn was banished, the Yenicheli was completely eliminated, and efforts were made to modernize the Ottoman empire by Westernization. However, outside the country, I suffered from the fight against Greek independence, Russian south, Muhammad Ali.

DOC.Title: dissolution of the army corps of the Yenicelli
DOC.TEXT: Since the end of the 16th century, the revolutionization of Jenicheli advanced, became a force to form a privileged class in the 18th century and hindered the modernization reform, it was dissolved by Mahmut II.

DOC.Title: Ibn = Abdul-Wahab
DOC.TEXT: A religious reformer of Arabia. Denial of mysticism and saint worship, a revivalist movement to "return to the teaching of Muhammad" was held, and Wahhabi factions were opened.

DOC.Title: Wahab faction, Wahhab movement
DOC.TEXT: In the middle of the 18th century, Islamic reformists (reform movement) started by Wahhab. In honor of the return to Muslim school during the Muhammad era, he criticized mysticism and Shiites severely and tried to strictly apply Shari'a (Islamic law). I joined the Saud family and expanded the power.

DOC.Title: Saud family
DOC.TEXT: A ruler who dominated central Arabia. In cooperation with Wahab, around 1744, I went to the first Wahhabi kingdom (Saudo Kingdom).

DOC.Title: Wahahab kingdom, Saud kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The kingdom built by the Saud family in tandem with Wahab. Occupied Mecca Medina and dominated the majority of the Arabian Peninsula. It was destroyed temporarily in Muhammad Ali in 1818, but it soon revived. After extinction in the latter part of the 19th century, in 1902 the British support backed the reign of the Saud family, after Saudi Arabia and the country were declared.

DOC.Title: Riyadh
DOC.TEXT: The capital city of Wahab (Kingdom of Saud). The descendants of Saud took in 1902 and revived the kingdom. Currently the capital city of Saudi Arabia.

DOC.Title: Governor General
DOC.TEXT: A title given to a few high officials of the Ottoman Empire. Governor General of the territory gradually became independent with the decline of the Ottoman Empire.

DOC.Title: Muhammad Ali, Mehmet Ari
DOC.TEXT: Founder of Muhammad Ali. Governor Egypt (rank 1805-49). It resisted Napoleon 's invasion of Egypt and was given the status of Governor of Egypt from the Ottoman Empire in 1805, contributing to the modernization of Egypt. Destroyed the temporary Wahhab kingdom and assisted the Ottoman Empire in the Greek Revolutionary War, but caused the Egyptian Turkish war on Syrian possession, and went on to influence the European powers.

DOC.Title: Muhammad-Ally Morning
DOC.TEXT: The last dynasty of Egypt, with Muhammad Ali as the founder. From the late nineteenth century it was virtually under British rule.

DOC.Title: Egypt = Turkish War
DOC.TEXT: Two wars of war between Muhammad Ali's Egypt and the Ottoman Empire. [1st] Muhammad Ali asked for Syria's possession, fought and fought. Russia assisted the Ottoman Empire, but Britain, France and Austria interfered, reconciling Egypt and the Ottoman Empire, and acknowledging Syria's right to Muhammad Alley. [2nd] The Ottoman Empire attacked Muhammad Ali, seeking the rights of Egypt and Syria for the right to witness, and dispatched to Syria. Muhammad Ali won the Ottoman Empire with the help of France, but Britain, Russia, Austria and Prussia alliance and interfereed, and the right of the governor of Egypt was recognized at the London meeting, but the possession of Syria abandoned It was made.

DOC.Title: Turkey = British Commerce Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The market of the Ottoman Empire was opened, British products flowed in and resulted in a blow to the industry of the Ottoman Empire. After that, the Ottoman government 's finances failed, and the introduction of foreign bonds accelerated interference from the strength.

DOC.Title: London Conference
DOC.TEXT: The 2nd Egypt = Conflict of Powers held for the Turkish war dispute. England, Russia, Austria, Prussia and France participated.

DOC.Title: London 4 Country Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Treaty concluded by the four countries of the UK, Russia, Austria, Prussia at the London conference. Muhammad Ali abandoned the territory of Syria and acknowledged the hereditary status of governor of Egypt Sudan. In the next 41 years, France joined and the Five Straits Agreement was concluded, the Uncal-Sceresce treaty which approved the passage of the Dardanellus · Bosporas strait to the Russian warship was abandoned and the navigation of both straits of foreign warships was prohibited .

DOC.Title: Suez Canal
DOC.TEXT: A canal of about 160 km in length connecting the Mediterranean Sea and the Red Sea. French Lesbbies founded the International Suez Canal Company in 1858, started construction the following year, opened in 1969. Since then Egypt, who was in financial difficulty soon, sold the holding of the Suez Canal Company to the UK in 1875, the intervention on Britain in Egypt strengthened.

DOC.Title: Lesseps
DOC.TEXT: French diplomat. Constructed the Suez Canal and later began construction of the Panama Canal, but failed.

DOC.Title: Urabee's rebellion, Urabee-Pasha's rebellion
DOC.TEXT: In opposition to the strengthening of foreign domination over Egypt, armed uprising caused by military person Urabi (Olavie) guidance. Egypt for Egyptians "as a slogan and fought and became the starting point for the Egyptian ethnic movement. Britain sold one sold and suppressed, after that Egypt became a de facto protectorate.

DOC.Title: Mustafa = Carmill
DOC.TEXT: Egyptian ethnogeistic activist. He became a charismatic leader of the anti-British movement and founded the Kuomintang, but soon he was sick.

DOC.Title: Protecting the UK, Kuwait Nationalized
DOC.TEXT: At the end of the 19th century the UK entered into the Protection Treaty, under the control, and made the Persian Gulf a power zone.

DOC.Title: Tanjimart, Benefit Reform
DOC.TEXT: A general term for various reforms over the Ottoman Empire of justice, administration, fiscal, military, and culture. Although it was modernization from the top aiming at the Westernization of the Ottoman Empire, conservative factions were strong, failing to achieve sufficient results, and frustrated in the midway.

DOC.Title: Abdul-Mejit I
DOC.TEXT: Ottoman Empire 31st Sultan (ranking 1839-61). In 1839, Gurhane decree was issued and Tanjimart began. In 1856 confirmed the social equality of non-Muslims in the territory. In the outside world, he received support from Britain and France, beating Russia in the Crimean war.

DOC.Title: Gulhane Edict Decree
DOC.TEXT: Edict issued by Abdul-Mejit I in Gurhane (a rose garden in the Topkab Palace). A non-Muslim declaration that it guarantees legal equal and fair taxation within the Empire. Since then, Westernization reform called Tanjimart has started in earnest.

DOC.Title: Topkapi Palace
DOC.TEXT: In the late 15th century, the palace built by Mehmet II. It was used as a castle of Sultan until the 19th century.

DOC.Title: Crimean war
DOC.TEXT: A war where Russia opened up the pretext of protecting Greek Orthodox within the Ottoman Empire. The Ottoman Empire backed by Britain, France and others won the victory, and the Russian south policy was blocked again by the Paris Convention.

DOC.Title: Abdul-Hamito II
DOC.TEXT: Ottoman Empire 34th Sultan (ranking 1876-1909). Madohato issued the Constitution as the Prime Minister, but stopped the Constitution with the outbreak of the Russian-Turkish war as an excuse, revived the emperor tyranny. However, I could not cope with the rebellion and independence of the people in the territory, the interference of the strong power and the invasion, and it was abolished after the revolution of youth Turkey.

DOC.Title: Midhat = Pasha
DOC.TEXT: The Prime Minister of the Ottoman Empire (responsible 1872, 76-77). The Midhat Constitution was enacted. After that, it faced against Abdul-Hamit II and fell down.

DOC.Title: Midhat Constitution
DOC.TEXT: The first Ottoman Empire established by the Chancellor Midhat and also the first constitution in Asia. I took a bureaucratic system and a responsible cabinet system. Russia = Turkey The outbreak of the war was stopped 1878.

DOC.Title: Russia = Turkish War, Russia War
DOC.TEXT: A war broke out by Russia interfering with the repression of the Ottoman empire against the rebellion of slavic ethnic groups of the Balkans. The Ottoman Empire was completely defeated, and in 1878 the Saint-Stefano Treaty-Berlin Treaty was signed.

DOC.Title: Kajar morning
DOC.TEXT: Iranian Turkish Islamic dynasty established after destroying short-lived Zand morning. Tehran the capital. Since the 19th century, weakened by the invasion of Britain and Russia forces.

DOC.Title: Tehran
DOC.TEXT: Kajar morning · city of pufflevie morning.

DOC.Title: Treaty of Turkey Mancher
DOC.TEXT: The inequality treaty signed between the Kajar morning and Russia. Iran, who was defeated by the match against Russia during 1826-27 years aiming to recapture the Caucasus, got the majority of Armenia and gave Russia extraterritorial rights. Since then, they also granted similar rights to other foreign countries, which was the opportunity for aggression against Iran of power.

DOC.Title: Armenia
DOC.TEXT: Highland area between the Caspian Sea and Small Asia. Russia won the majority in Turkey Mancher Treaty.

DOC.Title: Azerbaijan
DOC.TEXT: Region on the southwest coast of the Caspian Sea. It entered under Iranian rule in the 16th century, but in the 19th century Russia invaded the northern part.

DOC.Title: Said = Ally = Muhammad
DOC.TEXT: Iranian religionist. He called himself "a parade (gate) that connects Mahdi (the Messiah) and the people," and created Barbism.

DOC.Title: Barbism
DOC.TEXT: The Mysticism New denomination of Shi'ite school of Islamism started by Said Ali-Muhammad. It spread among poor farmers and small and medium-sized merchants who repressed against oppression of the UK, Russia, etc. in accordance with the abolition of established religious ceremonies and elimination of class discrimination, gender equality and others. But it was viewed as dangerous by the government, guru was shot dead. Later, the disciples developed into Baha'i, which claims gender equality / adoption of world language etc.

DOC.Title: Barbist's Ran
DOC.TEXT: The feudal regime and the rebellion of the Iranian people who opposed the subjugation to foreign forces such as England and Russia. Although Barbism was not directly related to the rebellion, many of the poor farmers who participated in the rebellion were Paubuans, so they received intense repression and persecution by the government.

DOC.Title: Tobacco = boycott movement
DOC.TEXT: Anti-British anti-king movement by Iranian civilians, merchants, Ulamar and others who opposed the British trader acquiring monopoly right, such as the production and sale of cigarettes throughout Iran.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Afghanistan
DOC.TEXT: Middle Eastern 18th century Durrani kingdom established in the region from the morning achievement of ethnic independence, from the Am River to the Indus River. In the nineteenth century it became a protectorate in the wake of British invasion wary of Russia's south, but became independent in 1919 and became Republic in 1973.

DOC.Title: Kabul
DOC.TEXT: The capital of the Kingdom of Afghanistan.

DOC.Title: Afghan War
DOC.TEXT: The invasion war to Afghanistan three times the British opposing the south of Russia. In the first round Britain was completely defeated and succeeded in making it a protectorate in the second round, but in the third round he had to admit independence.

DOC.Title: Afghanistan Protected Nationalization
DOC.TEXT: UK has virtually protected Afghanistan by victory of the 2 nd Afghan War and was approved by Russia at the British Russian Cooperation in 1907.

DOC.Title: Turkestan Province
DOC.TEXT: Ministry that Russia invaded Central Asia in 1867 and established Tashkent as the provincial capital.

DOC.Title: Bukhara-Han County, Bojara-Han Country
DOC.TEXT: A small kingdom formed by the Uzbek people, mainly in Bukhara. It was regarded as a protected country of Russia in 1868 and it was reduced in 1920 when the Soviet regime was formed.

DOC.Title: Hiva-Han country
DOC.TEXT: A small kingdom formed by the Uzbek people in the Fergana region on the upper stream of the Sil River. It was annexed to Russia in 1876.

DOC.Title: East India Company, British East India Company
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1600, it is a large patent company granted exclusive rights on trade and colonization in a wide area ranging from Cape of Hope in the west to Magellan Strait in the east. Moved the center of activity from the fragrance islands to India on the border of the case in 1623, and became the center of British Indian rule by promoting the acquisition and management of colonies based on Madras · Bombay · Calcutta.

DOC.Title: Mughal Empire
DOC.TEXT: The last Islamic dynasty in India built by Babe. The sixth generation of Auranda Zebu was at its heyday, and the entry into Western European countries where it came was only a matter of trade in special products and the acquisition of the base therefor. Since the second half of the 17th century, Western European countries advanced rapidly after losing unity through chaos such as religious conflicts and regional revolts. After the battle of Placie, the rule of Mughal emperor became nominal, was destroyed by the British during the great rebellion of the Indian people in the middle of the 19th century.

DOC.Title: Carnatik War, Karnataka War
DOC.TEXT: Three colonial wars in the UK and France in South India. In the end Britain won the victory, British control over South India was established.

DOC.Title: Battle of Plushy
DOC.TEXT: The battle that the British East India company army destroyed the Allied troops allied army of France / Bengal. The French forces were destroyed from India, British Indian rule dominated.

DOC.Title: Bengal Superfare
DOC.TEXT: A local power who was authorized by the Mughal Empire to control the Bengal region (tax collection right <Diehanie>). Because of the French side in the battle of Plushy, lost to Britain, in 1765, the British eastern India company was deprived of the tax collection rights of Bengal · Bija · Orissa and lost control of the Bengal region.

DOC.Title: Clive
DOC.TEXT: British East India company official (secretary). politician. As a military commander, he brought victory to Britain during the Carnatic War and the battle of Plushy, became the first governor of Bengal. Later, it was summoned to the Congress for corruption and committed suicide.

DOC.Title: Bengal
DOC.TEXT: It is the most fertile area in India in the lower Ganges river basin. In 1765, the British East India Company acquired the tax levy and was substantially dominated.

DOC.Title: Governor of Bengal
DOC.TEXT: 1758 Director of regional governance in Bengal established by the United Kingdom. The first generation was clive. In 1773 he was renamed Governor General Bengal.

DOC.Title: Governor General Bengal
DOC.TEXT: It was established on behalf of Governor in 1773 Governing Law. He also governed the Madras and Bombay districts.

DOC.Title: Indian Governing Law
DOC.TEXT: A collective term of laws made by the parliament of the home country for Indian rule. After setting the legal status of the East India Company on Indian Government in 1773, it was established one after another, but what was enacted in 1919 and 35 years is particularly important.

DOC.Title: Mysore Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Regional kingdom of Hinduism (temporary Islamicism in the late 18th century, established in South India in the early 17th century). It was defeated by England in four Mysorel wars and subsequently subordinated to Britain.

DOC.Title: Mysore War
DOC.TEXT: Four wars between England and Mysore Kingdom. Britain won the victory, making South India dominate decisive.

DOC.Title: Maratha alliance
DOC.TEXT: A feudal association of Hindu marathurisms in the western part of Deccan Plateau. It resisted British invasion, but was destroyed by Britain in three Maratha wars.

DOC.Title: Malarter War
DOC.TEXT: Three wars of England and Maratha alliance. Britain won the victory, establishing the control of the Midwest of Deccan Plateau.

DOC.Title: Abolition of trade exclusivity for British East India Company
DOC.TEXT: At the request of the industrial capitalist in the home country, East India Company 's exclusive right to trade with India was abolished except for tea. However, the company survived, invested in India and collected the ground tax, possessing the Indian Government.

DOC.Title: Gurkha War
DOC.TEXT: A war that the British defeated the Gurkans and conquered Nepal.

DOC.Title: Ceylon, Sri Lanka
DOC.TEXT: In 1815, the British officially obtained from the Netherlands in the Vienna Protocol.

DOC.Title: Commercial suspension of British East India Company
DOC.TEXT: Eastern India Company 's entire commercial activity in India was stopped, and only Indian Government Rights remained. In the same year, the trade exclusive right against China and the abolition of the tea trade exclusive right in all areas were also decided.

DOC.Title: Sikhism
DOC.TEXT: Early in the 16th century, the new religion that Nana-kaku was founded under the influence of Islamist. It was monotheistic and denied caste. Sikhs spread to the Punjab region, militarily gathered against the pressure of the Mughal Empire, resisted the invasion of the UK.

DOC.Title: Shiku War
DOC.TEXT: The battle that the British army destroyed Sikhs in northwest India. The UK annexed the Punjab region.

DOC.Title: Punjab consolidation
DOC.TEXT: The victory of the Sik war annexed Britain, almost all of India's conquest was completed.

DOC.Title: Zombinder system
DOC.TEXT: Land tax collection system implemented by the UK in India. It was introduced to Bengal · Bihar in 1793, and it was mainly carried out in northern India since then. Instead of recognizing the traditional rights of Zamingdar (former landowner / lord) as modern land ownership, Britain places them as direct responsible for delivering land tax to the state. Land taxes are fixed amount and permanent fixed, tax collection from farmers has become certain, tax revenues have dramatically increased. It is a system certified and strengthened landowner control, which indicates Indian domination in the UK depends on the old forces.

DOC.Title: Ray yard work system
DOC.TEXT: The tax collection system that Britain carried out primarily in South India and Sindh region since the beginning of the 19th century. A system that Raiyatt (cultivated farmer) acknowledged modern land ownership rights and simultaneously took tax liability. Unlike the Zamdaley system, the colonial government directly controlled farmers without intervention of landlords. The control and deprivation of Britain was carried out in a method corresponding to the actual situation in various places, and it was not uniform.

DOC.Title: Plantation
DOC.TEXT: Large farm management that cultivates a single product crop using vast land and cheap labor. In India, British capital flowed into the 1830s when trade exclusivity of East India Company was abolished, plantations such as Indigo, Tea, Jute Hemp and Opium developed. It depended on the international market price, afflicted workers even if they were rich or poor · They brought devastating blow to Indian industrial structure.

DOC.Title: Shiperhee, Sepoi
DOC.TEXT: The meaning of "soldier" in Persian. An Indian mercenary organized by East India Company. It was organized by upper caste Hindus and Muslims.

DOC.Title: The rebellion of Seperihu, Sevoy's rebellion
DOC.TEXT: The first national rebellion in India, which began with an armed uprising of the Shippery troops in northern Delhi and expanded throughout northern India. A part of the former feudal lords was also participated in this rebellion from farmers and commerce and industry. The rebels who occupied Delhi declared the reign of Mughal emperor who was famous and innocent, but the rebel army had no unified organization or goal, and the British side who used the former rulers and the Afghans / Gurkans It was crushed by counterattack. As a result of the rebellion, the Mughal Empire was destroyed and direct governance by the British government began.

DOC.Title: India Great Rebellion
DOC.TEXT: Anti-English rebellion from 1857 to 1959 was not taken over by Shiperchi alone, it was a designation from the perspective that it was a whole ethnic resistance movement. Moreover, this rebellion is regarded as the origin of the ethnic independence movement, and it is also called "1857 Indian independence war" in some cases.

DOC.Title: Lakshmi-Bai
DOC.TEXT: Queen of a small country of North India. Although he was one of the leaders during the Great Indian Revolt, he was killed in the battle. It is popular in India as "Great hero's hero".

DOC.Title: Occupying Delhi Castle
DOC.TEXT: The Sipperhei army cooperated over the religious conflict of Hindu and Islam, occupied Delhi Castle, and made declaration of the reign of the Mughal emperor who was famous and innocent.

DOC.Title: Mughal Empire Destruction
DOC.TEXT: The British army caught Mughal emperor in 1857 and exiled to Burma the following year, so the Empire was destroyed both in name and fame.

DOC.Title: Dissolution of East India Company, Dissolution of British East India Company
DOC.TEXT: Looking at the misfortune by the East India company's rebellion, the British parliament decided the new Indian Governing Law and dissolved, and the direct governance of India by the home country government was started.

DOC.Title: Emperor of India
DOC.TEXT: In 1877, the Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom proclaimed a position and came to that position.

DOC.Title: Indian Empire
DOC.TEXT: The name of the Indian colony which Queen Victoria was formed as a concurrent Indian emperor. Actually it was established in 1858 during the rebellion of Sipper Brown.

DOC.Title: Queen Victoria
DOC.TEXT: Queen of the British Empire heyday (ruling 1837-1901). After 1877 it also served as Emperor of India.

DOC.Title: Clan Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The former regional royalty in India, which was recognized even after the establishment of the British Indian Empire.
