Internal regime excluding diplomatic rights, defense rights and others was recognized, maintaining semi-independence, large and small 550 or more. After the rebellion of Shiperghi the UK adopted a policy to use the conservative clan kingdom and to use it for the suppression of ethnic movements.

DOC.Title: Division of Governance
DOC.TEXT: Ruling power is to govern by using the conflict in the controlled forces. Although the Roman Empire was once a famous governance method that he went on in the dominated territory, Britain made use of differences on religion and caste in India.

DOC.Title: Dutch East Indies
DOC.TEXT: A colony formed after the 19th century, the Netherlands promoted conquest around Javanese Batavia. It is almost the current region of the Republic of Indonesia. The Dutch East India Company was in colonial management and monopolized the spice trade, but it was in a bankruptcy state due to a decline in spice prices, a decline in maritime rights, corruption of officials, etc. In 1799, the company was dissolved, It moved to direct governance.

DOC.Title: Amboya Incident
DOC.TEXT: A case where the Netherlands massacred all UK commercial staff members on one of the Molucca islands. Domination of the Dutch perfume islands has been established, after which the UK will concentrate on entering India.

DOC.Title: Mataram Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Islamic Kingdom established in the rice-producing area in eastern Java. The seventeenth century was full, but it was destroyed in the middle of the 18th century due to internal conflict and Dutch attacks.

DOC.Title: Batavia Republic
DOC.TEXT: A republic established in the Netherlands due to the influence of the French Revolution and invasion of the Revolutionary Army. Taxation from France and Ikiris suffered suffering from overseas colonies such as Cape colony and Sri Lanka. After that, it was conquered by Napoleon and disappeared because his younger brother Rui became king (rank 1806-10).

DOC.Title: Dissolution of East India Company, Dissolution of Dutch East India Company
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon broke up due to the conquest of the Netherlands and the failure of colonial management. In 1811, Java was also occupied by Britain, but was returned to the Netherlands for 16 years in the fall of Napoleon.

DOC.Title: UK = Dutch Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Bordering the Malacca Strait, Britain recognized Melaka Singapore in the East and Sumatra in the West in the West, each as a power sphere.

DOC.Title: Java War
DOC.TEXT: A great rebellion of Java Island, taught by the royal Diponegoro against the tyranny of the Netherlands. Although it was suppressed, it caused the financial distress of the Dutch East Indian government.

DOC.Title: Fan = Den = Boss
DOC.TEXT: Dutch East Indian Governor (President 1830-33). In 1830, a forced cultivation system was implemented.

DOC.Title: Forced cultivation system
DOC.TEXT: Economic policy implemented in Java Island since 1830. We forced coffee, sugarcane, indigo, etc. in one fifth of cultivated land and bought it cheaply. The Netherlands exported these crops and produced enormous profits, but in Java, rice shortage occurred, and famine came in succession.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Aceh
DOC.TEXT: Islamic kingdom in northwestern Sumatra. Since the end of the 16th century, it flourished in trade and the like, resisting the Dutch invasion, the Aceh war.

DOC.Title: Aceh war
DOC.TEXT: War the Netherlands conquered the Kingdom of Aceh. The Netherlands suffered to suppress the guerrilla troops, mainly farmers.

DOC.Title: Combow morning, Araunpaya morning
DOC.TEXT: The last dynasty of Burma. It was a heyday in the 18th century, destroyed the Ayutthaya Morning in Thailand, and repulsed the Qing Army. After that, the morning went quietly. It was destroyed in the Burmese war with three Britons.

DOC.Title: Assam
DOC.TEXT: Northeast India. It was the beginning of the Burmese war that the Burmese army invaded this place at the beginning of the 19th century.

DOC.Title: Burma War, Myanmar War
DOC.TEXT: Three wars of the UK and the Compaun dynasty. In the first round Britain deprived India and Burma's border areas such as Arakan, and in the second round they joined the lower Burma. Since then Burma approached France, it destroyed Concounge Morning (Part 3).

DOC.Title: Burma consolidation, Myanmar consolidation
DOC.TEXT: As a result of the 3rd Burmese war, the UK destroyed Concounge Morning and annexed Burma to the Indian Empire.

DOC.Title: Penang
DOC.TEXT: Island in the western coast of the central Malay Peninsula. In 1786, East India Company made British territory and used it as a relay harbor.

DOC.Title: Singapore
DOC.TEXT: Island facing the southern end of the Malay Peninsula (Republic). In 1819, British colonial administrator Raffles bought from King Johor focusing on its importance, and built a new city. Became British territory in 1824, became the biggest base in the Southeast Asia region of the UK.

DOC.Title: Melaka, Muraka
DOC.TEXT: The port city on the southwest coast of the Malay Peninsula. It has grown through trading trade for a long time, the Kingdom of Islam was established, but it was occupied by Portugal in 1511 and the Netherlands in 1641. England occupied during the Napoleonic war, officially became the British territory in 1824.

DOC.Title: Straits colony
DOC.TEXT: A colony where Britain established Penang Island, Melaka, Singapore in 1826. In 1867 it became a direct jurisdiction of the home country.

DOC.Title: Malayan Union State, Malaya Commonwealth
DOC.TEXT: British protectorate formed in four southern states of the peninsula in 1895. Tin resources are abundant, and in the beginning of the 20th century it became a management site for rubber = branding.

DOC.Title: Overseas
DOC.TEXT: Immigrant from India (then British Indian Empire). Many are peasant farmers, low caste layer, Tamil people in southern India, and engaged in harsh labor in the Southeast Asia direction (especially in Malay's rubber farms and port labor in Singapore). Besides, there were many that went to Britain mainland, South Africa, Persian Gulf Coast, Ceylon Island, and others.

DOC.Title: Chinese overseas
DOC.TEXT: Immigrants from China (especially South). Many engaged in harsh labor in Southeast Asia (especially in Malaysian tin mines and Thai rice production areas). Later on, some of them will succeed at immigrants and participate in political and economic dominance, while also seeing the case of friction with the local residents, forming an Chinese culture that maintains their own ethnic culture It was done.

DOC.Title: North Borneo possession
DOC.TEXT: In 1888 the boundary was defined with the Netherlands and the northern part was the British territory.

DOC.Title: Mexican silver
DOC.TEXT: From the 16th century · Latin American silver coins Spain used for trade with Asia. Since the latter half of the 16th century, Manila was used as an intermediary ground for trade with China.

DOC.Title: Manila opening port
DOC.TEXT: In 1834, under the rule of Spain, Manila formally became a free port, prospering as a port of export such as Manila hemp, sugarcane, tobacco, etc. to Europe, in addition to relay trade between Latin America and China. As a result, the cultivation of these international products rapidly increased mainly in Luzon.

DOC.Title: Nishiyama Party's Ran, Tyson Party's Ran
DOC.TEXT: The rebellion that Nguyen Fumi made with two younger brothers, multiplied by the decline of Ding Dynasty. We occupied Yue, robbed Hanoi, built the Nishiyama morning.

DOC.Title: Nishiyama Morning
DOC.TEXT: Dynasty of Vietnam. The three brothers Nguyen Fumi and others destroyed the authorities Mr. Zheng and Ningi of Ding Dynasty and dominated the territory in three minutes. In 1802, it was destroyed by Nanbu Fortress.

DOC.Title: Nongfeng Fu, Feng Fu Feng, Yoshinobu
DOC.TEXT: The first Emperor of the Nguyen dynasty (rank 1802-20). In the late early morning of the Nanchu family, with the help of French Pinyo et al., In 1802 destroyed the Nishiyama morning, unified the whole of Vietnam, built the Nguyen Dynasty.

DOC.Title: Ochinikuni, Vietnam
DOC.TEXT: In 1802, the unified Nationwide Futoshi made the country name beyond. It was sealed by King Ochinikoku from Qing Dynasty in 1804 and became a tributary of Qing dynasty. The capital is Yue (acclimatization).

DOC.Title: Nguyen Dynasty
DOC.TEXT: The last dynasty in Vietnam. Although it was a religious country, it was stable, but it was invaded by France since 1858, and it was regarded as a protectorate of France in 83 to 84 years. It was annihilated in 1945 by Baidoi 's abdication.

DOC.Title: Pinyo
DOC.TEXT: French missionary. We gathered weapons and valiant soldiers to support Nanfu Fortress, and then crossed France, in 1787, established the French Yue defense alliance. However, the French Revolution occurred, there was no reinforcement from the French government, but Pinyo himself recruited mercenaries and paved the way for the formation of the Nguyen dynasty.

DOC.Title: Buddha Yue war
DOC.TEXT: Napoleon III co-dispatched Spain with the pretense of missionary persecution and occupied Saigon.

DOC.Title: Saigon Convention
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of the Buddha Yue war. In the Nguyen dynasty France approved the freedom of Christianity propagation, coachishina (Southern Vietnam) three eastern provinces and Saigon's census.

DOC.Title: Eastern coachishina acquired, Eastern part of France coachishina
Saigon
DOC.TEXT: Central city of Cochsina. Currently Ho Chi Minh City. It was occupied by the French Army in 1859 and was transferred to France under the treaty of 62 years.

DOC.Title: Protected country of Cambodia
DOC.TEXT: France consolidated Protection Treaty with King King of Cambodia to consolidate the control of Cochin Sina, and made Cambodia a protected country. Then it was incorporated into the Indochina Federation in 1887.

DOC.Title: Western of coachishina
DOC.TEXT: It was occupied by France in 1867, and completed the control of the whole coachishina.

DOC.Title: Black flag forces
DOC.TEXT: In the late nineteenth century, Chinese volunteers Liu Eifuku organized in Vietnam. In collaboration with the Nguyen dynasty, it resisted the invasion of France, and in the Qing and Buddhist war it became possible to french about the Qing Dynasty.

DOC.Title: Liu Yongfuki
DOC.TEXT: Qing Shi · Initial soldier of the Republic of China. Hello from Guangdong Province. After being a member of the People 's Chamber of Commerce and Industry, he was pursued by the Qing Army, drove to Vietnam, served the Nguyen Dynasty, and organized the black flag forces in 1867. In 1873-85, I felt it was a French army that invaded Vietnam. After returning to the country after the surrender of the Nguyen dynasty, he also returned to China, acted as an anti-Japanese movement in the Sino-Japanese War, an exclusion movement in the case of the Yoshika event, protesting against Japan's "request of 21 Kaju" during the First World War.

DOC.Title: Tonkin
DOC.TEXT: Area in the northern part of Vietnam. There are many fertile agricultural areas. It was occupied by the French Army twice in 1873 and 82 years.

DOC.Title: Annan
DOC.TEXT: Central region of Vietnam. It derives from the name of Angu Ann National Guard Office where the Tang drew. The French army occupied in 1883.

DOC.Title: Yue Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The one of 1883 was also called the Armanian Treaty from the name of the French ambassador to the French state, a temporary treaty with Vietnam as a protectorate of France. The ones in 1984 confirmed the contents of protection.

DOC.Title: Vietnam Protected Nationalization
DOC.TEXT: It was decided by the Yue Treaty of 1883, 84 years.

DOC.Title: religious rights
DOC.TEXT: Various authorities exercised by a religious country against a protected country. Contents vary from moment to moment, but in general, the religious nation holds the diplomatic and military rights of protecting countries, and often interferes with the internal affairs (legislative, judicial, administrative, tax collection, education, etc.).

DOC.Title: Qing-Buddha War
DOC.TEXT: Battle between France aimed at becoming a protectorate of Vietnam and Qing who claimed religious rights to Vietnam. The Tianjin treaty was concluded in the UK mediation as the French side fought and the French navy attacked the coast and so on continued its predominance.

DOC.Title: Tianjin Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of the Qing and Buddha war. Kiyoshi abandoned Vietnamese religious rights and approved the protection by French. It also accepted the French privilege in the southern provinces of Qing.

DOC.Title: Federal Indochina Federation
DOC.TEXT: A French colony formed in Cochsina, Annan, Tonkin, and Cambodia. Governor General is placed in Hanoi, and in 1899 Laos was added.

DOC.Title: Hanoi
DOC.TEXT: In the ancient capital of the right bank of the Songkoi River, the Governor General of France was set up.

DOC.Title: Luang Prabang Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: In Laos, the kingdom which was established after the division of Langsun Kingdom. The capital is Luang Prabang. Although it was tied to Thailand and Vietnam, the kingdom survived even after being regarded as a protected country of France in 1893.

DOC.Title: Lao to Federal Indochina Federation
DOC.TEXT: France put pressure on Thailand's Ratanakosin morning which had practically dominated Laos, converted Laos as a protectorate in 1893, and transferred to the Indochinese Federation in 1999.

DOC.Title: Rattanakosin morning, Chakri morning
DOC.TEXT: The present dynasty of Thailand. Although it received pressure from Britain and France since the middle of the nineteenth century, it kept independence as a cushioning zone of column forces. It became a constitutional monarchy by the revolution of 1932.

DOC.Title: Bangkok
DOC.TEXT: Ratanakosin Morning capital.

DOC.Title: Rama IV
DOC.TEXT: King Thai (ranking 1851-68). Externally, we took an equilibrium measure against both Britain and France, and concluded an unequal treaty that permits extraterritorial rights. In the domestic market, promoting China's trade with China, developing paddy fields in the Chao Phraya River Delta area, using the capital overseas capital, promoting fiscal expenditure by exporting rice, promoting western European modernization policy and maintaining independence did.

DOC.Title: Bowling Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Friendship and trade treaty between Thailand and the UK. The name of the treaty is derived from John Bowling, which was the full authority of the British side (Governor General of Hong Kong). An inequality treaty in which Thailand has granted extraterritorial rights and low tariffs on Britain. The following year signed the same treaty with France and the United States.

DOC.Title: Rama V, Chulalongkorn
DOC.TEXT: King Thai (ranking 1868 to 1910). Excellent western European knowledge, demonstrating strong leadership, promoted modernization of Thailand (such as abolition of the abduction regime, reform of the administration, judicial, military, educational system, etc.) and strive to maintain independence.

DOC.Title: Monoculture
DOC.TEXT: Agriculture carried out with a squeezing kind in specific export commodity crops such as tea, coffee, sugar cane, indigo and rubber.

DOC.Title: Township
DOC.TEXT: Those who do not appoint a candidate who has passed the examination and those who have experienced bureaucracy and have been in a hometown. Many people were from landlords and large merchants, and played a major role in politics and society as influential people in rural areas.

DOC.Title: Amenity Club
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary secret society since Qing Dynasty. It is also called Sansha party. Expanded from Taiwan, Fujian, Guangdong, "Reflection of Antimony", "Destroying Han" and so on, supported the revolutionary movement since the end of the 19th century.

DOC.Title: Young party
DOC.TEXT: A secret society that is said to be a faction of the Tianchikai. In response to "anti-reclamation", it spread from Sichuan to Hunan and Hubei in the end of Qing Dynasty, and in the Shang Revolution played a major role in collaboration with Sun Yat-sen.

DOC.Title: White Ransen's Ran
DOC.TEXT: A peasant rebellion centered on the religious association of the Maitrea Shimonoseki faith which occurred in the middle of Qing (early stage of Jia Kyeong). It spread to Henan, Hubei, Sichuan, Shaanxi and Gansu. For the crushing, because the village's village, Yong Yong, was more active than the regular army of the Yagami and Green Mission, the weakening of the Qing Dynasty was revealed.

DOC.Title: Tenri no Ran
DOC.TEXT: The revolt that Tenri pilgrims of Shiranism have made. I ran into the Forbidden City of Beijing but failed, and the rebellion in rural areas was suppressed in three months.

DOC.Title: Guangzhou
DOC.TEXT: Harbor City of the Three Rivers of the Pearl River in southern China. The tradition of foreign trade has long, but it has been regarded as the only trade port to Europe since 1757.

DOC.Title: public direction
DOC.TEXT: Union of patent merchants who had monopolized foreign trade in Guangzhou as Qing dynasty. It was also called Guangdong Xixiang.

DOC.Title: McCartney
DOC.TEXT: British politician and diplomat. In 1793 he was audited by Dr. Ryu at the hot river and asked for expansion of trade with China but failed unsuccessfully and returned to the country in 1994.

DOC.Title: Amherst
DOC.TEXT: British politician and diplomat. In 1816 I arrived in Beijing for trade improvement negotiations as negotiating, but because I rejected the Three Knee Riders' reward, I could not attend the party and returned to the country.

DOC.Title: Three knees tapping head
DOC.TEXT: Chinese ritual when confronting the emperor. Three times kneeling down, lowering the head three times until reaching the ground each time, lowering the total of nine times.

DOC.Title: Opium
DOC.TEXT: Narcotics made from poppy milk. Although it was known as an analgesic agent and the like from ancient times in China, it becomes a strong poisoning symptom by successive use. The custom of drinking was tough since the 18th century, but the Qing Dynasty was banned.

DOC.Title: Jardin-Matheson Company
DOC.TEXT: British trading company founded in Guangzhou in 1832. With the abolition of trade monopoly of East India Company, we are expanding hand in manufacturing industry, banking industry, construction industry etc., especially in shipping business, especially in opium smuggling, trade in tea · silk, the center of entry into Britain against China It was an existential existence. The Chinese name is Yiwa Yoko.

DOC.Title: Triangular trade, Asia triangular trade
DOC.TEXT: Trade between China, India and the UK mainland made by Britain from the end of the 18th century to the 19th century. The tea ceremony habit became popular in the UK since the 18th century, the amount of tea imported from China sharply increased, and the import was excessively exceeded, and silver flowed out unilaterally to China as a price. In order to rectify this, we established a triangular trade that carries opium from India to China, tea from China to Britain, and home cotton products to India. However, in the 1830 's, the amount of opium imports in China exceeded the exported amount of tea, and silver flowed out from China in reverse. As a result, in China, the silver price rose and the harmful poison of opium sucking spread.

DOC.Title: Abolition of Chinese trade exclusivity for East India Company, Abolition of Chinese Trade Exclusive Rights by British East India Company
DOC.TEXT: It was decided by the British Parliament in the trend of free tradeism in 1833 (it took effect from the following April 34). As a result, a large number of British trading firms embarked on foreign trade, opium inflows to China further increased drastically.

DOC.Title: Opium War
DOC.TEXT: Aggression war waged by Britain against the Qing which forcibly enforced crackdown on opium close trade. In 1839 against the enforcement of opium prohibition by Lin Zhenyu in 1839, Britain declared war with the purpose of breaking foreign diplomacy and trade and dispatched 40 expedition forces including 16 warships to China. British troops capture Xiamen · Ningbo etc., 42 in the fall of Shanghai Zhenjiang, approaching Nanjing, Qing surrendered and signed the Nanjing treaty.

DOC.Title: Michimoku
DOC.TEXT: Qing Dynasty 8th Emperor (ranking 1820 ~ 50). Senjong. In Japan domestic suffering from the revolt caused by social unrest, suffered defeated by the Opium War against the outside, forced the European countries to open the country.

DOC.Title: Norinori Hayashi
DOC.TEXT: Kiyofu's politician. In 1838 he asserted opium prohibition and was appointed Minister of Ginza. In 1839 he took office in Guangzhou, forcibly forfeited or discarded opium, punished the Chinese closely traders, blocked the UK commercial district. When the Ahn war broke out, it was dismissed in the Qing Dynasty, which was shaken by the hard-line measures of the British side, and was further expelled to Ily province. After that, it was forgiven, and served as the governor of the province.

DOC.Title: Minister Kinney
DOC.TEXT: A senior official appointed temporarily for Qing dynasty. Emperor gives authority directly, to suppress specific troubles, such as suppressing civil war and negotiating with foreign affairs.

DOC.Title: Hakuzentai
DOC.TEXT: During the opium war, an armed organization organized by residents of rural areas. In May 1841, immediately after the Qing Army surrendered in Guangdong, residents of Sam Yuan river in the North Suburbs of Guangzhou organized, attacked the British army. People's anti-British struggle against the defeat of the Qing Army and the domineering of the British invasion forces had a major impact on the subsequent ethnic movements.

DOC.Title: Nanjing Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of the opium war signed in Nanjing. Jiangning is also called a treaty. (1) Opening five ports of Guangzhou, Fuzhou, Xiamen, Ningbo, Shanghai, (2) abolition of public offering, (3) Hong Kong's credit transfer, (4) confiscation of opium for confiscation of 6 million, reparation military expenses 12 million Both payments, (5) agreement on tariffs, (6) principle of equal diplomacy etc. We did not mention the opium trade caused by war, and after that opium smuggling continued. It was the pioneer of the unequal treaty against Qing.

DOC.Title: Gokang (Five mouth) commerce process
DOC.TEXT: Signed between UK and Qing. Qing admitted consular jurisdiction in the UK.

DOC.Title: Torge Godzilla Additional Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Additional Treaty of Nanjing Treaty signed in Tora Gate Jiu of Guangzhou. (1) import and export tax rate, (2) unilateral most-favored nation treatment, and (3) granting of land lease and residence right at the opening port (development to the concession).

DOC.Title: Treaty of Nozomi
DOC.TEXT: Kiyoshi and the American Friendship and Commerce Treaty concluded at a wish in the suburbs of Macao. Nearly the same as Nanjing Treaty, including MFN treatment and consular jurisdiction.

DOC.Title: Kuropu Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Treaty of Friendship and Friendship between the Qing and French, which was signed in Huangpu on the outskirts of Guangzhou. It was almost the same content as both Nanjing and Nanyi Treaty.

DOC.Title: Inequality Treaty
DOC.TEXT: A treaty unfavorable to one of the signatory countries. After the Treaty of Nanjing China was allowed to recognize many unequal treaties with foreign countries.

DOC.Title: MFN treatment
DOC.TEXT: An agreement that one of the signatory countries signs a privilege to a third country automatically in the future if it also gives the same privilege to the original treaty country. Kiyoshi acknowledged to Britain for the first time in Huangmen Jiao Treaty.

DOC.Title: Extraterritorial Rights
DOC.TEXT: A person who resides in a foreign country is not bound by jurisdiction of the country in which he lives.

DOC.Title: Consular Jurisdiction
DOC.TEXT: To have jurisdiction over the foreign criminal by the official of the offender of the criminal. In China, it was first recognized in the UK by the Five Port (five mouth) trade course after the Nanjing treaty.

DOC.Title: Loss of customs autonomy
DOC.TEXT: Originally, the state has the right to voluntarily determine the customs duties of its own country (customs duty self-right), but in the developed countries and colonies the agreement of the rate was forced from the other country in some cases. Kiyoshi gave the U.S. Treaty of Tariff Agreement in Nanjing Treaty, and the customs duty excluding tea was uniformly 5% in the Tora Gateja Addendum Treaty, and lost tariff autocracy. China suffered from this abolition until the age of the Republic of China and has been eliminated from 1928 to 30 years.

DOC.Title: Concession
DOC.TEXT: After Nanjing treaty, foreign settlement established at opening port. UK established for the first time in Shanghai in 1845. The extraterritoriality brought the province of China out of reach of the executive power of China.

DOC.Title: Wei source
DOC.TEXT: Scholar and politician of Qing dynasty. A sutra who advocated academics useful for actual politics. When the Opium War broke out, at the request of Xuzu Hayashi, he wrote "Geographical Book of the Sea" which is the world geographical document incorporating the latest knowledge of the time, and was also read in Japan at the end of the Edo era.

DOC.Title: Arrow case
DOC.TEXT: A case in which a Chinese sailor was arrested after being charged with allegations of pirates in the official constitution of the Qing Dynasty while the Arrow of a small sailing ship of the UK flag fired at the outside of the port of Guangzhou. In this time Britain insisted that the British flag was insulted and caused Arrow war with this case as an excuse.

DOC.Title: French missionary murder case
DOC.TEXT: A case where a French missionary in Guangxi province was killed by a local authority of Qing. Napoleon III made this an excuse for the war.

DOC.Title: Arrow War
DOC.TEXT: Invasion war to China by Britain · France. After the Nanjing treaty, the export of products did not grow as much as expected, and the UK, which had been seeking further expansion of the market, shook the arrogance interference as a pretext by the Arrow issue, and at that time, France, who was protesting to Qing by the missionary killing case We co-dispatched. When the British and French troops occupied Guangzhou in 1858, and went north to approach Tianjin, Qing suffered and concluded the Tianjin Treaty. However, in the year 59 armed conflict occurred in the case of Qing shooting against UK-France ratification mission, British and French troops occupied Beijing in 1960, Qing Dynasty surrendered and signed the Beijing Treaty.

DOC.Title: Second Opium War
DOC.TEXT: Another name for Arrow War.

DOC.Title: Tianjin Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Treaty concluded between the United Kingdom, France, America, Russia and Qing in Tianjin during the Arrow War in 1858. (1) Foreign Minister Representation in Beijing, (2) Christianity Missionary Nation, (3) Freedom of Travel in Foreign Chinese Inner Land, (4) Increase in Opening Port and Trade Freedom, (5) UK Mainly including payment of a total of 6 million reparations to France. The opposition of the Qing Dynasty was strong-In 1859, the British and French envoys of the ratification exchange were bombarded by the Great Powers, the two countries again sent the expedition army, and the battle resumed.

DOC.Title: Destruction of Yumenako
DOC.TEXT: It was plundered and destroyed by British and French Army occupying Beijing.

DOC.Title: Beijing Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of Arrow war. The ratification and exchange of the Tianjin Treaty and the establishment of (1) opening of Tianjin, (2) increase of reparation to 8 million, (3) transferring south of Kowloon Peninsula to the UK.

DOC.Title: Increase of port opening point
DOC.TEXT: In the Tianjin Treaty, there were six ports of Buzhou, Climb, Freshwater, Tainan, Chaozhou, and Qingshu, as well as four ports of Zhenjiang, Hanro, Jiujiang and Nanjing, Tianjin in the Beijing Treaty and 11 ports.

DOC.Title: Freedom of inland travel of foreigners
Prime Minister's office worker, Prime Minister Gate
DOC.TEXT: The first diplomatic office agency in Qing Dynasty established in Beijing in 1861. It is also called a general department. The first chief is Kyoto Prince.

DOC.Title: Heilongjiang, Amur river
DOC.TEXT: A big river that bounds East Siberia and the northeastern region of China, flows north and pours into the Sea of ​​Okhotsk.

DOC.Title: Treaty of Nerchinsk
DOC.TEXT: The border treaty tied between Kangxi of Qing and Peter I of Russia. The Argun River and the Stanovoy Mountain Range (Xinghai Anling) were the border between the two countries. It is the first equal treaty between Qing and European countries, but the circumstances and contents of the conclusion were favorable to the Qing Dynasty side.

DOC.Title: Kafta convention
DOC.TEXT: Treaty concluded between Qing and Russia with a town caution built in the south of Lake Baikal. The border between Mongolia and Siberia was established, mutual delivery of the fugitives, the way of trade between the two countries was negotiated.

DOC.Title: Laxman
DOC.TEXT: Russian soldier. First visit to Japan. In 1792 he entered Japanese drifting people, arrived at Nemuro with Nativity of Emperor Ekachelina II and asked for trade, but he returned home after being refused.

DOC.Title: Eastern Siberian Governor
DOC.TEXT: In 1847 the Russian emperor Nikolai I established. Granted governance and diplomatic rights, he endeavored to expand the Russian territory.

DOC.Title: Muravyov
DOC.TEXT: Russian politician. In 1847, as Prime Minister of Eastern Siberia, occupied the Amur River region with military force. He played an active part in negotiations between Aigun and Beijing Treaty and promoted the expansion of the territory of Russia.

DOC.Title: Aigun Treaty, Aibout Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Border treaty between Russia and Qing Russia tied with Arrow war. Heilongjiang is the border, Russia owns the northern part of Heilongjiang, and the eastern part of the Usry (Primorsky region) is joint management of the two countries.

DOC.Title: Beijing Treaty, Russo-Qing Beijing Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The treaty that stipulates that Russia will acquire the east of the Ussur River, etc. as a compensation for arbitrating the Qing Dynasty and the peace treats of Britain and France (Beijing Treaty) in the Arrow War. The current border between China and Russia in this direction was demarcated.

DOC.Title: Primorsky region, Eastern river east
DOC.TEXT: An area facing the Sea of ​​Japan in the southeastern part of Siberia.

DOC.Title: Vladivostok
DOC.TEXT: Construction started by Muravyov in 1860 The port city of Primoryeo. It faced the Sea of ​​Japan and became the base of the Russian Far East.

DOC.Title: Japan-Russia parent-child treaty
DOC.TEXT: The treaty between the Tokugawa shogunate in Japan and Russia. The Kurila region was set as a Japanese clan south of the Kuril islands, but no border was set for the Sakhalin Islands. In addition, the opening of Hakodate / Shimoda / Nagasaki for refilling firewood was also decided.

DOC.Title: Sakhalin-Kuril Exchange Treaty
DOC.TEXT: In 1875 (Meiji 8), the treaty established between the Meiji government of Japan and Russia. The Russian territory of Sakhala island, the Russian territory north of Urupp the Chishima archipelago is the Japanese territory.

DOC.Title: Sakhalin, Sakhalin
DOC.TEXT: Island located north of Hokkaido. Dutch in the 17th century, British and French in the 18th century, Russian people and Mamiya Forestry in Japan explored in early 19th century. It became the Russian territory with the Sakhala-Chikushima Exchange Treaty of 1875.

DOC.Title: Uruppu Island, Akashima Island
DOC.TEXT: Island in the middle of the Kuril Islands. This north was Russian territory, but the whole Kuril Islands became the Japanese territory at the Sakhalin-Kurile Exchange Treaty of 1875.

DOC.Title: Treaty of Turkey Mancher
DOC.TEXT: The 2 nd peace treaty of Iran = Russian war. Russia won most of Armenia and allowed extraterritorial authority.

DOC.Title: Bukhara-Han County, Bojara-Han Country
DOC.TEXT: In the mid-nineteenth century, it was defeated by Russia aiming for advancement to Central Asia and it was regarded as a protectorate of Russia in 1868.

DOC.Title: Hiva-Han country
DOC.TEXT: In the mid-nineteenth century, it was defeated by Russia aiming for advancement to Central Asia, it was regarded as a protectorate of Russia in 1873.

DOC.Title: Ko Kando = Han Country
DOC.TEXT: In the mid-nineteenth century, lost to Russia aiming to advance to Central Asia, it was annexed to Russia in 1876.

DOC.Title: Yakub = Bek
DOC.TEXT: Ko Khando = General of the Han kingdom. In 1865, he was independent in Central Asia and built Kashgar-Han country. While maintaining independence by utilizing the midway between the Russian and British forces, it is reported that it was killed by lefteous Muneeto of Qing and committed suicide.

DOC.Title: Ili incident
DOC.TEXT: Case that Russia occupied the Ily province of Central Asia in Xinjiang West North, multiplied by the Muslim rebels after 1862. The conflict occurred with Qing and negotiations continued since 1978.

DOC.Title: Ili Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The treaty which Russia · Qing concluded in Petersburg on Ili conflict. A part of Ili province was returned to the Qing Dynasty, but Russia was given a trade interest.

DOC.Title: Taipingi national disturbance
DOC.TEXT: The biggest rebellion in China's modern history that occurred in Guangxi at the end of Qing. After the Nanjing treaty, tax increases and soaring silver prices increased the tax burden of poor farmers and the economic change due to the port opening resulted in an increase in unemployed people. In 1851 he was soldiers at the Kaneda village of Guangxi Province with leadership of Hongu Xiang in the upper Tei, and built Taiping Heaven. After that, he advanced to Hunan and Hubei, added poor farmers and refugees, robbed Wusho in 53 years, capitalized Nanjing, renamed it the capital city. In addition, although one party advanced woodward cutting, another party controlled the Chinese, but weakened by inadequacy of change and inner conflict, suppressed by village who stood on the Qing Dynasty side and a volunteer commanded by a foreigner etc. It was. This movement had a nationalistic and revolutionary character and had a great influence on the Chinese ethnic movements and revolutionary movement since then.

DOC.Title: Hakka
DOC.TEXT: The meaning of "stranger" to the mainland. People who moved to mountains in Guangdong, Guangxi, Jiangxi and Fujian during the 4th to the 12th centuries. Many were engaged in peasants, charcoal grills, woodcuts, mining labor, transportation labor but were subject to discrimination and pressure, and many were migrant workers and immigrants to overseas.

DOC.Title: Top Imperial Society, Worship Society
DOC.TEXT: A Christian religious association organized in Guilin province in Guangxi Province centering on Hong Kong. Emperor means Yahweh. We gained many believers among Hakka and poor farmers because they claimed equality.

DOC.Title: Hong Hondo
DOC.TEXT: Taihei Heaven's leader. Hello from Guangdong Flower County. After failing several times in the examination, he touched on Christianity and organized the Imperial Diet. In January 1851, he soldiers in Kaneda village, built Taiping Heaven and called Tenno. In addition, in 1953 Nanjing was renamed the capital, renamed Nanjing to be the capital, but after 56 years the internal conflict intensified and the defeat was repeated, and the disease died just before the fall of the capital in 64 years (there is also the theory of suicide).

DOC.Title: Kaneda Village
DOC.TEXT: One small village in the current Guangxi Self-Governing District of Guiping County. In January, 1851, Hong Huihui was a leader, and the followers of the upper Imperial party sailed.

DOC.Title: Emperor Xianfeng
DOC.TEXT: Qing Dynasty Ninth Emperor (ranking 1850-61). He suffered from the Taiping Heaven · Arrow War, fled to the hot river during the invasion of the British and French Allied forces in Beijing, and died of the disease in that place.

DOC.Title: Taiping Heaven
DOC.TEXT: The country name of the country built by the rebel army with the leadership of Hong Hong. After 1853 Nanjing became the capital, and Hong Kong was the Tenpyo. "Declining Hing Han", denying Confucianism and traditional order, raising equality of land based on equality, gender equality and so on.

DOC.Title: Ameno
DOC.TEXT: Capital city of Taihei Heaven. In 1853 Taihei Heaven Army occupied Nanjing and was renamed. It fell in the year 64.

DOC.Title: "Rinko Cheung Han"
DOC.TEXT: The nationalist slogan raised by Taihei Heaven. As well as "anti-civil reconstruction" and the like, to defeat the Qing Dynasty ruling the Manchurian tribe, to revive the Han tribe state.

DOC.Title: Heavenly Asada Ridge System
DOC.TEXT: Land system and social organization which Taihei Heaven launched after the occupation of Nanking in 1853. We allocate the land equally even without gender, create a village organization, have mutual aid function, set military organization and living together based on religious norms, etc. It could not be implemented.

DOC.Title: abolition of hair products
DOC.TEXT: The hairstyle forced by the Qing Dynasty by the Manzhi people 's hairstyle, Taihei Heaven has been abolished and long hair has been made.

DOC.Title: long-haired brutal, hair ridge
DOC.TEXT: The designation of the Qing Dynasty side against the long-haired Taihei Heaven Army who refused hair.

DOC.Title: abolition of summary foot
DOC.TEXT: Beginning legs are bent inwards of the toes of the young girls, tied up with cloths, and called small feet that caused growth to stop, also called bow legs. It was told that it started in the fifth generation, and it was popular in the former · Ming · Qing dynasty. Taihei Heaven deprived it of women's freedom and forbidden it as a custom to subordinate to men.

DOC.Title: Confederate
DOC.TEXT: Farmers' Rebel Army, which was active mainly in the northern areas of the Yangtze River, such as Henan, Anhui, Shandong, Jiangsu and so on at almost the same time as Taiping Heaven. "Turn" is the meaning of a group. In response to Taihei Heaven, it developed rebellion activities in various places, but was suppressed in 1868.

DOC.Title: Lodging
DOC.TEXT: Voluntary army where local bureaucrats and villagers recruited for Qing Dynasty. The purpose was to compensate for the decline in the strength of the regular army 's eight flags and green mans. He played an active part in suppressing the White Lotus chaos and the Taiheiweaki Ran.

DOC.Title: Xiang, Yong Yong
DOC.TEXT: For Taiping paradise flattered, in 1853 the great clan organized in Xiangxi County, Hunan Province in the hometown. We organized the farmers as soldiers with executives of the same town. It became the main force of the Taiping paradise troops crushing, and in the year 64 he cheated on Amakyo.

DOC.Title: Sogoku clan
DOC.TEXT: Kiyofu's politician. During his homecoming to Hunan, he organized the Royal Army of Taihei Heaven. He served as Governor-General of the Ryuko, Director General Naoto Kuni and Cabinet University, and became the center of the official movement.

DOC.Title: Hua Wei, Huai Yong
DOC.TEXT: Lee Hong Kwang is the village that he organized in Hefei County, Anhui Province in 1862 when he was the lord of the great clan. He played an active part in suppressing Taiping Heaven · Army and became the power base of Lee Hong-ho afterwards.

DOC.Title: Li Konchi
DOC.TEXT: Kiyofu's politician. Organized the Hua military in Anhui Province under the living of the great clan, suppressed the Taiping paradise troops and the military. He served as Governor-General of the Ryuko, Director General Naoto Kan, and a Cabinet College Division, promoting the Occupation Movement and taking charge of domestic affairs and diplomacy as the best-performing person.

DOC.Title: Choukin Army
DOC.TEXT: A Chinese army commanded by Westerners who was active in the flattening of Taiping Heaven Army. American ward started in 1860 and organized a foreign warrior's wielding squadron in Shanghai. In the next year I broke up and organized the new Chinese troops and got western style training. 1862 After Ward died in the war, in 1983 the British soldier Gordon commanded. After active in the fight against Taiping Heaven Army, it was dissolved for 64 years.

DOC.Title: Ward
DOC.TEXT: An American sailor. In Shanghai in 1860 he organized foreign troops to repel Taiping paradise troops, and in 1961 they organized the Chinese to create the Championship Army. He was killed in battle with the Taihei Heaven Army.

DOC.Title: Gordon
DOC.TEXT: British soldier. In Arrow war, I participated in the grilling of the garden during the capture of Beijing. After the battle of Ward, he commanded the Changbuk Army from 1863, he worked with Lee Kun-Ho and actively suppressed Taiping Heaven Army. After that, he was sentenced to murderous suppression of Muddy of Sudan and killed in the battle.

DOC.Title: Kyoto Parent
DOC.TEXT: The name is Ein. Younger brother of Xianfeng. He served as a senior official such as Prime Minister Komon and served as a high-ranking political station as a powerful person in the late Qing Dynasty, alongside Nishi-Taito, assisting the emperor.

DOC.Title: The same emperor, Shukudo
DOC.TEXT: Qing Dynasties Tenth Emperor (ranking 1861-75). A child of Emperor Xianfeng. After the Arrow War / Taiheiyo national turbulence, it reached a superficial stable term called "the mediation of the same ruler", but the real power of politics was grasped by the mother in the West.

DOC.Title: Nishiuchi
DOC.TEXT: Emperor 's mother in the side room of Xianfeng emperor. Tying with Parent Yu to grasp the power of politics · After the death of the Emperor, the emperor of the nephew was set up and embattled himself as a regent himself.

DOC.Title: "Zhongxing's mediation"
DOC.TEXT: The name of the reign of the same emperor (1861-75) was due to the superficial internal stability and diplomatic stability period. It was a time when the Taipinghua national turbulence and military disturbance were flattened and the Okinawa movement by the Han Chinese officials was promoted.

DOC.Title: Official movement
DOC.TEXT: It is a modernization movement that tried to put up the wealth militia by introducing Western military technology, which was developed around 1860. Promoted mainly by the Han dynasty clan, Hon Kun-chan and Shozo Hozong of the Han Chinese bureaucratic who played a major role in the flattening of the Taipinghua disaster, mining development, railroad laying, establishment of various factories, etc. were carried out from the establishment of weapons factory and navy. However, based on the spirit of "Medium-West", because of avoiding political reform and beginning to imitate the surface of Western modern technology, the defeat of the Qing and Buddha War, the Nikki War, and its limit became clear It was.

DOC.Title: Western school faction
DOC.TEXT: Han Chinese high-level bureaucrats group such as Sogoku clan, Li Hongzhou, Shochūta and others who promoted the official movement.

DOC.Title: "Middle body West"
DOC.TEXT: Basic spirit of advancing the official movement. Based on the traditional Chinese academic centered on Confucianism, the idea of ​​using Western academic skills.

DOC.Title: Left sect
DOC.TEXT: Kiyofu's politician. He was active in suppressing the Taiping Heaven Army under the great clan. He became the governor of Zhuzhi and made a shipyard in Fuzhou, and pioneered the movement of foreign affairs. After that, became Governor of the Shaolin, suppressed the disturbance of Islamic scholars, then recovered Xinjiang, also involved in the case of Ili, a border dispute with Russia. In the Qing and Buddha war, he became commander of the Qing Army, but he died shortly after the war.

DOC.Title: "Netherlandian Style Guide"
DOC.TEXT: A report on overseas affairs submitted to the shogunate by the Dutch Commerce Director's Nagasaki Magistrate every time a Dutch vessel enters the port every year.

DOC.Title: "Tang Story Book", "Chinese Style Guide"
DOC.TEXT: A report that Nagasaki Magome issued to the shogunate the information obtained from the Qing merchant ship entering every year. Along with the "Netherlandian Story Book", it helped the shogunate collect overseas information.

DOC.Title: Perry
DOC.TEXT: Commander of the East India Fleet in the US Navy General. I arrived in Uraga in 1853 and requested opening the country. The following year, I reached again and signed a treaty between Japan and the United States.

DOC.Title: Japan-US Parent Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The opening treaty between the Edo shogunate and the United States. It is also called the Kanagawa Convention. By admitting the opening of ports of Shimoda / Hakodate 2 ports and most favored nation treatment, the isolation system since the 17th century has collapsed.

DOC.Title: Japan-US Cooperation Agreement on Treaties
DOC.TEXT: An inequality treaty tied between the US Consul General Harris and the Edo shogunate. Addition of opening ports of Kanagawa, Hyogo, Niigata and Nagasaki, principle of free trade, approval of consular jurisdiction, abandonment of customs duties. Japan signed a similar treaty with the Netherlands, Russia, the UK and France (Ansei Five Countries Treaty).

DOC.Title: Harris
DOC.TEXT: He came to Japan as an American Consul-General in 1856, and in 1983 signed the Japan-US Friendship and Commerce Treaty with the Shogunate.

DOC.Title: Great Government Referee
DOC.TEXT: In 1867, the general Shogun Tokugawa Yoshinori returned the administration to the court in the midst of intensification of the theory of Hyeosu 攘 や and the ceremonial movement.

DOC.Title: Meiji Restoration
DOC.TEXT: Variations promoted by the Meiji new administration which the Edo shogunate collapsed and was established in 1868. The title system of the shogunate was dismantled, aiming at the centralization system centered on the Emperor and the construction of a modern state centered on the capitalist regime.

DOC.Title: Nissin Ryo Bunko
DOC.TEXT: Treaty establishing formal diplomatic relations between Nissin and Nissin. The attribution of the Ryukyus belonged to unresolved issues.

DOC.Title: Ryukyu
DOC.TEXT: Another name for Okinawa. In the beginning of the 15th century Mr. Tadashi Sanno unified, active in relay trade by talking to Ming and Qing. Since invading Mr. Shimazu of Satsuma at the beginning of the 17th century, both belonged to Japan and China, but in 1871 Japan merged into Kagoshima prefecture and in 1979 it took independence as Okinawa Prefecture (Ryukyu disposition).

DOC.Title: Taiwan Soldier
DOC.TEXT: A case where Japanese troops dispatched soldiers as Ryukyus who were drifted in Taiwan were murdered by indigenous people in Taiwan. Utilizing this, Japan opened the way to dominate Taiwan.

DOC.Title: Sakhalin-Kuril Exchange Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Convention between Japan and Russia, which established that Japan owns all of the Kuril Islands and Russia owns Karafuto Islands respectively.

DOC.Title: Liberal Democratic Movement
DOC.TEXT: A political campaign seeking democratization against the tyranny of politics of the Meiji government. Originated from the Construction White Book established in 1874 by the Democratic People's Politicians, it began full-fledged as a political movement after the Southwest War of 1977. In 1881 promised the opening of the Diet after ten years.

DOC.Title: Empire of the Japan Imperial Constitution
DOC.TEXT: Constitution launched in 1889 and enforced until 1947. It is also called the Meiji Constitution. The Constitution of Germany was the paradigm of the Constitution, which admitted the emperor a mighty power.

DOC.Title: opening Diet
DOC.TEXT: In 1890 the first Imperial Assembly opened. Although it was only a bicameral system of the House of Representatives (election) and the House of Peers (composed of the privileged layer), the role of the Emperor was strong, so its role remained at the sponsoring institution.

DOC.Title: The turbulent coming disturbance
DOC.TEXT: The revolt that took place in the late Joseon Dynasty. Hong Seon (1779-1812) who was a fallen group of Heian Way, the northwestern part of North Korea, guided the criminal bureaucracy and poverty farmers, and was sentenced to death in Jeju in December 1811, but it was suppressed in half a year.

DOC.Title: Ganghwa Island Case
DOC.TEXT: A case where the Japanese warships under exercise on the Korean coast plunder landings as a pretext that the Korean army was bombarded near Ganghwa Island. As a result, the Japan-Korea Cooperation Treaty was signed and Korea was opened.

DOC.Title: Japan-Korea Friendship Rule, Kanjiwa Island Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Treaty of inequality concluded with Ganghwa Island Incident. (1) independent independence of Korea, (2) port opening of 3 ports including Busan, (3) establishment of Japanese consulate, consular office, and (4) consular jurisdiction of Japanese.

DOC.Title: 3 port open port
DOC.TEXT: Busan and other 2 ports (later determined as Motoyama and Incheon) were decided to open.

DOC.Title: Takaji
DOC.TEXT: King of the 26th King of the Joseon Dynasty (ranking 1863-1907). For ten years after the throne the father 's ryugaku became regent, after which the minister, Queen' s family, came to power. It was tormented by the pressure of Japan, suffering from the conflict between Japan and the Sino, Japanese aggression and interference.

DOC.Title: Great House
DOC.TEXT: Father of Kojong. My real name is Lee. The honorable title is the title given to those who are the king's father and are not a throne. Grasping power as regent of Kojong, promoted domestic reform and isolation policies. In 1873, due to the rise of Mr. Minami temporarily passed. After that, he took over the minor faction by multiplying the Imperial Army of 82 years, but failed and intervene in the intervention of the Qing Dynasty. After the Sino-Japanese War, he grabbed the government with Japanese aid, but soon retired with the rise of the father-in-law.

DOC.Title: 午 日 戦 乱
DOC.TEXT: Military rebellion that occurred in Han Castle (present Seoul). For the minor faction, the army armed forces murdered key persons and Japanese of the minor group and burnt the Japanese embassy. Although the Nissin two countries dispatched, the Japanese forces retreated because Qing caught the crown captain, assisted the minor faction, and raised the initiative in Korea.

DOC.Title: Min.
DOC.TEXT: Clan of Takajin 's wife Minji. In 1873 I retired from the high court and controlled the administration. Initially I approached Japan and tied with Qing by the 1882 Imperial Army turbulence. Afterwards, it was pursued by the administration by Japan, but after the interference of the three countries, it approached Russia and regained power. In 1895, Mr. Minji was assassinated in the court due to the Japanese conspiracy plot (Murder slayer case).

DOC.Title: Great Party
DOC.TEXT: Designation from the Kaizen school against the conservative faction of the minister center who relied on the Qing Dynasty to maintain the administration.

DOC.Title: Evolutionist, Independent Party
DOC.TEXT: Groove who tried to establish independence and modernization from Qing Dynasty against Japan by opposing the Great Party after the 1882 Imperial Army Turbulence. Kim Dae-woo · Park Kwon-doki and others led the way, failed to make a political change in 1984, but failed. In the Sino-Japanese War, I participated in the govern-ment day regime, but I was pursued by my father politicians in 1995, after Japan's petty killing case of the same year I was puppet.

DOC.Title: Kotama Yuki
DOC.TEXT: Evolutionary leaders. Following Japan, with the aim of reforming the Korea, he made an apology change in 1884, but failed and exiled to Japan as a failure. It was later assassinated in Shanghai.

DOC.Title: Kodokaji
DOC.TEXT: The political change that the Korean evangelists made in Han Castle. On the defeat of Qing Dynasty during the Qing and Buddha War, the evangelists took force of Japan to overthrow the Minister regime to build a new administration, but failed due to the intervention of the Qing Army. After that, Nissin won the situation with the Tianjin treaty once.

DOC.Title: Tianjin Treaty, Japan-Qing Tianjin Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Treaty concluded between the Sino-Japanese in relation to the processing of the Taxation Policy. Contents of the withdrawal of the bilateral forces from Korea, inquiries in advance for future dispatch, etc.

DOC.Title: Ding Wang
DOC.TEXT: Joseon dynasty thinker. Together with his older brother (Ding-kyung), he was devoted to Western studies (religion and thought centered on European Christianity), his brother was executed, himself was subjected to 18 years of exile. After that he devoted himself to writing, criticizing the corruption of the Joseon Dynasty, and left a work of Keigaku Kagaku.

DOC.Title: Choi Kao
DOC.TEXT: A philosopher born from both the falling group of the late Joseon Dynasty. Because it was religious (thought) called Eastern College around 1860 and it spread to people, it was caught as a "misleader" by the government and executed.

DOC.Title: Eastern University
DOC.TEXT: New Religion Founded by Choi Kaewon around 1860 in the Late Joseon Dynasty. In the meaning of Eastern studies for Western studies, it originated from the traditional folk beliefs, including Confucius, Buddha, and Road three teachers. Under the pressure of the aggression of the West, the Japanese invasion and the Korean dynasty, it spread rapidly among people who are upset by social unrest.

DOC.Title: All levels
DOC.TEXT: Regional leaders in East Asia. Leader of the Taiwan Peasant War. Armied mainly on the organization of Eastern College, expanded the rebellion (Taiwan peasant war) to various places, but was captured by the Japanese army and executed.

DOC.Title: Taiwan Peasant War, East School Party's Ran
DOC.TEXT: Farmers' rebellion centered on Eastern Studies, who occurred in the late Joseon Dynasty. Uprising in Jeolla-do as a leader of all the best scoring. When Korea requested the dispatch of the Qing Army, Japan also dispatched to protect the residents and excelled in the Nikki war.

DOC.Title: Sino-Japanese war
DOC.TEXT: The war between Japan and the Soviet Union over Korean rule. Both countries began soldiers and warfare with the Komal farmer war, but the Japanese army overwhelmed the Qing Army in the land and sea. After the war, Japan advanced the amendment of the inequality treaty that had been connected with Western countries, walking as a member of the imperialist power, but the defeated Qing became the invasion of the strong power.

DOC.Title: Shimonoseki Convention
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of the Sino-Japanese War. It is Hirofumi Ito, the plenipotentiary of Japan, Lee Hong-ho of Ching dynasty. (1) complete independence of Korea (abandonment of interference rights of Kiyoshi), (2) censure to Liaodong Peninsula, Taiwan, Penghu Islands to Japan, (3) payment of 200 million of compensation for Japan, (4) The above privilege approval, and (5) the establishment of a company at the opening port.

DOC.Title: Korean independence
DOC.TEXT: Qing promised non-interference with Korea.

DOC.Title: Three country interference
DOC.TEXT: A case where Russia opposing the acquisition of the Liaodong Peninsula by Japan by Shimonoseki Treaty forced Russia to return to Japan by asking Germany / France. Japan succumbed and returned 30 million yen to Qing at the price.

DOC.Title: Imperialism
DOC.TEXT: It is the movement that the power of Europe and the United States raced competition to expand armaments from the end of the nineteenth century (around 1870 to 1990) to the era of World War I, and divided the world into their own colonies and influential spheres. As a background to this, (1) the strong power that entered the monopolistic capitalist stage, as well as the market of the raw material supply site and the product until then, as well as overseas colonies as the destination of surplus capital, (Re-division) was further advanced, (2) the government that was pressed for the necessity to acquire funds such as social policy to cope with the increasing labor movement and socialist movement, expanded colonies etc. , The theory that it tried to apply the profit gained through its control (social imperialism), and so on. In the imperialist power stance, when anti-imperialism / nationalism movements were developed in areas divided into colonies and power ranges, there were cases where they collaborated and oppressed, but rather, As the conflict over the world division was intensified and trying to settle with military power, a large-scale war like the Russo-Japanese War and the First World War broke out.

DOC.Title: "Global Policy"
DOC.TEXT: Foreign policy that imperialist countries intend to advance politically, economically and militarily, with the primary purpose of acquiring colonies and power spheres. As a result, the confrontation between the imperialists fought deeply, and the fierce resistance movement of the local people opposing colonial rule occurred. It may also refer to the imperialist policy promoted by Wilhelm II of Germany in particular.

DOC.Title: Secondary Industrial Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Technological innovation that began to use electricity and oil as a new power source, mainly for heavy chemical industry, against the primary industrial revolution that mainly uses light industry and steam power / coal as a power source. As Germany and the United States followed in particular, the UK leading the first industrial revolution and called the "factory of the world" fell from that position.

DOC.Title: Heavy Chemistry Industry
DOC.TEXT: Generic name for heavy industry and chemical industry. It developed rapidly since the late nineteenth century. Huge capital was required for industrialization of heavy and chemical industries, which led to the concentration and monopoly of companies such as cartel, trust, and consultants.

DOC.Title: Electrical machinery industry
DOC.TEXT: With the discovery of the electromagnetic induction action of Faraday in 1831 (the principle of the motor) and the invention of the generator by Siemens of 66 years, since the 1970s, electricity has been used as new energy for factory power, chemical industry, transportation, communication, home etc. He advanced to all sectors.

DOC.Title: Company concentration / monopoly
DOC.TEXT: The company creates mechanisms such as cartel, cindikate, trust, consult, etc., and dominates the market exclusively.

DOC.Title: Cartel
DOC.TEXT: Cartel. A company in the same industry refers to a mechanism that monopolizes the market by mutually agreeing prices, production volume, sales channels, etc. while maintaining independence. In addition, companies that create joint sales organizations, so as to more firmly protect agreements such as prices, production volume, sales channels, etc. are called syndicate.

DOC.Title: Trust
DOC.TEXT: Corporate joint. It is a mechanism by which companies in the same industry are absorbed and merged under the influential capital and monopolize the market. Developed in the United States, especially the standard oil trust is famous.

DOC.Title: Conciern
DOC.TEXT: It is a mechanism by which enterprises crossing various kinds are integrated and controlled under a single capital and monopolize the market. Monopoly is the most advanced form, such as Krupp in Germany and Zaibatsu in Japan.

DOC.Title: Krupp
DOC.TEXT: Germany's largest weapons producer. After Alfredo (1812-87) who was protected by Bismarck has been involved in management, it grows into a large enterprise and sells weapons inside and outside the country and is considered to be a typical "death merchant". In addition to weapons production, it formed Germany 's largest military compounding consultant including steel, machinery and shipbuilding.

DOC.Title: Monopoly capital
DOC.TEXT: A small group of large companies that exclusively dominated the market, born as a result of concentration and monopoly of industrial capital. In the domestic market, it was protected by protected tariffs, sold at monopoly price to profit, externally, aimed at efficient profit by exporting capital etc. in tandem with state power. This type of monopoly capital became the economic background of activities of imperialism.

DOC.Title: financial capital
DOC.TEXT: Monopoly capital with bank capital and industrial capital combined. Due to the large scale production and the huge invested capital, industrial capital needs huge capital, mutual shareholdings with large banks and stocks are dispatched, executives are dispatched, and mutual ties are established It was established because it was strengthened.

DOC.Title: Standard Oil Company
DOC.TEXT: An oil company established by Rockefeller in 1870. It became the center of trust formation in 1982, monopolizing 80% of the nation's oil refining capacity, and oversea sales share reached about 60% in 1911. In the same year, although the oil trust was dissolved and split, these companies are still the dominant force of the world oil industry.

DOC.Title: Capital export, foreign investment
DOC.TEXT: Invested capitalist countries invest in surplus capital in domestic redundant capital in underdeveloped countries and colonies with raw materials, labor force, market. Higher profits were expected, and it took place frequently from the latter half of the 19th century, which became a major incentive for strong expansion policy of the strong.

DOC.Title: Colony acquisition
DOC.TEXT: In the age of imperialism, importance of colonies as a destination of surplus capital as well as raw material supply / product market was reaffirmed, and it advanced rapidly from the late nineteenth century.

DOC.Title: Immigration
DOC.TEXT: People who left their original living areas and transferred their living bases to new areas / countries. The latter half of the 19th century-the beginning of the 20th century was the era when immigrants in an unprecedented scale were born. The reasons are as follows: (1) People's movement has become easier than before due to the "Traffic Revolution", etc., the outflow from the over-populated area was encouraged, (2) due to the pressure of the imperialist countries and progress of industrialization, (3) that the imperialist countries needed labor in railway construction and farms and mines in their home countries and colonies, and (4) 19 It is conceivable that slave labor was abolished by the middle of the century and that alternative labor force was desired. Among them were immigrants from Europe (Eastern Europe, South Europe etc.), Asia to North America, and immigrants from Asia to Southeast Asia, Africa and Latin America. As the former is called "new immigrant", as the construction of a transcontinental railroad and lower-level workers, the latter (representative of overseas Chinese · signature) is harsh and discriminating as inexpensive labor force at branding and mines He received treatment.

DOC.Title: Global recession since the 1870s, a worldwide depression after the 1870s
DOC.TEXT: It is a depression that occurred in Europe in 1873 and continued till the mid-1990s. At the time, the agricultural depression that had become chronic due to the influx of cheap grain from the United States also overlapped, the recession in Europe prolonged, the concentration and monopoly of companies progressed, leading to the formation of monopolistic capitalism It was.

DOC.Title: Welfare State
DOC.TEXT: Not only for maintaining security and defense, it is a nation that places emphasis on policies for general public education and health and sanitation. Since the end of the nineteenth century, due to the fact that labor unions and socialist political parties were legalized in many countries, the government came into consideration for the lives of the workers. It emerges in full scale in the 20th century.

DOC.Title: "Belle Epoque"
DOC.TEXT: An era of ten years before the occurrence of the First World War in Europe. The original language is French, meaning "wonderful era". Among the Europeans whose modern civilization developed and enjoyed a rich life, the optimistic view towards society spread and was called like this.

DOC.Title: Disraeli
DOC.TEXT: Conservative politician. He served as Prime Minister (1868, 74-80) and promoted imperialist policy by insisting on protection trade.

DOC.Title: Suez Canal company share acquisition
DOC.TEXT: Disraeli bought shares (44.4% of the whole) of Suez Canal Company from Egypt who was in financial difficulties. As a result, the UK gained a strong voice in the management of the Suez Canal.

DOC.Title: "Bank of the World"
DOC.TEXT: From the end of the nineteenth century, the expression that states Britain dominates the world in financial terms. Since the 1870s, the UK lost its position as a "factory of the world", and it became a deficit in the trade side, but balance in the service industry such as marine transportation and insurance was balanced, and using the huge capital strength accumulated so far , It continues to have a strong influence to the world economy till today.

DOC.Title: City
DOC.TEXT: In the old town of London, once an area surrounded by walls. At the end of the 17th century, the Bank of England was built and since then many financial institutions gathered, it means the center of the British economy. Currently it is the center of the world's financial and trade line with the American Wall Street.

DOC.Title: Rothschild house
DOC.TEXT: Europe's largest Jewish financial capitalist family. The first generation began the financial industry in Frankfurt, but his sons moved to Frankfurt, London, Paris · Vienna Naples, lived in mutual aid and built a massive wealth to move the world economy. In particular, it is known that in 1875, the Rothschild family in London raised funds to acquire the Suez Canal stock in response to Prime Minister Disraeli's request, and financially assisted the Zionism movement came in the 20th century .

DOC.Title: Joseph = Chamberlain
DOC.TEXT: British politician. I left the Liberal Party against the Irish autonomy bill and established the Free Unification Party. Promoted imperialist policies such as the South African War as colonial minister (1895-1903).

DOC.Title: British colonial conference
DOC.TEXT: Conference for the cooperation between the home country and the colonies · the local governor held in 1887, 97, 1902, 2007.

DOC.Title: British Empire Society
DOC.TEXT: It was renamed the British colonial conference in 1907 and it was held in 11, 21 and 23 years.

DOC.Title: Fabian Association
DOC.TEXT: In 1884, organizations of socialists formed around intellectuals. We advocated gradual social reform. The name of the association was taken from the name of Fapius, an ancient Roman general, who was tapped with Hannibal.

DOC.Title: Webb and Mr.
DOC.TEXT: Sociologist. Husband Sydney theorized the Fabian Association, and later served as minister at the McDonald's Labor Cabinet. We married Beatrice in 1892, and we both tried to develop the socialist movement.

DOC.Title: Bernard-Shaw
DOC.TEXT: British playwright, critic, philosopher. Participated in the Fabian Association, he also made use of sharp satire, also known as theater and criticism works full of social criticism.

DOC.Title: Independent Labor Party
DOC.TEXT: British labor political party founded by Care-Hardy in 1893. Independent from established political parties, we aimed for progressive achievement of workers' parliamentary advancement and socialism. It became the center of formation of the Labor Council Committee in 1900 and also played a major role in establishing the Labor Party in 2006.

DOC.Title: Care = Hardy
DOC.TEXT: I am from a coal mine worker. It became the center of formation of the Independent Labor Party · Labor Council Committee and later became the first leader of the Labor Party.

DOC.Title: Labor Council Committee
DOC.TEXT: An organization formed in 1900 by three independent socialist groups of the Independent Labor Party, Fabian Association, Social Democratic Federation and 65 labor unions. Secretary-general McDonald's. It is regarded as the formation of a substantial Labor Party.

DOC.Title: Labor Party
DOC.TEXT: The labor committee which won 29 seats in the 1906 general election was renamed Labor Party. We adopted a gradualism / legalistic route that aims to realize the minimum life of workers and nationalization of basic industries through Congress and elections. For this reason, the Marxist social democratic federation did not participate.

DOC.Title: ASKIS
DOC.TEXT: A politician from the Liberal Party. Prime Minister (Resigned from 1908 to 16). I passed important laws such as the Congressional Law and the Irish Autonomous Law, but I resigned from criticism of the war guidance in the First World War.

DOC.Title: National Insurance Law
DOC.TEXT: A law stipulating assistance for living for a certain period of time to unemployed workers in accordance with the German social insurance law.

DOC.Title: Congressional law, House law
DOC.TEXT: The Senate stipulated that it would not be against the bill and the budget proposal passed three times through the House of Representatives and established the House 's advantage.

DOC.Title: Ireland Autonomy Law
DOC.TEXT: In response to the demands of autonomy and independence, the Gladstone Cabinet proposed in 1886, 93, but it was rejected. The third plan was established in 1914, but the implementation was postponed due to the outbreak of the First World War.

DOC.Title: Shin-Fayne Party
DOC.TEXT: A nationalist political party in Ireland formed in 1905. He insisted on independence and took a radical route.

DOC.Title: Ulster
DOC.TEXT: Region in northeastern Ireland. Since the days of James I of the 17th century Englandish and Scottish neophytes got settled, merged in the United Kingdom (United Kingdom) 1801, and was retained in the British territory after the establishment of the Irish Free State in 1922, so the indigenous Catholic A severe confrontation with the inhabitants (Irish people) continued.

DOC.Title: Easter uprising
DOC.TEXT: Irish radicals aiming for independent independence from Britain armed uprising in Dublin on Easter (Easter Day), protesting the postponement of the implementation of the Irish Autonomous Law.

DOC.Title: Third Republic Government
DOC.TEXT: French political system established after Napoleon III abdicated during the Prussian-France war and the second empire collapsed.

DOC.Title: Third Republic Constitution
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1875. The presidential system of seven years of office was stipulated.

DOC.Title: Boulange Case
DOC.TEXT: Former Philadelphia Boulanger of the German hardline faction attempted military dictatorship coup attempts using the public's vengeance of German revenge. After failing, Boulanger exiled to Belgium and committed suicide.

DOC.Title: Russian alliance
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1891-94. Military alliance of Russia and France, established against the alliance of the three countries of Germany, Austria and Italy. French international isolation since the Prussian-French war was resolved, and it was strengthened to a complete military alliance in 1994.

DOC.Title: Dreyfus Case
DOC.TEXT: A spy allegation against Captain Dreyfus (1859-1935) of the Jewish system soldier. Dreyfus was sentenced to life imprisonment as a German spy at the military conference, but in 1896 another another culprit was found. The military protected the real culprit to preserve prestige, toppled the public's anti-Semitism, and convicted Dreyfus to the end. On the other hand, writer Zora criticized the military's authoritarianism and anti-Semitic tendency, the public opinion was divided into two, the case developed into political problems of republican advocates and anti-Republican politicians. Dreyfus was released with pardon in 1899 and was innocent in 1906. In the case of reaffirming the deep-rootedness of anti-Semitism in Europe, Herzl et al later came to start the Zionism movement.

DOC.Title: Anti-Semitism
DOC.TEXT: Assertions, actions, persecution based on prejudice and hatred against Judaism and Jews. Between Christians, there was the theory that "Jews are Christ killed" from the beginning of Christianity, which became established in the form of discrimination, persecution and isolation to the ghetto since the Crusade movement. Since the French Revolution, Jews have been able to recognize citizenship as well as Christians, but occasionally incidents such as Poglom (assault and genocide against Jews held in Eastern Europe), discrimination under the surface Remains deeply involved, including the incident of Dreyfus at the end of the 19th century and mass genocide by the Nazis since the 20th century.

DOC.Title: Zionism
DOC.TEXT: Movement trying to build a Jewish ethnic state in Palestine. Zion is Masaki of Jerusalem.

DOC.Title: Herzl
DOC.TEXT: Jewish journalist. In Paris I encountered a Dreyfus incident, was shocked, and started the Zionism movement.

DOC.Title: Zola
DOC.TEXT: French Naturalist writer. In the case of Dreyfus, he played an active role in winning the innocence, criticizing the government and the military, wrote an opening letter saying "I will impeach."

DOC.Title: Clemenceau
DOC.TEXT: French politician. Prime Minister (Tenure 1906-09, 17-20). Since 1870, he belonged to the radical group and overwhelmed the conservative cabinet with eloquent eloquence. In the Boulanger case · Dreyfus case he also played an active role in defense of the Republicans, became prime minister in 1906 and 17, led the victory of the First World War.

DOC.Title: Total Labor Relations, CGT
DOC.TEXT: France's largest union of labor unions organized in 1895. Promoted sandika rhythm.

DOC.Title: Sandika rhythm
DOC.TEXT: Conflict unionism. We denied parliamentism and tried to realize the social revolution by the direct action of labor union centered on general strikes and to realize sharing of production means. After the end of the 19th century, it was particularly popular in France during the third Republic era.

DOC.Title: Radical Socialist Party, radical republican
DOC.TEXT: In 1901, a political party made by collective progressive republics in the Dreyfus case. As a party based on the support of small bourgeois and small farmers, it played an important role during the Third Republican period as a political party distinct from socialism and right wing forces.

DOC.Title: English French mutual agreement
DOC.TEXT: It was concluded against the German imperialism which continues to advance.

DOC.Title: France Socialist Party, Unified Socialist Party
DOC.TEXT: French socialist party formed in 1905. Socialist organizations gathered together following the resolution of the 2nd International Amsterdam tournament. The Total Labor Union which insisted on Sandika rhythm did not participate. In the 1930s, it became the center of the People's Front Cabinet, after World War II, Mitterrand became the president for the second term and became the ruling party.

DOC.Title: Politics separation method
DOC.TEXT: In order to break Catholic political intervention, the law enacted by the radical Socialist party's argument.

DOC.Title: resignation of Bismarck
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister Bismarck resigned due to the confrontation with the emperor Wilhelm II, and the parents of Wilhelm II were started.

DOC.Title: Wilhelm II
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of Germany (ranking 1888-1918). In 1890 he retired Bismarck and began his civil service. It expanded aggressive global policies and expansion of armaments, eventually deepening the confrontation with the UK and France, and fighting the First World War. In 1918, she was abdicated by the outbreak of defeat and German revolution, exiled to the Netherlands.

DOC.Title: "Global Policy"
DOC.TEXT: Before World War I, aggressive foreign policy that Imperialism Powers made. It is derived from what Wilhelm II used for the speech in particular, often referring to German imperialist policy.

DOC.Title: Navy's great expansion
DOC.TEXT: Wilhelm II stated that "the future of Germany is on the sea," especially since 1897. In this, Britain felt a threat and ran to build a state-of-the-art battleship, so the conflict between the two countries deepened.

DOC.Title: German Social Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1890, with the resignation of Bismarck and the abolition of the socialist crushing law, the German Socialist Workers Party was renamed and reached today. In the election in 1990, he won 1.35 million votes, 35 seats. In 1991, Marxist Erfurt's program was adopted, mass became the world's most socialist party with mass, and played a central role also in the second international. It became the first party in the election of 1912, but in World War I ended losing support in support of war policy.

DOC.Title: Revisionism
DOC.TEXT: It is not a revolution but a position to realize socialism with emphasis on parliamentary fighting and social policy. When Bernstein asked for the "correction" of the German Social Democratic route at the end of the 19th century, it was affixed a label called "revisionism" with the meaning of criticism from mainstream factions. Since then, in a controversy among Marxists, a group that recognizes 'Orthodox' Marxism often criticized against opponents against this name.

DOC.Title: LaSalle
DOC.TEXT: German socialists. In 1863 he founded the German Workers' Association (La Salle).

DOC.Title: Bevel
DOC.TEXT: German socialists. He was a pupil of Marx and formed a social democratic labor party (Eisenach school) in Eisenach in 1869.

DOC.Title: Bernstein
DOC.TEXT: Theoretical leader of the German Social Democratic right wing. Since around 1896, he opposed the mainstream school by advocating Marxist's amendment and was accused of that theory as "revisionism".

DOC.Title: Russian Social Labor Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1903, Marxist political party formed by Purhanov and Lenin. But shortly afterwards, it broke up over the decision of the program into two groups, Bolshevik and Menshevik. Although there was the theory that the established year was 1898, a member who aimed to organize was arrested immediately after that and could not work, so we took the 1903 theory, when more substantial activity began. ]

DOC.Title: Bolshevik
DOC.TEXT: In 1903, when the Russian Social Democratic Labor Party split, Lenin was the leader. Meaning of "majority" (because it became a majority in the party personnel in 1903). We strictly limited the members of the party to a small number of revolutionaries and insisted on the emphasis on the armed revolution. In 1917 led the November Revolution (Russian calendar October revolution), established the Soviet regime, renamed the Russian Communist Party in 18 years.

DOC.Title: Lenin
DOC.TEXT: A Russian revolutionary. Teaching Bolshevik, achieving the November Revolution, and building a socialist state.

DOC.Title: Menshevik
DOC.TEXT: The right wing within the Russian Social Democratic Labor Party. The meaning of "minority". In the 1903 controversy, based on the broad masses including the bourgeois forces, insisted on a gradual revolution that seeks to realize the socialist revolution after the bourgeois democratic revolution.

DOC.Title: Prehanov
DOC.TEXT: Russian Marxist father is a revolutionary. In opposition to Lenin, he instructed Menshevik.

DOC.Title: Martov
DOC.TEXT: Menshevik leader. In opposition to Lenin, against the November Revolution, exiled to Germany in 1920.

DOC.Title: Social Revolutionary Party
