DOC.TEXT: Accurately the revolutionary socialist party. Known as S. L.. It was formed at the end of 1901. Toward the flow of Narudeniki, we aimed to overthrow tyranny and redistribute land to farmers. It broke into right and left by the November revolution of 1917.

DOC.Title: Nikolai II
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of the last Emperor Russia (ranking 1894-1917). During the Russo-Japanese War, I faced the first Russian revolution and promised the Diet to open. While participating in World War I, he was forced to abdicate in the March revolution that occurred in 1917 while the predicaments continued, and was executed afterwards.

DOC.Title: Blood Sunday incident
DOC.TEXT: While the Russo-Japanese War situation was in a disadvantage, a case where an army fired to a demonstration team of peace petition to Winter Palace in Petersburg, and a number of casualties were issued. The people lost faith in the emperor and became the beginning of the first Russian revolution.

DOC.Title: Gapon
DOC.TEXT: clergyman. He led the labor movement since 1904 and tried to moderate it. At the beginning of the Blood Sunday incident demonstration, it was a catastrophe of bloodshed of more than 2,000 casualties and exiled abroad. After returning home, he was assassinated under suspicion of a police spy.

DOC.Title: The 1st Russian Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary movement that caused blood Sunday incident as a machine. A riot occurred in various places, mainly urban workers, and developed into an army rebellion in June. The government judged that it would be difficult for the Russo-Japanese War to continue, and while placing peace with Japan, promised the opening of the Diet by the Decree of October.

DOC.Title: Soviet, Council
DOC.TEXT: Meaning of "conference" in Russian. In the first Russian revolution in 1905, the workers of Petersburg began to organize factories as mothers.

DOC.Title: Potemkin's Rebellion
DOC.TEXT: Uprising of a squadron who happened in a battleship belonging to the Black Sea Fleet. The first time the revolution ran into the military, the government abandoned the Russo-Japanese War to continue.

DOC.Title: October Declaration, October Royal Decree
DOC.TEXT: Edict issued by Nicolai II. In order to break up revolutionary forces, we promised the opening of the Diet and the enactment of the constitution by putting demands of liberalists. The revolution greatly retreated and subsided.

DOC.Title: Duma
DOC.TEXT: Russian parliament that was promised to open in October declaration. It was equivalent to the House of Representatives, opened in 1906 and opened four times until the Russian Revolution of 17 years. Parliamentarians were elected by restricted elections and many restrictions were added to the legislative activities, but discussions have been tampered with the theme of dismantling the meal as a big theme.

DOC.Title: Constitutional Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: A bourgeois party established in October 1905. To become a constitutional monarchy, it became the first party in the first and second parliament. In the 17th March revolution it became the center of extraordinary government, continuing the First World War.

DOC.Title: Witte, Witte
DOC.TEXT: Russian politician. As finance minister (1892-1903) I actively introduced protectionist policy and foreign capital, promoted construction of Siberian railroad and Russian capitalism. After serving as the full authority of the Portsmouth conference, he drafted the Declaration of October and became prime minister during the first Russian revolution in 1905. After that, we promoted liberal reform, but it fell in 2006 due to conservative opposition.

DOC.Title: Sturypin
DOC.TEXT: A politician from Russian landlord aristocracy. After dismissing Witte, he became the prime minister (responsible 1906-11) and forcibly carried out reactionary politics such as parliamentary dissolution and revolutionary repression. On the other hand, promoting domestic reform, centering on land reform such as dismantling of Meal, social unrest increased and was assassinated.

DOC.Title: Meal demolition
DOC.TEXT: A rural community of Russia. Str Tuipin was regarded as the foundation of farmers' rebellion and unity, disassembled, aiming for the creation of own farmers by disbursing land, but not enough results.

DOC.Title: Apache, Apache Tribe
DOC.TEXT: Some of the Native American (Indian).

DOC.Title: Jeronimo
DOC.TEXT: The chief of Apache. I made intense resistance to white people, but surrendered in 1886, the organizational resistance of Native Americans eventually ended.

DOC.Title: Disappearance of frontier
DOC.TEXT: The US government announced in 1890. From then on, the expansion of US capital to foreign firms will begin in earnest.

DOC.Title: Rockefeller, Rockefeller I
DOC.TEXT: American businessman. Established the standard oil company in 1870, formed a large oil trust in 1982, suppressed 90% of the national oil market, became the ruler of the oil industry. From its descendants, there are many influential people in the American political world such as the presidential candidate, the state governor, the president of the bank.

DOC.Title: Carnegie
DOC.TEXT: American businessman. A child of poor Scottish immigrants. He made efforts and became the champion of the US steelmaking industry and was called "Steel King". It is known as a representative of the success story in the United States, as well as its name in charity projects such as making a large contribution to the construction of universities, libraries, music halls, etc.

DOC.Title: Morgan
DOC.TEXT: American businessman. After succeeding in railway investment in the 1890s, after establishing the Morgan company, it formed a giant chaebol that affiliated most of the steel industry and banks. US Steel, founded in 1901 in particular, acquired Carnegie Steel and successfully monopolized the national steel market.

DOC.Title: Antitrust method
DOC.TEXT: Law enacted to regulate monopoly capital. While the citizens' antipathy increased, the interstate transaction law in 1887, the Sherman antitrust law in 1990, the Kreiton law in 1914, etc. were established, but monopolization could not be prevented.

DOC.Title: McKinley
DOC.TEXT: President of the 25th US Presidency (1897-1901). Republicans. Promoted imperialist policies such as the annexation of Hawaii and the United States = Spain war, but was assassinated by anarchists.

DOC.Title: America = Spain War, US West War
DOC.TEXT: The war that the United States went open to Spain on the pretext of Cuba 's independence movement and the US ship' s explosion incident. As a result, Cuba became a de facto protected country after independence and won the Philippines · Puerto Rico · Guam.

DOC.Title: John = Hay
DOC.TEXT: McKinley · Theodore = Rose Vert. Secretary of State in both Presidents era (from 1898 to 1905). Promoted imperialist policy, including announcement of open door opening declaration on China.

DOC.Title: Open door declaration
DOC.TEXT: US Secretary of State John Hay advocates the three principles of open door, equal opportunities and territorial integrity concerning China.

DOC.Title: Theodore = Rose Velt, Theodore = Roosevelt
DOC.TEXT: President of the 26th US Presidency (1901-09). Republicans. Domestically promoting social reform, such as restraining monopoly capital by activating anti-trust law, promoting imperialist policies such as Caribbean policy (also called "clubs diplomacy"), with innovative principles in place . Arranged the Russo-Japanese War to establish the Portsmouth Treaty.

DOC.Title: Innovationism, Progressivism
DOC.TEXT: From the end of the 19th century to the First World War, as the industrial monopolization and social inequality deepened, middle classes and others took the initiative to revive free competition and purification of political circles, politics · Social movement. Regulation of monopoly, protection of workers were specified specifically.

DOC.Title: "Diplomacy of club"
DOC.TEXT: Theodore-Roseworth 's Caribbean policy. "Hold a big club and talk gently," and developed a foreign policy against the background of military strength.

DOC.Title: "Dollar diplomacy"
DOC.TEXT: American foreign policy to increase political and economic influence by expanding overseas investment. Especially the President Taft's diplomacy.

DOC.Title: American Socialist Party
DOC.TEXT: A political party formed in 1901. Theodore-Roseveuto was repressed by the government, few supporters, weak parties.

DOC.Title: World Industrial Workers Alliance, IWW
DOC.TEXT: A labor organization formed in the United States in 1905. Unskilled workers focused mainly on general strikes such as general strikes against the conservative alliance of the American Labor Union, but isolated and repressed under the gradual recovery of the US economy, it disappeared.

DOC.Title: Wilson
DOC.TEXT: United States President of the 28th (President 1913-21). Democratic Party. We adopted neo-liberalism, realized the tariff reduction and antitrust law enactment etc.

DOC.Title: "New Freedom"
DOC.TEXT: The slogan of Wilson who came to election in 1913. It was essentially the same as innovationism, highlighting politics and humanitarianism in enterprises, breakdown of the power of minority privileges, and politics for the people.

DOC.Title: "Missionary Diplomacy"
DOC.TEXT: Wilson 's nickname for Latin American diplomacy. He tried to preach the moral superiority of American democracy and to acknowledge American leadership.

DOC.Title: Africa division
DOC.TEXT: Since the late nineteenth century, the European powers invaded the African continent and became colonized. From around 1880 Britain and France began colonization, and Germany, Italy and other countries also advanced, led to the collision between indigenous resistance and imperialism, while the division was almost complete by around 1900.

DOC.Title: "Dark continent"
DOC.TEXT: The words used by Europeans against the African continent before exploration and development. A derogatory term based on prejudice from the Western world, meaning the state of unexplored and non-civilized.

DOC.Title: Trading trade
DOC.TEXT: From the 16th century until the middle of the 19th century, trade merchants sent black people to the Americas from the West Bank region of the continent of Africa. It is said that about one-third has died in the course of transportation, and blacks estimated to exceed 10 million people in 300 years were brought to the Americas and the African society stagnated. In the Americas and the Caribbean, the black slaves were heavily used as labor for plantations. Britain gave the greatest profit, but since the end of the 18 th century the campaign against trade trade increased and was abolished by the mid-nineteenth century.

DOC.Title: Livingstone
DOC.TEXT: British missionary / explorer. After 1849 he entered the South African outback and found the Victoria Falls. While searching for the Nile water source, it temporarily disappeared but was rescued by Stanley.

DOC.Title: Stanley
DOC.TEXT: An American explorer born in the UK. In 1871 he succeeded in rescuing Livingston and crossed the first in Central Africa. In 74-77 years, the publisher, in 78-84, explored the Congo again with the help of King Belgian and explored Sudan in 87-88.

DOC.Title: Berlin Conference
DOC.TEXT: An international conference to agree on African division. Bismarck held in Belgium to mediate the conflict over Congo possession. The principle (preemption right) that the previously occupied country can be possessed has been confirmed and spurred the African division competition.

DOC.Title: Congo
DOC.TEXT: Central Africa, the area of ​​the Congo River Basin. Especially the Belgian forces advanced, as Belgium helped Stanley explore, and they swept ivory, rubber and others.

DOC.Title: Congo Free Country
DOC.TEXT: A colony built as the private territory of Leopold II. We gave part to France and Portugal. It was transferred to the Belgian government in 1908 and renamed Belgian Congo.

DOC.Title: Leopold II
DOC.TEXT: King Belgium (rank 1865 to 1909). We strive to advance to Africa, dispatched Stanley to the Congo, built the Congo free country and made it my territory. However, the harsh deprivation was subject to international accusations and was forced to be transferred to the Belgian government in 1908.

DOC.Title: Congo International Association
DOC.TEXT: In 1882, an organization that Leopold II established for the development and control of the Congo region. In the Berlin meeting between 84 and 85, it was recognized national sovereignty and constructed a free country of Congo.

DOC.Title: Urabee's rebellion, Olavy's rebellion
DOC.TEXT: Egypt 's first anti-British movement, Egyptian Colonel Warrabie armed uprising in honor of the "Egypt for the Egyptians". Aiming at the Constitutional Reform and the Constitutional Revolution to open a parliament, but was suppressed by the British Army in 1882, it ended in failure.

DOC.Title: Protected country of Egypt, protected country of UK / Egypt
DOC.TEXT: Britain, who crushed Urabee's rebellion with a single soldier, put Egypt under de facto control. Formal protection Nationalization was in 1914.

DOC.Title: Sudan
DOC.TEXT: Originally refers to the area from the Red Sea coast to Sahara / Congo. Egypt Sudan in southern Egypt was invaded by the UK since 1869 and became joint management of the UK and Egypt in 1999.

DOC.Title: Mafudi
DOC.TEXT: Arabic meaning "guided". It is also used to mean "savior".

DOC.Title: Muhammad = Ahmad
DOC.TEXT: Founder of Muhudi school of Sudan. In 1881 he declared himself to be Mahdi, fought with foreign forces and built a Mahdi state.

DOC.Title: Mafdie's rebellion
DOC.TEXT: An anti-English resistance war by Muslims in Sudan, led by Muhammad Ahmad, who calls Mahdi. Britain caught himself up for crushing, which led the British 's entry into Sudan about 10 years behind.

DOC.Title: Gordon
DOC.TEXT: British soldier. In the Crimean War and the Arrow War, he was active in suppressing the Taiping paradise army in 1863 by directing the Chikatsu Army. He served as Governor and Governor of Sudan, killed by the Mahdi army and killed in battle.

DOC.Title: Khartoum
DOC.TEXT: Central part of Sudan, the confluence of White Nile and Blue Nile. In 1885, the Mafdi army occupied.

DOC.Title: 3C policy
DOC.TEXT: British imperialist policy. We aimed to colonize the area connecting the three cities of Cape Town, Cairo, Calcutta. It conflicted with German 3B policy.

DOC.Title: Cape colony
DOC.TEXT: The southernmost point of Africa. In 1652 it became the Netherlands territory, and in 1814 it became the British territory. Current state of South Africa Republic of Ichi.

DOC.Title: Cape Town
DOC.TEXT: The center of Cape colony.

DOC.Title: Oman
DOC.TEXT: A country in the eastern end of the Arabian Peninsula. In the mid-17th century, after defeating the Portuguese forces, it flourished mainly on trade activities and dominated the east coast of eastern Africa based on Zanzibar, but in the mid-nineteenth century Zanzibar declined as a result of separation and independence. After that, it was ruled by the United Kingdom between 1919 and 1970.

DOC.Title: Zanzibar Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Eastern Africa, the kingdom centered on Zanzibar island in the northeastern part of Tanzania. He strongly resisted the advance of Portugal · the UK.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Buganda
DOC.TEXT: East Africa, the country of Lake Victoria North. In 1894 it became the protectorate of Britain.

DOC.Title: Zulu Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: The kingdom that flourished on the east coast of South Africa in the 19th century. It resisted the invasion of Bouleans and British troops, but in 1897 it was split into Transvaal and Natal.

DOC.Title: Cecil-Rose
DOC.TEXT: British entrepreneur and politician. Since 1870 South Africa monopolized the diamond · gold digging right. He became Prime Minister of the Cape colony (responsible 1890-96), promoted imperialist policy and Abarth Hate policy.

DOC.Title: Rhodesia
DOC.TEXT: A region of the South Africa inland area that together the current Zimbabwe Republic and Zambia. It was conquered and occupied by South Africa company Cecil-Rose established in 1889 in 90-94. After Cecil-Rose, he was named Rhodesia.

DOC.Title: Boolean, Boer
DOC.TEXT: Descendants of Dutch immigrants who settled in the Cape colony since the 17th century (some descendants of French Huguenot). When the Cape colony became the British territory in 1814, the Bourrs migrated to the north and built the Orange Free State of the Transvaal Republic.

DOC.Title: Great = Trek
DOC.TEXT: In the 1830s, it means a large movement from the Cape colony to the north of the Boolean who sought a new place. After the Vienna meeting, British colonists became involved and it was caused by pressure.

DOC.Title: Transvaal Republic
DOC.TEXT: The country that the Boolean person built. A diamond mine was discovered in the 1860's and merged in Britain in 1977. In 1981, I succeeded in re-independence, but in 1984 the world's best gold mineralization was discovered, lost in the South African war and became the British territory.

DOC.Title: Orange Free Country
DOC.TEXT: A nation built by the Boules. In 1867 the world's best diamond mine was discovered and underwent a British invasion. In South Africa war surrendered even after a fierce battle, became a British territory.

DOC.Title: South Africa War, South Africa War
DOC.TEXT: British imperialist invasion war against the Transvaal Orange countries. As the Booleans fought strongly against the guerrilla war, the UK finally won about 450,000 troops and about 223 million pounds warfare, deploying a scorched land strategy and finally won. In 1906 the UK pioneered the human rights discrimination (apartheid) policy by giving autonomy premised on the preeminence of Bourt people to indigenous Bantu.

DOC.Title: Natal
DOC.TEXT: A republic built in 1838 after the Booleans who flew from the cape colony in the early 19th century and fought with the Kingdom of Zulu. It was conquered by Britain in 1843.

DOC.Title: South Africa Federation
DOC.TEXT: British ruler of four provinces of Cape, Transvaar, Orange, Natal, established in 1910. We conducted racial discrimination strongly from the beginning.

DOC.Title: Apartheid
DOC.TEXT: White race discrimination and racial isolation policy taken from the time of the formation of the Federal Republic of South Africa. It was inherited to the Republic of South Africa.

DOC.Title: Algerian Capture, France Algeria Capture
DOC.TEXT: Charles X was occupied by Algeria which was the affiliation of the Ottoman Empire since the 16th century, and Louis-Philippe became the territory of the territory in 1842. Settlers (colon) increased dramatically after the Prussian-French war, squeezing and dominating the indigenous Berbers.

DOC.Title: Tunisia Protected Nationalization, France Tunisia Protected Nationalization
DOC.TEXT: Tunisia once belonged to the Phoenician · Roma · Ottoman Empire, England · France entered the country, France's superiority was confirmed at the Berlin meeting in 1878, soldiers took over the capital Tunis in 1981, protected territory Respectively.

DOC.Title: Ashanti Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: A black kingdom in the realm of the present Republic of Ghana. Prosperous in trade faith and gold production, the beginning of the 19th century was at its heyday, in 1902 it was regarded as the British protectorate.

DOC.Title: Daughter Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: A black kingdom in the east of Ashanti Kingdom. Though prosperous in trade trade, it was invaded and annexed to France in 1894.

DOC.Title: Guinea
DOC.TEXT: An area ranging from Senegal to Angola on the west coast of Africa. In the trade area such as 隸 金, 牙, ivory, at the end of the 19 th century the strong power occupied and divided, but the French territory was the largest.

DOC.Title: Zamori = Toure
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic activist in Guinea. Building the Samori Empire against the background of Islamic faith, resisted the invasion of France. It was made a national hero of Guinea, but he was arrested in 1898 and died in prison. The great-grandfather of Guyan Independent father Sext-Ture.

DOC.Title: Zamori Empire
DOC.TEXT: The Islamic Empire that Zamori-Toure built in the inland part of West Africa. The 1880s was at its peak, but it was invaded by France and it was destroyed.

DOC.Title: Sahara Desert
DOC.TEXT: A vast desert spreading south of Algeria / Tunisia. France succeeded in entering the country in the 1890s.

DOC.Title: Madagascar
DOC.TEXT: An island in southeastern Africa. Since the 17th century, the Netherlands, France and the UK competed for expansion, but it was regarded as a French sphere in the Berlin Conference, and in 1896 the possession was declared.

DOC.Title: Djibouti
DOC.TEXT: A port located on the exit from the Red Sea to the Indian Ocean, on the northeast coast of Africa. French entered with the construction of the Suez Canal and in 1888 Djibouti port was built. It was colonized as French Somali coast in 1996. The eastern end of French Africa crossing policy.

DOC.Title: Africa crossing policy
DOC.TEXT: French African advance policy to cross the Sahara from West Africa, aiming to contact Djibouti and Madagascar.

DOC.Title: African longitudinal policy
DOC.TEXT: Britain 's policy of entering Africa, aiming to secure a region connecting Egypt and the Cape colony. It collided with French cross-policies.

DOC.Title: Fashewa incident
DOC.TEXT: A case where a British army taking a longitudinal policy and a French army taking a crossing policy collided and conflicted in Sudan's Fajonda. The French Army led by Colonel Marshan occupied the Faisjoda along the Nile River in Sudan, but the British Army led by General Kitchener arrived and urged the French troops to withdraw. Although the war was at stake, the French government conceded and Sudan was placed under Egypt's control of the UK. It was the beginning of the mutual conflict between imperialists of Africa.

DOC.Title: English French mutual agreement
DOC.TEXT: Agreement concluded with relaxation of British-French conflict with the peaceful settlement of the Fajonda incident. In 1904, mutual recognition of the superiority right in Egypt of England and Morocco of France was made.

DOC.Title: Morocco
DOC.TEXT: In the background of the British French correspondence, France, which received British support, fought German ambitions and succeeded in colonization in 1911.

DOC.Title: Cameroon
DOC.TEXT: Guinea bay coastal area of ​​West Africa. Germany began colonizing in 1884 and officially possessed it in 1902.

DOC.Title: East African colony, Germany East African colony
DOC.TEXT: Currently areas such as Tanzania and Rwanda. It was owned by Germany in 1885, and it became a colonial territory directly in 1991.

DOC.Title: Maji-Maji's Uprising
DOC.TEXT: In the German territory East Africa (now Tanzania), the German revolt that came out against the cotton forced cultivation. A name from the fact that I dared to drink "magical water" (Maji) which was believed to weaken the power of white people.

DOC.Title: South-West African colony, Germany South-West African colony
DOC.TEXT: The area that is currently Namibia. Since 1884, Germany entered, it was owned in 1985.

DOC.Title: Morocco incident
DOC.TEXT: The incident of collision of German French imperialism over Morocco occurred twice in 1905 and 11 years. Morocco was regarded as an important strategic point of Africa facing the Mediterranean Sea.

DOC.Title: First Morocco Incident, Tangier Case
DOC.TEXT: In the case of France · the German emperor Wilhelm II suddenly visited Tangier and asked for Morocco's territorial integrity and opening of doors, against the fact that the British accepted the superiority right in Morocco in the previous year's British French correspondence A case

DOC.Title: Tangier
DOC.TEXT: A port city that faces the Atlantic Ocean at the northern end of Morocco. The site of the first Moroccan incident.

DOC.Title: Algeciras meeting
DOC.TEXT: An international conference held in Algeciras, Spain, to settle the first Moroccan incident. Britain supported France and Germany conceded, Morocco became the scope of France and Spain.

DOC.Title: Second Morocco Incident, Agadir Case
DOC.TEXT: When France dispatched to suppress the resistance of indigenous people who settled in Morocco, a German warship suddenly entered Agadir and confronted with the French army. Because Britain backed France, Germany got a concession simply by gaining a part of the Congo from France.

DOC.Title: Agadir
DOC.TEXT: A port city facing the Atlantic Ocean in southwest Morocco. The second Moroccan incident scene.

DOC.Title: Protected Morocco, France Morocco Protected Nationalization
Somariland
DOC.TEXT: On the eastern coast of Africa, the area called "the corner of Africa". It was divided into French territory, British territory and Italian territory from the north.

DOC.Title: Eritrea
DOC.TEXT: Red Sea coastal area in northern Ethiopia. Italy separated from Ethiopia, occupied in 1885.

DOC.Title: Ethiopian Empire
DOC.TEXT: A country that prospered in the northeastern part of Africa from the first century. Also known as Abyssinia. It accepted Christianity around the 4th century and prevented invasion of Islamic forces since the 7th century. It temporarily split, but it was reunified in the 19th century. From the 1870 's, power of Western powers strongly interfered and invaded, but maintained independence.

DOC.Title: Menerik II ___
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of Ethiopia (ranking 1889-1913). It reunified Ethiopia and promoted modernization policy. In 1896, the invading Italian army was broken in Adwa 's battle.

DOC.Title: Italian troops invaded Ethiopia
DOC.TEXT: The 1st Ethiopian War. Ethiopia, a weapon offered by France, won the Italian army with a guerrilla warfare.

DOC.Title: Adowa
DOC.TEXT: A place in the northern part of Ethiopia. In March 1896, the invading Italian army was completely defeated in this place.

DOC.Title: Sanooky culture
DOC.TEXT: In the mid 19th century, the mysticism (Sufi) founder was founded by Luvia by Muhammad-Aussansey. Italy and others resisted pressure and control.

DOC.Title: Italy = Turkish War
DOC.TEXT: An invasion war where Italy took possession of Ottoman territory Tripoli Kirenaika. In 1912 the Lausanne treaty Italy gained control of Tripoli Kirenaika.

DOC.Title: Tripoli
DOC.TEXT: Libya western region. Italy occupied Italy in the Turkish war, annexed in 1912.

DOC.Title: Kireinaika
DOC.TEXT: Eastern Libya area. Italy occupied Italy in the Turkish war, annexed in 1912.

DOC.Title: Libya
DOC.TEXT: Italy, which merged Tripolo Kirenaica in 1912, revived the old name, renamed both areas to Libya.

DOC.Title: Liberia Republic
DOC.TEXT: The first republic of Africa built on the West Coast of Africa. In 1821, the American Colonial Society was set up as a residence of a slave released in the United States, and colonization began in 22 years. In 47 years declared independence, became Republicans, enacted the American-style Constitution. Although the independence was maintained also in the African division period since the end of the 19th century, since the dictatorship by the descendants of the liberation fellow who received the support of the United States kept tyranny, rebellion and massacre cases occurred frequently, many people are now refugees ing.

DOC.Title: Oceania
DOC.TEXT: Oceania. The islands dotted in the Pacific and the Australian continent-New Zealand together.

DOC.Title: Tasman
DOC.TEXT: An explorer in the Netherlands. We navigated the Pacific Ocean, reached Tasmania and New Zealand, and explored western New Guinea and the west north shore of Australia.

DOC.Title: Cook
DOC.TEXT: A British explorer. In three voyages in 1768-79, he explored Tahiti, New Zealand, Australia, Antarctica, Southwest Pacific Islands, Hawaii, but was killed by islanders in Hawaii.

DOC.Title: Australia
DOC.TEXT: Cook discovered in 1770, declared the British territory, became a British colonial colony since 1788. When the sheep farming industry developed from the beginning of the 19th century, gold mining was discovered in the 1850s, the influx of immigrants sharply increased.

DOC.Title: Aborigines
DOC.TEXT: Indigenous people in Australia. Today, we count 2% of the Australian population.

DOC.Title: White Australianism
DOC.TEXT: Caucasian priority policy in Australia. From the 1880 's, we adopted a policy to restrict colored immigrants and monopolize Australia with white people. Following international criticism, Australia abolished the restriction law in 1973, and today it is an active immigration recipient.

DOC.Title: Australia Commonwealth
DOC.TEXT: Dominion within the British Empire formed in 1901. The capital Canberra.

DOC.Title: New Zealand
DOC.TEXT: In 1642 Tasman reached. Became a British colony in 1840, became a self-governing body in 1907.

DOC.Title: Maori people
DOC.TEXT: Indigenous people in New Zealand.

DOC.Title: North Borneo possession
DOC.TEXT: Currently in Sabah province of Malaysia. In the southern part of the Netherlands, the Netherlands was part of the north in 1841, the United Kingdom was the protectorate, in 1988 the whole northern part was the British protectorate.

DOC.Title: Melanesia
DOC.TEXT: Southwest island of southwest Pacific Ocean. Including Eastern New Guinea, Bismarck Islands, Solomon Islands, Fiji Islands and New Caledonia. Indigenous people are Papuans and Melanesian of Austronesian language.

DOC.Title: Eastern New Guinea
DOC.TEXT: The Netherlands occupied the western part in 1828, Britain · Germany occupied the eastern part in 1984, divided it north and south. The British territory in the south became a territory of the Commonwealth of Australia in 1906, renamed Papua.

DOC.Title: Fiji
DOC.TEXT: Archipelago north of New Zealand. Tasman explored the northeast island in 1643, Cook in 1774 explored the southern island, became the British territory in 1874.

DOC.Title: New Caledonia
DOC.TEXT: It is an island in the east of Australia, French territory today. In 1774 Cook explored, became French territory in 1853, and was used as a penal colony since 64 years.

DOC.Title: Solomon Islands
DOC.TEXT: Spain arrived in the 16th century and was known to Europe. Germany dominated the northern part at the end of the 19th century and the United Kingdom the southern part. Independence in 1978.

DOC.Title: Bismarck Islands
DOC.TEXT: It was regarded as the German territory in 1884. After that control came to England and Australia, but in 1975 he became independent as part of the British Commonwealth Papua New Guinea.

DOC.Title: Polynesia
DOC.TEXT: Island of the vast waters east of the line connecting New Zealand · Hawaii. Indigenous people are polynesians of the Austronesian language.

DOC.Title: Tahiti
DOC.TEXT: It became French territory in 1842.

DOC.Title: Samoa
DOC.TEXT: In 1872, the United States entered the country and competed in the UK and Germany three countries, and in 1989 it became a joint protectorate of the three countries. In 1999 the UK retreated, the United States and Germany divided and ruled in the east and west. 1962 independence.

DOC.Title: Tonga
DOC.TEXT: In 1900 it became a British protectorate. In 70 years he became independent as Tonga Kingdom.

DOC.Title: Micronesia
DOC.TEXT: An island in the South Sea Islands north of the equator in the southwest Pacific. Caroline · Marshall · Gilbert islands etc. are included. Indigenous people are Micronesians of the Austronesian language.

DOC.Title: Marshall Islands
DOC.TEXT: It became German territory in 1886. Later, domination and Japan and the United States moved, and became independent in 1986.

DOC.Title: Caroline Islands
DOC.TEXT: Germany bought from Spain in 1899 after the US = Spain War. Later, Japan and the United States moved and dominance took off, separated into two countries, the Federated States of Micronesia in 1986 and the Palau Republic in 1994.

DOC.Title: Palau Islands
DOC.TEXT: Island of the western end of the Caroline Islands. In 1899 Germany took over from Spain.

DOC.Title: Mariana Islands
DOC.TEXT: Northern Mariana excluding Guam Island, in 1899 Germany was acquired from Spain. Today, governance is divided between the American Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands.

DOC.Title: Philippines
DOC.TEXT: During the American-Spanish war in 1898, the US military occupied Manila. After the war the US acquired Philippines from Spain on condition that it pays 20 million dollars.

DOC.Title: Guam Island
DOC.TEXT: Island on the southern tip of the Mariana Islands. As a result of the US = Spain war, in 1898, it became a US territory from the Spanish territory.

DOC.Title: Hawaii
DOC.TEXT: Islands located nearly in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. 1778 British explorer Cook arrived. At the end of the 18 th century the Kamehameha Dynasty was established, unifying the whole island in 1810 and forming the Kingdom of Hawaii. 93 years Parent American citizen became the center, established a special government, promoted the merger campaign with the United States. In 1997 the President McKinley signed the Consolidation Treaty, which was consolidated in 1898.

DOC.Title: Kamehameha morning
DOC.TEXT: The dynasty built by Kamehameha to end the civil war. In the middle of the 19th century the constitution was enacted and became a constitutional monarchy, but it was knocked down in 1893.

DOC.Title: Liliuokalani
DOC.TEXT: Hawaii's Kamehameha the last queen of the morning (ranking 1891-93). Although he aimed to create a regime to eliminate white people and aimed for the revival of the kingship, in 1893 they were forced to abdicate with a coup daughter of a civilian citizen. He is also a songwriter and composer of the Hawaiian folk song "Alohao".

DOC.Title: Pan = America Conference
DOC.TEXT: An international conference to discuss various issues in the Americas. The first meeting in 1889 was held in Washington, taking over ten or so Latin American meetings beginning in Panmama meeting in 1826. Since then, it was effectively a venue for diplomatic development in Latin America in the United States of America, but it was altered by the American Organization of Organization (OAS) in 1948.

DOC.Title: Caribbean policy
DOC.TEXT: The imperialist policy of the United States trying to militarily and politically control the Caribbean as its own "backyard". After excluding France 's Mexican interference in 1867, it became even stronger, became full-fledged by the American-Spanish war, and clarified it as a foreign policy when Theodore-Roseworth.

DOC.Title: Independence movement of Cuba
DOC.TEXT: Resident uprising against Spanish bad guard. After the First Independence War (1868-78), the Second Revolutionary War (1895-98) occurred with José Marti as leader. Because the Spanish army harmed US interests, it caused interference in America.

DOC.Title: America = Spain War, US West War
DOC.TEXT: The war that the United States went open to Spain, as a pretext of the Cuban independence movement and the US ship's explosion incident in Havana Bay. In four months America won unilaterally. Peace peace in August, peace peace in Paris in December, cuba independence, ceremonies of the Philippines · Puerto Rico · Guam to the USA decided.

DOC.Title: Plat clause
DOC.TEXT: In 1901, the eight provisions that the United States incorporated as an attachment item of the Constitution of Cuba. Cuba and restrictions on other treaties and loans, the interference rights of the United States and the right to set up a naval base, and so on, Cupa was effectively regarded as a protected country of the United States.

DOC.Title: Puerto Rico
DOC.TEXT: An island in the Caribbean. It was Spanish territory since reaching Columbus, but the US Army occupied and consolidated in the US = Spanish War.

DOC.Title: Dominica
DOC.TEXT: Eastern part of Caribbean Espanola Island. It became Spain territory in 1500, French territory in 1795, Spain territory in 1814, and became independent as a republic in 1944. After that, Reunion by Spain (1861 ~ 65), Military occupation by the United States (1916 ~ 24) was received.

DOC.Title: Panama
DOC.TEXT: In 1903, separated from Colombia with American aid, independent 0 Then the Panama Canal was built and placed under the strong influence of the United States.

DOC.Title: Panama Canal
DOC.TEXT: In 1903, the United States acquired construction rights and lease rights of the Panama Canal from the Panama Republic immediately after independence and was constructed in 2004 and opened in 2002. It continued to play a major role in economic and military affairs, but it was returned to Panama at the end of 1999.

DOC.Title: Nicaragua
DOC.TEXT: Country of Central America. I continued to receive interference from the United States.

DOC.Title: Haiti
DOC.TEXT: An island in the Caribbean. Although it became independent as the first black republic in 1804, it continued to receive interference from the United States economically due to the consumption of land by sugarcane cultivation, and received interference from the United States.

DOC.Title: Mexican Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Latin America 's first authentic democratic revolution. 1910 Madero and others' liberals caused an armed uprising, overthrowing the Dias dictatorship (1876-1911) for 11 years, Madero became president. However, the Revolution broke up in the conflict over land reform, Madero was defeated in the coup of generic welter in 13 years and was assassinated. Hellaita regime was overthrown for 14 years, but the civil war continued after that by the Karansa school, the Pyrillic school and the Zapata faction. In 15 years the Karansa faction won, the democratic constitution was enacted for 17 years, the Mexican revolution ended.

DOC.Title: Diaz
DOC.TEXT: Mexican dictator. Succeeded the coup in 1876 and became president (1877-80, 84-1911). It revived the privilege of the landowner class and progressed dependency on Britain and the U.S. capital, so it was expelled in the 1911 revolution.

DOC.Title: Madero
DOC.TEXT: Liberals of Mexico. In 1910 calling for an armed uprising to succeed in overthrowing the Dias administration, he took office as president (1911-13). In contrast to the land reform, the administration became unstable in conflict with the farmers' forces of Zapata and others, it was assassinated in the coup of his own welter general in 13 years.

DOC.Title: Zapata
DOC.TEXT: Farmer movement leader of the Mexican Revolution. He stood in the position of small farmers and poor farmers, insisted on thorough land reform and resurrection of the common land, and led the farmers army. It was assassinated by the Caransa school.

DOC.Title: billiard
DOC.TEXT: The leader of the Mexican Revolution. They are from farmers. I was alleged to be a Caransa school allied with Zapata, but it was assassinated.

DOC.Title: Caransa
DOC.TEXT: Mexican politician. He won the Mexican revolution and assumed office as president (1917-20). In 1917, he issued a constitution that stipulated land reform, nationalization of underground resources, separation of religion and social rights, security of social rights, etc. After that, he did not carry out the constitution faithfully, was assassinated losing support of the people.

DOC.Title: Three Emperor Alliance
DOC.TEXT: The alliance between the three emperors of Germany (Wilhelm I), Austria (Franz Josef I), Russia (Alexandre II). Bismarck, devoted to France 's revenge, became the center and tied. It was virtually meaningless in the Austrian-Russian interest conflict at the time of the Berlin Conference (1878), but it was revived in 1981 and lasted until 1987.

DOC.Title: Self alliance
DOC.TEXT: Military alliance between Germany and Austria. In commemoration of Russia's dissatisfaction with the decision of the Berlin Conference and gradually leaving Germany, we promised full mutual assistance when attacking from Russia. It survived until 1918.

DOC.Title: Three Kingdoms alliance
DOC.TEXT: Secret military alliance signed between Germany, Austria and Italy. Bismarck played an important role in Germany's French security diplomacy. Italy with conflict of interest with Austria over "uncollected Italy" collapsed because of withdrawal during the First World War.

DOC.Title: reinsurance treaty, double security treaty
DOC.TEXT: The confidential treaty between Germany and Russia concluded in 1887. Results of Bismarck diplomacy to prevent Russia from approaching France with deepening conflict with Austria in the Balkan Peninsula issue. When one of the two countries attacked, we promised to keep neutral with each other. It survived until 1890, but Wilhelm II refused Russian renewal request.

DOC.Title: Wilhelm II
DOC.TEXT: Emperor of Germany (ranking 1888-1918). Shortly after the coronation in 1890, he began retiring Bismarck and retired. Implemented an aggressive expansion policy called "global policy" to deepen confrontation with the UK, abdicated after losing World War I.

DOC.Title: Russian alliance
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1891-94. Political and military agreement concluded with Russia, which was separated from Germany by the dismissal of the re-insurance treaty, with France which was isolated since the Prussian-France war. It fought against the Three Kingdoms alliance and survived until 1917.

DOC.Title: Pan = Germanism
DOC.TEXT: The idea of ​​expanding the power of the Germanic people (German ethnic groups) has become the slogan for Germany to enter Balkan after 1890. It conflicted with Pan-Slavism and contributed to the First World War.

DOC.Title: 3B policy
DOC.TEXT: 3 B is the initials of the three cities of Berlin-Byzantium (former name of Istanbul) and Baghdad. Through the construction of railroads connecting these cities, we compare the German imperialist policy, which tried to make progress toward West Asia, with the British 3C policy.

DOC.Title: Baghdad Railway
DOC.TEXT: A railroad (plan) leading to Persian Gulf from Turkey's Conia to Baghdad. Although various strengths aimed, Germany won the right to lay down in 1899 and established a company in 1903. Ultimately it was only partially open.

DOC.Title: 3C policy
DOC.TEXT: 3 C is the initials of the three cities of Cape Town, Cairo, Calcutta. I called the British imperialist policy aimed at expanding power to areas connecting these cities. It was named against German 3B policy.

DOC.Title: "Honorable isolation"
DOC.TEXT: A word symbolizing isolated foreign policy that became a British tradition through the 19th century. This isolation policy was possible due to economic power as "factory of the world" and powerful navy power, but as a result of joining the Japan-UK alliance with Russia in 1902 to combat the expansion of power in the Far East, this policy It was abandoned.

DOC.Title: Japan-UK alliance
DOC.TEXT: In order to counter Russia 's entry into East Asia, the alliance the United Kingdom abandoned its long-standing isolation policy and tied with Japan. In 1921, it was abolished in the four-party treaty at the Washington Conference.

DOC.Title: English French mutual agreement
DOC.TEXT: We mutually approved the superiority rights of Egypt in the UK and Morocco in France. In order to counter the German expansion policy, the long confrontation relationship between Britain and France has been resolved and cooperative relationship has been entered.

DOC.Title: EU Russia Cooperation
DOC.TEXT: Iran (north Russia · southeast is Britain) · Afghanistan (Britain) · Tibet (mutual insistence non-interference), agreed the scope of power of the two countries. The conflict between the two countries was relaxed, and cooperative relations were formed against Germany's eastern direction policy.

DOC.Title: Three countries negotiations
DOC.TEXT: British, French and Russian partnership relations in Britain, France and Russia formed as a result of the establishment of the British French Alliance in 1891, the British French correspondent in 1904, and the British troupe in 1907. As a result, the German enclosure network was completed and conflicted with the alliance of the three countries. It was dissolved due to Russia's withdrawal at the Russian Revolution in 1917.

DOC.Title: Morocco incident
DOC.TEXT: Two times in 1905, 11 years, a collision case of French imperialism over Morocco. Morocco is a strategic point of Africa facing the Mediterranean Sea.

DOC.Title: Protected Morocco, France Morocco Protected Nationalization
DOC.TEXT: According to the second Moroccan incident of the previous year, the protection right of France was established.

DOC.Title: Battle race competition
DOC.TEXT: A conflict between the British and German naval forces between the end of the 19th century and the First World War. It began with the fact that Wilhelm II of Germany began construction of a large fleet and it became a major cause of worsening relations between the two countries.

DOC.Title: 'European powderhouse'
DOC.TEXT: Expression attached to the Balkan Peninsula, which was in a state of unrelenting eve of the First World War. While the Ottoman Empire, which once dominated this area, faded, the nationalism of small countries increased and the bread-germanism of Russian imperialism Pan-Slavism and German imperialism clashing to try to encourage and utilize it Then the crisis of war was imminent.

DOC.Title: Pan = Slavism principle
DOC.TEXT: A way of thinking to expand the power of Slavic people, mainly Russia. Together with the traditional South-South policy of Russia, it became the slogan of Russian imperialism aiming to advance into the Balkans from the late nineteenth century, clashing with Pan-Germanism.

DOC.Title: Serbia
DOC.TEXT: As a result of the Russian-Turkish war, in 1878 a small country of slavic system independent of the Ottoman Empire. Aspiring to expand the territory, deepening the conflict with Austria in the west neighborhood, he was at the forefront of Russian leadership of Pan-Slavism.

DOC.Title: Youth Turkish Revolution
DOC.TEXT: In July 1908, in the Ottoman Empire, a group known as "Youth Turkey" was a revolution aimed at overthrowing tyranny and reviving the Constitution. After that, the youth Turkish cabinet was organized, conservative though it did modernize Western, but dismantled at the defeat of the First World War.

DOC.Title: Bulgaria independence
DOC.TEXT: Bulgaria won autonomy from the Ottoman Empire in the Saint-Stefano Convention after the Russian-Turkish war in 1878, but on October 5, 1908, it accomplished complete independence on the turmoil of the youth Turkish revolution.

DOC.Title: Bosnia-Herzegovina annexation
DOC.TEXT: On 6th October 1908, Austria multiplied the turmoil of the youth Turkish revolution and declared consolidation. There were many Slavic residents in both regions, Serbia was eager to consolidate, so Serbia's anti Austrian sentiment increased at a stroke.

DOC.Title: Large Serbianism
DOC.TEXT: The goal of Serbia, which wants to integrate all the residential areas of neighboring Slavic residents under Serbian kingdom.

DOC.Title: Italy = Turkish War
DOC.TEXT: In Italy's invasion war, I took the Ottoman Empire territory Tripoli Kirenaika and made it a colony.

DOC.Title: Vulcan alliance
DOC.TEXT: Anti-Austrian alliance based on Pan-Slavism, formed by Serbia, Greece, Bulgaria, Montenegro under the guidance of Russia.

DOC.Title: First Balkan War
DOC.TEXT: The Balkan alliance and the wars of the Ottoman Empire. The Ottoman Empire was defeated and was deprived of the European territory excluding Istanbul and Crete in the London Treaty of May 13th.

DOC.Title: Secondary Balkan War
DOC.TEXT: Serbia, Greece, and Montenegro, followed by Romania and the Ottoman siege against Bulgaria, as a result of the First Balkan War as the acquisition territory of Bulgaria was excessive. Bulgaria, who lost a lot of territory after losing, approached the German-Austrian side.

DOC.Title: Universal Peace Conference
DOC.TEXT: In response to the deepening international crisis, Russian emperor Nikolai II advocated and held in The Hague, the Netherlands. Although the goal of reduction of armaments could not be reached, a decision such as the establishment of an international arbitration court was made.

DOC.Title: International Arbitration Court
DOC.TEXT: 1901 Court founded in The Hague for peaceful treatment of international disputes. Although I did not get much achievement, the idea was handed down to the International Court of Justice.

DOC.Title: Anti-war movement
DOC.TEXT: Imperialism Mainly by socialists, workers' organizations, intellectuals and colonial people within each country, but as war comes near and actually breaks out, many of them are going through war policy Cooperation, the movement was frustrated.

DOC.Title: Tolstoy
DOC.TEXT: Bunraku of Russia. I prayed for peace from the standpoint of humanitarianism, denying the war.

DOC.Title: Anatole = France
DOC.TEXT: French literary. After knowing the actual condition of imperialism in the First World War, after the Russian Revolution he was active in anti-war / anti-imperialism position.

DOC.Title: Roman-Roland
DOC.TEXT: French literary. Since he was active in advocating Dreyfus in the Dreyfus case, he wrote works that appeal for humanity love, justice and peace throughout his life. Even after the First World War, he was active in the front lines of peace activities, including calling for the Amsterdam Anti-War Games.

DOC.Title: Russell
DOC.TEXT: British philosopher and mathematician. After World War I, he continued to argue anti war positively.

DOC.Title: Jean-Jeres
DOC.TEXT: Leader of the French Unification Socialist Party. As the crisis of the great warfare increased and many of them were inclined to patriotism, they were strongly asserted anti-war, so they were assassinated by the right-wing nationalist on July 31, the great war.

DOC.Title: Rosa-Luxembourg
DOC.TEXT: A German female revolutionary from Poland. I persisted against the argument against the war.

DOC.Title: Second International
DOC.TEXT: An international federation of socialist political parties and labor unions formed in 1889 at the International Socialist Convention in Paris. The German Social Democratic Party became the center of activity and opposed the imperialist war. However, just before the First World War, the defense game was considered legitimate, converted to war support, abandoned its international role and virtually collapsed.

DOC.Title: German Social Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1890, the German Socialist Workers' Party was renamed and reached today. It played a central role in the second international, but in World War I endorse the war policy and led the second international to collapse.

DOC.Title: Basel extraordinary competition
DOC.TEXT: The Second International Special General Meeting held in 1912. While deepening the crisis of the great war, I resolved against the war.

DOC.Title: Chinese division, Chinese national division
DOC.TEXT: When the weak bodies of the Qing Dynasty were revealed in the defeat of the Sino-Japanese War, the strength of the force embarked on China division. The form mainly focused on acquiring interests such as railway laying rights and mining rights for mining, loaning and leasing the main points, setting the scope of power, and concluding a non-concession treaty. In the few years only a large part was substantially broken up strongly.

DOC.Title: ODA Loan
DOC.TEXT: Lending and borrowing of funds among countries. In Qing Dynasty it starts with a loan for payment of reparations after the Nisshin War. As the guarantee of repayment of the loan, the Chinese government used it as a means of security division of the strong power because it provided the customs, salt tariff as collateral, and the right to railway construction and the like.

DOC.Title: Railroad Laying Rights
DOC.TEXT: Qing Dynasty, one of the interests acquired by China in China, became the subject of foreign capital investment. There was a railway laying right, management administration right and others, and Rohan 2 or railroad (later Keihan Eraito, opening in 1905) laying was the beginning.

DOC.Title: Siberian Railway
DOC.TEXT: The longest railway in the world running east to west in Russian territory. It usually refers to between Vladivostok and Chelya Pinsk close to the Ural Mountains. Construction started in 1891 with the introduction of French capital, and by 1905 the line connecting with the Dongseo Railway was completed. It played an important role in promoting Russia's Siberian development and Far East policy.

DOC.Title: Todoke Railway
DOC.TEXT: A railway consisting of a main line extending from Manchuri ri to Suifen River and a branch line from Harbin to Lord Dalian. The main line was built as a compensation for the interference of the three countries in 1896, and the branch line was constructed with Russia acquiring the right to lay respectively in 1998.

DOC.Title: Mine mining right
DOC.TEXT: Qing Qing, one of the interests that Kengitsu acquired in China. Including mine survey, mining, management and other rights. In 1896, Russia acquired the digging right in the Heilongjiang · Jilin area, etc. In 1998, Germany got a mining right in the Shandong peninsula and Russia got the mining right in the Tohoku region south.

DOC.Title: leasing
DOC.TEXT: Part of the territory of another country is borrowed by the state by treaty. The government, the legislation and the judicial authority in the leasehold land during the lease period were held by the leasing country, and occasionally the troops were stationed, and they had the character of de facto territorial crisis. After the Sino-Japanese War, the demand for lease to China by the strong power increased.

DOC.Title: Jiaozhou Bay
DOC.TEXT: The bay on the southwest coast of the Shandong peninsula. Germany occupied the missionary killing as an excuse in 1897 and leased it in 1998. The deadline is 99 years. Germany built Qingdao City and used it as the base of the Oriental fleet.

DOC.Title: Liaodong Peninsula Southern part, Ryutsu / Dalian
DOC.TEXT: In 1898 Russia lent and borrowed, they built a military port and a commercial port in Dalian to be a fortress in order of travel. Deadline 25 years.

DOC.Title: Weihaihu
DOC.TEXT: The seaport on the northeast coast of the Shandong peninsula. British leased in 1898 against the Russian trip order · Dalian lease and lending · It became the base of the oriental fleet. Deadline 25 years.

DOC.Title: Kowloon Peninsula
DOC.TEXT: The other side of Hong Kong. In 1898 Britain lent and borrowed areas other than the British territory. The deadline is 99 years.

DOC.Title: New boundary
DOC.TEXT: It is an area with the Kowloon Peninsula and the attached islands added.

DOC.Title: Guangzhou Bay
DOC.TEXT: Bay of eastern coast of Raizhou peninsula in Guangdong province. It was occupied by France in 1898 and leased in 1999. The deadline is 99 years.

DOC.Title: Fujian Province
DOC.TEXT: Ministry located in the eastern part of China, opposite Taiwan. Japan let the Qing Dynasty acknowledge the disqualification and made it a range of power.

DOC.Title: John = Hay
DOC.TEXT: American diplomat. 1899 In the days of President McKinley 's Secretary of State, issued a declaration of opening the door to China.

DOC.Title: Open door declaration
DOC.TEXT: Secretary of State Secretary Hay declared that the country was asked for security concerning China. In 1899 he opened the door and equal opportunity, and in 1900 proposed territorial integrity. Hei is known as the three principles, its intention was to interrupt the Chinese market in the United States.

DOC.Title: "Sleeping Lion"
DOC.TEXT: Metaphors pointing to China until the Nisshin War that Western countries attached. When the disablement of the Qing revealed by the disastrous defeat in the Sino-Japanese War, the strength of the force embarked actively on the Chinese division.

DOC.Title: Variant movement, variant self-strong
DOC.TEXT: Political reform movement held in Qing Dynasty (1895-98). Ko Kekira and others aimed at establishing a constitutional monarchy based on the Congressional politics with the Meiji Restoration of Japan as a model. It was dealt with reflecting that the official movement was revealed that it revealed its limit, such as losing out to the Sino-Japanese war because the political reform was focused on the ingestion of Western technology mainly because it did not reform the politics.

DOC.Title: Variant of 戌
DOC.TEXT: Political reform promoted by Kaoru's year (1898), Kang Tae-hyeong, Liang Liu, Tan Tatsunaga etc. to Emperor Koumi (Variant Movement). Due to non-cooperation of the central and regional conservatives and counterattack by conservatives, it failed in just over three months.

DOC.Title: Yang Dynasty
DOC.TEXT: Kiyotsugu scholar / politician. Born from Guangdong. It also leads to Western science including Chinese classics, and advocated "variant method self-determination" from the viewpoint of public shearing. In 1888 he overwrote the emperor and presented the reform theory, and in 1998 he was appointed to the Light Empire (Tokusho) and carried out a modified method. It fainted with the political change of Bin, and exiled to Japan. Even then, insisting on maintaining emperor with the emperor 's emperor as the center, conflicts with the revolutionaries of Sun Yat-seng and others.

DOC.Title: Pruning school
DOC.TEXT: "Spring and Autumn" School with oral legion orthodox. In the latter part of Qing dynasty I criticized the empirical studies and emphasized the philosophy linked to real politics.

DOC.Title: Liang Ching-hy
DOC.TEXT: Qing dynasty's first scholar, politician, journalist. Although he was active in the variant movement, such as issuing an educational magazine under the Yang Dynasty, since the political change of Boryoku happened, he exiled to Japan and continued the Constitutional Movement afterwards. After returning to the country after the Shang Revolution, he took charge of the judiciary general, the general secretary general etc.

DOC.Title: Mitsudo Emperor
DOC.TEXT: Qing Dynasty Eleventh Emperor (ruling 1875-1908). He reigned at the age of four, and until the year 1887 Nishiuchi served as a regent. Parents began at the age of 17, and Yang Dynasty was appointed in 1998 to implement a modified method, but he was defeated by the political change of Ben.

DOC.Title: political change of 戌
DOC.TEXT: A case where a conservative faction centered around Nishiakatta suppressed a modified method of Mikado. It is said that the variants were defeated by Koni Yui 's obscurity acts. The Emperor of God was confined and politics of Nishi-Tajima resurrected.

DOC.Title: Nishiuchi
DOC.TEXT: Emperor 's mother in the side room of Xianfeng emperor. In the era of the same period Together with Dongtagashi held the real power of politics. Later he set up his nephew 's light emperor and took power as regent himself, but left the temporary affairs temporarily due to the emperor' s parents. However, when Emperor Kwan emphasized Kang Shihei and promoted a variant movement, he caused a political change in Baekje, repressed the transformation movement, deprived the real power, and inflicted Kodo Emperor. The center of the court conservatives.

DOC.Title: Yoshikazu
DOC.TEXT: Based on Shandong province, the White Lotus religious association who trained martial art called Yoshiwa fist. Due to German advance to the Shandong peninsula and antipathy against Christianity of propagation, it spread to the poor farmers, the migrants, the lower workers in the north of the country and expanded their forces. Armed uprising raising "Ryo Qiong Rui", a Yoshikaze incident occurred.

DOC.Title: Enemy Movement
DOC.TEXT: Anti-Christian movement occurred throughout China in the late 19th century. Since the admission of Christianity in the Beijing Treaty in 1860, the teaching (Christianity propaganda, life style, emotions and friction of Chinese people, resulting in consequences) occurred frequently. It began with the murder of France missionaries in Guangxi province in 1856, and then continued in various places afterwards, followed by the teaching of Tianjin in 1970 and the Yangtze River basin dating in 1991. Especially Germany 's advance as a pretext of the murder of German missionaries in Shandong in 1997 exploded as a Shandong tribe by Yoshikazu since 1998 and developed into a massive anti-imperialism / exclusion movement.

DOC.Title: "Ryohei Suena"
DOC.TEXT: The ecological slogan of Yoshiwa called "to extinguish foreign forces by supporting the Qing Dynasty".

DOC.Title: Yoshikazai incident
DOC.TEXT: Evocation exercise that the Yoshikazu center was centered, "exclaimed Yuan Qiu" and "demobilized people" were taken against the backdrop of the dissatisfaction of the people who increased their lives with imperialists advancing to China. The power of the Yoshie went up to Shandong, but in June 1900 he entered Beijing and killed Japanese and German diplomats. The Qing Dynasty also declared war with the strong power in the same month. On the contrary, the Allied forces of eight countries dispatched, and since August occupied Beijing, Nishiutaka and others were able to escape to Xi'an. The Beijing Protocol was signed in September the following year, and China 's semi-colonization became definitive.

DOC.Title: Co-dispatch of eight countries
DOC.TEXT: Eight countries of Japan, Russia, the United Kingdom, the United States, Germany, France, Austria and Italy were dispatched and defeated Yoshikazu and Qing Army in cooperation. At that time the British was a South African war, while the United States was in the Philippine 's Aginald' s suppression, there was no margin for troops, the geographically close Japan and Russia aiming for advance to the Far East were the mainstay.

DOC.Title: Beijing Protocol, Shimokazaba
DOC.TEXT: Final protocol on the peace treaty of the Yoshikaze incident which was signed between Qing Dynasty and 11 countries (8 military countries and Belgium, the Netherlands and Spain) in Beijing on September 7, 1901. The contents consisting of Article 12 include: (1) 39-year installment payments of 450 million both of which are collateralized by customs duties and salt taxes; (2) foreign troops in the area where the Beijing Legal Affairs Office is located; (3) Punishment of responsible persons in central and rural incidents and suspension of related provincial accountants for 5 years, (4) apology for the use of apology to Japan and Germany, (5) amendment of the trade and navigation treaty, (6) (7) weapons ammunition and the two-year suspension of import of its manufactured materials, etc., further advanced China's semi-colonization.

DOC.Title: Beijing housekeeping right
DOC.TEXT: In addition to winning the military power for the defense of the area where the Liberation Division is located, Mr. Kuniaki made it allow him to occupy the agreement area in order to maintain free traffic in the area including Beijing, Tianjin, Tanggu and Sankaikan.

DOC.Title: semi colonies
DOC.TEXT: Nominal is a country that is in a colonial state, even in an independent country. China, which was deprived of economic freedom by the invasion of European and American powers, is typical.

DOC.Title: occupation in Manchuria, station in the Tohoku region of Russia
DOC.TEXT: Russian troops, which became the mainstay of suppression of the Yoshikazu, stayed in the Tohoku region even after the incident, further strengthened and occupied the various regions, and also advanced to Korea. Korea who caught the interference of Japan approached Russia.

DOC.Title: Japan-UK alliance
DOC.TEXT: The alliance of Japan and Britain established in 1902. In the UK, which was wary of Russia, France and Germany's advancement, Russia abandoned the traditional "honorable isolation" against the situation that Russia restrained its troops in the Tohoku region of China even after the Yoshiwa incident, and also threatened Korea, I felt a threat to the south of the country, concluded an alliance with Japan that has ambition for Korea. In the content there was a military alliance character that one of the signatory countries entered a war, the other was neutral, and if a third country joined the enemy side, participate.

DOC.Title: Russo-Japanese War
DOC.TEXT: Japan and Russia 's imperialist war over the control of Korea and the Tohoku region of China. UK and USA supported Japan, Russia France and Germany, respectively. The war began with Japan's journey of attacks and Japan won the victory in the battle where the southern part of China Tohoku region, the Yellow Sea and the Japan Sea were the main battlefields. However, the national strength of Japan quickly went down, while in Russia the first Russian revolution broke out, making continuation of the war difficult. Both countries enjoyed peace with American President Theodore-Rosewalt.

DOC.Title: Blood Sunday incident
DOC.TEXT: A case where the army fired at a peaceful petition demo of workers led by monks Gapon in the capital Russia 's capital, firearms caught more than 2,000 people. After the incident, strikes of workers in the capital spread to the national strikes and furthermore to the first Russian revolution. As a result, the Russian government lost confidence and reserve capacity to carry out the Russo-Japanese War and decided to stand for peace.

DOC.Title: Fengian battle
DOC.TEXT: The last great decisive battle on land at the Russo-Japanese War. Fengtian is the present Shenyang in the northeastern China. Japan has triumphant but national strength and military power have reached their limits anymore.

DOC.Title: Battle of the Japan Sea
DOC.TEXT: A naval battle where the Russian Baltic fleet was destroyed by the Japanese Navy in the Sea of ​​Japan. In order to break the morphological disadvantage on land, Russia made the Baltic fleet from the Baltic Sea destroy the Japanese Navy and cut the transportation route with Japan, but fatigue in the voyage over half a year also overlapped and was defeated .

DOC.Title: Theodore = Rose Velt, Theodore = Roosevelt
DOC.TEXT: President of the 26th US Presidency (1901-09). He mediated the peace treaty of the Russo-Japanese War and arranged a Portsmouth meeting.

DOC.Title: Portsmouth Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of the Russo-Japanese War signed in Portsmouth, USA. All rights are Kotaro Komura and Witte. Russia is offering to Japan (1) protection rights of Korea, (2) transfer of lease rights in the southern part of Liaodong Peninsula, (3) southern Manchuria Railway (south of Changchun of the East Railway) and its concessions, (4) Sakhalin) campaign south of 50 degrees, and (5) transfer of Primorsky fishery right, but refused reparation payment.

DOC.Title: Korean protection rights
DOC.TEXT: Russia confirmed Japan's superiority in the Korean Peninsula.

DOC.Title: Liaodong Peninsula South, Kanto State
DOC.TEXT: Japan inherited the right to lend and all related interests from Russia. The term of the loan was extended to 99 years by the 1915 treaty, and it became the front base of the Japanese continental advancement.

DOC.Title: South Manchurian Railway
DOC.TEXT: The railway between the Changchun and the journey of the East Chung Railway Branch. In order to run this railroad and the railroad line, Japan established South Manchurian Railroad Co., Ltd. (abbreviated "Mitsui") in 1906 and actively promoted entering the continent.

DOC.Title: Minami Kuraba
DOC.TEXT: Russian name Sakhalin. Japan acquired south of 50 degrees north latitude.

DOC.Title: Katsura-Taft Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Memorandum of understanding between Prime Minister Katsura and US Tafto in July 1905. I approved mutual respect for America's priority and control over the Philippines in Japan against Korea.

DOC.Title: Japan-France agreement
DOC.TEXT: Agreement between Japan and France signed in Paris. Indochina in France, Korea in Japan, Kanto province etc, etc. Secret Exchange Exchange letter supports interests in Fujian Province in Japan.

DOC.Title: Japan-Russia Agreement
DOC.TEXT: After the Russo-Japanese War, an agreement between Japan and Russia intended to jointly defend the interests of both countries. It was concluded four times since the first in June 1907. First, we promised mutual respect of the rights gained from China by both countries, agreed in respect of the special interests and the scope of power in Russia 's external Mongolia in Japan' s Korea by secret clause.

DOC.Title: Japan immigration exclusion
DOC.TEXT: After the Russo-Japanese War, the issue of exclusion of Japanese workers intensified in the United States. 1906 San Francisco school entrance refusal incidents and 9 years passed in the California State Immigration Control Law passed. It was the background of wariness to Japan in the isolated American in East Asia.

DOC.Title: Korean Empire
DOC.TEXT: After the defeating country, Qing Dynasty was defeated by the Sino-Japanese War, Kao renamed the Korean Empire and thrust himself to the emperor in order to show that Korea is an independent country.

DOC.Title: Independent Association
DOC.TEXT: A political association formed in Korea in 1896. In opposition to Russia's domestic interference, aiming at securing independence and reforming the state government, it was broken down by the conservative squeeze in 1998.

DOC.Title: Japan-South Korea Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Agreement over 1904, 05, 2007 and 3 rd order. It strengthened the interference control of Japan against Korea, and it became a pillar of consolidation.

DOC.Title: First Japan-South Korea Agreement
DOC.TEXT: He forced Korean diplomacy and finance to have advisers on dispatching the Japanese government.

DOC.Title: 2nd Japan-South Korea Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Agreement that Japan who won the Russo-Japanese War compelled Korea. It is also called Korea Protection Convention. Korea was deprived of voluntary diplomatic power and was regarded as a protected country in Japan.

DOC.Title: superintendent
DOC.TEXT: In 1905, the head of the Korea National Security Bureau established in the 2nd Japan-South Korea Agreement. Staying in Han Castle (present Seoul), he conducted Korean diplomatic affairs and oversees domestic affairs. Hirofumi Ito is the first superintendent.

DOC.Title: Anti-Japanese Yuzen Struggle
DOC.TEXT: Anti-Japanese armed struggle of Korean people. In 1896 after the incidents of the murder of the Minister, an early war broke out. It occurred again after 1905, and it became intensified further by the forced dissolution of the Korean army in 2007. Spreading throughout Korea, spreading guerrilla warfare in various places for nearly 10 years, made Japan difficult to rule.

DOC.Title: Patriotic Enlightenment Movement
DOC.TEXT: Movement aimed at raising ethnic awareness and independence of Korea, opposed to Japan's control through cultural activities. It began full-fledged since 1906.

DOC.Title: Hague's encouragement case
DOC.TEXT: A case where Korean Kojong tried to appeal the invalidity of the 2nd Japan-South Korea Agreement and the unjustness of Japan control by dispatching a secretary to the 2nd World Peace Conference held in The Hague of the Netherlands. With this as an excuse, Japan abdicated Takajong and robbed domestic authority of the Korean government greatly. It was rather an excuse for the pressure of Japan.

DOC.Title: Third Japan-South Korea Agreement
DOC.TEXT: All of the Korean government was supposed to be guided by the superintendent, and the Korean army was dissolved.

DOC.Title: Ito Hirofumi
DOC.TEXT: A Japanese politician in the Meiji Era. He became the first Korean superintendent (responsible 1905-09) and promoted the consolidation of Korea by Japan. It was shot dead at Harbin station head 09.

DOC.Title: A heavy root
DOC.TEXT: Korean independence activist. It assassinated Hirobumi Itoh as the primary cause of the Korean loser country, assassinated at the head of Harbin station in 1909, and was killed in the following year.

DOC.Title: Convention on Korea consolidation, Japan-Korea consolidation treaty
DOC.TEXT: Signed in August 1910. In Korea, there was a strong protest, but in Japan there was hardly any opposite movement.

DOC.Title: Korea annexation
DOC.TEXT: In August 1910, Japan compelled South Korea to "Convention on Korea Consolidation", making Korea completely Japanese colonies. Through the third Japan-South Korea agreement already, Japan 's imperialism and colonial rule, which had strengthened interference control over Korea, was completed.

DOC.Title: Korean Governor's Office
DOC.TEXT: The Korean Governing Body, which oversees all of military and administrative affairs. It was placed in Kyoto (current Seoul) and was regarded as an institution under the Emperor. Matsuhiro Terauchi is the first governor.

DOC.Title: Kodo Shinmasaki, Shinkansen
DOC.TEXT: Reform after the Yoshiekai incident toward the modern state (the constitutional monarchy state) where the Qing Dynasty began. Establishment of schools, abolition of examinations, creation of new forces, preparations for the Constitutional Charter, and so on.

DOC.Title: New Army
DOC.TEXT: Western style army founded in China after the Sino-Japanese War. Shinkansen Army abbreviation. Initially called the Warlord Army, in 1895 the Yuan Seika reorganized it and renamed it Shinkan Army. Modeled on the German army, it became the best in the North Army. After the Yoshiwa incident, new ministry organization was advanced at each ministry, and the studying abroad students from the province became officers and soldiers. Many young people who lead to the revolutionary school became fuse lines to the Shihai Revolution.

DOC.Title: abolition of the enumeration
DOC.TEXT: In 1905, it was carried out in the opinion of Yu Nishi Kai and Zhang Yong-dong.

DOC.Title: Constitution Outline
DOC.TEXT: An outline of the Constitution issued by the Qing Dynasty in 1908. It consists of Article 14 of Kimiji University and Article 8 of the subject's rights and obligations. As a model of the Meiji Constitution of Japan, including the emperor 's all-ever system and sacredness of invincibility, the character who intends to reinforce the Qing Dynasty was strong.

DOC.Title: Diet commitment commitment
DOC.TEXT: In 1908, Qing Dynasty promised the opening of the National Assembly for 16 years with the launch of the Constitution Outline. However, there was an exercise calling for early opening, and in 1910, Qing Dynasty promised the opening of the Diet in 13 years (5 years of declaration).

DOC.Title: Abolition of military aircraft department
DOC.TEXT: In 1911, Qing Dynasty abolished the cabinet (university) and military affairs department (military aid minister) so far, taking a responsible cabinet system, and under the jurisdiction of the prime minister, set the ten ministers below foreign affairs. However, many of them were occupied by Manchurian royalty and bought disrepute.

DOC.Title: Chinese overseas
DOC.TEXT: Chinese who went to Southeast Asia region, especially overseas, committing the ban. After the Ming Dynasty, the number increased, and thanks to unity and mutual aid, many people succeeded economically locally. It became a source of funding for the revolutionary movements of Sun Yat-seng and others against the backdrop of abusive and abundant funding power.

DOC.Title: International student
DOC.TEXT: Many international students were sent to developed countries since the promotion of the Occupation Movement, but many of them were native capitalists, they had an anti-quiet mind and became the center of promotion of the revolutionary movement. There were a lot of studying abroad in Japan.

DOC.Title: Sun Yat-sen
DOC.TEXT: The leader of the Chinese Revolution. Issue Yuzen · Nakayama. Born in Guangdong Province. I learned medicine, but I soon hoped for a revolution, and in 1894 I formed Konkaku-kai in Hawaii. Supported by the overseas Chinese and other, the next year failed to armed uprising in Guangzhou failed. In 1905, he organized the China Alliance in Japan and mobilized revolutionary forces. Constructed the Republic of China with the Shang Revolution and assumed office as the extraordinary president, he was chased by Yuan Sei and subsequently dedicated his whole life to the Chinese Revolution, including organizing the Chinese Revolutionary Party and the Chinese National Party. Today also from both China and Taiwan with different structures, they are gaining deep respect, including being called "the pioneer of the Chinese Revolution" "Kunio Father".

DOC.Title: Kowakai @
DOC.TEXT: In 1894, Sun Yat-sen received the support of Chinese overseas, a revolutionary association centered on the Cantonese, organized in Hawaii. The following year, headquartered in Hong Kong, in 1895 Guangzhou, an armed uprising in Huizhou in 1900 failed but failed. It became the center of the China alliance formed in Tokyo in 1905.

DOC.Title: Chapter Branin
DOC.TEXT: Qing dynasty's first scholar / revolutionary. Initially we approached the variant school of Kang Sharag and others, but after the political change in Bin, we approached Sun Yat-sen and joined the China Alliance. It was reunited with the Sun Yat-sen in 1910 and became Chairman of Light Rebirth. After returning to the Republic after the Shaoyan Revolution and participating in the ROC government, he disappeared in opposition to the imperial resurrection of Yusei Ka. Later years I devoted myself to a country study.

DOC.Title: Optical Resurrection
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary organization formed by chapter Bang Bin and others in 1904. Cai Yuan culture was chaired. In 2005 he joined the China Alliance, but conflicted with Sun Yat-sen and others, and in 1910 he reunited with chairman Bang Lin. Dissolved in 1912.

DOC.Title: Hakuikai @
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary group formed by Hwang Hoa and others around the end of 1903. In 2005 he participated in the China Alliance.

DOC.Title: China Alliance
DOC.TEXT: In 1905, a revolutionary organization formed in Tokyo centering on Sun Yat-sen. Stimulated by the world situation such as the Russo-Japanese War, revolutionary organizations such as Kokozakai, Hikari Kaikyo, Hua Kai, etc., gathered together to select Sun Yat-sen in the Prime Minister, Huang Xing as Deputy Prime Minister, As its basic policy. Published the institution magazine 'Komonin' and tried to disseminate revolutionary thought. We also supported Japanese private volunteers. It was reorganized into Kuomintang for 12 years.

DOC.Title: Three democracy
DOC.TEXT: The basic philosophy of the Chinese Revolution advocated by Sun Yat-sen. Contents of national independence, extension of civil rights, stability of civilian life, became the guiding principles of the Chinese alliance · Chinese KMT.

DOC.Title: Ethnic independence
DOC.TEXT: It means overthrowing of different race.

DOC.Title: Expansion of civil rights
DOC.TEXT: It means the establishment of a republican state based on human democracy.

DOC.Title: Consumer stability
DOC.TEXT: We aimed to solve social problems by excluding monopoly of profit of landowners and capitalists.

DOC.Title: Four Principles
DOC.TEXT: At the time of the formation of the China Alliance in 1905, the basic principles that Sun Yat-sen moved up based on San Democracy. "Extermination Prisoner" (Defeat Qing Dynasty) "Repair Chinese", "Founders' Country" "Average Land Rights."

DOC.Title: "Gomen Report"
DOC.TEXT: Agency newspaper of China Alliance. Monthly. It was launched in Tokyo in 1905, and by the tenth year 26 was published. The main authors went over, the Huang dynasty, the chapter Bang Lin, and the Yado wrestling.

DOC.Title: Main national railway nationalization
DOC.TEXT: The policy to take nationalization of privatized railroads issued in May 1911. Qing Dynasty tried to overcome financial difficulties by borrowing from a foreign country with collateralized nationalized railway. In the 1911 railway state-owned decree, Yuan Han Railway (Guangzhou ~ Hanro) · River Han Railway (Sichuan ~ Hanro) was targeted.
