For this reason, the Hokkaido, Hunan, Sichuan and Guangdong provinces formed Keiko Doshishai, and fierce opposition campaigns were held.

DOC.Title: Shikoku Loan Association
DOC.TEXT: The Yokohama loan group formed in 1910 with the banks of the four countries of the United Kingdom, the United States, Germany and France. In 1111, the money reform loan was first formed, and in the same year, the Lake Hirohito railroad loan was established. However, it was scarcely carried out by the Shang Revolution and broke up in 13 years.

DOC.Title: Interest recovery movement
DOC.TEXT: Movement aiming at collecting interests such as railway laying rights and mines mining rights deprived of the strong, and industrial development by national capital.

DOC.Title: Ethnic capital
DOC.TEXT: Although it may mean the capital of my own ethnicity in many cases, most refers to the capital of the race formed in the form of countering foreign capital in developed countries, subordinate countries and colonies. Conflicts with foreign capital, state monopoly capital, buying capital etc., became the center of ethnic independence and unification movement.

DOC.Title: Sichuan Riot
DOC.TEXT: An armed uprising that occurred in Sichuan against the state-owned railway of 1911. A strike occurred in Chengdu in August, and in September the public conflict with the people, constituting an armed uprising in various places of Sichuan. In the Qing Dynasty we dispatched the Hubei New Army and tried to quell it.

DOC.Title: Wuchang Uprising
DOC.TEXT: Army of the Hubei new army which occurred on October 10, 1911. It became the beginning of the Shang Revolution. Revolutionary uprising within the Hubei New Army armed uprising, occupying Wuchang by the morning of 12th. The revolutionary party declared independence of Hubei Province with the rebirth of Libium, who was a military officer of the New Army, and dominated Wuhan Sanseong in Wuchang, Hanyang, Han Rom.

DOC.Title: Xinhai Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that killed the Qing Dynasty and established the Republic of China. After the Yoshikazu incident, the Qing Dynasty undertook a series of reforms called Shinko Shrine, but at the same time the revolutionary movements overturning the Qing Dynasty were rapidly progressing. In May 1911, when the Qing Dynasty issued a railway state-owned ordinance and exaggeratedly oppressed the opposition movement against it, it became clear that Kodo Shinzaki was only a measure to prolong the Manchukui rule indeed, and the revolutionary tone increased further. As the riot that started in Sichuan gets fierce, when the new army of Wucho who was ordered to repress on 10 October (Year of Yin) stands up on the revolution side, the uprising expands at a stretch and the uprising of 14 provinces Declared independence. The foundation of the Republic of China was declared in January 12, Emperor Qing Dynasty abdicated in February, the first republic in China history (ROC) was established. However, soon the real power was deprived by the warlord Yu Seika, and many challenges still remained in realizing the real Chinese revolutionary aims aimed at the revolutionaryists such as Sun Yat-sen (for example, Miyawadaism).

DOC.Title: First Revolution
DOC.TEXT: It refers to the Shang Revolution.

DOC.Title: Foundation of Republic of China
DOC.TEXT: Representatives of ministries that declared independence with the Shang Revolution proclaimed the establishment of Nanking as a temporary general president of Sun Yat-sen in Nanjing. The first republic of Asia was established.

DOC.Title: extraordinary large president
DOC.TEXT: The head of the temporary government of the Republic of China. Sun Yatonenwa was inaugurated on January 1, 1912. But after the destruction of Qing Dynasty, Sun Yaten resigned and on March 10 Yuyo Kai went on to take office.

DOC.Title: Yuusi Kai
DOC.TEXT: The first soldier / politician of Qing Dynasty. He is from Henan Province. He played active in the Hua Military, gained the trust of Lee Hong-ho, and after construction of the New Army after the Sino-Japanese War. Bearing down the variant of the battlefield, he became a shandong in Shandong, preserving his military power in the case of Yoshikaze, he became Minister of Governor-General of North Korea (Hebei Province) and Minister of North Korea after death of Lee Hong-ho and held power. When the Xinhai Revolution occurred, it was appointed from the Qing Dynasty to the Prime Minister, ordered to suppress the revolution but traded with the revolutionary party, on the contrary abolished the Qing Dynasty Emperor in February 1912 and became a temporary large president in March. In addition, in April the temporary government was transferred to Beijing, and in 2001 it took office as the former president (responsible 1913-15). After that, it strengthened the dictatorship and suppressed the second revolution. At the end of 2003, it issued a declaration of the imperial government and resulted in the Third Revolution and died shortly after canceling the 16 years Emperor's Declaration.

DOC.Title: North Army
DOC.TEXT: Kiyuzu, a new army under the control of Director General Shinzo Yuusi Ka. After Yoshiwa incident, it was reinforced under Yuan who held the real power, became the core of the Qing Army, and went to Yuan 's privatization. After the Shang Revolution, Yuan and its captains formed the North Army against the North Army against the background, but after the death of Yuan, they broke up into Anhui and Naomas.

DOC.Title: Feng Shi, Pu Yi
DOC.TEXT: The last Emperor of the Qing Dynasty (Division 1908-12). He reigned at the age of three, and his father's impersonation served as regent. It exiled in February 1912 with Shinsai Revolution. After being expelled from Beijing in 24 years, when Japan built Manchukuo, he took office as Manchuria Governor for 32 years, then became Emperor of Manchukuo (ranking 1934-45). It was caught by the Soviet Union after World War II and served as a war criminal after returning to Japan for 50 years, but he has served as a war criminal from 59 years, after that he sent a life as a citizen.

DOC.Title: Temporary Law
DOC.TEXT: The provisional basic law until the establishment of the Constitution, which was enacted at the beginning of the foundation of the Republic of China. All 7 chapters 56. In order to suppress the authority of the extraordinary large president (specifically, Yuusyo Ka), the power of the House of Councilors, the legislature, was strengthened, and the extraordinary president was supposed to be elected by the House of Councilors.

DOC.Title: KMT
DOC.TEXT: In August 1912, the political party formed by Sung Dynasty et al. Together with the Chinese alliance and others. Winning parliamentary elections, under the crackdown of Yu Nishi Kai, Song Tajin assassinated, the second revolution ended in failure, and it was broken up in November 2001.

DOC.Title: Songjiro
DOC.TEXT: Qing Dynasty and the people's first revolutionaries. As a substantive leader of the Kuomintang, he fought against Yu Nishi Ka but was assassinated in Shanghai.

DOC.Title: Second Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that Jiangxi's Li Wei-Warra sailed against the tyranny of Kenneth Kai and the suppression of the Kuomintang. There was insufficient mobilization of revolutionary forces, and due to insufficient weapons, it was controlled by Yu Nishi Kai, which brought about the strengthening of the dictatorship instead.

DOC.Title: Chinese Revolutionary Party
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary secret society formed in Tokyo in July 1914, Sun Yat-sen. I aimed to rebuild the revolutionary forces after the failure of the second revolution. In 19 years it was reorganized into China Kuomintang.

DOC.Title: Yuyo Kaigai
DOC.TEXT: In October 1913, Kan Yuyo became the official general president, but in November it dissolved the KMT, in 14 years stopped the Diet, promulgated the New Convention Act, etc., strengthened the dictatorship. In 15 years he developed a campaign to revive the imperial reign and enthroned the emperor in January 16. But domestic opposition fierce Domestic third revolution occurred, so in March the declaration of cancellation of the imperial administration, died of illness in June disappointment.

DOC.Title: New Convention Law
DOC.TEXT: The new basic law of the Republic of China that was promulgated in May 1914. It was content to legalize the tyranny of Kaneki.

DOC.Title: Third Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution broke out against the empowerment movement of Yuan Sei Ka. Starting with the uprising of the Yunnan Guardian Army from Yunnan's Tangguang, and spreading to various parts, Yuan declared the cancellation of the imperial March in March. After that the revolutionary faction established an extraordinary government in Guangdong province, gathered to overthrow Yu Sei kai, but after the death of Yuan, it was divided and became a warlord / political party conflict era.

DOC.Title: Warlord
DOC.TEXT: From the death of Yuusi Kajiri to the Suwon national revolutionary army by the stone's National Revolutionary Army, it refers to the factional factions fought over the authority of the Beijing government. Anhui 's Stephen Rui, Naoko' s Cao · Wu Pei Pei, Feng Tai Zhang crafters etc. Behind the warlord, there was support from the imperialist power, respectively, promoting the division of China and the hardship of the people.

DOC.Title: saty, widow's martyrdom
DOC.TEXT: A custom of Hindus where the left wife gets hooked and dies in fire to burn the body of her husband. In the movement of Lam-Mohan-Roy et al., The British colonial government prohibited it by law in 1829, but after that the trend of saying it was "beautiful" remained and it was not completely lost.

DOC.Title: Sherwary Woolwaller
DOC.TEXT: Islamic theologian in India. While pursuing the origin of Islamic thought, we aimed for harmony with real society. That thought later became the theory of resistance to British colonial rule.

DOC.Title: Lahm = Mohan-Roy
DOC.TEXT: Bengali social reform activist. He criticized Hindu idol worship and saty and tried to disseminate modern thought.

DOC.Title: Indian High Administrative System, ICS
DOC.TEXT: In 1858, Indian people also wanted to be a senior official of the Indian government. In addition, by enacting legislation by establishing the Indian Council Act of 1861, we tried to make Indian elite take part in British Indian rule.

DOC.Title: Naology
DOC.TEXT: Indian thinker. The cause of poverty and starvation in India was insisted on liberating from British rule, as being in "the outflow of wealth" from India to the UK. He participated in the Indian National Congress and served as its chairman.

DOC.Title: Indian National Council of India
DOC.TEXT: In 1883, a nationalist organization formed around Banerjee et al. Against the racial discrimination policy. In opposition to this, the National Congress was formed by the colonial government.

DOC.Title: Banerjee
DOC.TEXT: Indian politician / ethnic campaigner. He was a moderate reformist, opposed to racial discrimination, and in 1883 he formed the entire Indian National Council. When the Indian National Congress was founded, it joined this.

DOC.Title: Indian National Congress
DOC.TEXT: In 1885, the organization that Britain was founded by representatives of merchants, landlords, intellectuals and others to divert the Indian dissatisfaction and seek cooperation with Britain. The first was held in Bombay. Initially it was moderate at a meeting only to be consulted by the Governor of India.

DOC.Title: National Council School
DOC.TEXT: Political association of people who participated in the National Congress. Initially it was moderate, but as British governance strengthened and ethnic awareness advanced, he gradually strengthened the anti-British and independent character. In particular, it became radical with the Bengal decree in 1905.

DOC.Title: Tirac
DOC.TEXT: Leader of Indian independence movement from the end of the 19th century to the beginning of the 20th century. He insisted on a radical anti-British struggle, instructed the National Congress Party, and contributed to the adoption of four principles at the Calcutta Games.

DOC.Title: Bengal decree, Curzon law
DOC.TEXT: Legislation to divide Bengal state into East Bengal with many Muslims and West Bengal with many Hindu. Although it was a typical 'divide and conquest' measure aimed at the division of anti-English resistance movement (and increase of land tax), it was rather withdrawn in 1911, intensifying anti-British struggle.

DOC.Title: Cursor
DOC.TEXT: British politician. In the era of Governor-General of India (1899 to 1905) I formulated the Bengal Decree Order (Curzon Act). After that he returned home and took charge of foreign ministers and others.

DOC.Title: 4 Principles of the Calcutta Games
DOC.TEXT: In 1906, the practice plan adopted by the National Council in the opposing struggle against the Bengal Decree Order. Swedish, Swarazi, Ethnic education. It is said that Japan's victory in the Russo-Japanese War encouraged the National Assembly.

DOC.Title: English currency exclusion
DOC.TEXT: Boycott of British commodity.

DOC.Title: Swadeshi
DOC.TEXT: The domestic product favorite meaning. It was also consistent with Indian national capital requirements.

DOC.Title: Swarage
DOC.TEXT: Indian meaning of autonomy and independence.

DOC.Title: Ethnic Education
DOC.TEXT: Denial of colonial education that mentally grim Indian youth, advocating education that encourages Indian awareness and pride.

DOC.Title: All India = Muslim Federation
DOC.TEXT: A political organization of India = Muslims formed in 1906 with the support of Britain. It was a manifestation of British plot to divide with the Hinduism Congress Party.

DOC.Title: Philippine Independence Movement
DOC.TEXT: To Spain's tyranny, it was developed into an ethnic movement aiming at independence from the enlightenment reform movement mainly on returnees from overseas study. The spread of the US = Spanish war into the Philippines, was expected to liberate from colonial rule by the United States, but after all, since the United States was going to rule, the anti-American struggle developed after that.

DOC.Title: Jose-Rizal
DOC.TEXT: Philippine national activist. In 1887, he published a Spanish tyranny in a novel and exiled to various places. He returned home in 1992 and formed a Philippine (ethnic) alliance. It was deemed to be related to the riot of Katipunan and it was shot dead.

DOC.Title: Philippine alliance, Philippine ethnic alliance
DOC.TEXT: In 1892, a nationalist group formed mainly by Rizal. I aimed for independence by a peaceful method.

DOC.Title: Katipunan
DOC.TEXT: A radical radical secret society formed for the Philippine Revolution in 1892. Uprising occurred in August 1996, but was suppressed, and then Agilando became moderate and weakened when it gained the initiative.

DOC.Title: Aginaldo
DOC.TEXT: Leader of the Philippine independence movement. In 1896 he participated in the Philippine Revolution and took office as President of the Revolutionary Government the following year, but was exterminated by the Spanish army. When the American = Spanish war broke out, I returned home with American aid. Declared Independence of the Republic of the Philippines, became the President of the Republic, but the United States did not recognize, developed the conflict against the United States (the Philippines = the American War). He was arrested in 1901 and retired from the resistance movement.

DOC.Title: Philippine Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Beginning with Katipunan 's Spanish armed uprise, it was frustrated with internal division and American intervention.

DOC.Title: Inauguration of the Republic of the Philippines
DOC.TEXT: January 1899

DOC.Title: Maloros Republic
DOC.TEXT: The name of the first Philippine Republic, which was established by the revolutionary government of Aginaldo et al., Promulgated by the Constitution in Malolos. Aginaldo was arrested and collapsed.

DOC.Title: Philippines = American War
DOC.TEXT: The Philippine Revolutionary Government and the American War, established just after the end of the US = Spain War. It was decided that America will be the winner and will become a new ruler of the Philippines to replace Spain.

DOC.Title: Rama V
DOC.TEXT: King Thai (ranking 1868 to 1910). We promoted the administration of the administrative, judicial and military westernization, worked on the abolition of the slavery system, the revision of the inequality treaty, and tried to maintain Thai independence and modernize.

DOC.Title: Vietnamese ethnic movement
DOC.TEXT: Under the rule of France, the Restoration movement aiming at modernization and the Donzoo movement seeking independence occurred, but both were frustrated in response to French crackdown.

DOC.Title: Fan = Boi Chau
DOC.TEXT: Kanji name Ban Heianzhu. Vietnamese scholar / ethnic movement leader. With the aim of liberation from French rule, in 1904 he formed the Shinkokai and organized the Donzoo movement. However, when the movement ceased due to the expulsion of international students by the Japanese government, in the 12th year China formed Guangdong Hikari Light Fight and aimed for a military revolution. It was arrested in France for 25 years and continued to be lifted.

DOC.Title: Ishinha party
DOC.TEXT: A secret society aiming for independence of the French, formed by Fan = Boi Chau and others in 1904. I was expecting Japanese aid, but I was betrayed.

DOC.Title: Donzoo movement, Tohoutai movement
DOC.TEXT: Movement to study in Japan in Vietnam at the beginning of the 20th century. Today, international students in Japan have exceeded 200 people due to the calls of fans = Boie Chow and others who were inspired by Japan's victory in the Russo-Japanese War, but after the Japan-France agreement, Japan's French government I was frustrated with strengthening the enforcement.

DOC.Title: Fan = Cheu Ching
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic activist in Vietnam. Criticizing the policy of Fan = Boi Chau, in cooperation with France aimed at enlightenment modernization. Established Donkin Gijuku, promoted cultural and ethnic movements.

DOC.Title: Donkin Keio
DOC.TEXT: 1907 Fan-Cheu Ching made a decision in Hanoi. There are four divisions of education, finance, propaganda, and writings, supporting the ethnic movement.

DOC.Title: Japan-France agreement
DOC.TEXT: As a result, the Japanese government banished Vietnamese international students at the request of the French government, promising to crack down anti-government movement and independence movement between Japan and France.

DOC.Title: Vietnam Optical Reunion
DOC.TEXT: Anti-Buddha secret society established by Fan-Boi-Chau in 1912. It was stimulated by the Shang Revolution and formed in Guangdong. It aimed at the military revolution but was repressed and faded.

DOC.Title: Indonesian folk movement
DOC.TEXT: For the Dutch tyranny, from the beginning of the 20th century resistive campaign occurred beginning with small ethnic capital of various places, ethnic organizations such as Sarekat-Islam were formed. It gradually evolved into a campaign aimed at independence of Indonesia beyond distinction of region and religion.

DOC.Title: Samin movement
DOC.TEXT: Popular movement started by farmer Samin from the end of the 19th century. He resisted the rule of the Netherlands and sought a return to the primitive communist society.

DOC.Title: Buddy = Utomo
DOC.TEXT: An organization of national movement in early Indonesia formed in 1908. In the meaning of "best wisdom", intellectuals became the main body, seeking improvement of social status and culture of Indonesian people.

DOC.Title: Sarekat = Islam, Islamic alliance
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic movement group formed in central Java in 1911. Initially it was an association formed by Javanese merchants to compete with the Chinese overseas, but eventually it expanded the organization mainly around merchants and intellectuals and became a political organization demanding autonomy against the Netherlands.

DOC.Title: Pan = Islamism
DOC.TEXT: The idea that the Islamic powers unite and try to counter the invasion from foreign countries. In the latter half of the 19th century, it began with the advocacy of Afghani et al., And was disseminated by Mr. Muhammad Abduf of his disciples.

DOC.Title: Afghani
DOC.TEXT: Thinker of Iranian origin (he called Afghan person <Afghanie>). Widely popularized the Islamic world and Europe and advocated Pan-Islamism. He also raised many disciples and influenced constitutional reforms and ethnic movements of Islamic countries.

DOC.Title: Muhammad = Abdouff
DOC.TEXT: Islamic reform thinker in Egypt. I was influenced by Afghani and participated in the rebellion of Urabi. He endeavored to disseminate Islamic reform ideas aimed at harmony between Islamic thought and modern culture and influenced ethnic movements.

DOC.Title: Abdul-Hamito II
DOC.TEXT: Ottoman Empire the 34th Emperor (ranking 1876-1909). Midhat as Prime Minister and promulgated the Midhat Constitution, but with the premise of Russia = Turkey (Russian war) prevailed the Constitution and revived the emperor tyranny regime. I could not cope with the rebellion and independence of the people in the region, the interference and invasion of the Imperialism powerful power, was abolished in the youth Turkish revolution.

DOC.Title: "Youth Turkey"
DOC.TEXT: A collective term for organizations formed by young officers and intellectuals, with the aim of establishing a constitutional system based on the revival of the Midhat Constitution. In 1908 he revolutionized the Turkish revolution and was in charge of the administration, gradually became a dictator, and disappeared after the First World War.

DOC.Title: Unification and Progress Committee
DOC.TEXT: Anti-organization organization formed around 1889. He acted as a central organization of "Youth Turkey" and aimed to restore and establish the constitutional system.

DOC.Title: Youth Turkish Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Successful bloodless revolution succeeded under the guidance of soldier Envel-Pasha in Saronic Greek. "Youth Turkey" won the administration, set the constitutional monarchy and set western liberalism. Japan's victory in the Russo-Japanese War encouraged them and gave them directions.

DOC.Title: Midhat Constitutional Resurrection
DOC.TEXT: In 1908, Abdur-Hamito II promised with the opening of the Diet.

DOC.Title: Pan = Turkish principle
DOC.TEXT: The nationalist thought of the Ottoman Empire that grew after the youth Turkish revolution.

DOC.Title: Kajar morning
DOC.TEXT: Iranian Turkish Islamic dynasty. The capital city is Tehran. Since the 19th century, it was afflicted by the invasion of Britain and Russia, and was semi-colonized by the British-Russian negotiator in 1907.

DOC.Title: Tobacco = Poicot movement
DOC.TEXT: A movement in which Ulama (religious leaders), merchants, people protested that Kajar morning gave an exclusive right on the production and sale of cigarettes to British merchants. Iran's first large-scale resistance movement, Iran nationalism has been increasing since this time.

DOC.Title: Iranian Constitutional Revolution
DOC.TEXT: The constitutional movement that occurred against the invasion of England and Russia and the government dependent on it. The provisional constitution was enacted in 1906 and the National Assembly was founded, but it was frustrated by the interference between Britain and Russia.

DOC.Title: World War I
DOC.TEXT: The first global scale warfare played by 31 countries, mainly in European imperialist countries. A total power battle became all-out, new weapons appeared one after another, and seriously damaged human and material. As a result, there were major historical changes such as (1) the downturn of Europe, (2) the activation of colonial independence movement, (3) the founding of the Soviet Union, and (4) the status of the United States and Japan.

DOC.Title: Salayevo case
DOC.TEXT: A case where Serbian student Puritipi who belonged to the anti-Habsburg nationalistic organization assassinated the cousin of the Austrian throne (Franz-Ferdinand) who arrived in Saarjevo, the capital of Bosnia to visit the army large exercise, assassinated. The serious outrage of the Serbian side against the consolidation of Bosnia and Herzegovina by Austria in 1908 was an explosion and became a direct cause of the First World War.

DOC.Title: Franz-Ferdinand
DOC.TEXT: Austrian successor to the throne. It was the nephew of the Austrian emperor Franz Joseph, but since the crown prince and father died, he became a successor to the throne. It was assassinated with Princess at Sarayevo.

DOC.Title: Austria's Serbian Declaration of War
DOC.TEXT: On July 23, Austria has given Serbia a final notice of 48 hours deadline. On August 25, Serbia responded with a partial reserve but Austria was not convinced and declared war on 28th.

DOC.Title: Russian Total Mobilization Order
DOC.TEXT: On July 30, 1914, Russia issued a total mobilization order to support Serbia who received the declaration of war on Austria.

DOC.Title: Belgian neutral violation
DOC.TEXT: As planned in Germany (strategy of Schleifen), Germany first took over the short-term defeat of France, first requested passage of the territory to Belgium of the eternal period neutral country on August 2, 1914, and began invading on the 4th. But this was a great excuse for England participation.

DOC.Title: Allied Powers, Concession Country
DOC.TEXT: UK, France and Russia are the mainstay, Serbia, Montenegro, Japan and others are also joining. Italy, after neutrality, in 1915, signed the Confidentiality Treaties of London and stood the Allied side. Romania in 16 years, USA and China in 17 years, etc. became a total of 27 countries.

DOC.Title: allies
DOC.TEXT: The Ottoman Empire in Germany and Austria, Bulgaria in 1915 joined, consisting of four countries.

DOC.Title: Japan's participation
DOC.TEXT: Japan declared war on Germany and added it to the Great War with the Japan-UK alliance as an excuse. Japan deprived the interest that Germany had in China (especially Shandong Province), and it also decided to advance to all over China and the South Pacific.

DOC.Title: Occupation of German Nanyang Islands
DOC.TEXT: By October 1914, the Japanese army occupied the north of the equator of the German islands.

DOC.Title: Occupation of Jiaozhou Bay
DOC.TEXT: Japan attacked the Shandong peninsula that had been a German influential sphere since 1898 and occupied Qingdao in Jiaozhou Bay where the base of the German Oriental fleet was built in November 1914.

DOC.Title: Qingdao
DOC.TEXT: Harbor city of Jiaozhou Bay. Since it was leased and lodged by Germany and its base of Toyo fleet, it was regarded as a target for Japan's participation in the war.

DOC.Title: 21 Requests for Clause
DOC.TEXT: Request submitted to the Yuan Sei government of China from January 1915. The contents of de facto belonging to the Tohoku region, Inner Mongolia, North China in China. The strong power was not able to interfere due to the great war, the Chinese side subdued in May, but the anti-Japanese mourning intensified.

DOC.Title: Ishii / Lansing agreement
DOC.TEXT: Agreement concluded between amendment ambassador Ishii Kikujiro and US Secretary of State Lansing. The United States acknowledges Japan's special interests in China and that Japan will allow equal opportunities for the United States of China. In February 1922, it became virtually ineffective at the establishment of the nine countries treaty.

DOC.Title: Eastern Front
DOC.TEXT: Battle between Germany and Austria of the First World War and Russia. Initially the Russian troops got offensive against the German side, but since they lost to the German army in the battle of Tannenberg, since the end of November 1915 the German army entered the Russian territory and the battle took place.

DOC.Title: Battle of Tannenberg
DOC.TEXT: The German general Hindredruk destroyed the invaded Russian army and wiped out the threat from the eastern part. Today 's northeastern part of Poland.

DOC.Title: Hindenburg
DOC.TEXT: German soldier. He won the victory at Tannenberg, became a hero, and instructed war as general chief of staff. After the war the president became president (responsible 1925-34).

DOC.Title: Western Front
DOC.TEXT: Battle in the Western direction (French direction) seen from the German side. The German attacks were frustrated at the Marni battle, after which the stalemate continued, and there were many deaths over a small ruling area until the end of the war. It was the main battlefield of the First World War.

DOC.Title: Battle of Marne
DOC.TEXT: The battle that France stuck at the Marne river in the German army that broke through Belgium. As a result, the operation of Schleifen in Germany for a short-term decisive battle went back and became a long-term battle.

DOC.Title: Secret diplomacy, confidential treaty
DOC.TEXT: As the war was prolonged, belligerent countries carried out various secret diplomacy to advance the fight advantageously. Among them, strengthening the unity of its own campaign, prevention of a single truce, embracing of a neutral country, support of the rebellion of ethnic minorities in enemy territory, cooperation of the colonial people of the home are made, and therefore, postwar expansion of territory I signed a secret treaty subject to autonomy and independence. Among them, the secret treaties involved in Britain are the most frequent.

DOC.Title: London Confidentiality Treaty
DOC.TEXT: To Italy who declared the initial neutral of the war, Britain, France, Russia promised to join the coast of the Adriatic coast, which was part of "uncollected Italy".

DOC.Title: "Uncollected Italy"
DOC.TEXT: The purpose of participating in Italy was in the recovery of this place.

DOC.Title: Withdrawal from the Three Kingdon alliance, withdrawal from the Italian triple alliance
DOC.TEXT: For participating in the Allied side.

DOC.Title: Participation in Italy
DOC.TEXT: Denied against Austria by the London contest.

DOC.Title: Hussein · McMahon Agreement, Husain · McMahon Agreement, Hussein · McMahon Letter
DOC.TEXT: Britain 's High Commissioner Egypto McMahon promised Arab leader Hussein to admit monopoly and independence of Arab residential areas, subject to war cooperation. As a result Arab began fighting the Ottoman Empire.

DOC.Title: Sykes · Pico agreement
DOC.TEXT: Division of the Ottoman territory by Britain, France, Russia and international management of Palestine. However, having agreement with the Hussein · McMahon agreement in October 15 promised Arab independence, this agreement was exposed by the Russian revolutionary regime in November 2005 and made the Arab side indignant.

DOC.Title: Promised Indian autonomy
DOC.TEXT: Indian minister Montagu of the UK announced the Indian autonomy declaration after the war, subject to Indian war cooperation and independence movement cease. As a result, many Indian soldiers struggled at the European · Mesopotamia Front and issued tens of thousands of war dead, but after the war Britain did not keep this promise.

DOC.Title: Balfour Declaration
DOC.TEXT: British foreign minister Balfour promised the establishment of a Jewish Palestinian national folk. It was primarily to obtain cooperation from the Jewish financial capital, but in 15 years he arroged the Arab promised to be independent in the area including Palestine.

DOC.Title: Lusitania No.
DOC.TEXT: British liner. It was sunk by the German submarine in May 1915, and there were many dead people. Among them, more than 100 American passengers were killed, so America 's German public opinion became severe.

DOC.Title: Verdun
DOC.TEXT: The greatest fierce battlefield in the Western Front. The German assault in February-December 1916 protected the French army. The casualties are about 340,000 German troops and about 360,000 French troops.

DOC.Title: Battle of Somme
DOC.TEXT: Major offensive from the allied side against the German army on the Somme river in northern France. The British used the tank for the first time. It is estimated that the casualty injured will be 900,000 for the Allied Forces and 600,000 for the German Army, but the victory or defeat ended without being fixed.

DOC.Title: Battle of Ypres
DOC.TEXT: A battle took place between Allied and German Army near Ypres in Western Belgium. The German army for the first time used poison gas for 15 years.

DOC.Title: total strength
DOC.TEXT: As the war has prolonged, winning and losing of war did not settle at individual battlefields, but in each of the domestic countries, it came to depend on how to mobilize and produce the entire nation and prepare the supply system .

DOC.Title: Trench warfare
DOC.TEXT: Both fighting enemies digging deep trenches, fighting against a steel wire netting confrontation. As the side protecting the cannon and the machine guns became advantageous, such ways of fighting became central and the war got into a stalemate.

DOC.Title: Tank
DOC.TEXT: In September 1916, the UK began using it at the battle of Somme.

DOC.Title: poison gas
DOC.TEXT: In April 1915, Germany began to use in the battle of Eve.

DOC.Title: Submarine
DOC.TEXT: The German army was named U-boat, especially for attacking the enemy's commercial ship.

DOC.Title: Airplane
DOC.TEXT: Differentiated from reconnaissance aircraft to fighter aircraft and bomber and developed.

DOC.Title: machine gun
DOC.TEXT: A gun that strikes over hundreds of bullets per minute. With this use, the number of casualties and injuries in the First World War has become enormous.

DOC.Title: Unlimited submarine strategy
DOC.TEXT: A strategy in which the German military group, which was in a military inferiority, took power at the risk of political disadvantage. Ships entered into the battle area were anti-blocking tactics against Britain, meaning that they sink in indiscriminate, no warning regardless of nationality.

DOC.Title: Participation in the United States of America
DOC.TEXT: I had already confiscated in February 2005, but I went on to join for the reason of the unlimited submarine operation in Germany. Furthermore, it was a more fundamental reason for participating in the United States that the United States had the fear that payment of the debt to the United States would become difficult if the UK / France were defeated. With the participation of the United States with a huge production force, the battle situation began to be advantageously developed to the Allies side.

DOC.Title: Nationwide coalition system
DOC.TEXT: A system that various political parties unite to support the government in order to survive prolonged war. In the UK in 1916 the Lloyd-George Cabinet, in France it is the Clement of Clementism that was established in 17 years. In Germany, in 16 years the military of Hindenburg and others established the dictatorship system.

DOC.Title: German Independent Social Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1917, the left party of the German Social Democratic Party formed a new party opposing war cooperation. Workers 'strikes also joined, making Germany' s continuation of the war difficult.

DOC.Title: Surrender Bulgaria
DOC.TEXT: On September 29, 1918, we signed an armistice agreement subject to unconditional surrender with the Allied Powers. The king abdicated himself and exiled, the firstborn of the firstborn Boris III reigned.

DOC.Title: Ottoman Empire Surrender
DOC.TEXT: On October 18, 1918, the Allies called for a ceasefire and fought on 30th.

DOC.Title: Austrian surrender
DOC.TEXT: On October 30, 1918, an extraordinary government was established with labor strikes, surrendering November 3.

DOC.Title: Sailor Rebellion of Kiel Military Port
DOC.TEXT: With the German defeat becoming apparent, the government ordered a fleet within the Kiel army ship to sort out negotiations advantageously, but a sailor rebelled against it. And this rebellion expanded all over the country, the German empire collapsed and accepted the ceasefire, the great war ended.

DOC.Title: Establishment of the German Republic
DOC.TEXT: As the sailor rebellion at Kir 's military port expanded throughout the country, Emperor abdicated on 9th, exiled to the Netherlands, and the republic was established. And the Social Democratic Party formed an extraordinary government with the Independent Social Democratic Party.

DOC.Title: German Armistice Agreement, Germany Armistice Treaty Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The temporary government representative of Germany signed in the forest of Compiègne northeast of Paris, the end of the First World War.

DOC.Title: German Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that took place in Germany from November 3, 1918 to January 2007 (the end of the First World War-the beginning of the postwar period). After Kir 's military rebellion, Imperial Government was overthrown and the Republicans were established, but this revolution showed a deeper deepening with socialist demands. An extraordinary government established in such circumstances tried to suppress the deepening of this revolution under the leadership of the Social Democratic Party, which was connected with conservatives of the military and political and financial world. On the other hand, the radical group who once belonged to the Social Democratic Party, but criticized its conservatism and gathered to the Spartacus group, in January 1919 claimed an even more thorough revolution and led to an armed uprising, lost, guidance A person was assassinated, and the revolution ended.

DOC.Title: Late, Council
DOC.TEXT: Organization of workers and soldiers created during the German Revolution, the Soviet of the Russian Revolution. The German Revolution ended in failure and the role ended.

DOC.Title: 14 Peace Principles of the 14th and 14th Clauses
DOC.TEXT: Peace Principles for the end of the Great War announced by US President Wilson in January 1918. It embodied the ideal of peace without victory, it was issued in an effort to suppress the discord of the Allies by the declaration on peace of the new Soviet regime on November 8, 1917, and the subsequent exposure of the secret treaty. At the Paris Peace Conference the following year, it became the center of America 's assertion. The main provisions are as follows.

DOC.Title: Abolition of secret diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: Under the public peace treaty, arguing that diplomacy should be made public.

DOC.Title: Ocean freedom
DOC.TEXT: He insisted on absolute freedom of navigation in the high seas regardless of peacetime or wartime.

DOC.Title: Elimination of tariff barriers
DOC.TEXT: Removal of obstacles to economic activity and assertion of equality of trade terms.

DOC.Title: Armament reduction
DOC.TEXT: Reduce armaments of each country up to the limit of safety.

DOC.Title: Fair resolution of colonial problems
DOC.TEXT: Claims for acquiring cooperation of colonial people.

DOC.Title: ethnic self-determination
DOC.TEXT: We insist that international guarantees are necessary as the developments of ethnic groups can be determined voluntarily, respectively. It was applied only to the independence of post-war Eastern European countries, not applied to Asian-African ethnic movements.

DOC.Title: Establishment of the International Peace Organization
DOC.TEXT: It was realized as an international federation after the war.

DOC.Title: Russia Single Peace People
DOC.TEXT: The Soviet regime peacefully with Germany with the Brest-Litovsk Treaty, withdrew from the war.

DOC.Title: Russian Revolution
DOC.TEXT: The March Revolution (Russian calendar February Revolution) and November Revolution (Russian calendar October Revolution) that occurred in Russia in 1917. In particular, it sometimes refers to the latter, the first socialist revolution in history. During World War I, the contradiction of Russian society became even more serious. Foreign capital was raised, low working conditions further declined, the workers revolutionized. The army also lost consecutive defeats because of poor guidance and poor equipment, and soldiers also revolutionized. In addition, mobilization of farmers and livestock to war reduced agricultural production, paralyzed transportation route, caused a urban food crisis. A revolution occurred in March 1917 due to the food crisis of the capital, the rule of Romanov morning over 300 years ended. The temporary government that was established afterwards stood on the bourgeoisie side, emphasized the relationship with Britain and France and took measures to continue the war, but labor, agriculture and soldiers gathered in Soviet for bread and peace, dual It became a state of power. After returning from exile in Bolshevik leader Lenin succeeded in expanding the power in Soviet, defeated the temporary government on 7 November, established a socialist regime.

DOC.Title: Uprising of Central Asian peoples
DOC.TEXT: In the summer of 1916, an uprising protested against the fact that the Russian government suffering from labor shortage protested Muslim residents in Central Asia to mobilize to military facilities and others. The Russian army subdued it by the end of the same year, but it expanded to Zakhukas and Siberia temporarily, and shocked the Russian government.

DOC.Title: Petrograd uprising
DOC.TEXT: Demonstrations and strikes caused by the food crisis occurred on March 8, 1917, expanded to the general staff of general citizens on 10th, even the military began to join the workers on the 12th.

DOC.Title: Petrograd
DOC.TEXT: After the war, Petersburg was renamed and became Petrograd. In 1924, after renouncing Lenin, he was renamed Leningrad for his achievement, but in 1991 he returned to the former name of St. Petersburg.

DOC.Title: Soviet, Council
DOC.TEXT: Meaning of "conference". Born in 1905 during the first Russian revolution. On March 12, 2005, formed as a council (labor troops) by representatives of workers and soldiers in Vietlograd, became the center of the subsequent revolution.

DOC.Title: Nikolai II
DOC.TEXT: The Romanov Russian last morning emperor (ranking 1894-1917). I survived the first Russian revolution during the Russo-Japanese War, but on 15th March 1917 during the First World War, I abdicated with the report of the capital riot. Attempted to succeed to the imperial Mikhail, but he was declined and the imperial government collapsed. After the November Revolution was confined-During the civil war, it was executed by the Revolutionary with the family.

DOC.Title: March Revolution, Russian calendar February Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that took place in March 1917 and caused the Romanov morning to collapse. In the capital city of Petrograd, food crisis, popular demonstrations, workers' strikes occurred, and Nikolai II was forced to abdicate as it expanded to various places, an extraordinary government centered on bourgeoisie was established .

DOC.Title: Russian calendar
DOC.TEXT: The Julian calendar, adding 13 days will be the Gregorian calendar. It was used until November Revolution.

DOC.Title: Temporary government
DOC.TEXT: The Russian government between the March Revolution and the November Revolution. The Constitutional Democratic Party, which stands on the profit of bourgeoisie, was established with the addition of some social revolutionary party and Menshevik. While taking the war continuation policy, dissatisfaction of the popular people became increasing without dissolution of the food crisis and land reform problems, was brought down by the November revolution guided by Bolshevik.

DOC.Title: Dual power
DOC.TEXT: In the period of the November Revolution from the March Revolution, there was a coexistence situation where the temporary government existed, while the Soviet rule the people as another political power.

DOC.Title: Constitutional Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: A bourgeois party established in October 1905. To maintain the constitutional monarchy, we maintained the first party in Duma. Even after the March revolution, we took a war continuation policy.

DOC.Title: Social Revolutionary Party
DOC.TEXT: Known as S. L.. It was formed at the end of 1901 centered on radical students and intellectuals, aimed at overthrowing tyranny and distributing land. After the March revolution, he occupied the majority in Soviet, Kerenski joined the extraordinary government, became the prime minister after July, played a leading role in the dual power era and claimed war continuation . However after the November revolution, it split into both sides.

DOC.Title: Menshevik
DOC.TEXT: After the March Revolution, along with the Social Revolution Party, was a leading force in the Soviet, partly participated in the temporary government, but declined with the rise of Bolshevik. After the November Revolution, I went around anti-revolutionary.

DOC.Title: Kerensky
DOC.TEXT: In the right wing of the Social Revolutionary Party, he came to the temporary government after the revolution, later became the prime minister, asserting continuation of the war, oppressed popular movements and Bolsheviks et al. The November Revolution exiled to America.

DOC.Title: Lenin
DOC.TEXT: Bolshevik leader. During the exile in Switzerland, the March Revolution took place and returned to Russia at a sealed train provided by Germany (a train that gave ride to Revolutionaries of Lenin et al. On condition that contact with outside the train is prohibited while passing through Germany). In April thesis clarified the basic policy of the revolution, succeeded the November revolution, established the first socialist regime in history.

DOC.Title: April Thesis
DOC.TEXT: About Bolshevik's basic policy, what Lenin announced. With the slogan "To All Soviet Power," we declared that we should concentrate our power on the Soviets, not to support the temporary government, in order to achieve the revolution.

DOC.Title: November Revolution, Russian calendar October Revolution
DOC.TEXT: The temporary government that was established as a result of the March Revolution was a government controlled by bourgeoisie and still continued the war, so laborers, soldiers, farmers and others gathered in Soviet for bread and peace, dual power It became a state. But initially Soviet leaders were compromised against the temporary government, so Bolshevik leader Lenin deprived himself of power within the Soviet, overthrowing the extraordinary government of Kerensky on November 7, established a socialist regime .

DOC.Title: Bolshevik armed uprising
DOC.TEXT: With the guidance of Lenin and Trotsky, soldiers and workers of the Bolshevik school rose and beat the extraordinary government.

DOC.Title: Social Revolutionary Party Leftist
DOC.TEXT: It conflicted with the right wing since August 1917. In the November Revolution cooperated with Polishviki, opposing the peace treatement with Germany in March 18, it was oppressed against Bolshevik and armed conflict caused the crush and was repressed.

DOC.Title: All Russia = Soviet Conference
DOC.TEXT: The highest institution of the Soviet organization. Declared the formation of a new administration at the second meeting immediately after the November Revolution (November 8, 1917), and elected the People's Committee. In the 5th convention (July 18), the Constitution of the Russian-Soviet Socialist Federal Republic was established.

DOC.Title: People's Committee meeting
DOC.TEXT: The newly established Soviet regime was established at the All Russia-Soviet Conference held on November 8, 1917, the day following the success of the November Revolution. Mr. Lenin was chaired by the Chairman (prime minister), Trotsky as Foreign Affairs People's Committee member, and Stalin and others as ethnic People's Committee, and promulgated "Declaration on Peace" and "Declaration on Land".

DOC.Title: "Declaration on Peace"
DOC.TEXT: What Lenin announced as the first foreign policy after the regime was in control. We called for unannounced · grant money (no compensation) · peace of self-determination of nation to all belligerent countries. In an effort to advance the battle in the eastern front, Germany will negotiate in December according to this, but the Allied nations have ignored. Therefore, Lenin disclosed the secret diplomatic documents that the former Russian government had tied with Britain, France and others, and revealed the actual state of foreign policy of the strong powers government. For this reason, the strength of the power was forced to re-identify the war purpose again.

DOC.Title: "Declaration on land"
DOC.TEXT: At the same time as "Declaration on Peace", it was announced as the first domestic policy by the Russian new administration. Proclamation to abolish the sovereignty of the land, such as forfeiting the land owned by the landowner for free. This has taken the first steps of socialist policy to publicize production means.

DOC.Title: Constitutional Council
DOC.TEXT: On November 25, 1917, the first parliament of Russia, elected by a proportional representative election. The social revolutionary party occupied the overwhelming majority, Bolshevik became the second largest number of seats, but it was less than half of the social revolutionary party. The opening of the meeting on January 18, 18, at the beginning of the session, the declaration of the rights of the workers and the people under pressure by the Soviet Union was rejected, so all Polishviki members were sent off, the next day, Lenin closed and dissolved this parliament with military force .

DOC.Title: Cheka, Emergency Committee
DOC.TEXT: Abbreviation for all Russian emergency committees founded in December 1917. Organization for the detection and control of sabotage, speculation, counterrevolutionary conspiracy accompanying publicization. It was abolished in 22 years when the domestic battle ended, and its secret police role was taken over by GPe.

DOC.Title: Bolshevik dictatorship, proletarian dictatorship
DOC.TEXT: It was practically realized by the dissolution of the Constitutional Council of 19 January 1918. The dictatorship "for the time being" by Lenin, from the working-class dictatorship to the one-party dictatorship, eventually followed the way to Stalin's personal dictatorship.

DOC.Title: No merge / grant money / ethnic self-determination
DOC.TEXT: The war closing method that the Soviet administration claimed in "Declaration on Peace". A fair peaceful condition was presented that "the winner in the war does not impose a territory or compensation (reparation) on the loser, but accepts autonomy of the people". However, as Germany demanded excessive territorial disposition as a winner in peace negotiations with the Soviet Union, this principle was not applied in the Brest-Litovsk Convention signed in March 1918.

DOC.Title: Brest-Litovsk Convention
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty of Germany and Russia signed on March 3, 1918. Soviet-Russia has withdrawn from the war alone by losing the vast territory of Poland, Ukraine, Finland etc. In addition, Germany was able to terminate the eastern battle favorably by this, and it was possible to put all the troops to the western fight. However, in the defeat of Germany at the end of 18 years the treaty itself was invalidated.

DOC.Title: Trotsky
DOC.TEXT: A Russian revolutionary. Originally belonged to Menshevik, after joining the Bolshevik after the March Revolution, helped Lenin and led the November Revolution to success. In the new administration as the first Foreign Affairs People 's Committee to the German Peace Committee against Germany, it became full authority to Germany, and during the civil war, he established the Red Army and was active. As a theorist, he insisted on the theory of world revolution (persistent revolution theory), conflicting with Stalin et al.'s theory of single-country socialism. Although it was seen as successor of Lenin, it was gradually isolated in conflict with the Stalinists and was expelled outside the country for 29 years.

DOC.Title: World Revolution theory, persistent revolution theory
DOC.TEXT: One of the theories of the Communist movement exercised by Trotsky. In order for the Soviet regime to last forever and the Communist revolution to succeed, the theory that a revolution has occurred throughout the world (actually in Europe), and that several communist regimes must be formed and coexist.

DOC.Title: Russian Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: In the first Bolshevik seventh party convention, after renaming the administration on March 6-8, 1918, it was renamed from Bolshevik.

DOC.Title: Moscow
DOC.TEXT: On March 16, 1918, he decided to move the capital to Moscow at the 4th extraordinary Soviet convention and set up a government agency at the Kremlin Palace.

DOC.Title: Civil war
DOC.TEXT: After the revolution succeeded, the battle between White Army (anti-revolutionary force centered on group of former Government Army · Social Revolution Party etc) and Red Arm (army of Soviet regime side) which occurred in various places. It ended in the victory of the Red Army by around 1921 when the Soviet-Poland war ended.

DOC.Title: Red Army, Red Army
DOC.TEXT: Army of the Soviet regime. Immediately after the November Revolution, it was formed around workers and soldiers, and since January 1918 it was organized as a center of court soldiers. It played a big part in the fight against anti-revolutionary forces and foreign interference forces.

DOC.Title: Anti-Revolutionary Army, White Army
DOC.TEXT: Political parties other than landowners, nobles, imperialist officers, and Bolshevik, opposed to the Soviet regime, formed in various places with the support of foreign countries. Although it was powerful at a time, it was weakened by internal division and popular opposition, and it was destroyed by the Red Army.

DOC.Title: Soviet interference war
DOC.TEXT: The Allied Powers supported each White Army to overthrow the Soviet regime, and in March 18, starting with the British Army 's Murmansk landing, he penetrated Russian territory without a declaration of war. The Soviet regime temporarily crisis even after the end of the war, but before the conflict of interests and speculations of each country, the opposition of the domestic people, the resistance of the Soviet people against the invading army, and the counterattack of the reinforced Red Army 22 I retracted by around the year.

DOC.Title: Czech soldiers POW
DOC.TEXT: 45,000 Czech soldiers who exiled to the Russian army during the war were rebellious in May 1918 while traveling on the Siberian Railway to participate in the Western Front, occupying the railroad tracks, and supporting the anti-Revolutionary Army. The rescue of this Czech soldier became an excuse for the massive interference of the Allied Forces.

DOC.Title: Siberian dispatch
DOC.TEXT: In the nominal case of rescuing the Czech soldiers, the US and China dispatched mainly the Japanese army and then after the war ended, even after returning to the Czech soldiers, they occupied Siberia and punished the anti-revolution regime. The US Army was uncooperative with the Japanese Army, and in the beginning of 20 years it retreated to the western United Kingdom / France withdrawal. The Japanese army was arrested for up to 22 years (Kita Karuya until 25 years), and was accused from inside and outside by the Ninagang (Nikolayevsk) incident.

DOC.Title: War Communism
DOC.TEXT: 1918-21, economic policy of the Soviet regime, conducted to cope with the civil war and the interfering war. We banned all corporate bans, nationalization of small and medium factories, cash salary of wages, labor obligation system and food distribution system, forced cereal forcing from farmers etc. However, farmer's willingness to produce was lost, which resulted in extreme food shortages.

DOC.Title: Comintern, Third International
DOC.TEXT: In 1919, the left wing forces such as the Communist Party of the world formed organization in Moscow under the guidance of the Russian Communist Party. In the 1920s, in order to fight against the world revolution and the Soviet Union, the 1930s issued various orders for fighting against fascist forces, but when the Battle of Soviet Union started, it is necessary to prioritize coordination with Allies 43 It broke up in the year.

DOC.Title: Soviet-Polish War
DOC.TEXT: The war that Poland invaded Russia under the Soviet regime with the aim of expanding territory (first territory recovery before the division of Poland). After that Russia recovered temporarily, but in 1920 it was a major defeat in Polish army in Warsaw.

DOC.Title: Nep, New Economic Policy, NEP
DOC.TEXT: New economic policy adopted in 1921. As a result of wartime communism, it was done to recover extremely reduced production. With the abolition of the grain dumping system, admitting the management of small private enterprises and small farmers, the willingness to produce was stimulated, and by 1927 the production recovered to almost prewar levels in each sector.

DOC.Title: British Soviet Trade Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Trade agreement between the UK and the Soviet regime. Britain solved the economic blockade against the Soviet Union, and the Soviet administration approved the establishment of the British Trade Representative.

DOC.Title: Rapallo Treaty
DOC.TEXT: In 1922, the Convention signed between the Soviet regime and Germany. Contents that we abandon mutual claim rights against damage given during the First World War and restore diplomatic relations. The approach of the two countries that were internationally isolated made a shock to many countries.

DOC.Title: Soviet Socialist Republic Federation, Soviet Union, Soviet Union, U.S.S.R.
DOC.TEXT: Establishment was declared at the first federation Soviet tournament in 1922. Initially started in 4 Soviet republics of Russia, Ukraine, Belarus and Zakhukas, later Uzbek Republic, Republic of Kyrgyz Republic, Turkmen Republic etc. joined, consisting of 15 Republics.

DOC.Title: Russia
DOC.TEXT: Member States of the Soviet Union. The residents are East Slavic. The capital city is Moscow.

DOC.Title: Ukraine
DOC.TEXT: Member States of the Soviet Union. The residents are East Slavic. The capital city is Kiev.

DOC.Title: Belarus, White Russia
DOC.TEXT: Member States of the Soviet Union. The residents are East Slavic. The capital is Minsk.

DOC.Title: Zakafukas
DOC.TEXT: Member States of the Soviet Union. Current Georgia. About 70% of the inhabitants are Georgians and are considered to be South Caucasian. Todori is Tbilisi. In 1936, it was further separated into Republic of Georgia, Republic of Armenia, Republic of Azerbaijan.

DOC.Title: Kazakh Republic
DOC.TEXT: A member country of the Soviet Union established in 1924. The capital city is Astana.

DOC.Title: Uzbek Republic
DOC.TEXT: A member country of the Soviet Union established in 1924. The capital city is Tashkent.

DOC.Title: Republic of Georgia
DOC.TEXT: The capital city is Tbilisi.

DOC.Title: Armenia Republic
DOC.TEXT: The capital is Yerevan.

DOC.Title: Azerbaijan Republic
DOC.TEXT: The capital city is Baku.

DOC.Title: Soviet Socialist Constitution
DOC.TEXT: In the 1924 All-Soviet second conference, it was created on behalf of the first constitution of 18 years enactment. The Soviet Central Executive Committee is supposed to act on behalf of the Soviet Union, although all federal Soviet competitions are the highest institution. In recognition of the right to self-determination of ethnicity, the voting rights were not granted to former births or old bureaucrats. It continued until the Stalin constitution in 1936.

DOC.Title: All Russia = Muslim Tournament
DOC.TEXT: Meeting organized by Muslim (Islam) of Central Asia · Zakhukas. In May 1917, the first tournament was held in Moscow, asking the temporary government to realize the Federal Republic based on self-determination of the people. After that, the Soviet rule dominated the area and declared that Lenin acknowledged Muslims' faith and autonomy, but it overlapped with the confusion of the civil war, and in the end it ended in Uzbek, Kazakh, Kyrgyz, Tajik, Turkmen, Republic of Turkmen It was named and divided, and it was annexed to the Soviet Union.

DOC.Title: Soviet approval
DOC.TEXT: Sekiyu approved after watching the hope of resuming trade and seeing that the Soviet regime was stabilized in the Nept period. In the strength of the United States, the US refused approval until the end, but in 1933 approved.

DOC.Title: British Soviet approval
DOC.TEXT: By the Labor Party Cabinet. Later, the Conservative Party had diplomatic relations and diplomatic recovery in 192.

DOC.Title: Italian Soviet approval
DOC.TEXT: One hundred twenty nine

DOC.Title: France's Soviet approval
DOC.TEXT: One hundred twenty nine

DOC.Title: Versailles regime
DOC.TEXT: An international system created based on the Treaty of Versailles and a series of subsequent treaties of the Peace treaty of the First World War. Preventing the defeated country Germany from becoming a threat again, anti-Soviet anti-communism, maintaining the status quo of colonies, promotion of domestic parliamentaryism, and so on. The League of Nations played a major role in maintaining the system, but it collapsed due to the occurrence of the Great Depression and the formation of the Nazi regime.

DOC.Title: Paris Peace Conference
DOC.TEXT: Opened on January 18, 1919. The Allied Powers (Victory Countries in the Battle of War) discussed the terms of peace with the allies. It was held excluding all defeated countries, and the three countries of the UK, the US, France coached the initiative.

DOC.Title: Wilson
DOC.TEXT: United States President of the 28th (President 1913-21). Although it was reelected to be neutral during the First World War, we gradually decided to fight, and in April 1917 I took a slogan to "participate in the German slogan" "peace without victory". The Peace Principles of 14 clauses were announced, and at the Paris Peace Conference we made an idealistic argument based on this, but we had no choice but to give much to the realistic argument of Britain and France.

DOC.Title: Lloyd-George
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom (Tenure 1916-22). At the Paris Peace Conference I mediated American idealism and the demanding German sanctions against France.

DOC.Title: Clemenceau
DOC.TEXT: At the time he was a radical socialist and the prime minister (serving 1917-20). We insisted on severe sanctions against Germany and its thorough weakening, on the other hand, aimed at improving France's position in Europe.

DOC.Title: Treaty of Versailles
DOC.TEXT: Treaty summarizing the part related to Germany at the Paris Peace Conference. On June 28, 1919, between the mirrors of the Palace of Versailles was signed between the Allies and Germany. Germany ceased part of the territory to Poland, Belgium, Czechoslovakia, Lithuania, Saar etc decided attribution by the People's Poll, Danzig was under the control of the League of Nations. As a result, Germany lost 10% of pre-war area / human loss, lost all overseas colonies, strict prohibition of future merger with Austria, and so forth. Furthermore, it has the following contents.

DOC.Title: Alsace-Lorraine
DOC.TEXT: Immediately after the Armistice Treaty, the French Army occupied and was transferred to France.

DOC.Title: German armaments limit
DOC.TEXT: The Army banned the draft system, banned the possession of heavy weapons and armored weapons, with an upper limit of 100,000 forces. Navy has 36 ships and 15,000 troops, 1 less than 10,000 tons, submarines are prohibited. No air force is forbidden. As a result, Germany has been overwhelmingly inferior in military strength.

DOC.Title: Rhineland unarmed
DOC.TEXT: A demilitarized zone with a width of 50 km in the east of the Rhine, banned German military facilities and soldiers, and the West Bank occupied the Allied for 15 years.

DOC.Title: Poland corridor
DOC.TEXT: Intermediate zone between East Prussia and mainland Germany. It was made into emerging Poland territory.

DOC.Title: Compensation
DOC.TEXT: We do not decide the total amount and payment method, but for the time being we will pay 20 billion gold mark by the year 1921. The total amount was officially decided as 142 billion gold mark in April 21, 2009.

DOC.Title: Saint-Germain Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty with Austria. The territory of the Austrian-Hungarian empire was divided into ethnic groups such as Poland, Czech Republic, Croat-Sloven (Yugoslavia), Hungary, and the empire was dismantled. As a result, Austria reduced its area and population to about a quarter, was subject to severe arms restrictions, and was forbidden to merge with Germany.

DOC.Title: Neuay Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty with Bulgaria. We ceded the territory to Greece · Yugoslavia and returned Dobrukia who robbed it during the war to Romania.

DOC.Title: Trianon Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty with Hungary. The complete separation from Austria, the territory ceiling to Romania, Yugoslavia and the Czech Republic was decided, the area was reduced by a third and the population decreased to two-fifths. One third of the Hungarians lived abroad, and their dissatisfaction caused participation in the German-Italian side during the Second World War.

DOC.Title: Sevres Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Peace treaty with the Ottoman Empire. On the territorial side, the European territory leaves only the area around Istanbul, Mesopotamia · Palestine is the British, Syria is the mandate rule of France and the Cypriot is ceded to the UK, and furthermore the military restrictions · the extraband There was also a provision such as the revival of Pituration), so the newly formed Great National Assembly refused ratification. It was subsequently revised significantly in the Lausanne Treaty of 1923.

DOC.Title: Austria = Demolition of the Hungarian Empire
DOC.TEXT: On November 3, 1918, the Austrian-Hungarian Empire signed a truce with the Allied Powers, and on 12th the emperor declared that "abandon all involvement in the national affairs in Austria", the next 13th He abandoned Hungary 's governing authority, so the empire dismantled. On that day, Austria and Hungary respectively declared Republicans. It was formally confirmed by the 1919 Saint-Germain-Trianon Treaty.

DOC.Title: Hungary
DOC.TEXT: As of the end of October 1918, the new government, established in the Hungarian revolution, insisted on the separation from Austria, departed from the Austrian emperor's control after the Austrian-Hungarian empire's defeat on November 3 (signing the Armistice Agreement), November 16 I declared the Republic of Japan. Thereafter, the Communist Party government (Hungarian-Soviet regime) was established in March-August 19, but the Romanian troops invaded and in February 20, after the withdrawal, the Kingdom of Hungary regented by Horti was established.

DOC.Title: Czechoslovakia
DOC.TEXT: October 28, 1918 declared independence from Austria, and Masaryk became the first President of November 14. It was officially endorsed by the Saint-Germain Treaty.

DOC.Title: Finland
DOC.TEXT: In December 1917, during the Russian Revolution, declared independence from Russia, became a republic.

DOC.Title: Estonia
DOC.TEXT: During the Russian Revolution in November 1917, declaring independence from Russia, the Soviet regime approved independence in 20 years.

DOC.Title: Latvia
DOC.TEXT: November 18, 1918 declared independence from Russia, the Soviet regime approved independence in August 20.

DOC.Title: Lithuania
DOC.TEXT: February 16, 1918 Declared independence from Russia, the Soviet regime approved independence in June 20.

DOC.Title: Baltic Country 3
DOC.TEXT: Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania on the Baltic Sea coast.

DOC.Title: Poland
DOC.TEXT: In 1918 Wilson 's fourteen criminal cases supported independence, declared independence as the Republic of Poland on 3 November, and was officially approved at the 19th Paris Peace Conference.

DOC.Title: Selb = Croat = Sloven Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: Declared independence from Austria in December 1918 and was officially approved by the Saint-Germain Treaty. From intricate ethnic problems to intimidation, the dictatorship by the king was launched for 29 years, and the country was renamed the Yugoslav kingdom.

DOC.Title: Yugoslavia
DOC.TEXT: In 1929, in the king 's coup d'etat, Selb-Croat-Sloven' s Kingdom was reorganized and renamed.

DOC.Title: Arabic independence
DOC.TEXT: He stood at the allied side in the First World War and fought with the Ottoman Empire. In 1916 Hussein built the Kingdom of Hagers under the support of Britain, but in 24 UK assisted Ibn Saul to build a new Kingdom, which became the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in 1932.

DOC.Title: Mandate Governance
DOC.TEXT: A system of disposing the territory of the Ottoman Empire, the defeated country after the First World War. It is a nominal term to delegate governance from the League of Nations, but in fact it was a subdivision of the territory. Many were enforced in Asia where you do not want to apply ethnic self-determination.

DOC.Title: Iraq
DOC.TEXT: Old Ottoman Empire territory. In 1920, it was regarded as the mandate ruling territory of the UK and became independent in 1932.

DOC.Title: Palestine
DOC.TEXT: Old Ottoman Empire territory. In 1920, it was regarded as the mandate rule of the UK.

DOC.Title: Trans Jordan
DOC.TEXT: Old Ottoman Empire territory. In 1920 the Arab local government was established in Transjordan with British aid. It became the mandate rule of the UK in 21 years, became the constitution kingdom under British rule in 28 years, independence is 46 years.

DOC.Title: Syria
DOC.TEXT: Old Ottoman Empire territory. In 1920, it was regarded as the mandate rule of France and became an independent country for 43 years.

DOC.Title: Lebanon
DOC.TEXT: Old Ottoman Empire territory. In 1920, it was regarded as the mandate rule of France and became independent for 43 years.

DOC.Title: International collaborationism
DOC.TEXT: Each country who was discouraged by the great damage of World War I, worked together. As maintaining the capitalist international order was the primary objective, the Soviet Union Soviet Union was eliminated and claims of colonies and small countries were largely ignored.

DOC.Title: League of Nations
DOC.TEXT: The first collective international security organization of history based on Wilson 's proposal to fourteen people. The establishment was decided by the Treaty of Versailles, which was officially launched in January 1920. There were drawbacks such as the exclusion of the US and the exclusion of the Soviet Union and Germany, the leadership of Britain and France, unanimous principles in each country vote, uncertainty of sanctioning provisions, but became the center of postwar international cooperation. The headquarters is Geneva, Switzerland.

DOC.Title: General Assembly
DOC.TEXT: The Supreme Council of the League of Nations. It consisted of one vote of one member country, unanimity as a rule.

DOC.Title: Board of Directors
DOC.TEXT: One of the highest institutions of the Federation. The permanent members are Britain, France, Italy and Japan, and Germany was added in 1926. The non-permanent members are the four countries elected by the general assembly-from 22 years to 6 countries, 26 to 9 countries.

DOC.Title: Federation Secretariat
DOC.TEXT: Permanent in Geneva.

DOC.Title: International Labor Organization, ILO
DOC.TEXT: We have made recommendation and mediation as coordinating institutions of domestic labor problems, affiliated with the Federation.

DOC.Title: Permanent International Court of Justice
DOC.TEXT: Federation affiliated organization permanently established in The Hague in 1920. It was an arbitration institution without mandatory rights.

DOC.Title: International Federation not participating, not going to the United Nations League
DOC.TEXT: In March 1920, as the isolationist tide after the war increased, strong Republican senators rejected the ratification of the Versailles Treaty and decided not to participate. The International Federation's advocate country, the non-participation of the United States, reduced the significance of the federation.

DOC.Title: Washington Conference
DOC.TEXT: With the advocacy of President Harding of the United States, we concluded naval disarmament treaties, nine national treaties and four-party treaties among major countries. It showed an increase in the international voice of the United States after the war.

DOC.Title: Washington regime
DOC.TEXT: An international organization created based on the Washington Conference of 1921-22. Maintaining the colonial system in the Pacific Ocean, opening up the door to China (guaranteeing opportunities for entry into the United States, suppression of excessive expansion in Japan), etc. With the Versailles system in the direction of Europe, 1920 It became the pillar of the international order of the age.

DOC.Title: Washington Naval Armament Restriction Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Signed in 1922. The main ship ownership ratio of the main attack weapon of those days was set to 5, 5, 3, 1.67, 1.67 in the United Kingdom, the United States, Japan, France, Italy. Responding to the desire for peace, it has stopped the arms race competition. The same ratio of emerging America and the maritime kingdom Britain reflected the change in national strength after the war.

DOC.Title: Nine Country Treaties
DOC.TEXT: Signed in 1922. America, UK, Japan, France, Italy, China, the Netherlands, Belgium, Portugal promised respect for China's sovereignty and independence, territorial integrity, equal opportunity, opening the door. American assertion to China street, Ishii-Lansing agreement has expired, Japan's entry into China has retreated to the state before the request.

DOC.Title: Convention of the Four Countries
DOC.TEXT: Signed in 1921. America, UK, France and Japan promised mutual respect of territory and interests of the Pacific region and non-military bases of the islands.

DOC.Title: Delegation of Japan-UK alliance
DOC.TEXT: It was resolved automatically upon the formation of the treaty of the four countries.

DOC.Title: Locarno Treaty
DOC.TEXT: In October 1925, seven countries, Britain, France, Germany, Italy, Belgium, Poland, Czech Republic, were hypothesized at Locarno in Switzerland and officially signed in December London. In the Western European Security Treaty, the condition of maintenance of status quo, mutual non-invasion, arbitration trial of conflict, and the accession of the German Federation took place.

DOC.Title: Germany's joining of the International Federation
Geneva Disarmament Conference
DOC.TEXT: Discussed supplementary ship disarmament between Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States. France and Italy did not participate, eventually broke up without reaching an agreement.

DOC.Title: Treaty of non-war, Kellogg Brian Treaty
DOC.TEXT: US Secretary of State Kellogg and French Foreign Minister Purian have been the center, and the treaty signed by 15 countries in Paris in 1928. After that, 63 countries added. Convention that "the resolution of international conflict is not by force".

DOC.Title: Kellogg
DOC.TEXT: As Secretary of State Secretary of State (1925-29), he endeavored to establish a non-war treaty.

DOC.Title: Brian
DOC.TEXT: French politician and socialist. He served several times as Prime Minister and Foreign Minister, promoted peaceful diplomacy and advocated a non-war treaty.

DOC.Title: London Disarmament Conference
DOC.TEXT: We have prescribed that the holdings of auxiliary ships are less than 10 · 10 · 7 in Britain · America · Japan. In particular, the Japanese military and right wing forces strongly rebounded and became a major turning point for Japan's militarization.

DOC.Title: Lloyd-George Nationwide Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: British cabinet established with the cooperation of the Conservative Party, mainly by Liberty George of Liberal Party. From the time of war to just after the war, strong guidance was made.

DOC.Title: Fourth election law amendment
DOC.TEXT: The first election law in the UK. Voting rights have been expanded to adult men and women older than 30 years.

DOC.Title: Women's suffrage, British women's suffrage rights
DOC.TEXT: The first election law in the UK. Voting rights have been expanded to adult men and women older than 30 years.

DOC.Title: Shin-Fayne Party
DOC.TEXT: The Irish political party formed in 1905. He advocated radical radical anti-British, immediate independence, gradually extended the power, including supporting the Easter raising of Easter (April 16th April 16th when England was absorbed in the game against Germany).

DOC.Title: Ireland Free Country
DOC.TEXT: In the general election of 1918 Sin = Faye party won the victory, declared independence in 19 years. The UK also made concessions and acknowledged the Irish Free State as a self-governing body in 22 years. The prime minister is De Vallera.

DOC.Title: De = Valera
DOC.TEXT: An American born Irish. Leader of independence movement. After independence he served the prime minister and the president for a long time.

DOC.Title: Ale
DOC.TEXT: Ireland Free Country established a new Constitution in 1937, also declared that it will be a complete independent state by leaving the United Kingdom Commonwealth, renamed it.

DOC.Title: United Kingdom Commonwealth
DOC.TEXT: After the First World War, the British Empire was renamed in this way as the British colony acquires autonomy right from the home country both domestic and diplomatic. According to the Balfour report at the British Imperial Conference in 1926 and the decision of the 31st year Westminster Charter.

DOC.Title: British Imperial Conference, 1926 British Imperial Conference
DOC.TEXT: During the war in Britain, the conference attempted to recognize that the dominance of the British dominate the dominance of the home country, and to hold it in the home country.

DOC.Title: Westminster Charter
DOC.TEXT: Act established in 1931, the law which established the status of the UK dominion. Contents that Britain 's rulers have legislative and judicial powers independent of Britain' s home country.

DOC.Title: McDonald
DOC.TEXT: British Labor Party leader. I insisted on anti war during the war. He served as Prime Minister at the Labor Party Cabinet (1924, 29-31) and the Nationwide Cabinet (1931-35).

DOC.Title: Labor party cabinet
DOC.TEXT: In 1924 the first Labor Party cabinet in the United Kingdom came into existence, with the expansion of voting rights after the war, the second round was established in 1929. We did not adopt Marxism, aimed at moderate reform.

DOC.Title: First McDonald's Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Britain 's first Labor government. Approving the new government of the Soviet Union and trying to focus on social welfare, it collapsed in a short period of time.

DOC.Title: 5th election law amendment
DOC.TEXT: Election rights are granted to all women aged 21 and older as much as men, and the general election system in the UK is completed.

DOC.Title: Poincaré right cabinet
DOC.TEXT: The Cabinet organized three times by Poincaré of the French Conservative Party. Especially the Cabinet (1922 ~ 24) organized in the 2 nd round forced occupation of the rules.

DOC.Title: Rule Occupation, Rule Soldiers
DOC.TEXT: A case where the French Poincaré cabinet invited Belgium and occupied the rule industrial area with the pretext of delaying payment of German compensation. Germany ceased production with the resistance of non-cooperation · The economy got into turmoil, but the French side got no place to go and the failure of the German hard-line measures became clear.

DOC.Title: Leftist union government, French leftist union government
DOC.TEXT: In June 1924, the Socialist Party of Japan and the radical Socialist Party of France fought and won the general election, was born, the left wing federation regime.
