He made peaceful diplomacy, signed the Rocarno Treaty with the withdrawal of the rules, but achieved results, but collapsed in 26 years due to financial difficulty, inflation progression and so on.

DOC.Title: Brian
DOC.TEXT: He served as Prime Minister and Foreign Minister of France. Socialist and succeeded in cooperation with Germany. The Locarno Treaty was established in 1925, and the Treaty of No War was established in 28 years.

DOC.Title: German Social Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: A German socialist party, established at the end of the 19th century. When the First World War broke out, the majority departed from Marxism, lost revolutionary colors and cooperated with the war. After the Great Battle it held the regime, but in 1933 he was dissolved in the Nazis.

DOC.Title: German Independent Social Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1917, the revolutionary party formed by the anti-war school within the Social Democratic Party. Although it claimed a revolution from 18 years, it stayed in a minority group, split into right and left for 20 years, and joined with the Communist Party and the Social Democratic Party, respectively.

DOC.Title: Spartacus team
DOC.TEXT: A radical organization that led the anti-war / revolution immediately after the end of World War I (from November to December 1918). Based on the Spartacus faction formed by Left Knehit in the left wing of the Social Democratic Party in 1916, it became the center of formation of the German Communist Party of December 30, 1918.

DOC.Title: Rosa-Luxembourg
DOC.TEXT: A German female revolutionary from Poland. In the revisionist controversy theoretically guided the left Social Democratic Party. It was massacred after the 1919 uprising (called "Spartacs Uprising" by the Social Democratic Party and the military).

DOC.Title: Carl-Reeve Knecht
DOC.TEXT: Social Democratic Party lawmakers insisted on a single anti war during the war. After guidance of the Spartacus (group), he was also active in organizing the German Communist Party, but was slaughtered after the 1919 uprising.

DOC.Title: German Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: It was formed mainly at the end of 1918 by the Spartacus. After the uprising in January 1919 it increased party power and attacked the Social Democratic Party from the radicalist point of view.

DOC.Title: Weimar National Congress, Weimar National Assembly
DOC.TEXT: It was convened in February 1919, led by the Social Democratic Party and enacted the Weimar constitution.

DOC.Title: Weimar Constitution, Weimar's Constitution
DOC.TEXT: Constitution of the German Republic established in 1919. The sovereign residents, the common election of gender equality, the right to organize workers and the right to collective bargaining, presidential system for seven year term, etc. were prescribed and it was the most democratic constitution in the world at that time.

DOC.Title: Weimar Republic, Weimar Republic
DOC.TEXT: The German republic from the time when the Weimar constitution is enacted until the Nazis acquires the regime. Although there was a democratic constitution, it was exposed to right wing attacks claiming reparation problems, inflation, revolution and the right to claim to destroy the Treaty of Versailles, and after the occurrence of the Great Depression, the Nazis who won the administration over social instability I was knocked down.

DOC.Title: Eberto
DOC.TEXT: Social Democratic leader. Became Prime Minister in the German Revolution at the end of World War, and suppressed the uprising of the Spartacus in January 1919. Being the temporary president of the German Republic in the Weimar National Assembly, from 1919 to the death of 25 years, he took the middle route as the president of the German republic (the first generation), but suffered from an unstable political situation by violent attacks of both sides.

DOC.Title: Compensation problem
DOC.TEXT: In 1921, the reparations officially decided to be the 132 billion gold mark exceeded the capabilities of Germany, the defeated country, extremely squeezed the lives of the people. The dissatisfaction with the government taking a performance policy focusing mainly on payment compensation increased, and the right wing cried against the Versailles regime.

DOC.Title: Rule Occupation
DOC.TEXT: A case where the French / Belgian armies occupied the rules of the German industrial zone due to delay in reparations of Germany. Germany carried out passive resistance such as sabotage, but it suffered from extreme inflation and faced an economic and social crisis. When I saw that there was no achievement in France, I withdrew from the formation of the Dose plan and turned to coordination with Germany.

DOC.Title: Inflation
DOC.TEXT: As a result of the occupation of the rules, German industrial production stagnated and the price surged suddenly. The value of Marc fell to 1 trillionth of that during the war, people's lives were destroyed, political unrest increased.

DOC.Title: Strateman
DOC.TEXT: German politician. Although it was right-winging until the defeat, he became the leader of the German People's Party, and in 1923 as the Prime Minister of the Great Dall coalition, he struggled to stabilize the currency and rebuild the economy. Since then he became foreign minister of successive cabinet, actively promoted cooperative diplomacy, became the leading role of German economic recovery and peaceful diplomacy.

DOC.Title: Rentenmark
DOC.TEXT: In November 1923, banknotes issued for inflation pickup. We issued income from real estate etc. as collateral, exchanged 1 trillion marks with 1 Rentenmark, inflation sharply miraculously met.

DOC.Title: Dose plan
DOC.TEXT: German new compensation system established in 1924. It was created by a special committee chaired by an American financist Dose. The main content is to lend US capital to Germany and to reduce the amount of compensation for immediate duty. It became the cause of France 's withdrawal of rules and became the basis for the reconstruction and rationalization of the German economy.

DOC.Title: Locarno Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Signed in 1925. Seven countries, Britain, France, Germany, Italy, Belgium, Poland and the Czech Republic, were regional collective security agreements promising line disarmament and mutual non-invasion, which was the result of Stolazeman coordinated diplomacy.

DOC.Title: Germany's joining of the International Federation
DOC.TEXT: By concluding the Locarno treaty, Germany's acceptance of the International Federation was approved.

DOC.Title: Hindenburg
DOC.TEXT: German soldier. It became a national hero with victory of Tannenberg. Although he retired after the defeat, he ran for the presidential election in 1925 and won the victory, becoming the president (responsible 1925-34). It was conservative and covered the imperialist, the right wing and the military, but we could not cope with the Great Depression and allowed the rise of the Nazis and appointed Hitler as prime minister.

DOC.Title: Draft Young
DOC.TEXT: German new compensation plan drafted in 1929, signed for 30 years. It was created by a committee headed by the American finance house Young, reducing the total amount of compensation to about 35.8 billion gold marks and relaxing payment for 59 years. In the 32nd year it was revised to 3 billion gold at the Lausanne conference, but Hitler unilaterally abandoned it for 33 years.

DOC.Title: Lausanne Conference
DOC.TEXT: International conference on compensation and war bond issues. We decided to postpone the payment of German damages in the collapse in the Great Depression and reduce it to 3 billion gold marks. The war bonds to the US were also resolved, and the reparation and war bond problem actually ended.

DOC.Title: Hungarian Revolution
DOC.TEXT: In the confusion of defeat and independence, Hungary's Socialist Party / Communist Party established the Soviet regime following the Russian revolution. However, it was overthrown by the intrusion of Horti or Romanian troops.

DOC.Title: Republic of Hungary
DOC.TEXT: In November 1918, he became independent from Austria as a republic.

DOC.Title: Holuti
DOC.TEXT: A soldier of Hungary and a politician. I killed the Republic of Hungary = Soviet. Since 1920, the regency was revived to become regent, strengthening the dictatorship system. Afterwards he cooperated with the Nazis, but he fainted in 1944 and exiled to Portugal.

DOC.Title: Masaryk
DOC.TEXT: Politician in Czechoslovakia dedicated to independence movement, became the first president (tenure 1918-35). I trained the Czech Republic in the Western European parliamentary and industrial countries in Eastern Europe.

DOC.Title: Venezu
DOC.TEXT: Politician of Czechoslovakia. After studying in Western Europe, working towards independence movement with Masaryk, 1918 Foreign Minister, 35 years President. Exiled as a result of the formation of the Munich agreement in 38 years. Although he became president in 46 years after World War II, he resigned from the revolution of 48 years and died suddenly shortly afterwards.

DOC.Title: Pilsudski
DOC.TEXT: A politician / independent activist in Poland. In 1918 he declared independence and became the head of state himself and instructed the war against Soviet (Poland = Soviet war). In 1922 he resigned from the side attacked, but in 26 years he took over the power with the military-centered coup d'etat, then strengthened the dictatorship system.

DOC.Title: Fascism
DOC.TEXT: Dictatorship denying parliamentary democracy. After the First World War, it appeared in Italy where social turmoil continued, and also dominated power in Germany and the like after the depression. It is also called totalitem.

DOC.Title: Italian Socialist Party
DOC.TEXT: The first modern political party in Italy, founded in 1892. We insisted antiwar / neutrality in World War I, and expanded its party party rapidly after the war.

DOC.Title: Northern Italy's strike
DOC.TEXT: A large strike of workers occurred in Northern Italy from April to September 1920. It took place in protest against the economic turmoil after the First World War, especially the rise in price inflation, but it was overwhelmed by government mediation proposal and ended in failure. The left wing's movement was weakened by this, and fascism forces expanded.

DOC.Title: Socialist side leftist
DOC.TEXT: In 1921, separated from the improvementism of the Socialist Party and separated, Italy Communist Party was formed.

DOC.Title: Mussorini
DOC.TEXT: Italian politicians and dictators. He served as editor in chief of the Socialist Party Institution magazine with a lingering tongue, but was excluded from the party in favor of participating in the great war. After that it turned to a position of anti-socialism, formed a fascism party in 1919 after the war. In the 22nd Roman military affair, he took over the administration and established a dictatorship system by 25 years.

DOC.Title: Fascist Party, Fascist Party
DOC.TEXT: Fascism political party founded by Mussolini. In 1919 it was launched as a "warrior's fashion", after that, it attacked labor unions and farmers' organizations, expanded support to capitalists, landlords, military, etc., renamed them Fascist Party. In 22 years, organized the Roman troops took the seat of administration, but in 43 years Mussolini was defeated and the party was dissolved.

DOC.Title: Roman advance
DOC.TEXT: Mussorini organized to acquire power, intimidating demonstrative behavior. The military thought about crushing but because the king refused, the Mussorini regime was established.

DOC.Title: One-party dictatorship system
DOC.TEXT: In the 1926 parliament, it was established by dissolution of all parties other than the fascist party.

DOC.Title: Fascism Great Council
DOC.TEXT: Although it was the supreme voting body of the fascist party, in 1928 it officially became the nation's highest voting body, and the one-party dictatorship was completed.

DOC.Title: Fumume consolidation
DOC.TEXT: Fiume is the land of the northern coast of the Adriatic Sea. Italy requested consolidation since the end of World War II, and after World War II he was fighting with Yugos on this issue, but in 1919 the rightist militant occupation was occupied. It will be free city for 20 years, but Mussorini again merged again in 24 years. Italy was defeated in World War II and became the territory of Yugoslavia.

DOC.Title: Protected State of Albania
DOC.TEXT: In 1926, the Italian troops stationed soldiers under the pretext of concluding the Tirana Convention, deepening cooperative relations and goodwill, making it a de facto protected country.

DOC.Title: Lateran Convention, Lateran Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The treaty which the Italian government and the Roman Government settled. Mussorini acknowledged the Vatican as a nation and approved that Catholic is the only religion in Italy, since the Italian government annexed the Roman pontificate in 1870, and the pope also approved the Mussolini government Acknowledged.

DOC.Title: Vatican City
DOC.TEXT: Located in the city of Rome with the Papacy. In the Lateran Treaty of 1929, the Vatican City was confirmed to be an independent country with which the Papacy had exclusive control.

DOC.Title: Death of Lenin
DOC.TEXT: The death of a powerful leader of the Russian revolution intensified the dispute, such as how to build the Soviet society afterwards, who will attract the successor.

DOC.Title: Trotsky
DOC.TEXT: Soviet revolutionary leader. Lenin helped guide the November Revolution and led the civil war to victory as a military commissioner. Although he was seen as a successor to Lenin, he was defeated by Stalin. It was expelled from the country in 1929 and since then it tried to counterstalin movement but was assassinated in Mexico.

DOC.Title: World Revolution Theory
DOC.TEXT: It is also called permanent revolutionary theory. The theory claimed by Trotsky as the center. Since Russia is a developed country, it can not survive because it is isolated, so the theory that the existence of the Soviet Union can be survived only by continuing the revolution worldwide and expanding socialist forces.

DOC.Title: Theory of Single-country Socialism
DOC.TEXT: The theory claimed by Stalin as the center. Russia is a backward country, but since it has a vast territory, the theory that socialism can continue to exist even in one country alone.

DOC.Title: Stalin
DOC.TEXT: Communist leader of the Soviet Union. Always stayed in mainstream and majority, losing Trotsky after Lenin's death, then letting the opponent out of battle and extermination, and in the early 1930's he took control of de facto dictatorship. From 1928 onwards, while promoting the five-year plan, he carried out fear politics to massacre the opponents under the name of purging and continued dictatorship until the death.

DOC.Title: Buharin
DOC.TEXT: Central leader of the Soviet Communist Party. In opposition to Stalin, he was executed, he was executed.

DOC.Title: First Five-Year Plan
DOC.TEXT: A full-fledged socialist planned economy started after the production capacity recovered once in the neping period. Heavy industrial priority policy, agricultural mechanization / grouping was promoted. Although the Soviet Union developed from an agricultural country to an industrialized country, agriculture was devastated.

DOC.Title: Col ​​hoze
DOC.TEXT: Group farms by aggregation of agriculture. Share land and agricultural tools and use them jointly. It expanded nationwide in the five-year plan.

DOC.Title: Soft Hoes
DOC.TEXT: State farm. Land and production equipment were state owned, farmers worked in a salary system. Through the five-year plan, we switched from the former landowner's large farm (or Col Hoose).

DOC.Title: Second Five-Year Plan
DOC.TEXT: Although there were a large number of starvation and deaths occurred in the first five-year plan, some consideration was given to consumer goods production, but the international situation became tense, eventually put emphasis on heavy industry / military industry It was. It also coincided with the establishment period of Stalin dictatorship.

DOC.Title: Stalin regime, Stalin dictatorship regime
DOC.TEXT: It means Stalin's dictatorship from the early 1930's to the end of its death by 53 years. Stalin is focused on concentrating power on himself, despite constructing a socialist society, the opponents are executed and executed, and the number of victims is said to be several million.

DOC.Title: Abstinence Act
DOC.TEXT: The law prohibited the manufacture and sale of alcoholic beverages in the United States. Abolition law was enacted in 26 states before the First World War, but amended the 1917 Constitution and promulgated in 19. However, smuggling and smuggling by criminal grooves spread and was abolished for 33 years.

DOC.Title: Republican Party
DOC.TEXT: One of the two largest political parties in the United States. It began to represent the interests of industrial capital during the Civil War, and it was conserved more than the Democratic Party in the 20th century. After the First World War, the government was maintained until 1921-33.

DOC.Title: Wasp, WASP
DOC.TEXT: Abbreviation for White (W), Anglo-Saxon (AS), Protestant (P), which is the white middle class of the northern city. It became the central hierarchy of the American society of the 1920s.

DOC.Title: K · K · K, Koo-Kraks = Clan
DOC.TEXT: Anti black black secret organization formed in Tennessee in 1865. It revived in the 1920s.

DOC.Title: Sacco · Vanzetti case
DOC.TEXT: In 1920, the false accident that two anarchists were convicted of murder charges with insufficient evidence. A case symbolizing the conservatism and self-righteousness of American society at that time. On the other hand, the opposite opinion raged, but it was sentenced to death in 1927.

DOC.Title: Harding
DOC.TEXT: The 29th President from the Republican Party (President 1921-23). He took the trend of conservatism and isolationism, and won the election with "returning to normal state". It is known for hosting the Washington Conference and for a series of corruption cases that occurred under the administration.

DOC.Title: Coolidge
DOC.TEXT: The 30th president from Republican Party (Resigned from 1923 to 29). It was supported by the American boom in the 1920s and promoted the laissez-faireism.

DOC.Title: Immigration Law
DOC.TEXT: Legislation passed by the US Congress several times since 1875. Especially in the immigration law of 1882, Chinese immigrants are severely restricted, also called Chinese exclusion law. In 1924, the Immigration Law strengthened immigration restrictions on new immigrants (immigrants of East and Southern Europe that increased since the end of the 19th century), and furthermore Asian immigrants were banned entirely.

DOC.Title: Immigration Immigration Law
DOC.TEXT: Another name for the Immigration Act of 1924. It was called like this because it included content that prohibits immigration from Japan all the way, and the worsening of Japan-US relations advanced further.

DOC.Title: Hoover
DOC.TEXT: The 31st President of the Republican Party (President 1929-33). We insisted on the eternal prosperity of capitalism through free laissezza, and even when the Great Depression occurred we rarely took measures and made the situation more serious.

DOC.Title: "Everlasting prosperity"
DOC.TEXT: Presented by President Hoover at the beginning of 1929, the words expressing an optimistic view on the future of the American economy. But in the autumn a depression began.

DOC.Title: Ford
DOC.TEXT: 1903 Established Ford Motor Company, Introduced Flow Working Method, Succeeded in Mass Production and Low Price of Popular Car "T Type Ford" Symbol of mass production and mass consumption era.

DOC.Title: Mass production / mass consumption
DOC.TEXT: A system that consumes large quantities of large quantities that was established against the rapid development of industrialization. Since the 1920s, the United States has taken the world leadership in new industrial fields such as automobiles and electrical products (irons, washing machines, refrigerators, radios are representative), and has devised a mass production system, on the other hand, It is possible to expand the purchasing power of the mass consumption, such a system was established. The so-called "American way of life" was carried out, pop culture became complicated, enriching the people's economic and cultural life, but a large number of uniform products are produced, which people consume in large quantities There is also a point that it has led to uniformity in values. Moreover, wasteful energy and resources progressed, which also caused the destruction of the global environment.

DOC.Title: Mass consumption society
DOC.TEXT: A system of mass production and mass consumption has penetrated and a society where consumption civilization has come to reach the general public.

DOC.Title: Contemporary Popular Culture
DOC.TEXT: Culture developed based on the development of the American economy in the 1920s. Especially radio, movie and professional sports developed as entertainment of the masses, and it became a trigger for popular society formation.

DOC.Title: New Middle Tier
DOC.TEXT: A hierarchy located between rich capitalists and relatively poor workers. Generally, the white collar layer of the city, the land ownership farmers, the small commerce and industry, etc. are classified into this hierarchy, but since they do not have large assets and on the other hand can not receive protection of union organizations etc., from economic depression and inflation It was easy to be hit hard. For that reason, when the social and economic situation deteriorates, it is analyzed that it has become dissatisfied with politics and society, runs to extreme conservatism, becoming the central supporter of fascism.

DOC.Title: 21 Requests for Clause
DOC.TEXT: The Okuma cabinet of Japan submitted to the government of Yusei. Transfer of former German interests in Shandong, de facto Japanese rule of southern China in Tohoku region and inner Mongolia in China, contents of interference requesting China's domestic affairs etc. Although the Yan government succumbed to the hard-line attitude of the Japanese government, the anti-Japanese movement of Chinese people further increased with this.

DOC.Title: Literary Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Part of the Chinese New Cultural Movement, which was developed around the White Eye Movement in 1917. With the magazine 'New Youth' set in, Mr. Hu, Chen Xiuhui, Lee Tao Lu, Lu Xun and others gained popularity.

DOC.Title: New culture movement
DOC.TEXT: An enlightenment campaign centering on intellectuals, young people and students. Many parts overlap with the literary revolution. With "New Youth" as the stage, he introduced modern European culture, criticized Confucianism and feudalism thought, and had a major influence on the fifth and fourth movements.

DOC.Title: Peking University
DOC.TEXT: Being the predecessor of Keisei Daigakudo founded in 1898, Beijing University in 1912. When Chen Yuan culture took office as president in 16 years, Hwang, Chen Xinhua, Lee Dae-hyeon and others of the time at that time were renewed their schoolwinds as professors and became the center of the new cultural movement, the fifth and the fourth movement, including students It was.

DOC.Title: Chen Dianhide
DOC.TEXT: An early thinker of the Republic of China, the central character of the literary revolution. In Shanghai in 1915 launched "Youth Magazine" (titled "New Year" the following year), became professor at Beijing University in 17 years, but retired from conservative society leaning to Marxism during the fifth and fourth movement, retired . After that, he received the aid from Comintern and founded the Chinese Communist Party in 1921, becoming the first chairman (1921-27). It was criticized for a compromising attitude with the national government side for 27 years and was expelled from the party in 1929.

DOC.Title: "New Youth"
DOC.TEXT: In September 1915, an educational magazine "Youth Magazine" that Shin Hai published in Shanghai was titled "New Youth" the following year. He introduced modern rationalism in Europe and the United States, criticized Confucian thought which was former system of Chinese former morality, criticized Confucian thought, strongly supported the white story movement and literary revolution.

DOC.Title: Hu suitable
DOC.TEXT: A Chinese scholar. While advancing to the United States advocating white talk literature, it became the beginning of the literary revolution. In 1917 he became Professor of Beijing University and criticized Confucian thought from the standpoint of pragmatism (practicalism). However, after the movement of the fifth and fourth movement, it shifted to refinementism for conservatism, and in the situation that the communist side became dominant in the Chinese civil war after the Second World War, he exiled to the United States for 48 years.

DOC.Title: White story movement, white talk literary movement
DOC.TEXT: Movement trying to express literature in a friendly spoken language from the old esoteric literary body. It was started in 1917 when advocated by Hu Hui, but this reform that leads to the cultural liberation of the masses was supported by cultural people and students.

DOC.Title: Lee Dae Woo
DOC.TEXT: Initial thinker of the Republic of China. Marxist thinker and one of the founder of the Chinese Communist Party. He was a professor at Beijing University and theoretically guided the fifth and fourth movement. Although it also contributed to the national cooperative work of 1924, it was captured in the 27th anniversary crew and executed.

DOC.Title: Lu Xun
DOC.TEXT: Initial literary person in the Republic of China. My real name is Zhou Tree. While studying in Japan during the Russo-Japanese War, he turned from medicine to literature. After returning home, I sent a teacher's life, and in literary revolution, in Beijing I announced "madman diary", promoted white-talk literature. After the fifth and fourth exercises, he pursued the root of social evil thoroughly, in a work including "A Q Qingda".

DOC.Title: "Madman Diary"
DOC.TEXT: Lu Xun's novel. A white story novel that was announced in 1918 during the literary revolution. In the form of madman's notebook, denying tradition, especially Confucian thought, became the starting point of Chinese modern literature.

DOC.Title: "Al Qaedao"
DOC.TEXT: Lu Xun's novel. Works of 1921. With poor farmer Aki as the main character, he thoroughly criticized the consciousness of the Chinese people who do not try to find a tragedy reality.

DOC.Title: Dalai = Rama XIII
DOC.TEXT: The teacher of Tibetan Buddhism who contributed to the independence and modernization of Tibet. In 1913, I returned to Tibet from the exile, and concluded a treaty with the UK the following year and made it the first step in accepting international status.

DOC.Title: Mongolian People's Republic
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1924, a republic of socialist situated in outer Mongolia. In 1920, Suhae Bartle and Choibalsan, who formed the People's Revolutionary Party of Mongolia, came up with independence from the Red Army and achieved independence. In 1924, declared the formation of the People's Republic, became the second socialist country following the Soviet Union. The capital city is Ulaanbaatar (old warehouse).

DOC.Title: Mongolian People's Revolutionary Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1920 the center organization of liberation of Mongolia, formed by Suhae Bertle and Choibalsan et al.

DOC.Title: Choibalsan
DOC.TEXT: Sue bartle's ally. He was active in the construction of the People's Republic of Mongolia and took office as Prime Minister in 1939.

DOC.Title: Korean Governor's Office
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1910, the highest institution of Japan's rule of rule. I reported to the Emperor.

DOC.Title: Military politics
DOC.TEXT: After Korea annexation, Korea domination by the power of the military and police force, which Japan went through the Korean Governor General. It deprived liberties such as speech, publication, gathering, etc., furthermore enforced Japanese, confiscated land through land survey, raised ethnic awareness among Koreans.

DOC.Title: San-I Movement, Banzai Incident
DOC.TEXT: Japan's suppression of the movement the Korean people asked for independence from Japan. Inspired by the principle of self-determination of peoples at the Paris Peace Conference, a declaration of independence was issued on March 1, and a demonstration of the people shouting "Korea independence independence" was held in various places in Korea. Japan's military and police thoroughly oppressed this, and there were victims who are said to be the dead 8000 people.

DOC.Title: Republic Korea Republic Government
DOC.TEXT: In April 1919, the government declared establishment in Shanghai to inherit the three-and-one movement. It depended heavily on the strength, soon became famous and innocent. The first president is Lee Seiyoun.

DOC.Title: Culture politics
DOC.TEXT: After the San-I movement, the designation of the Korean rule of governance that Japan did. Although we adopted a relaxing measure to the limited extent, the result forced the Japanese language and customs, and obliterated the Korean culture. During the Pacific War, we made the name of Japanese style celebrated, and we visited the shrine etc.

DOC.Title: Taisho democracy
DOC.TEXT: The tendency of liberalism and democracy that was uplifted in the Taisho era. Beginning with intellectuals awakened to democracy against the background of the industrial development and the rapid increase of urban people R and spread to the public general public as well.

DOC.Title: Rice fighting
DOC.TEXT: Rising prices due to the First World War began to rise in the rice price from around 1917, spreading throughout the country as a result of the wife's ivy started in Namerikawa, Toyama Prefecture in August 18. Spontaneous public disturbance. Terauchi cabinet resigned, the first political party cabinet of Japan emerged in Japan.

DOC.Title: Siberian dispatch
DOC.TEXT: In the Soviet intervention war by the Terauchi Cabinet, the original cabinet also continued. Supporting the anti-revolutionary army, I bought war cost 1 billion yen and death about 3000, it ended without success.

DOC.Title: Great Kanto Earthquake
DOC.TEXT: A major earthquake that occurred mainly in the southern part of Kanto on September 1, 1923. One in Kanto, including Tokyo and Yokohama, suffered major damage. The aftermath of the earthquake disaster caused the Japanese economy to stagnate. In addition, Korean massacre incident caused by rumor occurred.

DOC.Title: Ordinary Election Law, Japan Male Ordinary Election Law
DOC.TEXT: Amendment to the House of Representatives election law passed in 1925. Men who are 25 years old or more awarded voting rights, men who are over 30 years old have given election rights.

DOC.Title: Security maintenance law
DOC.TEXT: It was issued in 1925 by the Royal Decree. Laws of repression of labor movement and democratization movement in Japan. Afterwards the death penalty was added to penalties, and it was used for speech and thought suppression. Abolition for 45 years.

DOC.Title: Financial crisis
DOC.TEXT: Crisis of bankruptcy in nationwide scale occurred in March 1927. Full-scale from the installation of banks in the Keihin area, bankruptcy of small and medium-sized banks continued. We implemented a moratorium (payment moratorium) and temporarily suspended banks nationwide, so we calmed down in May. This influence caused the Wakatsuki cabinet to collapse, and the Tanaka cabinet was formed.

DOC.Title: Tanaka Cabinet, Yoshikazu Tanaka Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Cabinet of political party. Domestically, the law on security maintenance was strengthened, and the labor movement and socialist movement were thoroughly oppressed. Externally we actively made advance in China, we carried out the Shandong dispatch and caused the Jinan case. It fell over the responsibility problem of Manchurian Incident Case (Ching Woo Bomb Murder Case).

DOC.Title: Chingaku bomb killing case
DOC.TEXT: June, 1928

DOC.Title: Shandong dispatch
DOC.TEXT: A case where the Tanaka cabinet dispatched soldiers for nominal protection of residents. The aim was in preventing the reunification of the Chinese by the clearing of the National Revolutionary Army and the military advance in Japan. In 1927, he took 2nd soldiers in the first and the 28th year, sent a reinforcement unit to the Jinan case, raised criticism both inside and outside.

DOC.Title: Jinan Incident
DOC.TEXT: A case of a collision between the Japanese army and the northernmost troops occurred in Shandong Jinan. The Japanese Tanaka cabinet, which took a hindrance to the Kitakami army of the North, was dispatched to Jinnam on the occasion of protection of Japanese residents and massacred and thousands of civilians were occupied. After that, the northernmost troops pursued further collision, bypassed Jinan, aimed at Beijing. In the following May, the agreement was concluded and the Japanese army withdrew but the Chinese sentiment towards Japan deteriorated.

DOC.Title: Stephen Rui
DOC.TEXT: Anhui faction warrior's bigger head. After the death of Yuyo Kai, he grasped the administration of Beijing, received assistance from Japan (Nishihara ODA loan) taking a policy of Japan-Japan policy. In World War I participated in the Allied side in August 1917.

DOC.Title: five / four movement
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic movement started in Beijing on May 4, 1919. Public opinion in China rose dramatically as the request for disposal was refused at the Paris Peace Conference. Beginning with a demo by about 3000 students in Beijing in April, it developed and expanded to the patriotic movement of national student, citizen, worker's anti-imperialism and anti-feudalism. Eventually, the government released arrested students and refused to sign the Treaty of Versailles.

DOC.Title: Denial of signing treaty of Versailles
Anti-imperialism, Rebels
DOC.TEXT: The fight of Chinese people against the imperialist forces promoting colonial ties with Chinese feudal factions. It became clear by the fifth and fourth movement.

DOC.Title: Anti-feudalismism
DOC.TEXT: It is feudal about politics that warlords and bureaucrats forcibly ignore the will and freedom of the people, and opposed to this.

DOC.Title: Drainage exercise
DOC.TEXT: Exclusion movement of Japanese and Japanese currency. Especially after 21 requests, it became intensified, and in the fifth and fourth movement it became the center of anti-imperialist fighting.

DOC.Title: Cantonese military government, Guangdong government
DOC.TEXT: Three times in 1917, 21 and 23, the government established in Guangzhou with Sun Yat-sen as the Omimoto. Since it was a coalition government of Sun Yat-sen and the southwest warlords, he intermitted three times due to internal conflict. In 1925, after the death of Sun Yat-sen, it was reorganized into Guangdong national government.

DOC.Title: Chinese National Party
DOC.TEXT: Secret society organized by Sun Yat-sen in 1914 The Chinese Revolutionary Party was renamed as a popular party in October of the same year under the influence of the 1955/4 movement.

DOC.Title: Callahan declaration
DOC.TEXT: In 1919, the Foreign Affairs People's Committee Agency Karakhan of the Soviet regime declared, for example, the abolition of the treaty of China inequality against Empire Russia era. We had great reactions to the various Chinese worlds who started awakening to nationalism in the fifth and fourth movement. However, in the re-declaration of the next 20 years, it retreated somewhat, such as excluding the Togai railroad.

DOC.Title: Chinese Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: A party leading the People's Republic of China today. It was formed in Shanghai in 1921, and there were more than 50 original members, and Chen Takuhide became the first chairman. Originally under the guidance of Comintern, we took a cooperative route with the Kuomintang under its policy, but the cooperation was broken because of the 4 · 12 coup occurred in 27 years.

DOC.Title: China National Party First Tournament
DOC.TEXT: The abbreviation for the 1st National Congress of the Chinese National Party held in Guangzhou in 1924. The KMT acknowledged that Communist Party members would join as individuals and established a joint national cooperation. In addition, we decided policies such as nurturing the National Revolutionary Army, the new Sanduism, "consecutive Soviet Social Cooperative Relief Engineering Agriculture".

DOC.Title: "Seo Seo · Shinko · Relief Engineering Farm"
DOC.TEXT: It was confirmed at the Sun Yat-sen · Iefei talks in 1923, and it was decided at the National Komeito First Competition in 24 years. "Collaboration with the Soviet Union, acceptance of Communist Party members, assistance of workers and farmers" was also a new development of San Democracy.

DOC.Title: Army clash overthrow
DOC.TEXT: For the unification and modernization of China, Sun Yat-sen is out, and it was transferred to execution by clearing.

DOC.Title: National Cooperation, First National Convention
DOC.TEXT: Cooperation system between the Chinese KMT and the Communist Party. Instead of coalescing equal, Communist Party was allowed to join the KMT as individuals with party affiliation, but the opposite was not admitted. It was realized with the strong instructions of Comintern which makes the main force of the National Revolution the KMT.

DOC.Title: Huangpu Army School
DOC.TEXT: In 1924, the Military Academy that the KMT built in Guangzhou. Shosuke stone was appointed to the principal.

DOC.Title: National Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution destroying imperialists and warlords, aiming for ethnic unity. Beginning with the revolutionary movement of Sun Yat-sen from the end of the 19th century, realization was realized through the joint cooperative, but after the collapse of the cooperative in the Shanghai (4 · 12) coup in 1927, the Chinese Kuomintang became the center It was practiced.

DOC.Title: Death of Sun Yat-sen
DOC.TEXT: Sun Yatonen died in March 1925, but shortly thereafter, the 5 · 30 incident occurred, the anti-imperialist movement expanded to the nationwide scale, the organization of the National Revolutionary Army promoted the unification of China, aimed at Sun Yat-sen The National Revolution has advanced further. However, Yusuke Stone, which was supposed to inherit Sun Yat-sen, will collapse the coalition of the nation and will revolutionize the national revolution with the KMT alone.

DOC.Title: May · Three ○ Movement
DOC.TEXT: Anti-imperialist movement that occurred in Shanghai on May 30, 1925. In February of the same year, fighting was intensified by Chinese workers in Shanghai 's Japanese management factory requesting improvements in treatment and strikes, and workers are shot dead in Shanghai on May 15 The protest campaign increased as the case evolved. A British police force fired at a demonstration of students and workers on May 30, many casualties came out and became a national anti-imperialist fight. In this movement, the work of the working class was also prominent, and it became confident and spread confident in the later ethnic movements.

DOC.Title: National Revolutionary Army
DOC.TEXT: Based on the decision of the Kuomintang-one general meeting in 1924, the official name of the troops organized in 25 years, centering on Huangpu Army School students in suburbs of Guangzhou. It is also called a national government army. In January 26, Yeosuke Stone became the general commander, and became the main force of the Futurari army.

DOC.Title: Guangzhou National Government, Guangdong National Government
DOC.TEXT: The government that the KMT established in July 1925. The official name is the National People's Government of the Republic of China, the foundation of the Taiwanese government today.

DOC.Title: Suzuki stone
DOC.TEXT: Chinese National Party leaders. I am from a soldier. After the death of Sun Yat-seng, he improved his ability within the KMT, became the general commander of the National Revolutionary Army in 1926, grabbed the military authority, and began to cut down. Hoping for the extension of the Communist forces, they approached the business world, landowners and foreign forces, and collapsed the cooperative cooperation with the Shanghai coup on April 12, 27. In the 28th year he became the national governor in Nanjing, afterwards he took power as the supreme leader of the national government.

DOC.Title: Chicken
DOC.TEXT: The fight that the National Revolutionary Army had overthrew the northern warlords and unified China. July 1926 issued Guangzhou, occupying Wuhan within the year. After the Shanghai Coup d'etat in 27 years, it was suspended temporarily due to national division etc. It restarted in April 28 and occupied Beijing June, and at the end of the same year Zhang Xiaobu of Fengtian warlord was subjected to the national government, unification was completed.

DOC.Title: Zhejiang Zaibatsu
DOC.TEXT: A group of capitalists who started as a buying capital and dominated the Chinese business world, mainly in Shanghai where imperialist power is concentrated. It was a conglomerate mainly composed of banks, became a masterpiece of Shanghai Anti-Community Coup of Shaolin Stone, after that he grew up in tandem with Shuri Seki (Nanjing National Government). The four major families (Chiang Kai-shek, Sungko sentence, Hangcheong Hui, Chen Tsuo) are central.

DOC.Title: Shanghai coup d'etat
DOC.TEXT: Anti-cowdait that Shosuke stone carried out in Shanghai on 12th April 1927, as the woodcutter is progressing. In response to the requests of imperialist countries and Zhejiang Zaibatsu, who were surprised by Shanghai liberated by the workers guided by the Communist Party, Yeonbe stone killed numerous communist members and workers. Although the national cooperative collapsed (nationwide division), Chiang Kai-shek was appreciated by the landlord · chaebol · imperialist countries, while the Communist Party moved the stage of the activity from the city to the rural village.

DOC.Title: Nanjing National Government
DOC.TEXT: In April 1927, Yusuke Stone gathered the Kuomintangist right wing to establish, and received support of imperialist power. In September, the Wuhan government merged, and in the 28th year Shuin Seng was appointed chief (Takeshi 1928-31, 43-48) and was approved by the country.

DOC.Title: Wuhan government, Wuhan national government
DOC.TEXT: In January 1927, the Kuomintang leftist and others of the Communist Party became the center, and the national government was established from Guangzhou to Wuhan to be established. In contrast to the Nanjing (national) government which Chiang Kai-shek was formed in April after the Shanghai coup d'etat, it split in July due to economic unrest and internal conflict, joining the Nanjing government in September.

DOC.Title: KMT leftist
DOC.TEXT: Anti-female stone · conservative who is representative of Wangjeon's inscription. Although the mainstream faction of the Wuhan government insisted on maintaining the cooperative cooperation, it later compromised with Yuzuke Stone and turned to anti-communism.

DOC.Title: Anhui faction
DOC.TEXT: A group of the Beijing warlord. The leader is Stephen Rui from Anhui. After the death of Yuusa Kai, the stage grabbed the administration with the support of Japan, but retired after being defeated by the Yasukuni war of 1920. After the second direct service war in 24 years, the stage took office as temporary standing but resigned in 26 years, Anhui disappeared in 28 years.

DOC.Title: Direct Faction
DOC.TEXT: A group of the Beijing warlord. Initially he was the leader of Fengokui, who was in direct opposition to the Anhu factions. After that, Cao Cao stood, won the Anping War of 1920 and established the Fengtian government and coalition government, but from this time the subordinate Wu Pheng studies became influential. Although the direct faction became prosperous due to the victory of the Fenghua war in 22 years, it went down to the second battle war in 24 years and disappeared in 28 years.

DOC.Title: Fengoku 璋
DOC.TEXT: Chinese soldier. It was a confrontation with Stephen Rui of Anhui as a direct army team.

DOC.Title: Wu Pei 孚
DOC.TEXT: Chinese soldier. Following Cao Cao, he won the Fenghua war and brought the heyday of the direct faction, but he was defeated in the second round of Sergeant war and fled to Sichuan.

DOC.Title: Fengtian War Crimes, Tohoku Warlords
DOC.TEXT: A warlord based on Zhang Mingbin that was based in the East 3 province and was supported by the Japanese army. It became powerful by associating with the direct faction who won the Anping War of 1920, but was defeated by Wu Pei in the first baton war of 22 years. However, he won the second battle war in the 24th year and dominated the Beijing government soon. It was annihilated by the assassination of 28 annual creation.

DOC.Title: Dongsan province
DOC.TEXT: Qing Dynasty · 3 provinces of Fengte · Jilin · Heilongjiang, located in Tohoku region of China. It was the target of Japan 's entry into the continent.

DOC.Title: Zhang Cheung
DOC.TEXT: The head of the Tohoku warlord bodhisattva. Although being under the support of the Japanese military, it was defeated by 1928 northern troops, and was bombed by the Japanese army (Kwantung Army) on the way home to Fengtian.

DOC.Title: Kwantung Army
DOC.TEXT: It was stationed to guard the Kanto and the South Manchurian Railroad · Japan's Army troops.

DOC.Title: Suicide bomb killing case, Fengtian incident
DOC.TEXT: An incident where the officers of the Kwantung Army bombarded Zhang Ming Ru losing to the Futenma by defeating North Korean forces with each train. What the Japanese military aimed for direct control in the Tohoku region of China.

DOC.Title: Zhang Ke Xiao
DOC.TEXT: The eldest son of Zhang Cheng. In 1928, after the father was bombed, it held the real power of Tohoku and opposed Japan, supported the unity of Chiang Kai-shek. In the Manchurian Incident, according to the intention of the warrior, I moved the army to the mainland without fighting. After returning to the country outside, he was made to the front line of the Communist Army conquest, but resonated with the claim of the Red Army, which gives priority to the anti-Japanese, he made a Xi'an incident in 36 years.

DOC.Title: Finished greening
DOC.TEXT: Beijing Army occupied Beijing in June 1928, and by the end of December the Zhang Zhang Zhuang of the Tohoku warlord showed loyalty to the national government, the unification of China (National Revolution) was completed at the time.

DOC.Title: Promises of post-war autonomy
DOC.TEXT: British Indian minister Montagu went by. Contents that will gradually realize autonomy in India.

DOC.Title: Rollert method
DOC.TEXT: A repression law regulating the arrest without a warrant against Indians, imprisonment of trial, issued by the Indian government.

DOC.Title: Amritosar incident
DOC.TEXT: A case where British troops fired and got more than 1,000 casualties on the protest rally in Amritsar Sar of the Punjab region against the ignorance of independence promises and Rolitto law issuance. Indian anti-British movement has intensified.

DOC.Title: Indian Governing Law
DOC.TEXT: Established 1919 · Implemented for 21 years. It was said that "Autonomy right at the level of state politics is accepted", but the important authority is the content which the UK holds, far from the promise of autonomy during the war.

DOC.Title: National Council School
DOC.TEXT: A political association in India formed in 1885. UK organized to relieve Indian dissatisfaction. Ethnic capitalists and intellectuals were the focus, initially cooperative with the UK. However, as ethnic capital grew in the 20th century and the ethnic awareness of Indians increased, it became a confrontational attitude with England and became the center of independence movement of Indians (Hindus).

DOC.Title: Gandhi
DOC.TEXT: Born in a rich family in India, he studied in London and became a lawyer and fought back in 1915, fighting racial discrimination in South Africa. However, after the Rolitt Act and the Indian Government Law were issued in 1919, he became a leader of the National Council and headed the anti-English independence movement. He took up the independence of India after World War II, with a unique religiously strong nonviolence / disobedient nonresistentism, but was immediately assassinated by radical Hindus. "Independent father of India" is said to be.

DOC.Title: Nonviolence / disobedience
DOC.TEXT: Struggle system of Gandhi guidance. Based on the doctrine of non-killing and abstinence of Hinduism, the movement of Satya Graja seeking to maintain the truth, the first was developed in 1919-22 years, the second was developed in 1930-34 years.

DOC.Title: Satya Graha
DOC.TEXT: Coined by Gandhi. Satya is truth, Graha is the meaning of grasping. It shows a battle attitude with evil. He gave the meaning of "nonviolence resistance".

DOC.Title: Indian Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1925 founded as a worker peasant party in Kanpur, Northern India. In the latter half of the 1930s, we formed a unified fight with the National Congress Party, and it was legalized in July 42 to expand the party.

DOC.Title: Lahore
DOC.TEXT: The central city of the Punjab region. In 1929 the National Assembly faction was held, declaring perfect independence, the rush of the boycott of the roundtable meeting and the disobedience movement was resolved.

DOC.Title: Poolna = Swarage
DOC.TEXT: The meaning of "complete independence". It was resolved in the 1929 National Congress Party Lahore.

DOC.Title: salt march
DOC.TEXT: Gandhi opposed to the monopoly method of salt carried out 360 km from Ahmadabad in 1930 to 80 people in Dandy for 29 days and worked to make salt himself. The march that reminds me of pilgrims was enthusiastically supported and further strengthened the anti-British movement.

DOC.Title: Tagore
DOC.TEXT: Indian literary and philosopher. I won the first Asian Nobel Prize. Humanism and the thought that sustained the mysticism of India had great influence mainly in Indian thought world.

DOC.Title: Ambedokal
DOC.TEXT: Indian religionist / politician from 'castleless' caste. Dedicated to anti caste movement, became chairperson for drafting the Indian Constitution after independence.

DOC.Title: Nehru, Neel
DOC.TEXT: After graduating from Cambridge College, he was dedicated to the independence movement as a leftist group of the National Congress. Cooperating with Gandhi from the late 1920s, he instructed anti-British struggle as chairman of the congress faction. After World War II, he served as Independent Prime Minister of India (responsible 1947-64).

DOC.Title: Constitutional Reform Investigation Committee
DOC.TEXT: In 1927 the UK dispatched to India to explore the ideal way of Indian governance after 10 years. The fact that all the committee members consisted of white people caused indignation on the Indian side, and the anti-British ethnic movement was revitalized again.

DOC.Title: round table round table meeting
DOC.TEXT: In order to embrace and deter the independence movement, the UK organized a leader on the Indian side to London. It was held three times from 1930 to 32, but it ended in failure.

DOC.Title: New Indian Government Act, revised Indian Government Act
DOC.TEXT: Established by Britain. The federal system and the autonomy system of each state were introduced, but the right of appointment and dismissal of the Governor of Governor of India and the governor of the state remained the British, and it was far from the request of perfect independence.

DOC.Title: All India = Muslim Federation
DOC.TEXT: In 1906, an organization of India-Muslims formed in Britain under the guidance of the British to oppose the Hindu-style National Council. Before and after the First World War it became anti-British and tied up with the National Congress Party, but after 37 years deepened the conflict and resolved to build an independent state of Muslims in 40 years.

DOC.Title: Jinner
DOC.TEXT: Leader of the Muslim League. In 1947 he became the first governor of the Pakistani cabinet.

DOC.Title: Independence Movement in Burma, Independence Movement in Myanmar
DOC.TEXT: In Burma, ethnic movements have been active since the war, and a separation movement from India has occurred. Separation was decided by the New Indian Government Act of 1935, completely separated by the Burmese Governing Law of 37 years, became the director general under the direct control of Burma governor. A full-scale anti-British independence struggle has developed from the Indian exclusion movement of 38 to 39 years.

DOC.Title: Saya-san
DOC.TEXT: Burmese ethnic movement leader. The farmers' uprising (1930 ~ 32) occurred, arrested and executed.

DOC.Title: Burma governance law
DOC.TEXT: The complete separation from India is decided.

DOC.Title: Takin party
DOC.TEXT: Originally, it was called "We Burmese Association". Since the mid-1930s, he demanded immediate and complete independence of Burma, and mainly worked in urban areas.

DOC.Title: Aung-sun
DOC.TEXT: Leader of the Burmese independence movement. Secretary general of the Takin party in 1940. While cooperating with the Japanese army during the Pacific War, the anti-Fascist People's Freedom Federation was organized for 44 years and turned into an anti-Japanese. After the war, signed an independent agreement from the UK, was assassinated by conservatives.

DOC.Title: Thai Constitutional Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Ratanakosin (Chakri) From the tyranny in the morning and instability of the people's life after the war, the constitutional revolution by the People's Party occurred in 1932, and the Constitution was launched to open a parliament.

DOC.Title: Piven
DOC.TEXT: Thai soldier / politician. It emerged in the constitutional revolution of 1932, became prime minister for 38 years and approached Japan. It fainted in 1944 and revived in the coup of 48 years, but exiled in the coup of 57 years.

DOC.Title: Thailand
DOC.TEXT: 1939 Changed Siam as Thailand. After the Second World War, it became Sham again, but it was renamed as Thailand again in 1949.

DOC.Title: Kartini
DOC.TEXT: Indonesian nationalists. Although he died young, he did pioneering activities with the women's liberation campaign.

DOC.Title: Indonesian independence movement
DOC.TEXT: After the World War I against the severe domination and exploitation of the Netherlands, promoted by Sarekat Islam of the nationalist party founded in 1911 and the Communist Party of Indonesia, it was reorganized by the uprising of 1926-27 years, suppression .

DOC.Title: Indonesian Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: Renamed the East India Social Democratic Union, it was established as the first Communist Party in Asia in 1920. He instructed the revolt of 26 to 27 years, and was severely repressed, but continued underground movement.

DOC.Title: Indonesian Kuomintang
DOC.TEXT: A nationalist group founded by Soekarno. The Indonesian National Alliance, formed in 1927, was renamed in 1927. In 1919, under the crackdown, the underground leadership in 31 years decided to dissolve the party. After independence recovered power, he was in charge of the regime several times.

DOC.Title: Sukarno
DOC.TEXT: Indonesian independent movement leader. Republic of the Republic of Indonesia (President 1949-67). In 1927, he founded the Indonesian Kuomintang, and since 42, promoted the independence movement from the Netherlands while partnering with the Japanese army. I declared independence after the surrender of Japan.

DOC.Title: Merdeka movement, patriotism movement
DOC.TEXT: Independence movement from the Netherlands centering on Indonesian Kuomintang. Sukarno instructed this movement and raised its reputation.

DOC.Title: Indochina ethnic movement
DOC.TEXT: French crackdown was severe, most ethnic movements were forced into devastation, the Communist Party of Vietnam became the center of activity.

DOC.Title: Vietnam Youth Revolutionary Dokkyo Association
DOC.TEXT: A nationalist organization formed in 1925 by Ho Chi Minh and others in Guangdong, China. He played an active part in anti-French movement mainly on intellectuals in the 20's.

DOC.Title: Vietnamese National Party
DOC.TEXT: A revolutionary nationalist group formed in 1927 with the Chinese KMT as a model. Expanding the organization to military soldiers, armed uprising in 30 years, but was suppressed by the French army.

DOC.Title: Indochina Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: Communist Party of Vietnam formed in 1930 by Ho Chi Minh and others. It was gradually endorsed by workers and farmers, became the center of resistance and independence struggle against France and Japan, renamed the Vietnamese Labor Party in 1951.

DOC.Title: Ho Chi Minh
DOC.TEXT: Vietnamese revolutionary. I learned Marxism under the influence of the Russian Revolution and played a leading role as Vietnamese Communist Party leader. After 1939, he fought with France and Japan, after independence as the first president, fought the Indochina war / Vietnam war.

DOC.Title: Gedin-Soviet Movement
DOC.TEXT: In 1930, farmers and workers who opposed French violent repression set up Soviet with the Communist Party around the Gye Tin province. It collapsed in 31 years, but it helped the subsequent development of the Communist Party.

DOC.Title: Philippine independence promise
DOC.TEXT: Autonomy was approved by US President Franklin Roseworth in 1934, and independence was promised 10 years later. The promise of perfect independence was delayed slightly due to the outbreak of the Pacific War and the battlefield of the Philippines, but it was realized in 46 years.

DOC.Title: Philippine Independent Preparation Government
DOC.TEXT: The Philippine temporary government that the United States launched in 1935.

DOC.Title: Turkish Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A series of events that Mustafa Kemal and others overthrew the Ottoman Empire, built a republic and made various reforms. In 1919, upon the crisis of the disintegration of the Ottoman Empire by accepting the Izmir region of Greek forces, acceptance of the Sevres Convention, Mustafa Kemal held a Turkish Grand National Assembly with Ankara in 20 years and established the Ankara government. Then defeated the Greek troops, succeeded in revising the Sevres Convention at the Lausanne Conference 23 years, and maintained Turkish independence. In the previous year, the Sultan system was abolished (meaning the destruction of the Ottoman Empire), the Turkish Republic was officially established in October, 23, and Kemal became its first President. After that, we proceeded with modernization (de-Islamization) such as abolition of the caliphate system, separation of religion and religion, liberation of women, romanization, but did not carry out land reform.

DOC.Title: Turkish Grand National Assembly
DOC.TEXT: In 1920, in Congress held in Kemal in Ankara, its members formed the Ankara government and led the fight against invaded Greek forces. After repelling the Greek forces, when the Turkish republic was established in 1923, it became its legislative body, and the People's Party (later Republican People's Party) formed by Kemal that same year grabbed the initiative.

DOC.Title: Battle with intrusion Greek forces
DOC.TEXT: Along with the defeat, the Greek forces supported by the Allies invaded and occupied Izmir (Smyrna). In response to this, the Turkish KMT, guided by Mustafa Kemal, was settled and fought back, and the national army fighting back the Greeks and recovering Izmir. This victory opens the way to revising the Sevres Convention.

DOC.Title: Sevres Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The treaty was tied between the Allies and the Ottoman Empire. It was an oversaw content such as the reduction of territory, reduction of arms and permission of extraterritoriality, so we upgraded the patriotism of the Turks.

DOC.Title: Mustafa Kemal, Kemal Pasha
DOC.TEXT: Turkish soldier. To the crisis of the lost country, we gathered a large group of citizens in the big parliament, repulsed the Greek forces, abolished the sultan system, built a Republic, became the first president (tenure 1923-38) and tried to modernize Turkey .

DOC.Title: Ataturk
DOC.TEXT: In 1934, the great parliament presented to Mustafa Kemal, the meaning of "the father of Turkey".

DOC.Title: Eliminate sultan system
DOC.TEXT: Kemal declared the abolition of the Sultan system, as the Sultan (Mehmet VI) exiled to Malta, the Ottoman Empire was destroyed both in name and fame.

DOC.Title: Lausanne Convention
DOC.TEXT: New Turkish administration and allied peace treaty of Allied countries. Turkey restored Izmir and Istanbul surroundings and eastern Thrace, and abolished armaments restrictions and extraterritoriality, protected independence.

DOC.Title: Kurdish problem
DOC.TEXT: The problem that Kurds who have a population of about 20 million people can not build a nation state. Construction of the Autonomous Region was granted by the Severn Treaty, but denied by the Lausanne Convention.

DOC.Title: Izmir recovery, Smyrna recovery
DOC.TEXT: Izmir is on the coast of the Aegean, but it was returned to Turkey by the Lausanne treaty.

DOC.Title: Turkey Republic
DOC.TEXT: Kemal declared establishment in 1923, and Kemal became the first President. After that, Westernization and modernization were promoted by Kemal.

DOC.Title: Ankara
DOC.TEXT: It was regarded as the capital as well as the founding of the Republic of Turkey.

DOC.Title: Constitution of the Republic of Turkey
DOC.TEXT: Proclaimed in 1924. The sovereign people, the single-legislative parliament the only legislative body, the president has much in common with the constitution of Western Europe, such as the term of office four years. Subsequently, the provision that Muslims became state religion was deleted, and the separation of church and state became the principle.

DOC.Title: Caliphate abolition
DOC.TEXT: This completely separated politics and religion.

DOC.Title: Women's liberation
DOC.TEXT: Since 1925, in parallel with the abolition of the Islamic calendar and the Turkish hat, the woman's Chaddle (a kind of veil) was abolished, and a monogamy system was established. In the year 34, women's suffrage was granted.

DOC.Title: Character reform, adoption of Romaji
DOC.TEXT: Abolished the Arabic script and established 29 new latin characters suitable for Turkish pronunciation. He raised the literacy rate of the people as part of educational innovation.

DOC.Title: Wahud party
DOC.TEXT: A nationalist party of Egypt formed in 1918. In the meaning of "representative", the landlord and the nationalists of the national capital instructed, became the main body of anti-English independence struggle, and achieved almost independence in 22 years. In 24 years, he continued to hold the leadership until the Egyptian revolution of 52 years with the administration.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Egypt
DOC.TEXT: In 1922, it was established apart from the status of Britain 's protected state. However, the UK reserved Egypt's defense rights, the Suez Canal gang tightening right, and the Sudanese ownership.

DOC.Title: Suez Canal Band Stable Right
DOC.TEXT: Britain grasped by Urabee's rebellion suppression in 1882 and made it the basis of political and military rule over Egypt. In 1954, he lost the bureaucracy and soldiers.

DOC.Title: Muslim Brotherhood
DOC.TEXT: An organization that spread to the Arab region in support of Islamic reconstruction. In 1929, Hasan = Albanna was formed mainly in Egypt, supplementing the construction of an Islamic state whose constitution is the Koran.

DOC.Title: Egypt = British alliance treaty
DOC.TEXT: Egypt recognized full sovereignty and set out the retreat of British troops and officials. However, the British forces continued their soldiers in Sudan and the Suez Canal Zone. It was according to this treaty that Egypt was regarded as a British military base during the Second World War.

DOC.Title: Palestinian issue
DOC.TEXT: A confrontation occurring between Jews and Arabs in Palestine, a region of the eastern coast of the Mediterranean. In this place, Arabs (which will be Muslims since the 7th century) populated after the Jews were removed by the Roman Empire in the 1st century. However, the founding movement (Zionism movement) occurred among the Jews who continued to be persecuted, and the return to this place was accelerated by obtaining promises of support from the UK during the First World War. As a result, the Arabs oppressed and oppressed, and the conflict between the two peoples (religiously Jews and Muslims) deepened.

DOC.Title: Zionism
DOC.TEXT: A way of thinking to promote the construction of the state of the Jews, which began at the end of the 19th century. Zion is the sacred hill of the Jews near Jerusalem, and the Jews tried to build in the Palestine with this as a symbol.

DOC.Title: Hussein · McMahon Agreement, Husain · McMahon Agreement, Hussein · McMahon Letter
DOC.TEXT: Agreement made by a round-trip to Arab leader Hussein and the British High Commissioner McMahon. After the end of World War I, the purpose of accepting an independent state to the Arabs under the Empire (The letter of October 1915 which touched the independence is McMahon Declaration). It was contradictory to the Balfour Declaration, and after the war, the British neglected, calling for Arab's anger, the Palestinian problem occurred.

DOC.Title: Balfour Declaration
DOC.TEXT: British Foreign Minister Balfour who wanted cooperation of Jews (especially financial capitalists) declared the support of the construction of the Jewish state in Palestine. It was typical of British double diplomacy.

DOC.Title: Hussein, Husain
DOC.TEXT: The leader of the Arab independence movement. Although the agreement with McMahon is broken, after the Great Battle he founded the Kingdom of the Kingdom of the Kingdom of the Arigia on a part of the Arabian Peninsula. However, I was defeated by Wahhabi leader Ibn Saul.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Hijors
DOC.TEXT: In 1916 Hussein was built on the western coast of Arabia. Although declared independence in 18 years, it was annexed to Ibn Saud's Nedbid Kingdom in 24 years and it was destroyed.

DOC.Title: Ibn Saulard, Abdul-A-Aziz
DOC.TEXT: The first King of Saudi Arabia (ranking 1932-53). Originally from the family of Saud, Islamic school Wahhab school. In 1924, he destroyed the Kingdom of the Kingdom of Hijaz and built the Kingdom of Hijaze-Nejedo, developed into Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in 1932, and became the King.

DOC.Title: Hijaz = Screwed Kingdom
DOC.TEXT: In 1924, the kingdom that Saudian family was born and Ibn Saulde of King Nejdz built. In 1916 he conquered the Kingdom of Haggers that Hussein's Hussein built and added Mecca Medina to the field.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
DOC.TEXT: In 1932, Ibn Saoud unified the majority of the Arabian Peninsula except Yemen and built a kingdom. The capital is Riyadh (Mecca is the capital on religion). Make Islamism of Wahab factions as state religion.

DOC.Title: Yemen independence
DOC.TEXT: West and south end of the Arabian Peninsula. Along with the withdrawal of Turkey in 1918 Zaido (Shiite faction) realized independence.

DOC.Title: Independence of the Kingdom of Iraq
DOC.TEXT: In 1920 it was regarded as the mandate ruling territory of the UK, and the kingdom was formed in 21 years. Independence was granted in 1932, and Hussein 's son, Faisal, crowned the king (ranking 1932-33).

DOC.Title: Syrian independence
DOC.TEXT: In 1920 the Kingdom of Syria declared independence, but was made a mandate rule of France. Autonomy was acknowledged in 1936, and as Syria republic became independent in 46 years.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Jordan
DOC.TEXT: In 1928 he was recognized as independent under the mandate of Britain, and he called the Kingdom of Trans Jordan. The complete independence was 1946.

DOC.Title: Lebanon Independence
DOC.TEXT: In 1920 it was separated from the kingdom of Syria and became the mandate and governance territory of France, declared independence in 1941, became a republic in 43 years.

DOC.Title: Druze faction
DOC.TEXT: Islamic school Shiite faction. Today, it occupies a part of the Islamic factions in Lebanon.

DOC.Title: Ismailer faction
DOC.TEXT: Islamic school Shiite faction. Building the Fatimid dynasty mainly in Egypt from the 10th to the 12th century and building the "Assassination Church" in the northern part of Iran in the 11th and 13th centuries. After that, it was divided into many sects.

DOC.Title: Kurdish
DOC.TEXT: Iran-Iraq-A mountainous ethnic group living across Turkey and elsewhere. Iranian languages ​​are used, and there are many Sunni Muslims. It continues to be divided by strong border delineation, it is hindered to build their own country to this day, and suffering continues.

DOC.Title: Kajar morning
DOC.TEXT: Iranian Turkish Islamic dynasty. I suffered from the invasion of England and Russia from the beginning of the 19th century. We declared neutrality in World War I, but it was occupied by both British and Russian troops. Russia pulled up in the revolution, but it was semi-colonized under the treaty that was unfavorable to Britain. After that, in 1925, with the leather = Hearn coup, it was replaced by the Pufflevy morning.

DOC.Title: Leather = Hearn, Leather = She
DOC.TEXT: Iranian soldier. In 1921 crisis of the lost country, coup d'etat held. In the 24th year, the parliament decided to abolish the Kajar morning, and it was inferred by the emperor the following year (from 1925 to 41) and started the Pufflevy morning.

DOC.Title: Pufflevy Morning
DOC.TEXT: Iranian dynasty that Leather-Hearn originated.

DOC.Title: renamed Iran
DOC.TEXT: I renamed the former name Persia to Iran.

DOC.Title: Third Afghan War
DOC.TEXT: Afghanistan, a protected country in the UK, declared independence in 1919 and was able to play as a British invader.

DOC.Title: Afghanistan independence
DOC.TEXT: As a result of the Third Afghan War, in the Rawalpindi Convention, the UK officially approved the independence of Afghanistan.

DOC.Title: African National Congress, ANC
DOC.TEXT: In 1912, it was founded in South Africa to promote the movement to eliminate racial discrimination based on nonviolentism. In the 60 years, criminal cases against the anti-apartheid rally triggered and became illegal. In 1980, he contributed to the achievement of independence of the Jimpa Bue, became legalized in 1990, and won the elimination of the apartheid law next year.

DOC.Title: Pan = Africanism
DOC.TEXT: From the end of the nineteenth century African intellectuals active in the West were developed mainly for the purpose of activating the liberation movement in Africa.

DOC.Title: Pan = Africa Conference
DOC.TEXT: Conference to advance Pan-Africa movement. In London in 1900, in a conference calling for opposition to colonialism and racial discrimination, and in 19 Paris (which was held at the Peace Conference at that time), summarizes the resolution of gradual autonomy acquisition in the African colony The meeting is representative. Both of these coalesced after the Second World War and activated the nationalism of Africa.

DOC.Title: DuPoys
DOC.TEXT: The American Black Liberation Movement Leader. He was active in the African independence movement, including instructing black movement for improving rights in the United States and holding a Pan-Africa conference.

DOC.Title: West African National Congress
DOC.TEXT: Conference for nationalist movement held in British Ghana in 1920. Then in the 1940 's, Enkulma made the People' s Party of the Gold Coast Conference to advance ethnic movements and brought the first black African independence country of Ghana in 1977.

DOC.Title: World Depression
DOC.TEXT: The biggest downturn in world history, which began on 24 October 1929 (Dark Thursday), triggered by a massive crash of stock prices at the New York Stock Exchange (Wall Street). In each country involved in this depression, companies and banks went bankrupt, unemployed people increased, social unrest spreaded. Causes include (1) that agricultural prices declined immediately after the First World War, poor farmers became poor and purchasing power declined, (2) excessive capital investment advanced, excessive production, (3) trade has been shrinking due to high tariff policies of each country. The depression began in America, but since the United States had overwhelming economic power then, the impacts of other capitalist countries were serious. Especially in Germany where economic reconstruction was promoted by introducing American capital, companies and banks went bankrupted due to capital shortage due to the rise in US capital. However, the Soviet Union of the socialist country was implementing the five-year plan at that time and rarely was affected by the depression of the capitalist country. Each country that was in depression launched various countermeasures, but in addition to Italy, which was a fascist regime immediately after the war, fascist forces emerged in Germany and Japan, and they decided to push the way for war.

DOC.Title: New York Stock Market
DOC.TEXT: It was established in Wall Street in 1817, when I entered the 20th century I aligned with Lombard Street in London and became the center of world finance after the First World War.

DOC.Title: Wall Street
DOC.TEXT: One corner of the New York Stock Exchange (securities) exchange. It is the origin that the wall of the Dutch colonial era remained when the city was built.

DOC.Title: Hoover
DOC.TEXT: President of the 31st American Republican from 1929 to 33, in charge. I predicted the eternal prosperity of American capitalism right after inauguration, but a panic occurred in the autumn of that year. However, believing in the capitalist economy's ability to recover economically, he devoted himself to classical freedom of laisseztism practically leaving the depression, the depression worsened further, the crowd got lost, the government lost the administration to the Democratic Party .

DOC.Title: Hoover-moratorium
DOC.TEXT: In 1931, due to the spread of the financial crisis caused by the Great Depression, the Huber issued war bonds and payment of reparation one year suspended grace. However, the decision was too late to have any effect.

DOC.Title: Franklin-Roseworth, Franklin-Roosevelt
DOC.TEXT: The 32nd President of the Democratic Party (Resigned from 1933 to 45). After serving as Senator and Governor of New York State, he won the presidential election by committing measures against the Depression. After taking office as President, we implemented the New Deal policy, the government aggressively intervened in the economy and worked to restore the economy, promoted good neighboring diplomacy externally, deepened friendship with the Latin American countries, approved the Soviet Union etc . In opposition to the rise of fascism and served as President of the third and fourth periods unusual in American history during the Second World War, he died of disease just before the German defeat.

DOC.Title: New Deal
DOC.TEXT: Franklin-Rose Welt 's Countermeasure to Overcome the Depression. Meaning of new repair. Instead of free laissez-faire of the principle of capitalism so far, the nation actively intervene and control the economy, trying to rebuild the economy and people's lives.

DOC.Title: Modified capitalist policy
DOC.TEXT: A policy that the nation actively intervenes in the economy, and the economy recovers. Until now capitalism has been thought to be a fundamental freedom to eliminate national intervention, so the word "amendment" was borrowed.

DOC.Title: Keynes
DOC.TEXT: British economist. It brought about a revolutionary change in economics, with modified capitalism positively capturing national economic intervention.

DOC.Title: Agriculture adjustment method, AAA
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1933. Important legislation of New Deal. The government restricted agricultural production, stabilized agricultural prices by buying up overproducts, aimed at salvaging farmers and restoring their purchasing power.

DOC.Title: National Industrial Recovery Act, NIRA
DOC.TEXT: The most important bill in New Deal policy enacted in 1933. We make regulations for each enterprise, regulate production, secure enterprise proper profit, on the other hand recognize workers' right to organize and collective bargaining, ensure proper wage, to increase productivity and purchasing power I aimed for recovery. However in 35 years the Supreme Court ruled a unconstitutional ruling.

DOC.Title: Tennessee River Basin Development Corporation, TVA
DOC.TEXT: In 1933, as a part of New Deal policy, a government agency aimed at comprehensive development of the Tennessee River Basin. The government embarked on comprehensive development centering on the construction of dams and waterways, restored productivity by supplying electricity, lowered prices by reducing the price of electricity monopolized by the private sector, together with this project I tried to absorb many unemployed people, pay wages, increase purchasing power.

DOC.Title: stop gold standard,
DOC.TEXT: In 1931 the UK stopped, in the year 34 the United States established the gold reserve law, it shifted to the managed gold standard.

DOC.Title: Wagner method
DOC.TEXT: Since the national industrial restoration law was regarded as unconstitutional, the part concerning the rights of workers therein was legislated by Senator Wagner's proposal. Increasing the rights of workers, such as recognizing workers' right to organize and collective bargaining once again.

DOC.Title: Social Security Act
DOC.TEXT: The law that the federal government guaranteed payment such as unemployment insurance, retirement allowance and old age pension.

DOC.Title: Industry Organization Session, CIO
DOC.TEXT: In 1935, it was launched as an industrial workers' organizing committee within the American Federation of Labor (AFL), separated and independent in 1938. It was organized around unskilled workers against the skilled worker-centered AFL. We rejoined again with AFL in 1955.

DOC.Title: Good neighboring diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: Foreign policy parallel to Rose Velt 's New Deal. We pursued friendship with the aim of integrating economic and political North and South America, excluding isolationism · expansionism · dollar diplomacy.

DOC.Title: Soviet approval, US Soviet approval
DOC.TEXT: In the era of President Rosewu Nilt, the Soviet Union approval was given by the United States to the last two New Deal and block economy among the strong powers. The background is to counter the rise of the Fascism countries and the fact that the United States tried to expand exports to the Soviet Union.

DOC.Title: Philippine Independence Law
DOC.TEXT: In 1934, the independent bill passed the US Congress, recognized 35 years by Shogun, promised complete independence ten years later.

DOC.Title: Cuba independence approval
DOC.TEXT: I abolished the Brat provision of 1901 that protected Cuba as a guardian, approved complete independence.

DOC.Title: Cardenas
DOC.TEXT: President of Mexico (Tenure 1934-40). We gradually reformed the Mexican revolutionary regime, which was conspicuously rebounded, and tried to disseminate education and worker protection and industrialization. We succeeded in reforming agricultural land · nationalization of railroad and oil, promoted democratization.

DOC.Title: Vargas
DOC.TEXT: President of Brazil (Tenure 1930-45, 51-54). While maintaining the dictatorship regime, we conducted nationalist policies such as protecting workers and nationalizing resources.

DOC.Title: Second McDonald's Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Although it departed as the Second Labor Party Cabinet, it lost support from the ruling Labor Party and fell down.
