DOC.Title: Reduction of unemployment insurance
DOC.TEXT: The proliferation of unemployment due to the depression increased the amount of unemployment allowance and came into a financial crisis, so what Prime Minister McDonald's proposed. Following the opposition of the ruling Labor Party, the cabinet resigned entirely.

DOC.Title: McDonald's Nationwide Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: The second McDonald's cabinet organized by the Conservative Party and the Liberal Party to newly overcome the Depression after the resignation of the Labor Party cabinet newly. McDonald himself was expelled from the Labor Party.

DOC.Title: stop gold standard,
DOC.TEXT: The national coalition cabinet will take effect. UK currency was taking gold standard system (a system to stabilize the value of currency by guaranteeing that currency can be exchanged for a certain amount of money) until the First World War, but the economy was confused by the depression and balance of payments also It got worse and stopped this system because money began to run out of the country.

DOC.Title: Ottawa Federal Congress, United Kingdom Federal Economic Conference
DOC.TEXT: British federal economic conference for overcoming the depression held in Ottawa, the capital of Canada. The block economy system was adopted, and an Ottawa agreement such as mutual trade agreement was concluded with focus on the preference tariff system between the home country and the municipality (formation of tariff block).

DOC.Title: Block economy
DOC.TEXT: Exclusion that prevents another country from having economic relations such as trade with this region by creating a region (block) that links the home country and its overseas territory (colonies, self-governing bodies, ranges of forces, etc.) with a preferential tariff system etc. Economic policy. Britain and France with a wide overseas territory could do this, but Japan, Germany, Italy, etc., which were shut out from the block market, tried to form a new block themselves also due to aggression policy.

DOC.Title: Sterling = block, bond = block
DOC.TEXT: British economic zone. It was established on a vast colony.

DOC.Title: Financial crisis, Japan financial crisis
DOC.TEXT: Bankruptcy on nationwide occurred in March 1927. In the crisis, the Wakatsuki cabinet against non-Chinese counterparts collapsed, and the Tanaka cabinet, which asserted aggressive policy, was established.

DOC.Title: Kwantung Army
DOC.TEXT: Japanese Army Corps who was responsible for the security of the Kanto and South Manchurian Railroads. Established in 1919. Ignoring the government's intention, it expanded the war in China with dogma.

DOC.Title: Manchurian Incident
DOC.TEXT: A war that the Kwantung Army had caused the Yuyajo Lake incident and led to the invasion of Manchuria. Japan, which won the military, established the puppet state (Manchuria County) in 32 years, but isolated internationally.

DOC.Title: Yuyajo Lake Incident
DOC.TEXT: On the night of September 18, 1931, at the Yufujyo lake on the outskirts of Fengten, the Kwantung Army blew up the South Manchurian Railway Line himself, made a military action as a progression of the Zhangraese Army, and started the Manchurian Incident.

DOC.Title: "15 Year War"
DOC.TEXT: After the Manchurian Incident, it is also called "15 Years of the War" from the Japan-China War to the Pacific War.

DOC.Title: Shanghai Incident
DOC.TEXT: The incident that the Japanese Navy started fighting with the pretext of a Japanese murder case. After a difficult struggle Japan fought a ceasefire and saw the signing of a ceasefire agreement in the mediation of Britain, the United States, France and Italy.

DOC.Title: Litton investigation team
DOC.TEXT: International Federation Nikka Dispute Investigation Committee. Between February and July 1932, the head coach Littton (UK) conducted field survey and announced the report in October. While considering the Manchurian Incident as an invasion act of Japan, I greatly acknowledged Japan's privilege in the Tohoku region of China. However, the Japanese government completely rejected this report and withdrew from the International League in the following 33 years.

DOC.Title: Manchukuo country
DOC.TEXT: Puppet state which virtually established and dominated Kwantung Army. Declared the foundation on March 1, 1932, and in 1934 Yu Yi became the emperor. The capital city is Shinkyo (Changchun).

DOC.Title: Feng Yi
DOC.TEXT: The last emperor of the Qing Dynasty. Empress Dian. After the Japanese affiliated agency brought out of the Tianjin Elephant, in Manila Manchuria in 1932 and Emperor in 34 years.

DOC.Title: Five-five Case
DOC.TEXT: Innovative school youth officer and right wing cried out overthrowing political party politics, the injury assassinated the prime minister at the official residence, and the other incident was attacked several places. With this, the party cabinet is over and the military's voice has become powerful.

DOC.Title: Hot River
DOC.TEXT: Hot River is a military base between Manchuria and Hebei Province. In February-March 1933, the Japanese army occupied and transferred to Manchuria.

DOC.Title: Withdrawal from the International League, withdrawal from the Japan National League
DOC.TEXT: Japan withdrew from the general meeting of the Federation with dissatisfaction that a recommendation such as Manchurian withdrawal based on the Litton investigation team report was adopted at 42 to 1. It means withdrawal from the Versailles regime and it was the first step towards international isolation.

DOC.Title: Tang Dynasty Agreement
DOC.TEXT: In 1933, a ceasefire agreement between the Japanese army and the national government signed in Tangguhu province in Hebei province. By this, China admitted the existence of Manchuria County in fact.

DOC.Title: Naval disarmament treaty abandonment
DOC.TEXT: Japan announced the destruction of the Washington-London disarmament treaty, and since 1936 it became an unlimited treaty era.

DOC.Title: Red Army
DOC.TEXT: The army of the Communist Party of China who was born on the occasion of the Nanchang uprising in August 1927. It is generally said that it will be reorganized into the Eighth Route Army immediately after the Construction Army. Although weapons and equipment were poor, they were conscious and took the lead in the liberation struggle and grew up supported by farmers in the liberation zone.

DOC.Title: Jinggang Mountain
DOC.TEXT: Mountainous areas in the southern part of the border between Hunan and Jiangxi provinces. In 1927, Mao Zedong made it the base of the revolution. In the following year the Red Army's Fourth Army was set up.

DOC.Title: China Soviet Republic
DOC.TEXT: On 7th November 1931, the Communist Party government which summarized the communist forces of various places and was built in southern part of Jiangxi province. The capital is Ruike. Mao is appointed chairman.

DOC.Title: Temporary Government of the Republic of China Soviet
DOC.TEXT: A temporary government of the Communist Party, which was established on November 7, 1931. The capital is the edge deposit. Mao is Mao Tse.

DOC.Title: Rui gold
DOC.TEXT: Small city in southeast of Jiangxi Province. 1931-34, the capital city of the temporary government of the Republic of the Soviet Republic.

DOC.Title: Mao Saoto
DOC.TEXT: China Communist Party, the leader of the People's Republic of China. I am from Hunan Province. In 1921, he participated in the establishment of the Chinese Communist Party. Became the chairman of the temporary government of the Republic of Soviet Republic founded in 31 years, and held the initiative within the party at the Zunyi meeting on the way of the long war. Main theme such as "new democracy theory", "practical theory", "contradiction theory" and so on.

DOC.Title: Long March, Onishi transition
DOC.TEXT: The Chinese Communist Party 's army (Red Army) moved under the pressure of the KMT and moved from Jiangxi Provincial Fund to the northern part of Shaanxi Province. Major migration full of suffering over a distance of about 12,500 km, Mao's initiative was established on the way, Yanan became the capital of extraordinary government after 37 years.

DOC.Title: Zunyi conference
DOC.TEXT: On the way to the long run, the Communist Party Expansion Political Bureau Conference held in Guizhou Province Zunyi. It became an opportunity from the Moscow study abroad school to shift the leadership of the party to Mao Zedong.

DOC.Title: Eighth Declaration
DOC.TEXT: Declaration announced by the Chinese Communist Party. It is officially referred to as "a book to tell all the people for anti-Japan rescue." In response to the invasion of Japanese imperialism, he called for the cessation of civil war and the formation of nationalism and battlefield, calling for the overthrow of Shurusen Stone which hindered it.

DOC.Title: Yan'an
DOC.TEXT: A small city in northern Shaanxi province. It was the central ground for the Chinese Communist regime until Mao Zedong moved to Beijing for 49 years after the shift in early 1937.

DOC.Title: Municipal reform
DOC.TEXT: In November 1935, the government's reforms aimed at unification of money. Only banknotes of three banks of the national government system were made to pass as bills, and a banknote-oriented system was taken with a method to ban other banknotes. Externally, we first joined the British pound and then to the dollar (after May 1936) and increased the international economic power of China. On the other hand, the three domestic banks and four families established state monopoly capital monetary control, strengthening Shuzen stone dictatorship.

DOC.Title: Money
DOC.TEXT: Banknotes issued by three banks of the national government. As its value was linked with British pounds of the currency, it came to circulate as the only currency of the Republic of China.

DOC.Title: Baodong defense and self-governance government
DOC.TEXT: 1935 The puppet government that Japan established in the northeastern part of Hebei province. It became the base of smuggling Japanese goods and hit the Chinese economy.

DOC.Title: Zhang Ke Xiao
DOC.TEXT: The eldest son of Tohoku warlord Zhang Rui. After the Manchurian Incident, he went outdoors in conflict with Yuzuke Stone. After returning to Japan, he became commander of fighting with the Red Army (Communist Army), but he made a Xi'an incident by resonating with the Red Army claiming the first day of anti-Japan. After the incident, they were captured by Joosuke Stone and sentenced to imprisonment. After the Second World War, he escaped to Taiwan on the establishment of the Communist party regime, but was forced long by house by Chiang Kai-shek. The honor was recovered in 1990.

DOC.Title: Xi'an case
DOC.TEXT: A case in which Zhang Jiaobao and Yang Tiger Castle and others confined arrests to Jinxian stone entering Xi'an for the duty of the Communist Army strategy with force. Shinseki who agreed to the anti-Japanese by persuading by the Chinese Communist Party's Zhou Enlai released on 25th, returned, and thereafter the historical transformation of unity for anti-Japanese advanced.

DOC.Title: National Co-operative, Second National Co-operative
DOC.TEXT: It is a cooperative relationship between the KMT and the Communist Party, which was established in the wake of the Xi'an incident. As a result, the Anti-Japan Ethnic Unification Front was established, and the two cooperated to fight against Japan. The Red Army was entrusted by Shusuke Stone and renamed the Eighth Route Army.

DOC.Title: Anti-Japan Ethnic Front Line
DOC.TEXT: An organization of ethnic resistance against Japanese invasion, established in the Second National Cooperation.

DOC.Title: Ni · 6 Case
DOC.TEXT: In February 26, 1936, the radical army of the Japanese Army (Empress Division) officer led by about 1,400 troops and assassinated the cabinet ministers, and the case aimed at the establishment of the military government expected by their own. Although the case was settled in 4 days, the political control of the military was decisive, and the invasion to China was accelerated after that.

DOC.Title: Roongdo bridge incident
DOC.TEXT: A military conflict case between Japan and China that occurred in the suburb of Beijing at Rohwu Bridge. Since then, the two countries have entered into a full war.

DOC.Title: Japan-China War
DOC.TEXT: The Rohwibashi incident started. The Japanese side called "the China Incident", but what he called the incident was a measure to avoid the application of wartime international law, which was not a declaration of war but a substantial war. In the early days the Japanese army was dominant, Nanjing in December 1937, occupied Wuhan Sansein in October, 38. But since this time the strength of the Japanese army has reached the limit and it has moved to the endurance race. Japan suffered from the occupied land holding by the resistance of the Chinese side civilians and was also isolated internationally.

DOC.Title: Japan-Germany Anti-Common Agreement, Japan-Germany Anti-cooperation Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Agreement concluded between Japan and Germany in November 1936 as a purpose (reason) to cope with the expansion of communism by the activities of Comintern. In addition, Italy joined the following November, the International Fascist Front (Axis camp) was established.

DOC.Title: Nanjing genocide incident
DOC.TEXT: A case where the Nanking Occupied Forces massacred a lot of POWs and civilians. I spread the infamy of the Japanese army internationally.

DOC.Title: National Mobilization Law
DOC.TEXT: The law promulgated by the Konoe Cabinet in 1938. Contents that wartime workers and goods can be allocated without Congressional approval.

DOC.Title: Dong A New Order
DOC.TEXT: Construction target that Japan made as an excuse for war fulfillment. In November 1938, in a statement of Prime Minister Konoyu, he tried to tie alliance between Japan, Manchuria and the Republic of China and tried to justify the aggression war by denying the old order dominated by Britain, America and France. Specifically, it was a concept of building an economic block, but later expanded to the concept of the Great East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere.

DOC.Title: "Having country"
DOC.TEXT: It is a designation that refers to Britain, the United States, France, etc. which have rich colonies and resources.

DOC.Title: "No country to have"
DOC.TEXT: About Japan, Germany and Italy with few colonies and resources. Representation from a position justifying invasion and subdivision.

DOC.Title: Nomonhan Incident
DOC.TEXT: Limited war between the Japanese and Soviet armed forces due to border conflict at the Western Border of Manchu. The Kwantung Army of Japan disregarded the power of the Soviet-Mongolian military mechanized unit and was completely defeated by a reckless operation. A ceasefire agreement was concluded in September with the establishment of a monologous non-aggression treaty and the beginning of World War II.

DOC.Title: Guangzhou occupation
DOC.TEXT: Late October 1938

DOC.Title: Wuhan occupation
DOC.TEXT: End of October 1938

DOC.Title: Chongqing government
DOC.TEXT: The national government took over from Chong Rong to Chongqing and continued anti-Japan warfare.

DOC.Title: Wang Dynasty, Wang Jingfeng
DOC.TEXT: Kuomintang's leftist politician and Suzuki's rival. Escape Chongqing in December 1938, established a national government (Nanjing) which is a puppet regime of Japan in Nanjing in March 40. In 44 years, I died of cancer in Japan.

DOC.Title: totalitarian
DOC.TEXT: Political ideas and political forms that prioritize the interests of the state and society as a whole, deny individual freedom and interests. It appeared after World War I against the modern democracy. Beautifying the people's nation and state with irrational thought, taking a dictatorship system, promoting external invasion, and controlling domestic society violently. German Nazism, Italian fashion system, Japanese militarism, etc. are typical, but the political system of communist countries is often included in this.

DOC.Title: Hitler
DOC.TEXT: A German dictatorship who is born in Austria. Since 1921 he became the leader of the Nazis, and the violation of the Versailles system and anti-Semitism and anti-Communism were favored. Winning regime in 1933 by social crisis due to depression. By establishing a thorough dictatorship, fearing politicians in Germany, forcing a severe expansion and invasion policy, World War II, committed suicide just before the defeat.

DOC.Title: National Socialist German Workers Party, National Socialist German Workers Party
DOC.TEXT: Right wing political party established after the First World War. In 1920 renamed from the German Labor Party. Nazis is an abbreviation. After the Great Depression, following the social unrest, attracting people with aggressive action power, which also took terrorism by taking social unrest, and attracting people with energetic propaganda power, to support middle and small farmers, especially the middle class such as bureaucrats, shopkeepers and small and medium enterprises Received the power rapidly expanded. After that, with the support from the capitalist and the military who felt a sense of crisis in the advancement of the Communist Party, Hitler in the 33rd year became the prime minister and acquired the administration.

DOC.Title: Nazis, Nazi Party
DOC.TEXT: Right wing political party established after the First World War. In 1920 renamed from the German Labor Party. Nazis is an abbreviation. After the Great Depression, following the social unrest, attracting people with aggressive action power, which also took terrorism by taking social unrest, and attracting people with energetic propaganda power, to support middle and small farmers, especially the middle class such as bureaucrats, shopkeepers and small and medium enterprises Received the power rapidly expanded. After that, with the support from the capitalist and the military who felt a sense of crisis in the advancement of the Communist Party, Hitler in the 33rd year became the prime minister and acquired the administration.

DOC.Title: Munich Ichigo
DOC.TEXT: A Nazi coup dedicated to overthrowing the Weimar government overturned by rule occupation and inflation and winning a government. It was suppressed on the same day by the military, Hitler and others were arrested soon.

DOC.Title: "Our conflict"
DOC.TEXT: Hitler's work. After Munich's revolution, what Hitler dictated in prison. In the first volume in 1925 and the second volume in the year 27 was published, it became the scripture of the Nazis. Although there are many lies and exaggerations, it is regarded as one of the basic documents of Hitler and Nazi research.

DOC.Title: Assault Team, SA
DOC.TEXT: Founded in 1921. Direct action group of Nazis. Major task is to overthrow opponents with violence. Unemployed people, citizens, veterans, etc. served mainly on Nazi street exercise. Later it became a paramilitary presence and conflicted with the Defense Forces, but the leaders were swept away by Hitler in 34 years and virtually dissolved.

DOC.Title: Guard, SS
DOC.TEXT: Guardian organization of the Nazi executive founded in 1923. After the establishment of the Nazi regime, he also played a role as a secret police, while monitoring and abusing prisoners of war during the Second World War.

DOC.Title: Lausanne Conference
DOC.TEXT: International conference on compensation and war bond issues. We decided to postpone the payment of German damages in the collapse in the Great Depression and reduce it to 3 billion gold marks. In addition, war bonds to the United States of England and France were also resolved, so the reparation and war bond problem actually ended.

DOC.Title: Hindenburg
DOC.TEXT: Supported by conservatives and elected president in 1925, he was reelected by breaking Hitler with the support of the middle school and the Social Democratic Party in the 32nd presidential election. While the middle party faded and attacks from both sides strengthened, while exercising presidential emergency power to stabilize, it did not succeed, and inevitably appointed Hitler as Prime Minister in 33 years.

DOC.Title: Presidential emergency order
DOC.TEXT: Article 48 of the Weimar Constitution. A law that states that the president can exercise emergency power to take necessary measures if parliament does not function due to emergencies or disagreements between political parties. Hindenburg has appointed a minority cabinet of three generations since 1930 in this way.

DOC.Title: 1932 election
DOC.TEXT: In the election held in July, Nazi's seats 230, 37.4% of all votes, the first party (the second party in the 1930 election), the Social Democratic party 133, the Communist Party 89, the total sum of about 140 intermediate factions Came out. Hindenburg acknowledged the Papen Cabinet and asked for Hitler's entry, but Hitler became an opposition in search of a cabinet by himself. Nazi seats 196 in the November election, Social Democratic Party 121, Communist Party 100, Total intermediate rankings 143. Hindenburg made a cabinet at the defense army Schleicher, but the big capital frightened by Nazi's decline, the advance of the Communist Party decided to support the Nazis, and the Schleicher cabinet collapsed in two months.

DOC.Title: middle class, middle class
DOC.TEXT: Middle of capitalist and working class, white collar, merchants, craftsmen are representative. It was a central supportive group, hoping for the Nazis who seemed to have a particularly strong falling feeling in the world depression, superior in action power.

DOC.Title: Hitler cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Established in January 1933. Supported by the military and large capitalists, it was launched under the name of a national cooperation cabinet and immediately dissolved the parliament. In March, while suppressing anti-Nazis forces such as the Communist Party by all means, it became the first party after a general election, established the full authority delegation law, abolished parliamentary politics, strengthened the dictatorship of the Nazi party party.

DOC.Title: Parliamentary Arson Case
DOC.TEXT: The incident that occurred on the night of February 27, 1933. As a criminal, Rubbe and others, a former Dutch Communist member, were arrested and the Communist Party was illegally converted into dissolution. Although the incident has been regarded as a Nazi 's proposal, there is also a theory that Rubbe' s sole crime, the truth is unknown.

DOC.Title: Repression of the Communist Party, dissolution of the Communist Party
All rights delegation law
DOC.TEXT: A bill that leaves the legislative power to the government because it removes ethnic and national difficulties. We added the Communist Party's seat in the general election to Nazis, established the National People's Party and the Central Party by bringing in favor, and established Hitler's dictatorship system legitimately.

DOC.Title: President, Furrer
DOC.TEXT: In 1934 President Hindenburg 's death, the presidential system was abolished and Hitler became inaugural position to take office (occupation 1934-45). Have full power of the president, the prime minister, the party leader.

DOC.Title: Third Empire
DOC.TEXT: German under Nazi rule. The meaning of the "third empire" following the Holy Roman Empire and the German Empire.

DOC.Title: Gestapo
DOC.TEXT: Abbreviation of State Secret Police (GeheimeStaatspolizei) established by Gering in 1933-34. From the year 34, he was under the jurisdiction of the Minister of Home Affairs, and Himmler held the real power, punished the people without performing ordinary laws and trials, and became a symbol of Nazi's fear politics.

DOC.Title: Withdrawal from the International League, withdrawal from the German League of Nations
DOC.TEXT: Hitler declined withdrawal after Japan, denying that he went to the League of Nations with assertion of equality of arms in order to reverse German arms restrictions under the Treaty of Versailles. I asked for the result of the people 's vote and got support of 95%.

DOC.Title: incorporation of Saar
DOC.TEXT: By local referendum, I returned to Germany with an approval rating of 91%. It was the success of the Nazi regime's first expansion of the territory.

DOC.Title: Rearmament Declaration, German Rearmament Declaration
DOC.TEXT: Hitler declared Versailles Treaty abandoned, restoration of duty military service, defense troops to expand by 5.5 times.

DOC.Title: Draft recruitment, German duty military service revival
DOC.TEXT: At the heart of the German Rearmament Declaration, the implementation of conscription system, possession of 500,000 standing army, organization of air force, etc. were also declared.

DOC.Title: French mutual aid treaty
DOC.TEXT: To strengthen the French Soviet non-aggression treaty of 1932 in order to counter the Nazi = German rearmament declaration. However, Nazis will pretext to destroy the 1936 Locarno Treaty as an excuse.

DOC.Title: Soviet Union = Czech Mutual Assistance Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Nazis = military treaty against the threat of Germany.

DOC.Title: France = Czech Mutual Assistance Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Nazi = Germany against the opposition.

DOC.Title: British German Navy Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Admitted to Germany holding 35% warships and 45% of submarines in the UK. The British himself neglected the Treaty of Versailles and approved German rearmament.

DOC.Title: Discard of Locarno Convention
DOC.TEXT: Hitler unilaterally abandoned provisions of German and Belgian, German and French border security and Rheinland permanent unarmed provisions.

DOC.Title: Rheinland Visit
DOC.TEXT: Hitler decided to do so. We concluded the Treaty of Versailles and the Locarno Treaty on the grounds of the conclusion of Mutual Assistance Treaty of Buddha Soviet Union and implemented it. France cured the attitude towards Germany, but since it was not able to get in sync with Britain, it became an established factual fact and made Hitler's deep confidence.

DOC.Title: Four-year plan
DOC.TEXT: In the Nazi economic plan that began in 1936, the responsible person gains. The military top priority of "cannon than butter" was militaristic like civilian disrespect. The second plan was suspended in the war.

DOC.Title: Autobahn
DOC.TEXT: High-speed motorway network running Germany and Austria. In 1932 the first section of the Cologne-Bon line opened. Construction also had meaning of unemployment countermeasures.

DOC.Title: Jewish persecution
DOC.TEXT: Nazi started race based on racial theory, as soon as it came to power. In the Nuremberg law promulgated in 1935, the Jews up to one-eighth mixed blood, denied the right to live as citizens, such as banning public office and prohibiting business management. Eventually the extinction policy was forced.

DOC.Title: anti-Semismism
DOC.TEXT: Another name for anti-Semitism that began to be used in Germany since about 1880.

DOC.Title: Einstein
DOC.TEXT: A Jewish physicist born in Germany. Aside from the persecution of the Nazis, he exiled to the United States in 1933 and tried to counter anti-fascism.

DOC.Title: Thomas-man
DOC.TEXT: German writer. In opposition to Nazi's inhuman policy, he exiled to America in 1933, moved to Switzerland after World War II, and consistently defended humanism.

DOC.Title: "Crystal Night", Crystal Nacht
DOC.TEXT: On 9-10 November 1938, the Jewish shops were killed and massacred by the Nazis. I got this name because the glass which became quashed turned sparkle like a crystal.

DOC.Title: Roma
DOC.TEXT: It is a self-proclaimed person who is usually called "gibsy". Together with the Jews, they were made subject to Nazi persecution. It is believed to have an origin in India and has long been a wandering life, so it has the image of "wanderers of people", but today many of them have settled lives.

DOC.Title: Holocaust
DOC.TEXT: Jewish massacre. The Nazis who got anti-Semitism called the "final solution of the Jewish problem", built an extinction camp in various places and carried out a systematic massacre.

DOC.Title: Ethiopia Intrusion
DOC.TEXT: The Mussolini administration in Italy executed to divert the public's attention from the domestic economic crisis due to the depression, and merged in 1936. The League of Nations voted on economic sanctions against Italy, but the oil embargo was not executed, the effect was thin, and the ineffectiveness was revealed.

DOC.Title: Berlin = Rome Axis
DOC.TEXT: Germany and Italy partnership established in 1936. By Rhineland, Ethiopia invasion and Spanish civil war intervention, the interests of both internationally isolated countries were combined in common.

DOC.Title: Japan-Germany Anti-Common Agreement, Japan-Germany Anti-cooperation Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Signed in Berlin in November 1936. Italy joined in November 1937 and became the three defense cooperation agreement. Spain, Hungary, Bulgaria, etc. are members later. Anti-joint is antisopportant, there was also one aspect that you could expect favorable such as USA, UK, France.

DOC.Title: Withdrawal from the International League, Withdrawal from the Italian League of Nations
DOC.TEXT: Following Japan and Germany, withdrawal from the Versailles regime.

DOC.Title: Amsterdam Anti-War Conference
DOC.TEXT: An international conference on anti-war / anti-fascism, held at the call of Roman-Lolan.

DOC.Title: Comintern 7th convention
DOC.TEXT: It is held in Moscow. Backed by the emergence of the Nazi regime in Germany, the Communist Party of each country has ceased to be a self-righteous policy so far and cooperated widely with all anti-fascist groups such as Social Democratic Party, Social Democratic Party, Liberal Democratic Party, Intellectuals, Religious Organization, We decided the policy that we should create a unified front and a people front.

DOC.Title: People's Front
DOC.TEXT: Anti-fascism People's Unification Front, which unites all factions and organizations opposing fascism and war (Communist Party · Socialist Party · Liberal Democratic Party · Workers · Peasants · Citizens to Intellectuals · Religious Organizations). From "enemies who are not friends" to "people who are not enemies are ally" was taken. It was realized in France and Spain, and in China it was called the national unity fight.

DOC.Title: French People's Front
DOC.TEXT: In 1935, the Socialist Party, the Communist Party, the radical Socialist Party agreed and was formed. The Great Depression became fierce, French politics became unstable, the subpartial upright / short-lived cabinet continued, and was formed with the emergence of fascism forces. Winning the next year's election, the People's Front Cabinet was formed.

DOC.Title: France Socialist Party
DOC.TEXT: An association organization of socialist factions formed in 1905. As a radical leftist party, he contested the leadership of the workers' organization with the Communist Party.

DOC.Title: Junior Socialist Party
DOC.TEXT: A progressive Republican party formed in 1901 triggered by the Dreyfus incident. Small citizens, small farmers and small merchants were the supporting base.

DOC.Title: French Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1920 the Social Democratic Leftists broke up and formed and workers from key industry were made ground. We abandoned the traditional revolutionary first principle and adopted flexible tactics such as promising cooperation outside the Cabinet to the People's Front Cabinet, and tried to establish it.

DOC.Title: People's Front Cabinet, French People's Front Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: The coalition cabinet of the Socialist Party and the radical Socialist Party with Prime Minister of the Socialist Party (Blum) (People 's Front Cabinet). Promoted the 40 hour weekly labor system, paid leave system, collective agreement etc., adopted anti-fascism policy, but retreated without overcoming the economic crisis.

DOC.Title: Blum
DOC.TEXT: French politician. Socialist party leader. It became the Prime Minister of the People 's Front Cabinet.

DOC.Title: Spanish Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that killed Primo-de-rivera 's dictatorship under the rule of the Bourbon morning and established the Republic of Spain. The Spanish society became confused by the Great Depression, the Republic of Bourbon was abandoned and exiled as a result of the republican winning in the local election in April 1931 triggered the realization of the Republic of Spain. The government of the new Republic enacted a new constitution following the Weimar constitution but did not carry out land liberation and the landowners, churches, military persons and capitalists violently repelled, political unrest continued.

DOC.Title: Spanish People's Front
DOC.TEXT: In January 1936, formed from moderate republics to anarchists. The Azaña cabinet appeared with the victory over the general election in February, embarked on land reform and deprivation of the privilege of the church, but Franco stood up against the rebellion and fell in the civil war.

DOC.Title: Asaña
DOC.TEXT: Spanish liberal republican politician. It became the President of the People 's Front Cabinet (1936-39 in office) but was defeated by the civil war, exiled to Paris in 1939.

DOC.Title: Civil war in Spain
DOC.TEXT: Franco of the general supported by the anti-Republican military, landlord, church against the people's front government began with the rebellion in Morocco. Fascist groups in Germany and Italy openly aided Franco, but Britain and France took measures against non-interference as a result of fighting the expansion of the war, and did not support government forces. Instead of helping the government by the Soviet Union and the International Volunteer Army, the Soviet Union was focused on taking the initiative of the government and suppressed government forces other than the Communist Party, the government troops were confused and weakened I lost.

DOC.Title: Franco
DOC.TEXT: Spanish soldier. Spain's revolt leader. After the victory, he forced the dictatorship as the president of the nation, and kept its position for a long time after the Second World War.

DOC.Title: International Voluntary Army
DOC.TEXT: Explicit fascism People who participated in the Spanish government forces from around the world to fight against rebellion. Although weapons and training were low as war potential, the spirit of defending freedom and humans was regarded as a symbol of the conscience of the world. Many liberalists, writers Hemingway, Orwell et al. Are famous.

DOC.Title: Hemingway
DOC.TEXT: An American writer.

DOC.Title: Mallow
DOC.TEXT: French author and politician. During the Second World War I participated in the German resistance and after World War II served as the cultural minister of the De Gall regime. The masterpiece is "hope".

DOC.Title: Orwell
DOC.TEXT: A British writer. In 'Catalan hymns' and 'Animal farms', I painted Spanish civil war and corruption of the Soviet regime.

DOC.Title: Non-interference policy
DOC.TEXT: 1936 United Kingdom · France led the establishment of the Spanish civil war non-disposition committee, 27 countries including Soviet Union, Germany, Italy etc. participated and carried out. But Germany and Italy publicly assisted the rebels and the Soviet Union withdrew.

DOC.Title: Farantha Party
DOC.TEXT: Spain's right-wing party. Founded in 1933, it was reorganized in 37 years during the civil war in Spain, became the only political organization under the Franco dictatorship system.

DOC.Title: Madrid
DOC.TEXT: It is the capital city of the Republic of Spain and the center base of the People's Front. It fell in March of 1939.

DOC.Title: Guernica
DOC.TEXT: A small city in the northern Basque Country of Spain. The German-Italian forces supporting the rebellion added an indiscriminate bombing to this town in the government-controlled territory to bring out many victims and shocked the world. Picasso who felt strong anger in this incident is also famous for drawing a work called "Guernica".

DOC.Title: Salazar
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of Portugal (responsible 1932-68). Supporting fascism both inside and outside as a dictator, also supported Franco during the Spanish civil war.

DOC.Title: Austria consolidation
DOC.TEXT: In March 1938, Nazi = Germany went. Although it was banned by the Treaty of Versailles and the Saint-Germain Treaty, there was also a strong opposition from Britain, France and Hungary, but using the activities of the Nazi in Austria, invading the army and forced the consolidation.

DOC.Title: Sudeten region
DOC.TEXT: Hitler requested a censure with the pretext of living in Germany with Czechoslovakia's German border zone. Czechoslovakia rejected the agreement with Britain and France and refused, but Hitler intimidated the possibility of war.

DOC.Title: Munich talk
DOC.TEXT: Meeting with Hitler and Chamberlain (UK), Daradie (French), Mussorini (Italy) on Sudeten problem. In response to Hitler who won the Sudeten region even if appealing to war, Britain and France got promises that Hitler would not claim any further territory, and acknowledged Hitler's request. A typical example of the German appeasement policy between Britain and France, the parties Czechoslovakia and neighboring countries Soviet Union were not convinced to this conference and the Soviet Union further deepens distrust of Britain and France.

DOC.Title: Neville = Chamberlain
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom (President 1937-40). Conservative Party. I kept pursuing Hitler's appeasement policy. Although continuing the indecisive policy even after the beginning of the Second World War, Germany 's rapid advance in France, withdrawing it in response to the withdrawal operation of Dunkirk, it gave up to Churchill as the prime minister' s seat.

DOC.Title: Dalladie
DOC.TEXT: French Prime Minister (Resigned 1933, 34, 38-40). Following Chamberlain at the Munich talks.

DOC.Title: Appeasement policy
DOC.TEXT: A policy that tries to avoid a definite conflict (war) by concession to the opponent. Britain at the Munich talks (including France dragged by it) was typically seen in foreign policy that conceded Germany's illegal demand to avoid war at the cost of Czechoslovakia. After all, Nazi = Germany caused the Second World War, and this policy was wrong.

DOC.Title: Boemen Maren, Bohemia · Moravia
DOC.TEXT: West half of the former Czechoslovak territory. In March 1939, Germany was consolidated, but residents of this area were Slavic, and it was a clear violation against the Munich Agreement.

DOC.Title: Czechoslovak dismantling
DOC.TEXT: In Germany 's intimidation, it was separated into the Czech Republic (Bohemia and Moravian) in the west and Slovakia in the eastern half and was dismantled.

DOC.Title: Slovak Protected Nationalization
DOC.TEXT: I succumbed to the pressure of Germany.

DOC.Title: Albania consolidation
DOC.TEXT: Italy unilaterally declared consolidation.

DOC.Title: Germany = Italy Military Alliance
DOC.TEXT: Concluded in May 1939. I called it a steel alliance.

DOC.Title: World War II
DOC.TEXT: The greatest war in history that most participants on the planet and countries around 60 countries participated in. Although various conflicts have deepened since the outbreak of the Great Depression, fascism and totalitaria emerged especially in "not-to-have countries" Germany, Italy, Japan, etc. and began to implement aggressive policy aiming to expand colonies In a position (reason) that "countries that can have" Britain, France, the United States and others protect democracy, it became a war trying to stop it. In 1941 June Germany attacked the Soviet Union, the Soviet Union also participated in the position of antifascism. Beyond World War I, the performance of weapons has increased and the damage has expanded, and the sacrifice of not only soldiers but also the general public has increased. In the early stage of the battle situation, the Axis side (Germany, Italy, Japan) was advantageous, but eventually it was completely lost to the Allies side.

DOC.Title: Poland corridor
DOC.TEXT: Poland territory between Germany and East Prussia. Although it became Polish territory under the Treaty of Versailles, German residents also resided, and since March 1939, Germany strongly demanded that passage right.

DOC.Title: Danzig
DOC.TEXT: Current Gdańsk. In the former German territory, it was regarded as a free city under the control of the International Federation in the Treaty of Versailles, it was the only seaport in Poland. Since March 1939, Germany requested a censure, Poland hoped for the support of Britain and France, and refused with the corridor.

DOC.Title: Singular non-aggression treaty
DOC.TEXT: The Soviet Union, who was concerned about Germany's expansion of power, tried to deepen collaboration with Britain and France but was unable to accept it. So I wanted to conclude a treaty with Germany in order to postpone even the timing of the start of war with Germany. Meanwhile, Germany also wanted a partnership with the Soviet Union to strengthen the position for England and France when invading Poland. As a result, it became a situation of partnership between the treaties of the two countries which totally differed in their basic position, and gave a great impact to the world. In addition, the confidential clause agreed on the scope of power in the Poland-Baltic countries.

DOC.Title: Start of World War II
DOC.TEXT: It began with German invasion of Poland against Poland. On September 3, Britain and France fought against the German war, after which many nations entered the war and expanded to the great war.

DOC.Title: Invasion of Poland, Invasion of Germany Poland
DOC.TEXT: Beginning on September 1, 1939, the Polish army was destroyed in three weeks by the German Army's electric blast fight (a strategy of intensively introducing aircraft and tanks).

DOC.Title: Invasion of Poland, invasion of Soviet Poland
DOC.TEXT: The Soviet Union started invading Poland in accordance with Monoza non-aggression treaty (secret clause) and occupied West Ukraine · White Russia lost in the eastern half and 1920 by the 28 th.

DOC.Title: Consolidation of the Baltic States, the consolidation of the Soviet Baltic States
DOC.TEXT: From September to October 1939, the three countries of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania compelled each other to conclude mutual aid treaties with the Soviet Union, and the Soviet troops stationed and occupied. Formally merged in August 40, August.

DOC.Title: Soviet Union = Finland War
DOC.TEXT: Finland rejected the Soviet territorial exchange request and fought from the Soviet Union. The Soviets took a ceasefire with the strong resistance of the Finnish citizens and Britain and France turning to Finland support and the Soviet Union robbed Karelia province.

DOC.Title: United Nations League, Exclude Soviet Union
DOC.TEXT: According to Finnish complaint, the Soviet Union was expelled as an aggression country.

DOC.Title: Denmark / Norway invasion, Germany Denmark / Norway invasion
DOC.TEXT: Germany occupied illegal military occupied both neutral countries. As a result, the state of conflict with the British and French Army ("Strange War" Phoneywar) since October 1939 has ended, and full fledged warfare has started.

DOC.Title: Dutch / Belgian invasion, Germany Netherlands / Belgian invasion
DOC.TEXT: Germany invaded trampling the eternal neutrality rule, invaded the Netherlands in 5 days, surrendered Belgium and turned to the German army north France.

DOC.Title: Churchill
DOC.TEXT: British conservative party leader. While continuing to criticize the German appeasement policy against Germany, in May 1940, in exchange for Chamberlain in the crisis of the German army, he became Prime Minister (July 1945), exerting powerful leadership to make the Second World It did not fight the great war, it became a symbol of England in wartime.

DOC.Title: Dunkirque
DOC.TEXT: Port of French side of the Dover Straits. From May to June 1940, all British troops and over 300,000 French troops dispatched by the continent were surrounded by the German army in this area, but most of them escaped from the sea.

DOC.Title: Participation in Italy
DOC.TEXT: I took advantage of the dominance of Germany and took part in the war. Formed the Mediterranean Front, the Italian Army was weak through World War II and the military role was low.

DOC.Title: Paris occupation, France surrender
DOC.TEXT: The German army arrived bloodless, France newly surrendered to Germany instead of the Petan cabinet.

DOC.Title: Petan
DOC.TEXT: French soldier / politician. Although he was a French hero who played an active part in World War I, when I was defeated by Germany in the Second World War, he built Vichy as the capital and a German cooperation cabinet and became the president of the country. He was killed in treason after the war and died in prison.

DOC.Title: Vichy government
DOC.TEXT: A German cooperation regime, set up in Vichy in the central French town. With this, the third Republic of France was abolished, the Vichy rule reigned in the southern half of France, the German army occupied and dominated the northern half. It collapsed by resistance uprising and liberation of Paris by coalition forces.

DOC.Title: Do = Goal
DOC.TEXT: French soldier. June 1940 During the surrender of the government of the home country, asylum to London, declared the establishment of the free French government, continued anti-war against Germany. Often conflicted with Churchill and others, it became a symbol of Germany resistance during the war.

DOC.Title: Free French government
DOC.TEXT: The de facto French government where de = goal was established in London in June 1940. In keeping with the anti-war against Germany, he instructed the resistance movement. Afterwards, he moved to Algiers and entered Paris after his liberation, he became an extraordinary government until 46 years of the establishment of the fourth Republic.

DOC.Title: Bessarabia
DOC.TEXT: Area name of the Danube estuary area. In June 1940, the Soviet Union requested a campaign to Romania together with North Bukovina and merged.

DOC.Title: Weapons lease law
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1941. After the surrender of France, the law established by US President Roseworth to support the isolated British. We revised the neutral law of 37 years and approved the sale, transfer, lending and exchange of munitions under the name of the President. It was applied to most Allies through World War II and totaled $ 50 billion by the year 45.

DOC.Title: Vulcan control
DOC.TEXT: The occupation of Yugoslavia Greek by the German army until the spring of 1941. On the other hand, the Soviet Union has controlled Romania's oil resource zone in the previous year, the conflict between the two countries became increasingly intensified, leading to the start of the Soviet attack by Germany in June 191.

DOC.Title: Tito
DOC.TEXT: My real name is Joshib = Broz. It is a communist of Yugoslavia, strongly developed Partisan struggle against the German occupation forces, and after the war the government was controlled. After the war, from the confrontation with Stalin, pushed the original Yugoslav socialistic route.

DOC.Title: Partizan
DOC.TEXT: A fierce battle taken by irregular forces with inferior weapons and equipment. Avoid the front decisive battle, mainly wreck and distress the enemies mainly due to raids and disturbances. It was done in the Nazi of the Second World War and occupied territory of the Japanese army and damaged it.

DOC.Title: Nissho Neutral Treaty, Japan-Soviet Non-Aggression Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Established in April 1941. Japan wanting to advance negotiations and conflicts with the United States advantageously and the Soviet Union with anxiety about the entry into the Balkans in Germany joined.

DOC.Title: German Soviet War
DOC.TEXT: On June 22, 1941, Germany unilaterally abandoned the Singapore non-aggression treaty and began with an attack on the Soviet Union. Hitler raised the territory to the East to lay out the "living zone" of the German nation, but as the German army is focusing on combat in Western Europe, the Soviet Balkans Peninsula The confrontation in this area intensified as invasion into the area was done rapidly. Dengeki strategy was executed with the German army of 3 million as the main force, including Finland, Romania, Hungary, Italy army, the initial stage of the German side's advancement was remarkable, but in the winter the Soviet Union The resistance of the side became strong, and it went on for a long term warfare. As Britain and the United States backed the Soviet Union, the character of war fought against fascist forces and anti-fascist forces.

DOC.Title: Meeting on the Atlantic Ocean, the US-UK Summit Meeting
DOC.TEXT: In order to cope with the offensive of fascism, Rose Welt and Churchill 's U.S.-UK summit meeting held on a ship on the Atlantic Ocean. The Atlantic Charter was announced.

DOC.Title: Atlantic charter
DOC.TEXT: In August 1941, the US and UK Leaders created and announced the expansion of the war. In all eight categories, it consisted of non-expansion of territory, territory non-change, ethnic self-determination, freedom of trade, labor and social security, freedom of the oceans, arms reduction, reconstruction of the peace mechanism. After the announcement the fascism side was silent, but the Soviet Union and others were backed by many nations and ethnic groups.

DOC.Title: Ghetto
DOC.TEXT: A district that forcibly isolated Jews in European cities. After the epidemic of the 14th century best, it was made in the progress of Jewish discrimination and persecution.

DOC.Title: concentration camp
DOC.TEXT: Nazi = a place where politicians and Jews and others were housed to make Germany do forced labor or genocide. During this period, many camps were also established in the Soviet Union under the Stalin regime.

DOC.Title: Auschwitz
DOC.TEXT: The largest concentration camp built by Nazi Germany in 1940. It is said that more than 1.5 million people were massacred, mainly Jews. There is a trace left as a "museum" of war crimes at Polish Oshifientim now.

DOC.Title: Pacific War
DOC.TEXT: The war between Japan and the Allied Powers in the Pacific region of World War II. The Japanese army began invading Pearl Harbor in Hawaii, the Malay Peninsula, the Philippines and others. For the first half year the Japanese army was predominant and called for releasing Asia from white colonial rule and deployed troops to Southeast Asia. The reality caused severe domination and exploitation of the people in the occupied area, and it rebelled and since the summer of 1942, it was completely defeated by the counterattack of the Allied countries mainly in the United States.

DOC.Title: Asia-Pacific War
DOC.TEXT: Another name for the Pacific War. It is used to clarify that this war was not only the Pacific region, but also the war spreading to Asia including Southeast Asia.

DOC.Title: "Great East Asia War"
DOC.TEXT: The name of the Pacific War officially used by the Japanese government during the war.

DOC.Title: Japan, Germany, Italy Alliance, Japan, Germany, Italy, Military Alliance
DOC.TEXT: It was signed in Berlin right after the German military success. The conflict with Japan's United Kingdom was decisive.

DOC.Title: French state Indochina resident
DOC.TEXT: In September 1940, with the surrender of France, the Japanese army entered the northern French Indochina (Vietnam). In July 1919, while exchanging the Japan-French protocol during the US-Japan talks, he moved to the south, showed intention of making a south shift blatantly, hardened the United States.

DOC.Title: Nissho Neutral Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Established in April 1941. Japan, which tried to advance to the south by promoting favorable relations with the United States, and the Soviet Union in dealing with the Balkans in Germany promised mutual inviolability and neutral maintenance. The deadline is 5 years. However, at the Yalta talks in February 1945, the Soviet Union announced its participation in the war against Japan within three months after the German surrender.

DOC.Title: US-Japan negotiations
DOC.TEXT: Negotiations started by the Konoe Cabinet, and the withdrawal from the Japanese army from China and withdrawal from the alliance of three countries became the central issue. However, the Japanese military did not give way, negotiations concluded the Nissan neutrality treaty, southern France French Indochina married ceremony, hardened the United States. In October, the Konoe Cabinet replaced the Tojo Cabinet and the opening campaign was finalized.

DOC.Title: ABCD line
DOC.TEXT: It began to be used as a newspaper / broadcasting term since around the summer of 1941, the enemy forces surrounding Japan. A is the United States, B is the UK, C is the China, D is the Netherlands. It was used to caution the enemy of the Japanese people.

DOC.Title: Pearl Harbor surprise
DOC.TEXT: The Japanese Task Force attacked the American Pacific Fleet main force of Hawaii Pearl Harbor. Because the warning of declaration war from the Japanese side was delayed and it became "surprise attack" before declaration of war, Japan became to be bothered stubborn. The Pacific War began.

DOC.Title: Germany / Italy, war against the US
DOC.TEXT: Following the arrangements of the Tripartite alliance · German-Italian both countries declared. This literally became a world war, but between Japan and the Soviet Union with a neutral treaty did not open wars.

DOC.Title: Hong Kong strategy
DOC.TEXT: In December 1941, the Japanese army occupied Hong Kong, the base of the British army.

DOC.Title: Murray occupation
DOC.TEXT: The Japanese army attacked from the north and completed in February 1942.

DOC.Title: Singapore occupation
DOC.TEXT: The Japanese army succeeded in the occupation, after that massacres against the overseas Chinese were held.

DOC.Title: Javan Sumatra occupation
DOC.TEXT: The Japanese army succeeded in occupation, especially efforts to secure oil resources.

DOC.Title: Philippine occupation
DOC.TEXT: We occupied Manila and pursued the American troops afterwards.

DOC.Title: Occupation of Burma, occupation of Myanmar
DOC.TEXT: We occupied Rangoon (now Yangon) and occupied almost the whole May in May.

DOC.Title: Allied countries
DOC.TEXT: To the Axis countries of Japan, Germany, Italy in World War II, countries such as the United States, the United Kingdom, France, the Soviet Union, and China that were coalesced with anti-fascism.

DOC.Title: "Great East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere"
DOC.TEXT: Economic, political and military blocks of East Asia with Japan as the leader. This plan was announced by the 2 nd Konoe Cabinet in July 1940. Although we abolished the colonial rule of the Caucasians from East Asia, they sang the coexistence and co-prosperity of the Asian peoples, but in reality they would exploit the people of the occupied areas and forced labor to lead the rebellion of Asian peoples Became.

DOC.Title: Greater East Conference
DOC.TEXT: In 1943, Japan, which is heading towards inferiority, held a meeting of representatives of Thailand, Myanmar, the Philippines, the National Government (Wangjing insignia side), Manchuria County in Tokyo. I emphasized again that the significance of war is in the liberation of Asia and asked for cooperation with these countries.

DOC.Title: Axis country
DOC.TEXT: Countries belonging to the side of Japan, Germany, Italy alliance against the Allied Forces.

DOC.Title: Empowerment Policy
DOC.TEXT: Measures to strengthen colonial rule on Korea and Taiwan, which took place since the beginning of the Sino-Japanese War. In order to make Koreans a perfect empire subject, we forced the palace worship, the shrine visit, the oath of the empire's subjects and so on.

DOC.Title: Creation renamed
DOC.TEXT: Part of the empowerment policy. Policy to force Koreans to Japanese style (surname) and change the name to Japanese style. It was promulgated in November 1939 and was enforced in February of the following year.

DOC.Title: Sanko policy
DOC.TEXT: Since 1940, the Japanese military performed in China, a strategy of annihilating the Chinese. "Sanko" refers to Chinese baking light (burning), killing (killing), shadowing (depriving).

DOC.Title: Forced entrainment of Koreans
DOC.TEXT: Hunting gathering Koreans for forced labor by Japanese mining labor. We decided the allocation for each region (road) of Korea, mobilized the police force etc and executed it. During 1939-45 years, 720,000 people were entrained and overworked, and many victims were issued.

DOC.Title: Comfort Women
DOC.TEXT: A woman recruited from Asian countries by the Japanese army.

DOC.Title: Resistance
DOC.TEXT: It refers to the resistance movement in the fascism control area. Although the size, organization, lineage, tactics, and equipment were various, it became one of the characteristics of World War II in the struggle that the general citizen was mainly. Disturbing the back of the occupation forces, it greatly affected the military behavior of the regular army. France 's resistance to Germany is the most famous, and it contributed to the Nazi' s defeat in the second half of the Second World War.

DOC.Title: Guerrilla warfare
DOC.TEXT: Synonymous with Partizan · Raid fight, in battle system against regular army of inferior weapon equipped non-regular army. Early in the 19th century, the resistance of the Spanish army for the Napoleonic army is the etymology.

DOC.Title: Kim Il Sung
DOC.TEXT: As a leader of the Korean Communist Party, since 1934, he fought an anti-Japanese struggle around the Mountainous region of North East China North Korea, but escaped to the Soviet Union in 1941.

DOC.Title: Korean People's Revolutionary Army, Tohoku Anti-Japanese Allied Army
DOC.TEXT: Army who conducted anti-Japanese struggle under the guidance of Kim Il-sung from 1934 to 1935.

DOC.Title: Eighth Route Army
DOC.TEXT: In September 1937, the name of the Chinese Communist Party since the Red Army entered under the leadership of Shinsuke Stone under the National Cooperative. It became the main force of anti-Japan warfare in North China, beset the Japanese army with the Fourth Army downstream of the Yangtze River, won the support of the people.

DOC.Title: Fourth Army
DOC.TEXT: the above. Established in 1938, under the guidance of the Chinese Communist Party, an army that was active mainly in the Yangtze River basin during the anti-Japanese game.

DOC.Title: Chandra = Pose
DOC.TEXT: One of the leaders of the Indian National Congress. During the Second World War, Japan formed the Indian National Army with the cooperation of Japan due to anti-British independence, but it was used as a strategy of Japan. An accident was killed in Taiwan at the end of World War II.

DOC.Title: Vietnam Independence Alliance, Betumin
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic Unification Front established with Indochina Communist Party as the center. After the surrender of France, when the Japanese army entered Indochina, it became the center of anti-Japan armed struggle. After the war, the Democratic Republic of Vietnam was established and developed a fight against independence against France.

DOC.Title: Ho Chi Minh
DOC.TEXT: Vietnamese Communist leader. He directed the Vietnam Independence Alliance to develop armed struggle against Japan, and in September 1945 the president of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam (1969) became the postwar.

DOC.Title: Fukubarahap, Fukudan
DOC.TEXT: Anti-guerrilla organization in the Philippines. He played an active part in Luzon Island. After the war, I fought with the US Army, and was compromised around 1955.

DOC.Title: Anti-Fascist People's Liberty Federation
DOC.TEXT: Burma's anti-Japanese national unity front, formed in August 1944. After entering full-scale armed conflict against Japan against March in 1945, after the defeat of the Japanese army developed anti-English independence struggle, after independence gained control of the administration.

DOC.Title: Allied Joint Declaration
DOC.TEXT: Announced on January 1, 1942. The Allied Powers declared their unity with each other's war purpose and antifascism.

DOC.Title: British and Soviet military alliance
DOC.TEXT: Immediately after the war in Germany, in July 1941, Britain and the Soviet Union promised mutual assistance in war against Germany, and in May 42nd further concluded a military content agreement.

DOC.Title: Battle of the Midway
DOC.TEXT: Until then, the main force of the Japanese Navy Tactical Force who won the consecutive war was a battle that suffered catastrophic blows. After this, the Japanese army decided to follow the way to losing.

DOC.Title: Guadalcanal Island
DOC.TEXT: An island in the southern Solomon Islands. Since August 1942, the Japanese and the US army expanded the fight, but the Japanese army deprived of the airspace was exhausted and withdrawn at a great sacrifice.

DOC.Title: Battle of Sterlingard
DOC.TEXT: The Volga riverside sentence is the current fight in Volgograd. The German army besieged this city and fought a fierce urban war, but the Soviet troops oppositely besieged in November 1942. 300 thousand of the German military's most elite units were forbidden from Hitler and were destroyed in response to the battle of the Soviet forces in February 43, and German soldiers who became captives were also almost killed by forced labor. It became a turning point for the German Soviet game, and the road to the defeat of the German army began.

DOC.Title: Second Front
DOC.TEXT: A full-scale counter-attack strategy from the West towards Germany during the Second World War. The Soviet Union, which had been hitting the majority of the German army since the start of the German Soviet game, asked the United States and the United Kingdom for execution. In response to the strong demand of Stalin, Churchill was reluctant to prolong the time, but Rose Welt was aggressive, claiming to land North French with Stalin. By the June 1944 landing of Normandy, this strategy was finally implemented.

DOC.Title: North Africa landing, Allied Forces North Africa landing
DOC.TEXT: The Allied forces, the main force of the US military, landed in Morocco and Algeria, countering against Germany and Italy from the western North Africa began.

DOC.Title: Comintern dissolution
DOC.TEXT: Stalin decided to strengthen the unity with the Allied Powers.

DOC.Title: Sicilian landing, Allied force landing Sicily
DOC.TEXT: The United States British first landed in Sicily before the invasion of the mainland of Italy. As a result, in July Mussolini was arrested by the king, party and military, and it fainted (the German army rescued in September).

DOC.Title: Vadio regime
DOC.TEXT: In July 1943, the Italian cabinet, established after Mussorini's loss. We decided to surrender unconditionally to the Allies.

DOC.Title: New Italian government unconditional surrender
DOC.TEXT: The Italian mainland was led by the Badrio regime, but the northern part of Italy was occupied by the German army.

DOC.Title: Fascist party dissolution
DOC.TEXT: The Vadolio administration issued an order to dissolve at the same time as surrender, but practically it was ineffective before that.

DOC.Title: Cairo talk
DOC.TEXT: Rose Wert, Churchill and Yuusuke Stone debated the basic policy of the war against Japan in the capital city of Cairo, Egypt.

DOC.Title: Cairo declaration
DOC.TEXT: Signed in November 1943, announced in December. Regarding Japan, after surrender, we abandoned the island on the Pacific Ocean, which it robbed after 1914, the refund of China Tohoku and Taiwan to China, the independence of Korea.

DOC.Title: Tehran talks
DOC.TEXT: The first meeting by the three Leaders of the Allies that Rose Vert, Churchill Stalin opened in Tehran. We discussed mainly the second front issue, and the United States and the United Kingdom promised to do it in May of 44. The Soviet Union also promised to participate in Japan after the surrender of Germany.

DOC.Title: Normandy landing
DOC.TEXT: Large-scale landing strategy to North France by the Allied Forces (US British main body) conducted in June 1944. With this success, the second front was established, German attacks from Germany from the West and German attacks by the Soviet forces from the east got intertwined from both east and west, accelerating the flow of defeat.

DOC.Title: Eisenhauer
DOC.TEXT: American soldier. From 1943 onward, he led the mainland of Sicily and Italy, and when landing in Normandy, he is the supreme commander of the Allied forces. It played a major role in overthrowing Germany and became the 34th US president (responsible 1953-61) after the war.

DOC.Title: Paris liberation
DOC.TEXT: In response to the approach of the Allied Forces the resistance organization uprised, the German army withdrew and escaped the war. De Gaul entered Paris on 26th August.

DOC.Title: Soviet troops invaded Eastern Europe
DOC.TEXT: In 1944, the Soviet troops invaded one after another to Borland, Romania, Bulgaria, and in April 1945 they entered Berlin before the US British. As a result, Eastern Europe was placed under the influence of the Soviet Union after World War II.

DOC.Title: Fall of Saipan Island
DOC.TEXT: The US Army landed, and over 30,000 Japanese troops were almost completely annihilated. As a result, the Japanese archipelago entered the bombing range of the US Air Force, and air raids became everyday. And the Tojo cabinet was forced to retreat in July 18 R.

DOC.Title: US Army, Leyte Island Capture
DOC.TEXT: In October 1944, the US military began attacking the Leyte island in the central part of the Philippines and completely occupied in December. And I robbed the entire Philippine air court.

DOC.Title: US forces, Retaking the Philippines
DOC.TEXT: The US Army landed on Luzon Island. The Japanese army was blocked from contacting the mainland Japan, February Manila was occupied by the American army.

DOC.Title: Japan mainland air raid, American mainland air raid
DOC.TEXT: Beginning in June 1944 from the Chinese base to the Kitakyushu industrial area, after November B29 long-range bombers came from Mariana base to Tokyo, destroy industrial power · transportation power. After March 1945 it turned to indiscriminate attacks against cities mainly of incendiary bombs, even the middle cities became scorched, and Japanese warfare ability was destroyed.

DOC.Title: Yalta talk
DOC.TEXT: A meeting of post-war processing by Rose Wert, Churchill Stalin. The conflict between the UK and the Soviet Union has surfaced in the Polish-Balkans issue. He died in April after returning home at the last international conference of Rose Veld who was sick. Yalta is a health resort on the Crimea.

DOC.Title: Yalta Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Yalta Talks 3 Agreements by the Leaders. In the announcement, defeat Germany 's four-country management, a German war criminal trial, German demilitarization, the establishment of a new government of Poland and Yugoslavia. In the secret agreement, it was decided that the Soviet Union's entry into the Soviet Union within three months after the overthrow of Germany, the Soviet of Southern Sakhalin and Chishima, etc. were acquired.

DOC.Title: Dresden Great Raid
DOC.TEXT: In February 1945, an indiscriminate bombing to the German ancient capital Dresden by Allied forces. 35,000 civilians were sacrificed.

DOC.Title: US Army, Iwo Jima Occupation
DOC.TEXT: The Japanese army was almost completely annihilated and the resistance ended in March. The US military also made a great deal of sacrifice, but then developed and used it as a relay base for the bombing of Japan.

DOC.Title: US military, Okinawa mainland landing
DOC.TEXT: Landing on the main island of Okinawa. The Japanese army was almost destroyed in June following the overwhelming US military storm. Residents of Okinawa were also caught in intense fighting (some were forced to self-check the Japanese army) and issued numerous victims.

DOC.Title: Fall of Berlin
DOC.TEXT: By the Soviet Army. Hitler committed a scorched earth tactic orders even though the enveloping net to Berlin was declining, but committed suicide on April 30 just before the fall.

DOC.Title: German unconditional surrender
DOC.TEXT: Germany surrendered, the war in Europe ended.

DOC.Title: Potsdam talk
DOC.TEXT: Churchill (Atri from the middle) · Truman · Stalin gathered in Potsdam outside of Berlin and settled Potsdam Agreement such as disposal of Germany, non-nazising, demilitarization and allied country management. For the treatment against Japan, we discussed the conditions of surrender and the management policy after the war. In this talks, the confrontation between rice and Sovie surfaced, leading to the post-war Cold War.

DOC.Title: Potsdam Agreement
DOC.TEXT: We decided to negotiate the process of defeated countries Germany and Japan.

DOC.Title: Potsdam Declaration
DOC.TEXT: Joint Declaration of Joint Declaration of the United States, the United Kingdom, China (July, 1945 Participation in the Soviet Union August 8). Recommend unconditional surrender. The Japanese government stuck to national protection (maintenance of the Emperor System) and ignored it, but later accepted.

DOC.Title: Truman
DOC.TEXT: President of the 33rd American (President 1945-53) He was promoted to president by the death of Rose Walt's disease, ordered the Second World War, ordered the atomic bomb to Japan. After the Great War we took a containment policy against the Soviet Union.

DOC.Title: Dropped the atomic bomb in Hiroshima, dropped the atomic bomb in the United States of Hiroshima
DOC.TEXT: It received the first atomic bombing attack of the human race with no warning and the whole city of Hiroshima was destroyed. In the five years after the atomic bomb survived more than 200,000 people died.

DOC.Title: Soviet Union, Declaration against Japan
DOC.TEXT: Participated by the Yalta agreement. Broke the Nissho Neutrality Treaty, invaded Manchuria (Tohoku region of China) · Korea · Saka. As a result, about 180,000 people living in Japan died, and about 600,000 people were detained in Siberia and elsewhere.

DOC.Title: Dropped atomic bomb in Nagasaki, dropped atomic bomb in America Nagasaki
DOC.TEXT: More than 140,000 people dead in five years after the atomic bombing.

DOC.Title: Japan surrender
DOC.TEXT: On 14th, the Japanese government decided to accept the Potsdam Declaration on the condition that the protection of the national government is held at the pre-conference. The Allied party opposed the surrender because the unconditional surrender was claimed, but the Emperor broadcasted the end of the war to the people on 15th. September 2 signed a surrender document, World War II ended.

DOC.Title: Atlantic charter
DOC.TEXT: In August 1941, a charter summarized at the Atlantic Opinion of Rose Vert Churchill. We expressed a war purpose with a total of 8 articles to the fascism countries. With the approval of the Soviet Union in January 1942 it developed into a joint declaration of allied nations and became the basic idea of ​​the later United Nations Charter.

DOC.Title: Moscow Declaration
DOC.TEXT: Declaration summarized at the four-party foreign ministerial talks in 1943 in the United States, the UK, the Soviet Union, and China. "The early establishment of the International Security Organization" was announced and led to the Dumbarton-Oaks conference.

DOC.Title: Dumbarton-Oaks Conference
DOC.TEXT: A conference held in the above-mentioned area on the outskirts of Washington. A draft of the United Nations Charter was created by the representatives of the United States, the United Kingdom, the Soviet Union and China.

DOC.Title: San Francisco Conference
DOC.TEXT: A meeting held by 50 countries on the Allied side close to the victory in the great war. Added to the draft of the Charter created at the Dumbarton-Oaks Conference adopted as the Charter of the United Nations by adding decisions at the Yalta meeting to give voting rights to major powers at the Security Council.

DOC.Title: United Nations Charter
DOC.TEXT: An international treaty expressing the creation of the United Nations. It was signed on 26th June 1945. In its preamble, "the purpose of founding" says "to save future generations from the disastrous scores of wars up to two times" was said.

DOC.Title: United Nations, United Nations
DOC.TEXT: In October 1945, the International Peace Organization was established under the Charter of the United Nations. The original member countries are 51 countries, the headquarters is New York. As of 2007, 192 countries are members. Reflecting the failure of the League of Nations, he adopted the majority voting system at the General Assembly, strengthened the authority of the Security Council, and granted veto power to the five major powers. In addition to General Assembly and Security Council, we have many institutions. Today, nearly 60 years since the establishment, strengthening peacekeeping functions against regional conflicts In addition to the North-South problem, organizational and fiscal problems, and the American tendency towards independence, we face a big crossroads.

DOC.Title: Secretariat
DOC.TEXT: New York. I will hold the secretary general.

DOC.Title: General Assembly
DOC.TEXT: Majority voting system with one-vote voting power of each member country. There is no executive right just by discussion / recommendation. In January 1946 the first was held in London, the second in New York, the third in Paris, and later in New York.

DOC.Title: Security Council
DOC.TEXT: Major institutions with the most powerful powers in the United Nations. The authority superior to the General Assembly and has the authority to sanction economic, diplomatic and military necessary for resolving international disputes. It consists of eleven countries (later 15) and non-permanent six (ten) (15 later).

DOC.Title: permanent member
DOC.TEXT: Five countries, the United States, the United Kingdom, the Soviet Union, France and China. China's representation right moved from the Republic of China (Taiwan) to the People's Republic of China in 1971, after the dismantlement of the Soviet Union at the end of 1991, Russia took over the representation right, both of which are permanent members.

DOC.Title: Veto Right
DOC.TEXT: Rights owned by 5 permanent members of the UN Security Council. In the cases involving international disputes, the Security Council dealt with the principle of consensus, but the agenda often stagnated due to the abuse of veto power.

DOC.Title: Non-permanent member
DOC.TEXT: The term of office is six years in two countries. It increased to 10 countries from January 1966.

DOC.Title: United Nations Forces, International Police Forces
DOC.TEXT: An army that exercises military enforcement against a country that takes invasive action under the UN Charter. However, at the Security Council, the opinions of the US and Seo conflicted and never formally formed (unusually organized at the time of the Korean War). For this reason, the UN peacekeeping activities are shifting to peacekeeping activities (PK 0), etc. that do not rely on military enforcement but mediate under the consent of conflict concerned.

DOC.Title: Economic and Social Council
DOC.TEXT: One institution of the United Nations. Matters concerning promotion of human welfare such as economy, society, culture and education are handled. It consists of 18 countries (54 countries as of 2007) selected by the General Assembly.

DOC.Title: International Court of Justice
DOC.TEXT: One review of the United Nations. It was established in 1946 as a legal processing agency for international affairs, and all member countries are bound by the decision. Location is The Hague of the Netherlands.

DOC.Title: UNESCO, United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, UNESCO
DOC.TEXT: A UN specialized agency founded in 1946. Promote world peace through education, science and culture.

DOC.Title: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, World Bank
DOC.TEXT: A UN specialized agency established at the end of 1945. Capital is allocated to Member States and is aimed at financing postwar reconstruction and developing country development.

DOC.Title: International Monetary Fund, IMF
DOC.TEXT: A UN specialized agency established at the end of 1945. The objective is to gain international exchange stability.

DOC.Title: International Labor Organization, ILO
DOC.TEXT: A UN specialized agency established in 1946. It inherited the organization established in the 1919 International League. Representatives of governments, employers and workers exchange ideas on labor issues such as improvement of working conditions and make agreements. In addition, international labor standards shall be established under the Convention or Recommendation. The headquarters is Geneva, Switzerland.

DOC.Title: World Health Organization, WHO
DOC.TEXT: UN specialized agency. I am in charge of the field of health and sanitation. Teach and coordinate international health care projects. Inauguration in 1948. Head office Geneva.

DOC.Title: UN Food and Agriculture Organization, FAO
DOC.TEXT: UN specialized agency. Improve food production and distribution, aim at raising people's nutrition level and improving the lives of farmers.

DOC.Title: United Nations Children's Fund, UNICEF
DOC.TEXT: Subordinate organization of the Economic and Social Council. Provide assistance and remedies for infants and children in developing countries and disaster-stricken areas.

DOC.Title: Bretton-Woods Association
DOC.TEXT: A meeting of 44 countries on the allied side was held in the same name in the United States to rebuild the world economy. The Bretton-Woods Agreement was concluded, and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (World Bank), whose main objective was development assistance from developing countries, and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) aimed at stabilizing the international monetary system, The decision was decided.

DOC.Title: Bretton-Woods regime
DOC.TEXT: International monetary system based on Bretton-Woods agreement. Fixed exchange rate between the US dollar and national currencies (fixed exchange rate system) to stabilize international trade · Mainly to develop the world economy. However, as the dollar crisis progressed in the 1970s, the international currency regime centering on the dollar ended and the Bretton-Woods regime collapsed as the livelihood shifted to the floating exchange rate system by 1973.

DOC.Title: General agreement on GATT, GATT, tariffs and trade
DOC.TEXT: In October 1947, 23 countries signed for the purpose of removing tariffs and other trade barriers and encouraging free and equal international trade. Based on this agreement, 8 negotiations were held, and tariff reduction etc. of various items were decided. The World Trade Organization (WTO) was established as a permanent organization that further develops this agreement in 1995.

DOC.Title: International Military Trial
DOC.TEXT: Trial for Nazi = German and Japanese war criminals by Allies. The first international tribunal in world history that convicted war leaders and responsible offenders of atrocities by humanitarian name.

DOC.Title: Nuremberg trial
DOC.TEXT: A trial that the Allies did in order to judge the central leader of Nazi Germany. Among 22 defendants, sentences of hanging 12, life imprisonment 3, imprisonment 4, innocence of 3 persons were made.

DOC.Title: German occupation of four German countries, division management of four countries in Germany
DOC.TEXT: The military division occupation by the four countries was decided in June and August 1945, America-UK-France-Soviet Union Shikoku Agreement. Like Berlin, it was placed under the control of the four countries.

DOC.Title: non-nazy
DOC.TEXT: To dismantle the mechanisms useful for Nazi stakeholders and Nazi elongation.
