Not only the Nazi party's dismissal, prohibition of propaganda and banishment of public officials of Nazi officials, but also broad democratization in politics and education fields. It was decided by the Moscow Declaration and the Potsdam Agreement and executed severely after the war.

DOC.Title: Joint management of four countries, joint management of Austria 4 countries
DOC.TEXT: According to the agreement in July 1945, the United States, Britain, France, Soviet four countries split and managed.

DOC.Title: Paris Peace Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Conclusion of February 1947. Regulations on compensation and compensation of the territories of the five defeated countries of Italy, Romania, Bulgaria, Hungary and Finland were stipulated.

DOC.Title: Universal Declaration of Human Rights
DOC.TEXT: Adopted at the 3 rd General Assembly of the United Nations on December 10, 1948. Although it is not legally binding, it shows the norms on basic human rights and freedoms of all nations and citizens.

DOC.Title: Tokyo Trial, Far East International Military Trial
DOC.TEXT: A trial that the Allies did in order to judge the central war leaders in Japan. Among the 28 defendants, 3 people who suffered from death and disappeared. The remaining 25 people were sentenced to be hanging 7, life imprisonment 16, imprisonment sentence 2 (all but those who were death sent out are released after the peace treaty). Emperor and chief officers were not charged.

DOC.Title: Allied Forces General Headquarters, GHQ
DOC.TEXT: Based on the Potsdam Declaration, the Supreme Headquarters of the Allied Army established for the occupation of Japan. In fact the United States almost monopolized the governance. An indirect governance system was adopted that governs Japanese citizens through the Japanese government.

DOC.Title: MacArthur
DOC.TEXT: Since 1945, Japan reigned as Japan's Occupation Allied Command Army Commander. Initially promoted the non-militarization of Japan, but then shifted emphasis to the conversion of Japan into an anti-communist state. In April 1951, it was dismissed against President Truman over the Korean War.

DOC.Title: Army dissolution
DOC.TEXT: It was executed based on the Potsdam Declaration.

DOC.Title: Agricultural land reform
DOC.TEXT: One of the three major reforms by the GHQ directive that is in line with the crusade demolition and labor reform. In 1946, a law for dismantling the prewar landlord system was enacted, and a self-employed farm was founded.

DOC.Title: Zaibatsu dismantling
DOC.TEXT: One of the three major reforms of the GHQ directive. In 1946, the holding company organization committee was established, and dismantling between goods before the war was promoted.

DOC.Title: Educational Reform
DOC.TEXT: It is one of the reforms GHQ has advanced in Japan, and it was decided to put the goal of education in the development of democratic human beings. On the institutional side, so-called six, three, three, four system was adopted.

DOC.Title: Yoshida Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Cabinet with Prime Minister Shigeru Yoshida (1878-1967). The Japanese Constitution was enacted, and the San Francisco Peace Treaty · Japan-US Security Treaty was concluded.

DOC.Title: Constitution of Japan
DOC.TEXT: It was promulgated on November 3, 1946, enforced on May 3, Based on the draft GHQ, it was attached to the parliamentary deliberations during the Yoshida Cabinet period and enacted. The sovereign residents · symbolic emperor system · pacifism · punishment for fundamental human rights etc was determined.

DOC.Title: Atelie Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: The Labor Party Cabinet, established under the victory of the Atree party, won in the general election in July 1945. Domestically, we strove to nationalize important industries and enrich social welfare systems, and externally accepted India, colonization independence, accept Marshall = plan, and add to NATO.

DOC.Title: Enrichment of social welfare system
DOC.TEXT: In order to "welfare state", the national insurance law was enacted to guarantee the lives of unemployed people and sick people, and also put efforts in the construction of houses that were short in the war damage.

DOC.Title: "From cradle to grave"
DOC.TEXT: A British labor government is a slogan that aimed at enhancing the social welfare system.

DOC.Title: Important industry nationalization
DOC.TEXT: We nationalized the Bank of England and the coal industry.

DOC.Title: Churchill
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of the Conservative Party Cabinet (victorious coalition cabinet second Churchill Cabinet), which was established after victory in the general election in 1951. The foreign minister is Eden. During his tenure there was the coronation ceremony of Elizabeth II and the formation of the (new) Western European Union.

DOC.Title: Eden
DOC.TEXT: British conservative party politician. Following Churchill he became prime minister (serving 1955-57). Although it dispatched to the Suez turbulence (second Middle East war), it was driven to withdrawal and resigned taking responsibility for it.

DOC.Title: Suez dispatch
DOC.TEXT: Co-dispatched Britain went with Israel in France. I aimed at overthrowing the Nasser administration and recontrolling the Suez Canal Zone, succeeding militarily but withdrawing from international condemnation.

DOC.Title: Yale, British Commonwealth withdrawal
DOC.TEXT: During World War II, Ale penetrated neutrality without cooperating with Britain's anti-German strategy, after World War I withdrew from the British Commonwealth and renamed the Republic of Ireland.

DOC.Title: France temporary government
DOC.TEXT: In June 1944, the Free French government in London was reorganized and established in September after returning to Paris, returned to France in September, and worked on trials of war criminals, economic reconstruction, constitutional establishment, etc. In December 1945, the deputy goal of the president was nominated as head of the Constitutional Constitutional Congress but it conflicted with the Communist Party and Socialist Party who made a breakthrough in the election and resigned in January, 46.

DOC.Title: Constitution of the Fourth Republic
DOC.TEXT: Established October 1946. The human rights declaration of 1789 was reconfirmed, and then complete parity of men and women, guarantee of basic human rights, exclusion of tyranny, etc. were determined, and the parliamentary cabinet system was taken.

DOC.Title: Fourth Republicans
DOC.TEXT: Based on the Constitution of the Fourth Republic that was established in October 1946 · It was established in January the following year. Like the Third Republic, the party's state continued, the cabinet was also short-lived and weak. Colonial independence movement such as Indochina and Algeria intensified and it collapsed.

DOC.Title: French Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: Formed in 1920. He was active as a center of resistance during the Second World War. It rapidly expanded after the war, it became the first party several times and participated in the administration, but the sovereign government did not come true. After 48 years it became an opposition party.

DOC.Title: Italy, abolition of royalty
DOC.TEXT: In June 1946, the referendum was abolished by referendum and became republican, the Republic Constitution was enforced in January, 1846.

DOC.Title: Italian Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: Formed in 1921. It became the center of resistance during the Second World War, and after the war it expanded its power under Triati Secretary, becoming the largest Communist Party in Western Europe. In 1991, it was renamed to leftist Democratic Party.

DOC.Title: Italian Socialist Party
DOC.TEXT: Formed in 1892. After the war reoccurred, it coalesced with the Christian Democratic Party for a long time, but in 1983 he set up a cabinet of Socialist Party of Kraksi. Dissolved in 1994.

DOC.Title: Christian Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: Reconstructed the Italian People's Party, a Catholic party formed in 1943. Italy's largest political party, taking anti-communism line since 47 years, widely supported by conservatives from large capitalists to farmers, often in charge of the administration.

DOC.Title: People's Democracy
DOC.TEXT: Political forms of socialist countries established in Eastern Europe immediately after the Second World War. Aiming at a socialist state that does not take the form of a one-party dictatorship (to allow the existence of multiple parties). Then, as the Eastern European countries became the Soviet satellite country (subordinate country), it meant the political form of the Soviet (de facto Communist party dictatorship).

DOC.Title: Poland
DOC.TEXT: The unified government was established in 1945. 52 years Constitution of People's Republic adopted.

DOC.Title: Hungary
DOC.TEXT: 1949 issued the People's Republic of Korea Declaration.

DOC.Title: Romania
DOC.TEXT: Declaration of the People's Republic of 1947. It became a socialist republic for 65 years.

DOC.Title: Bulgaria
DOC.TEXT: 1946 issued the People's Republic of Korea Declaration. 47 years Constitution adopted.

DOC.Title: Albania
DOC.TEXT: 1946 issued the People's Republic of Korea Declaration. I confessed with the Soviet Union in 1961.

DOC.Title: Yugoslavia
DOC.TEXT: Declaration of the Federal People's Republic of 1945. It was renamed Socialist Federal Republic in 1983. Under the guidance of Tito, refused to become a satellite country of the Soviet Union, he was expelled from the Comin Form for 48 years.

DOC.Title: Tito
DOC.TEXT: Leader of Yugoslavia 's German resistance movement. In 1945 he built the People's Republic of Eastern Europe for the first time and became prime minister. By refusing Stalin domination, Cominformum was expelled in 48 years and approached the west, after 53 years became president. In the 56 years after the death of Stalin, he restored diplomatic relations with the Soviet Union, but again in the case of the Hungarian case in the same year, it restarted diplomatic relations in around 1960. He took the position of the third power from the outside and became the center of non-allied countries after 1961. Inwardly promoted its own socialist route.

DOC.Title: Commin Form, Removing Yugoslavia
DOC.TEXT: Tito, who achieved nearly independent liberation from Germany, was expelled as it strengthened the independence policy against the Soviet Union. After that, Yugoslavia made its own socialist construction and neutral diplomacy.

DOC.Title: "Cold War", Cold War
DOC.TEXT: The conflict between the US and the Soviet regime from the end of World War II to the end of World War II. It meant a severe tension that did not lead to a direct military conflict. Beginning with the confrontation of America in a military superior monopolizing nuclear weapons, the conflict became more intense as the Soviet nuclear weapons development in 1948-49 and the expansion of the socialist sphere in Eastern Europe and East Asia.

DOC.Title: "Iron Curtain"
DOC.TEXT: A figurative expression used by former Prime Minister Churchill of England in the Fulton city of the United States in 1946. The Soviet Union criticized that the "iron curtain" was dropped on the line connecting Stettin in the Baltic Sea to Trieste in the Adriatic Sea and that his sphere of influence is being built on the eastern side.

DOC.Title: Containment policy
DOC.TEXT: To prevent the spread of the Soviet Union (communist zone), the foreign policy taken by the Truman regime of the United States. Military intimidation against the Soviet Union (Communist sphere), on the other hand centered on military and economic assistance to anti-communism countries. Truman = Doctrine, Marshall Plan, North Atlantic Treaty etc as effective means.

DOC.Title: Truman = doctrine, Truman declaration
DOC.TEXT: Declaration in March 1947 that Truman aided Greece · Turkey and decided to block the communism of both countries. Since then, the American Soviet Union Containment Policy has been launched.

DOC.Title: Two worlds
DOC.TEXT: It refers to a state where the world is divided and conflicts between the capitalist camp and the socialist camp, mainly of rice and so on.

DOC.Title: Marshall
DOC.TEXT: American soldier / politician. As a special envoy to mediate China's civil war, while serving as Secretary of State (1947-49), Marshall Plan was drafted and implemented.

DOC.Title: Marshall = Plan, European Economic Recovery Assistance Plan
DOC.TEXT: US Secretary of State Marshall proposed European economic recovery plan with American economic assistance. The main purpose was to prevent European Communism. It was carried out between 1948 and 1951.

DOC.Title: European Economic Cooperation Organization, OEEC
DOC.TEXT: In order to accept Marshall = plan, 16 Western Europe countries were formed. After that, it increased member countries, developed to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in 1961 (OECD).

DOC.Title: "Peace of America", American hegemony
DOC.TEXT: From the end of the Second World War to the mid-1960s, the state had the overwhelming economic power and military power and held the initiative in the world (especially the capitalist world) order.

DOC.Title: Cominformum, Communist Party Information Bureau
DOC.TEXT: In September 1947, an information exchange organization organized by the Communist Party of the nine countries of the Soviet Union, France, Italy, Bulgaria, Romania, Hungary, Poland, Czechoslovakia, Yugoslavia against the Marshall Plan. In 48 Yugoslavia was expelled, East Germany joined in 1949, but it was dissolved in 56 years.

DOC.Title: Com com, Eastern Europe Economic Mutual Assistance Meeting, COMECON
DOC.TEXT: In 1949, the Soviet Union and the Eastern European Socialist Sixth Country organized to counter the Marshall Plan. Member countries changed such as East Germany in 1950, Mongolia in 1962, Cuba in 1972, Vietnam in 1978, Albania withdrew in 1961. It was strongly influenced by the interests of the Soviet Union and dissatisfaction of the member countries was great, but it was dissolved in September 1991.

DOC.Title: Czechoslovakia = coup d'etat
DOC.TEXT: Also called the Czech Revolution. Whether to accept Marshall = Plan or not, the police force cleared the non-Communist Party officials, and the Communist Party government was established.

DOC.Title: Western European Union Convention, the Prussian Convention
DOC.TEXT: The treaty which the United Kingdom · France and the three countries of Benelux (Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg) shocked by the Czech revolution joined. It became model of NATO later.

DOC.Title: West administrative district currency reform
DOC.TEXT: Currency reforms made by three countries in the United States, the United Kingdom, and France, in the occupied area (the area that will be the later West Germany). Because it was carried out without notice to the Soviet Union, the Soviet Union repulsed and made a blockade in Berlin.

DOC.Title: Berlin blockade
DOC.TEXT: The Soviet Union blocked traffic to West Berlin in June against the currency reform in the occupied territories of the United States, the UK and France. For this reason, the three countries in the West forced "heavy air transport operations" to bring food, fuel, etc. to West Berlin. This incident raised the tension between the East and the West extremely, and even concern about armed conflict was feared, but the Soviet Union in May 1949 released the blockade and concluded.

DOC.Title: Germany Federal Republic
DOC.TEXT: Established in May 1949. Inauguration in September. Known West Germany.

DOC.Title: Bonn
DOC.TEXT: A city on the left bank of the Rhine. It became a provisional bells capital of the Federal Republic of Germany until 1990.

DOC.Title: Christian Democratic Union
DOC.TEXT: A German party formed in 1945. It is a conservative and middle-aged party that gathered Protestant political forces as the mother of the Catholic Central Party, and was often in power after the war.

DOC.Title: Adenauer
DOC.TEXT: 1876 ​​- 1967 Party head of the Christian Democratic Union. Prime Minister of West Germany (responsible 1949-63). With the strengthening of the Cold War, we clarified the position of the Western side and achieved re-armament of West Germany, strong accession to NATO and EEC with strong leadership. As a result, unification of Germany became difficult, but economically, it achieved a rapid recovery from the defeat of the defeat ("Economic Recovery of Miracles").

DOC.Title: Economic Recovery of West Germany
DOC.TEXT: Under the Adenauer regime, West Germany gained economic recovery at a rapid rate that is said to be a miracle from the defeat of the defeat.

DOC.Title: North Atlantic Treaty Organization, NATO
DOC.TEXT: Collective security organization based on the North Atlantic Treaty signed in Washington in April 1949. The Cold War period, the largest anti-SO military alliance centering on the United States. It was founded in 12 countries including the United States, the UK, France, Italy and Canada, followed by Turkey, Greece, West Germany and Spain. In the 99 years after the end of the Cold War, Poland, Czech and Hungary, and in 2004, seven Central and Eastern European countries including the Part 3 countries, for example, joined the group and their significance was lost, and the September 11 September 2001 terrorist attacks Since then, the American solitary behavior strengthened, conflicts within the member countries are intensifying.

DOC.Title: Paris Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Signed in October 1954. The treaty where the sovereignty of West Germany has been restored. NATO accession and rearmament were also accepted, and with Italy, accession to the Western European Union Convention (Brussels Convention) was also accepted.

DOC.Title: West Germans Rearmament
DOC.TEXT: It was approved by the Paris Agreement, and in 1956, the draft system was enforced.

DOC.Title: West Germany, NATO accession
DOC.TEXT: It joined in May 1955 and became the center of NATO in Europe with France.

DOC.Title: Soviet-West German diplomatic diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: The two leaders of the Soviet Union and West Germany announced a joint declaration in Moscow and were achieved. As a result, normal diplomatic relations including the return of the prisoners of war in Germany and exchanging ambassadors were established, but the territorial problem remained unresolved.

DOC.Title: German Democratic Republic
DOC.TEXT: In October 1949, founded in the Soviet occupied territory. Eastern Germany. The capital city of Berlin. Absorbed in the Federal Republic of Germany in 1990.

DOC.Title: Socialist Unity Party, Unified Socialist Party, SED
DOC.TEXT: In 1946, the Communist Party and the Social Democratic Party jointly formed in the Soviet occupied territory, followed by a one-party dictatorship system.

DOC.Title: Austrian State Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The treaty signed in May 1955 by the United Kingdom, the United States, France and the Soviet Union. The joint management of the four countries was canceled and all Occupation Forces retreated, and Austria recovered its independence as a permanent neutral country.

DOC.Title: Warsaw Treaty Organization, Eastern European Friendship Mutual Assistance Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The East side camp's largest military alliance signed in May 1955. Eight countries of Poland, Eastern Germany, Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria, Albania, formed mainly in the Soviet Union against the rearmament of NATO and West Germany. In 68 years Albania left and was dissolved in 1991.

DOC.Title: elimination of inequality treaty
DOC.TEXT: The United States and the UK signed a new treaty against China, which is fighting against Japan. As a result of this, the extraterritoriality of most of the leased land has been eliminated and China's external legal equality has almost been realized.

DOC.Title: Chinese National Party
DOC.TEXT: In 1919 he renamed the Chinese Revolutionary Party with the guidance of Sun Yat-seng, aiming for a mass party. However, after the death of Sun Yat-sen, under the guidance of Chiang Kai-shek, it turned into a political party with the landowner · bourgeoisie as the main support base.

DOC.Title: Chinese Communist Party
DOC.TEXT: Formed in 1921. It grew through anti-Japan war.

DOC.Title: Liberation Area
DOC.TEXT: It is also called Edo area. The controlling district of the Communist Party of China. It expanded mainly in western rural areas of North China under the anti-Japanese war. At the time of Japan's defeat, it was 19 liberation areas, with a population size of approximately 95 million.

DOC.Title: Twin Agreement
DOC.TEXT: In October 1945, the agreement between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party. We agreed on domestic peace and civil war avoidance, etc. and decided to convene the political consultation meeting.

DOC.Title: National Cease-fire Fight Agreement
DOC.TEXT: The United States' special envoy Marshall mediated and the two parties agreed and it was formed, but the KMT soon abandoned it.

DOC.Title: Political Consultative Conference
DOC.TEXT: Since the ceasefire agreement was concluded through the intermediary of Marshall, the meeting of the twin agreements, representatives of the minority parties and organizations including the National and Ruling parties gathered in Chongqing and held. Adopted the "Government Code" and confirmed the foundation policy based on peace. However, as the KMT abandoned the ceasefire agreement, the civil war was resumed in July.

DOC.Title: Chinese Land Law Outline
DOC.TEXT: Land policy announced by the Chinese Communist Party in 1947. I revealed the abolition of the owner's land ownership and gained farmer's support.

DOC.Title: Civil war
DOC.TEXT: The battle between the KMT and the Communist Party occurred in November 1945 shortly after the surrender of Japan. Although the ceasefire agreement had been signed, the KMT broke it and attacked it with the support of the United States. However, because of the corrupt constitution, I lost support from the people, and then we repeatedly defeated the Communist Party's PLA.

DOC.Title: People's Liberation Army
DOC.TEXT: In March 1947, it was mainly made up of the conventional Eighth Route Army and the Fourth Army, and was made as a Communist Army.

DOC.Title: People's Political Consultative Conference
DOC.TEXT: In September 1949, in the Beijing conference held by the Communist Party with the victory close. Centered on the Communist Party, he gathered delegates from various political parties and citizens excluding Ishikari Ishiba, and served as the highest institution of the People's Republic of China until 1954.

DOC.Title: People's Republic of China
DOC.TEXT: On October 1, 1949, the Founding Declaration. The capital city is Beijing. Mao is Mao Tse. Based on the new democracy, the working class was guided, and it was regarded as a socialist country that is formed on the alliance with farmers.

DOC.Title: New democracy
DOC.TEXT: The revolutionary theory of the Chinese Communist Party advocated by Mao in 1940. At that time, China is not at a level that can realize Communism at once, it is necessary to release from imperialist forces and feudal powers first, for this purpose, while the Communist Party (working class) guides, the farmers' class and other We must cooperate with democratic forces to promote revolution and for a while it is said that pure socialist policy and the Communist party one party dictatorship should not be done. However, when succeeding in the foundation of the People's Republic of China, we tried to realize a socialist economic system and a one party party dictatorship system at a rapid rate.

DOC.Title: Mao Saoto
DOC.TEXT: Chinese Communist Party leader. President of the People's Republic of China (responsible 1949-59). In the process of the long war, he held the initiative of the Chinese Communist Party and instructed the anti-Japan war / civil war. He took over as the first president of the People's Republic of China and proceeded with the construction of socialist China, but failed to make great breakthrough policy at the end of the 1950s and gave a big sacrifice, he gave Liu Shi-oi the status of the president. After that 66 years since the Cultural Revolution, I exiled Liu Hao and others and deprived the real power. Died of disease in September 1976.

DOC.Title: Zhou Enlai
DOC.TEXT: Chinese Communist Party leader. First Prime Minister of the People 's Republic of China (responsible 1949-76). Domestically, while maintaining the position of a powerful person succumbing to Mao Zedong, he practiced flexibly from the standpoint of realism and received high evaluation. On diplomatic side he played an active part such as leading nationalism of Asia and Africa. The 1st Tiananmen Incident occurred from the rally mourning in January 1976, died of death, its death.

DOC.Title: Government of the Republic of China, National Government
DOC.TEXT: Yuzuke Ishiya who flew to Taiwan in December 1949. It depended on the anti-China policy of the United States as a result of the Korean war in June of 1950. The United Nations also occupied the position of the permanent member of the Security Council, but the representative right was granted to the People 's Republic of China in 1971, and it was expelled from the United Nations.

DOC.Title: Suzuki stone
DOC.TEXT: Since 1928 as a leader of the Chinese national government, continued fighting against the Communist Party from an anti-communist position. In the civil war that relapsed after the Second World War, he was defeated by the Communist Party and flew to Taiwan, setting up a Taiwan national government.

DOC.Title: Mutual Defense Treaty of the United States of America
DOC.TEXT: Concluded in December 1954.

DOC.Title: Approval of People's Republic of China
DOC.TEXT: It was approved by the Soviet Union, Eastern Europe and India in 1949 and the United Kingdom in 50 years. After that, the movement of approval from Western countries stopped in the progress of the East-West Cold War, but it approved by France in 1964, Canada, Italy in 1970, Japan in fact, and virtually the United States in 1972.

DOC.Title: Sino-Japanese Friendship Alliance Mutual Assistance Treaty
DOC.TEXT: In February 1950, both China and the Soviet Union considered the United States and Japan as enemy countries, and a military alliance tied in Moscow. It was dissolved in 1980.

DOC.Title: Land reform, land reform law
DOC.TEXT: Law to confiscate land from a large landowner and promote farmers' ownership of land. Land reform was realized almost nationwide by 1952.

DOC.Title: Korean War
DOC.TEXT: China supported North Korea and dispatched volunteers from October 1950.

DOC.Title: First Five-Year Plan, China First Five-Year Plan
DOC.TEXT: It was executed with the aid of the Soviet Union in 1953. Heavy industry was given priority and aggregation of agriculture was carried out rapidly, but too rapid socialization made a mess.

DOC.Title: Constitution of People's Republic of China
DOC.TEXT: In September 1954, it was adopted at the National People's Congress. I asked for the construction of a socialist society based on new democracy.

DOC.Title: Second Five-Year Plan, China's Second Five-Year Plan
DOC.TEXT: It began in 1958. An overwhelming plan called "great leap forward" was set up, but it made a big mistake and it soon went out of the way.

DOC.Title: "Great leap forward"
DOC.TEXT: Policy / slogan aiming at the rapid development of industry and agriculture, which was aimed at the second five-year plan. Mao Zedong and his radicals kept the moderate factions of Liu Shao · Deng Xiaoping and put them into practice. Natural disasters overlapped with the decline of workers and farmers' exhaustion and production motivation, resulting in a major failure. It is said that 15 million people were starved to death.

DOC.Title: People's Congress
DOC.TEXT: Established in 1958 ~ 59. An organization that integrates production activities and administrative and educational activities in rural areas. It was developed from agricultural production cooperation company and it was thought to be the basis of construction of communist society. However, productivity declined and it was dismantled in the 1980s.

DOC.Title: Cairo declaration
DOC.TEXT: Presented in December 1943. Presented at the Cairo talks of Rose Wert, Churchill and Yuusuke Stone. Korea's independence after the war was approved.

DOC.Title: North latitude 38 degree line
DOC.TEXT: In August 1945, at the conclusion of the Second World War, in Korea, the Soviet Army in the north and the US Army in the south occupied the north with a 38-degree north boundary as a temporary bell.

DOC.Title: National Foundation Preparation Committee
DOC.TEXT: In August 1945, the political organization created in various parts of Korea with the defeat of Japan. In September, he declared the establishment of the People's Republic of Korea, chaired by Lee Seung-Nam, but was forced down by the US occupation forces and dissolved.

DOC.Title: Democratic People's Republic of Korea
DOC.TEXT: People's Democratic Republic established in northern Korea in September 1948. The capital city is Pyongyang. First Prime Minister Kim Il Sung.

DOC.Title: Kim Il Sung
DOC.TEXT: First Prime Minister of the Democratic People 's Republic of Korea (responsible 1948-72). Participating in the anti-Japan war, after the founding of the country became the first prime minister, guided the Korean war which began soon after. Since 1972, he took office as chief (responsible 1972-94) and kept dictatorship status until 1994 died.

DOC.Title: Workers' Party of Korea
DOC.TEXT: Democratic political party in the DPR Korea. Inaugurated in June 1949, Kim Il Sung continues to maintain dictatorship system under the guidance of parent Kim Jong Il.

DOC.Title: Principal idea
DOC.TEXT: The slogan which Kim Il-Sung was called since the 1970s. Independence in politics, autonomy in the economy, self defense in national defense. After that, it became the theory justifying Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il's personal worship.

DOC.Title: Korea Republic
DOC.TEXT: Established in August 1948. A republic founded in southern Korea. The capital city is Seoul. The first president is Lee Seiyoun.

DOC.Title: Lee's Syngent
DOC.TEXT: A Korean politician. He advanced the independence movement overseas mainly in the United States, returned home after defeating Japan, took office as the first President of the Republic of Korea (responsible 1948 ~ 60). We promoted anticomparative political policy, but in 1960 a popular demonstration such as a student broke down.

DOC.Title: Fukubarahap, Fukudan
DOC.TEXT: Anti-guerrilla organization in the Philippines. After World War II, I was taught as an American army, but I was compassed in 1955.

DOC.Title: Philippine independence, Philippine republic independence
DOC.TEXT: Independent as the Republic of the Philippines. Taking a treaty against mutual defense against the United States in 1951, we took an antiperspray parent rail line.

DOC.Title: Five Principles of Founding Pange, Panchasila
DOC.TEXT: In June 1945, the five principles of the Indonesian state announced by Sukarno. (1) faith to the supreme god (only God), (2) nationalism, (3) humanitarianism, (4) democracy, (5) social justice, which is the basis of the Republic Constitution, even today It is regarded as the basic principle of the state.

DOC.Title: Indonesia Republic independence
DOC.TEXT: In August 1945, the Declaration of Independence was announced focusing on Sukarno, and the Republic Constitution was enacted. However, the Netherlands did not recognize independence, and a four years war of independence was developed. Independence was approved at the Hague agreement in 1949.

DOC.Title: Sukarno
DOC.TEXT: Leader of Indonesian independence movement. In 1928, he founded the Indonesian Kuomintang and was able to claim to dominate the Netherlands. During the Second World War I cooperated with the Japanese army, but after 45 years Japan surrender, I declared independence and became the first President. After that, he fought with the Netherlands, achieving complete independence for 49 years and hosting an Asia-Africa conference in 1955, he was active as a leader of non-allied countries. In the domestic, although it maintained the administration on the balance of the military and the leftist (Communist Party), it was robbed by Suharto and others in the coup in 1965 and it was lost in 1976.

DOC.Title: The Hague Agreement
DOC.TEXT: By the United Nations mediation, the Netherlands recognized Indonesian independence.

DOC.Title: Indonesia, withdrawal from the United Nations
DOC.TEXT: Major reasons for winning Malaysia's non-approved nation as non-permanent member of the UN Security Council. Although it was the first withdrawal since the establishment of the United Nations, it was a foreign policy that clarified Indonesia's anti-United Nations, anti-US and parent China routes.

DOC.Title: Vietnam Independence Alliance, Betumin
DOC.TEXT: A national unified front for Vietnam independence formed in May 1941. Ho-Chi Min-gu guided and carried out armed resistance against Japan, but after the surrender of Japan developed a struggle against independence against France.

DOC.Title: Ho Chi Minh
DOC.TEXT: First President of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam (Tenure 1945-69). In 1930, the Vietnam Communist Party formed the Vietnam Independence Alliance in 1941 and issued the Vietnam Independence Declaration for 45 years. After that he continued to lead the Indochina war and the Vietnam War and promoted construction of socialism in Vietnam.

DOC.Title: Democratic Republic of Vietnam
DOC.TEXT: In September 1945, an independent declaration was issued in Hanoi. After that the war broke out with France (Indochina war), and it reached the military boundary line north latitude 17 degrees line by the Geneva accord of 54 years. After 1965, the war with the United States intensified, but in 1937 it pursued withdrawal of the US Army, in Saito (current Ho Chi Minh City) in 1975, it collapsed and unified the North and North, renamed the following year the Vietnam Socialist Republic.

DOC.Title: Indochina war
DOC.TEXT: Immediately after the surrender of Japan, the democratic republic of Vietnam was established, but the war that occurred because France aimed for recovery of colonial rule. The liberation power fought while liberalizing farmland, receiving popular support, defeated France, a ceasefire agreement was reached at the Geneva conference.

DOC.Title: Vietnamese country
DOC.TEXT: In 1949 France was sponsored and Bao Dai became the chairman. After the Geneva Convention of 54 years it dominated South Vietnam, but in the following year Bao Dai was exiled by God = Djem and replaced with the Republic of Vietnam.

DOC.Title: Bao Dai
DOC.TEXT: The thirteenth generation of the Nguyen dynasty (ranking 1925 to 45). Withdrew after World War II, exiled to Hong Kong. It was established in France in 1949 and became Vietnamese President, but retired because the Vietnam Republic was established in 1955.

DOC.Title: Geneva Conference
DOC.TEXT: Armistice meeting of the Indochina war. The United States, the United Kingdom, the Soviet Union, France, China, Vietnamese Democratic Republic, Vietnamese Country etc participate. Armistice talks began with the collapse of Dien Bien Phu, and the Armistice Agreement was concluded.

DOC.Title: Dien Bien Fu
DOC.TEXT: A town in the basin of northwest Vietnam. Although it was the base of the French army, it fell in May, 1954, triggering a war on Indochina warfare.

DOC.Title: Geneva Armistice Agreement
DOC.TEXT: It was signed in July 1954. It was promised that the north latitude 17 degrees line was made a provisional military boundary line and the north and south unified elections will be carried out. The United States supported Vietnamese countries without this signing.

DOC.Title: 17 degree north latitude
DOC.TEXT: Provisional military demarcation line determined in the Geneva Armistice Agreement. To be precise, the Ben Hai River near the 17 degree line bounds.

DOC.Title: Vietnam Republic
DOC.TEXT: In October 1955, Prime Minister Goh-Din-Diem ignored the Geneva Armistice Agreement and was established by expelling Bao Dai. Receiving the support of the United States, refusing the North-South unified election and opposing the north, the civil war against the corruption · financial politicism occurred, and the Vietnam war broke out. It was annexed to the Democratic Republic of Vietnam in 1976 after the withdrawal of the US military in 1973.

DOC.Title: Go = Din = Diem
DOC.TEXT: First president of the Republic of Vietnam (responsible 1955-63). He dictated politics based on American aid, but was assassinated in a coup against the corruption politics.

DOC.Title: Cambodian independence
DOC.TEXT: 1953 November independence. In accordance with the monarchy socialism with Sihanouk as the prime minister, the domestic construction was promoted keeping neutrality during the Vietnam War. Sihanouk was exiled by right-wing coup by Ron-Nol in 1970 and became confused by American intervention. Communist democratic Kampuchea was established in 1976, and carried out urgent resettlement and mass genocide of urban residents to rural areas. After that the Vietnamese armies invaded, exercising influence by defeating the democratic Kampuchea, withdrew in 1989. The civil war condition continued afterwards, but the Kingdom of Cambodia was established after the 1993 New Constitution was enacted.

DOC.Title: Sihanouk, Sihanouk
DOC.TEXT: A politician from the royal family of Cambodia. I will serve as head of the King · State. After independence of Cambodia, despite the imperialist socialism, strongly appealing nationalism and trying for domestic development, the coup was caused by economic deterioration and was expelled. He returned from China as an exile in 1975 and arrived at the position of head of state, but he resigned as the political power of Democratic Kampuchea was established. In the aftermath of confusion, we repeated efforts to peace and became the king of the Kingdom of Cambodia that was established in 1993.

DOC.Title: Lao independence
DOC.TEXT: During the Second World War, the Japanese army was occupied, but in April 1946 it revived as a kingdom. The complete independence was recognized in the Geneva Convention of 54 years, but unstable political situation continued. During the Vietnam War, the invasion of the US Army was also received, but in December 1975 the People's Democratic Republic of Laos was built.

DOC.Title: Burma independence
DOC.TEXT: As the Federal Republic of Burma, it was completely independent from the British Commonwealth. The March-Wyn administration was established in the military coup d'etat March, 62, declaring socialization. Although anti-government demonstrations calling for democratization expanded in 1988, a new military regime was established in the coup d'etat, renamed the country in 1989 as Myanmar.

DOC.Title: NEWIN
DOC.TEXT: Burmese soldier / politician. Since 1962 he held power and promoted socialism. 74 to 81 years, the president. Even after the president's resignation, he continued to hold the real power, but retired in the 1988 democratization campaign.

DOC.Title: Commonwealth of Malaya
DOC.TEXT: In August 1957, independence as the dominion of the United Kingdom Commonwealth. 1963 changed the country name with Malaysia.

DOC.Title: Malaysia
DOC.TEXT: Inauguration in September 1963. Singapore · Saba · Sarawak made up the federal centered on the independent Malaya federation in 1957. Confrontation with Indonesia has intensified in Brunei border problem. Singapore was separated and became independent in August 1965.

DOC.Title: Singapore, separation / independence
DOC.TEXT: Singapore with many Chinese residents rebounded against the Malay priority policy, separated and independent from Malaysia.

DOC.Title: Indian independence law
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister Ately submitted a bill, passed by the British Parliament.

DOC.Title: Indian independence
DOC.TEXT: Separated from Pakistan as a sovereign within the United Kingdom, it became independent.

DOC.Title: Gandhi assassination
DOC.TEXT: In January 1948, Gandhi, who continued seeking harmony between Hindu and Islamic, was assassinated. The criminal was a radical Hindu of anti-Islam.

DOC.Title: Nehru, Neel
DOC.TEXT: As a leader of the National Council, he instructed the independence movement, after independence he became the first prime minister (tenure 1947-64). In the domestic policy, we implemented a large-scale land reform and a five-year plan, but it did not proceed smoothly. In the outside, he took a non-alignment policy and was noted as a mediator of the East-West conflict, and he also served as one of the anti-colonial leaders of Asia and Africa.

DOC.Title: Constitution of India
DOC.TEXT: Enforced in January 1950. We stipulated Republicans, parliament system, federal system, prohibited discrimination by caste, and decided to abolish the inhabitant system.

DOC.Title: India Republic
DOC.TEXT: Based on the release of the new Constitution, denied the allegiance to the crown (British royal family), became a republic. We have implemented a five-year plan from 1951, aiming to escape from the colonial economy.

DOC.Title: All India = Muslim Federation
DOC.TEXT: Formed in 1906. The wealthy Muslims of Muslims were central and insisted on the separation of Pakistan. Although it was a small number compared with the National Congress Party, the UK helped with the nominee of Muslim protection and promoted confrontation with the congregation.

DOC.Title: Jinner
DOC.TEXT: Initially it belonged to the National Congress, but later became the leader of the Muslim Federation, became the first governor of Pakistan (responsible 1947-48).

DOC.Title: Pakistan Republic independence
DOC.TEXT: As a self-governing body within the British Commonwealth, separated from India and became independent. It was divided into two East and West regions and it was established.

DOC.Title: Pakistan = Islamic Republic
DOC.TEXT: In March 1956, it was renamed this way according to the Constitution, but in October 1988 it became a Republic of Pakistan again in the military coup. In conflict with India, it gradually approached China.

DOC.Title: Kashmir attribution problem
DOC.TEXT: Kashmir in the northwestern part of India has become a victim of the conflict between India and Pakistan as residents are Islamic and the King is Hindus, and since October 1947, conflicts including armed conflicts have continued.

DOC.Title: Sri Lanka independence, Ceylon independence
DOC.TEXT: It became independent as a self-governing body within the British Commonwealth. In 1960 July Bandaranaike (currently responsible 1960-65, 70-77), who became the world's first female prime minister, changed the country name to Sri Lanka in 1972.

DOC.Title: Arab Federation
DOC.TEXT: In March 1945, formed in Seven countries of Egypt, Lebanon, Syria, Iraq, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Yemen with the aim of defending the sovereignty of the Arab nationals and promoting mutual cooperation. Libya, Tunisia, Morocco, Algeria, Sudan, Kuwait and others were also members. It became the center of the Arab nationalist movement and played a major role in the Palestinian issue, but weakened as the internal conflict became fierce.

DOC.Title: Palestinian division proposal
DOC.TEXT: A plan to divide Palestine into Jewish and Arab states after the end of the mandate of Britain, resolved at the United Nations General Assembly in November 1947. The Arab side refused because it was unreasonable content to give 56.6 per cent of the Palestinian land to the Jews who had only one third of the population and 6% However, the Jewish side accepted this, and established the country of Israel.

DOC.Title: Israel
DOC.TEXT: May 1948 Declaration of Founding. British mandate was over and was established by the Jews who accepted the proposed division of Palestine.

DOC.Title: Palestine
DOC.TEXT: The eastern shore of the Mediterranean. Due to British contradiction diplomacy during World War I, the Jews emigrated massively after the war and the conflict with Arabs intensified. After the Second World War, the Palestinian war broke out in the process after the end of the mandate in England. Up to now, the Middle East war broke out four times, developed into an international problem.

DOC.Title: Zionism
DOC.TEXT: An exercise to build a nation without returning to a religious hometown Zion (Masarumi in Jerusalem). It was uplifted from the first Zionist tournament in 1897 and Israel was built after the Second World War.

DOC.Title: Palestinian War, First Middle East War
DOC.TEXT: Battle between Israel who established the country based on the Palestinian division proposal and Arab countries that do not accept it. The Arab side suffered a serious defeat and Israel robbed the land beyond the proposed Palestinian division. America and the UK supported Israel.

DOC.Title: Palestinian refugees, Palestinians
DOC.TEXT: Arab people who were originally Palestinian residents but were driven out to Israel. The Palestinian Liberation Organization (PLO) was founded in 1964 because the 700 million Arabs became refugees in the Suez war (the Second Middle East War) after the Palestinian War, and the liberation struggle is developing.

DOC.Title: Korean War
DOC.TEXT: The war between the Democratic People 's Republic of Korea (North Korea) and the Republic of Korea (Korea) (but was a "hot war in the Cold War" which the USSoceries were strongly involved). In the first war, the North Korean army went to Busan, but in September 1950, it was reversed at Incheon landing of the United Nations army (virtually the US army is the main body). After that, the UN forces exceeded the north latitude line of 38 degrees and reached the Chinese border in November, but retreated due to the Chinese volunteers' participation. After 1951, the front line stuck in the vicinity of the 38 degree line and became muddy. A cease-fire fighting in July 1953 was established after a two-year cease-fighting talks. There was concern about the development of the world war, and the Cold War system was further strengthened after that. A special economy was brought to Japan, which triggered economic recovery.

DOC.Title: United Nations forces dispatch
DOC.TEXT: In June 1950, the Emergency Security Council accredited North Korea as an invader and exerted the UN forces, as the Soviet delegation absented and can not exercise veto power. This UN Force was also a US military-based army which the US Army played, both command and power (except for Army Korean soldiers), and most of the troops and weapons.

DOC.Title: Seventh Fleet, USA 7th Fleet
DOC.TEXT: A powerful fleet of America that defends the western Pacific to the Indian Ocean.

DOC.Title: MacArthur
DOC.TEXT: Southwest Pacific direction head commander during the Second World War. Then, the Japanese Commander of the Occupation Allied Army, in the Korean War it became the Supreme Commander of the UN Forces. But because of the bombing to the Chinese territory and the use of nuclear weapons to defeat the battlefield, President Truman dismissed in April 1951.

DOC.Title: People's volunteer dispatch of People's Republic of China
DOC.TEXT: Chinese People's Volunteers joined the North Korean side against the UN forces that northward and were able to be the main force. Since then, China has become a major strategic target of the United States.

DOC.Title: Korea Armistice Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Established in July 1953. After that, Korea's North-South division on the military boundary line near the 38th line was fixed.

DOC.Title: Panmunjom store
DOC.TEXT: Place where armistice talks in the Korean War were held. It is on the north latitude 38 ° line.

DOC.Title: "Rolling back policy"
DOC.TEXT: In January 1953, the policy advocated by US Secretary of State Dulles. Contents that we will conduct military confrontation against severe communism more than the "containment policy" so far.

DOC.Title: Police Reserve Corps
DOC.TEXT: In August 1950, upon the outbreak of the Korean War, it was launched under the direction of GHQ. It was renamed the 52nd Security Force, and 54th Self Defense Force.

DOC.Title: special demand
DOC.TEXT: With the outbreak of the Korean War, orders for massive amounts of war related products received from the US military. As a result, the Japanese economy that was in recession quickly recovered.

DOC.Title: San Francisco Peace Conference
DOC.TEXT: Peace conference of allied countries of Japan and 48 countries. The problem of single peace was a problem.

DOC.Title: San Francisco Peace Treaty, San Francisco Peace Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Signed in September 1951. Peace treaty of Japan to 48 countries such as the United States of America. Effective in April, 52. Japan restored sovereignty, abandoned the territorial rights of Korea, Taiwan, Sakura, and Kuril Islands, Okinawa, Amami Oshima and Ogasawara Islands were provisionally placed under the administration of the United States. China, the Soviet Union, India, Burma and other community countries were not connected.

DOC.Title: Japan-US Security Treaty
DOC.TEXT: It was signed with the San Francisco Peace Treaty. Contents that the US military stationed in Japan, keeping safety against civil war and foreign enemies. It was also expected to boost Japan's self-defense capabilities.

DOC.Title: Hua Hua Peace Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Signed in April 1952. Peace treaty between Japan and the Taiwanese National Government tied in Taipei. Confirmation of abandonment of Taiwan in Japan and abandonment of right to claim compensation against Japan in Taiwan. It has expired due to normalization of diplomatic relations between Japan and China in 1972.

DOC.Title: Japan-Soviet diplomatic recovery
DOC.TEXT: Japan's Prime Minister Hatoyama and the Prime Minister of the Soviet Union signed a joint Declaration on the end of the war.

DOC.Title: Japan-Soviet joint declaration
DOC.TEXT: The return of Siberian detainees and resumption of trade were sent out, but the problem of the Northern Territories remained unresolved.

DOC.Title: Japan's accession to the United Nations
DOC.TEXT: The diplomatic relations between Japan and the Soviet Union disappeared, and the UN General Assembly approved it in December 1956.

DOC.Title: Convention mutual defense treaty
DOC.TEXT: Anti-military treaty between the US and the Philippines, signed during the Korean War. The Philippines was incorporated as part of the American Far East anti-communist camp.

DOC.Title: US-South Korea mutual defense treaty
DOC.TEXT: Anti-military treaty between the United States of America and the Republic of Korea, tied immediately after the ceasefire of the Korean War. The Korean Army in Korea was to have command of the Korean Army.

DOC.Title: Mutual Defense Treaty of the United States of America
DOC.TEXT: The military treaty that the Yusuke Ishi administration of the United States and Taiwan joined. Containment of China was the main content. It expired in 1980.

DOC.Title: Pacific Security Treaty, ANZUS
DOC.TEXT: The collective defense treaty of Australia, New Zealand, and the United States. It acted as a anti-communism military alliance, but New Zealand actually withdrew from the country in 1986 and dismantled.

DOC.Title: Southeast Asian Convention Organization, SEATO
DOC.TEXT: Established in September 1954. The United States is the center, Anti-Communist military alliance tied in 8 countries of the UK, France, Australia, New Zealand, the Philippines, Thailand and Pakistan. It resolved in 1977 after the end of the Vietnam War.

DOC.Title: Turkey = Iraq mutual defense treaty
DOC.TEXT: Anti-military treaty between Turkey and Iraq. It will later evolve into the Baghdad Convention Organization (METO).

DOC.Title: Baghdad Convention Organization, the Middle East Treaty Organization, METO
DOC.TEXT: Anti-military alliance formed in November 1955. Iran-Pakistan joined the Turkish-Iraq mutual defense treaty concluded in February of the same year and it was formed.

DOC.Title: Central Convention Organization, CENTO
DOC.TEXT: Anti-Communist military alliance established in August 1959. It was reorganized as the Iraq Revolution occurred and the Baghdad Convention Organization (METO) collapsed. Four countries military alliance of the UK, Iran, Pakistan, Turkey. The Iran-Islamic revolution occurred in 1979 and was resolved.

DOC.Title: Warsaw Treaty Organization, Eastern European Friendship Mutual Assistance Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The largest military alliance on the east side signed in May 1955.

DOC.Title: Atomic bomb
DOC.TEXT: Weapons of mass destruction made using nuclear fission of uranium and plutonium. In July 1945, the United States succeeded in the experiment, and in August the same year, it dropped into Hiroshima and Nagasaki, causing unprecedented damage. Until the Soviet Union developed for 49 years thereafter, the monopoly of America continued.

DOC.Title: Nuclear test
DOC.TEXT: Since the United States succeeded in July 1945, the United States, Soviet Union, Britain, France, China, India and Pakistan implemented the nuclear weapons program in order to develop nuclear weapons and show off their national strength.

DOC.Title: American nuclear test
DOC.TEXT: In July 1945, we succeeded in an experiment of hydrogen bomb (hydrogen bomb) at atomic bomb (atomic bomb), November, 522.

DOC.Title: Soviet nuclear test
DOC.TEXT: In September 1949, I succeeded in the experiment of the atomic bomb, the hydrogen bomb in August 1953.

DOC.Title: British nuclear test, British nuclear possession
DOC.TEXT: In October 1952 the atomic bomb was successful in the experiment of hydrogen bombs in May of 1952.

DOC.Title: French nuclear test, French nuclear possession
DOC.TEXT: In February 1960, the atomic bomb succeeded in the hydrogen bomb experiment in June 1966.

DOC.Title: China's nuclear test, China's nuclear weapons
DOC.TEXT: In October 1964, the atomic bomb succeeded in the experiment of hydrogen bomb in June 196.

DOC.Title: India's nuclear test, nuclear possession in India
DOC.TEXT: I succeeded in the experiment of the atomic bomb in May 1974.

DOC.Title: Pakistan's nuclear test, Pakistan's nuclear weapons
DOC.TEXT: I succeeded in the experiment of the atomic bomb in May 1998.

DOC.Title: Fourth Five-Year Plan
DOC.TEXT: Heavy industry division was focused · The war damaged recovery was aimed. However, as the Cold War intensified, emphasis was placed on the munitions sector, and the reconstruction of the people's lives was delayed.

DOC.Title: Death of Stalin
DOC.TEXT: The deaths of the Soviet dictators who concentrated their mighty powers greatly shocked both inside and outside. On the other hand, there was also a facilitation of easing of East and West tensions.

DOC.Title: Soviet Communist Party 20th Convention
DOC.TEXT: The tournament held in February 1956. Khrushchev criticized Stalin, the release of political prisoners and the restoration of freedom of speech were to be carried out. At the same time, peaceful coexistence policy was announced at this competition.

DOC.Title: Criticism of Stalin
DOC.TEXT: Khrushchev made a secret report at the 20th party convention, accusing Stalin for personal worship, mass quandisation, major power and so on.

DOC.Title: Peaceful coexistence policy
DOC.TEXT: The idea that socialist countries and capitalist countries can coexist peacefully with each other. China rebelled against this idea, causing the Sino-Soviet conflict to intensify.

DOC.Title: Khrushchev
DOC.TEXT: Due to the death of Stalin, he became the first secretary of the party (responsible 1953-64), after that he served concurrently as prime minister (serving 1958-64). Initiated criticism of Stalin and a peaceful coexistence route, giving great impact to both inside and outside. The latter deepened the confrontation with China because it meant the maintenance of the world order by the United States and the Soviet Union. After that, it was lost due to the response to the Cuban crisis and the failure of economic policy.

DOC.Title: Comin Form dissolution
DOC.TEXT: It was dissolved in the stream of criticism of Stalin and relaxation of tension.

DOC.Title: "Snow Show"
DOC.TEXT: A word expressing the sense of liberation of the Soviet Union after Stalin's death, named after the title of Erenburg's novel. It was also used as a relaxation of tightening within the Communist sphere and the expression of relaxation of international tensions since the 4th big talks in 1955.

DOC.Title: Geneva 4 big talk
DOC.TEXT: Held in July 1955. President of the United States President Eisenhauer, British Prime Minister Eden, French Prime Minister Faure, Soviet Prime Minister Bruganin and the four leaders gathered and held a conference. Although it did not give concrete conclusion even in the German issue etc., it raised the mind to settle international dispute by talks.

DOC.Title: Polish anti-government anti-Soviet riot, Poznan riot
DOC.TEXT: In the city of Poznań in the western part of Borland, workers and students raised discontent with repression of living and freedom and freedom. The Polish government felt Soviet troops intervention, crushed himself and brought a lot of sacrifice, but direct intervention by the Soviet troops was avoided.

DOC.Title: Rubber Stopper, Rubber Luka
DOC.TEXT: He was engaged in labor movements before the Second World War and guided the resistance against German resistance during the Great War, but in 1951 he was arrested as a nationalist. In 56 years Poznan riot revived, promised Poland's independent line and settled the situation. Unified Workers Party First Secretary (Resigned 1956-70).

DOC.Title: Hungarian antiso riot, Hungary incident
DOC.TEXT: In Budapest, the capital city, intellectuals, students, workers, anti-Soviet anti-Government Reform Request Movement. A reformist Naji took office as new prime minister, declared withdrawal of Soviet troops, abolition of one party dictatorship, withdrawal from Warsaw Treaty Organization, but was crushed by Soviet troops. The Kadar regime was subsequently established with the help of the Soviet Union.

DOC.Title: Nagi = Imule
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of Hungary after the Second World War (occupying 1953-55). In the case of the Hungarian case in 1956, he returned to prime minister, but he died with the full intervention of the Soviet troops and was executed for reasons of treason.

DOC.Title: artificial satellite
DOC.TEXT: An artificial celestial object circling outside the atmosphere. In October 1957, the Soviet Union succeeded in launching the world's first satellite called Sputnik 1 and gave a great shock (Subutnik = Shock) to the United States. However, in January 1988 the United States also succeeded in launching.

DOC.Title: Visit to Khrushchev
DOC.TEXT: I visited the United States for the first time as the Supreme Leader and met with Eisenhauer. Both sides argued over the Berlin problem, but the spirit of cooperation between the United States and the Soviet Union was born.

DOC.Title: Camp = David
DOC.TEXT: America's President's Sanso in Maryland, USA. Khrushchev Eisenhauer, the two leaders' meeting and famous for the peace agreement between Egypt and Israel by US President Carter in 1977.

DOC.Title: U2 type aircraft case
DOC.TEXT: A case in which the U 2 type reconnaissance aircraft in the United States was shot down in the sky over the Soviet Union. The tension of rice, Sova has risen temporarily.

DOC.Title: Truman
DOC.TEXT: President of the 33rd Democratic Party (Resigned from 1945 to 53). Rose Velt suddenly deceased from the vice president, re-election in 1948. Domestically, we promoted social welfare under the name of Fairdale policy, but in the outside world we announced Truman = Doctrine and promoted anti-communism policy.

DOC.Title: Taft-Hartley method
DOC.TEXT: Act enacted in 1947, constraining labor union movement. During the New Deal, the rights of workers guaranteed by Wagner law etc. were severely restricted.

DOC.Title: McCarthyism
DOC.TEXT: In the United States under the cold war regime from 1950 to 54, "red hunting" whirlwind (1908 to 57) conducted by Senator McCarthy (1908 to 57) (all liberal officials, diplomats, soldiers, cultural men and others were all determined as communists An agitating exercise to expel it). When the world regained calmness and falsehoods of McCarthy's "evidence" disappeared and disappeared, it gradually declined. People suicide went out, and mutual distrust between people grew deep, leaving scars on American society.

DOC.Title: Eisenhauer
DOC.TEXT: United States President of the 34th (President 1953-61). He pledged to resolve the Korean War and won the Republican candidate for election. Diplomacy entrusted Dulles to conduct anti-hostile policy, which is called "reworking" against the Communist Party, but then developed diplomacy corresponding to Kurushicov's peaceful coexistence route. Domestically, we adopted a moderate conservatism policy while defending the position of large capital.

DOC.Title: Coudenhof-Careerghi
DOC.TEXT: Austrian politician. My mother is Japanese. After the First World War, we aimed for European integration by doing pan-European movement to restore peace and strength of Europe.

DOC.Title: Schumann
DOC.TEXT: French politician. During the Foreign Minister (Tenure 1950-51) era, he proposed the ECSC initiative.

DOC.Title: Schumann-plan
DOC.TEXT: Proposed by Schumann in May 1950, the establishment of the economic cooperation organization of Western countries. It became the basis of establishment of ECSC.

DOC.Title: European Coal Iron and Steel Community, ECSC
DOC.TEXT: Signed in 1951, it came into force in 52 years. We promised the complete integration and co-operation of coal and steel between the six countries of France, West Germany, Benelux 3 countries and Italy. Then develop into EEC.

DOC.Title: Rome Treaty
DOC.TEXT: In March 1957, six countries of France, West Germany, Italy, Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg signed an agreement with EEC and EURATOM.

DOC.Title: European Economic Community, EEC
DOC.TEXT: A European joint market that was established in 1985 following the signing of the Rome Treaty in 1957. Although it was limited to coal and steel at ECSC, we expanded the scope of economic integration to all products and services here. Participants in agricultural productivity faced difficulties in the differences between the countries, but developed and established the foundation for European integration. As a result of Western economic reconstruction, progress from America's domination, overwhelmed Eastern Europe. It became EC in July, 67.

DOC.Title: European Atomic Energy Community, EURATOM
DOC.TEXT: Inauguration in 1958, cooperation agency for the integration and management of nuclear resources. Participating countries are the same as ECSC, EEC and others.

DOC.Title: European Free Trade Association, EFTA
DOC.TEXT: In July 1960, the joint market of industrial products that the UK proposed to combat EEC. It was composed of seven countries together with Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Austria, Switzerland and Portugal. Integration with EC has been promoted extensively since 1984, and the current members are Switzerland, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway only.

DOC.Title: European Community, EC
DOC.TEXT: In July 1967, each of the EEC, ECSC and EURATOM board of directors and committees was established with the aim of integrating in a wider field (not only economics but also politics).

DOC.Title: Do = Goal
DOC.TEXT: During the Second World War, he set up a free French government with guidance on resistance to Germany. After the liberation of France, he arrived in the position of a temporary government prime minister in June 1944, but in opposition to the Constitution of the Fourth Republic in 46 years it fell on the ground. When Algeria's independence dispute intensified, it was expected to solve it, and the strong goal of the right wing and the military parties established the do-goal cabinet of 58 years. In September he realized the amendment of the Constitution of the Fifth Republic which strengthened the president's authority, and arrived in the position of President of October. Algerian independence approval, nuclear development, distance from the United Kingdom and the United States, and approaching China and the Soviet Union, and pursuing "the glory of France".

DOC.Title: "Glory of France"
DOC.TEXT: The slogan when Do-Goal promoted France 's unique diplomacy against the rule of the United States, Britain and the Soviet Union.

DOC.Title: Constitution of the Fifth Republic
DOC.TEXT: Constitution enacted in October 1958 by a referendum. The President 's authority was greatly strengthened, including the strengthening of the executive power of the president (including the right to appointment and dismiss prime minister and monopoly of diplomacy), the reduction of parliamentary authority, the referendum system, revision of election law favorable to the ruling party.

DOC.Title: Fifth Republic
DOC.TEXT: French political system that was established in October 1958.

DOC.Title: French nuclear possession
DOC.TEXT: In February 1960 the experiment was successful in Sahara, becoming the fourth nuclear powered country in the world.

DOC.Title: Algeria independence
DOC.TEXT: Dead-Goal approved July 1962.

DOC.Title: France approval by France
DOC.TEXT: De-goal pursuing its own diplomacy went. This collapsed a part of the containment in the United States of America.

DOC.Title: France, withdrawal from NATO military organization
DOC.TEXT: De-goal who dislikes America / British rule decided to withdraw. As a result, NATO Headquarters and Headquarters moved from Paris to Brussels.

DOC.Title: May crisis, May revolution
DOC.TEXT: A massive anti-Do-Goal regime campaign by students, workers, citizens of Paris. From university conflict to developing general strike of general union, the political crisis deepened. In December 's general election the Do-Goal faction won victory and it was totally brought back, but De-Goal' s prestige was greatly hurt and it became a factor leading to retirement in the next 69 years.

DOC.Title: Do = goal retirement
DOC.TEXT: We did a referendum to promote local autonomy and reform of the Senate, but withdrew without consent from the people, the do-goal era of ten years ended.

DOC.Title: Wilson Cabinet, First Wilson Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Labor party cabinet which was established for the first time in 13 years. He struggled to rebuild the British economy, but with difficulties in the pound crisis of 1967 and the EC accession issue, he resigned after being defeated by the Conservative Party in the general election in June 1970.

DOC.Title: Retreat from east Suez
DOC.TEXT: The Wilson Cabinet has fallen into an economic crisis. This ended the British as a colonial empire.

DOC.Title: pound devaluation
DOC.TEXT: In November 1967, the Wilson Cabinet adopted policies to improve the international balance of payments by export increase. It lowered the pound 's dollar parity by 14.3% and raised the official discount rate at the same time, but there was only a temporary effect.

DOC.Title: Government Government
DOC.TEXT: A coalition government with three parties of the Christian society alliance and the Social Democratic Party, headed by Keysinger of West Germany's Christian Democratic Union.

DOC.Title: US-Japan Security Treaty Revision
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister Kishi visited the United States in January 1960 and signed. Contents include clearly stating the duty of Japan 's defense of the United States, bringing nuclear weapons to Japan and operation of the US military from Japan beforehand in consultation with the Japanese government. It was also obliged to strengthen Japan's self-defense capabilities. On the contrary, the opposition movement intensified, President Eisenhauer 's visit to Japan was canceled, and the Kishi cabinet collapsed.

DOC.Title: High Economic Growth
DOC.TEXT: Rapid economic growth of Japan in the 1960s. The economic growth rate exceeded 10%, established a position as an economic superpower, but evils such as pollution also became serious.

DOC.Title: Third power
DOC.TEXT: In international politics, it is a power that asserted positive neutrality without giving anything to the US Soviet camp. In the latter half of the 1950s, emerging countries in Asia and Africa, primarily from India, were the center and claimed anti-colonialism and peaceful coexistence.

DOC.Title: Colombo Conference
DOC.TEXT: The summit of the five countries of Burma, India, Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Pakistan, held in Colombo, Sri Lanka. Early settlement of the Indochina war, prohibition of the use of nuclear weapons, China's accession to the United Nations, and Asia-Africa Conference held.

DOC.Title: Nehru / Zhou Enlai talks
DOC.TEXT: In a meeting held between India and China, we finally summarized the Five Principles of Peace.

DOC.Title: Peace Five Principles
DOC.TEXT: Five diplomatic principles summarized in the 1954 Neru Zhou Enlai talks. (1) Respect for territorial integrity and sovereignty, (2) mutual non-aggression, (3) internal non-interference, (4) equality and reciprocity, and (5) peaceful coexistence, affecting the ten principles of peace of the following year .

DOC.Title: Asia-Africa Conference, Bandung Conference
DOC.TEXT: First ever Asia-Africa summit meeting in Bandung, Indonesia. With the participation from 29 countries, I announced the ten principals of peace, strongly devised the philosophy of anti-colonialism · peaceful coexistence.

DOC.Title: Bandung
DOC.TEXT: Cities in Indonesia. The 1st Asia-Africa Conference venue.

DOC.Title: Peace Ten Principles
DOC.TEXT: Principles confirmed in the Asia-Africa Conference. (1) Respect for basic human rights and the UN Charter, (2) Conservation of sovereignty and territory, (3) Equality between race and state, (4) Domestic non-interference, (5) Respect for self- (7) denial of armed invasion, (8) peaceful settlement of international conflict, (9) promotion of mutual cooperation, (10) respect for justice and obligation.

DOC.Title: Non-Aligned Countries Summit
DOC.TEXT: Conference held in Belgrade, Yugoslavia, at the call of Tito Nasser Nehru in 1961. The Asian, African and Latin American leaders of 25 non-allied countries, observers from three countries participated. Peaceful coexistence, support of national liberation struggle, sweeping out foreign military bases, opposing old and new colonialism. At the tenth summit meeting held in Jakarta in 1992 after the end of the Cold War, 108 countries participated and decided to place a permanent secretariat in New York.

DOC.Title: Belgrade
DOC.TEXT: The capital city of Yugoslavia.

DOC.Title: Tito
DOC.TEXT: Yugoslav vs German resistance movement (Partisan) leader. prime minister. Lifespan from 1974 onwards. Promoted original socialistic routes, externally taken the position of the third power, active since becoming the center of non-allied countries since 1961.

DOC.Title: Third world
DOC.TEXT: It refers to the nation's advanced developed capitalist state group and the socialist state group, south developing country group. It may also mean a group of countries not belonging to both the east and west camps.

DOC.Title: Free officers
DOC.TEXT: At the end of the Second World War, Nasser formed youth officers and others, and made Nagib the headmaster. In July 1952 the Egyptian Revolution took effect, with the aim of reforming domestic feudalism and the upper part of corruption that had surfaced in the Palestinian war.

DOC.Title: Egyptian Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that the free officers, mainly Nagib and Nasser, banished the King Farouk for the purpose of renewal. The Nagiib administration was established after declaring the Republic in June 1953, but the following year Nagib was exiled and Nasser grabbed the power.

DOC.Title: Egypt Republic
DOC.TEXT: The Egyptian Revolution destroyed the Muhammad Ali Dynasty and was established in 1953.

DOC.Title: Nagif
DOC.TEXT: Egyptian soldier. As presided by Nasser and others, he became the leader of the free officer group and was the first President of the Republic of Egypt (executive director 1953-54) by carrying out the Egyptian revolution in 1952, but it fainted in 1954.

DOC.Title: Nacelle
DOC.TEXT: Egyptian soldier and politician / president. Organized a free officer group to carry out the Egyptian revolution, further exiled Nagib under the backdrop of the force of the military in 1954, took office as prime minister (responsible 1954-56). Inaugurated as president in the 56th year referendum (1956-70), the construction of Aswan = High Dam, nationalization of the Suez Canal, merger with Syria to form the Republic of the Arab Republic (Syria withdrew in 1961), Arab ethnic groups He served as the center leader of exercise. However, after a serious defeat in the Third Middle East War in 1967, he died suddenly.

DOC.Title: As One = High Dam
DOC.TEXT: A huge dam where construction was planned in Aswan upstream of the Nile in 1952. In 1956, the Suez war broke out, mainly due to the frozen US and other construction funds, but in 60 years it was constructed with funds and technical assistance from the Soviet Union, and it was completed in 70 years.

DOC.Title: Suez Canal Nationalization
DOC.TEXT: Nasser declared, against the fact that the US rejected the provision of Aswan = High Dam Construction Fund.

DOC.Title: Suez war, Second Middle East war
DOC.TEXT: Israel suddenly began to invade Egypt against the Suez Canal Nationalization Declaration, and the British and French troops started dispatching and began. However, the United Nations immediate cease-fire resolution and the Soviet Union's Egypt support statement were issued, and the invading army was forced to withdraw.

DOC.Title: Arab nationalism, Arab-nationalism
DOC.TEXT: Thoughts and exercises seeking unification of the Arab world. Rise in the 20th century, raised under the guidance of Nasser after the Suez war.

DOC.Title: Iraq Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Casshem and others abolished the royal government and established the Republic. With this, he withdrew from the Baghdad Convention Organization.

DOC.Title: Kasem
DOC.TEXT: Iraqi soldier. In 1958 he beat the royal government and also served as prime minister and general commander. It gradually became isolated within the Arab countries and was killed in the coup d'etat in 1983.

DOC.Title: Independence of Libya
DOC.TEXT: Former Italian colony. During the Second World War, the British and French Army occupied, but independence was approved at the United Nations General Assembly in 1949, and in December 1951 it became independent as the Union Kingdom. Then in September 1969 the young officers abolished the royal government and established the republic, and Gaddafi that became the center became the authoritarian regime pursuant to the development of Islam and the unification of the Arab.

DOC.Title: Independence of Sudan
DOC.TEXT: It became a republic from the UK-Egypt co-ordinance territory since 1899. A civil war in the south continued in the 1990s, a serious hunger problem occurred.

DOC.Title: Morocco independence
DOC.TEXT: French territory Morocco became independent, merged the Spanish territory Morocco etc, became the kingdom in August 1957. Constitution of constitutional monarchy was made in 1972, and several revisions were made after that. Externally, since 1975, confrontation with neighboring country Mauritania has continued over the Western Sahara problem.

DOC.Title: Tunisian independence
DOC.TEXT: It is completely independent from the French territory, declared republic by abolishing the royal government in July of 1957. In 1959 the Republic Constitution was enacted, but a bloodless coup occurred in 1987.

DOC.Title: Algerian War
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic liberation struggle from France. France acknowledged the independence of Indochina in 1954 and tried to maintain the colonial Algeria which had been investing heavily in the underground resources, but as independence struggle strengthened, it became muddy and made a great sacrifice. The De Gour regime was born in 1988 and approved independence in 1962. It became a civil war state after 1992, and many victims came out.

DOC.Title: National Liberation Front, FLN
DOC.TEXT: Algeria 's French armed resistance organization formed in November 1954. Developing guerrilla struggle, achieved independence for 62 years.

DOC.Title: Evian agreement
DOC.TEXT: France and the National Liberation Front (FLN) agreed that the ceasefire of the Algerian war was decided. A meeting began in Evian of Lake Geneva from 1961, Algeria's independence was recognized.

DOC.Title: Algeria independence
DOC.TEXT: July 1962

DOC.Title: Independence of Ghana
DOC.TEXT: As autonomy within the British Commonwealth, independence was achieved, becoming the first self-sustaining independent black nation in sub-Saharan Africa. I moved to the Republican for 60 years.

DOC.Title: excluder
DOC.TEXT: First president of Ghana (responsible 1960-66). Pan Africanist activist. Domestically, it carried out socialist policy and promoted the African Unification Movement, including holding the African People's Congress in 1958. After dictatorship, in February 1966 the military coup died and was exiled.

DOC.Title: Independence of Guinea
DOC.TEXT: It was completely independent from France by referendum and became a republic. It was a black African nation and took nationalistic lines alongside Ghana.

DOC.Title: Secure Tour
DOC.TEXT: The first President of the Republic of Guinea (responsible 1961-84), one of the radical nationalists in Africa. After the falling of Enkulma in 1966, it was active as the center of the African Unification Movement, and externally took the Sino-Soviet approach policy.

DOC.Title: "Year of Africa"​
DOC.TEXT: 17 emerging economies became independent in Africa, in 1960.

DOC.Title: Congo independence
DOC.TEXT: Independent as a republic from Belgium. The civil war broke out shortly afterwards. It was renamed the Zaire Republic in 1971 but returned to the Congo in 1997, during which time a civil war broke out.

DOC.Title: Congo disturbance
DOC.TEXT: Anti-Caucasian riots occurred throughout Congo immediately after independence, but the Belgian troops intervened, separating and independence of Katanga province, which is rich in important mineral resources, aimed at its control. The United States also intervened with the support of separatist factions, so it became a fierce civil war. In 1965, the military coup dictated the political power of the parents.

DOC.Title: State of Katanga
DOC.TEXT: The state in the southeastern part of the Democratic Republic of Congo. Treasury of important mineral resources such as uranium · cobalt · copper. Therefore, Belgium plotted independence of Katanga and made military intervention. The current state of Shaba (meaning copper for Chaba).

DOC.Title: Rumumba
DOC.TEXT: Leader of Congo independence movement. After independence, the first Prime Minister of the Republic of Congo (responsible 1960-61). It was caught by opposition faction in Congo disturbance and was killed.

DOC.Title: Nigerian independence
DOC.TEXT: Independence within British Commonwealth. Although it became a federal republic of 1963, the conflict between tribes intensified, became a civil war (1967-70), and a large number of starvation people came out. Thereafter, confusion continues, such as military coups and conflicts between Islam and Christians.

DOC.Title: Civil war in Nigeria, Biafra war
DOC.TEXT: In the eastern province of Nigeria, the Ibo group issued a declaration of independence as the Republic of Bihaula in 1967, so it came into a civil war. Warfare expanded from tribal conflicts and religious conflicts, and the Soviet Union and the UK assisted the government army side, the Biafra Army was destroyed, and disastrous circumstances such as the occurrence of many starvests continued during this period.
