DOC.Title: African countries summit meeting
DOC.TEXT: In May 1963, it was held in Asia (Di) Suabeba, the capital city of Ethiopia. The leaders of 30 countries from Africa participated and signed the African Unity Constitutional Charter.

DOC.Title: African Unity Constitutional Charter
DOC.TEXT: Signed in May 1963. Promotion of unification and solidarity of African countries, improvement of living standards, cleanup of colonialism, respect for the UN Charter.

DOC.Title: African Unification Organization, OAU
DOC.TEXT: In May 1963, under the slogan "One Africa" ​​was formed at the African Independence Nations Summit. Discussed various issues in Africa as it is also called "the UN of Africa". In 2002 African Union (AU) was substituted.

DOC.Title: African Economic Community
DOC.TEXT: In 1991, the African Unity Concept resolved to establish with the aim of economic integration in Africa. It became the basis of the African Union (AU) launched in 2002.

DOC.Title: African Union, AU
DOC.TEXT: In July 2002, in lieu of the African Unity Organization (0 AU), it was established as the world's largest regional integration organization with 53 member countries and about 800 million. It is conceived as a model of the European Union (EU), aiming at the creation of African Parliament, Court, Central Bank and issuing single currency.

DOC.Title: New colonialism
DOC.TEXT: A new type of colonialism began to stand out since the 1960s. It is to avoid substantial old political and military rule, to maintain economic control and to continue substantial control. An expression called criticized by a radical faction of a developing country against a structure in which multinational corporations in developed countries advanced into developing countries and continuing to obtain enormous profits.

DOC.Title: Multinational corporation
DOC.TEXT: A large company in a developed country that owns and operates assets in several countries. A major oil company in the United States and a large trading company in Japan are representative.

DOC.Title: Rio Agreement, the Inter-American Defense Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The collective defense treaty of the Americas led america led by the Rio de Janeiro in September 1947. We aimed to strengthen anti-communist camps and countermeasures for revolutionary movement.

DOC.Title: Organization of the Americas, OAS
DOC.TEXT: In April 1948, a cooperation organization of 21 countries in the Americas established in the Bogota Charter of the 9th Pan-America Conference. It was the foundation of the American community. Current member countries are 35.

DOC.Title: Guatemala Left regime
DOC.TEXT: A reformist government established in Guatemala. After defeating the dictatorship regime in 1944, the leftist regime was established, enacted legislation legislation and land reform. However, the U.S. fruit company repulsed, collapsed in 1954 by the anti-revolutionary power which the CIA (American Central Intelligence Agency) incited.

DOC.Title: Peron
DOC.TEXT: A politician in Argentina. President (responsible 1946-55, 73-74). He emphasized nationalism and implemented a national socialist policy with contents such as protection of workers and nationalization of important industries, etc. · In 1955, it was defeated / exiled by the right coup. After returning home in 1973, he took office as President again but suddenly the next year. Later, Vice President Mrs. Isabel became President, but he was dismissed for 76 years · Military regime was established.

DOC.Title: Batista regime
DOC.TEXT: The dictatorship of Cuba. Corruption tied with US capital, collapsed with the revolution that Castro and others made.

DOC.Title: Cuban revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that defeated the Batista regime in an armed liberation struggle guided by Castro and others. It was the first socialist in the Americas, including deepening the relationship with the Soviet Union by issuing a socialist declaration in 1961, and gave a great impact to the United States.

DOC.Title: Castro
DOC.TEXT: A Cuban revolutionary. Prime Minister (1959-2008). Arrested in 1953 armed uprising, he moved to Mexico after his release and returned to Cuba in 56 years to develop guerrilla warfare. Defeated Batista regime in January 1959, took office as Prime Minister of February. Even after that, we are striving to create socialist Cuba nation, but the economy is stagnating.

DOC.Title: Guevara
DOC.TEXT: He assisted Castro with the leadership of the Cuban revolution and became a minister after the revolution but resigned in 1965. After that he joined Bolivian guerrilla struggle and was caught and killed after the battle.

DOC.Title: America, Crossing with Cuba
DOC.TEXT: In January 1961, it was held at the end of the Eisenhau administration.

DOC.Title: Cuban Socialism Declaration
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister Castro declared in May 1961 that the Cuban revolution is a socialist revolution. It became the emergence of the first socialist republic outside the Eurasian Continent.

DOC.Title: Cuban crisis
DOC.TEXT: A case where humanity faced a crisis of nuclear warfare entirely due to the conflict between the US and the Soviet Union over Cuba. The fact that the Soviet Union tried to build a missile base in Cuba was directly triggered, the United States strongly asked for removal and the confrontation escalated. Ultimately, the Soviet Union left the crisis in response to the removal of missiles from Cuba.

DOC.Title: Bolivia Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A leftist government was established and a revolution promoting nationalistic reform such as nationalization of Tin mine. The 1964 coup occurred frequently, and since then the military government and civil affairs have been repeated.

DOC.Title: Vargas
DOC.TEXT: President of Brazil (Tenure 1930-45, 51-54). Promoting industrialization and protecting workers by establishing a dictatorship system, but it was lost in the military coup d'etat. After returning, he took nationalistic attitude and gained support from workers and citizens, but committed suicide in the pressures and economic crisis of the United States.

DOC.Title: adjustment policy
DOC.TEXT: Economic policy advanced mainly by Liu Shi-Oh and Deng Xiaoping after the breakthrough policy promoted by Mao Zedong and others caused a large number of starvests and failed. Especially agriculture recovered, succeeded in recovering to a certain extent.

DOC.Title: Liu Shao
DOC.TEXT: Chinese Communist Party leader. He is mainly active in the labor movement. In 1959 he took office as Major President on behalf of Mao Zedong but was thoroughly criticized as the supreme leader of the real power (faction) school in the Cultural Revolution, deprived of all public offices and died of prison.

DOC.Title: Tibetan revolt
DOC.TEXT: Anti-Chinese movement centering on Tibetan Buddhist priests occurred in the capital city Lhasa. Chinese People's Liberation Army crushed, but in April the Dalai-Lama exiled to India and the relationship between China and India worsened.

DOC.Title: Dalai = Rama 14th
DOC.TEXT: It exiled to India in 1959 with repression from China against Tibetan rebellion, and it has become a symbol of the Tibetan independence movement after that. Won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1989.

DOC.Title: Medium India Border Dispute
DOC.TEXT: Darai-Lama 's tightening in the border zone since Indian exile, the large battle between China and India occurred in October 1962. China ceased fighting while overwhelmingly dominated. As the border between the two countries there is McMahon = line which was decided by British intervention in 1914, but China has not recognized this and it is an unsolved problem.

DOC.Title: Medium-S argument, Sino-Soviet conflict
DOC.TEXT: The conflict between China and the Soviet Union concerning the socialist revolutionary method and how to advance national liberation fighting. In 1956, Khrushchev criticized Stalin, the opposition of China to the fact that Criticism of Stalin and the peaceful coexistence route with the US side were brought back, the beginning of confrontation. The Soviet Union's discontinuation of technical assistance, Khrushchev's approach to the United States, Soviet Union's assistance to India in India during the Sino-Indian border conflict, etc. deepened the conflict. After the Cuban crisis of 1962, it developed into a controversial dispute, after the Cultural Revolution of China, the Soviet Union condemned China as a doctrinal principle and China as a revisionist, and in 1969, a major border conflict broke out There were a lot of casualties coming out. It was relaxed somewhat from around 1980 and conflict was over at Gorbachev in 1989.

DOC.Title: Discard of Sino-Soviet technical agreement
DOC.TEXT: The Soviet Union unilaterally notified, and the Soviet engineers came back to Japan in July of the following year, and the supply of materials ceased, so the Chinese economy was hit hard.

DOC.Title: Sino-Soviet border dispute
DOC.TEXT: Along with the intensification of the Sino-Soviet conflict, it began in the 1960s. In the collision at Jinjojima (Damanski Island) in March 1999, numerous casualties came out on both sides, and the Soviet Union became a violent confrontation to mention the use of nuclear weapons.

DOC.Title: Jindo Island, Damanski Island
DOC.TEXT: Sino-Soviet collision place in March 1969. It is an island in the Usry river, became a Chinese territory by the Sino-Sova negotiations in 1988.

DOC.Title: Proletarian Cultural Revolution, Cultural Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Power struggle developed in the form of cultural struggle / ideological conflict in China in the early 1966s-70s. Mao Zedong who was losing power due to failure of great breakthrough policy, criticized Liu Odori · Deng Xiaoping who was in the center of power at that time as "the real power", "the mobilization school" etc., mobilize the red guards and mobilize the mass movement It began to rise up, to recover the power. Later on, People's Liberation Army joined, Mao Zedong and others became dominant, armed struggle and persecution against politicians and bureaucrats leading to Liu Shi-Oh and Deng Xiaoping were spread all over the country. Mao's recovery of power succeeded but political, economic and social domestic politics, economy and society got into great confusion. After that, the Cultural Revolution headed for the end, but four people appeared, in an effort to continue the Cultural Revolution, trying to grasp the real power, suppressed opponents. After the death of Mao Zedong in 1976, the four people were arrested, the real power shifted to Deng Xiaoping, the Cultural Revolution completely ended.

DOC.Title: real right school
DOC.TEXT: Within the Communist Party of China, meaning "those who will revive capitalism", the name Mao Zedo gave to Liu Shao · Deng Xiaoping. The ministry is an alias.

DOC.Title: Red Guard
DOC.TEXT: In 1966, an organization created mainly by students. Because Mao Zedo supported its activity as "rebellious rational" (reasonable for contrition), he became a scout of the Cultural Revolution and fought a violent struggle throughout the country. However, as the confusion spread to society as a result of armed struggles among red guards, members of the Red Guards were driven to rural areas and remote areas under the name of "Shitara", and it ended.

DOC.Title: Lin Biao
DOC.TEXT: Chinese soldier. Defense minister. Created the Red Army with Mao Zedong, he also played an active part in long wars, anti-Japanese warfare, Korean war and so on. Actively promoted the Cultural Revolution and was nominated as the successor of Mao Zedong in the nine general meeting. But in 1971, failed to assassinate Mao Tse Tong, failed, crashed and died on the way to the Soviet Union (there are still many unknown things about the truth about death).

DOC.Title: Four People
DOC.TEXT: In the Cultural Revolutionary Period, a group that held power with the authority of Mao Zedong. Including Jiang which was Mao's wife.

DOC.Title: Kaigo
DOC.TEXT: A woman who was an actress and became the third wife of Mao Zedong. In the Cultural Revolutionary Period, he took power as one of the four players, but he fainted and was sentenced to death. Afterwards it was sentenced to life imprisonment, committed suicide during bail on illness.

DOC.Title: Deng Xiaoping
DOC.TEXT: Chinese Communist Party leader. He joined the Communist Party of China in 1924, and served as a key post. In the Cultural Revolutionary Period, when criticized with Liu Shao, he was dismissed, and after that he repeatedly resurrected and lost his feet, but he revived immediately after the collapse of the four players and became the greatest player. We have implemented realistic policies such as "four modernization" policies and economic liberalization policies.

DOC.Title: Vietnam Republic
DOC.TEXT: Republic that was in the southern part of Vietnam between 1955 and 1975. A state that established God-Ding-Jim, who was assisted by the United States, to expel Bao Dai and became prime minister. Refusing the South-North unified election stipulated by the Geneva Armistice Agreement, it fought against the north (Democratic Republic of Vietnam), but a civil war broke out in corrupt politics and entered the Vietnam War. After the withdrawal of the US military in 1973, it was annexed to the Vietnamese Democratic Republic in 1976 and became a Vietnamese socialist Republic.

DOC.Title: Go = Din = Diem
DOC.TEXT: First president of the Republic of Vietnam (responsible 1955-63). Although we did dictatorship with American aid, the civil war broke out and was assassinated in the coup.

DOC.Title: South Vietnam Liberation National Front Line
DOC.TEXT: Formed in December 1960. An organization formed to overthrow the interference of America and to overthrow the corrupt parent's Go-Din-Jim administration. Communists, nationalists, Buddhists, Catholics, etc., made up of various powers.

DOC.Title: South Vietnam = coup d'etat
DOC.TEXT: Between November 1963 and June 1965, the coup d'etat 13 times, the cabinet change 9 times, the unstable political situation continued.

DOC.Title: Tonkin Gulf incident
DOC.TEXT: An incident reported that an American destroyer was attacked by a North Vietnam torpedo boat. For this reason, the US Air Force bombed retaliating North Vietnam on 4th and it triggered the full intervention of the Vietnam War in the United States. It turned out later that it was an American upscale incident.

DOC.Title: North Vietnam Bombing, North Bomb
DOC.TEXT: After the Tonkin Gulf incident, he called the North Vietnam to stop providing support to the liberation national fight, and began a massive bombing to the north. At the same time, a large number of U.S. ground troops were dispatched to the South Vietnam area, and the war was expanded throughout Vietnam.

DOC.Title: Vietnam War
DOC.TEXT: The war started with the intervention of the United States in the civil war between the South Vietnamese army and the South Vietnamese liberation fight line. Since the 1965 Northern Bombings, the US military expanded the scale of the intervention, dispatched 530,000 troops during the peak period, repeated the large-scale ground warfare and air strikes using the latest weapons, but the Soviet Union The violent resistance of the northern Vietnam and the South Vietnamese liberation fight, which was supported by the war, became muddy. After that the United States faced into difficulties due to the anti-war movement both inside and outside the country, expanding the budget deficit etc. In 1968, it was forced to face a peace talks. The war further expanded to Laos and Cambodia, but the US signed a Paris agreement in 1973 and retreated. Saigon (now Ho Chi Minh City) in South Vietnam has fallen due to the battle of the Liberation Ethnic Front in 1975, and the North and Vietnam reunification following North Vietnam was successful the following year.

DOC.Title: Vietnam anti-war movement
DOC.TEXT: Movement against the intervention of the United States in the Vietnam War. Not only in the United States, it has been intensely deployed from various standpoints in Europe, Japan and others. As a result, America was isolated internationally.

DOC.Title: Paris peace talks
DOC.TEXT: Meeting for Peace in Vietnam. In March 1968, American President Johnson was launched with a statement of partial stoppage of the North bomb. Later in October, following the Stop of North American Explosive Surface Statement in the United States, the Liberation Front · South Vietnam participated in November and it became Paris Expansion Peace Conference. The war has expanded in Cambodia in 70 years, and the North bomb was resumed in 1971, but the peace agreement was concluded in 1973.

DOC.Title: Vietnam peace agreement, Paris peace agreement
DOC.TEXT: Signed in January 1973. Agreement that realized the withdrawal of US military from Vietnam. However, the battle between the South Vietnamese government and the North Vietnam Liberation Front was continued.

DOC.Title: US withdrawal of Vietnam
DOC.TEXT: Withdraw from the Vietnam peace agreement. After that we sent weapons to the Vietnam Republic in the south and continued to support.

DOC.Title: Saigon capture
DOC.TEXT: Because the southern Vietnamese government was destroyed by the rampage of the South Vietnam liberation national front, the war of 30 years since the Indochina war ended.

DOC.Title: Vietnam Socialist Republic
DOC.TEXT: The name of the state that was established in July 1976 after the end of the Vietnam War. In April 1974, the unification election was held in the North and North Korea in July, declaring the reunification of the North and the North at the unified Diet, and the new Constitution based on the Constitution of North Vietnam was enacted. Hanoi capital.

DOC.Title: Democratic Kampucia, Democratic Cambodia
DOC.TEXT: A new state that was established after the overthrow of the Ron-Nol government. The head of state and the president are Sihanouk. In April 1976, Sihanouk resigned as head of state because the Communist Pol Pot faction advanced in the election of the People's Congressmen.

DOC.Title: Pol Pot administration
DOC.TEXT: The regime of the democratic Kampucia established in April 1976. In response to the construction of an extremely communist society based on rural areas, mass forced resettlement and urban genocide of urban residents to rural areas were carried out. Outwardly, it adopted the policy of the parent China and conflicted with Vietnam and Laos. In 79, collapsed in the attacks of Vietnamese Army and Hen-Samlin Army.

DOC.Title: Red Khmer, Khmer-Rouge
DOC.TEXT: Political forces centered on the Cambodian Communist Party rebuilt in 1960 as a leader of Pol Pot.

DOC.Title: Lao Patriotic Front, Patho-Rao
DOC.TEXT: Liaos leftist group formed in 1945. The Lao People's Revolutionary Party held the initiative behind the scenes. While fighting the invading American forces during the Vietnam War, we promoted liberation of farmers and established the Government of Lao People's Union after withdrawing from the US military. Furthermore, in December 1975 the King was abolished and renamed the Lao People's Democratic Republic.

DOC.Title: Laos People's Democratic Republic
DOC.TEXT: In December 1975, abolished the royal government at the National People's Congress. Virtually the dictatorship of the People's Revolutionary Party (Communist Party) is being held.

DOC.Title: Development dictatorship
DOC.TEXT: Since the mid-1960s, a dictatorship system that was justified on the grounds that it promotes economic development efficiently. It appeared in Asia and Latin America.

DOC.Title: Zhang Shu cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Although it was established after the exile of Lee Seihong 4, it collapsed at the military coup.

DOC.Title: Korean military coup
DOC.TEXT: A case where a military young officer centered on Park Geun-hye overwhelmed Zhang Shu cabinet and grabbed the administration.

DOC.Title: Park Ji-hee
DOC.TEXT: Korean soldier. After graduating from the Japanese military academy school, he instructed the coup d'etat in 1961 and grasped the military and government. It became acting president for 62 years, shifted to civil affairs in 1983, assumed office as President. In order to deepen relations with Japan and the United States under the Cold War system, we concluded 65 years Japan-Korea basic treaty, dispatched to the Vietnam War, and made economic growth by introducing foreign capital etc. While maintaining dictatorship for a long time with severe repression against opponents, the corruption of the administration, the expansion of the gap between rich and poor progressed, and was assassinated by the aide in 1979.

DOC.Title: Japan-Korea Basic Treaty
DOC.TEXT: It signed in June 1965, it became effective in December. Convention for normalizing diplomatic relations between Japan and Korea. It invalidated the treaty on Korea consolidation in 1910 and accredited the Korean government as the sole government of the Korean Peninsula. It was also decided to provide economic assistance of 300 million dollars for free from Japan and 200 million dollars in compensation.

DOC.Title: Marcos
DOC.TEXT: President of the Philippines (Tenure 1965-86). Dictatorship in corruption progressed while maintaining long-term administration. After the assassination of the political league in 1983, the anti-Marcos movement increased, exiled to Hawai in the coup in 1986.

DOC.Title: Lee = Kuan Yew
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister Singapore (responsible 1965-90). He succeeded in economic development with strong leadership and continues to exercise its influence even after he retired from the prime minister.

DOC.Title: Mahathir
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of Malaysia (Resigned from 1981 to 2003). In keeping with the look-east policy learned from the economic development of Japan, it promoted its own economic development policy and maintained the long-term administration.

DOC.Title: NEWIN
DOC.TEXT: Burmese military, politician, president (responsible 1974-81). In the 1% 2 year coup d'etat, he took power and promoted closed Burmese-style socialism. Even after the president's resignation, he continued to hold the real power, but retired in 1988.

DOC.Title: Nasakom, NASAKOM
DOC.TEXT: Unified front that Soekarno advocated from around 1960. NAS is a Nationalist party and nationalist organization, A is religion (Agama) and Islamist groups, KOM represents the Communist Party. The ministerial class also consisted of three members, Soekarno held power over the balance of them. Eventually the Communist party forces expanded, but the Communist Party was destroyed at the 9 / 30th incident in 1965, and Nasakom collapsed.

DOC.Title: Nine and Three Cases, Military Coup Set
DOC.TEXT: A case in which the right wing overtook the uprising of the left wing of the military and then leftist groups were destroyed afterwards. The Indonesian Communist Party, the largest of the nonsocialist countries, counting 2 million members, was destroyed, the March and 1966 military and right wing held power and Sukarno fainted.

DOC.Title: Indonesia, returning to the United Nations
DOC.TEXT: In January 1965, despite leaving the United Nations under the Soekarno regime, Suharto, who gained power by the military coup d'état, switched to an anti-communist route and returned to the United Nations in September 1966.

DOC.Title: Suharto
DOC.TEXT: Soldier of Indonesia. He took over the nine and thirty incidents in 1965, held the real power, appointed president in 1968. We took an antipersonant parent rail line, introduced Western capital, and proactively promoted economic development. However, he was criticized for the expansion of the gap between rich and poor, monopoly of the interests of the Suharto family, and resigned from the president in 1998.

DOC.Title: Association of Southeast Asian Nations, ASEAN
DOC.TEXT: An organization formed in August 1967 in Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, Philippines, Thailand. Initially, the colors of anti-communism military alliances were strong, but since 1971 it has shifted to a political and economic cooperation mechanism. Brunei in 1984, Vietnam in 1995, Myanmar · Laos in 1997, Cambodia in 1999.

DOC.Title: Iranian oil nationalization
DOC.TEXT: Mosadeg, a radical nationalist who came to power and became Prime Minister, took over Anglo-Iranian oil company and took action to nationalize the oil. However, it was shut out from the international oil market, resulting in financial difficulties due to a drastic decrease in oil production. After that, the Mosadeg regime collapsed in the coup d'etat in 1953, and the nationalization also failed.

DOC.Title: Mosadeg
DOC.TEXT: Iran 's nationalist politician. As prime minister (tenure 1951-53), he took the nationalization of oil, but in 1953 he died in the coup d'etat.

DOC.Title: Pufflevy II
DOC.TEXT: King Iran (ranking 1941-79). He drafted a modernization policy called "white revolution" dictately and realized high economic growth, but revolutionized by the expansion of the gap between rich and poor and repression against Islamic forces, was driven to exile.

DOC.Title: White Revolution
DOC.TEXT: Modernization policy from the top by King Pafévy II. Throwing economic assistance from the United States and tremendous oil revenue, forcing the military and the capital to modernize. However, contradictions of society, such as expansion of the gap between rich and poor, intensified, anti-king movement spread.

DOC.Title: Arab Republic
DOC.TEXT: A nation that was formed by integrating Egypt and Syria in February 1958. President Nasser. Syria repulsed and withdrew from Egypt led integrated promotion in 1961, and it was resolved.

DOC.Title: Kennedy
DOC.TEXT: The 35 th president (serving 1961-63). Democratic Party. He was the first Catholic president of the United States to win the president the youngest. With the slogan "New Frontier", it appealed actively to solve poverty, racial discrimination, urban problems, educational problems, etc. and appeared spectacularly. We made the world tense with the East-West confrontation such as the Cuban crisis and the Berlin crisis, but after that we tried to coexist with the Soviet Union, such as concluding a partial nuclear test stop treaty. It was assassinated in November 1963.

DOC.Title: New frontier policy
DOC.TEXT: The slogan for Kennedy's presidential candidacy. I regarded the United States as a "new frontier", appealed to the American people to build a new US with the spirit of pride and self-sacrifice, promoted economic growth, construction of highways and houses, educational reforms.

DOC.Title: Alliance for progress
DOC.TEXT: In 1961 Kennedy proposed to the Latin American countries anti-communist alliance draft for Cuba containment. There was not much achievement.

DOC.Title: Cuban crisis
DOC.TEXT: October 1962

DOC.Title: Direct communication agreement, hot line agreement
DOC.TEXT: A direct telephone line between the US and Soviet leaders. From the reflection on the Cuban crisis, we made it possible to consult immediately as soon as an emergency occurs in both countries.

DOC.Title: Partial nuclear test termination treaty
DOC.TEXT: Treaty prohibiting nuclear weapons experiments in the atmosphere, in space and in water except underground experiments. France and China did not participate because of the aspect of maintaining the nuclear monopoly system of the United States, the United Kingdom, and the Soviet Union, and it became ineffective.

DOC.Title: Assassination of Kennedy
DOC.TEXT: Dallas city in Texas was shot dead while in a story. Official survey report was Oswald's single crime, but Oswald was assassinated immediately after arrest, many contradictions remain in the research report itself, the truth is many unknown points.

DOC.Title: Johnson
DOC.TEXT: President of the 36th US Presidency (1963-69). Democratic Party. Promoted from vice president Kennedy assassination, election in 1964 election. On the domestic side, we could have built a "great society" but deepened the intervention in the Vietnam war and led the American economy and society to disorder and decline.

DOC.Title: "Great society" plan
DOC.TEXT: In a plan announced by Johnson in 1965, it came to lift discrimination and poverty from the United States. Although it gave certain results such as the establishment of the Civil Rights Act, large-scale intervention into the Vietnam War caused a financial crisis and ended in failure.

DOC.Title: Black Liberation Movement, Civil Rights Movement
DOC.TEXT: An exercise to eliminate discrimination against black people who continued after the Civil War in America. As the Vietnam War became muddy, as discrimination against black people became deeper, discrimination against black people strengthened, and it strengthened with anti-war peace movement.

DOC.Title: Civil Rights Act
DOC.TEXT: Established July 1964. Law to eliminate discrimination against various (especially blacks). Extensive content that prohibits discrimination by race, religion, sex, country of origin, etc. was included. In reality, however, the black liberation movement continued because discrimination (especially against blacks) was not sufficiently resolved.

DOC.Title: King Pastor
DOC.TEXT: Leader of the Black Liberation Movement. As a leader of the Southern Christian Leaders' Conference (SCLC), promoted the movement to eliminate racial discrimination from the standpoint of nonviolentism. In April 1968 he was assassinated while developing a "march of the poor" towards Washington.

DOC.Title: Vietnam intervention
DOC.TEXT: It began full-fledged since the start of the bombing of the North.

DOC.Title: Vietnam anti-war movement
DOC.TEXT: Anti-war campaign globally enhanced as the Vietnam War expanded, as victims increased to Vietnamese and drafted American youth. In the United States, it was linked to the civil rights movement aiming to abolish racial discrimination, it expanded to Europe and Japan, and it became a great force to form a worldwide public opinion seeking withdrawal from the US military Vietnam.

DOC.Title: Nixon
DOC.TEXT: President of the 37th American Republican from Texas (1969-74). In a serious dollar crisis, Nixon-Doctrine (a policy to refrain from excessive overseas intervention in the US like before) was announced. We realized our visit in 1972, improved US-China relations, and concluded Vietnam peace agreement in 1973. However, due to the Watergate incident, he was forced to resign in 1974.

DOC.Title: Dollar = shock, dollar crisis
DOC.TEXT: A sharp decline in the value of the dollar, which advanced rapidly at the exchange suspension announcement of gold and dollars in 1971 (Nixon-shock). Although the US balance of payments continued to keep the deficit since 1988, it has expanded further due to the increase in military expenditure during the Vietnam War, and it is an American currency, while at the same time an international key currency (the currency used in international trade etc.) But the credit of the dollar there fell sharply. As a result, the adoption of the gold dual price system in 1968, the collapse of the gold dollar standard system at the announcement of the gold dollar exchange suspension in 1971, the value of the doll declined steadily by 1973, It shifted to the system.

DOC.Title: Kissinger
DOC.TEXT: International political scientist. politician. In 1969, he became a national security adviser for President Nixon and appointed Secretary of State in 1979 (~ 77). He visited the country in 1971 and played a major role in improving US-China relations, he demonstrated his diplomatic skills.

DOC.Title: Nixon's visit
DOC.TEXT: In February 1972, US President Nixon visited China, which had been hostile to the past, and announced the US-China Joint Statement. It became the de facto China approval of the United States.

DOC.Title: Vietnam withdrawal
DOC.TEXT: The Vietnam Peace Agreement was signed and by the end of March the US retreated from Vietnam.

DOC.Title: Watergate Incident
DOC.TEXT: In the presidential election in June 1972, Nixon instructed the establishment of eavesdropping instruments at the office of the political opponent Democratic Party. It was discovered in 1973 and became the cause of the resignation of the president in 1974.

DOC.Title: Nickson resigns
DOC.TEXT: Losing support in the Watergate case, the impeachment in the House has also decided routinely.

DOC.Title: Khrushchev dismissal, Khrushchev lost leg
DOC.TEXT: It was suddenly dismissed at the Central Committee Executive Committee due to domestic affairs, especially agricultural failures and individual experts. The stumbling block in the foreign policy such as the Cuban crisis and Sino-Soviet confrontation was also in the background of dismissal.

DOC.Title: Brezhnev
DOC.TEXT: Communist leader of the Soviet Union. He became the center of the dismissal of Khrushchev, became the first leader of the Soviet Communist Party since October 1964, became the highest leader of the party, and concurrently served as the chief executive of the highest conference in 1977 and held absolute power. It increased international tension by invading Afghanistan and expanding arms and led the Soviet economy to bankruptcy.

DOC.Title: Kosuigin
DOC.TEXT: After the collapse of Khrushchev, he became prime minister (responsible 1964-80). As an economic bureaucrat, he assisted Brezhnev to promote economic reform but resigned from illness.

DOC.Title: Berlin Wall
DOC.TEXT: The wall that the East German government created to block West Berlin in August 1961. Building around West Berlin due to the increase in exiles from the East Germany. By the time it was opened in 1989, there was a tragedy that nearly 200 casualties (about 3000 arrested) came out to overcome this.

DOC.Title: Albania's Self-opposition Diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: Foreign policy started with Albania closing diplomatic relations with the Soviet Union at the opportunity of the Soviet Union reconciliation with Yugoslavia in 1955, which was in conflict with Yugoslavia. In the Sino-controversy, Albania also stood for the Chinese side.

DOC.Title: Albania's Self-Assassination
DOC.TEXT: In October 1961, Rubania endorsed China in the Sino-Japanese controversy and was disconnected from the Soviet Union in December.

DOC.Title: Romania's Self-opposition Diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: Since 1965, the foreign policy of Romania advanced by Causuchek who held power. Contents were separated from the rule of the Soviet Union and aimed at restoring relations with western European countries, so it was evaluated by the western camp.

DOC.Title: Criticism of the Soviet Union in Romania
DOC.TEXT: Ceauşesk took the independence and was critical of the Soviet Priority Komekon and the Warsaw Pact Treaty Organization from about 1962 and did not participate in the Czech intervention in 1968. It was behind the fact that he was trying to overcome the underground resources of Eastern Europe, particularly oil, and to make the economy self-sustaining.

DOC.Title: Democratization movement of Czechoslovakia
DOC.TEXT: From January 1968, the liberalization campaign spread explosively in Eastern Europe's largest industrialized country Czechoslovakia. President Noveotney has lost, Dopchek's administration came into being, and liberalization and democratization were promoted. In August, however, the Soviet Union and Eastern European five countries militarily intervened, the liberalization movement was crushed.

DOC.Title: "Prague Spring"
DOC.TEXT: The name of the term of the democratization movement in 1968.

DOC.Title: Dopsek
DOC.TEXT: Politician of Czechoslovakia. In January 1968 he became the first secretary of the Czechoslovakia Communist Party and instructed the democratization campaign, but he was taken to the Soviet Union in August and was dismissed after returning to the country. In December 1989 the Federal Council chairman came back.

DOC.Title: Czechoslovakian military intervention in the Soviet Union
DOC.TEXT: The Soviet Union, Eastern Germany, Poland, Hungary, Bulgaria, the five national army invaded to prevent liberalization, occupied the whole land, and brought leaders of Doppchek to the Soviet Union. The Czechoslovak citizen expanded against the resistance against the opposition but eventually succumbed and the democratization Yukari route failed.

DOC.Title: Brezhnev-Doctrine
DOC.TEXT: The diplomatic policy Brezhnev fulfilled to justify the military intervention in Czechoslovakia in 1968. It is also called restriction sovereign theory. He said that the "benefits of the whole socialist countries will take precedence over the individual interests of each country" and that the Soviet Union has the right of internal affairs against socialist countries that are about to leave the socialist region.

DOC.Title: Sakharov
DOC.TEXT: An atomic physicist. He served as a Soviet anti-system intellectual, and received the 1975 Nobel Peace Prize. Although it was kept under arrest afterwards, it was released by the Gorbachev regime in 1986 and died of illness immediately after starting a new activity.

DOC.Title: Polish anti-government movement
DOC.TEXT: Movement that workers repulsed to announce unilaterally raising prices of necessities for daily necessities by the government. Hundreds of casualties came out due to conflict with security forces, and the rubber Uka administration collapsed.

DOC.Title: Dollar = shock, dollar crisis
DOC.TEXT: After the announcement of the exchange of dollars and gold by US President Nixon in August 1971 (Nixon-Shock), the dramatic decline in the value of the dollar advanced and a great impact on the world economy ran.

DOC.Title: Bretton-Woods regime collapsed
DOC.TEXT: Since the suspension of the exchange of US dollar with gold in 1971, the decline in the value of the US dollar became apparent, maintaining the fixed exchange rate system became difficult, and the major countries moved to the floating exchange rate system by the spring of 1971 It collapsed.

DOC.Title: floating exchange rate system
DOC.TEXT: A system that entrusts the exchange rate to the transaction of the market which has been done since 1973.

DOC.Title: Fourth Middle East War
DOC.TEXT: Both Egypt and Syrian army stormed the Israeli army and battled with the Sinai Peninsula and the Golan Heights. Moreover, although the Israeli victory ended, an oil crisis occurred around the world because the Arab side implemented the oil strategy.

DOC.Title: Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, OPEC
DOC.TEXT: In 1960, a major consulting body formed by the major oil-producing countries to counter the United States and British international petroleum capital. It was a kind of cartel that agreed on the production and price of crude oil.

DOC.Title: Arab Petroleum Exporting Country Organization, OAPEC
DOC.TEXT: A consultative body formed by Arab countries within the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries 1968. During the fourth Middle East war, the oil strategy was invoked, attracting world attention by causing oil crisis.

DOC.Title: Oil strategy
DOC.TEXT: Measures such as oil embargo on parent Israel, reduction in oil and increase in crude oil price, which was implemented by 0APEC in 1973 as a result of the fourth Middle East war. He hit the world economy, mainly developed countries.

DOC.Title: Oil crisis, primary oil = shock
DOC.TEXT: Global economic turmoil triggered by the 0 APEC oil strategy in the 4th Middle East War. As a result, the world economy suffered a serious recession.

DOC.Title: Stagflation
DOC.TEXT: Economic phenomenon in which inflation (price increase) occurs in a serious economic downturn. After the oil crisis, it hit the world economy.

DOC.Title: Second Oil Crisis
DOC.TEXT: In 1979 oil prices sharply increased with the Iran-Islamic revolution triggered, resulting in global economic turmoil.

DOC.Title: United Nations Special Resource General Assembly
DOC.TEXT: General Assembly adopted the "Declaration on Establishment of New International Economic Order" reflecting the intention of the undeveloped countries of Asia and Africa in 1974. Following the occurrence of the oil crisis, the "resource nationalism" of the developing countries was strongly listed on the table.

DOC.Title: New International Economic Order Establishment Declaration, NIE 0 Declaration of Establishment
DOC.TEXT: Declaration adopted at the United Nations General Assembly in 1974. Natural resources in the developing countries in the south have reviewed the past international economic order that has been advantageously used by developed nations in the north and urged the construction of an economic order that reflects the interests of developing countries.

DOC.Title: Resource nationalism
DOC.TEXT: The idea that developing countries, which became manifested in the 1970s, should be used to improve the domestic economy, aiming for the usefulness of their resources. Background was the backlash from developing countries against the current situation that the resources of developing countries are used too cheaply for developed countries and wealth is not accumulated in developing countries.

DOC.Title: Bikini Hydrogen Bomb Experiment
DOC.TEXT: Nuclear test carried out by the US at the Atoll Bikini of the Middle Pacific Marshall Islands. Since 1946, since the atomic bomb, after 54 years I continued the hydrogen bomb test, so the surrounding residents bomb victims of "ashes of death".

DOC.Title: "Ashes of Death"
DOC.TEXT: Radioactive substance generated by nuclear test. Since the atomic bombing of the Fifth Fukuraku-maru by a hydrogen bomb test on the Bikini Atoll, its danger has been generally recognized.

DOC.Title: Fifth Fukuryura Maru incident
DOC.TEXT: A case in which a Japanese fishing boat Fifth Fukuryu Maru was exposed in a bikini bomb experiment and the crew was killed or injured. It became a trigger to increase movement to ban atomic bomb.

DOC.Title: Russell · Einstein declaration
DOC.TEXT: A philosopher Russell and a physicist Einstein declared the danger of nuclear weapons and nuclear war in the name of human beings, science and intelligence. It exercised a great influence on the A / H bomb prohibition movement.

DOC.Title: Bertrand = Russell
DOC.TEXT: A British philosopher. As a behavioral liberalist and humanitarian, he headed the anti-war peace movement.

DOC.Title: A / H bomb prohibition movement
DOC.TEXT: With the fifth Fukuraku-maru incident in 1954, the campaign started from the movement of a housewife in Suginami, Tokyo and developed into a global movement. Although playing a major role in the antiwar peace movement of the 1950s, the conflict between political parties subsequently broke down.

DOC.Title: A World Bomb Blasting Competition
DOC.TEXT: The first was held in Hiroshima, the first disaster-stricken country in Japan. Since then he has led the world anti-nuclear movement, but it has split since 1962.

DOC.Title: Pugwash conference
DOC.TEXT: Based on the Russell-Einstein Declaration, a conference on science and international affairs held in Bagwash, Canada. It is a central organization of scientists' nuclear weapons prohibition movement.

DOC.Title: Partial nuclear test termination treaty
DOC.TEXT: Foreign Ministers of the United States, the United Kingdom, and the Soviet Union signed in Moscow and it came into force in October. We prohibited nuclear weapons experiments in the atmosphere, in the outer space and in the water except underground experiments. There were many approved countries, but France and China did not participate and the effect was weak because the underground nuclear test was approved.

DOC.Title: Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty, Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty, NPT
DOC.TEXT: In July 1968, 62 countries such as the United States, the United Kingdom and the Soviet Union (now Russia) signed the treaty signed in March 1970. Treaty prohibiting the transfer of nuclear weapons and manufacturing aid to nuclear non-possessing countries by limiting nuclear weapons states to the five countries of the United States, Russia, the United Kingdom, France and China. In 1995, the extension of this treaty was decided indefinitely, but there are many unequal contents such as holding only in five countries, and there are countries where it is believed to have nuclear weapons without joining the treaty Problems remain.

DOC.Title: Nuclear war prevention agreement
DOC.TEXT: The US / Soviet Union signed. It was mainly aimed at preventing the occurrence of accidental nuclear war.

DOC.Title: Strategic Weapons Limit Negotiation, First Strategic Weapons Negotiation Negotiation
DOC.TEXT: Negotiations aimed at disarmament through the limitation of the quantity of strategic missiles, which was signed in 1972. However, the content consists of "the theory of equilibrium of fear" that, when one places a first-stance nuclear attack, by holding both sides in a state of receiving a retaliatory attack from that other party, they are forced to preempt first strike attacks It was.

DOC.Title: Strategic Weapons Limit Negotiation, Second Strategic Weapon Negotiation Negotiation
DOC.TEXT: Arrangement concerning the means and total number of strategic weapons signed, signed in June 1979. With regard to the content of the transportation means, we made arrangements that are finer than the first and the total number was also equal to the US-Soviet Union. However, due to the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan that occurred in December the same year, the US Congress did not ratify the treaty, so the treaty did not come into effect and was abandoned at the end of 1985.

DOC.Title: United Nations Disarmament Special General Assembly
DOC.TEXT: The United Nations General Assembly held three times (1978, 82, 88) pushed by the rise of international public opinion seeking prohibition of atomic /

DOC.Title: Medium-range Nuclear Force Treaty Full Treatment, INF Total Cancellation Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Treaty negotiations began in 1981 between the US and Soviet, the treaty signed in 1987. After the Gorbachev regime was born in the Soviet Union, the negotiations advanced. Nuclear weapons loading is a historical treaty in the sense that the United States and the Soviet Union first agreed to reduce nuclear weapons in the treaty of abandoning possible middle range missiles and not manufacturing afterwards.

DOC.Title: Strategic Weapons Reduction Treaty, First Strategic Weapons Reduction Treaty, STARTI
DOC.TEXT: The negotiations began in 1982 and the strategic nuclear weapons reduction treaty signed by both the US and Soviet Leaders in July 1991. Both the US and the Soviet Union have decided to reduce the number of nuclear warheads to 6,000 and its means of transport (missiles and bombers) to less than 1,600 (aircraft).

DOC.Title: Strategic Weapons Reduction Treaty, Secondary Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty, STARTII
DOC.TEXT: Treaty negotiating significant strategic nuclear weapons reductions beyond STARTI in January 1993 between President Bush and US President Yeltsin and Russian President. Both the US and Russia agreed to reduce nuclear warheads to 3,000 to 3,500 each by 2007. However, dismantlement of nuclear weapons is more expensive than manufacturing, and there is concern that management of plutonium, which is caused by demolition, is extremely difficult to manage.

DOC.Title: Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty, CTBT
DOC.TEXT: Treaty prohibiting explosion experiments on all nuclear weapons. In the General Assembly of the UN General Assembly, approval was adopted in 158 countries, but ratification of the five nuclear weapons-owned countries and designated 44 countries was required for the entry into force of the Convention. However, as several of them have refused, there is no promise of entry into effect.

DOC.Title: German Social Democratic Party
DOC.TEXT: A political party in Germany. The German Socialist Workers' Party formed in 1875 was renamed in 1990. It was dismissed by the Nazis in 1933, but it was rebuilt for 45 years. After the Second World War, the Brant administration · Schmidt administration · Schroeder regime etc was suppressed.

DOC.Title: LDP
DOC.TEXT: The latter part of the Liberal Party formed in 1848. It was almost the third party in West Germany after the Second World War, but temporarily cooperated with the Social Democratic Party to support the Brant administration.

DOC.Title: Brandt
DOC.TEXT: Social Democratic leader. After being mayor of West Berlin, he became Prime Minister of West Germany (1969-74). We worked on settlement with the eastern countries called "Tohoku diplomacy", and later won the Nobel Peace Prize. As a concrete example, it was concluded that an armed force non-exercise agreement with the Soviet Union in 1970, the normalization agreement with Poland in the same year, the East-West German basic treaty in 1972, and so on. Domestic economy was also smooth, but one of the prime minister's secretaries resigned taking responsibility for arresting as a spy of the East Germany.

DOC.Title: Toho Diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: Policy promoting settlement with East Germany, Poland and the Soviet Union promoted by the Brant administration. With this, tension relief (detent) advanced.

DOC.Title: Soviet Union = West Germany Anti-Treaty Convention, Moscow Convention
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister Kosuigin Brandt signed in Moscow, it came into effect in 1972. Maintaining the border after the Second World War, and using armed forces between the two countries.

DOC.Title: West Germany = normalization of Polish diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: Signed in Warsaw, entered into force in 1972. We defined the border at Oder-Neisse Line.

DOC.Title: East-West German basic treaty
DOC.TEXT: In the Treaty signed in 1972, we confirmed the sovereignty of both parties and confirmed that the border between Poland and (East) Germany is Oder-Neisse Line.

DOC.Title: Oder-Neisse Line
DOC.TEXT: The Oder River and the tributary Naise River, it was regarded as the borderline between East Germany and Poland. It was set as a provisional bell in the Potsdam Agreement, but was later officially approved.

DOC.Title: East and West Germany, United Nations simultaneous accession
DOC.TEXT: Following the establishment of the East-West German Treaty, it fulfilled the simultaneous accession.

DOC.Title: Schmidt
DOC.TEXT: Following Brandt, he became prime minister (responsible 1974-82) and cooperated with France to strengthen EC (European Community).

DOC.Title: detent, relaxation of tension
DOC.TEXT: In the 1970s, it means relaxation of tension advanced between the US and the Soviet Union.

DOC.Title: European Security Cooperation Conference
DOC.TEXT: A meeting of 35 countries leaders including the US-Soviet Union gathered in Helsinki to discuss tension relaxation in Europe. It was renamed the European Security Cooperation Organization (OSCE) in 1995, and the function was strengthened.

DOC.Title: Helsinki declaration
DOC.TEXT: We declared equality of sovereignty of each European countries, respect for fundamental gifts, etc and became a symbol of detent spirit.

DOC.Title: Euro communism
DOC.TEXT: A new communism that rapidly spread in Western and South Europe from the mid 1970s, defending the existence of multiple political parties and parliamentary politics and denying the leadership of the Soviet Communist Party. The Italian Communist Party, for example, was the center, and at one time it had great power.

DOC.Title: Portuguese democratization
DOC.TEXT: The military led by General Spinoola overthrew the reactionary government that had struggled with colonial problems, and leftist forces also backed it. Since July, I approved or promised independence of African colonies. Domestically, the lines of the Socialist Party, the Communist Party, and the military parties were in conflict, but in April 1976 they were transferred to civil affairs and the middle left wing was in charge of the administration.

DOC.Title: Franco death
DOC.TEXT: Since the victory in the civil war in 1939, we have maintained the Spanish dictatorship system, but due to its death the recovery of the democratic state of Spain began.

DOC.Title: Spanish democratization
DOC.TEXT: Following the dictator Franco 's death, Juan Carlos reigned and the royal government restored, under it the Delegation in 1978, a referendum took place, the new constitution was approved, democratization advanced.

DOC.Title: Spanish revival
DOC.TEXT: Fans of the direct line of the royal royal family Carlos came in November 1975 after Franco death, the royal government revived.

DOC.Title: Fan = Carlos I
DOC.TEXT: King Spain (ranking from 1975). We promulgated the new Constitution and promoted democratization.

DOC.Title: Greek return to democracy
DOC.TEXT: The military dictatorship established in the coup d'etat in 1973 was brought down the following year, and the transition to Republicans was decided by referendum.

DOC.Title: China's UN representative title change
DOC.TEXT: The resolution of the People's Republic of China was resolved at the United Nations General Assembly. As a result, the Taiwanese people's government, which had so far had representation rights, was expelled from the United Nations.

DOC.Title: Nixon's visit
DOC.TEXT: Presented the US-China Joint Statement. The United States effectively approved China.

DOC.Title: Okinawa Return Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Signed in June 1971. Although it was occupied by the United States after 45 years, the movement demand demands for the return of Okinawa residents and Japanese citizens has increased, and the refund was made while leaving the US bases and facilities.

DOC.Title: Okinawa reversion
DOC.TEXT: May return to Japan in May 1972. Okinawa prefecture was established.

DOC.Title: Northern Territories issue
DOC.TEXT: Russia currently dominates the northern four islands of Habu Islands, Shikotanjima, Kunashirijima and Oshareashima in the east of Hokkaido, but from Japan's historical background Japan claims its ownership.

DOC.Title: Tanaka Cabinet
DOC.TEXT: Cabinet with prime minister Tanaka Kakuei (1918-93). He visited China in September 1972, signed a Japan-China Joint Statement and realized normalization of diplomatic relations between Japan and China. 74 The pension pulse problem (allegations of corruption over political funds) was pursued, and it was forced to resign entirely.

DOC.Title: Japan-China Joint Statement
DOC.TEXT: Statement that "Japan and China have concluded war situation." Japan agreed that China is the only legitimate government and that Taiwan is the territory of China and that China will not demand Japan for compensation.

DOC.Title: Day-to-day diplomacy normalization
DOC.TEXT: In September 1972, it was realized on the same day by signing the Japan-China joint statement. At the same time, the Japanese government declared that the Treaty of Peaceful Treaty with Taiwan had disappeared.

DOC.Title: Japan-China Peace and Friendship Treaty
DOC.TEXT: Signed in Beijing. Based on the Japan-China Joint Statement, we promised both countries' no war and friendship.

DOC.Title: Summit, Leaders' Leader Summit
DOC.TEXT: Since the first meeting in Rambouillet in the suburbs of Paris in 1975, the Summit of Japan, the United States, Britain, Germany, France, Italy and Canada held almost every year. The EC chairperson also participated from the third time, and in 1991 President Gorbachev of the Soviet Union was also donated. The theme was diverse, but initially it was the main theme of energy issues, the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, economic support and environmental problems of the former Soviet Union / Eastern Europe became the main theme. Russia has officially participated since 1997, and its name has also been changed to the main country summit conference.

DOC.Title: Enlarged EC
DOC.TEXT: Initial six countries (France, West Germany, Benelux 3 countries, Italy), January 1973 UK, Ireland, Denmark was established as a new member. Greece later in 1981, Spain / Portugal in 1986 joined, and EC member countries became 12 countries.

DOC.Title: European currency system, EMS
DOC.TEXT: A system that stipulates setting the central price of each country's currency and its variation range and maintaining fluctuations within that limit. Measures to advance currency integration, was established in 1979.

DOC.Title: Single European Protocol
DOC.TEXT: Effective in 1987. By 1992 the EC decided to aim for complete market integration.

DOC.Title: Schengen agreement
DOC.TEXT: In 1990, an agreement to abolish border inspection between EC member countries.

DOC.Title: European Summit Meeting
DOC.TEXT: In 1990, the leaders of all Europe gathered to adopt the Paris Charter and declared that the disintegration of Europe was concluded by the unification of Germany. At the same time, we concluded the European Normal Weapons Reduction Treaty.

DOC.Title: Maastricht Treaty
DOC.TEXT: In December 1991, a treaty aimed at promoting European integration adopted in February 1992 agreed at the EU summit meeting held in Maastricht, a regional city in the Netherlands. There was a historical significance in that further integration in terms of economics, currency and politics was further promoted and even a pathway to transfer a part of state sovereignty to the EU was established.

DOC.Title: European Union, EU
DOC.TEXT: As a result of the Maastricht Treaty EC further developed, formally launched in November 1993. With the introduction of common citizenship and the strengthening of the powers of the European Parliament, European integration has further deepened. As of July 2013, the member countries count 28 countries (the main non-member countries in the Western Europe are Norway and Switzerland). How to solve the problem caused by major economic disparities among member countries (eg, the highest Luxembourg per capita with the highest Luxembourg and lowest Bulgaria per capita) and how to accept Turkey as a new member today It is the main theme of.

DOC.Title: Euro
DOC.TEXT: The currency is officially adopted in many countries of EU member countries. It began to be used for settlement of interbank transactions since 1999, but bank notes and coins were introduced in 2002, and distribution also started in general. Today it has established itself as an international currency aligned with the dollar.

DOC.Title: EU Constitution
DOC.TEXT: In 2004, it was adopted at the EU Summit to promote further integration of the EU. However, since the ratification of the ratification was rejected in the Netherlands and France in 2005, the establishment is dangerous and an alternative plan is being considered.

DOC.Title: Northern Ireland conflict
DOC.TEXT: Conflict between Protestant (British) residents and Catholic (Irish) residents in British Northern Ireland (Ulster Region). Some of the Catholic residents who received various discrimination since about 1969 made terrorist activities by making an illegitimate Ireland Republican Army (IRA), Protestant militants also retaliated, and in 1972 British troops embarked on arming military (especially against the IRA), and the conflict expanded. In April 1998, a peace agreement was reached between the two, and then the situation went down to calm despite the turnaround, in May 2007 the Northern Ireland autonomous government was launched (revived).

DOC.Title: Thatcher
DOC.TEXT: UK 's first female prime minister (serving 1979-90). Domestically, we made efforts to reduce the welfare and privatize state-owned enterprises, to promote the creation of a "small government", to make economic reconstruction by emphasizing free competition, and to overcome "British disease". In addition, I also took the nickname of "a woman of iron" from outside, such as the Falkland War / Ireland problem, taking a hard line that is willing to sacrifice.

DOC.Title: New conservatism
DOC.TEXT: In the 1980s, the idea aimed at strengthening liberalism by "making a small government" promoted by the Thatcher regime of England, the Reagan administration of the United States, the Nakasone regime of Japan, and so on.

DOC.Title: "British illness"
DOC.TEXT: A word expressing the stagnation situation of the British economy. Thatcher et al. Have revived a small government and free competition, saying that the cause is the inefficiency of state-owned enterprises, heavy taxes to maintain social security, frequent strikes by strong labor unions, and so on.

DOC.Title: Falkland War
DOC.TEXT: A war that the British repatriated the Army, Armenian troops occupying the British Falkland Islands by exercising the Army, Air Force of the Urge.

DOC.Title: Major
DOC.TEXT: Succeedor of Thatcher Prime Minister of the United Kingdom (Tenure 1990-97). Conservative Party. Although it overcomes inflation and the high unemployment rate which is the biggest problem of the economy, it was ineffective due to lack of leadership.

DOC.Title: Blair
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom (Tenure 1997-2007). He led the Labor Party and won the general election, withdrew the government from the Conservative party for the first time in 18 years. Following the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks, the support rate has been greatly reduced due to the deepening of intervention in the war in Iraq in 2003 in cooperation with the American Bush administration.

DOC.Title: Giskar Destan
DOC.TEXT: French politician and president (responsible 1974-81). The 1st Summit was held in Paris. I did not succeed in countering the economic depression and lost support.

DOC.Title: Mitterrand
DOC.TEXT: French politician / president (office 1981-95). In the 1981 presidential election, it was elected as a unification candidate for the company and re-elected in the 1988 election. At the beginning of the inauguration nationalization of key industries was done, but the economy did not progress smoothly, and the general election also lost the Socialist Party, so the dual structure of the power that the conservative faction organized the Cabinet continued long.

DOC.Title: Chirac
DOC.TEXT: In 1995 he was appointed French President (Tenure 1995-2007) from Mayor of Paris and was reelected in 2002. Externally, we resumed nuclear tests that had been frozen since 1992 and received criticism both inside and outside, but in 2003 against the Iraq war led by the United Kingdom, 2003, the leadership was appreciated. I was struggling to solve economic problems such as recession and unemployment increase.

DOC.Title: call
DOC.TEXT: Christian Democratic Union leader. Prime Minister (Resigned from 1982 to 98). As we walked on the maintenance middle line, we saw opportunities for the Berlin Wall to collapse in the Eastern European Revolution in 1989, and we reunited the German nation for the next 90 years.

DOC.Title: German unification
DOC.TEXT: In 1990, it was caught capturing the machine of the Eastern European Revolution.

DOC.Title: Foreign labor issues
DOC.TEXT: Problems arising in the influx of foreign workers. In Germany, the inflow of workers from developing countries such as Turkey has increased, while on the other hand with over 4 million unemployed people in the country, the extreme right power exercise activities utilizing the dissatisfaction of the unemployed people are activated It is a big problem. Even in other countries such as France, it is a serious problem.

DOC.Title: Neo-Nazi
DOC.TEXT: In Germany, grooving attacks of foreign workers on the basis of exclusionism. Racism and violence affirmation, etc. are strong in common with the former Nazis, and the momentum is increasing with the unemployment rate rising. Even in Austria, the Liberal Party, which accepts part of the former Nazi policy, joined the coalition government in 2000 and became a major problem.

DOC.Title: Schroeder
DOC.TEXT: German politician. Social Democratic Party. Prime Minister (Tenure 1998-2005). Coalition with the Green Party to become Prime Minister, decided to abolish nuclear power generation by 2030. Although the support rate declined due to the stagnation of the domestic economy, the support rate was restored because it opposed the United States and the British against the strategy against Iraq against France in cooperation with France.

DOC.Title: Carter
DOC.TEXT: The 39th president of the United States from the Democratic Party (President 1977-81). He took office as a president with a fresh image and developed a foreign policy called "human rights diplomacy", but his administration was weak and did not produce sufficient results. Egypt · Israel interrogated the peace mediation, but it was forced into a hard time due to the response to the Iranian Revolution and the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan.

DOC.Title: "Human rights diplomacy"
DOC.TEXT: Slogan of Carter diplomacy. For the countries that do not protect human rights, we have put pressure to protect human rights, using economic assistance as a material. Although it attended a strong attitude to apartheid in South Africa, there were aspects that lacked consistency, such as supporting the Philippine dictatorship.

DOC.Title: US-China diplomatic normalization
DOC.TEXT: January 1979

DOC.Title: New Cold War
DOC.TEXT: A severe confrontation between rice and sos which reignited in the early 1980s. It was triggered by the Soviet Army's invasion of Afghanistan at the end of 1979, and both sides were forced to expand armaments, which brought a serious blow to the economies of both countries.

DOC.Title: Reagan
DOC.TEXT: The 40th American President (Resigned 1981-89). Republicans. Domestically, we did administrative reform aimed at a small government, encouraged free competition and also reduced social welfare, but in addition to showing out strong 'America', we expanded armaments and confronted the Soviet Union He strengthened his posture. The American citizens were satisfied with the image of "strong America", gained a high support rate, but the deficit in fiscal and trade, which is said to be "twin deficits" expanded, and the economy further weakened the economy.

DOC.Title: Strategy Defense Initiative, SDI
DOC.TEXT: The concept announced by US President Reagan in March 1983. Before the enemy 's ICBM (Intercontinental Ballistic Bullet) arrives, he proposed a study on how to intercept and destroy. However, it took a huge amount of money and was stopped because there are many technological challenges. Instead, the Theater Missile Initiative (TMD) was set up.

DOC.Title: Economic friction, trade friction
DOC.TEXT: International economic conflict arising from trade imbalance etc. In the 1980s, the United States suffered from budget deficits and stolen deficits called "twin deficits", while Japan overcame two oil shocks, succeeded in strengthening the economic structure and expanded the trade surplus. As a result, Japan-US trade friction occurred, and the United States sought Japan to expand domestic demand, open markets, and export restrictions.

DOC.Title: Plaza agreement
DOC.TEXT: Conclusion at a meeting held by the finance ministers of the five advanced countries and the central bank governor to save that the US trade deficit expanded to the debtor country. We decided to promote dollar depreciation policy (lowering the exchange rate with other currencies of the dollar) with cooperation of each country, but the trade deficit in the United States has not been resolved, but the distrust of the American economy spread widely, and in 1997 It led to the occurrence of Black Monday of the month (a massive crash of stock price).

DOC.Title: Bush
DOC.TEXT: The 41st American President (Resigned from 1989 to 93). Republicans. Cooperating with the Gorbachev regime of the Soviet Union, we achieved results at the end of the Cold War. Iraqi president Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait, overwhelmingly endorsed Iraq in the Gulf War in 1991 and received overwhelming support from the Americans, but due to the subsequent economic deterioration the public's dissatisfaction grew and the presidential reelection failed did.

DOC.Title: Malta talks
DOC.TEXT: In December 1989, Bush Gorbachev and the two leaders met at the Maltese island of the Mediterranean and declared the end of the Cold War (Malta Declaration).

DOC.Title: Gulf War
DOC.TEXT: A war that a multinational force centered on the United States began airstriking against Iraq ignoring the UN resolution. Iraq fought with a missile attack on Israel, but withdrew from Kuwait with a major defeat. Ocean pollution caused by oil spill and environmental destruction such as air pollution due to the flame of oil field occurred.

DOC.Title: Clinton
DOC.TEXT: The 42nd American President (Tenure 1993-2001). Democratic Party. I ran for candidacy with youthfulness and a fresh image, and he won the Bush with a big break and was elected. In accordance with the pledge of domestic policies, many appointed women, black people, etc., also worked on fiscal rebuilding, initially got a high support rate, but criticized for scandal and inconsistent foreign policy.

DOC.Title: Bush
DOC.TEXT: President of the 43rd US Presidency (2001-09). Republicans. The son of the 41st president. He won the president in close race watching rarely in history. On September 11, 2001, after the terrorist attacks on the United States, the United States declared total terrorist attack against the terrorist attacks, took a hard line such as attacking Afghanistan and Iraq but the local security did not go away and stayed stationed The sacrifice of the US military expanded, and its support rate dropped sharply.

DOC.Title: September 11th Terror, 9/11 Case
DOC.TEXT: An American aircraft carrying numerous passengers crashed into the world trade center building in New York one after another, after which the same building collapsed and numerous casualties came out. On that same day, terrorist activities continued in various places such as the Pentagon crashing other aircraft, and it was called "simultaneous multiple terrorism". On the other hand, President Bush issued a declaration of "war on terror" and began attacking Afghanistan (Taliban regime) which Bin Laden and others who declared as the mastermind of the case were hidden.

DOC.Title: US Army, Iraq Attack, Iraq War
DOC.TEXT: In March 2003, the United States launched an attack with the reason that Iraq possesses weapons of mass destruction such as nuclear weapons and poison gas (it turned out that it was a mistake later). Early in April with the British army entering and controlling Baghdad, May was declared the collapse of the Hussein regime and the end of the main battle. However, after that terrorist activities against occupation and governance such as the United States and the United Kingdom became active, the victims expanded not only to the US military and allied troops but also to international organizations such as the United Nations and the Red Cross Committee, Counterattacks have caused many casualties to civilians in Iraq. President Hussein was detained in 2003, and in 2004 the governance right was delegated to the Iraq interim Suzu government but due to the sectarian conflict between the Shiites and Sunnis and the Kurdish problem, bloodshed disaster occurred every day, There is no prospect of it. Japan also passed the Law on Special Measures for Iraq Reconstruction Assistance in the Diet in July 2003, and in December the SDF participated in the first overseas mission to carry heavy weapons.

DOC.Title: Iraq Reconstruction Assistance Special Measures Law
Individual behaviorism
DOC.TEXT: Even though the United States can not get international understanding, it is an idea to act on its own interests. Especially remarkable in the Bush administration, in the attack on Iraq, the major countries that actively supported were only a few, such as UK, Japan, Spain and Australia.

DOC.Title: Military intervention in the Soviet Union, Afghanistan
DOC.TEXT: Afghanistan 's parents' sect forces produced coup d'état under the support of the Soviet Union, and the Soviet forces controlled the whole country by multiplying it. America's strong opposition resulted, the US-Soviet relations worsened sharply.

DOC.Title: Andropov
DOC.TEXT: In November 1982, he was promoted from political officials due to the death of Brezhnev and became Secretary of the Soviet Communist Party. I died of disease in about a year.

DOC.Title: Cernenko
DOC.TEXT: In February 1984, he was appointed General Secretary of the Soviet Communist Party due to Androop 's death, and in April he was concurrently chairman of the Supreme Council. From the beginning of his career, he died of illness in about a year.

DOC.Title: Gorbachev
DOC.TEXT: Soviet politician. Secretary General of the Communist Party (responsible 1985 ~ 91), President (Tenure 1990 ~ 91). In 1985, after Secretary General Cernenko's death, he became secretary general secretary. We carried out extensive reform such as perestroika of Soviet politics, economics, society and culture, and Glasnost (information disclosure). Furthermore, he made great achievements such as promoting democratization and liberalization of the Soviet Union, reducing military power, rebuilding the economy of the private sector, improving US-Soviet relations and alleviating the tension of the world. However, he was damaged by a conservative coup, he resigned President December in August 1991.

DOC.Title: Perestroika, Reform
DOC.TEXT: It is translated as reconstruction and reform. Gorbachev began with large-scale reforms throughout the entire Soviet society. A slogan for reforming the bureaucracy that bloated in Brezhnev era, appointing intellectuals, rebuilding the economy, and realizing liberalization and democratization. As a result, beyond Gorbachev 's intentions, the disintegration of the Soviet Communist Party, the disappearance of the Soviet Union.

DOC.Title: Glasnost, information disclosure
DOC.TEXT: Gorbachev is one of the new routes launched, the content of saying that it will boldly disclose information by abolishing the secret principles based on the Soviet ideology so far. The accident at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant in 1986 triggered.

DOC.Title: Chernobyl nuclear power plant accident
DOC.TEXT: The worst nuclear power plant accident in history that occurred at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant located in the Ukraine Republic (then Soviet territory) north of Kiev. It damaged the reform movement of the newly formed Gorbachev regime.

DOC.Title: New thought diplomacy
DOC.TEXT: From diplomatic policy based on the Cold War, conversion to tension relaxation diplomacy. The withdrawal of the Soviet Union from Afghanistan in 1988-89, etc. was realized.

DOC.Title: New Belgrade declaration
DOC.TEXT: Declaration that Gorbachev denied the leadership of the Soviet Union against socialist countries. It led to the Eastern European revolution in 1989.

DOC.Title: Withdrawal from Afghanistan, withdrawal from Soviet Afghanistan
DOC.TEXT: Based on the Geneva agreement in April 1988, it began to withdraw from May 15 and completed in February 1989. There was a background of economic collapse of the Soviet Union.

DOC.Title: conservative coup, anti Gorbachev coup
DOC.TEXT: During presidency of President Gorbachev, the conservatives of the vice president and others carried out a coup to block the overwork of the reform. In response, President Yeltsin and the Republic of Russia and some of the citizens and military resisted the coup, the coup died in failure on the 3rd. As a result, Gorbachev resigned as secretary himself, recommending dissolution of the Communist Party, 74 years of Communist Party rule collapsed, and in December the Soviet Union was also demolished.

DOC.Title: Soviet Communist Party dissolution
DOC.TEXT: Immediately after the failure of the coup, Gorbachev declared the dissolution.

DOC.Title: Baltic Three Country Independence Recovery
DOC.TEXT: The Soviet Union approved, the three countries Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania recovered their independence.

DOC.Title: Independent State Community, CIS
DOC.TEXT: An organization organized on December 8, 1991 by the leaders of the Slavic 3 Republic of Ukraine, Russia and Belarus, and participated in the 11 Republic on 21th (93 Georgia also joined). It is not a national organization because it does not have its own constitution or parliament. Although it aims cooperation system of former Soviet Union countries in terms of security, economy, culture, etc., it is considerably morose.

DOC.Title: Soviet extinction
DOC.TEXT: The Independent State Community (CIS) was established, Gorbachev resigned from the President and the Soviet Union disappeared.

DOC.Title: Russian Federation
DOC.TEXT: In December 1991, the Russian Republic of the former Soviet Union has been renamed. He succeeded to the government of the former Soviet Union and was recognized as a permanent member of the United Nations. Yeltsin took office as the first President.

DOC.Title: Yeltsin
DOC.TEXT: President of the Russian Federation (in office 1991-99). In fact, he also served as the leader of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS). In August 1991 he became active in overwhelming conservative coup d'etat, became the most powerful person on behalf of Gorbachev, became the leader of the CIS, the first president of the Russian Federation after the collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991. It promoted the capitalism of Russia with frantic execution power, but the tendency of dictatorship was also strong.

DOC.Title: Chechen dispute
DOC.TEXT: A civil war over the independence from the Russian Federation of the Chechen Republic located in the North Caucasus. In December 1994, the Russian troops intervened in Chechnya militarily and the civil war intensified. In August 1996, a ceasefire was agreed between the Russian side and the Chechen independence group, but the battle was resumed thereafter and violent terrorist activities also occurred frequently.

DOC.Title: Putin
DOC.TEXT: President of the Russian Federation (Tenure 2000-08). Born from former Soviet Union KGB (Soviet National Security Committee). Following Yeltsin, he took office as President. The spread of the gap between rich and poor, the spread of corruption, the deterioration of security due to the rampant of Mafia advanced. However, by the suppression of the power of Chechnya conflict, information control by mass media control, economic recovery by the soaring price of oil, etc., we aimed to stabilize the administration.

DOC.Title: Moscow's theater occupation case
DOC.TEXT: In October 2002, a Chechen insurgent forced the audience to hostage at the Moscow Theater. All government Chechen insurgents and hostages were sacrificed because government armed forces used special gas.

DOC.Title: Northern Ossetia school occupation case
DOC.TEXT: In September 2004, armed groups, mainly Chechen independents, took a hostage of more than 1000 hostages at a school in Russia's North Ossetia Republic. Armored troops of the Russian government took powerful measures and became a fierce battle with armed groups, hundreds of casualties came out.

DOC.Title: Poland Voluntary Management Union, "Solidarity"
DOC.TEXT: A new type of labor union independent from the government established in 1980. In 80 years, due to the nationwide strike against the announcement by the government of a significant rise in food prices, the government approved the establishment under pressure to concede. Walesa, who was the leader, became a symbol of the liberalization movement of Borland / Eastern Europe.

DOC.Title: Warissa
DOC.TEXT: A leader of a labor union "solidarity" independent from the government, expanded this organization to a nationwide scale. However, "solidarity" was illegalized by martial law, and himself was also arrested. After the Communist regime was overthrown, he became the president (occupying 1990-95).

DOC.Title: Jarzerski
DOC.TEXT: Polish soldier, prime minister (Resigned 1981-85).
