In 1980, after the Gielek regime collapsed due to the development of the "Solidarity" movement, he became prime minister of Poland in 1981 and declared martial law, suppressed "solidarity" movement. After that, in July 1989, he became the president (responsible 1989-90) in the Eastern European revolution but resigned in December 1990.

DOC.Title: Honeker withdrawal
DOC.TEXT: Honecar (resigned from 1971 to 89) of East Germany Socialist Unification Party (Communist Party) secretary general retired and the 18-year dictatorship ended.

DOC.Title: Berlin Wall opening
DOC.TEXT: The East German government canceled traffic restrictions between East and West Germany. As a result, the extinction of the Eastern European Communist Party became definitive.

DOC.Title: German unification
DOC.TEXT: In August 1990, the Unification Treaty on East and West Germany was signed, officially unified on October 3, the country became the Federal Republic of Germany.

DOC.Title: Havel
DOC.TEXT: President of the Czech Republic Slovakia (Czech Republic) (Resigned from 1989 to 2003). An anti-regime playwright who was active in overthrowing the Communist Party regime. After taking office as president in December 1989, after the Czech Republic and Slovakia separated, in January 1993 it became President of the Czech Republic.

DOC.Title: Causescu execution
DOC.TEXT: From December 1989 indiscriminate firing incidents against the demonstration expanded demographics throughout Romania, the Cherauszes regime collapsed. Immediately after that the couple was executed.

DOC.Title: Com Comcon resolution
DOC.TEXT: Established as a socialist country economic cooperation organization in 1949, the constituent countries lost their reasons for existence by abandoning the planned economy and dissolved in 1991.

DOC.Title: Elimination of Warsaw Treaty Organization
DOC.TEXT: In 1955 the Soviet Union and Eastern European countries organized as a military alliance against NATO, but Gorbachev's regime wrecked in 1991 because it abandoned the initiative of the Warsaw Treaty Organization against the background of the end of the Cold War.

DOC.Title: Eastern European Revolution, Eastern European Socialist Sphere Disappearance
DOC.TEXT: It has been maintained under the strong dominion of the Soviet Union, but it has completely disappeared due to the dissolution of the Treaty Organization of the Republic of Wimbledon in 1991.

DOC.Title: Zhou Enlai death
DOC.TEXT: He had served as a prime minister of the State Council (prime minister) for a long time and was dead in trying to end the cultural revolution. In April of the same year, a riot occurred (the first Tiananmen Incident) on the occasion that the garlands of the people who mourn it were withdrawn by four people.

DOC.Title: Mao Tse Died of Death
DOC.TEXT: It was the death of the death of the old Communist members such as Zhou Enlai (January) and Zhude (July) of the same year. It became a major turning point of China's modern history, arrest of four people, the complete termination of the Cultural Revolution, conversion to a new line.

DOC.Title: Hua Nang Feng
DOC.TEXT: Inaugurated in January 1976 as a prime minister (Delegate 1976-80) with Zhou Enlai death. In October 1976, about a month after Mao's death, he arrested and overturned the four gangs, officially became the chief of the Communist Party of China (1976-81) and switched to a new line. He later resigned as criticized by Deng Xiaoping.

DOC.Title: Four people arrest
DOC.TEXT: Against the backdrop of authority of Mao Zedo, he tried to promote the cultural revolution still, but he was arrested by Huawei County Fair and all were convicted in the 81-year trial.

DOC.Title: Deng Xiaoping
DOC.TEXT: Chinese Communist Party leader. It fainted during the Cultural Revolution, and after that it repeatedly resurrected and lost, but it revived just after the collapse of four people and became the most powerful person. We embarked realistic policies such as "four modernizing" policies, boldly introduced capitalist economic policy while maintaining the dictatorship of the Communist Party.

DOC.Title: "Four Modernization"
DOC.TEXT: It is the modernization of agriculture, industry, defense, science and technology, originally proposed by Zhou Enlai. Deng Xiaoping brought back again after the Cultural Revolution and was set as a new goal of China.

DOC.Title: People's Congress dismantling
DOC.TEXT: Production responsibility system for each farmer (privatization of de facto farmland) was carried out in rural areas and dismantled.

DOC.Title: Reform / Open Policy
DOC.TEXT: A slogan of a new policy that Deng Xiaoping set up since 1978. Demolition of the People's Congress and introduction of foreign capital etc.

DOC.Title: Socialist market economy
DOC.TEXT: Politically to pursue the goals of socialism under the Communist party's dictatorship system, to introduce capitalistic market economy economically.

DOC.Title: US-China diplomatic normalization
DOC.TEXT: The leadership centered on Deng Xiaoping was realized while advancing reform and opening policy. As a result, the United States exchanged with the Taiwanese people's government.

DOC.Title: Hu Yao Jun
DOC.TEXT: President of the Chinese Communist Party (Mr. Takeshi 1981, 82-87 General Secretary). Because he actively promoted reform and open-door routes, he collided with the conservative and presbytery, and resigned in 1987.

DOC.Title: Zhao Ziyang
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of China (responsible 1980-87). General Secretary of the Communist Party of China (responsible 1987-89). Following Hu Yaobao, he promoted reform and opening routes, but he was pursued responsibility for the (second) Tiananmen Incident incident in 1989 and fell down.

DOC.Title: special economic zone
DOC.TEXT: Four cities in Guangdong and Fujian Province and Hainan Island designated since 1979 in order to promote the introduction of foreign capital and technology into joint venture enterprises.

DOC.Title: Tiananmen Incident, Second Tiananmen Incident
DOC.TEXT: A case where a conservative faction of Lee Peng repeatedly protested a demonstration at a large Tiananmen Square in the masses seeking broader liberalization using the army. The state of repression was conveyed to the world through the mass media, the Deng Xiaoping leadership was brought under a strong condemnation, and economic sanctions were also imposed, but it survived this and kept the Communist party's dictatorship system.

DOC.Title: Jiang Zemin
DOC.TEXT: After the dismissal of Zhao Ziyang, General Secretary of the Communist Party (in office 1989-2002) became. He took office as President of the State in March 1993, and promoted reforms while maintaining the leadership of the Communist Party.

DOC.Title: Zhu Rongji
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister (Tenure 1998-2003). Together with Jiang Zemin, promoting the introduction of a capitalistic market economy while holding up the preservation of socialism.

DOC.Title: Hong Kong's return
DOC.TEXT: Since the Nanjing treaty after the Opium War, it was returned from England to China for the first time in 155 years and became Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. The social system is based on one country and two systems, capitalist regime is guaranteed for 50 years in the future.

DOC.Title: Macao return
DOC.TEXT: The return of Macao, which was under the control of Portugal for about 450 years, to China has been realized. As a result, the colonies that the Western countries had in Asia have disappeared. As with Hong Kong, two countries' systems are applied to Macao.

DOC.Title: Hu Jintao
DOC.TEXT: Following Jiang Zemin, he took office as president of the country (from 2003 to 2013).

DOC.Title: Wen Jiabao
DOC.TEXT: Following Zhu Rongji, he took office as prime minister (from 2003 to 2013).

DOC.Title: Mongolia, withdrawal from socialist system
DOC.TEXT: In 1990, the People 's Revolutionary Party abandoned the one-party dictatorship system, free elections were implemented, the New Constitution came into effect in 1992, and withdrew from the socialist regime.

DOC.Title: Vietnam / Cambodian refugees, Indochinese refugees
DOC.TEXT: Mass refugees caused by the economic turmoil caused by the invasion of Cambodia in Vietnam, the Chuetsu war, etc. in the late 1970s. It is set to total 1 million or more. It has become an international problem since 1978.

DOC.Title: Doi Moi, renewal
DOC.TEXT: Vietnam's reform and opening route adopted in 1986. On the economic front, he is stating the expansion of production of living consumer goods, introduction of market economy, introduction of foreign capital.

DOC.Title: Pol Pot administration
DOC.TEXT: The political power of the democratic Kampucia with the leadership of Pol Pot established in April 1976. 79 · It collapsed in the attack of the Vietnamese army, it was replaced by Hen-Samrin administration.

DOC.Title: Vietnamese Army Invasion of Cambodia
DOC.TEXT: The Vietnamese army invaded Cambodia with the support of the Hen-Samrin regime and military occupation of Phnom Penh in January 1979.

DOC.Title: Cambodian People's Republic
DOC.TEXT: With the support of Vietnam, the Pol Pot administration was overthrown. The head group is Heng Samrin. After that, guerrilla political fighting of Pol Pot faction came, but peace agreement was concluded through mediation of the United Nations.

DOC.Title: Hen-Samrin administration
DOC.TEXT: In 1979, Heng Samlin was established under the support of the Vietnamese army.

DOC.Title: Chuetsu War, China = Vietnam War
DOC.TEXT: Because Vietnam dispatched to Cambodia with the support of the Soviet Union, the war that China invaded the northern part of Vietnam. Vietnam with abundant experience of battle has ended out the Chinese army.

DOC.Title: Cambodia withdrawal from Vietnamese Army
DOC.TEXT: Review of the Vietnamese policy of the Soviet-Gorbachev regime and policy change to Vietnam's economic reconstruction.

DOC.Title: United Nations Cambodian Interim Administrative Organization, UNTAC
DOC.TEXT: Based on the Paris peace agreement in 1991, the administrative agency for peace in Cambodia was established in March 1992. Since the civil war in Cambodia came to a ceasefire, he was active in monitoring the cease-fight and fair implementation of the election afterwards, and in May 1993 general election was held without political factions.

DOC.Title: Kingdom of Cambodia
DOC.TEXT: Constitutional monarchic kingdom established in September 1993 with the new Constitution delivered, restoring Sihanouk to the king.

DOC.Title: Hun Sen regime
DOC.TEXT: In the 1998 general election held the regime, in 1999 Kingdom of Cambodia fulfilled ASEAN accession.

DOC.Title: Kim Jong Il
DOC.TEXT: A leader of the North Korean Democratic People's Republic. In October 1997, he took office as General Secretary of the Korean Workers' Party, who had become empty after Kim Il-sung's death. It was reappointed as national defense chairman by concession of the Supreme People 's Assembly in September 1998, it reached the highest national level.

DOC.Title: North and South Korea Summit Meeting
DOC.TEXT: In June 2000, a meeting that was realized between Kim Jong Il of North Korea and Kim Dae Jung, South Korea. North and South Joint Declaration was announced, advances such as unification of north and south, humanitarian affairs and economic cooperation were prompted, but it did not lead to relaxation of tension.

DOC.Title: Six-Country Talks
DOC.TEXT: The meeting of the United States, North Korea, Japan, South Korea, China, Russia, which was held during the deepening allegations of nuclear development by North Korea. Meanwhile, North Korea 's nuclear development and missile experiments were advanced, so it is continuing with many interruptions.

DOC.Title: Japan-Morning Summit Meeting
DOC.TEXT: Koizumi · Kim Jong Il summit meeting held in 2002 and 2004. North Korea officially acknowledged the abduction of Japanese and some victims returned home, but it has not been fully resolved.

DOC.Title: Ethiopian Revolution
DOC.TEXT: With the economic crisis and hunger getting worse, the revolution that the military uprised and overturned the emperor's tyranny. Since then, the new administration takes socialistic routes, but starvation became more severe by misappropriation, and in 1991 it was overthrown by rebels.

DOC.Title: Haile-Selassie
DOC.TEXT: The last Emperor of the Ethiopian Empire (ranking 1930-74). During World War II British cooperation restored independence from Italy. Although it strengthened the dictatorship from the 1960 's, a large amount of starvation occurred in drought, was abolished in the revolution of 1974, and was later executed.

DOC.Title: Eritrea Liberation Front
DOC.TEXT: Liberation organization against Ethiopia's eritrea consolidation. As a result of the referendum in 1993, it separated and became independent from Ethiopia in the same year.

DOC.Title: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development, UNCTAD
DOC.TEXT: A meeting established by the United Nations with the aim of forming a mechanism to promote economic development in developing countries. The 1st General Assembly was held in Geneva, 1964, and has repeated the number of times thereafter. We are trying to solve the North-South issue by improving the trade system that is advantageous to developed countries and expanding the assistance to developing countries.

DOC.Title: North-South issue
DOC.TEXT: Rather than catching the problem of the world from the confrontation between the Western capitalist camp and the eastern socialist camp, the idea of ​​viewing as a conflict between rich northern developed countries and poor southern developing countries. As a background for this, the idea that developed nations in the north should aid developing countries in the South, capital and technology as well as developing the economy and welfare of the whole world has been widespread .

DOC.Title: South-South problem
DOC.TEXT: Between the developing countries in the South there are disparities also between the wealthier countries such as oil producing countries and emerging industrial economic regions (NIES) and the poorest countries that are also called non-oil-producing countries and the fourth world .

DOC.Title: Emerging industrial economic area, NIES
DOC.TEXT: It means a country or region that has succeeded in rapid industrialization from developing countries and has realized a high economic growth rate since the 1970s. Brazil, Mexico, Argentina in Latin America, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Korea, Singapore in Asia etc.

DOC.Title: Association of Southeast Asian Nations, ASEAN
DOC.TEXT: Organized in 1967, the five foreign ministers from Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, the Philippines and Thailand. Initially the color of anti-communism military alliance was strong, but in 71, declaring neutralization of Southeast Asia, shifting to a cooperative mechanism in politics and economics, in 1992, a plan of ASEAN free trade zone (AFTA) was established It was. Brunei member countries in 1984, Vietnam in 1995, Myanmar · Laos in 1997, Cambodia in 1999, ASEAN 10 where all countries of Southeast Asia participate was realized. In addition, the ASEAN Regional Forum was held as a framework of security dialogue in the Asia-Pacific region in 1994, and it also began to play an important role in terms of peacekeeping.

DOC.Title: Southeast Asia Friendship and Cooperation Treaty
DOC.TEXT: At the first ASEAN summit held after the end of the Vietnam War, it was signed with the aim of deepening friendship and solidarity in the Southeast Asian region.

DOC.Title: ASEAN Free Trade Zone, AFTA
DOC.TEXT: In 1992, it was formed with the aim of promoting liberalization of trade through a reduction of tariff / non-tariff barriers among member countries.

DOC.Title: ASEAN + Japan-China-Korea Summit
DOC.TEXT: In 1997, the leaders of Japan, China and South Korea joined the ASEAN countries and it was held. It is discussed mainly about the creation of an East Asian community that deepens economic cooperation and intends to integrate the region.

DOC.Title: Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation Council, APEC
DOC.TEXT: Cooperation system established for the purpose of economic development in the Asia-Pacific region in 1989. Initially it was established in 12 countries including Japan, Korea, the United States, Australia, New Zealand, ASEAN Member States, etc. Mexico, Chile and others have joined since then, now it consists of 19 countries and 2 regions. The advocacy of the East Asia Economic Cooperation (EAEC) initiative in 1991, the response to the Asian currency crisis in 1997, measures against terrorism since 2001 and countermeasures against SARS (new pneumonia) are noted.

DOC.Title: Hawk
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of Australia (Resigned from 1983 to 91). Labor Party. Domestically promoting structural reform and advocating the formation of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation Council (APEC).

DOC.Title: Third Middle East War, 6 Days War
DOC.TEXT: A war that Israel attacked Egypt, Syria and Jordan preemptively and won the game in six days. Since Israel occupied the Sinai Peninsula, the Golan Heights, the West Bank West Bank, the Gaza Strip, and so forth, a number of Palestinian refugees occurred. On the other hand, Israel has expanded the dominated territory by a factor of five.

DOC.Title: Sinai Peninsula
DOC.TEXT: An area sandwiched between the Mediterranean and the Red Sea in eastern Suez Canal. It was returned in 1979 Egypt = Israel Peace Treaty.

DOC.Title: Golan Heights
DOC.TEXT: Highland area in western Syria. In 1981 Israel annexed to its own territory and did not respond to the refund request.

DOC.Title: West Bank of the Jordan ___
DOC.TEXT: Since 1993, Israel has expanded Jewish settlements and is deepening confrontation with Palestinians, although it was placed under the control of Palestinian Interim Iraq Government.

DOC.Title: Gaza Strip
DOC.TEXT: The headquarters of the Palestinian Interim Autonomous Government has been in place since 1993, but after 2000 the Israelis are increasingly monitoring and repressing.

DOC.Title: Sadato
DOC.TEXT: In the sudden death of Nasser in September 1970 he was promoted from Vice President to President Egypt (serving 1970-81). In exchange for diplomatic routes to the parent American policy, in March 1973 the Egyptian-Israeli Peace Treaty was concluded with American mediation, but was assassinated in 1981.

DOC.Title: Fourth Middle East War
DOC.TEXT: Egypt · Syria pre-embark Israel and gains victory in the first game, but Israel fought back and won militarily. But the defeat in the first war and the huge war cost (for 1.5 years of the state budget of Israel) also had a great blow to Israel. The Arab side also launched a petroleum strategy, putting pressure on the strategy of embargoing oil to countries that support Israel.

DOC.Title: Egypt = Israel Peace Treaty
DOC.TEXT: In mediation of US President Carter, in 1978 agreed to peace at Camp David, the two leaders signed in Washington in March 197. Shortly after Egypt announced withdrawal from the Arab League, the 18 Arab countries and the PLO had exchanged with Egypt.

DOC.Title: Camp = David agreement
DOC.TEXT: I agreed to normalize diplomatic relations between Israeli Egypt and Israel and return the Sinai Peninsula.

DOC.Title: Sadat assassination
DOC.TEXT: During Cairo's military parade recruitment, he was shot dead by an ardent Islamic fundamentalist group dissatisfied with Israeli peace. Vice president Mubarak was promoted to his successor.

DOC.Title: Mubarak
DOC.TEXT: Egyptian President (Resigned 1981-2011). Inheriting the Sadat route, while also emphasizing the relationship with the United States and Israel, we also tried to restore relations with the Arab countries.

DOC.Title: Sinai Peninsula return
DOC.TEXT: Egypt = Israeli troops withdrew from the occupied territory under the Israel Peace Treaty, the return to Egypt was realized.

DOC.Title: Invasion of Lebanon, Invasion of Israel Lebanon
DOC.TEXT: The civil war continued Lebanon invaded the Israeli army which was supported by the United States and invaded the PLO from its base Beirut (the capital of Lebanon). In the meantime, a Palestinian refugee genocide incident occurred by a group of parent Israeli Christians.

DOC.Title: Rabin
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of Israel (Tenure 1992-95). In 1993, with Palestine Liberation Organization 's Arafat, mutual recognition, agreed to establish a provisional autonomy of the Palestinians.

DOC.Title: Palestine Liberation Organization, PLO
DOC.TEXT: An organization formed by the Palestinians in 1964 to restore the land and rights lost to Israel. Since Arafat became a leader in 1969, he fought a radical struggle by mobilizing the Palestinian resistance organization. However, since 1982 abandoned the armed struggle, signed a provisional autonomy agreement with Israel in 1993 and Arafat became the representative of the provisional autonomous government.

DOC.Title: Arafat
DOC.TEXT: Leader of Arab national liberation movement. Since 1969 he has served as the chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization and instructed armed struggle and approved the PLO as the sole representative of Palestine at the Arab summit in 1974. After that, mutual recognition with Israel was made in September 1993, and a provisional autonomous government was established.

DOC.Title: Palestinian State Establishment Declaration
DOC.TEXT: PLO declared for the first time in the Palestinian National Assembly with Alger. Virtually Independent State Concept Coexisting with Israel. A Palestinian provisional autonomy agreement in 1993 showed a path to realization, but since the Sharon administration was established in Israel in 2001 and began taking hard measures such as assassination of the Palestinian leader, the Palestinian suicide bombing, Israel The retaliatory attack on the side and confusion further deepened.

DOC.Title: Middle East Peace Conference
DOC.TEXT: Held in the US and the Soviet Union, held in Madrid, Spain. It was meaningful that Israel and the surrounding Arab countries and the PLO first met together for peace negotiations.

DOC.Title: Palestinian Interim Autonomy Agreement, Oslo Agreement
DOC.TEXT: Secret negotiations on Norway's mediation were promoted, and an agreement granting temporary autonomy of the Palestinians in the Israeli occupied territory signed in Washington. In May 1994, precedent autonomy began in the Gaza Strip and the Jordan River West Bank Yellico, and in September 1995 agreed to expand autonomy. In January 1996, Arafat took office as secretary of the Palestinian provisional autonomy administration.

DOC.Title: Assassination of Prime Minister Rabin
DOC.TEXT: Israeli Prime Minister Rabin was assassinated by a far right Jewish student who opposed the peace route with Arab / Palestine.

DOC.Title: Intifada
DOC.TEXT: A protest movement by stoning etc. that has been continued in the West Bank area of ​​the Gaza-Jordan River in the Israeli occupied area since 1987.

DOC.Title: Sharon
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of Israel (Tenure 2001-06). Leader of the right wing. Assassination of Palestinian leaders, promoting a new settlement policy to the Palestinian property (some ordered the removal), deepening the conflict with the Palestinians, greatly backed Middle East peace. In 2006, I fell ill and retired.

DOC.Title: Middle East peace Road Map
DOC.TEXT: Roadmap (pathway, measures) to advance peace in the Middle East, announced by President Bush of the United States in 2002. Although Palestinian side stops terrorist activities and Israel side mainly admits the establishment of the Palestinian state, it is considered difficult to realize it because the Israeli forcible construction of separation walls and the bomb attack by Palestine = guerrilla can not be sufficiently filled.

DOC.Title: Iran Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution against the ruling and dictatorship politics of King Pafouvii II. In February 1979, Shi'ite supreme leader Khomeini held the real power and forced a religious colorful policy such as restoration of Islamic discipline. The birth of a new administration that raises Islamic fundamentalism and takes a strong anti-American route encourages the surrounding Islamic fundamentalist forces and activates those activities (including terrorist activities). Also, with the invasion of the Soviet Union in Afghanistan, the posture of the opposition was clarified. The sharp decline in oil production caused by the Iranian revolution triggered an oil crisis that exceeded 73 years and hit the West world.

DOC.Title: Oil Crisis, Second Oil Crisis
DOC.TEXT: The crisis that occurred in February 1979 due to the sharp decline of oil sparked by the Iranian revolution.

DOC.Title: Komeini
DOC.TEXT: Iran 's Shiite leader. From the exiled Paris teach the revolution and returned to Japan in February 1979. After the revolution succeeded, Islamic discipline was restored, and various measures were enforced extensively. Externally, anti-US and anti-Soviet are clarified, and they also conflicted with Arab countries.

DOC.Title: Iran = Islamic Republic
DOC.TEXT: In March 1979, a national referendum was established with a national referendum with Islamist as the national principle.

DOC.Title: Bath Party
DOC.TEXT: A party advocating Arab nationalism. In Iraq I lost Kasem in the coup d'etat in 1963, and after the year 68 I gained control of the administration, Saddam Hussein took over the leadership from 1979.

DOC.Title: Saddam Hussein, President Hussein
DOC.TEXT: Iraqi politician and president (from 1979 to 2003) He belonged to the Baath Party and revealed a sharp head. After taking office as a president, we exercised Iran-Iraq war, invasion of Kuwait and the Gulf war on the outside, domestically carried out dictatorship politics, oppressed opponents, and massacred Kurds of ethnic minorities with poison gases. In 2003 Hussein regime collapsed due to the attack of Iraq of the United States British, the location of which was unknown, but was detained by the US military in December the same year. After being sentenced to death in the Iraq High Court, which was established under the occupation of the US military, it was executed in December 2006.

DOC.Title: Iran = Iraq war
DOC.TEXT: Iraq began invading Iran by multiplying the turmoil of the Iranian Revolution, and the warfare warfare of nine years continued without fruition by the United Nations etc mediation. Since 1985, both sides indiscriminately attacked the Persian Gulf navigation vessels, which made it difficult to export petroleum. Since America was severely confronted with Iran, it supported Iraq and gave the opportunity for Iraq to become a military powerhouse.

DOC.Title: Iraq, Invasion of Kuwait
DOC.TEXT: It went to Gulf War because Iraq invaded Kuwait's oil resources and declared consolidation.

DOC.Title: Multinational force
DOC.TEXT: An army composed of 28 countries, mainly based on the 580,000 American troops against Iraq's invasion of Kuwait. In response to the resolution of the UN Security Council approving the use of military force against Iraq, it entered the Gulf War in January 1991 and used a large amount of new weapons to hit the Iraqi army seriously.

DOC.Title: Islamic Reconstruction Movement
DOC.TEXT: A power recovery movement based on ardent Islam faith spread among the Arabs who have been suppressed by Israeli hardline policy and expansion of the influence of the United States in the Middle East region. With the masses of popular support gathered, some have intensified and ran into terrorist activities, resisting violently against the international order centered on developed countries, mainly the United States.

DOC.Title: Islamic fundamentalism, fundamentalism
DOC.TEXT: Movement to strictly restore politics and culture spreading mainly in the Middle East Islam area to the fundamental principles of Islam. The opposition to the modernization of Western flows is also the underlying and it is also the ideological background of the Islamic reconstruction movement. The Iranian Revolution of 1979 also occurred from this position, but today some organizations have run into extreme terrorist activities and become a big problem.

DOC.Title: Muslim Brotherhood
DOC.TEXT: Islamic fundamentalist forces centered on Egypt. It is also known for assassination of Sadat in 1981 and terrorist activities against foreign travelers in Luxor in 1997.

DOC.Title: Islamic Salvation Front
DOC.TEXT: Islamic fundamentalist forces in Algeria. Although it won the victory in the general election in 1991, since the election was invalidated to the military regime, since then, he ran into anti-government terrorist activities and Algeria became a civil war state.

DOC.Title: Taliban, Taliburn regime
DOC.TEXT: Islamic fundamentalist forces in Afghanistan. He won the civil war after the withdrawal of the Soviet army and began severe ruling by casting strict Islamism almost throughout Afghanistan. Since 1996, it has been strengthened in connection with the Islamic radical group Al-Qaeda. Since October 2001, we have lost control in Afghanistan following the fierce retaliatory attack by the US military against the terrorist attacks and the attack by the anti-Taliban power. It revived power around 2007, and is activating terrorist activities.

DOC.Title: Bin-Lardin
DOC.TEXT: A Saudi Arabian Millionaire and a leader of the Islamic radical group. It is regarded as the top mastermind of several terrorist attacks represented by the September 11 terrorist attacks that occurred on September 11, 2001, and although it was pursued by the United States, the location was unknown.

DOC.Title: Al-Qaeda
DOC.TEXT: It is regarded as an Islamic radical international terror network with Bin Laden as the leader. After the outbreak of many international terrorisms such as September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks frequently the group that is seen as the mastermind frequently called al-Qaeda, there are no clear organization and many unknown points.

DOC.Title: President Park assassination
DOC.TEXT: In the South Korean counterpart demo is loosening Park dictatorship, the central information manager shot dead Park and attempted to take over the power was arrested. In December the same year high officials concerned were arrested and both were executed.

DOC.Title: Gwangju incident
DOC.TEXT: Martial Army oppressed the democratization movements of students and workers in Gwangju, a case where a number of casualties were issued. In December 1979 after the assassination of President Park, the military centered on Doo Hwan grasped the real power, and confronted with the force of military opposition to the expansion of the emergency martial law to the whole country in May 1980.

DOC.Title: All Doo Hwan
DOC.TEXT: Korean soldier / president (served from 1980 to 88). After assassination of President Park, he grasps the real power. Suppressed the Gwangju incident, he took office as President of September 1980. He strengthened cooperation with the US and Japan, promoted economic development, but retreated without being able to suppress the anti-government movement in 1987.

DOC.Title: Roh Tae Won
DOC.TEXT: Korean soldier / politician. The declaration of democratization was issued, realizing presidential direct election. In the election held in December 1987, he won the president (in office 1988-93) and made the first South Korea change of peaceful administration. He joined the United Nations and made achievements in establishing diplomatic relations with socialist countries, but suffered from deteriorating trade balance and intensifying student movement and labor-management conflict.

DOC.Title: Han Hsi diplomatic ties established
DOC.TEXT: With the opening of the Seoul-Olympic Games, President Roh developed northern diplomatic relations and met with President Gorbachev of the Soviet Union in June 1990, establishing diplomatic relations in September.

DOC.Title: South and North Korea, United Nations Concurrent Membership
DOC.TEXT: Although North Korea insisted on joining in a single seat, since the policy was changed, the simultaneous accession of the United Nations in North and South Korea was realized.

DOC.Title: Establishing diplomatic relations between China and South Korea
DOC.TEXT: He signed a joint statement in Beijing and established diplomatic relations. As a result, South Korea diverted with Taiwan.

DOC.Title: Kim Young Sam
DOC.TEXT: A Korean politician. Won the president in the December 1992 election (Tenure 1993-98). It was the birth of the civilian government for the first time in 32 years.

DOC.Title: Kim Dae Jung
DOC.TEXT: President of Korea (Tenure 1998-2003). He was active as a leader of Korean democratization movement for a long time and was arrested and imprisoned under Park administration. We realized the inter-Korean summit meeting in the beginning of 2000.

DOC.Title: Sun policy, inclusive policy
DOC.TEXT: Kim Dae Jung developed the North Korean friendship policy. It responded to North Korea flexibly, mainly economic assistance, trying to solve peacefully the problem of Korea. The name named for the fable of the ancient Greek author, Isobu (North wind and sun). As a result of this policy June 2000 · North and South Korea summit meeting was realized.

DOC.Title: North and South Korea Summit Meeting
Roh Moo-hyun
DOC.TEXT: President of Korea (Tenure 2003-08). We inherited Sunshine policy and maintained policy towards North Korea's appeasement.

DOC.Title: Lee Teng Hui
DOC.TEXT: The first president of Taiwanese origin (highest-ranking leaders, responsible 1988-2000). Along with the death of President Baekje in 1988, promoted from vice president. Based on economic development, we strove to improve Taiwan's position in the international community. However, when China and Taiwan argued for "bilateral theory", China exerted a strong pressure and international tension occurred.

DOC.Title: Democratic Progressive Party
DOC.TEXT: Party in Taiwan. Although it was in the position of the opposition party under the reign of the KMT, it won the general election in 2000 and ended the monopoly of the KMT regime over half a century.

DOC.Title: Chen Shui-bian
DOC.TEXT: President from the DPP (President 2000-08). While struggling with the weakness of the administration base of minority ruling parties, we are striving to restore the economy. Following accession by China to the World Trade Organization (WTO) (2001), in 2002 Taiwan's accession was successful.

DOC.Title: Suharto Resignation
DOC.TEXT: President Suharto resigned in Indonesia in 1998, Vice President Habibie was promoted. It was caused by riots against the background of the people's anger toward the monopoly of interests by the Suharto clan and the economic turmoil associated with the Asian currency crisis of 1997.

DOC.Title: Asian currency crisis
DOC.TEXT: In 1997, as a result of the liberalization of currency exchange in Thailand, the decline of the currency spread to Korea, Indonesia and others. Due to a decline in trade and the possibility of a global recession, the IMF urgently made financial restrictions to these countries, urging severe structural reforms · In Indonesia, the Suharto regime collapsed.

DOC.Title: Habibie
DOC.TEXT: President of Indonesia (Tenure 1998-99). I tried to eliminate the Suharto clan and liberalize politics but the economy did not improve and I resigned. In the end of the administration, he was unable to suppress terrorist activities towards East Timor's independents and was intervened by the United Nations.

DOC.Title: Megawati
DOC.TEXT: President of Indonesia (Tenure 2001-04). The eldest daughter of Soekarno. Although it gradually gave results to the rebuilding of the economy, foreign investment narrowed down due to security deterioration such as terrorist activities and so on.

DOC.Title: Benigno = Aquino assassination
DOC.TEXT: Marcos' s greatest political enemy Benigno (1923-83) was shot dead at Manila Airport when he returned from the exile as the asylum. After the incident, anti-government movement continued against the backdrop of public anger and economic turmoil, leading to the collapse of the 1986 Marcos administration.

DOC.Title: Corazon-Aquino
DOC.TEXT: President of the Philippines (reign 1986-92). Since her husband Benigno was assassinated in 1983, he entered politicians, ran for the presidential election as a opposition candidate candidate, won the president with the support of the Defense Forces, while malicious campaign fraud was condemned. I tried to escape from the dictatorship of the Marcos era with a fresh image, but the gap between rich and poor did not shrink and the economy stagnated and threatened by the frequent occurrence of coups.

DOC.Title: Ramos
DOC.TEXT: President of the Philippines (Tenure 1992-98). We tried to harmonize the domestic powers, such as legalization of the Communist Party, reconciliation with the right army of the Army, peace with the Moro National Liberation Front, but the economic crisis could not be solved.

DOC.Title: Estrada
DOC.TEXT: President of the Philippines (Tenure 1998-2001). He was a movie actor and became a president with popular popularity. A scandal was discovered associated with various interests, and it was prosecuted and retreated at the impeachment trial.

DOC.Title: Arroyo
DOC.TEXT: President of the Philippines (Tenure 2001-2010). After Estrada resigned, he was promoted from the vice president. Economic reconstruction and settling of poverty are the subjects, but the results have not been much improved. On the other hand, we are advancing dependence on the United States, strengthening the fight with Islamic radicals in line with anti-terrorism activities.

DOC.Title: Burma military coup, 1962 Myanmar military coup
DOC.TEXT: Military coup d'etat done by General Ne-Winn. Ne-Wyn, with the position of the supreme leader until 1981, carried out dictatorship politically, with a spirit of socialism, and maintained leadership until 1988 even after that.

DOC.Title: Burma military coup, 1988 Myanmar military coup
DOC.TEXT: In July 1988, the Nwinwin regime collapsed due to the anti-regime movement of students / people, Seo-Maun defense authority in coup d'etat in September, established the National Law Order Recovery Council (SLORC), military administration I did it. In 1989 the country was changed from Burma to Myanmar.

DOC.Title: Sue Qi
DOC.TEXT: Burma's father, Aung San's daughter. Leader of the Myanmar Democratization Movement. Continuing to criticize military policy, in July 1989, the military regime created a house arrest. The national democratic federation led by Sue Qi in 1990 won the general election, but the military government is refusing to transfer the administration. Received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1991. The house arrest was released in July 1995, but release and arrest are repeated after that.

DOC.Title: India = Pakistan War, Markpa War
DOC.TEXT: Mainly the war between India and Pakistan over the attribution of Kashmir. The first (1947-49) campaign over the attribution of Kashmir, ceased fighting with the United Nations mediation. Secondary (April-September 1965) ended with a cease-fire proposal by the Security Council. Third (1971) is the cause of (1) refugees from East Pakistan inflow into India, (2) East Pakistan 's approach to India, (3) resolution of the Kashmir problem, and (4) domestic tightening of India etc , September 1971 repeated small hits, India won the victory in the full war between December 3 and 16. As a result, East Pakistan became virtually independent by the country name of Bangladesh, but the Kashmir problem has remained unresolved up to today, and the unstable situation continues.

DOC.Title: Bangladesh independence
DOC.TEXT: Pakistan was divided into east and west, but west dominated the east politically and economically. In such a state East Pakistan was dissatisfied, declared independence in March 1971 with India's cooperation, virtually independent in December. The capital city of Dhaka.

DOC.Title: Indira = Gandhi
DOC.TEXT: Prime Minister of India (responsible 1966-77, 80-84). The daughter of Nehru. While promoting socialist policy with the slogan of poverty banning, the anti-government movement suppressed. Outwardly I took a stance of conspicuous affairs. It repressed the Sikhs and was assassinated by the radical group.

DOC.Title: Indian nuclear possession
DOC.TEXT: It exploded underground in the Tar Desert in the US underground, and became the sixth nuclear possession in the world.

DOC.Title: Indira = Gandhi assassination
DOC.TEXT: In the vicinity of the Prime Minister 's official residence in New Delhi, Shika radicals were shot dead. It was retaliation for crackdown on Sikh radicals in June.

DOC.Title: Rhab = Gandhi
DOC.TEXT: Indira 's eldest son and succeeding prime minister (responsible 1984-89). It was assassinated during the 1991 story.

DOC.Title: Indian People's Party
DOC.TEXT: A political party in India established in 1980, raising Hindu supremacy. He grew up to be responsible for the administration on behalf of the National Congress Party, but intensified conflict with Pakistan.

DOC.Title: Pakistan's nuclear weapon
DOC.TEXT: We pursued development under the deepening of confrontation with India, succeeded in underground nuclear test in 1998.

DOC.Title: New Panama Canal Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The treaty that was signed in 1977, President Carter 's time. The United States promised to return Panama Canal Zone to Panama in 23 years (2000). In 1989, the Bush administration invaded Panama and was aimed at revising this treaty, but it was refunded at the end of 1999.

DOC.Title: Agende
DOC.TEXT: President of Chile (in office 1970-73). Succeeded in establishing a socialist government by the first election in history, promoting agricultural land reform and nationalization of copper mines. However, he died in the coup d'etat of the Conservative military groups such as Pinochet who joined the United States.

DOC.Title: Military coup in Chile
DOC.TEXT: In order to defeat the Agenda socialist regime, the military coup received support from the United States, the Pinochet military regime was established.

DOC.Title: Pinochet
DOC.TEXT: Leader of the Chilean military dictatorship. He continued infringement of human rights such as massacres in people opposed to dictatorship and fear politics. It was defeated in the 1988 national referendum, and after that he was treated, but arrested in 1998.

DOC.Title: Chilean civil administration transfer
DOC.TEXT: March 1990

DOC.Title: Falkland War
DOC.TEXT: The Argentine army occupied the British Falkland (Malvinas) Islands, but was surrendered by the British army and was surrendered.

DOC.Title: Argentina civil government transition
DOC.TEXT: The military regime collapsed after losing the 1982 Falkland War, and it was transferred to civil affairs in 1983.

DOC.Title: Nicaragua Revolution
DOC.TEXT: A revolution that the Sodo NISTA national liberation front (FSLN) defeated Somosa dictatorship. This also affected the neighborhood, anti-government activity also intensified in Guatemala and El Salvador.

DOC.Title: America, Nicaraguan intervention
DOC.TEXT: In the 1980 's, the United States intervened in order to put pressure on Nicaragua' s left-wing regime and developed into a civil war. In 1990, succeeded in establishing the political power of the political race, the civil war ended.

DOC.Title: El Salvador Civil War
DOC.TEXT: In 1980, the civil war that began between the government army and left wing guerrillas. America strengthened government forces, Nicaragua supported left wing guerrillas, but a ceasefire agreement was signed in 1992.

DOC.Title: Theology of Liberation
DOC.TEXT: Theology widely spread in the Catholic church in Latin America since the mid-1960s. I emphasized the actual activity of salvation of poor people.

DOC.Title: Grenada Left Wing regime
DOC.TEXT: In 1979, it was formed by defeating the dictatorship regime. Domestically, while establishing democratic institutions and disseminating education, deepening friendship with the Soviet Union and Cuba externally, they were knocked down by the intervention of the Reagan administration in the United States in 1983.

DOC.Title: Fujimori regime
DOC.TEXT: Peru 's regime established by Japanese Nikkei II Alberto-Fujimori (1990-2000). Taking hard measures against the leftist power, but was criticized for the corruption of the administration, Fujimori exiled to Japan.

DOC.Title: Cumulative debt
DOC.TEXT: Debt to obliged developed countries (funds with repayment obligation) that have been manifested since the early 1980s. Oil shocks, sluggish export goods prices in developing countries also overlapped, almost all repayment became impossible, and raised concerns about the global financial system.

DOC.Title: South American South Community Market, Mercosur
DOC.TEXT: A customs union between Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay, Uruguay and Venezuela, founded in the 1991 treaty. The South American currency crisis occurred in 2002 and the trade between the member countries declined, so significance is diminished.

DOC.Title: Mexican economic crisis
DOC.TEXT: Inflation and external debt increased in the 1980s, the Mexican currency (peso) fell on the flight of foreign capital at the end of 1994, resulting in economic turmoil. It led to the end of one-party rule by the institutional revolutionary party in 2000.

DOC.Title: institutional revolutionary party, PRI
DOC.TEXT: Developed from the Mexican revolution, formed the National Revolutionary Party in 1929, and was renamed the current institutional revolutionary party in 1969. It has been going to dominate Mexico for 71 years since it was formed, but it was defeated in the 2000 election and surrendered to the National Action Party, the democratization of Mexico progressed.

DOC.Title: Guinea = Bissau independence
DOC.TEXT: It was independent from Portugal.

DOC.Title: Mozambique independence
DOC.TEXT: It became independent from Portugal as a People's Republic. The intervention of the Rhodesian Caucasian Government has been intense since 1970 and the civil war with the anti-Government guerrilla, which was aided by South Africa in the 1980s, intensified, but the ceasefire witnessed in 1992.

DOC.Title: Angola independence
DOC.TEXT: After the release struggle from Portugal was done since 1961, it became independent as the People's Republic of China for 75 years. After that, the civil war continued intermittently, but the cease-fire fought in 2002.

DOC.Title: Rhodesia
DOC.TEXT: In 1923 he became a British colonial autonomous colony, and in 53-63 he formed the federation of Rhodesia = Nyisaland (Central African Commonwealth). After the demolition of the Federation, North Rhodesia became independent as Zambia, and in South Rhodesia the Rhodesia White government was established for 65 years. After that, the liberation movement was developed in Rhodesia, the 80-year black government was born, the Zimbabwe and the country name were renamed.

DOC.Title: Zimbabwe independence
DOC.TEXT: Southern Rhodesia's white regime became independent in order to maintain apartheid, but as the civil war became civil war and the black forces expanded, they beat the white regime in 1979 and made the country name Zimbabwe in 1980.

DOC.Title: Namibia Independence
DOC.TEXT: In 1949, the Republic of South Africa illegally annexed and enforced the apartheid regime. As a result of the 1989 election under the supervision of the United Nations, it became independent in March 1990.

DOC.Title: South-West African People's Organization, SWAPO
DOC.TEXT: A black organization died for Namibia independence. After achieving independence from the Republic of South Africa in 1990, he was in charge of the administration.

DOC.Title: Eritrean independence
DOC.TEXT: In 1952 he won the autonomy right at the UN resolution but was consolidated into Ethiopia in 1962. On the other hand, the Eritrea Liberation Front was organized, the liberation struggle accompanied by numerous victims continued, independence was officially decided by the referendum ballot.

DOC.Title: Eritrea Liberation Front
DOC.TEXT: Liberation organization against Ethiopia's eritrea consolidation. As a result of the referendum in 1993, it separated and became independent from Ethiopia in the same year.

DOC.Title: Chad Civil War
DOC.TEXT: Since 1966, the conflict between Arabic Muslims in the north and black Christians in the south developed into a civil war. Signs of calming have been seen since 1990.

DOC.Title: South Africa Republic
DOC.TEXT: Old South Africa Federation. 1961 May departed from the British Commonwealth, became a republic. Punished by apartheid, sanctioned by the United Nations, isolated in the international community. After that, in 1991 the Apartheid law was abolished in the international pressures, the black Mandela president was born in May 1994.

DOC.Title: apartheid, racial isolation policy
DOC.TEXT: In South Africa, a small number (16%) of Caucasians dominated and discriminated a majority (84%) of non-whites. Colored race discrimination and color discrimination policy strengthened in 1949-50 in the South African Commonwealth of the UK Dominion. The three laws of the Human Registering Act, the Group Regional Law, and the Indigenous Land Law were central. It was improved from around 1984 with the international pressure, and it was abolished by the Declark administration in 1991.

DOC.Title: African National Congress, ANC
DOC.TEXT: In 1912, it was formed with the aim of defending the rights of Africans by nonviolentism. After that, it received severe repression, it became illegal in 60 years, strengthened armed struggle. It was legalized in 1990 and succeeded in abolishing apartheid in 1991.

DOC.Title: Declark
DOC.TEXT: Republic of South Africa (President 1989-94). We promoted dialogue with black people and abolished apartheid. In 1993 he received the Nobel Peace Prize. In 1994, Vice President (~ 96).

DOC.Title: apartheid, legal elimination
DOC.TEXT: The Declark administration abolished the three laws of population registration law, group regional law, indigenous land land law, which are the basis of apartheid which remained until the end, legally the apartheid regime was closed.

DOC.Title: Mandela
DOC.TEXT: A black liberation activist in South Africa. Since joining ANC in 1950, he devoted himself to the anti-apartheid movement and lived in prison for 27 years until 62-90, but was released by the Declark administration. In 1993 he won the Nobel Peace Prize with Declark, and since 1994 he became President of South Africa (~ 99).

DOC.Title: Regional dispute
DOC.TEXT: Local warfare arising from causes such as ethnic conflict and border conflict. After the end of the Cold War, it has occurred frequently in many parts of the world and has issued numerous victims.

DOC.Title: Ethnic conflict, ethnic problems
DOC.TEXT: A conflict between different ethnic groups (a group that is conscious of sharedness such as language, customs, religion). After the end of the Cold War, the conflict in the nationwide unit that had a big meaning in the former severe rice-Soviet confrontation became unclear, the confrontation in the ethnic unit that had been held down during the Cold War was newly surfaced, Ethnic conflicts began to occur frequently.

DOC.Title: Ethnic = group, ethnic group
DOC.TEXT: A group formed strongly conscious of ethnicity such as language, customs · religion. In reality, the nation state is often composed of many ethnic groups, and among them the ethnic minorities that are often subject to discrimination often form refusal to assimilate to the nation state. There are many examples such as British Scots and Welsh, Spanish Basque, American black, Australian Aborigines.

DOC.Title: Terrorist activities, international terrorism
DOC.TEXT: Activities that try to realize their claim by means such as intimidation or military force. In the Cold War period, activities of leftist radicals were the main activities, but since the 1990s many religious groups have emphasized cult groups and fundamentalism. In addition to assassination / kidnapping etc., the means have been diversifying and becoming large scale with bomb, bacteria and toxic gas.

DOC.Title: Czech Republic Slovakia, separation into the two Republics
DOC.TEXT: Slovakia became a sovereign state, officially separated.

DOC.Title: Yugoslavia Civil War
DOC.TEXT: A strong civil war that the conflict of interests of the ethnic groups surfaced at the close of the death of Tito and the end of the Cold War. Croatia and Slovenia in June 1991, Macedonia also declared independence from the Federation in September the same year. In addition, when Bosnia and Herzegovina declared independence in 1992, the army of the new Yugoslavia Federation consisting of Serbia and Montenegro invaded the civil war. Despite the United Nations' mediation, a bloodshed case involving ethnic problems and religious conflicts was complicated, but in October of 1995 a ceasefire came into effect with the mediation of the United States. However, after that conflict occurred in Kosovo and others.

DOC.Title: Croatia · Slovenia Republic, Independence Declaration
DOC.TEXT: June 1991

DOC.Title: Independence Declaration of Macedonia
DOC.TEXT: September 1991

DOC.Title: Bosnia and Herzegovina Independence Declaration
DOC.TEXT: March 1992

DOC.Title: New Yugoslavia Federation established
DOC.TEXT: April 1992

DOC.Title: ethnic cleansing
DOC.TEXT: A thorough suppression measure including massacre and hostile erosion against hostile peoples. During the Yugoslav civil war and the Kosovo conflict, the Serbian side went and was criticized by the United States and others.

DOC.Title: Miloshevich
DOC.TEXT: President of the New Yugoslavia (ruling 1997-2000). Inspired the ethnic consciousness of the Serbs, criticized the independence movement of the Albanian inhabitants who dominate the Kosovo autonomous province, and received strong condemnation from the international community. After being defeated in the 2000 presidential election, he was sent to the international criminal court after being resigned for being charged with atrocities and was killed by the disease.

DOC.Title: International Criminal Court
DOC.TEXT: In 1993, it was set up in The Hague of the Netherlands to judge Milosevic of New Yugoslavia on charges of humanitarian crime. In 1994, an international criminal trial court was set up in Arusha, Tanzania, in order to judge atrocities in Rwanda civil war.

DOC.Title: Kosovo problem
DOC.TEXT: A problem arising as the new Yugoslavia's Milosevic regime diminished the autonomy of Albanian residents, which dominates the Kosovo autonomous province. As conflicts escalated to an armed struggle, the United States supported the armed struggle of Albania and carried out Serbia bombing as the center of the NATO army due to the atrocities on the Serbian side. After that the United Nations intervened and the provisional autonomous government was established, but the conflict has not been resolved.

DOC.Title: NATO troops, Serbia bombing
DOC.TEXT: It was held without resolution of the UN Security Council and left problems.

DOC.Title: Basque Country Movement
DOC.TEXT: The movement that the Basque people who live in the northern part of Spain and have their own language and culture are seeking independence from Spain. Activating terrorist activities since 1968, conflict with the Spanish government continues.

DOC.Title: Chechen dispute
DOC.TEXT: A civil war that the Chechnya Republic located in the North Caucasus is seeking independence from the Russian Federation. In December 1994, the Russian troops intensified due to military intervention in Chechnya (First Chechen conflict). In August 1996, a ceasefire was agreed between the Russian side and the Chechen independents. But in 1999, the Russian government declared that frequent terrorist incidents in Moscow were caused by Chechen armed groups, and made the Russian troops again into Chechnya (the second Chechen conflict). As a result, the capital of Chechnya's capital, Grou Nui, was destroyed and terrorist activities by Chechen armed groups repelling against it have also become active.

DOC.Title: Georgian dispute
DOC.TEXT: Following the collapse of the Soviet Union, intensified ethnic conflict. Religious and ethnic problems are complicatedly intertwined, especially the separation and independence movement of the Abkhazians in the western part of Georgia becomes an armed fight and we can not see the clue of solution.

DOC.Title: Kurdish problem
DOC.TEXT: The problem that about 20 million Kurds can not form an independent state and are suppressed as ethnic minorities under the control of Turkey, Iran and Iraq. In the war in Iraq, the Hussein regime has collapsed and new solutions are being sought as the situation in Iraq becomes fluid.

DOC.Title: Sri Lanka
DOC.TEXT: In 1972 the constitution was enacted, from Ceylon to Sri Lanka, renamed the Sri Lanka Democratic Socialist Republic the following year with amendment of the Constitution in 1977. The civil war continued since 1983, but in 2009 the government army suppressed rebel factions.

DOC.Title: Tamil person
DOC.TEXT: Minorities of Hindu and Sri Lanka. He demanded separation and independence and continued conflict with Sinhalese.

DOC.Title: Sinhalese
DOC.TEXT: Indigenous people account for over 70% of the population of Sri Lanka. Buddhist.

DOC.Title: Sri Lanka Civil War
DOC.TEXT: Battle between the Sri Lankan government, mainly Sinhalese, and armed groups, mainly Tamils, started in 1983. The intense civil war situation continued, but 2009 armed groups issued a declaration of defeat, and the government ended with a victory.

DOC.Title: East Timor Civil War
DOC.TEXT: A civil war occurred in East Timor over separation and independence from Indonesia. In 1974, Portugal abandoned its colonial policy, and in the following year East Timor declared independence, but since Indonesia unilaterally declared consolidation in 1974, an independent struggle by armed groups developed. In 1999 after resigning Suharto, independence was decided by a referendum, but immediately after that independence opposition militia attacked the favor and faced a state of disturbance. As the United Nations dispatched multinational forces and worked to restore security, Indonesia also withdrew its consolidation-the United Nations East Timor provisional governance system was set up and a new state was started. Although it achieved independence in May 2002, the industrial infrastructure is weak, and the forecast of national construction is considered to be a lot.

DOC.Title: Separation and independence of East Timor
United Nations Timor-Lest Interim Government Organization
Aceh independence movement
DOC.TEXT: Separation and Independence Movement from Indonesia in Aceh Province in the northern part of Sumatra Island. Since 1976 Islamic armed groups have been developing armed struggle, but at the end of 2002, a ceasefire agreement was signed with the government. However, the next year, the president Megawati declared martial law and launched a sweeping strategy, the battle resumed.

DOC.Title: Huge earthquake off the coast of Sumatra
DOC.TEXT: A huge earthquake occurred off west off the northern tip of Sumatra Island, Indonesia on 26th December 2004. A huge tsunami occurred due to a strong earthquake presumed to be magnitude 8 · 9, attacking countries in the Indian Ocean such as Indonesia, Sri Lanka, India, Thailand and Malaysia, the number of deceased / missing people is about 300 thousand , It suffered the greatest damage in history.

DOC.Title: Civil war in Somalia
DOC.TEXT: Battle between armed groups in Somalia, which became fierce since the 1980s. Ethiopia and Sudan also intervene and it is in a difficult situation to solve.

DOC.Title: Rwanda Civil War
DOC.TEXT: The tribal conflict between Tutsi and Hutu developed into a civil war. Massacre of the Tutsi family, which is said to be the worst case in the history of modern Africa, genocide against Tutsis, occurrence of refugees, epidemic of epidemic diseases in refugee camps, etc. After that, international support activities centering on NGOs have been developed, and since 2000 the moderate people have held power and the way to peace is being explored.

DOC.Title: Ethiopia = Eritrea conflict
DOC.TEXT: Border conflict between Ethiopia and Eritrea, which began in 1998. After that it expanded to a full war, but a ceasefire agreement was made in 2000.

DOC.Title: Congo civil war
DOC.TEXT: In 1997 the power struggle over the status of the president expanded to civil war. Then a person supported by Angola went to the position of the president and saw the end of the year.

DOC.Title: Sierra Leone Civil War
DOC.TEXT: It was civil war since 1991, but the United Nations intervened in 1999 and a ceasefire agreement was made in 2000.

DOC.Title: refugee
DOC.TEXT: People who are in need of protection due to war and hunger, lost their living bases, separated from their original settlements, and in difficult circumstances. The 20 th century is also called "the century of refugees", but due to the frequent occurrence of regional and ethnic conflicts after the Cold War, the number has further increased.

DOC.Title: Economic refugee
DOC.TEXT: Those who have illegally crossed the border in search of better employment opportunities, but who are in a difficult situation not able to secure their living base. Many cross-border people lose employment opportunities from the confusion caused by local conflicts and ethnic conflicts in their own countries, and in many cases it is difficult to distinguish them from "refugees".

DOC.Title: UN peacekeeping operations, PKO
DOC.TEXT: Activities that the United Nations aims at peaceful resolution of conflict. Until the end of the 1980s, ceasefire monitoring was the main task, but as regional conflicts and ethnic conflicts frequently occurred after the end of the Cold War, maintaining security, monitoring elections, and restoring ceasefights in conflict-progressed areas It is expanding in both active and active areas, including forced behavior such as maintenance.

DOC.Title: United Nations Cambodian Interim Administrative Organization, UNTAC
DOC.TEXT: An administrative agency established in March 1992 to monitor ceasefire in Cambodia and to fairly implement elections. Part of UN peacekeeping operations (PKO).

DOC.Title: United Nations Military Monitoring Group
DOC.TEXT: An organization dispatched with a certain military power in the responsibility of the United Nations for resolving regional conflicts and maintaining peace. Part of UN peacekeeping operations (PKO).

DOC.Title: United Nations Social Development Summit
DOC.TEXT: The United Nations organized meeting in Copenhagen in 1995. Participation by citizens was necessary to solve the problem of poverty, employment and social integration in the world.

DOC.Title: South Pacific Forum, SPF
DOC.TEXT: The South Pacific Regional Cooperation Organization formed in 1971. 16 countries and regions such as Australia and New Zealand join. We are cooperating in opposition to nuclear tests, protection of fishery resources and environmental problems. It was renamed the Pacific Forum in 1999 and the issue to strengthen the relationship with the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation Council (APEC) and others.

DOC.Title: South Pacific Nuclear Free Zone Treaty, Rarotonga Treaty
DOC.TEXT: It was adopted and signed at the 16th SPF in Rarotonga of the Cook Islands. Prohibited experiments, production, acquisition, possession and deployment of nuclear weapons in the region.

DOC.Title: Moorea Atoll
DOC.TEXT: It is in Polynesia of the South Pacific, French territory since 1958. From 66 to 1999 France repeated nearly 200 nuclear tests in this area.

DOC.Title: North American Free Trade Agreement, NAFTA
DOC.TEXT: 1992 Regional agreement signed by the three countries of the United States, Canada and Mexico, which came into effect in 1994. It aims to realize the elimination of tariffs and non-tariff barriers among Member States and to stimulate trade.

DOC.Title: World Trade Organization, WTO
DOC.TEXT: An international organization dealing with various problems of international trade established in lieu of GATT in January 1995. It plays a role of promoting globalization of the economy through rule making for expanding free trade as well as things as well as services and intellectual property rights. In recent years, criticism that it promotes economic disparity and environmental destruction is also strengthening.

DOC.Title: Globalization
DOC.TEXT: In modern society, the exchange of persons, goods, capital, information and the like became extremely active, and the world was united. As a result, the world got caught up in the competitive society, the disparity between the stronger (the winner) and the weak (the loser) spread widely, the strong in Europe and the United States monopolized the wealth, spreading its values ​​to the world. On the other hand, weak people move towards unity with shared values, and movements such as strongly opposing and opposing the strong are also pronounced.

DOC.Title: IT revolution
DOC.TEXT: It is a dramatic development of communication information technology centering on computers. We are promoting globalization on the information side.

DOC.Title: Multinational corporation
DOC.TEXT: A large company in developed countries that owns and operates assets diversely in several countries. Through lively activities beyond the boundaries of the state, it is advancing the globalization of the economy at the forefront, but in recent years it has been said that it is the root of poverty in developing countries and is subject to condemnation.

DOC.Title: National nation
DOC.TEXT: In principle it is a nation formed from one ethnic group with its own sovereignty and territory. In the 20th century, the nation-state system spread throughout the world, but at the same time globalization has progressed, activities that exceed the sovereignty and territory of the nation-state are active, and its significance is changing.

DOC.Title: Non-profit organization, NPO
DOC.TEXT: A private organization active in fields such as education, environment, welfare, etc., not for the purpose of profit. Although it is said that there are more than one million organizations in the world, in Japan it has been established one after another after the Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake of 1995. NGOs are organizations similar to NPOs, but are often used in groups that address international issues, in particular.

DOC.Title: NGO, NGO
DOC.TEXT: It is a private organization that is active not only for the purpose of profit, human rights, peace, medicine, education, women's position, especially in the international field. Amnesty International, the International Committee of the Red Cross, Medical Doctors Without Borders etc are well known.

DOC.Title: Amnesty International =
DOC.TEXT: Based on the purpose of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, a private international human rights defense organization (NGO) established in 1961. People imprisoned imprisoned for reasons such as race, sex, religion, thought, etc. are called "prisoners of conscience", seeking release, fair trials, abolition of torture and capital punishment, etc., human rights awareness to people Aiming at spreading. The headquarters is London.

DOC.Title: Greenpeace
DOC.TEXT: An environmental protection organization of global scale. It is also known to take bold actions on many environmental problems such as global warming, toxic chemicals / marine pollution, disappearance of forests, nuclear radiation contamination.

DOC.Title: Medical Doctors Without Borders
DOC.TEXT: Established in France in 1971, an international medical aid organization. It is known for activities such as conflict areas, refugee camps, developing countries and dispatching doctors to urgent need for medical assistance.

DOC.Title: Mass production / mass consumption society
DOC.TEXT: Production / lifestyle style that the industrial society that began with the Industrial Revolution and achieved great development in the 20th century produced by the industrial society. In the latter half of the 20th century people started to notice the limitations of resources and the environment, it became apparent that such a social system is the root cause of environmental pollution, and the importance of review is being screamed.

DOC.Title: Pollution
DOC.TEXT: Disaster caused serious health damage and environmental deterioration that occurred while production activity became active and consumption life advanced. Air pollution, water pollution, noise, etc.

DOC.Title: Environmental problems, environmental destruction
DOC.TEXT: In recent years, the problem of destruction of the global environment that has deteriorated at a rapid speed. Emergency solutions such as global warming, destruction of the ozone layer, acid rain, decrease of forests, desertification, etc. are required.

DOC.Title: Global warming
DOC.TEXT: Greenhouse effect due to carbon dioxide is the main cause.

DOC.Title: Destruction of the ozone layer
DOC.TEXT: Emission of Freon gas is the main cause.

DOC.Title: Acid rain
DOC.TEXT: Increase in sulfur oxides and nitrogen oxides is the main cause. It is damaging forests and historic buildings.

DOC.Title: Desertification
DOC.TEXT: Excessive grazing / cultivation, forest destruction are the main causes.

DOC.Title: Air Pollution
DOC.TEXT: Exhaust smoke from the factory, exhaust gas of the automobile, etc. are the main cause.

DOC.Title: Environmental refugee
DOC.TEXT: People who have become refugees who can not live in their original settlement due to deterioration of the natural environment. It is estimated that desertification and global warming are the main causes, and it is estimated that it will reach tens of millions in the 21st century.

DOC.Title: Green Revolution
DOC.TEXT: About the 1970s, the American foundation was the center, trying to increase the harvest by breed improvement such as rice. Especially in Asia, which suffered from sudden population growth and sluggish food production, it was thought that it was a powerful solution, but the use of large amounts of fertilizer and agricultural chemicals is indispensable, problems of enlarging the gap between rich and poor and ecological changes occur It was.

DOC.Title: Rachel-Carson
DOC.TEXT: An American oceanographer. It pointed out that organic compounds such as DDT are enriched through the food chain occurring in the natural ecosystem and have great influence on health and shocked. The main work is "Spring of Silence", which is regarded as a classic of environmental problems.

DOC.Title: United Nations Human Environment Conference
DOC.TEXT: The first international conference on the theme of the environment held in Stockholm. With the slogan "The irreplaceable earth", the human environment declaration was adopted.

DOC.Title: Earth Summit, United Nations Conference on Environment and Development
DOC.TEXT: An international conference held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. There were numerous participation from non-governmental organizations (NGOs). The Rio Declaration appealing the need for economic development in harmony with nature and the Agenda 21 plan, which is a concrete measure to realize it, were adopted.

DOC.Title: Kyoto Conference, Global Warming Prevention Conference
DOC.TEXT: A conference held in Kyoto, Japan. The Kyoto Protocol incorporating developed countries' greenhouse gas reduction targets was adopted. However, America, the largest emitter of greenhouse gases, refuses ratification, and issues remain to be realized.

DOC.Title: Green Party
DOC.TEXT: Group focusing on West Germany, emphasis on environmental protection, anti-nuclear movement, peace movement, women's liberation movement, etc. In 1983 he won seats for the first time in the Congress and in 988 he set up a coalition government with Schroeder Democratic Party.

DOC.Title: Population Explosion
DOC.TEXT: A rapid increase in world population seen mainly after the World War II, mainly in developing countries. It is said that world population will reach 10 billion by about 2050. It is also a cause of environmental problems / urban problems, causing developing food crisis in developing countries.

DOC.Title: Hunger
DOC.TEXT: It is getting worse in the third world, especially in Africa. Regional conflict, rapid population increase, desertification and so on are thought to be caused.

DOC.Title: AIDS, Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome, AIDS
DOC.TEXT: Viral infections that have become a worldwide problem since the 1980s. The immune function is destroyed, the resistance is weakened, and it tends to be affected by various diseases. Infection spread rapidly due to use of contaminated blood products, blood transfusion, sexual intercourse etc. Ignorance about poverty and AIDS also accounts for 30 million infected people in Africa.

DOC.Title: Drug
DOC.TEXT: Substances that cause analgesic and hallucinogenic effects. Abuse is addictive, resulting in destruction of human nature. Showing global spread today, it is a big threat.

DOC.Title: Human alienation
DOC.TEXT: In the society human beings themselves created, the state of losing its own essence. It is thought that this state is progressing more and more in the modern society which became enormous and complicated.

DOC.Title: Atomic physics
DOC.TEXT: Developed since the beginning of the 19th century. From the study of the nature and structure of atoms, later the field expanded, nuclear physics · elementary particle Uu · theory of physical properties was born.

DOC.Title: Einstein
DOC.TEXT: A Jewish-based theoretical physicist born in Germany. Presentation of relativity theory. Aside from Nazi persecution, he exiled to the United States in 1933 and strove for a peace movement after the war.

DOC.Title: Relativity Theory
DOC.TEXT: Einstein announced special relativity theory in 1905, general relativity theory in 15 years, fundamentally changed Newton 's physics.

DOC.Title: Quantum mechanics
DOC.TEXT: Dynamics applied to microscopic worlds such as elementary particles, nuclei and atoms.

DOC.Title: Heisenberg
DOC.TEXT: A German physicist. We established the foundation of quantum mechanics · nuclear theory.

DOC.Title: Nuclear weapons
DOC.TEXT: Weapons using nuclear energy. In the atomic bomb using nuclear fission reaction in July 1945, hydrogen bomb using nuclear fusion reaction in November, 52, respectively, the United States succeeded in the first development.

DOC.Title: intercontinental ballistic bullet, ICBM
DOC.TEXT: A missile with a large nuclear warhead and a range of long range. Developed by the Soviet Union in 1957, the United States also succeeded in developing shortly afterwards, and since then became a strategic main weapon of major countries.

DOC.Title: Nuclear power generation
DOC.TEXT: Power generation utilizing heat generated in nuclear reactors. Although it was put to practical use in the Soviet Union in 1954, the risk of fatal accidents has also been pointed out.

DOC.Title: Three Mile Island nuclear power plant accident
DOC.TEXT: Accidents occurred at Three Mile Island Nuclear Power Station in Pennsylvania State, USA. Radiation leaked, evacuation of the surrounding residents, exposed the danger of nuclear power generation.

DOC.Title: Chernobyl nuclear power plant accident
DOC.TEXT: Soviet Union Ukraine Republic The nuclear reactor exploded at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant north of Kiev city, causing many casualties and people suffering from aftereffects. Radioactive contamination spread not only within the Soviet Union but also to Eastern Europe and Northern Europe.

DOC.Title: Synthetic fiber
DOC.TEXT: Nylon · Vinylon (Invention in Japan) · Polyester and other polymeric compounds as fibers. Nylon created from the study of Carothers (rice) became a breakthrough term.

DOC.Title: Plastic
DOC.TEXT: Synthetic resin of polymer compound by petrochemical industry.

DOC.Title: Molecular Biology
DOC.TEXT: Fields of study to clarify the molecular structure of biological substances. Progressed since the 1940's, Watson and Click in 1939 rapidly developed since advocating DNA double helix structure.

DOC.Title: Biochemistry
DOC.TEXT: It is an academic field aiming to clarify life phenomena based on chemistry theory and method, also called biochemistry. In 1970, we successfully synthesized raw protein.

DOC.Title: Biotechnology, genetic engineering, biotechnology
DOC.TEXT: The academic field aimed at effectively utilizing the functions of life and organisms. It analyzes the structure of genes and is applied also to breed improvement and disease prevention / treatment. On the other hand, the risks associated with gene recombination (cloning technology) are also concerned.

DOC.Title: Human = Genome
DOC.TEXT: Human genetic information. In 2003, "decryption completion" was declared by six countries' leaders.

DOC.Title: antibiotics
DOC.TEXT: Substances that inhibit the growth and function of microorganisms. Approximately 1000 species including penicillin have been discovered so far and are used for chemotherapy and agricultural chemicals.

DOC.Title: penicillin
DOC.TEXT: In 1928-29, Fleming was separated from a kind of blue mold.

DOC.Title: Vehicle
DOC.TEXT: The German Daimler completed a motorcycle gasoline (motorcycle) in 1885 and a four-wheeled gasoline car in 1986.

DOC.Title: Ford
DOC.TEXT: America's "Car King". In 1913, it adopted the mass production system of automobiles, succeeded in cost = down, and enabled the spread of automobiles.

DOC.Title: aircraft
DOC.TEXT: 1903 Wright brothers succeeded in the first flight. It developed as a weapon in the First World War and became the main weapon in the Second World War.

DOC.Title: Write Brothers
DOC.TEXT: In 1903 cooperation succeeded in the first flight (duration of 59 seconds). After that, we extended the duration of flight and opened the way for practical application.

DOC.Title: Lindberg
DOC.TEXT: In 1927 I accomplished the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean (between New York and Paris).

DOC.Title: jet aircraft
DOC.TEXT: An airplane powered by a jet engine. Succeeded in Germany in 1939, spreading on behalf of propeller aircraft.

DOC.Title: Space development
DOC.TEXT: Projects in outer space using rockets, artificial satellites, spaceships, etc.

DOC.Title: Rocket
DOC.TEXT: Injection type propulsion device. During the Second World War, a military rocket called V2 was developed by Germany, and in 1957 after the war, the Soviet Union used and launched the Satellite Sputnik 1 launch.

DOC.Title: artificial satellite
DOC.TEXT: An artificial object that launches using a rocket and revolves around the earth on a certain orbit. In 1957 October Soviet Union successfully launched Sputnik 1. In 1961 he also succeeded in an artificial satellite (spaceship) at Vostok 1, after which the development competition of each country intensified.

DOC.Title: Apollo 11
DOC.TEXT: An American spaceship. In July 1969, I succeeded in landing and returning to the moon surface for the first time in human history.

DOC.Title: Apollo plan
DOC.TEXT: A manned lunar surface exploration plan of America in the 1960s.

DOC.Title: Communication Satellite
DOC.TEXT: It is an artificial satellite used as a relay station of long distance communication, and long distance communication became possible using microwave. It has been used in the capital since 1962.

DOC.Title: Meteorological Satellite
DOC.TEXT: Satellite for weather observation. It has been used since the mid 1960's.

DOC.Title: Electronics, electronics
DOC.TEXT: Technologies and academic using electrons. Born in the 1920s, established in the 1950s, it has developed enough to be said to be a key industry today.

DOC.Title: Transistor
