DOC.TEXT: Developed in the United States in 1948. Instead of a vacuum tube, it becomes a main part of electronic equipment.

DOC.Title: Integrated circuit, IC
DOC.TEXT: A circuit incorporating a large number of electronic components on a narrow base, which was made possible with the advent of semiconductors. Development is progressing to large scale integrated circuits (LSI), very large scale integrated circuits (VLSI), ultra large scale integrated circuits (ULSI) in recent years.

DOC.Title: Computer
DOC.TEXT: A device that performs calculation, storage and information management at super high speed. In 1946, the first computers in the US were completed and developed dramatically in the development of 1 C · LSI.

DOC.Title: personal computer
DOC.TEXT: Personal = computer. With the development of electronics technology, high-performance computers have become smaller and lower in price, and it has become popular for personal use as well.

DOC.Title: IT revolution
DOC.TEXT: Sudden changes in society caused by the explosive dissemination of technical information such as computers and the Internet. Although it is expected that dramatic improvements in living standards due to dissemination of new information media and e-commerce transactions are expected, there are also minuses such as an increase in opportunities for new crimes called high-tech crimes.

DOC.Title: computer = virus
DOC.TEXT: Computer = soft made with malice. It infects through the Internet, etc. and hinders the normal function of the personal computer.

DOC.Title: Mobile phone
DOC.TEXT: A portable phone that uses wireless communication. Today, not only simple call functions but also new technologies such as connecting to the Internet and having camera functions appear.

DOC.Title: Information society, information age
DOC.TEXT: A society / era in which a great amount of information is produced and the role of information is extremely great. It is progressing further by the IT revolution.

DOC.Title: Mass = Communication
DOC.TEXT: Using mass media such as newspapers and radio / television, to communicate massive information to the public.

DOC.Title: radio
DOC.TEXT: Formally in November 1920, the vote broadcast of the US presidential election is the first.

DOC.Title: Television
DOC.TEXT: 1926 Baird (UK) succeeded in imaging the first moving object. We began experimental broadcasting in collaboration with BBC in 29 years, and the London Broadcasting Station officially broadcasted in 1936. Today, digitization, large screen, etc. are rapidly progressing.

DOC.Title: Raw philosophy
DOC.TEXT: It is a position to experience living reality fluidly as it is, idealistic ideologicalism and scientific rationalism and to start philosophy from there.

DOC.Title: Bergson
DOC.TEXT: French philosopher. Life is a temporal flow, and life is a creative evolution that makes a leap.

DOC.Title: Spengler
DOC.TEXT: A German historical philosopher. Main article "Fall of the West".

DOC.Title: "Fall of the West"
DOC.TEXT: Announced in 1918-22. Volume 2. From the spiritual collapse of the capitalist society and the experience of the First World War, we foretold the downfall of Western civilization and gave a big reaction.

DOC.Title: Existential philosophy, existentialism
DOC.TEXT: A philosophy that seeks human beings as irrational irrational being impossible to capture logically and pursuing as an upset in absurdity. From this anxiety and despair it was said that in order to form a human being as a realistic / subjective existence (existential), he must be aware of the transcendent (God or no). Born as reactionary to the empirical philosophy / rationalism of the 19th century, it became familiar after the second great war when crisis awareness increased.

DOC.Title: Sartre
DOC.TEXT: French philosopher and literary student. Representative of existentialism. Established existentialist literature. Then they approached Marxism. Main article "presence and absence".

DOC.Title: pragmatism
DOC.TEXT: I translate it as pragmatism. Born in the late 19th century, it became the mainstream of American philosophy of the 20th century. I try to capture the truth as a practical value for life. It was adopted a lot in pedagogy.

DOC.Title: Dewey
DOC.TEXT: American philosopher / pedagographer. Takagi made pragmatism. The main work is "democracy and education".

DOC.Title: psychoanalysis
DOC.TEXT: Freud's established discipline. In understanding the spirit of man, he insisted on the importance of the unconscious mental area (deep psychology).

DOC.Title: Freud
DOC.TEXT: Austrian psychiatrist. Founder of psychoanalysis. The theory had a great influence on psychology, humanities and social sciences.

DOC.Title: Marxism
DOC.TEXT: Philosophy and economics based on materialism historical based on dialectical materialism, based on the theory of class battle.

DOC.Title: Lenin
DOC.TEXT: A leader of the Russian Communist movement and a revolutionary. Developed Marxism theoretically, established the principle of Leninism, and practiced in the Russian Revolution.

DOC.Title: Mao Saoto
DOC.TEXT: The leader of the Chinese Revolution. Based on Marxism, there are books such as "New Democracy theory" and "Theory of contradiction".

DOC.Title: Max = Weber
DOC.TEXT: German sociologist / economic historian. Contributed to sociology, political science, economic history by comparative research across the ages and the east, and social science method method which transpired. Main article "Ethics of Protestantism and the spirit of capitalism".

DOC.Title: structuralism
DOC.TEXT: A theory and philosophy trying to clarify society and history, focusing on analysis of structures and systems that last long-term. Levi Strauss et al. Showed a viewpoint away from the western way thought method which was mainstream in the 19th century, based on the achievements of anthropology, and since 1960 gained supporters in the field of philosophy and history since 1960.

DOC.Title: Levi-Strauss
DOC.TEXT: French anthropologist. Main article "The Empire of Sadness".

DOC.Title: Roman-Roland
DOC.TEXT: French novelist and playwright, pacifists. It fulfilled the attitude of anti-war / anti-fascism. Novels such as "fascinated soul" and "Jean-Christophe".

DOC.Title: Proust
DOC.TEXT: A French novelist. A masterpiece of a novel psychological novel, the masterpiece "Pursuit of Lost Time".

DOC.Title: Camus
DOC.TEXT: French writer. Participate in anti-Nazi resistance movement. I drew human absurdity and rebellion. Existentialism in a broad sense. Representative work "Gentile" "Best".

DOC.Title: Thomas-man
DOC.TEXT: German writer. From the conservative / non-political way of life, I turned around with the experience of World War I, and fought anti-fascism based on humanism. Master work "Evil Mountain".

DOC.Title: Joyce
DOC.TEXT: Irish novelist. Psychological literature was established pursuing subconscious. "Ulysses".

DOC.Title: Lawrence
DOC.TEXT: A British novelist. Criticizing functionalistic contemporary civilization and upper class hypocrisy, it was instinctive sex to make humans happy. The masterpiece "Mrs. Chatterley's Lover".

DOC.Title: Hemingway
DOC.TEXT: An American writer. One of the representatives of the "lost generation". We opened behaviorist literature with "Farewell Yayba" based on the experience of World War I and "Who bells ring for everyone" depicting the Spanish civil war.

DOC.Title: Kafka
DOC.TEXT: Born in Prague, Czech Republic, a Jewish novelist. I drew human loneliness, anxiety and despair. Master work "Transformation" "Judgment". After death, he is highly appreciated in France and is considered as a precursor to existentialist literature.

DOC.Title: Tagore
DOC.TEXT: Indian thinker / poet. He emphasized humanism and also sympathized with mysticism. He strongly protested the Amrit Sar incident and also had a great influence on the Indian ethnic movement. He compiled Bengal contemporary literature at the poetry 'Gee Turn Jari'.

DOC.Title: Lu Xun
DOC.TEXT: Chinese literary. It fiercely resisted the feudal system and imperialism through literature and criticism activities and became a spiritual pillar of the Chinese liberation movement. Pioneered white talk literature with "Madman Diary", criticized the spirit of feudal reality evasion that was rooted in Chinese society with "A Q Qingdao".

DOC.Title: Beast Faction, Fauvism
DOC.TEXT: Early in the 20th century, it fell on the Impressionist paintings and took place in Paris paintings. It features a bold depiction with simplified form and clear primary colors, Matisse Rouault · Black et al.

DOC.Title: Matisse
DOC.TEXT: French painter. Representative of the faction. Established excellent composure beauty due to extremely simple and clear lines and brilliant brilliant colors.

DOC.Title: Cubism, cubism
DOC.TEXT: At the beginning of the 20th century, art movement campaigned mainly in France under the guidance of Picasso · Black. A perceptiveist in painting trying to represent the composition of objects collectively.

DOC.Title: Picasso
DOC.TEXT: Born in Spain, he was a painter who was mainly active in France. Founded a three-dimensional faction and developed a shocking method. Subsequently, we adopted surrealism and developed a unique colorful style of painting. Participated in the Communist Party of France in 1944. He was one of the most representative painters of modern art.

DOC.Title: surrealism
DOC.TEXT: It was influenced by Freud's psychoanalysis, and occurred in parallel between literary art and art in the 1920s and 1930s. I focused on expressing dreams and inner spiritual subconscious without regard to prejudice. Tanggy Dali is representative.

DOC.Title: Dali
DOC.TEXT: Spanish painter. Representative existence of surrealists. I also made movies in America.

DOC.Title: Sikeiros
DOC.TEXT: Mexican painter. Famous for the production of mural paintings. I participated in the Mexican revolution and the Spanish civil war.

DOC.Title: Schönberg
DOC.TEXT: Austrian composer. I was chased by the Nazis and exiled to the United States. Late Romanticism, founder of twelve sound music. Work "Gure's Song" "Purified Night".

DOC.Title: Bartok
DOC.TEXT: Hungarian composer. It produced works combining Hungarian folk music with Western music. In 1940 I escaped to America, avoiding the rise of fascism. Major works "Blue Beard's Castle" "Microcosmos".

DOC.Title: Movie
DOC.TEXT: In 1895, a silent film (silent movie) was screened by the French Lumiere brothers. After that the technology advanced to Torquay movies (movies with audio) and color movies, after the First World War, the movie industry established in the United States.

DOC.Title: Disney
DOC.TEXT: Movie maker. Creating masterpiece animation movies such as "Snow White", "Pinocchio" and "Cinderella", Disneyland was founded.

DOC.Title: Chaplin
DOC.TEXT: A movie actor / director from the UK. Created a highly completed work full of humor and criticism. After World War II, it was expelled from the United States in fact by American McCarthy whirlwind, and later in Switzerland. Major works are "dictators", "modern time", "town lights" and so on.

DOC.Title: "Modern = Times"
DOC.TEXT: In a humorous storyline, a work painted with satire with "the age of modern times" (modern = Times), where humans are toppled by machine civilization.

DOC.Title: Musical
DOC.TEXT: Performing art composed of songs, dialogs and dances. In the United States after World War I, I gained popular popularity with movies, jazz music and others.

DOC.Title: Jazz
DOC.TEXT: American music originating from black music. After the first World War I got a golden age, was played in a variety of bands afterwards, and was loved.

DOC.Title: Counter = Culture
DOC.TEXT: Anti-organizational culture born from strong criticism of established society / culture (mainstream culture) spread in the United States since the late 1960s. It is translated as "counter culture". Particularly in Europe and Japan, with the political movements of the Paris crisis in May and the anti-war movement in Vietnam, rock music, enthusiasm for the Beatles, It was also expressed in the form of folk song fashion.

DOC.Title: Lock
DOC.TEXT: A music with a strong rhythm and a dynamic feeling that began in the mid 1950s in the United States. After that, various forms of things were born and developed.

DOC.Title: Beatles
DOC.TEXT: A music group formed by four young people from Liverpool, Britain, became a symbolic presence of youth culture in the 1960s. Since its introduction in 63 years, he has acquired many fans all over the world with his own home-made music full of fresh rhythms and beautiful melodies and recorded unprecedented record sales with 200 million copies until it was dissolved in 1970.

DOC.Title: Expansion of SARS, expansion of new pneumonia, expansion of severe acute respiratory syndrome
DOC.TEXT: New pneumonia that showed signs of epidemic since autumn 2002 rapidly expanded to Asia and Canada in the following year 2003, and in March WHO (World Health Organization) has reached a "global warning" It was. The pathogen was found to be a new virus, but the background of this pandemic is the migration of people by globalization and the rapid expansion of contact opportunities. By July 2003, we gathered almost 8,500 infected people and about 900 dead and converged.

DOC.Title: London bombing terror
DOC.TEXT: On July 7, 2005, the terrorist bombardment that occurred in London metro and bus. More than 50 people were killed and over 700 injured, but the suspect was identified as a Pakistani British-centered member, and at that time the Summit of major countries summoned Gleneagles in the northern part of England It was concluded that it was a bombings terrorism focusing on this because it was being held at.

DOC.Title: Large earthquake in northern Pakistan
DOC.TEXT: On 8th October 2005, a major earthquake occurred near the border of Pakistan and North India. Magnitude 7 · 6 was recorded, and more than 70 000 deaths came out.

DOC.Title: Infection of people with avian influenza
DOC.TEXT: Originally, a virus that infects birds (poultry such as chickens in particular) was mutated to a virus (H5N1 type) that infects humans. Especially since 2003, deaths occurred in China and Southeast Asia, viruses were discovered in Europe (H5N1 type) in 2005, and the possibility of new infections and outbreaks is also left.

DOC.Title: Hurricane "Katrina" landing in the USA
DOC.TEXT: A large-scale hurricane named "Katrina" at the end of August 2005 struck the southern part of the United States in the hurricane (mainly the Caribbean and the Gulf of Mexico), the dead alone caused a massive damage of over 1,000 people It was. Furthermore, the damage was concentrated on the poor and the black people, and the seriousness of social problems (racial discrimination) was highlighted. Also, it was a serious disaster, such as soaring cereal prices, soaring crude oil prices and the bankruptcy of airlines that bought a bow.

DOC.Title: North Korea announces implementation of nuclear test
DOC.TEXT: On 9th October 2006, North Korea announced that the nuclear test was carried out. Later, each country attempted to confirm through various means (measurement of seismic waves and measurement of radioactive substances in the air), but views are divided on the scale of the experiment and "degree of success".

DOC.Title: The world simultaneous equity depreciation from China
DOC.TEXT: On February 27, 2007, a massive crash of Chinese stocks (about 9% collapse) centered on Shanghai occurred, which led to a collapse in the stock prices of major global stock markets. This was the first time in history that the global simultaneous weak stocks declined, it was a case symbolizing that the trend of the Chinese economy has grown to such an extent as to influence the direction of the world economy.

DOC.Title: New EU Treaty, Lisbon Treaty
DOC.TEXT: The treaty agreed at the EU informal summit meeting held in Lisbon, Portugal in October 2007. The establishment of standing presidency (the President of the EU) and expansion of the majority voting system (until now, there were many unanimous methods) were decided. It can also be said that it is the Organizational Reform Convention to further promote EU integration, which has been considered since the failure of ratification of the EU Constitution in 2005.

DOC.Title: Butted assassination
DOC.TEXT: In December 2007 former Prime Minister Bhutto of Pakistan was assassinated during the tour in the capital city of Islamabad. The situation in Pakistan further strengthened the confusion, and in August 2008 the parental Musharraf administration (2001-2008) fell.

DOC.Title: Russian President assumed Medvedev inauguration
DOC.TEXT: In 2007, he was nominated as a successor from Putin who had just come to the end of the president's term of office, and officially became President of Russia (tenure 2008-12) in subsequent elections. In legislation, the president is the supreme leader in Russia, but the view that Putin, who became the new prime minister, holds the de facto highest power is also strong.

DOC.Title: Tibetan cancer
DOC.TEXT: A protest demonstration in Lhasa against the Tibetan suppression policy by the Chinese government spread to areas where many Tibetans live, such as Sichuan, Qinghai, Gansu, and a number of casualties came out due to collision with the police and military It was. Beijing Olympics ahead of the Chinese government laid the strict press control, there are many uncertainties.

DOC.Title: Sichuan Province Great Earthquake
DOC.TEXT: Major earthquake of magnitude 7 · 8 class with epicenter of Sichuan province of China in May 2008. Many buildings were destroyed, and the dead / missing people brought about a huge damage estimated to be close to 80,000 people.

DOC.Title: South Ossetia Conflict, Russia / Georgian Military Collision
DOC.TEXT: In August 2008, Georgia exercised the army to suppress the independence movement in South Ossetia in the territory, but a military conflict occurred when the Russian army that supported independence invaded South Ossetia. Since then Russia proclaimed Independence Approval of South Ossetia State (and Abkhazia), Western countries strongly rebounded and developed into a major international problem.

DOC.Title: Crude oil price surge
DOC.TEXT: The sharp rise in crude oil prices has become significant since the beginning of the 21st century, and in June 2008 the price of crude oil as an index at the New York Exchange rose to around 140 dollars per barrel. In addition to a decline in supply capacity in oil-producing countries, a sharp inflow of speculative funds is thought to be caused by an increase in demand in regions with rapid economic growth such as China and India. After that, although the price rise showed some calmness, it also spreads to other commodity prices and invites worldwide inflation (price increases).

DOC.Title: World financial crisis
DOC.TEXT: In the period from September to October 2008, the management crisis rapidly expanded in American financial institutions, and the crisis spread to global financial institutions shortly afterwards, the stock price plummeted, serious situation in the broad economic field Recession). There is also a theory that its size and seriousness are comparable to the world depression that occurred in 1929.

DOC.Title: Gaza conflict
DOC.TEXT: Conflict between Israel and the Palestinian armed forces Hamas which dominates the Gaza Strip. Because of Hamas' rocket attack on Israel, in December 2008 Israel with overwhelming military power began a fierce retaliatory attack. In January 2009, Israel unilaterally issued a ceasefire declaration at the stage when more than 1,000 victims (mainly children and noncombatants) came to Palestine side, Palestinian side also ceased fighting, intense fighting finished.

DOC.Title: Establishment of the Obama administration
DOC.TEXT: In January 2009, Obama of the Democratic Party took office as the 44th president of the United States of America. The formation of the Obama administration, president of Barack Obama, who is the first African-American blood drawn in America's history, attracts worldwide attention in many fields such as economics, diplomacy (especially against Islam), environmental issues, and nuclear weapons management .

DOC.Title: epidemic of H1N1 influenza, swine influenza epidemic
DOC.TEXT: In April 2009, influenza caused by a new virus (epidemic common cold) began to appear in Mexico. This virus was mutated to a virus infecting pigs from pigs to human beings, and it was originally called swine influenza. Subsequently, the extent of infection has also expanded rapidly to the global scale, reaching the level at which the World Health Organization (WHO) announces the pandemic (worldwide infection) declaration, and measures are urgently needed in each country (region) ing.

DOC.Title: Xinjiang · Uighur Autonomous Region riot
DOC.TEXT: Ethnic confrontation case in Xinjiang and Uighur Autonomous Region of the west end of China that occurred in July 2009. It seems that Uighur's strong dissatisfaction with the Han tribe's longstanding dominance caused the background, but a number of victims, mainly Uighurs, came out after the government army controlled, and then went on to calm down. As the Chinese government conducts thorough information management, there are many unclear points.
